1.content:
Though usually quiet and peaceful, on this day the sounds of chatter, games and laughter erupted from the Ponyville library. It wasn't the biggest party that Pinkie Pie had thrown that year (or month, or even week) but the Good-Luck-And-We'll-Miss-You-So-Much-But-We-Know-You'll-Do-Great party being held would certainly be remembered by everypony present for years to come.

Five young mares and about a dozen little colts and fillies were at the center of the party, playing a round of Pin The Tail On The Pony. Each one wore a cape marking them as Cutie Mark Crusaders, though the ones on the oldest five were well-worn and too small for them now. The capes and emblems of a caped pony over a blue shield were nevertheless sported with pride and infused with countless happy memories. There were the original three: Apple Bloom, Sweetie Belle and Scootaloo. The one being spun around was the frizzy-haired Twist, and the one doing the spinning was the young black alicorn, Nyx.

Like her friends, Nyx was starting to grow into adulthood. But whereas for them, that meant they were still smaller than fully-grown adults, she stood taller than all but the largest ponies. Her eyes, no longer hidden by the enchanted lenses that made the dragon-like pupils look round like a normal ponies, now shone with laughter and joy where once they had looked down on all ponies with scorn when they belonged to the jealous and spiteful Nightmare Moon. Her horn gleamed with magic as--at her friends' insistence--she held Twist up off the ground with her mind, spinning and flipping her around in all directions before daintily setting the bespectacled pony back onto the floor. The extra third dimension of spin had made the candy-making pony even dizzier and more unsteady than usual, as demonstrated by the tails already attached. When Twist pinned her own tail and took off the blindfold, everyone including her giggled at how she had placed it on the pony's back hoof.

"Alright, who's next?" Nyx asked, and she was answered by several cries and hooves raised up into the air, including Pinkie Pie who bounced in, squealing, "Oooh! Ooh, me me me!".

From a short distance away, Twilight Sparkle watched her adopted daughter with love and pride while Rarity and Applejack did the same toward their little sisters. One of the little colts got blindfolded and levitated, giggling around the tail in his mouth as Nyx gave him a spin.

"Hard t' believe they're this big already, ain't it, Sugarcube?" Applejack turned to look at the other two as she mused, "Are y'all gonna be okay? Ah know it's easy fer me. Apple Bloom's just gonna be apprenticin' with Rusty Nail when she ain't lendin' a hoof around the orchard, and Twist'll still be in town workin' at the candy shop if she gets lonely, but with Sweetie Belle goin' to that fancypants consternarium--"

Applejack was suddenly interrupted by Rarity wailing, "CONSERVATORY!" She then started bawling, quickly dabbing at her wet eyes with a handkerchief.

Twilight put a hoof on her friend's shoulder. "It's okay, Rarity, I know this is hard, but Sweetie Belle's going to be just fine."

"I... I know," Rarity sniffled, her lip quivering as she looked to her little sister. "It's just that I offered and I begged, and I pleaded with her, but... but..." The fashion-conscious pony started weeping again. "Oh, Sweetie Belle, why oh WHY wouldn't you wear the new capes I made for you?! They would drape SO much more elegantly!"

Applejack rolled her eyes as Twilight struggled not to do so herself, giving Rarity a reassuring smile instead. "Yeah, uh... it's a tragedy, but it's just for a few hours."

Rarity continued to dry her eyes until she slowly eased out of her moment of drama. "*sniff* Yes, I know... I'll just miss my little sister so terribly while she's gone... What about you, Twilight? Did Nyx finally decide what she was going to do?"

Applejack asked, "Decide? Ah thought the princesses invited her up t' Canterlot so's they could teach her alicorn stuff."

"They did," Twilight replied, still gently patting Rarity's shoulder. "But Nyx said that she wanted to consider other options. She really wants to use her power to help everypony, but... well, even with the princesses vouching for her, there are still a lot of ponies who think she should have been banished."

Applejack nodded. "Yeah, takin' over Equestria and two weeks o' night ain't easy t' get over." When Twilight looked at her, she replied, "Hey, I think those ponies have rocks fer heads, but ah know her. An' just look at all them Cutie Mark Crusaders. Most o' them had t' join in secret just on account o' Nyx bein' in the group, but they did anyhow, an' now they're all friends. Things're bound t' be tough, but she's grown up right, so it'll work out one way or another." After a pause, she remembered the original question and asked, "So, what DID she decide, Sugarcube?"

11.content:
Twilight said to her friends, "Well, we spent a few days considering her options. I made charts with the pros and cons of each one and modified for the severity of each factor of course. And I made sure to thoroughly research each one, because I didn't want her to make a decision based on a knee-jerk bias over objective-"

"TWILIGHT!" Rarity and Applejack both interrupted in unison as the unicorn started to ramble, snapping her out of it.

She sheepishly smiled and continued, "R-right. Well, eventually, we figured that apprenticing with the princesses was probably for the best. We knew there would be ponies in the capitol who wouldn't want her so close after... after what happened..."

She choked a little, still having difficulty talking about how the cult that had created Nyx flooded her with the memories and power of Nightmare Moon that she had been intended to have from the beginning. Nyx... her Nyx, as much as she didn't want to think about it like that, had taken on that role and overthrew the Royal Sisters. Thankfully for all of Equestria, it was because she was Nyx, and didn't have Nightmare Moon's spite and jealousy that she had chosen of her own will to reject the role that had been chosen for her and undo the harm she had done.

"And she doesn't really need lessons on being an alicorn. She still has the latent talent and knowledge. It's just that her mental and physical maturity are based on how much magical power she has, so that'll come back on its own eventually. They just thought that everypony seeing her prove her loyalty to the princesses will go a long way toward showing that she really isn't Nightmare Moon anymore. Not in any way that matters."

Rarity beamed happily at the news. "That's quite an astute observation. She certainly does take after her mother in that regard." Twilight blushed at the praise. "Oh, and just think! The conservatory Sweetie Belle will be attending is within trotting distance." Stars started to gleam in the white unicorn's eyes. "The two of them, bosom friends, together mingling with the creme de la creme of high society! Oh my... oh my, I simply MUST make dear Nyx a suitable gown to match with the one I made for Sweetie Belle! Such a cosmopolitan center of culture and style, it would be an absolute CRIME to send them off without giving them the opportunity to make the best possible impression for their grand debut! And Twilight, how could you have kept this to yourself, knowing that I would have so little time to work?"

Twilight blinked a few times and opened her mouth to say something, only for Rarity to place a hoof over her lips. "Shhh, it's alright, dear. I know you have so much on your mind, and I DO forgive you, but I simply must hurry." Turning to the gathered Crusaders, she called out, "Sweetie Belle! Sweetie Belle, dear, I'm afraid that I have to dash off to the Boutique!"

Sweetie Belle looked confused for a moment, but could tell that her big sister was on a mission, so she waved and assured her that she would make it home after the party. As Rarity made it to the door, Pinkie Pie, who was being spun around, quickly pulled her blindfold up and cried out, "Waaaaaiiiit! Don't go out yet!"

The white unicorn was already out the door, however, and a series of loud bangs and brightly colored flashes filled the library through the windows and open door. Nyx dropped Pinkie Pie as everypony quickly ran over to look, only catching the last few trails of a fireworks show that backlit Rainbow Dash and Fluttershy as they held up a banner reading "GOOD LUCK, CUTIE MARK CRUSADERS!" Fluttershy's end was hanging lower, as she'd reflexively cringed from the display.

"What the hay, Rarity?!" Dash exclaimed, glaring down at the unicorn. "We've been waiting out here a good half hour setting up, and you go and blow it early!"

Spike, who was down between the two pegasi with an empty box of fireworks, said to the downcast little Crusaders, "Sorry, everypony, we were expecting you to be coming out!"

This was met with a disappointed "Awwwww" from everyone until Pinkie Pie suddenly popped up from behind Spike, somehow having left the library without anypony noticing her pass them by, a second box of fireworks perched on top of her head. "Well, it's a good thing I brought backups!" This was met with a round of cheers as she set it down, and Spike lit the fuses with a puff of fire.

As a cascade of sparks and streams of light exploded in the skies of Ponyville a second time, Scootaloo took the opportunity to show off by whipping out her scooter, upgraded and adjusted over the past few years, using her wings to give her a quick boost of speed and launch herself up a small rise in the road like a ramp. Hooves clapped together wildly as she flipped around in the air, backlit by a bright, star-shaped explosion, getting a high-five from Rainbow Dash at the apex of the arc. The sound of her fanfillyish squeal on the way down could be heard even over the pops and bangs of the display.

Down on the ground, Applejack and Apple Bloom sat next to each other, ooohing and ahhhing.

Sweetie Belle clopped up alongside Rarity and asked, "You still need to go off to the Boutique?" Rarity, glancing down at her sister, smiled before putting a foreleg around her and pulling her in for a hug while they shared what would be the last of such moments for a while. "Well, yes... but it can wait a minute longer," she replied.

Nyx, likewise, made her way to Twilight and leaned down a little to nuzzle her mother. "You all had this set up for us?" she asked, amazement in her voice. "I love you so much, mom!"

Twilight was actually as surprised as anyone else, but decided not to say so as she nuzzled back. Her horn lit up with magic as she formed an image in her mind, then cast a spell to shoot it up into the sky. A fond memory from when Nyx was just a little filly, the two of them with Spike and Owlowicious sitting around a storybook. This image then spread out, bringing all of their friends and family into a tapestry that spread across the sky.

"I love you too, Nyx. So much."

------------

The next day, it came time for those who were leaving for Canterlot to depart. Because of Twilight and Nyx's special relationship with the princesses, a private pegasus-drawn chariot was to be sent down to pick up Nyx and Sweetie Belle. Hugs and well-wishes were shared between everyone present, and an only ever-so-slightly frazzled looking Rarity levitated a pair of packages to her sister and Nyx.

"Here you go. It took me all night to finish yours, Nyx, but be sure to put it on before you land. You two will look so absolutely DIVINE, you'll steal the breath of everyone who sees you! I trust you both will act like proper ladies while you're there?"

The two young mares giggled to one another, then replied in unison, "Of course. Thank you, Rarity," both of them performing their finest curtsy, which had her smile in both pride and relief.

Twilight also presented them with gifts in the form of stacks of books bound together with twine. "Here, girls, I was able to requisition some books from the library, so you don't need to worry about returning them." Sweetie Belle's stack were largely books on music or collections of songs while Nyx's were mostly storybooks, with a few of her fillyhood favorites slipped in. "And you promise you'll write?" she asked Nyx.

The black alicorn smiled and tried to keep from crying as she thought back to all the times Twilight had read her stories, even once when she was in her fully-grown form. "Every week, mom. Cross my heart, hope to fly, stick a cupcake in my eye."

Twilight's eyes widened, not having expected that. "Oh? You know, if you make a Pinkie Pie promise, you'll have to keep it-"

"FOREVERRRR!"

"--What she said."

Nyx laughed and nuzzled Twilight again. "I know. I'll definitely keep it." They then turned their heads up toward the sky as the moment approached for the chariot to arrive.

1121.content:
Nyx sat, her turqoise eyes glowing. She narrowed her eyes slightly, watching the alicorn colt with distaste. How dare he. How dare he even suggest he needs to protect us. I am Nyx! She fumed, her ears pinned back to her mane. Azure swiveled his head around, his intense eyes piercing her soul. "We are about to arrive. When we depart the carraige, you are to stay by me. Understood?" he blinked at Sweetie Belle, then sat his unwavering gaze back on the horizon. Sweetie Belle rolled her eyes, a smile on her pretty muzzle, and scooted closer to Nyx, shivering in the cold night air. Nyx stood, reaching with her long neck to snag a navy-wrapped parcel with her teeth. She placed it in her lap, then did the same for a purple wrapped package. Sweetie Belle blinked, then levitated the ribbon off the parcel, the paper gently falling. A pale pink gown slid off the wrapping, starry silk glistening in the moonlight. The gentle folds of the skirt descended to the ground, and a silvery strap fell a length, hanging in Sweetie Belle's magic. She quickly gasped, her eyes on the gorgeous garment. Nyx looked with awe and playful envy, admiring the beautiful handiwork of Rarity. Sweetie Belle stood, levitated the dress onto her hide, and smiled. She looked to Nyx with glowing eyes, and laughed, indicating the similarly wrapped package of Nyx's. "Open yours!" she cried, and circled Nyx, bouncing up and down. Nyx blinked, and picked up the parcel in her own aqua-blue magic. The wrapping fell away, albeit hastily, and a similarly made, navy blue and purple dress fell out, starry silk sparkling. Nyx slipped into it, and felt herself transform. She watched as her height shrunk, to match that of Sweetie Belle's, if not slightly taller, and as her own dark purple mane straightened, then curled slightly, appearing neat and sophisticated, not like her usual unkempt, stray plait. Nyx's eyes became rounded. "Trust Rarity to try to protect me." she snorted, then ajusted the spell on the dress so that her eyes were the same. She understood the rest, but her eyes were special. They made her different. Nyx huffed slightly, seeing Azure's impressed gaze fall on her. He had a strange look in his eyes, dreamy, almost. Nyx narrowed her eyes, snorted, and looked to Sweetie Belle. Azure shook his head, cleared his throat, and turned back to the sky. Sweetie Belle smiled, trotted to her, and whispered in Nyx's ear. "You have an admirer." she teased gently, and turned away. Nyx grimaced, looked to Azure, and shook her head. He couldn't like me, She thought. Not with my history...I've never had an admirer, before...What good are colts, anyway? She huffed, blushing slightly, and turned away. She staggered slightly as the chariot thudded to the ground, making Nyx blink. As she opened her eyes, she gasped as the hulking mass of Canterlot Castle loomed over them. Nyx regained composure, and stepped lightly out of the golden chariot, dipping her head gracefully to the pegasi driver. Sweetie Belle followed daintily in pursuit, followed by Azure. He blinked at her, then turned his head away. Sweetie Belle sniggered, then trotted off, a few meters ahead. Nyx rolled her aqua eyes, the dragonlike slits making the action strange, and followed at a gentle canter, levitating the hem of the beautiful dress away from the ground. Azure started in surprise, and followed at a brisk gallop, catching up on Nyx quickly, straining to be at her side for reasons other than to be her personal guard.
--------------

Nyx trotted up the marble staircase to the throneroom of Canterlot Castle. Azure was at her side, muscular shoulder brushing hers. Nyx shivered every time they touched. His warm black fur was pleasant for her to touch, and sent a shiver down her spine, making her heat race. Nyx shook her head, trying to shake off the strange feeling, and cantered the last few steps, huffing. As she blinked, panting, at the top, a warm voice reached her parked ears. "It does take some getting used to. I don't know what the architect was thinking. He must have been fit." Celestia's flowing mane shone in the moonlight. Her sister, Luna, stood at her side, equal in height. There was a friendly shine in both their eyes, and Nyx bowed, muzzle brushing the floor. Azure stood at attention, mane flowing, wings and head raised. Nyx glanced sideways, and felt her heart quicken as his eyes met hers. Looking back to the Princesses, she stood, head held high, eyes wary. She was still slightly unsure of the two, and nearly killing them, then banishing them to the moon and sun respectively didn't help the feeling of it. Celestia smiled warmly, and beckoned Nyx closer, wrapping a heavy wing around her. "Come. I will take you to your quarters, and Luna will show you around the caste later. In the morning, we will start study. Luna will be your guardian, I your mentor. Azure Kage is your bodyguard, present at your will and when you leave the palace. For now, follow me!" she said lightly, and trotted off. I wish Sweetie Belle was here. She thought. The unicorn had departed from their company at the heart of Canterlot to settle in at her residence. Nyx trotted off, mane flowing, heart racing as she felt the warm touch of Azure's shoulder. She had feelings for him, no doubt. And so did he.

---------------

11212.content:
Nyx sat on the large velvet bed, sinking into the covers. She was deep in thought, brows furrowed, when her mind created an image. Muscled, black, with an azure mane and tail, stood Azure Kage, at attention. His glowing horn illuminated the dark night, catching Nyx's eyes in the shadows. He started, then smiled, walking forward with a devilish grin. He laughed, then nodded towards the sunrise appearing over the horizon. "Walk with me." His deep voice rumbled, and he turned. Nyx followed, trotting to keep up with him. She brushed his warm side, and a shiver ran through her body, wanting more. As she went to nuzzle his cheek, a lighter voice broke into her dream. "You know, I once had a crush." Nyx jumped around, blushing deeply, as the navy-blue Night Princess emerged. The dream faded, and Nyx woke, thrashing in the soft covers. She flapped her wings and landed aside the bed, still red. "P-princess Luna." she stammered, bowing before the alicorn. A small smile touched her face, and she walked to the large window which held the perfect image of the full moon. Luna sighed, then turned to Nyx. "He was all I ever dreamed about. Perfect in every way. My best friend, when Tia and I were...not seeing eye to eye. He comforted me. When I transformed, he was the only one whom did not look to me with hate. He looked to me with concern, with worry. But...a thousand years banishment takes its toll. He is no longer." she sighed, then blinked, her purple eyes on Nyx's turquiose. "If you love him, let him know. You never know what can happen." The night princess turned, winking. "I will return in the morning, to guide you around the castle." She winked again, then with a flash of navy magic, disappeared. Nyx sighed, then flopped onto the duvet, wings spread, magic soothing her aching muscles. She groaned with pleasure, and soon her dreams came, filled with images of Azure and more.

---------------

Nyx awoke to the sun in her eyes. Blinking, her catlike pupils dilated, to a wisp. Stretching, she sighed, only to be greeted by the sight of Luna standing aside of the bed. Scrambling to make herself presentable, she levitated her hairband to her head, smoothing her flyaway mane. "Princess." she greeted Luna, dipping her head as she jumped ungracefully from the bed. Her rear hooves caught on the heavy quilt, and she stumbled, landing squarely on her rump with a muffled 'oomph'. Luna snorted and levitated the young alicorn to her feet. "We have our work cut out for us. Thou shall follow I, when ready." The night princess trotted off, mane flowing gracefully, head held high. Nyx scrambled after her, hooves echoing once on the marble floors. Luna blinked tiredly, then led the alicorn to the Sun Princess's private study. With a rap on the door with her magical mane, Luna and Nyx entered the high-ceilinged room. She gasped at the library surrounding them. Books upon books adorned the shelves set on the wall, their covers all different. Nyx went to run to the closest shelf, then stopped herself, remembering where she was. Striding across the room at Luna's heels, she stopped at Celestia's chair, then curtsied. Celestia snorted warmly. "No need for that every time you see one of us." she laughed, then indicated the nearest book stack. "Today we will start with the history of Equestria. Skim the books, them wait for me." Nyx promply levitated the first book, opened it gently, and started reading, her eyes darting across the page at a rapid pace. Celestia looked to Luna, eyes narrowing. "You are tired. You must sleep, but first, you must tell me what you found last night." The sun princess said, casting a silence spell around the two. Luna grimaced, then started. "It was an intrusion of her privacy. Nothing but...simple dreams?" she turned away, grimacing, not wishing to expose the young alicorn's secret. Celestia narrowed her eyes, a playful smile on her face. "Simple dreams...of what?" Luna sighed. She rolled her eyes, ears twitching.
"She has...feelings...for a colt..." she said vaguely, and seeing the expression on Celestia's face, preempted the next question. "Azure Kage. Desendent of Lapis Lazuli, original Night Guard for Princess Luna. Azure is her personal bodyguard, the colt alicorn. Around her normal age...and..." Luna stopped. Celestia smiled devilishly, squeezing it out of her. "And what, Luna?"
-"Tia, I really don't think..."
-"Luna..."
Celesta started again. "Luna, what is it?"
Luna glared at her, then whispered a jumble of words at rapidfire pace.
"LapisLazuliwasmycrushbeforeIwasbanishedandheobviouslyfoundsomeoneelseth ereforehercrushwhenIsayherImeanNyx'scrushisdescendedfrommineandforsomereason AzureisanalicornandIthinkInowhavefeelingsforAzureanditsallabigmessnowbutIhavenoc hancebecause..."
Celestia widened her eyes, somehow keeping up with the jabber. "Because of what?" she asked, worried and curious.
"Because...because...he has feelings for her, too." She sighed, and looked away.
Celestia snorted, annoyed. "You have to fall for him, don't you...nevermind. Luna, keep it to yourself. Being High Princess of Equestria, you need to put these feelings aside and-"
Luna snorted. "-And I suppose you have put aside yours for that stallion?"
Celestia reeled back. "You know about-I mean, that is different. Our private student, who happens to be an alicorn, does not have a crush on him!" She lashed back, fuming. Snorting, she turned to Luna, and looked her in the eye. "You are tired, Luna. Go to bed." She removed the silence spell, and trotted over to Nyx. Luna sighed, anger smouldering and dying, then trotted out of the study in the direction of her chambers. Nyx looked up as Celestia approached, then put her nose back to the book, already up to her third. Celestia looked at her, then cleared her throat. "Nyx Sparkle, tell me, who founded Equestria as we know it today?"
Nyx's eyes shone as she recited the well known Hearth's Warming Eve tale to the Sun Princess, Azure still sitting in the front of her mind.

~

112122.content:
Nyx sighed, gently shutting the heavy oak door of the Princess's private study. Celestia had drilled her on Equestria, Discord, and all she knew all day. Nyx glanced at the ornate stained glass window, one that depicted the six Elements of Harmony defeating Discord. The sun was just setting over the low hills of the far-off Neighvada. Snorting, wondering how the time had gone so fast, she trotted to her chambers, entering with a flick of her horn. Rustling through her personal belongings, she found a pair of aqua-glass slippers, to protect her hooves. Rooting through deeper, her horn grazed the golden fabric with a sigh. I wonder how Sweetie Belle is. I must visit her... She thought distantly, pushing the cape to the bottom of the chest. Her magic found a black cloak, and she levitated the heavy fabric on, sighing as the dark material made her resemble how she had looked in the days of her reign as the...monster. She shrugged, discarding the memories, and pulled her purple hair back with her headband. Trotting out the heavy doors, she rounded the corner to the throne room, then trotted down the thousands of sparkling marble steps until she was out the huge, ornate, golden palace doors, and into the gardens of Canterlot Castle.
------
Heavy breathing disturbed Nyx's deep thoughts. With a start, she whirled around, teeth bared, relaxing as she saw the black-and-azure form of Azure Kage. He winked at her, a smile on his face, and joined at her shoulder, still puffing. In between breaths, he glared at Nyx. "You...know...I'm meant to...be at your side...twenty-four/seven...except when in...the castle...or with the...Princesses." He breathed out, huffing heavily. With a sharp intake of breath, Nyx apologised. "I've just been so...free before. I've never had to wait for a guard before...before my..." She broke off, blushing deeply, embarrassed as she recalled her exploits as a nightmare. Azure just smiled, a twinkle in his eye, and just reminded her of a small, unforgotten fact to Nyx. "Don't mind me. I'm just a teenage colt, after all." He purposely reminded her of their age similarities. Nyx blushed deeper, heart racing, tingling skin. She turned away, feigning hurt, and spread her wingspan wide, gaining altitude fast. She was the one rare pony whom could keep up, and even best, Rainbow Dash, thanks to her almighty wing power and length. As she looped the air, she caught a glimpse of Azure quickly launching, a startled look painted on his beautiful, handsome, gorgeous-Stop it. She harshly told herself, snapping awake. She felt feathers brush her flanks and rump, and saw Azure beside her, taunting her. Their eyes met, and Nyx hovered in the air, Azure drawing closer, green eyes locked on her blue. Nyx flew forward, then smiled, flapping fast, spiraling quickly upwards, gaining height by the second. Azure matched her perfectly, and when Nyx felt the height sufficient, waited for Azure to catch up, he having fallen behind slightly. As he met her height, their eyes locked, cemented to each other's longing gaze. Nyx had never felt the intense passion before, and didn't know how she knew what to do. As Azure drew closer, inch by inch, asking her, Nyx smiled, and flapped forward, so that they were wrapped up in a close embrace. As their eyes met, held together, their lips followed suit, melting into each other. Nyx closed her eyes, and drew in her wings. They were plummeting, held tight together, sharing their lips together. Nyx drew him closer, and they spiraled, down towards the ground.
----
Luna levitated her blue-striped socks onto her hooves, gazing to the moon. She blinked, relishing in her night, and stepped to her balcony, a smile plastered on her face, moonlight warming her. She felt the warmer touch of a magical mane, and sighed contentedly as her sister sat next to her, yawning. "Another masterpiece, more beautiful than the last." Celestia commented, before wrapping a heavy white wing around her sister. They sat together for awhile, watching the stars move. Suddenly Celestia moved her wing to shield her sister's gaze. Luna uttered a muffled squeak, and fought to surface for a glimpse of what the elder had shielded her from. As she burst up, wings spread, she watched as a dark, enterwined shape plummeted towards the ground. She recognized the windswept mane of Nyx Sparkle, and then the bulky shape of Azure Kage. Luna gasped as she realized what they were doing. A kiss. And it wasn't for her, from the colt she loved. A cry escaped her mouth, and Luna fell to the balcony, where Celestia awaited. She hit the cold ground, and she cried, covered by the elder sister's wing. Celestia sighed, realizing her sister's heartbreak. "You do not know what is good for you, Luna." She consoled, stroking her head. "They are meant to be, dear sister, and I think that you knew. You are so determined, or for want of a better word, plain stubborn." She sighed, and curled round her sister, her own tears melding with those of the younger's. The stars flickered twice, then dimmed. With a final blink, they disappeared from the sky.
----
Nyx broke apart from Kage as they neared the ground. Flourishing her wings, she gently landed on all fours, breathing heavily. Azure hit the ground, a devilish smile on his face, mildly pleased with himself. He winked at Nyx, and lay down on the ground, ruffling his wings. After a pause, he smiled, winking. "Well...I wasn't expecting that on our first night. As an emlpoyee guard, I'm not sure that was part of the contract." He joked, and walked to her, nibbling an ear, before planting a kiss on her muzzle, then taking to the sky, leaving Nyx alone. With a dreamy sigh, Nyx lay her head on the grass, and summoned a quill and parchment.
~~~
Dear Mother,
I am enjoying my stay at the castle so far. Celestia has already tested me on my knowledge, and I await the results...I hope passed!
Luna has been very nice to me. She has shown me around the castle, helped me with...a little problem, and been my guide and friend.
I am coming to Ponyville for a visit tomorrow, Celestia told me I needed a rest.
When I visit, I have been issued...a...guard, of sorts. He will be accompanying me and staying with us, I hope.
I do have a little surprise, I will tell you when I arrive.
Sweetie Belle is doing fine, and has been taken on as a singing student by Top Note, the head teacher at the conservatorium.
See you very soon,
Nyx
---
Nyx stepped off the train with Azure at her shoulder. Over the past months, he had grown to be much more than a guard. He had officially asked her to be her 'coltfriend' the night after their first kiss. Nyx trotted towards the gates, levitating her small bag. Her mane was drawn back with a aqua headband, and in plaits. Her eyes were sparkling with happiness. Azure was equally as happy. As they walked slowly towards the massive tree in the distance, Azure winked, and walked closer to her, so that they were pressed together like in clamps. Nyx rubbed her muzzle along his, and Azure planted a soft kiss on her lips, before dancing away a few steps. Nyx sniggered. "Good idea. Not sure how Twilight'd take it if we waltzed in the door like that. She'd grill Celestia, then eat Luna alive." Azure looked at her worriedly.
"Will she take it well?" He was worried.
Nyx snorted, then frowned. "Not sure, really. I've never..well, had a coltfriend, before." She trotted ahead, nearing the library. Azure winked then cast a spell, hiding his wings and donning his royal Nightguard armour. He took on a distant look, flexed his muscles, and pranced forward, magically opening the door. When she stepped inside, she had a brief moment to register that Pinkie had thrown a surprise party before the deafening and almost illegible, muffled cry of 'Welcomehomehappyalicorn-princesstraining' was shouted. Nyx laughed, and trotted forward, only to be tightly embraced by a short, bouncy, pink earth pony. Soon Rainbow, Rarity, Applejack, Twilight, and a shy Fluttershy joined in the warm hug. As the others broke away, Twilight bounced around her, snuggling her, and laughing like an ecstatic Pinkie. "It's been so long! Nothing's happened around here!" she cried, and then literally cried. Nyx took a stunned step back, and then squeezed Twilight tight, before letting her gently go. Pinkie, with a loud call of, "Let's Parrrrttaaayyy!" started handing out cupcakes of all kinds.
----
Later that night, when the party had dispersed and died, Nyx sat in Twilight's room with Twilight and Rarity, with Azure standing emotionless at her side, like a buff stone statue. Rarity kept looking in his direction, obviously interesed, which pricked Nyx with soft jealousy. Twilight could stand the silence no longer, breaking it with a unwittingly rude, "Does he speak? What's his name?" Rarity gasped, and huffed, muttering something about 'No sense around stallions' and the like. Nyx snorted, and flicked Azure with her tail, signalling him to speak. Although they had grown close, he was still her guard and therefore, when in public, had to act like it. He blinked gratefully, and sighed. "I do speak, Ms. Sparkle. I am Azure Kage, former lieutenant of the Royal Night Guard. I was re-employed to serve Miss. Sparkle." He shifted his weight, and Nyx continued.
"I do have some... embarrassing, uncalled-for and startling news, but that can wait. Azure, stop acting like a guard, and I request that you reveal yourself." Nyx teased. Azure sighed, and levitated his armour off, revealing his flowing, bright-blue and red mane, and more importantly, his gorgeous wings. Rarity gazed at him with more intensity, and Twlilight gasped.
"An alicorn? B-but..."
Azure rolled his eyes with mock anger. He smiled. "I am descended from the original Lapis Lazuli, first guard of the Princess Luna, who was an alicorn. I carry that gene."
Nyx smiled. "Now, for the embarassing and uncalled-for news...
Azure Kage is my...coltfriend!" Nyx blushed.
Both mares gasped.

12.content:
Twilight said to her friends, "Well, we spent a few days considering her options. I made charts with the pros and cons of each one and modified for the severity of each factor of course. And I made sure to thoroughly research each one, because I didn't want her to make a decision based on a knee-jerk bias over objective-"

"TWILIGHT!" Rarity and Applejack both interrupted in unison as the unicorn started to ramble, snapping her out of it.

She sheepishly smiled and continued, "R-right. Well, eventually, she figured that she wouldn't want to put herself in a position where it looks like she's being shown any kind of favoritism. She didn't want to cause any political trouble for the princesses by making it look like she was being allowed too close to the throne after... what happened... But she thought that it would still help for everypony to see her swear her loyalty to the princesses, so she applied to join the Royal Guard. She thought that starting at the bottom ranks would prove she isn't the power-hungry monster some ponies are still afraid of."

Rarity frowned a little. "Oh my. That hardly seems the place for a proper lady. Are you both sure that it's what's best for her?"

Applejack added, "Yeah, I have a second-cousin in the Guard, and he always has horror stories 'bout the trainin' when he comes t' visit. Ah'm not doubtin' she can handle it, o' course, but those ponies take a lot of abuse."

Twilight hung her head a little, but put on a brave little smile as she glanced up at Nyx, who was levitating Pinkie Pie and spinning her around for her turn at Pin The Tail On The Pony. "Yeah, I was worried about that, too. She's a lot tougher, mentally, than when she was little, but she'll be all on her own..."

Applejack patted Twilight on the shoulder. "Aw, don't worry like that, Sugarcube. Yeah, mah cousin says it's tough, but he also always talks about how he made some of his best friends in the Guard. And considerin' her momma's the biggest expert on friendship in Equestria, ah'm sure she'll get along fine with the other ponies."

"And if she ever feels the craving for more refined company, she and Sweetie Belle will be within trotting distance of one another," Rarity assured her. "And I know that you two will be corresponding, so it isn't as though she'll be all alone." This made Twilight's smile widen with gratitude before she blinked over at the game. "WHAT is Pinkie Pie doing?"

Nyx had apparently decided to play a little joke on the pink earth pony, holding her upside-down with her magic and levitating books to act as a 'floor' while Pinkie walked toward the pony drawing on the wall, seemingly oblivious to the inversion of gravity while the little Crusaders laughed wildly and cheered her on. And yet, when she reached the wall, Pinkie somehow managed to pin the tail exactly on the X anyway, drawing gasps not just from the kids, but from Twilight and the other parents and guardians at the party.

As Nyx flipped Pinkie around to place her back on the real floor, the alicorn's jaw was hanging open. "HOW did you do that?" she asked, honestly astonished while Pinkie pulled off the blindfold.

"Oh, that's easy, you just have to HUUAAAAAAAGH!" Everyone present was startled by the earth pony's sudden gasp as she pointed toward the front windows. "Look out, there's a giant Ursa Major coming and it's gonna step on the library!!!" This suddenly threw everyone into a panic, though Twilight and Nyx were the first to throw themselves into action, both of them bursting out the front door, their horns glowing with magic! Neither was going to let anypony to come to harm on their watch, though perhaps they should have noticed more quickly that they hadn't heard or felt any of the telltale signs of such an enormous creature stomping through town. As a result, what they did see took them completely by surprise.

Mere moments after stepping out of the library, the sky exploded in a burst of fireworks that backlit Rainbow Dash and Fluttershy as they held up a banner reading "GOOD LUCK, CUTIE MARK CRUSADERS!" Fluttershy's end dipped lower as she reflexively cringed from the loud noises, but she kept it aloft anyway.

Spike, who was down between the two pegasi, grinned and waved before setting off a wave of fireworks with a puff of dragon fire. All the little ponies and their parents rushed outside to gawk as rockets and streamers flew up into the air, exploding in colorful blossoms of fire. "Oh my gosh, this is perfect," Scootaloo exclaimed, taking the opportunity to show off by whipping out her scooter. Upgraded and adjusted over the past few years, she used her wings to give her a quick boost of speed and launch herself up a small rise in the road like a ramp. Hooves clapped together wildly as she flipped around in the air, backlit by a bright, star-shaped explosion, getting a high-five from Rainbow Dash at the apex of the arc. The sound of her fanfillyish squeal on the way down could be heard even over the pops and bangs of the display.

Down on the ground, the two pairs of sisters sat next to each other, ooohing and ahhhing.

Nyx, likewise, made her way to Twilight and leaned down a little to nuzzle her mother. "You all had this set up for us?" she asked, amazement in her voice. "I love you so much, mom!"

Twilight was actually as surprised as anyone else, but decided not to say so as she nuzzled back. Her horn lit up with magic as she formed an image in her mind, then cast a spell to shoot it up into the sky. A fond memory from when Nyx was just a little filly, the two of them with Spike and Owlowicious sitting around a storybook. This image then spread out, bringing all of their friends and family into a tapestry that spread across the sky.

"I love you too, Nyx. So much. And... I'm still a little worried about the Guard, but I'm sure you'll do great."

Nyx smiled. "Awww, thanks mom, but you don't need to worry. Remember how scared I was of the first day of school? And that turned out to be amazing! I bet Boot Camp will be the same way."

------------

Boot Camp was awful!

She and Sweetie Belle had left in high spirits, saying tearful goodbyes to their friends and loved ones, and she even made a Pinkie Pie promise to write home every week. They then had to part ways from one another after arriving at Canterlot, but Nyx remained optimistic as she reached the recruit processing center.

And then she stood in line.

And in another line.

And filled out a stack of forms.

Then stood in a few more lines.

Then did some basic physical, magical and flight-speed tests. Being the first alicorn recruit on record, she was required to go through all three. And though she had gotten respectable scores on all of them, blowing the magic test away in particular, the sheer number of tests left her feeling drained by the time she slogged through them.

And of course, with each test came a seemingly exponential increase in the number of forms to be filled out. The earth ponies and pegasi behind her were getting jaw cramps trying to handle them all, and even she and the unicorn recruits who could levitate their pens came out of it feeling like their horns were going to fall off.

What made it worse were the stares. She thought she had gotten used to some ponies continuing to regard her with suspicion, as though she would try to take over the world again at any moment. Those she could handle, but what she didn't know how to deal with were the stares of confusion. Fellow recruits kept their distance, not sure what to make of the black alicorn's presence, but apparently afraid to ask. In Ponyville, even those who hated her were at least used to her presence. Here, she felt more freakish and out of place than she had in a long time.

Eventually, she was made to stand in a line alongside the recruits she had been grouped with, and they were approached by a middle-aged grey earth pony in Guard armor who, despite being shorter than Nyx, was built like a slab of granite and had a stubbly chin that could probably be used to beat somepony to death with.

"FALL IN, YOU LAZY HORSEFLIES," he bellowed. "MY NAME IS SGT. ROCK JAW, BUT YOU WILL REFER TO ME AS 'SIR, YES SIR!' OVER THE NEXT FEW WEEKS, YOU WILL COME TO KNOW ME AS YOUR WORST NIGHTMARE MADE MANIFEST! I MAY NOT HAVE A HORN ON MY HEAD, BUT IT IS MY SACRED DUTY TO MAGICALLY TRANSFORM YOU GLUE FACTORY REJECTS INTO SOMETHING RESEMBLING REAL PONIES! AND BY CELESTIA AND LUNA'S GRACE, I WILL NOT FAIL IN THIS TASK, EVEN IF IT MEANS GRINDING EACH AND EVERY ONE OF YOU DOWN TO THE BONE! DO I MAKE MYSELF CLEAR?!"

Nyx joined the others in stammering, "S-sir, yes sir!" Not to the sergeant's liking, however, as he made them repeat it over and over again until he was satisfied enough to loudly order them into the mess hall for their evening meal. Her vocal chords were too sore to complain as she was passed a tray of something that probably only barely qualified as food, which she weakly levitated over to an empty seat near several other ponies, who quickly moved away.

With a sigh, she started to eat, pretty certain she'd made the wrong decision.

As Nyx used her magic to retrieve the diary, Rock Jaw suddenly snorted and shifted in his sleep! Fortunately, as he simply rolled over onto his side while he slept, the gruff sergeant turned away from her, making it even easier to pull the diary loose. Floating it across the barracks toward her, she slipped it out the window and silently beamed as she showed it to Flint, who returned a bright smile of his own.

Unable to wait, and feeling confident that she could get away with it thanks to Rock Jaw's snoring, she magically cracked open the book and flipped through the pages, skimming through it until she found the most recent entry. What she found there, however, caused her spirit to immediately sink.

I just can't stomach it. I've served princess Celestia for over thirty years, and not once did I ever question my service to her, but this past month has been all but unbearable. I've been doing as ordered, keeping a watchful eye along with the agents she slipped into ranks and biting my tongue while seeing Nyx and Flint get all buddy-buddy with one another. I swore an oath, not just to train my recruits, but to protect them from harm, and watching that monster corrupt one of my ponies just twists my gut! No matter how many times I'm told to simply observe while treating that sick abomination like any other recruit, I feel like my head's going to split open. If something isn't done soon, I'm going to take my sword and deal with it like I feel I should have on day one.

As Nyx read the words, each one cut into her heart until she dropped the diary. 'Monster?' 'Sick abomination?' Rock Jaw was always harsh, but had always been harsh to everyone equally. It was something that she could take solace in, that at least she was being treated the same as the others, but that was just a facade covering up that level of hatred? And princess Celestia had sent secret agents to keep an eye on her? How many of those ponies that she and Flint had been planning to impress with this stunt were actually only there to ensure that she didn't go bad again?

While she was lost in thought, Flint poked a hoof toward the fallen book to flip it open again. "So? What was in it?"

"Nothing!" Before he could touch it, though, Nyx quickly scooped it up with her magic and put it back inside, floating it back to its spot under the sergeant's pillow. Unable to meet his confused face, Nyx hung her head and started to make her way back toward the barracks. "Nothing... just... his daily schedule," she fibbed.

TODAY IS THE DAY WE FIND OUT WHETHER YOU'RE JUST A FLEA-BITTEN NAG WITH DELUSIONS OF ADEQUACY, OR IF WE'VE MANAGED TO WHIP YOU INTO REAL THOROUGHBRED SHAPE!"

The sergeant bellowed at the recruits from in front of two wooden crates. With a double-legged buck, he kicked open the crates, causing dozens of dull practice weapons to spill out onto the ground.

"TODAY, YOU WILL BE SPARRING AGAINST ONE ANOTHER, UTILIZING ALL OF THE SKILLS YOU HAVE HOPEFULLY LEARNED THUS FAR! EACH SPARRING MATCH WILL LAST UNTIL YOUR OPPONENT EITHER SUBMITS, OR CAN NO LONGER FIGHT! AFTER THAT, ANY PONY THAT CAN STILL MOVE WILL BE PAIRED OFF WITH ANOTHER OPPONENT UNTIL SUCH A TIME AS NOPONY IS LEFT STANDING!" The grizzled sergeant smirked as waves of unease radiated from the recruits. "OF COURSE, IF THAT SOUNDS TOO STRENUOUS FOR SOME OF YOU, ANY PONY HERE MAY CHALLENGE ME TO A ONE-ON-ONE MATCH INSTEAD! SHOULD THEY SURVIVE THE EXPERIENCE, IT WILL COUNT AS AN AUTOMATIC PASS, THOUGH I ONLY RECOMMEND IT IF YOU ENJOY THE PROSPECT OF EATING YOUR NEXT FEW WEEKS WORTH OF MEALS THROUGH A STRAW! SO, DO I HAVE ANY VOLUNTEERS?!"

Sgt. Rock Jaw made his way down the line, asking each pony one by one to step up. Most immediately cowed with a quick "Sir, no sir!" A small few did try their luck, notably the first unicorn and pegasus recruits that he approached. Perhaps they thought that their natural gifts of magic or flight would give them an advantage over the earth pony, but the unicorn was sent flying by a surprisingly swift body-slam before he even got the chance to cast a spell.

The pegasus lasted slightly longer, but only by flying around out of reach, trying to use her superior speed and mobility to confuse Rock Jaw. When he taunted her by shouting, "I'M SORRY, TWINKLEHOOVES, IS THIS A SPARRING MATCH OR A DANCE? IF I'D KNOWN IT WAS THE LATTER, I'D HAVE PUT ON MY FANCY DRESS UNIFORM!" She then tried to come at him from behind while he was shouting, wooden sword in her mouth to get him in the back of the head, only for him to punctuate his taunt with a swift buck behind him. Without even looking, he sent the pegasus spinning end over end before she finally crashed hard onto the ground to be attended by the medics.

With a chuckle, he turned to the rest of the recruits and continued down the line. "WELL, NOW THAT I'VE LIMBERED UP, IS THERE ANYPONY ELSE WHO WANTS TO TANGLE WITH THE BIG DOG?! NO? HOW ABOUT YOU, PRINCESS?!"

He had finally gotten to Nyx, who replied with a quick, "Sir, no sir!" Just as he was about to move on, however, she added, "Sir, I wasn't finished, sir!" All eyes turned to look at her as she glared at the sergeant. "Sir, if you want a more even fight, why don't you use a real sword... sir!"

The sergeant set his rather prominent jaw as the other recruits, and even seasoned Guards observing the proceedings gasped in surprise. "RECRUIT NYX, I THINK I MUST HAVE HAD SOMETHING SUICIDAL IN MY EARS, BECAUSE IT SOUNDED TO ME LIKE YOU WANT A REAL THROW-DOWN!"

Nyx leaned down a little to look Rock Jaw square in the eye, her own dragon-like gaze challenging him with a hard glint as she whispered, "Just giving you the chance you've been waiting for since day one, sergeant..."

Narrowing his own eyes, Rock Jaw whispered back in a quiet, gravelly rumble, "And where'd you get that notion, missy? Because whatever you think you heard, I'd suggest forgetting about it before you get yourself hurt."

Nyx pulled her head back up and asked in front of everyone, "Why? Are you afraid you might get shown up, you loud, obnoxious BULLY?"

Rock Jaw started grinding his teeth so hard that across the field, ponies started wondering if an earthquake was about to start. "ALRIGHT, HAVE IT YOUR WAY, RECRUIT! DON'T SAY I DIDN'T TRY TO TALK SOME SENSE INTO YOUR PRETTY LITTLE HEAD! YOU! GET MY SWORD!" He pointed to a startled earth pony recruit who was as stunned as anypony else by the impending showdown, but quickly ran off and returned from Rock Jaw's quarters with a sheathed claymore-sized sword in his mouth. While the recruit held it out toward Rock Jaw, the sergeant grabbed the hilt in his mouth and pulled it out in a smooth flourish. The blade, nicked in several places from hard use, nevertheless shone with a blindingly polished gleam in the sunlight. Around the hilt, he still managed to bellow with only a slight muffling effect, "GO ON AND USE ANY FANCY TRICKS YOU WANT, MISSY! MIGHT ACTUALLY MAKE THIS A GOOD SHOW FOR THE PEANUT GALLERY!"

Nyx stared down Rock Jaw. She'd already considered some of her options. Though still a long way from her full power, she was still probably the most powerful magic-user in the squad, and could use some of the abilities she had as an adult, just not with as much juice to power them. To start with, she used...

"Yeah!" Nyx lunged forward, an ethereal blade swinging towards the sergeant's unprotected back as the other turned into mist and shuttled away from Rock Jaw as he tried to bring his own blade to bear in time.

Clang!

The two swords struck, the sergeant having stuck it into the ground and spun behind it. "Heh, you think to match me, blade to blade?"

"Yes, all of us shall." Where there had been Two, there were now five. Above the fight was a sixth who would keep watch and concentrate on sustaining the other copies' weapons.

The Nyxes all backed off to give Rock Jaw the chance to get a grip on his claymore. "We shall defeat you."

Sergeant Rock Jaw smirked through his claymore's hilt. "LEMME TELL YOU SOMETHING, RECRUIT. I'M STRONG. YOU'RE WEAK. AND AN OL' RHYME THAT THE SERGEANT WHO TRAINED ME DRILLED INTO MIND WAS THIS: WHERE THE WEAK WILL FAIL, THE STRONG SHALL PREVAIL." He swung his sword out in a wide arc, the Nyxes backing off, only to realize the mistake as the claymore bit into the ground and the sergeant flew forwards, landing atop one of the clones with all four hooves in an attack that would have made Applejack scared for her trees. The clone, one of its wings bent out of shape, hissed in pain before dissolving and returning to the Nyx in the sky, who bolstered the weapons and the speed of the remaining copies.

"You forget the other side to that poem, Sergeant. It is clear you did not do your reading." The four clones on the ground started spinning around Stone Jaw, who dug his hooves into the ground as he was buffeted by the almost gale-force winds.All four clones than stopped synchronously, and in a voice amplified four times the Royal Canterlot Voice, Nyx boomed, "WHEN THE STRONG CANNOT SPEAK, THEN LOUD BECOME THE WEAK!" The power of the four-fold Canterlot Voice created a sonic boom centralized within the shield the four Alicorns erected just before it went off, saving themselves and the rest of the Company the scrapes and bruises being thrown across the ground for who knew how far, as well as muffling the sonic boom's CLAP.

All the clones flew towards each other, turning to mist until there was only two left. One of them stepped forward. "Do you yield, Sergeant?"

The Sergeant, dazed, bruised, and ears bleeding couldn't hear her. Nyx's horn flashed and the Sergeant's ears were instantly healed. The unsteady look in his movements did not disappear, though. "Sergeant."

Rock Jaw looked at her, and tried to glare, but had to shake his head as a wave of dizziness almost bowled him over. "What," he managed to spit out through gritted teeth.

"Do you yield?"

",,, I... I yield to NOPONY! I AM ROCK JAW, AND I WILL PUT YOU BACK IN YOUR PLACE, MAGGOT! I WILL-" Clunk, thud.

Nyx looked at the now prostrate Sergeant with thinly veiled contempt- contempt veiled by smugness. "He should have kept better control of his blade."

She turned to face her peers, and was met by a roar of cheers.

122231112121.content:
With the battle over, Rock Jaw was carried off to the infirmary. Though his wounds were healed, he was out cold, which meant a reprieve for the remaining recruits. And in the aftermath of the drill sergeant's fall, everypony who was present gathered around Nyx to cheer for their new hero. The alicorn tried to stay calm while they pushed in to congratulate her, but she just couldn't do it. With a happy squeal, she told them, "Hey, since Rock Jaw cut out early, let's party!"

This was met with a round of cheers as several earth ponies suddenly hoisted her up onto their backs and carried her back to the barracks.

*****


Roughly an hour and a half later, Nyx was in the middle of the barracks, allegedly dancing to a phonograph's tune. It was playing one of the more popular collaborations between cellist Octavia Philharmonica and her partner, DJ-PON3, and the fusion of classical and techno beats would have had more ponies moving their hooves if they weren't staring in fascinated confusion at the alicorn flailing her limbs around like she was in the throes of an epileptic seizure.

"Sweet fancy Mareses," a bespectacled medic with a balding mane exclaimed as he stepped into the barracks. "What in the-? *cough* I mean, recruit Nyx, Sgt. Rock Jaw's regained consciousness and wants to see you!"

There was a scratching sound as one of the ponies bumped into the phonograph, knocking the needle loose. Everypony stopped what they were doing, including Nyx mid-spasm. Putting all four hooves back on the ground, she looked around at the others. In the last hour and a half, she'd gotten to know her fellow recruits better than in all the time she'd been there before. In fact, aside from Flint, she hadn't even tried to speak to them much, thanks to that disastrous first day.

She hadn't known that Emerald Wing's sister was a favorite to win the Best Young Flyer Competition, or that Scribble was an amateur novelist, using his experiences with the Guard as a foundation for a series of short stories. And while she had won the fight with Rock Jaw fair and square, a part of her couldn't help but worry about what would happen.

But as she walked toward the exit to follow the medic out, she heard somepony tell her, "We got your back, Nyx!"

"Yeah, no matter what, you stand up to that jerk!"

There were other murmurs of encouragement, and a few started stomping their hooves on the ground as Nyx left the barracks, her heart feeling more steady. Soon, she was led through the door to the infirmary, where Rock Jaw was laying back in one of the cots. Seeing him there, Nyx narrowed her eyes and mentally braced herself for what was bound to be an epic shouting match.

Instead, the sergeant simply asked in a very normal and even tone, "Thanks, doc. You mind leavin' us alone to talk for a bit?"

"Sure thing, sergeant," the medic replied, stepping out of the room and shutting the door behind him.

Once they were alone, Rock Jaw leaned back, crossing his forelegs behind his head as he grinned. "So, how do you like being everypony's hero?"

Nyx just stared for a bit, blinking a few times in confusion. "Uh... what? I mean... I thought you were going to start screaming at me."

"Of course you did," Rock Jaw replied with a smirk. "And here I thought I overplayed it durin' the fight. Guess the ol' legend of Rock Jaw's still alive and well."

Nyx sat down on her haunches. She was prepared for yelling, but this was so incongruous that it was making her head swim. "Overplayed...? What... you mean... you didn't...?"

"Mean what I was screamin' during the fight? Psh, nah, that was just to keep up the image. Course, you gave me the best scrap I've had since Shining Armor was a recruit, so I can't honestly say I was even coherent for that last bit."

Nyx rubbed her forehead. "But... I don't understand. You think I'm a monster!"

Rock Jaw set his face in a more serious expression and leaned forward to look the alicorn in the eye. "Listen, kid, and listen close. I've been serving Princess Celestia since I was a colt. If you've got two brain cells to rub together, you must've figured out that I was there when you put us all to sleep and took over. Then I was brainwashed with the rest of the Guard. And after you let us go, I was still raring to pick up my sword and come at you for the princess's sake, because I'm loyal to Celestia to my dying breath.

"But a big part of loyalty some ponies have trouble with is trust. Trust that goes beyond your own personal feelings. When Princess Luna showed up, a lot of ponies in the Guard thought she should've been sent straight back to the moon, and if it'd been my call, that's exactly what would've happened. But it wasn't, so I trusted her highness and accepted her decision. Then you came along and got off with what a lot of ponies thought was a slap on the hoof. Imagine the grumbling over Princess Luna, times twenty. All the fear and wounded pride. Some even said they felt betrayed by the princesses, as if their own hurt feelings counted for more than thousands of years of knowing a thing or two about a thing or two.

"So no, I don't think you're a monster, because I believe in Celestia, and she believes in you. Simple as that. Can't say I didn't enjoy our little sparring match, but considering I never got the chance to fight for my country the first time, you can't really blame me for relishing the opportunity for a rematch. Now are you gonna close your mouth? Can't have a Guard standing around with their jaw hanging open like they're trying to catch flies."

Nyx blinked and closed her mouth, not having realized that it was open. "Sorry, sir. But that still doesn't explain why you wrote what you did in your journal!" She quickly put a hoof over her mouth, going a few shades paler after realizing she had blurted out her invasion of the sergeant's privacy.

Instead of getting furious, though, he raised an eyebrow at her. "And how do you know what's in my PRIVATE journal, recruit? No, don't bother backpedaling, I've got a good idea. The truth is..."
122231112121.title: Warrior's Honor

1222311121211.content:
"W-what? But... why?"

"Look. You've been here for a few months, right? Well, you gotta remember the basics. Harmony comes from friendship. Y'know how you get friendship quickly when other ponies don't like ya? Ya earn respect." Rock Jaw waved a hoof dismissively. "You'd be surprised how many friends I have, missy, and most of them are recruits I used to yell at, because they're better now, thanks to all that. Sometimes, the best kind of friend out there is the one who gives you encouragement. But you can't survive on a friend's encouragement alone, you need your own courage, your own strength.

"Eons ago, or however long it was before the Princesses were born, and even before Discord began his rule, ponies never stuck together. They'd congregate on small groups to mate, and then they'd scatter like grain on the wind. Didn't matter back them that most wouldn't survive, 'cause that's how life was. Then, they started travelling in bigger and bigger groups, until they were roaming around in herds of thousands at a time. And there, in the very thicket of history being made, a concept so new it didn't have a name yet was invented. Two concepts, actually. Family and friendship. Back then, a pony could survive into adulthood if they were cunning enough, or had enough other ponies around to use as shields. Then, when the herds got so big it was almost impossible to think of surviving on your own, There'd start to be order. A certain degree of comradeship that fostered and grew until the first recorded piece of magic not done by unicorns was recorded.

That magic was the magic of love, friendship, and family. An earth pony mare fended off a fully grown dragon just by yelling at it, screaming at it, until a burst of light flew forth from her heart, scaring it away. She was protecting her daughter, and it was a phenomenon that happened more and more often as the herd mentality ponies had developed became something more."

Rock Jaw cleared his throat and picked up the glass of water on his nightstand, taking a small sip. "The bottom line is that when the need was great, a pony was able to throw themselves in front of their friends, and guard them. We go a little bit further than that, here in the Royal Guard. We stuff a bunch of ponies in a sardine can so they have nothing to do but make friends, or get on each other's nerves. But you were the exception. So, taking note that you were pretty buddy-buddy with Flint, I got one of his bunk mates to yammer about my journal, and then waited. I didn't expect anything to come of it so quickly, though."

Rock Jaw smiled, an honest smile. "Now, I'm proud that you've gotten on the other recruits' good sides, but don't worry." His smile turned into a sinister, teasing smirk. "I'm gonna push your horn to the grinding stone so hard that yer pretty little hoofsies will be sharp as a tack!"

Nyx grinned, snapping off a salute as she straightened up. "Sir, yes of course, sir!"

"So I made myself clear?"

"Clear as crystal 'neath the full moon, sir!"

"Good, now get your poetic flank outta here before I court-martial you for taking away from my beauty sleep."

Nyx left the room, suppressing her laugh of relief until she was back out front of her barracks. "Hey, uh... N-nyx?"

"Hm?" Nyx looked over her shoulder to see Flint standing there, pawing at the ground nervously.

"I was wondering..."

Flint arrived just seconds after her. He arrived out of breath. He had sprinted the whole way there because it took longer than he expected to get ready. He was wearing a black suit and tie that were just slightly too big for him. Despite this he looked quite nice.

13.content:
Twilight started fretting, "Well, she got this idea into her head, but I wasn't really sure because it was so radical. I tried to draft up some charts and checklists to weigh all the pros and cons, but she said she made up her mind..." She trailed off, muttering quietly to herself like Fluttershy in front of a press conference.

Leaning in curiously, Applejack asked, "Come on, Sugarcube, what'd she decide?"

Twilight took in a deep breath and let out a worried sigh. "She's... leaving the country. She knows that if she went anywhere near the capitol, all the ponies who thought the princesses let her off too easily would start making hay about it all over again, and that would be right there with the princesses to vouch that she's reformed. Everywhere else, she was afraid of starting a panic just by showing up." The unicorn let out a little chuckle. "Plus, you know curious she is about the world. So she figured that as long as everypony is afraid she'll become Nightmare Moon again, maybe she should travel somewhere where there aren't many ponies."

"Oh my, traveling abroad? How romantic! Oh, darling, you should have told me sooner! If she's going to be visiting other cultures, then she should represent the best of our own. I simply MUST prepare a fine dress for her to wear when she arrives! First impressions are so very important, you know, and I just received a shipment of sapphires that will look absolutely DIVINE on Nyx." Rarity then stood up and called out to her little sister, "Sweetie Belle, I have to dash off to the Boutique for a few hours!"

Pinkie Pie, who was being spun around in the air, quickly pulled her blindfold up and cried out, "Waaaaaiiiit! Don't go out yet!"

Rarity, who hadn't had a chance to get very far, blinked and asked, "Whyever not?" A question that caused Twilight to arch an eyebrow and ask their bubbly friend, "Yeah, why not?"

Bobbing around in the air, Pinkie Pie stammered, "W-well, because... we haven't had CAKE yet!" Quickly zipping out of Nyx's telekinetic field, she moved back into it just as quickly, but this time holding a large five-layer cake in her hooves. All of the Crusaders cheered, including Nyx as she dropped Pinkie, and everypony gathered around.

The five oldest Crusaders were the first to get their pieces, and started munching on them. "Mmm, this is so good! Thanks, Pinkie," Nyx said, watching the younger Crusaders line up for their slices next. Something seemed a little odd, though. She swallowed a mouthful of moist, chocolatey deliciousness before asking, "Hey, where's Spike?" She would have expected to see him at least lining up for a piece of his own, but had lost track of her draconic 'sibling' while spinning ponies around.

Twilight looked around as well, sharing the confusion. "That's weird. Where DID he go? And where's Rainbow Dash and Fluttershy for that matter? I know they were here just a little while ago."

"Ooh, maybe it was a mirage! Or an illusion! Maybe Fluttershy showed Dash a rabbit hole that sucked them into a parallel dimension where everything's topsy-turvy, and nothing makes sense! Here, have some cake," Pinkie Pie interjected, quickly shoving a slice of cake in front of the other three. Right at that moment, an irate Rainbow Dash threw the door open.

"What the hay, Pinkie? How long are we supposed to wait out there? I'm looking forward to that..." Her eyes widened, and her mouth opened as she saw the cake being served up. Then she narrowed her eyes in a cold glare, pointing accusingly at the pink earth pony. "You were supposed to wait until after! CAKE TRAITOR!"

Pinkie meeped as Rainbow Dash tackled her, Fluttershy timidly poking her head inside while Dash and Pinkie tussled, holding onto one end of some sort of banner. "Umm... am I supposed to still be holding this...? I can fly with my end, but I don't think it would be very legible that way..."

Rainbow Dash ended up knocking toward the doorway, where she tripped over the banner Fluttershy was holding, sending her tumbling outside. Moments later, a series of loud whistles and explosions filled the library as fireworks went off, illuminating the night sky with a festival of colors that all the little Crusaders and their parents had to rush to the windows or out the door to see, sadly only catching the last few streams of color.

Down below the fading smoke trails of the display, an embarrassed Spike waved to them standing next to an empty box. "Uh... heh... sorry, I kinda jumped the gun there."

From her spot on the ground, though, Pinkie Pie somehow produced a second box full of fireworks. "It's okay," she exclaimed in her usual perky way. "I brought backups!"

As Spike and Pinkie Pie got the second display started, the rest of their friends settled down on the grass to watch, chuckling at the comedy of errors that had led to that moment. Leaning over toward where Twilight and Nyx were sitting, Applejack asked, "So, Nyx. Twilight tells us you're goin' abroad for a little while. Where'd y'all plan on headin'?"

Nyx looked over to her mother, knowing she'd see the worried smile that was on the purple unicorn's face. Putting a foreleg around Twilight in a loving hug, she replied, "Well, princess Celestia already knows about it, so she arranged for me to visit..."

         Rarity coughed, and began to explain. "You see, Nyx, on Plowpony's Day several years ago, Twilight decided she wanted to try and teach me teleportation. Now, I told her that it wasn't necessary, that I had no desire to be a great mage, unlike her or..." she grimaced "...Trixie. After my first attempt ended in spectacular failure, I swore it off. Twilight, though, just would not listen to me. She ran back to the library to get... what was it, Twilight?"

         "Magical lubricant," Twilight replied. "It's meant to be used as an aid for unicorns who are having trouble learning how to teleport. I opened it up to check if it was still good, and didn't close it all the way. I tried teleporting with it back to the field."

         Nyx winced. She'd used the stuff once or twice after being stripped of her power as Nightmare Moon, and Twilight had explained how dangerous it could be if used improperly. "Let me guess... boom?"

         Twilight nodded, and Rarity picked up the tale. "The explosion could be felt and seen all the way out at the field. Being the good friends we are, all of us dashed to the library. We found Twilight and Spike, and they were mostly unharmed."

         "Uh, 'mostly'? That doesn't sound promising," Nyx said.

         "It isn't," Twilight said with a wince at the memory. "Turns out trying to teleport with a partially-opened tube of lubricant is a really bad idea. Not only did I cause an explosion - something I hadn't done since my early days as Princess Celestia's apprentice - but it gave me a case of Horn Rot."

         Nyx winced. "Ouch. And considering how powerful in magic you are..."

         "Yeah. Zecora told me I had, at most, two-and-a-half weeks before the Horn Rot would run its course. The normal cure takes three weeks to brew." Twilight sighed. "I thought I was a goner, until Zecora mentioned the Beneviolet, a flower that could reverse the effects. The problem was that the Beneviolet exists only in the Archback Mountains, far past the borders of Equestria. Past Gildedale, too."

         Rarity picked up the thread again. "I was feeling guilty about Twilight hurting herself trying to help me, so I offered to go along with Applejack and Rainbow Dash to find the Beneviolet. We ended up journeying through Gildedale and the Shimmerwood on our way to the Archbacks."

         Applejack cut in. "Durin' our stay in Gildedale, we met some of the local ponies, includin' their prince, Ashtail. We managed ta solve a problem they'd been havin' fer a long while, now. See, there are these creatures in Gildedale called komagas, which stampede across the plains fer a month at one point in the year. Thing is, the ponies there didn't know what a stampede was."

         Nyx grinned. "But with you there..."

         Applejack returned the grin. "Yep, we managed ta turn away a big herd of 'em before it could hit the capital, Thatchhome. Earned us quite a bit o' respect from their king, Hammer Hoof. He said the three of us would always be welcome in Gildedale." Her eyes grew wistful. "Sometimes, ah think about goin' ta visit, see how things are doin'..."

         "Visiting your coltfriend?" Rainbow Dash snickered from above, startling the group.

         "RAINBOW DASH!" bellowed Applejack, incensed. "What in tarnation d'ya think yer doin', startlin' us like that?!" She glared up at the cackling pegasus. "An' he AIN'T mah coltfriend!"

         Rainbow landed, still snickering. "I heard you all talking about Gildedale, and I thought I'd chip in my two cents." She leaned up to whisper in Nyx's ear. "AJ was rather fond of Ashtail, from what I saw."

         Applejack was preventing from lunging at the pegasus by a combined aura of blue and purple magic. "Applejack, Rainbow's just trying to rile you up," Twilight said. "Don't rise to her bait."

         Nyx chuckled. "Well, I'll be sure to pass Ashtail your regards, if you want, Applejack," she said. The farmpony blushed, but nodded.

*****


         The next day, the Crusaders left town, each heading their seperate ways. Nyx flew toward the Drackenridge Mountains, the natural border between Equestria and Gildedale. She carried with her a care package from Applejack, Rarity, and Rainbow Dash. Each of them had contributed something different. From Applejack, there was a bushel of apples, and a letter to Ashtail. From Rainbow Dash, a vial of liquid rainbow from her cloud-home's fountain. And from Rarity, a mane-care kit addressed to 'Shield Maiden and her grey filly', a designation that puzzled Nyx. Still, she flew strong, hoping to reach Gildedale before the day was out.

13511.content:
It was almost guiltily that Nyx proved Rainbow Dash right: It was easier to get over the Drackenridge Mountains by air than by ground, even with the gale-force winds.

When Nyx had pestered the three of them for details, Dash had shown her the trick she could do with lightning, and Nyx was definitely impressed when she dashed all the way up to Canterlot and then back with a letter to Twilight from Celestia, as well as one to Rarity from Falalauria, who had somehow known Dash would be dropping by.

Applejack had regaled Nyx with stories of Hammer Hoof's might, and even Ashtail's prowess with a lasso, once he knew what one was, and the times he had visited Sweet Apple Acres to see how she farmed. "He was mighty impressed when he saw not only how strong I was, but also how gentle I could buck-" Dash snickered- "Mah trees, and DAMMIT, Dash!"

As Dash and Applejack traded blows, Rarity spoke excitedly about their advances in fashion ever since she had done up a few designs for the ladies in the Eastern Quarter. Nyx's attention was drawn away when Dash tried to zap-tackle Applejack with her lightning run, only to bounce off and shoot off, out of town.

She came back a few minutes later with a bag of bits and a 'first prize' medal hung around her neck. When asked where she'd been, Dash had just shrugged, saying she'd won a race in Las Pegasus, a bet in Skybet*, and performed as a shooting star in the background for a movie being shot. As an aside to Rarity, it was a romance film she'd like.

Nyx shook off the memories of that morning, and started searching for her welcome party. Dash had sent word ahead, and she was expecting a small group, maybe around a campfire. All she could see was the beautiful golden grass, and a large patch of dirt below her. Banking sharply, she-

"LADY NYX, WE WELCOME YOU!"

"WELCOME!"

Nyx realizes that the large, square patch of what she thought to be dirt was actually a large formation of ponies, all with dull or mottled brown, gray, and tan coats. She alights in front of two ponies at the front of the company of mares and stallions, where two gray mares, the older with a shield on her flank, and the younger with an open mouth, where you could see the uvula. "You must be Shield Maiden, and her daughter?"

The younger mare- no, she was just a big filly- nodded, smiling happily. "My name is Mountain Voice!"

Nyx blinked. "Mountain Voice?"

"Yes, I went over the mountains to visit the pegasususes-"

"Pegasi," Nyx corrected unconsciously.

"-and the unicorns, and on the way back, we got trapped in the snow, so I yelled, and yelled, and yelled, and yelled until somepony heard us, and came to help us. When I was pulled out of the snow, I had my Cutie Mark!"

Nyx smiled, impressed. "That's amazing. You know, I can use the ROYAL CANTERLOT VOICE as well.

Deep Voice giggled. "If that's the Royal Canterlot Voice, than IT IS WEAK! TROOPS! YOU WILL LINE UP BEHIND SHIELD MAIDEN, OUR GUEST, AND MYSELF! MOVE!" Nyx barely had the time to blink before everypony was galloping as fast as equinely possible.

Nyx levitated the basket next to herself, keeping it level. She turned to Shield Maiden. "I thought that Captain Ashtail would be here," she shouted, though her voice sounded small against the thundering of hooves.

"No! He's with his father in Thatchhome!"

"What's going on?"

*For all intents and purposes, it's pronounced like Tibet, but with the 'skih' sound.
