14.content:
Twilight said to her friends, "Well, we spent a few days considering her options. I made charts with the pros and cons of each one and modified for the severity of each factor of course. And I made sure to thoroughly research each one, because I didn't want her to make a decision based on a knee-jerk bias over objective-"

"TWILIGHT!" Rarity and Applejack both interrupted in unison as the unicorn started to ramble, snapping her out of it.

She sheepishly smiled and continued, "R-right. Well, eventually, she decided that as much as she would like to prove her loyalty to the princesses directly, she was worried that getting too close to the capitol would cause political problems from those who think she should have been punished more severely. Celestia and Luna vouching for her would go a long way, but would also make some ponies raise questions about the fairness of their decisions.

She still wants to prove that she wants to help everypony, though, so she decided to apply for a law-enforcement job in another city. By enforcing Equestrian law far away from the princesses, she hopes to prove that she doesn't have any desire to take the throne again, and build a reputation that'll eventually overshadow... everything everypony remembers about Nightmare Moon..."

Applejack put a hoof on Twilight's shoulder as the purple unicorn's voice broke slightly. "Ah, it'll be okay, Sugarcube. Ah can't wrap mah head around all that politics mumbo-jumbo, but it sounds lahk y'all've put a lot o' thought into it. That gal's got her head screwed on right, so ah'm sure it'll work out."

"Indeed," Rarity said supportively. "Though with Sweetie Belle in Canterlot and Apple Bloom and Twist staying here in Ponyville, I imagine you must be so worried about her being lonely."

Twilight perked up a little, thanks to her friends and their kind words. "Actually, Nyx and Scootaloo will be going together. You know how she is about pursuing a serious racing and stunt career, so they arranged to go to the same city."

"Oh, that's MARVELOUS," Rarity exclaimed.

Applejack chuckled. "Yeah, ah can just imagine the trouble THOSE two'll get into on their own, but at least they'll have each other." She looked toward the game being played and arched an eyebrow so high that it raised the brim of her hat. "Speakin' of trouble, what the hay is Pinkie Pie doin'?"

Nyx had apparently decided to play a little joke on the pink earth pony, holding her upside-down with her magic and levitating books to act as a 'floor' while Pinkie walked toward the pony drawing on the wall, seemingly oblivious to the inversion of gravity while the little Crusaders laughed wildly and cheered her on. And yet, when she reached the wall, Pinkie somehow managed to pin the tail exactly on the X anyway, drawing gasps not just from the kids, but from Twilight and the other parents and guardians at the party.

As Nyx flipped Pinkie around to place her back on the real floor, the alicorn's jaw was hanging open. "HOW did you do that?" she asked, honestly astonished while Pinkie pulled off the blindfold.

"Oh, that's easy, you just have to HUUAAAAAAAGH!" Everyone present was startled by the earth pony's sudden gasp as she pointed toward the front windows. "Look out, there's a giant Ursa Major coming and it's gonna step on the library!!!" This suddenly threw everyone into a panic, though Twilight and Nyx were the first to throw themselves into action, both of them bursting out the front door, their horns glowing with magic! Neither was going to let anypony to come to harm on their watch, though perhaps they should have noticed more quickly that they hadn't heard or felt any of the telltale signs of such an enormous creature stomping through town. As a result, what they did see took them completely by surprise.

Mere moments after stepping out of the library, the sky exploded in a burst of fireworks that backlit Rainbow Dash and Fluttershy as they held up a banner reading "GOOD LUCK, CUTIE MARK CRUSADERS!" Fluttershy's end dipped lower as she reflexively cringed from the loud noises, but she kept it aloft anyway.

Spike, who was down between the two pegasi, grinned and waved before setting off a wave of fireworks with a puff of dragon fire. All the little ponies and their parents rushed outside to gawk as rockets and streamers flew up into the air, exploding in colorful blossoms of fire. "Oh my gosh, this is perfect," Scootaloo exclaimed, taking the opportunity to show off by whipping out her scooter. Upgraded and adjusted over the past few years, she used her wings to give her a quick boost of speed and launch herself up a small rise in the road like a ramp.

Wanting to help her friend, Nyx launched herself up into the air to intercept Scootaloo, pushing up under the bottom of the pegasus pony's scooter to give her an extra boost. Hooves clapped together wildly as she flipped around in the air, capping the highest tip of a bright, star-shaped explosion, then getting a high-five from Rainbow Dash at the apex of the arc. The sound of her fanfillyish squeal on the way down could be heard even over the pops and bangs of the display as Dash and Nyx flew underneath Scootaloo to bring her back down to the ground with her held aloft like a celebrity.

Down on the ground, the two pairs of sisters sat next to each other, ooohing and ahhhing at the impromptu display of showmanship.

When Nyx made it back to her mother, Twilight laughed and said, "I can't believe you pulled that off on the spur of the moment!"

Nyx laughed as well, leaning down to nuzzle Twilight. "I can't believe you set up all these fireworks for us. I love you so much, mom."

Twilight was actually as surprised as anyone else, but decided not to say so as she nuzzled back. Her horn lit up with magic as she formed an image in her mind, then cast a spell to shoot it up into the sky. A fond memory from when Nyx was just a little filly, the two of them with Spike and Owlowicious sitting around a storybook. This image then spread out, bringing all of their friends and family into a tapestry that spread across the sky.

"I love you too, Nyx. So much.

------------

The next day, everyone big tearful goodbyes and well wishes to their friends and loved ones. Nyx made a Pinkie Pie promise to write home every week before she and Scootaloo got on the train that would take them to their destination. They both leaned out the window, waving as the train started to chug along out of the station.

Scootaloo could barely contain her excitement as she sat down, bouncing on her seat. "I can't believe it. We're doing this! We're REALLY doing this! Nyx, this is gonna be the best time of our LIVES!"

Nyx giggled, smiling fondly as she watched Ponyville slowly vanish over the horizon. "Eh... I'd be fine with second best."

They were on their way to...

===============

1. Appleoosa. It's grown into a boom town with a newly built racetrack, and Nyx can learn about frontier justice from the sheriff.

2. Manehattan. The big city is bound to be full of wonders, and could surely use another friendly neighborhood policemare.

3. Las Pegasus. A hotspot of entertainment, tourism, and absolutely no organized crime! Nope, just look somewhere else!

4. Fillydelphia. Current record holder for highest windspeed in a hurricane. The area's a bit of a disaster magnet.

142.content:
The train whistle blew as it pulled into Manehattan Central Station, gradually slowing to a stop. Nyx and Scootaloo filed out with the rest of the passengers and looked around in awe. The two of them had gotten dressed in some clothes that Rarity had made for them as a farewell gift. Elegantly tailored dresses and wide-brimmed hats that she had assured them gave them a 'high-society allure'. In Nyx's case, this also covered her horn so that aside from her unusual eyes, she simply looked like an unusually large pegasus.

As the two of them carried their luggage out of the station with the handles in their mouths, both of them nearly dropped their bags as they gaped at the city around them. Even though Canterlot was more grand in the sense that it housed the Royal Palace and the manor homes of the aristocratic elite, the sheer number of immense buildings towering over them was an astonishing sight. Moreso because in stark contrast to Equestria's capital or smaller towns like Ponyville, Manehattan was a busy place, seemingly every inch of it bustling with activity. The two friends had to take extra care not to get separated from each other in the constantly moving crowds outside the station while at the same time being nearly overwhelmed by the sheer scale of everything.

As a result, they didn't notice the pony that had been waving to them until he walked right up and tapped Nyx on the shoulder. "Excuse me, miss..."

Nyx turned to look, seeing a purple earth pony in a chauffeur's uniform. Hanging from his neck was a sign reading:

Scootaloo
& Nyx


"Oh! Yes, that's us," Nyx replied. "And you are...?"

"Cobblestone, miss," the chauffeur replied. "Mister Orange sent me to take you to your apartment."

The earth pony pointed to the most ornate carriage either of the mares had ever seen, causing Scootaloo to actually drop her luggage this time as she squealed, "Oh, wow, this is so awesome! Next time we see Applebloom, remind me to give her a big hug!" Nyx was surprised too as Cobblestone picked up the fallen bag and put it inside the carriage. Applebloom had told them that she had well-to-do relatives in the city who would help them get a good deal on a place to stay, but knowing the down-to-earth Apple clan as she did, Nyx simply hadn't been able to imagine this sort of extravagance.

Once Nyx and Scootaloo were in the carriage, Cobblestone hitched himself to it and started taking them down the busy streets.

It wasn't very far, but because of the teeming traffic, it took them about half an hour to reach their destination. Not that either of the mares were complaining, as it gave them a chance to get a good look at the city as they went. When they pulled up in front of a huge apartment building, Cobblestone took their luggage while a uniformed stallion in front of the building opened the door and tipped his hat to them. This caused Scootaloo to stop for a moment to ask him, "Hey, is this your job?"

The doorstallion blinked, but then replied, "Well, yes."

"You're paid to just stand here outside the building all day and pull the door open?" the pegasus asked with a raised eyebrow. "Even though I'm pretty sure most of the ponies who live here can do something as simple as open doors for themselves?"

"More or less. Why?"

Scootaloo squealed excitedly. "This is so awesome! Nyx, we've got a guy to open doors for us! Forget what I said before; next time I see Applebloom, I'm kissing her!"

Nyx chuckled a little and shooed her friend inside, replying, "Careful, Scoot, or I'll hold you to that." To the doorstallion, she said quietly, "Sorry about that, she's just really excited."

"Not at all," he replied with a bemused grin and a tip of his hat. "It's kind of refreshing, actually."

After a trip up the elevator, which was a novelty in itself for the two, Cobblestone led them to their apartment, which caused them to gape anew.

"Luna's mane..." Nyx exclaimed breathlessly, "It's practically bigger than the library! How are we supposed to afford this?"

Cobblestone set their bags down and replied, "This building is one of Mr. Orange's properties, Ms. Nyx. He wanted me to assure you that you would be getting a significant discount on the rent on account of your ties with the family." To Scootaloo, he added, "And from the trolley stop at the corner, it's just a ten minute ride to Big Orange Technical, Ms. Scootaloo."

The pegasus was still stunned by the apartment, but nodded along. She had been accepted to the college on a scholarship program. In exchange for joining the school's racing team, she would be able to get attention from talent scouts as well as classes in aerodynamics and engineering that would help her go professional.

"Thank you very much, Mr. Cobblestone," Nyx said as he handed her two copies of the apartment keys. "And please give Mr. and Mrs. Orange our thanks, too!" He smiled and nodded, leaving the apartment to let the mares get acquainted with their new home. Looking around, Nyx smiled. It was almost too good to be true.

The next day...

1422.content:
"What do you mean, my application was denied?" Nyx asked, pulling a sheet of paper from a satchel she had brought to the police academy. "You ponies sent me an acceptance form just last week!"

"I'm sorry," the unicorn clerk she was talking to replied. He opened up a file drawer and pulled out a thick sheaf of documents, flipping through them one by one. "According to our records, that was supposed to be a rejection form. I'm afraid it happens, sometimes. The system is supposed to catch these things, but every so often a mistake filters through the net. Ah, here we are." He pulled out the letter of application that Nyx had sent a month previously, showing it to her along with the large DENIED stamped across it.

"But... why...?" Nyx asked, her heart sinking like a stone.

Reading a hand-written note attached to the forms out loud, the clerk replied, "'Though the applicant has been legally absolved of the counts of high treason against the crown, we must deny her application. The public outcry over having such a high-profile criminal in our ranks would be a permanent stain on this department's image. Not to mention the effect this would have on the morale of our officers. Don't include this in the rejection letter, though. The last thing we need is a ticked-off... alicorn..."

The clerk trailed off, eventually realizing his mistake as he looked nervously over at Nyx. Instead of getting angry, though, the black mare hung her head lower and lower with every word. "I... I see..." she muttered quietly in a manner more befitting Fluttershy. Slowly turning away, Nyx walked out of the building, her heart crushed.

She had honestly thought this was different. She had sent out applications all over Equestria, and Manehattan had been the only department to accept. She pulled out the letter she had received again and looked it over. The tone of it was so positive. So proud to have her. But it had all just been a mistake.

Making her way into a small alley so no one would see her, Nyx clenched her eyes shut. She then started ripping apart the letter while berating herself for putting all her hopes on this false chance. "I should've figured... everyone else sent a rejection, so I should've known it was a clerical error..."

Suddenly, though, she heard something that broke her from her depressed thoughts.
1422.title: Beauraucracy strikes

choices: The newspaper. Who would suspect a mild-mannered cub reporter?
Something else
14221.content:
"If you just believe whatever you're told," a voice interrupted, "then you wouldn't have gotten very far as a policemare anyway."

Nyx opened her eyes in surprise, but didn't see anypony else in the alley as she looked around. "What? Who's there?"

"Someone who knows the real reason you got turned away. You being here scares the wrong ponies."

Nyx glared down the alley. She couldn't see anyone. A Throw-your-voice spell, maybe? "Yeah, the clerk in there said as much."

"Not the citizens," the disembodied voice replied. "And not the cops. I'm talking about the ones who have their hooves in some dirty business, but they're never afraid of getting arrested because they make big donations to the Copper's Ball every year." When Nyx blinked in surprise, the voice added, "Don't look so shocked. The Orange family aren't the only ponies of wealth and influence in this city."

Nyx narrowed her eyes. Now she was getting angry. "Oh yeah? Well, I've got connections, too. If that's how they want to play it..."

"Then they'll just wait patiently for the right time to destroy your life, and the lives of everyone you care about," the voice replied. "The ponies I'm talking about know how to work the system. The more powerful ones practically built the system. If you call in favors from the Royal Sisters, they'll just keep their noses clean for a little while. You don't even know who they are, let alone have any evidence they've done anything wrong. But it'll disrupt their business just enough to annoy them, and the next thing you know, Scootaloo gets busted with some illegal substance on her."

Fear mixed in with the anger at the mention of Scootaloo's name, which the disembodied voice apparently saw. "That's right, I know about your friend. And that means they know about her, they just don't care enough to make a move unless you give them a reason."

"But why? Why target me like this? I haven't done anything to them, yet. What am I supposed to do?"

"As for 'why', you just answered your own question. You haven't bothered them yet, but you would, given the chance. You had Equestria in your hooves. But then you gave it back. They can't understand why anyone with that kind of power would ever just give it up, but the smarter ones know that it means you're trouble. Ponies with real integrity always bother them, but when it comes with the strength and connections to put that integrity into practice, that terrifies them."

After a pause, the voice continued, "As for what you should do, that's up to you. If you try to get any kind of job that might give them grief, you'll find yourself blackballed in ten seconds flat. Honestly, the smart thing to do would be to just get back on the train and head home."

Nyx grimaced. She had come all this way in order to become someone who protected ponies from harm. But fighting off monsters from the Everfree Forest was very different from this sort of corruption. It certainly would be easier to go back home and deal with threats that she could actually hit back against. But instead, she replied, "Then I must have taken my stupid-pills this morning, because I think this is exactly why I need to stay here."

She couldn't see the expression on the face of the voice's owner, of course, but they sounded pleased as they said, "I was rather hoping you'd say that. It won't be easy, though. These ponies got where they are in the first place by knowing how to get away with things. You'll be blackballed from any job that might let you give them trouble, and you can't openly make a move since... well, let's face it. You have some very distinct features." There was a pause before the voice added, "I need to go. But I'll be in touch."

Nyx nodded. "Duly noted... but who are you? And why did you tell me all this?"

She received no reply, however. Left alone in the alley, she looked at the torn-up remnants of her acceptance letter. She then set her jaw and headed back out onto the street. She couldn't say she really knew what was going to come of it, but she had an idea and several hours before Scootaloo was scheduled to get back to the apartment to put it into motion.

----------

Once she had returned to the apartment, Nyx took the dress and hat she had worn the previous day. With a sigh, she whispered, "Sorry, Rarity, but it's for a good cause," as she took some scissors and began cutting up the dress, along with some of the other clothes she had brought with her. Whoever the voice was, they were right about one thing. There weren't any other solid black alicorns with turquoise dragon eyes running around, so if she was going to do anything, it couldn't be as Nyx. No... she would become someone else.

It was a story her mother had told her when she was a filly. Not one from any book, but from Twilight's life. A legend that she and her friends had created as part of one of their zany adventures.

After a few hours of work, cutting and sewing the material into a new form, Nyx slipped herself into a dark full-body with holes for her wings. She then put on a pair of goggles and a scarf she had bought on the way home. Topping it off with the wide-brimmed hat Rarity had made, Nyx looked at herself in the mirror. In the reflection, she saw a tall pegasus, the hat keeping her horn hidden while the tinted goggles masked her unusual eyes, and the scarf covered up the rest of her face. With a hidden grin, she pulled the last piece into place, attaching a cape to her neck.

"Maybe Nyx can't do anything in this city," she said to her reflection before rearing up in a pose. "But Mare-Do-Well can!"

Of course, being a masked vigilante alone wouldn't pay the bills, so Nyx had also begun working on a third identity that she could use to get a job. She had brought her old hairband and enchanted glasses as mementos of her fillyhood, but by placing the lenses into new frames, she could hide her dragon-like eyes easily enough. By wearing a vest to keep her wings concealed and a little magic to change the color of her hair and mane, she looked like nothing more than an unusually large unicorn.

"Now then, I'll just have to see about getting another job. Preferably one that'll help me dig up some dirt. Maybe I can ask Mr. Orange to help me out with that..."
14221.title: This Orange is slightly rotten

choices: "There's been a fire in one of the older districts. Can you cover it?"
"Foals have been disappearing from an orphanage. Wanna take a shot?"
142211.content:
There were two final touches to the third identity Nyx was crafting. First, she needed to cover up her cutie mark. Fortunately, she knew of a cutie-mark removal spell. Rarity had shown it to her at one point, saying that she had nearly gotten ostracized from her circle of friends on getting her cutie mark. Rarity had discovered and made use of the spell until each of her friends had their own cutie marks, at which point she stopped using it. However, Nyx being the curious filly she'd been, she'd eventually convinced the fashionista to show the spell, which even Twilight hadn't heard of. With that out of the way, some carefully applied body paint would form a new cutie mark.

         The last thing she needed to do to complete her new identity was to choose a name. Although not many ponies knew her true name, it was still a bit of an oddity. She needed a name that would blend in better. She sighed in frustration. "Ugh, stupid bureaucrats and their stupid fear of somepony who's practical with her power."

         "I could not agree more, Nyx," came a familiar voice.

         Nyx jumped and spun to face the speaker. "P-p-Princess Luna!" she yelped, then hastily bowed.

         The lunar princess chuckled. "Rise, Nyx. You are the daughter of my dear friend, not a filly to be scolded for being caught with her hoof in the cookie jar."

         Nyx blinked at that. "Uh, where'd that come from?"

         Luna chuckled again. "Let's just say I got caught in that exact situation a few times. Now, as for bureaucrats, I see you're well on you way to making a secret identity to deal with that. Have you any idea what you wish this new identity to be?"

         "No, and it's annoying me. Why do I have to go to so much trouble? I'm trying to come up with a new cutie mark as well, but it's just so hard!"

         Luna smiled. "Well, there is one thing I can tell you," she said. Nyx cocked her head curiously. "Even during my... dark days, I had an appreciation for journals and the written word. Perhaps you inherited some of that?"

         Nyx blinked. "Well, I do like to read... and I've even written a few things..."

         "And Manehattan has one of the most prestigious newspapers around, from what I hear," Luna added.

         Nyx nodded, a smile forming on her face. "Alright, then! I'm going to be Night Quill, new reporter for the Manehattan Times!"

         "Excellent!" Luna clapped her hooves in approval. "By the way, there's a spell that Celly and I developed in order to... blend in with the common folk if we felt the need. It's designed to hide our true nature as alicorns, since we're such a rare breed."

         Nyx's eyes widened. "Wow! That would be a big help with the disguise!"

         "Indeed, which is why I've decided you could use it. After all, even if you hide your wings with a vest, you're still a very large pony. Larger than most, and that makes you noticeable. Now, with this spell, you won't have to worry about that. Here's how it works..."

*****


         "So, Night Quill, do you have any previous journalism experience?" asked Jonah Jamareson, chief editor of the Manehattan Times. He was an earth pony with a blue coat, bright blue eyes, and a short-cropped black mane with grey streaks. His cutie mark was that of a folded newspaper in a bright blue star.

         "No professional experience, although I did occasionally write for the Foals Free Press in Ponyville," replied 'Night Quill'. She appeared to be a normal unicorn, with a deep blue coat, a cyan mane, and turquoise eyes. Her cutie mark was of a feather quill over a scroll, with a crescent moon on the scroll itself.

         "Really?" Jamareson said. "I heard about a bit of a fiasco with that newspaper a few years back. Something called 'Gabby Gums'. That wasn't you, was it?"

         The disguised alicorn shook her head. "No, I only became part of the paper after that whole incident blew over."

         "Ah," the editor said. "Shame, a minor celebrity would have been a great addition. Still, I suppose you have the experience. Welcome to the Manehattan Times!"

         Nyx blinked. "Wait, seriously? That's it? You hear I wrote for a foal's paper, and you hire me?"

         Jamareson sighed. "I'll be honest, Night Quill. We've been losing a lot of good writers lately. Ever since the Daily Planet went up in Maretropolis, suddenly it's the place to be for any newspony. But I'm staying here because I've been here since my old paper, the Daily Bugle, got bought out. I won't leave this company to anypony else."

         Nyx smiled. "Well, in that case, I'm happy to be aboard, Mr. Jamareson!" She held out a hoof.

         He smiled back. "Just call me Jonah." He shook the offered hoof. "Now, as it happens, I've got something I could use a fresh perspective on..."
142211.title: Clark Nyx? Nyx Parker? Nah, just Night Quill

choices: It's been a long ride. Settle in first
Sleep is for the weak! See the sights!
Someone was waiting for them to arrive.
143.content:
After several hours of riding the train into the desert, the sun eventually dipped down over the horizon. This gave the excited duo of Nyx and Scootaloo a chance to see a bright aura of light off in the distance, illuminating the growing dim. Pressing their faces against the cooling glass of the window, their train zoomed along the tracks toward the brilliant city that seemed to rise up over the horizon like a second sun.

"This is so freaking awesome," Scootaloo exclaimed, peeling herself from the window to bounce around the train car and punch the air a few times, simply unable to contain her energy. "I can't believe we're almost there! Las Pegasus! THE place for stunts and racing!"

"Yeah," Nyx replied, every bit as excited. "Before we know it, ponies are going to be packing the place to see Scootaloo: Fastest Pegasus on Wheels!"

Scootaloo laughed and replied, "I prefer 'Scootaloo: Tires of Fire' myself, but that does have a nice ring to it."

Nyx nodded, grinning widely as she looked down at her friend's cutie mark. A wheel that looked like it was spinning so fast that it had caught fire, and was going to zoom off Scootaloo's flank any moment. She had always been insanely talented with her scooter, but the mark hadn't appeared for a long time. It wasn't until she was a bit older and realized that her wings were never going to be strong enough to let her be a strong flier like her idol, Rainbow Dash. She had fallen into depression over it for a while, but thanks in small part to a zany scheme or two, the Cutie Mark Crusaders had helped her rekindle her love for wheeled vehicles instead. By letting go of her desire to be just like Dash and instead devote herself to developing her own skills, her cutie mark had finally appeared.

"And I get to be the roommate of the 'Tires of Fire'," Nyx said with a giggle. "I should get your autograph now before you're too big a star to be associated with us 'little ponies.'"

Really, the fact that they'd been offered opportunities in the same city was a miracle, especially since most of the police departments she'd applied for sent back replies that basically said, 'please don't ever contact us again' if they sent a reply at all. The Las Pegasus department, by contrast, had sent a glowing acceptance letter at the same time Scootaloo had gotten the attention of an amateur racing team. It was a fantastic turn of events for each of them, but being able to share the costs by travelling and rooming together was all the better.

After the train pulled into the station, the two disembarked with their luggage and gaped as they walked down the strip. Herds of ponies practically flooded the streets, contributing to the sensory overload of brightly lit signs for all the various casinos, clubs and other tourist attractions.
143.title: The City of Irresponsible Fun

choices: "Sorry, but my friend here has a big day tomorrow."
"Sure, if we have time to see Flip's act first."
"My friend here's such a big fan, any way we can get backstage?"
1431.content:
As much as the two ponies wanted to wander around and see everything, Nyx walked down the street said, "Come on, Scootaloo, let's get to our hotel so I can put these bags down." She then glanced over her shoulder and had to turn back around when she saw her friend get drawn toward a crowd gathered in front of the Seven-Leaf, one of the larger casinos on the strip. There, standing on a platform that was backlit by the casino's trademark sign of a seven-leaf clover, was an earth pony in a track suit. He was sitting atop a motorscooter at the top of an extremely high ramp, and revved the vehicle's engine for the crowd.

With a soft sigh, Nyx hurried over and grabbed Scootaloo's tail in her mouth before she could get lost in the crowd. Her friend struggled, whining, "Aww, come on Nyx, that's Flip Cartwheel up there! He's one of the best stuntponies alive! This is gonna be awesome!"

Nyx let go of Scootaloo's tail and chuckled a little, shaking her head. "Seriously, Scootaloo, you'll get plenty of chances to see this sort of thing. Heck, you'll get plenty of chances to do this sort of thing. Come on, I want to find our hotel while I still have time to get some sleep, and neither of us should be going off on our own right now."

Scootaloo groaned, but reluctantly turned around to go with her friend. "Fine, but you owe me, Nyx."

"I promise, if I don't make it up to you somehow, you can yank me away if I meet one of my idols," the alicorn replied with a soft laugh, turning around and immediately running into another pony.

Taken by surprise, Nyx stumbled and fell to the ground, as did the luggage she'd been keeping aloft with her magic, causing the bags to spill open.

Nyx shook her head and started to pick herself up before offering a hoof to the pony she'd knocked down. He was an older, flinty grey unicorn wearing an extremely expensive suit and fedora on the ground beside him. As she helped him to his hooves, Nyx suddenly gasped as recognition hit her.

"Y-y-you're... Suave Crooner," she stammered, her jaw hanging open.

Reaching out with his magic once he was upright, the unicorn picked up his fedora and put it back on his head. "The one and only." He then turned his head up to get a good look at Nyx, giving her a smile that made the mare's knees wobble. "But a tall, dark and gorgeous drink of water like you can call me whatever she wants."

"Swa-who? Nyx, who's this geezer?" Scootaloo had walked up and asked the question with a raised eyebrow, causing Nyx's face to feel like it had just caught on fire as she slapped a hoof over the pegasus's mouth.

Whispering into her friend's ear, Nyx hissed, "That's Suave Crooner! The Chairman! One of the greatest singers of all time!"

Scootaloo blinked in confusion a few times, but then asked, "Wait, is he the guy from those old records you borrowed from the mayor?" She started snickering. "Sweet Celestia, you're blushing! Oh, wow, wait'll the others hear you're in love with a fossil..."

"He's not that old! I-I mean, that's not it! I just admire his music!"

"You know," Suave Crooner said, interrupting their whispered conversation, "I'm doing a set in the Seven-Leaf, and I always perform better with a couple of lovely ladies in the front row, if you'd like to accompany me."

Before Nyx could say anything, Scootaloo got a wicked grin on her face and replied...
1431.title: Star struck

choices: Follow Nyx on her first day on the force
Follow Scootaloo as she meets the racing team
14311.content:
Nyx flopped down into her bed, groaning as she buried her face in the pillow. "Arrrrrgh, I hate the world..." she grumpily muttered. What made it worse was that when she tried to argue in favor of going to see the show, Scootaloo just smirkingly turned her own arguments against her. As a result, the two of them had found their way to the cheap hotel where they would be rooming together. She had barely noticed it, though, instead simply dropping her luggage as soon as they were in the door and throwing herself onto the bed.

"Well, speaking as a tax-paying citizen, I'm glad to know that our stalwart defender of law and order isn't gonna be sleeping through her training," Scootaloo teased. She then giggled as she ducked under the pillow Nyx threw at her. "Aw, come on, Nyx, don't be like that. You'll get plenty of chances to see shows in this town. Though considering how old he is, maybe you should move fast."

While Scootaloo snickered to herself, Nyx's horn glowed and reached out for the pillow she'd thrown, pulling it back to hit the pegasus in the back of the head. She looked over at the alicorn and narrowed her eyes into a challenging smirk. "Of course you realize, this means war," she said before picking up her own pillow in her mouth and launching herself at Nyx!

Cushions flew and bits of stuffing scattered around the room as the two young mares settled their differences in the traditional ways passed down through the generations. In the end, both of them had taken many a blow, and were panting heavily with exhaustion. "... Truce...?" Scootaloo asked with a tired grin.

Nyx nodded, falling back into her bed. "Yeah... truce... Ugh... I was so stupid... Your thing would've only taken a few minutes... so sorry, Scoot..."

Scootaloo picked up her pillow and put it back on her own bed, fluffing it up a bit before climbing onto the mattress. "Nah... don't be." She snickered to herself. "You were so busy trying to convince me to let you see that Crooner guy sing, Flip had time to do his trick and you didn't even notice, so I got what I wanted." When Nyx stared blankly at her, the pegasus gushed, "Quadruple-flip through two rings of fire! Can you believe it? Hoo boy, I'd have been kicking myself the whole way here if I hadn't seen that! Guess it would've been like how you felt, huh?"

Nyx's teeth started to grind together, her eyes shifting to a solid turquoise glow. "Vengeance... eternal vengeance...!" she growled, causing Scootaloo to yelp and quickly pull out two small slips of paper that she held out toward her friend.

"Th-that's why before I left, I told him about what a huge fanfilly you are, and he gave me a couple of tickets for later in the week!"

Nyx blinked, her eyes snapping back to normal with an almost audible *poof* as her usual slit-shaped pupils widened and glistened with unbridled joy. "T... tickets?"

Scootaloo chuckled and nodded. "I was gonna surprise you later on, but considering you looked like you were gonna turn me into a houseplant or something..."

Nyx practically pounced the pegasus, hugging her tightly! "Aw, Scoot, I'm sorry I was mad at you! We're totally even now! More than even! I owe you big for this!"

Scootaloo laughed, hugging back. "Well, keep in mind it's for the end of the week, so there's always a chance he could petrify by then... I'm kidding! I'm kidding! Hey, he looks good for someone who could be my grandpa."

Nyx pretend-glared at her friend as she replied, "I love you, Scootaloo, but I will unleash pillowy wrath again if you keep that up."

With that, the two ponies laughed and finished getting ready for the night before going to their beds and drifting off to sleep.
14311.title: Shield, meet double-edged sword

choices: An illusion of a store where a robbery is being committed.
An illusion of a police desk, with a cop's worst enemy: paperwork.
143111.content:
Nyx whistled a merry tune the next day as she trotted down the street to the address listed on the paper in front of her. Though police work probably wasn't all glamour and heroism, it would go a long way in trying to dispel the stigma of being Nightmare Moon's reincarnation. She had considered other options, and while some were enticing, she wanted to get to work burying her past as soon as possible.

         Looking up, she realized she had arrived at the Las Pegasus Police Academy. Smiling, she trotted inside to the front desk, where a dark amaranth pegasus mare sat doing the daily crossword, occasionally tossing a lock of her grey mane out of her face. "Hello," the secretary said, not looking up. "Can I help you?"

         Glancing at the sheet, Nyx nodded. "Yes, I'm a new recruit for the force, I sent in my application a few weeks ago?"

         Sighing, the secretary put down her pencil, and reached for a stack of papers. "Name?"

         "Nyx," replied the alicorn.

         The mare paused, and finally looked up. Her blue eyes widened on seeing Nyx. "You... you're the ex-Nightmare, right?" she asked, plucking an application out of the stack absent-mindedly.

         Nyx winced. "I prefer not to be called anything like that, ma'am."

         "Well, of course not!" the mare replied. "I mean, you saved a whole town, nearly killed yourself in the process, and have done nothing since to earn anypony's ire. That was years ago, anyway, and it's all water under the bridge to me." She held out a hoof. "Delta Requiem, pleasure to make your acquaintance."

         Nyx smiled, shaking the offered hoof. "Likewise, Ms. Requiem."

         "Please, just Delta," replied the pegasus. "So, you applied to the academy, eh? Good choice; Las Pegasus prides itself on its police force. Of course, we kind of have to, since our crime rates are the highest in Equestria, despite our efforts. Every little bit helps, you know?"

         Nyx nodded. "Exactly. So, where do I go?"

         "Well, you've got 15 minutes before orientation, so if you'll follow the signs, you'll get right to the meeting room," Delta replied.

         Nyx thanked her, and followed the signs to the labeled room. She opened the door, where twenty-nine other ponies were seated at desks, with one at a podium on a small raised stage. Nopony had noticed her yet, so she announced her presence with a knock on the door. Everypony turned, and promptly started gawking at her. All save the unicorn stallion at the podium. "You'd be Nyx, right?"

         Nyx nodded at the stallion's no-nonsense attitude. "Yes, sir."

         "Take a seat. You're just in time," he said. Nyx took a seat near the stage. A few minutes later, the stallion checked the clock on the wall, and nodded, closing the door with his magic. "Greetings, recruits. I am Captain Sharp Whistle of the Las Pegasus 45th Precinct, and also a teacher here at the Academy. You will not be working with me every day, so don't expect that. Now, some academies have you read books or take written tests for the first few months. Not here. Here, we believe in 'learning by doing'. So, if you'll follow me, we've got a few mock-ups of scenarios you might face in your time as an officer of the law."

         Nyx and the other hopefuls followed him to a hallway filled with doors. "There are ten doors, and thirty of you total. One group of ten will go first, then the next group, then the next. We'll cycle through everyone, until everyone has done each scenario once. The rooms are all equipped with security cameras that will record everything that happens. You will be judged based on your reactions to each situation. Now, you ten will be the first to pick a door."

         That group included Nyx. She chose a door at random, as the other nine in her group went to doors of their own choice. Nyx opened the door to find...
143111.title: Police Work For Dummies

choices: Nyx and her fellow recruits continue with the tests
Glitzen Glamour covertly approaches Nyx between tests
1431111.content:
Nyx was rather surprised to have practical tests so soon. Expecting the standard exams to start with, she and her mother had spent long hours studying all the laws and statutes that would be likely to come up. It was still just rote knowledge that she hadn't expected to have to use so soon. As a result, she felt nervous as she pushed through the door.

A bell overhead jingled as she stepped into the scene that had been set up. It was a small grocery store, with rows of vegetables, fruits and flowers on display. At the front counter, a stocky beige earth pony clerk was stuffing bits into a sack while a yellowish-green pegasus in a fedora held him at knife-point. Hearing Nyx come in, the robber quickly flapped his wings and vaulted over to the other side of the counter. "Don't move, copper! I'm takin' the bits and gettin' outta here, or this guy gets gelded, see?"

Taken by surprise by the realism of the illusion, Nyx was momentarily stunned. Reflexes took over the same as if she were really watching somepony being put in danger, and she snapped, "Hold it!" Not before the pegasus got to the clerk's side of the counter, though. Seeing the situation worsen, the young alicorn's heart and mind raced. "No, just... hold on. Nopony has to get hurt here. Like you said, you can just take the bits and go."

Backing up between two of the rows, but ensuring that the robber could keep her in sight as she offered him a path to the door. Her purple mane started to waft and move, despite there being no breeze through the shop. Glancing between the alicorn and the door, the robber snatched up the sack of bits and flapped toward the exit. Before he could reach the door, however, a black blur slammed into him, knocking him to the floor!

*****


Sharp Whistle stepped into the control room overseeing the various test rooms just as he heard an excited cheer come from one of the ponies in there. A gold-colored unicorn in a similarly hued suit, wearing expensive sunglasses despite being indoors, was frantically pointing at one of the screens. "That's what I'm talkin' about! That's what I'm talkin' about! Did you see that? Star material, baby!"

Arching an eyebrow, Captain Whistle rolled his eyes and asked, "What should I have seen, Mr. Glamour?"

Seeing the police stallion enter, the gold unicorn laughed excitedly and pulled him over. "Sharpy, baby, how many times do I have to say it? Just call me Glitzen! Especially when you give me grade-A talent like this! Wind the tape back, will you doll?" The policemare working the camera controls looked to Captain Whistle, who just gave her a resigned 'humor him' look before she rewound the footage of Nyx's test.

Pausing for a moment at the point where she had just started to back away from the robber, the image showed her mane and tail starting to move, and her hair flowed back behind her out of the pegasus's sight as she magically created a copy of herself. The copy then slipped around to another row so that when the robber tried to make his escape, the unseen alicorn had a clear shot at tackling him to the floor.

"Boom, baby! That! Is! What! I'm! Talking about!" The unicorn punched Sharp Whistle a few times in the shoulder for emphasis, who looked at him with barely restrained contempt.

"Look, Glamour, Lucky Seven might've talked the commissioner into letting you come in here with your ridiculous, vapid little show..."

"Little?!" The gold unicorn sounded sincerely offended as he stood up on his hind legs and tugged on the lapels of his suit. "Glitzen Glamour doesn't do anything little, baby."

"... but these recruits are here to be police first, not actors. So why don't you settle down and let us evaluate our applicants? And if any of them look like solid cop material, then maybe I'll let you talk to them. Not before. The last thing I need is somepony filling their heads with ideas of being a real-life action star, got it?"

Glitzen backed off. "Okay, okay, I got it. I need to go hit the little colt's room before round two starts, anyway."

Once he was gone, the policemare asked, "So, what do you think, Captain?"

"I think it'd be easier to ask the commissioner for forgiveness over kicking that twit's shiny flank out of here than it would be to put up with him... But if you mean the recruits, I have to admit that Nyx has potential. Quick thinker, didn't put the clerk in danger, and I wish I could pull that duplication trick." He glanced over the other monitors. Some of the recruits were still struggling with their challenges, but others were celebrating. "Looks like she's not the only one with talent, either, but the day's still young. Hopefully we can turn them into cops before Glamour gets his hooves on them."
1431111.title: VR = Virtual Robbery

choices: She refuses Glitzen's proposal, and sticks to her career of choice.
She accepts his offer, embracing the life of a heroine of Equestria!
14311112.content:
Nyx fanned herself in the waiting area with a small bit of magic. So far, she'd done numerous things for the illusory scenarios. She'd stopped a robbery, filled out some paperwork, chased down a grab-and-run thief (that had been easy for her), and investigated a crime scene. She idly wondered what would come next.

         "Psst..." The hissing whisper caught her ear, and she swiveled her head around. She soon found the source: a gold unicorn with an equally gold suit and expensive-looking shades. He waved for her to come closer to him. Frowning, Nyx stood up and trotted over. When she was close enough, he began whispering. "You are amazing, girl. Simply amazing. I've never seen such talent in any of the rookies to date!"

         Nyx blinked. The pony was obviously not one of the police, so what was he doing here? "Um, I'm flattered, sir. Who, exactly, are you?"

         "Ah, right, how silly of me," the stallion said. "Glamour's the name, Glitzen Glamour. And I already know about you, Nyx. Who hasn't heard of the redeemed Nightmare Moon?"

         Nyx narrowed her eyes. "Do me a favor, and spread the word. I do NOT like that name. It holds bad memories for me, understand?"

         Glitzen nodded, unfazed by her temper. "Of course, of course. Now, you're trying to become a policemare, right? Serve the law, save a life or two, etc.? Well, baby, let me tell you, you won't get much of anyplace as your run-of-the-mill policemare. You'll most likely get stuck behind a desk, filling out paperwork, and sorting things to where they need to go. Boring, ain't it?"

         "Perhaps, but necessary, Mr. Glamour," replied the alicorn. She was starting to get a headache from his prattling.

         "Yes, yes, but you know, you have other options," the unicorn said with a smile. "You want to be a policemare to erase the stigma of Nightmare Moon, am I right? Well, an average policemare's job won't do that for you. But I can get your name on the charts. I can see it now: 'End of the Nightmare! Shield Maiden fights for justice!' Oh, it's beautiful..."

         Nyx blinked repeatedly. "Uh... 'Shield Maiden'? What are you talking about?"

         Glitzen coughed. "Ah, right. You see, Nyx, I am somepony who looks at the up-and-coming talent of the rookies here at the Academy. And when I find promising talent - like yours - I give them an opportunity of a lifetime. The opportunity to become a real, true hero of the Equestrian people."

         What Glitzen didn't mention was that the 'real, true hero' stuff would all be staged, and everything recorded. The alicorn didn't need to know that. It wasn't as if she'd ever face anything resembling a real enemy while he was around. No, he paid the local mob good money to make these 'heroes' look good. And, when the 'hero's' time as a star had ended, the mob would be paid to lay low for a while, and Glitzen would tell the 'hero' that justice had been served, and they could hang up their suit. Most 'heroes' were only good for a month or two. But an alicorn...! Oh, Glitzen wanted to milk this mare for all she was worth!

         Nyx, meanwhile, was pondering what the gaudy stallion was proposing. On the one hoof, she'd come here to be a policemare, and her mother would be displeased if she ran off and did something completely different. On the other hoof, being a policemare would be hard work, and not likely to clear up any of the stigma around her for quite some time. What to do?
14311112.title: Bedazzled and Bewildered

choices: Of course, Glitzen. You're good for business.
Not just yet. There could be royal troubles.
143111121.content:
Nyx seriously thought about the offer. If there was a chance of making a good impression with the Equestrian public and building a new reputation for herself, it was definitely worth considering. If she could actually be a hero and earn everypony's trust...

Glitzen grinned as he saw her mulling it over. It was obvious that aside from her extraordinary abilities and gripping backstory, the young alicorn was eager to prove herself. The need for redemption practically radiated from her. Thanks to that, he just knew that she would be putty in his hooves, and go to greater lengths to please the public than the cocky glory-seekers he usually scouted would ever go. And with her kind of talents, she'd be able to make a far greater spectacle than any five of his previous finds put together!

"I'm really flattered, Mr. Glamour. You have no idea how much an opportunity like this means to me," she told him.

Glitzen's grin widened as he reached into his suit jacket to pull out a contract. "Oh, trust me babe, you won't regret-"

She interrupted him by continuing, "So I'm sorry, I'm going to have to decline."

Glitzen froze in place and blinked behind his fancy sunglasses. "I'm sorry, what? I didn't catch that last bit. You said...?"

Nyx replied earnestly, "It's a great offer, and if it was just about me, I'm sure I'd say yes in a heartbeat, but a big part of making up for my past sins is serving something more important than myself."

"Of course!" Glitzen replied, surprised by Nyx's refusal, but not so much that he couldn't try to bring her back around. "And with your shining example, you could serve all of Equestria as a symbol of hope and redemption!"

"Thanks, but if I do, I'd rather do so on a more personal level. Plus, there are some really great ponies here. I'd like to be able to make friends and work with them. I don't think I'd be able to do that if I started showboating as some lone heroine."

Glitzen's eye twitched, but it still wasn't anything he couldn't try to salvage. "You can have friends working with me! I'll be your best friend in the whole world! And you'll have thousands and thousands of friends! The fan clubs alone..."

Nyx shuddered at the thought. The mention of fan clubs reminded her too much of her time with the Children of Nightmare. Glitzen's ingratiatingly cheerful expression drooped and melted like a wax figurine under a hot lamp as she said, "Ugh... no, no thank you... But I do appreciate the offer, and there are plenty of ponies here who would be just as good for what you have in mind, I'm sure."

"Indeed there are," an icy voice replied, belonging to Sharp Whistle as he approached. Glaring daggers at Glitzen, he said, "In fact, if Mr. Glamour will kindly rejoin us in the control room, I would be more than happy to discuss his future working with my recruits.

Stuffing the contract back into his jacket, Glitzen stammered, "I... I was just heading back there..."

As the gold unicorn slinked away, Nyx arched her eyebrow and asked, "Uh... is there something wrong, Captain?"

Sharp Whistle make sure that Glitzen was gone before shaking his head. "No, not at the moment." He looked at her out of the corner of his eye, a faint smile forming as he nodded slightly. "You're doing a good job so far, recruit. Keep it up."

*****


Several hours later, in one of the highest floors of the Seven-Leaf casino, a dark green pegasus was carefully holding a putter and lining up a shot toward a drinking glass that had been turned on its side. The pony was on the older side, but lean and fit, with sharp green eyes. On his flank was a cutie mark of a seven-leafed clover and a pair of dice. One of the dice showed only sixes on all its faces, the other showing only ones.

Just as he was about to take the swing, a burly purple earth pony lumbered up to him. "Mr. Seven, Glitzen Glamour's outside. He seems distraught. Should I bring him in?"

The pegasus asked, "Why am I not surprised? Alright, let him in." As the earth pony moved toward the door, he added, "Oh, before you do, can you turn that glass 90 degrees clockwise? Thank you."

After the earth pony turned the glass so that it was no longer facing the pegasus, the club was pulled back once again. The door opened, and Glitzen pushed himself into the room. "Mr. Seven, I need your help! I've got a-" With a swing of the club, Glitzen was interrupted as the ball was sent arcing up toward a bronze bust of princess Celestia, ricocheting off of the statue's nose with a clang where it rebounded off of a bookshelf on another wall before banking off one of the lenses of Glitzen's shades before hitting the ground again, bouncing and rolling until it went into the cup.

With a satisfied smirk, the pegasus put his putter aside, and the purple earth pony dutifully picked up both the cup and ball. "Hello, Glitzen. You were saying?"

The gold unicorn's mouth opened and closed a few times before he could get his thoughts back on track. "R-right! Look, I've got a line on a 'hero' pony like I've never seen before."

"Do you now?"

Glitzen replied excitedly, "Oh, she's like a big, ripe, juicy apple hanging just outta reach! She's everything we could hope for and more, but she won't play ball! And Sharp Whistle's only makin' it harder. Can't you do somethin' about that?"

The pegasus looked at Glitzen with a bemused expression. "Who am I?"

Taken by surprise, the gold unicorn asked, "... What?" At the same time, the lens that had been struck fell out of his expensive shades.

"Who am I, Glitzen?" The pegasus walked over to his desk and sat down, looking across it at him.

"... You're... you're Lucky Seven, sir," he eventually replied, fearing it to be a trick question.

Lucky Seven smirked. "Exactly. So asking whether or not I can do something in this town is rather silly, isn't it?"

Glitzen reluctantly nodded. "You're right, Mr. Seven... really silly."

Lucky Seven then abruptly changed the subject. "Do you play roulette at all, Mr. Glamour?"

The unicorn blinked and answered, "Uh, now and then, sir. Why-"

"And when you play roulette, do you throw your hooves up into the air and start wailing to the heavens before the ball stops rolling?"

"Ummm... no, of course not, sir."

Lucky Seven tapped his desk as he replied, "Well that is exactly what you are doing now. I am rather interested in Ms. Nyx as well, so I already know about your fumbled attempt to involve her in your show. But don't let your bruised ego interfere with your sense. She's still trying to find her place in this world. The ball is still in play, and if I so chose, I could easily ensure that it landed on the spot you desire."

Glitzen swallowed and asked hopefully, "And... will you, sir?"

Lucky Seven smiled across the desk and replied...
143111121.title: A "talent agent" spurned

choices: The secretary, Delta Requiem, raving about Nyx's performance
A stallion in a tuxedo, with an invitation for both of them to the Seven-Leaf
1431111212.content:
When Glitzen blinked at the response, the pegasus elaborated. "You did study the case file on Ms. Nyx, did you not, Glitzen? Because, if you did, you'd remember that Nyx's adoptive mother is none other than Twilight Sparkle, widely regarded as one of, if not the most powerful unicorn alive today. In addition, Ms. Sparkle is the personal protege of Princess Celestia, and thus her word carries a lot of weight. And, as good as my fortune has held out thus far in my life, I am not eager to test my luck by becoming embroiled in politics with the crown. I apologize for the inconvenience, but I know my limits, as should you."

         Glitzen, despite his appearance, was no fool. True, he hadn't really looked at the case file before seeing Nyx in action. All he'd seen was 'alicorn', and he'd been sold. But if these details were right... "Of course, Mr. Seven. I suppose I'll have to make do with one of the other recruits for now. But, the option's not entirely out of the question, is it?"

         Lucky Seven chuckled. "No, of course not. But 'haste makes waste' as the adage says. So, go find one of your other prospects and have fun with your usual routine."

         With a sigh and a nod, Glitzen Glamour left, pausing only to pick up the lens that had fallen out of its frame. The purple earth pony from before came up to Lucky's desk. "Sir, those tapes from the new recruit batch have arrived. I think I can see what Glitzen was excited about. This alicorn is a natural-born crime fighter. She could definitely be bad for business."

         Lucky Seven smirked. "Ah, but everything in life is a gamble, is it not? Besides, if she gets too problematic, her superiors can always be bribed into giving her a desk job. She can't do much to us behind the walls of the station."

         The burly pony nodded. "On another note, we know where she's staying. She's got a hotel room with a friend of hers from Ponyville, a stuntpony named Scootaloo. Orange pegasus, purple mane."

         The mob boss smiled. "Ah, good work as always, capo. You really know how to make me smile. That information could definitely come in handy." He chuckled darkly, with no worries at all about the days to come."

*****


         Nyx fairly collapsed onto the bed. Illusions or no, the day had been exhausting. Captain Sharp Whistle had told her and the other recruits, after all the tests were done, that they were to return to their homes and come back tomorrow for the results. She groaned as she worked a kink out of her left hind leg.

         "Wow, did they run you ragged already?" Looking up, Nyx saw Scootaloo, grinning down at her with a far too chipper attitude.

         Nyx sighed. "I didn't expect the first day to be practical tests of ability. They had illusory scenarios of different things we might encounter during our jobs. It was... fairly overwhelming."

         Scootaloo smirked. "Well, I managed to get in touch with that racing team. I showed them a bit of my stuff, and they definitely seem interested. With any luck, I'll be tearing up stunt tracks before you know it!"

         Nyx chuckled. "Alright, Ms. 'Tires of Fire', don't get too far ahead of yourself. Remember, you're coming with me to that Suave Crooner concert on Saturday."

         "I know, I know..." Scootaloo said with an eye-roll. Before anything else could be said, there was a knock on the door of their hotel room. The pegasus blinked, looking at Nyx. "I'm not expecting anypony, are you?"

         "No..." Nyx stood up and trotted over to the door, looking out through the peep-hole. Outside was...
1431111212.title: Words of Caution

choices: Nyx goes straight to the academy for her evaluation
Nyx is on the way to the academy when she spots a commotion!
14311112121.content:
Nyx blinked in surprise at the sight of the Academy's secretary outside, and opened the door to let her in. "Ah, hi there. Delta, right? What brings you over this way?"

The amaranth, grey-maned pegasus smiled widely as she stood outside the door. "Hi, Nyx! I just had to come congratulate you. Technically, I'm not supposed to say anything about your results until after Captain Whistle gives you your official evaluation, but I couldn't help it. If what I've been hearing is true, precincts are going to be fighting over you!"

The alicorn was a bit taken aback. She didn't know what to say to that, or even what to feel. She'd been fairly sure she did well, but having Delta come all the way over just to tell her so in such effusively positive terms was a bit overwhelming. While she stammered out a 'thank you', Scootaloo came up and lifted a hoof. "Hey, I'm Nyx's roommate, Scootaloo. So, you two met at the Academy?"

Delta shook hooves with Scootaloo and nodded. "Delta Requiem. I'm the receptionist there."

Nyx got her head in order and asked, "Well, thank you so much for coming out here to tell me that. Uh, would you like to come inside for a bit, since you're here? If you haven't eaten yet, I could throw together some sandwiches and hay fries." Exhausted as she was, the alicorn was also getting hungry and could fix up something that simple with her magic while she rested her weary body.

"Really? Well, thank you, as long as it isn't any trouble," Delta replied, stepping into the room. It was small and cheap so that the young mares could afford to stay there long-term, but came with a kitchenette that they had stocked with a few very basic supplies upon arriving. Smiling awkwardly, the secretary admitted, "To be honest, I did have a bit of an ulterior motive in coming here."

Scootaloo snickered and mock-accused, "Oh, are you a spy?"

Delta laughed. "No, no, actually, I'm... kind of a fan," she said as Nyx settled back onto her bed, surprising the alicorn.

"A fan?" Nyx asked, looking back at Delta quizzically.

The pegasus nodded a bit and explained, "Of your story. Or at least the version of it I heard. Is it true that during the battle of Ponyville, you saved the orphanage from a giant Lupus Major?"

Nyx and Scootaloo blinked at each other, then both bust into laughter while a confused Delta watched them. Seeing her expression, Nyx wiped her eye and replied, "Sorry... sorry. I think we're just not used to versions of that story that make me seem more noble."

Scootaloo snickered and explained, "For one thing, there's no orphanage in Ponyville. There aren't enough orphans to warrant one, and the ones we do have get foster parents."

"And even a Lupus Major isn't much bigger than I am right now," Nyx added. "Don't get me wrong; they're tough, fast, and mean as Tartarus, but at least you don't have to worry about them stepping on houses like you would with an Ursa."

Delta looked a little embarassed. "Ah, I see. Well, I'm sure what really happened is just as impressive."

Nyx tilted her head as she reached out to the kitchenette with her magic and started sorting out the ingredients for some daffodil sandwiches. "Out of curiosity, where'd you hear this version?"

Delta replied, "Well... bits and pieces here and there. Mostly scraps I picked up from tourists, so I tried to piece together as much as I could based around what was actually known about it. Heh, you can really tell who's a tourist and who's a local around here by the version they believe. You know, around here, ponies are a lot more likely to believe the ones that put you in a positive light. Probably has something to do with those two weeks of night giving the casinos a bump in business, or because we love a celebrity around here... not that that's why I like your story, I mean! It's just..."

Nyx smiled and levitated three plates out with the sandwiches she had been making while Delta talked, putting one in front of each of them. "Would you like to hear the real story?" she asked. When Delta gave a delighted grin and nodded, the alicorn looked over at Scootaloo and mused, "You ever hear the one about how the Cutie Mark Crusaders infiltrated the Children of Nightmare's castle? Of course I'll need some help telling your side of the story, Scoot."

"Cutie Mark... Crusaders?" Delta asked with a raised eyebrow.

Scootaloo took a bite out of her sandwich and replied while she chewed, "Oh, you'll luvv thish. Ouh frendsh Abble-" After getting a look from the other two mares, she swallowed and continued, "Our friends Applebloom and Sweetie Belle and I wanted to see Nyx after those cult creeps gave her all her Nightmare Moon powers and memories back, so we--"

The other two ate while the orange pegasus went into her story, which led to another tale, and another, going on long into the night.

The next morning...
14311112121.title: A new friend?

choices: Take the time to get to know some of the other recruits.
Sharp Whistle shows up soon and asks to see Nyx next
143111121211.content:
Nyx galloped as fast as her hooves would take her, which was dangerous because she was less than perfectly coordinated at the moment. Even when given a clear path straight ahead, the alicorn's gait would weave groggily from side to side, and any time she tried to turn a corner, the threat of her tripping over her own legs was a very real hazard. It was even worse when she tried spreading her wings to keep her balance, because she took up the entire sidewalk that way and forced ponies around her to quickly duck underneath them.

Apologizing profusely the whole way, Nyx internally cursed herself for staying up so late trading stories with Delta and Scootaloo. As exhausted as she'd been from the previous day's tests, the two pegasi had kept her going so long that she completely lost track of time. As a result, with a few hours less sleep than she should have gotten, she found herself struggling to ensure that she would only end up slightly late as opposed to 'If you aren't going to take this seriously then pack up and go home' late.

When the building came into sight, she tucked her wings in and made a hard push for the final stretch, but she tripped up on the last step, causing her to tumble against the door. It burst open as she rolled and slid across the floor, finally stopping when she bumped into the reception desk.

Peering over it, a concerned but otherwise perky looking Delta asked, "Oh my gosh, Nyx! Are you alright? What happened?"

The alicorn groaned and looked up at her with bloodshot eyes, her purple mane a mess as she tried to sort out which limb was which before she even tried to stand up again. "You... words... make... how...?"

Getting a sense of Nyx's dilemma, Delta pointed to a contraption on a nearby table and replied, "Ahhh. Espresso maker. You will learn to respect it. You will learn to love it. You want me to make you a cup?"

Nyx's left hind leg twitched spastically for a moment before she figured out she wasn't moving the right part of her body, and transitioned to nodding. "Fifteen, please..."

"Let's start with just one," Delta said, coming out from behind the desk to work the machine, pouring out a cup that she brought to Nyx's lips. As the caffeine hit her bloodstream, Nyx showed signs of vitality again and got back to her hooves.

"Thank you so much... You're my best new friend."

Since Nyx wasn't looking directly at her, Delta asked, "Are you talking to me, or the machine?"

Nyx just looked at her awkwardly for a moment before running a hoof through her messy mane and asking, "So, uh... I'm not too late, am I?"

Delta smirked a little. "Don't worry, you're fine. Some of the other recruits spent the evening unwinding at the clubs, so you still look a lot better by comparison. I've got a brush in my purse if you need it, though."

"Erf, thanks Delta, but that's okay. Just gimme a second..." Now that she was able to concentrate, Nyx used a technique that she'd developed with Rarity's help. At this stage in her life, her mane wasn't as obviously magical as the princesses, but still obeyed her will to a degree. Focusing for a moment on how she wanted to look, her hair started untangling and styling itself into her usual look.

Delta blinked and said, "Okay, now I'm seething with jealousy. Well, you look ready, so head on in and knock 'em dead."

Nyx smiled gratefully to Delta and hurried into the room where the other recruits were waiting. It was true, while some of them were fresh and alert, others looked like they had spent the previous night partying and were now paying the consequences for it. There were a few empty seats as well, suggesting that she wasn't even going to be the last one to arrive. Captain Whistle wasn't anywhere in sight, so she figured that he was probably giving another recruit their evaluation.
143111121211.title: Need a better alarm clock!

choices: Nyx goes with one of the recommended choices.
Nyx considers other precincts and divisions.
1431111212112.content:
Before Nyx could do much other than look around at some of the other recruits, Sharp Whistle strode into the room, followed by a depressed-looking recruit. The recruit slowly left the room. Nyx followed him with her eyes, knowing that the poor colt's evaluation had gone poorly. Had he botched the scenarios so badly he'd been kicked out?

         "Ahem. Recruit Nyx, if you would follow me, please?" Nyx snapped her head back around at her name, and trotted over to Sharp Whistle. She followed him down the hall to an office. He sat behind the desk, and motioned for her to sit opposite him. "Now, before I go any further, Nyx, I'd like to ask you: Did Lieutenant Requiem visit you last night?"

         Nyx stared, startled. "Delta's a lieutenant? She's an actual officer?"

         Whistle smirked. "Yes, and she's also my niece, though she lives with me. Her parents are currently in the slammer for foal abuse and neglect." He sighed. "I wish my sister had never married that stallion... With a name like Lock Down, he couldn't be anything but bad news." He coughed. "Anyway, Delta is an actual officer, though she got there on her own merits, not just because I'm her uncle. If anything, I put more pressure on her than on other officers, just so ponies don't think I'm not putting enough pressure on her. Still, she does her job well, even if she hardly ever goes on patrol."

         "I never would have suspected..." Nyx murmured. "She acts so... bubbly."

         "Part of that is because you've never seen her in uniform," Whistle replied. "But it's also an act to throw ponies off. She acts like such a girly-girl so she can loosen tongues. She's gotten quite a bit of information with her silver tongue." Seeing her look, he smiled. "Don't worry, though, her admiration for you is genuine, Nyx. Now, enough about her, let's talk about you."

         Nyx felt butterflies in her stomach. Still, she forced them down, and nodded. "Yes, sir."

         Pulling out a folder, Whistle showed it to her. It had her name on it, and a sizeable stack of papers, including a photo of her. "Normally, I'd tell you which precincts and divisions you qualified for. But, that's not exactly necessary in your case."

         Nyx's ears folded back. "Does... does that mean..."

         Noticing her expression, Whistle realized what he'd said. "Not like that! You're qualified for any division, any precinct you choose! You aced all of the scenarios we put against you. There's a reason Glitzen was so eager to get a hold of you."

         Nyx let out a huge breath of relief. "Oh, thank Celestia!" She then paused. "Wait... Is there something about Glitzen I should know?"

         Whistle sighed. "Glitzen likes to make 'heroes' out of ordinary ponies. He gets them a contract, a fancy outfit, quite a decent amount of pay, and their name in the headlines for a month or two. With how often it's happened here in Los Pegasus, I'm honestly shocked anypony cares when a new 'hero' pops up."

         Nyx scowled. "So, I'm not the first pony he's tried to sweet-talk into playing hero?"

         "Hardly," replied Whistle with another sigh. "We lose a recruit or two to him every time this time of year comes around. Ambitious stallions and mares with dreams of grandeur. Dreams that hardly ever get fulfilled."

         Nyx rolled her eyes. "That's their choice, but I'm not letting him get to me. Now, you said I had my choice of precincts and divisions?"

         Whistle nodded, glad for the change of topic. "Yes. As I said, you qualified for anything of your chosing. However, there are two divisions that seem to best suit you: Robbery/Homicide, and Narcotics. As it happens, my own 45th precinct has an opening for Robbery/Homicide. Delta's precinct, the 63rd, has an opening for Narcotics. You can chose one of those, a different precinct, or a different division. The choice is yours."
1431111212112.title: Spoiled for Choice

choices: Go with Captain Whistle's Robbery/Homicide division
Go to Delta's precinct for Narcotics division
14311112121121.content: Nyx pondered the choices, but decided it would be best to chose something she was good it. When it came to robberies, she'd shown her prowess in defeating robbers without endangering anypony else. For narcotics, she had an uncanny sense of smell, as she'd proved in the scenario that dealt with such a thing. So, the question in her mind was, which seemed more appealing: stopping robbers and (Celestia forbid she encountered one) murderers, or stopping drug dealers?
14311112121121.title: Robbery/Homicide or Narcotics?

choices: The two have a friendly race to the precinct house
While flying, they spot something down below
143111121211212.content:
A little while later, Nyx came back out into the reception area, her head hung low and ears flattened. Surprised by her defeated expression, Delta came over and asked, "Nyx? Are you alright? What's the word?"

The alicorn let out a heavy sigh and asked, "Depends... do you prefer 'lieutenant'... or 'boss'?" She immediately perked up and grinned down at Delta, who let out a laugh, an embarrassed little smile on her face.

"So, Uncle Sharp spilled the beans, huh? And you chose the 63rd anyway? Most ponies would assume last night was all about pumping them for information."

Nyx shrugged and replied, "Well, isn't getting to know one another what friends do? If there's one thing growing up with Twilight Sparkle for a mother taught me, it's that friendships get started in a lot of different ways, and that it's something you should treasure whenever you find it. So from here on out, my training's in your hooves."

Delta visibly tried, but couldn't entirely keep the squee out of her voice as she said, "Oh, this is great! Don't think you can sweet-talk me into going easy on you, though. But I'm really glad that you think of me as a friend already! Just wait until you meet the rest of the squad; you'll love them. Technically you're still in training for a couple of months, but with your initial results, we'll be able to get you plenty of field experience in between tests."

Nyx nodded, though her mind drifted back to what Sharp Whistle had said after she had made her choice. "I'm sure you'll do well there. Delta shares my 'learn by doing' philosophy, so you'll likely end up getting trained on the streets instead of doing a lot of remedial studying. You'll still have to come in for tests periodically until your training period is over, though."

"Thank you, sir! I'll go tell her right away, if that's alright," she had replied. Before she could leave, though, he had held up a hoof to stop her.

"Wait, there's one thing I need to discuss about what I saw in the test scenarios yesterday. Not everypony picked up on it, but from what I saw, you seemed to have a tendency to throw yourself into harm's way. Especially when innocent civilians were involved."

"Isn't that what police officer's are supposed to do?" she had asked.

"We take risks every day so that other ponies don't have to, that's true. But it's important to do so with a clear head. You might be used to shrugging off things that would be a serious danger to other ponies, but there's always a bigger fish out there somewhere. Or lots of smaller, meaner fish. Or you might just have bad luck one day. And when that time comes, you'll need to protect yourself if you want to protect anyone else. Part of doing the job today is making sure that you'll be able to keep doing the job tomorrow.

Nyx thought back to her tests. She hadn't really thrown herself into danger as far as she could recall. Nothing that she wouldn't have survived, even if it had been real, anyway. Maybe Sharp Whistle was just being extra concerned since she was going to be working with his niece, who at this particular moment was telling her about the other members of the Narcotics Unit. "-who handles the dogs, and we'll want you working with a veteran, so I'll see about partnering you up with Canterlot."

Nyx blinked, coming back to the present. "Huh?"

Delta waved a hoof. "Oh, that's not his real name. It's just what we call him because he transferred here from Canterlot a few years ago. He's a little mopey about something that happened between him and the force there or something, but he's a great officer and the most loyal guy I know. Trust me, he'll take good care of you."

Nyx nodded along. "Ahhh, thanks Delta. Since my evaluation's out of the way, how about you show me the way to the 63rd?"

"Sure thing," Delta replied, "Uncle Sharp doesn't need me for anything else today either, so I was going to head back there anyway." She pushed open the door so they could go outside, then grinned and spread her wings. "I hope those things on your back aren't just for show, because we're taking the scenic route."

Nyx grinned back, getting the sense that she was being challenged. "I love taking in the scenery. Just don't think you'll be able to make too many donut stops along the way, lieutenant."
143111121211212.title: D.A.R.E. to just say "no"

choices: ... just went to grab a snack.
... got a call and headed out in a hurry. Not sure where.
1431111212112121.content:
Delta and Nyx stared each other down with their wings spread out. As if on some unseen cue, they both launched themselves up into the air simultaneously with quick flaps! Delta took the early lead, because while Nyx's wings were powerful and had a large span, the pegasus's lighter frame made it much easier for her to lift off as she climbed up above the buildings and curved off toward her destination.

Nyx followed after her, taking the time to climb up higher than the amaranth pegasus had before locking her wings so that she could soar like an eagle after Delta. The lieutenant looked back over her shoulder and teasingly stuck her tongue out in a very unprofessional manner, causing Nyx to smirk and narrow her eyes. "Oh, so that's how you're gonna be, huh? Alright, then that's how it's gonna be." Her horn glowed with magic, and she used it to warm the air under her wings to create thermals that lifted her up higher. She then tucked in her wings a little and angled downward, building up enough speed while Delta wasn't looking to zoom past her and take the lead without having to expend a lot of energy by flapping.

Of course, Nyx couldn't help but blow a raspberry at Delta on the way past, making the pegasus pony echo the same expression that she had moments before. She still had the advantage of maneuverability as they banked between some of the taller hotels, giving her the chance to make up some time. When Nyx saw her catching up, the alicorn called out, "Not bad, but you're no Rainbow Dash!"
