Delta retorted, "Maybe not, but I bet you I've got a few tricks even she doesn't know about!" She then dropped down suddenly, skimming low to the ground.

Nyx blinked in surprised, watching the pegasus as she tried to figure out what Delta was up to. She soon found out when her view of Delta, along with everything else, was suddenly blanketed in thick, milky white as she flew straight into an inexplicable bank of fog. The cold and clammy mist, though too "soupy" to simply kick away like a normal cloud, was still dense enough to keep her from seeing anything around her for more than a few dozen feet in every direction.

Following Delta's earlier lead, she dipped down below the fog only to suddenly have to veer from side to side as she dipped too close to carriage traffic. Her hooves clipped a table where a pony was playing Three-Card Monte, accidentally tipping it over along with the cards as she flipped end over end, trying to get her equilibrium back.

Spotting Delta down the street, Nyx flapped her wings hard and gave chase once again. The pegasus, not expecting Nyx to catch up so soon, didn't notice the alicorn gaining on her until they were almost to the precinct house. Glancing back and seeing the turquoise-eyed mare catching up and building momentum for the final stretch, Delta flapped hard to keep her lead! As the building drew closer and closer, so too did the distance between them narrow until...

*****


"Oh, come on, I completely passed you at the end there!"

"No way, I was ahead the whole time!"

"Not a chance, and you wouldn't have been ahead to begin with in the second half if it weren't for that freak mist."

A nearby pony cleared his throat and tried to look nonchalant.

"Oh, like you would've passed me in the first half without using magic? I am shocked... shocked that you would stoop to those sort of tactics in a friendly race."

A few more ponies cleared their throats, eyes rolled up toward the ceiling as they milled around.

"Is there a cold or something going around?" Nyx asked with a raised eyebrow.

Delta waved it off. "Ah, don't mind them. Come on, let's see who's here so I can introduce you to the rest of the team."

Nyx smiled and followed Delta, only to be startled by a sudden loud barking sound behind her! She instinctively reared up, getting her horn stuck in the ceiling tiles for a moment while she looked down. Instead of a dog, though, what she found was... a pony. A beige earth pony mare with dark brown eyes, wearing her police badge on a hat that looked like it was decorated with animal fur, and she was barking like a dog until Delta came over and bopped her on the head.

"Bad! Bad girl! You apologize," Delta scolded, causing the strange mare to whimper while Nyx pulled herself down.

"S... sorry," the beige pony said reluctantly with a raspy growl of a voice. "I was napping, and... she just came in all of a sudden..."

While she apologized, Delta flapped up to the top of a file cabinet where a cookie jar was kept out of easy reach. As soon as the pegasus touched it, the strange mare's ears perked up, and her attention snapped toward Delta. Flapping back down to the floor with the cookie jar in her hooves, Delta reached in and handed a biscuit of some sort to a stunned Nyx. "Here, give this to her."

The very confused Nyx took the biscuit. "Huh?" she asked, looking back and forth between Delta and the beige mare, who was suddenly sitting and drooling as she looked at Nyx with pleading eyes. Nevertheless, she held the biscuit out like Delta said.

The strange mare looked between Nyx and Delta, as if looking for permission. When Delta nodded, she quickly snatched the biscuit from Nyx's hoof with her mouth, then dashed off under the desk of a startled detective to start gnawing on it. Her flank stuck out, allowing Nyx to see a cutie mark depicting a full moon with a howling wolf sillhouetted against it.

While Delta put the jar back up atop the files, Nyx just stared in disbelief at what she'd seen. "Who... or what... was that?"

"Sgt. Howler of the K-9 unit," Delta explained. "Raised by wolves, if you believe the stories. She's just not very good with meeting new ponies. Something about 'establishing dominance', but since you fed her, she'll be your friend for life."

Nyx sweatdropped as she looked down at Delta. "Really, now...?" She couldn't say she remembered any of her mother's friendship studies dealing with this sort of situation. For her part, the lieutentant just shrugged and nodded.

"Yeah, don't worry about it. After a while, you'll get used to her." She did glance from side to side, though, before putting a hoof near her mouth and leaning in to whisper, "Though from what I've heard, her wolf parents raised her on meat when she was a filly. They say she sometimes goes hunting for small animals when she's off-duty..."

Nyx gulped nervously at that. "What? C-come on, now I know you're messing with me. A pony eating meat is just..." she looked over at Howler, who had pulled herself back out from her 'hiding spot' and was grinning happily at Nyx. Wow, those... those were some awfully sharp-looking teeth for a pony. "... ridiculous..."

Nyx suddenly found herself getting pulled along by Delta as she cheerily exclaimed, "Well, come on, we can't just stand here all day!" She led the alicorn to a desk that was empty of its occupant, but was decorated with a few knick-knacks. Momentarily stopping a passing stallion, Delta asked, "Hey, where's Canterlot?"

The stallion replied, "Oh, hi lieutenant. He..."
1431111212112121.title: Wacky Races

choices: "... a case on a known marijuana dealer."
"... a lead on an opium smuggling ring."
14311112121121211.content:
Delta smiled and nodded. "Okay! Nyx, follow me to one of the most important areas to any recruit: the rec room."

         Nyx chuckled and followed Delta to a side room. Inside, a large clay-red earth pony stallion similar in build to Big Macintosh stood nursing a cup of coffee and what appeared to be a chocolate chip cookie. His blonde mane had been cropped short, and his cutie mark was that of a stone wall, like a castle's battlements.

         "Canterlot! There you are!" Delta chirped, flitting up to latch onto the stallion's back.

         To his credit, the earth pony didn't even bat an eyelash at this. Apparently, this was something he was used to. "Greetings, lieutenant. May I help you?"

         "Just wanted you to meet your potential new partner!" the pegasus replied, hopping down.

         Swallowing the bite of cookie he had, the stallion turned around. "Alright, so who - !" He cut himself off, and his cup and unfinished cookie fell from his grasp as his grey eyes widened on seeing Nyx.

         The dropped items were caught by Nyx's magical aura, as she set them on the counter. "Hi, I'm Nyx!" she said happily. Her enthusiasm diminished when she saw the stallion's expression. "And, let me guess, you're one of those ponies who thinks I'm nothing but a monster, right?"

         The stallion shook his head rapidly. "N-no! Of course not! It's just, well..."

         Delta glared at the earth pony. "If you've got a problem with Nyx, just say so right now, and I'll put her with somepony else in Narcotics."

         He shook his head again. "I don't have a problem with her being my partner, I'm just... nervous."

         "Nervous?" Delta quirked an eyebrow. "That's a first. Don't tell me you're nervous just because a mare created by some whackjob cult is joining our police force."

         The stallion sighed. "It's not that... it's the fact that I used to be part of that 'whackjob cult'."

         Nyx's eyes widened. "You... you were one of the Children of Nightmare?"

         The red stallion nodded, lowering his head. "My name is Stonewall, miss Nyx. I was part of Spell Nexus's inner circle. I brought most of the components that were used in your... reincarnation. I never truly interacted with you, aside from when you removed the 'blessing' from all of the Children of Nightmare. I left the Canterlot Town Guard after that, because I needed a fresh start."

         Nyx likewise lowered her head. "I'm sorry."

         Stonewall's head shot up, and he stared at her. "Why are you apologizing to me? If anything, I should be the one apologizing."

         Nyx cut him off with a raised hoof. "You have nothing to apologize for. But me... it's because of my past as Nightmare Moon that you became part of the Children of Nightmare. You were forced to leave your old job because of me. And for that, I'm sorry. I ruined so many ponies' lives, and I've never really apologized to any of the Children of Nightmare before now. I wanted to at least do so once."

         Stonewall blinked once, then twice, then smiled. "Well, you're far more humble than Nexus made you out to be. Of course, I saw that back during your two-week tenure. You started raising the sun after a week because you were worried about your subjects. You chewed out Spell Nexus for not following your orders regarding Twilight Sparkle. And when you realized the truth about the blessing, you removed it from all of your followers, in an effort to atone." He dipped his head in acknowledgement. "For that, I accept your apology."

         The alicorn and earth pony shook hooves, exchanging smiles. The moment was interrupted by a cough. Jumping, they faced Delta, who wore a bemused look. "As tender as this whole reconciliation moment is, I'm assuming there's no problems with you two teaming up, right?"

         The two looked at each other, then back at Delta. "None whatsoever, ma'am," they chorused.

         Delta smiled. "Excellent. Now, Nyx is still technically in training, Canterlot, so it's your job to make sure she doesn't do anything stupid while on duty. Remember, you're Narcotics. You bust drug runners. Don't play the hero chasing murderers. That's Robbery/Homicide's department."

         Stonewall rolled his eyes slightly at this, apparently used to the lecture. Nyx saluted smartly. "Understood. Do we have a specific assignment at the moment?"

         Delta paused, and shrugged. "Grab a cup of coffee and a cookie, and meet me in my office."

*****


         A few minutes later, Delta was perusing the Narcotics division case file for the 63rd precinct, while Nyx and Stonewall made small talk. After a moment, Delta looked up. "Well, I may have something for you..."
14311112121121211.title: Stonewalled (Re)Introductions

choices: Hide and wait for one of his customers to show up?
Let me go and pretend to be a customer?
143111121211212111.content:
Nyx arched an eyebrow. Seeing the alicorn's expression, Delta asked, "Something wrong, Nyx?"

"Oh, no, I'm just kind of... surprised," Nyx replied. "I mean, I've only heard about what goes on in this town second-hand, but a pot dealer sounds pretty tame. Couldn't we just walk into any nightclub on the strip and bust people selling harder stuff?"

Stonewall just looked straight ahead with a... well... stoney expression, but from Delta's angle, she could see a hint of a grin out of the corner of his mouth. The pegasus sighed and replied, "In theory, yeah, you could do that. But in theory, you could trot up to the royal palace and graffiti the place with 'Princess Molestia' cartoons. And the graffiti would probably be the better idea of the two."

Delta pushed a note with the relevant information across her desk and said in a more serious tone than Nyx had heard from her before, "Look, you're still a trainee, and I'm giving you a chance to get your hooves wet with an easy assignment. The suspect, Grassy Knolls, is a three-time repeater with no history of violence. You just need to either catch him in the act, or prove that he's in possession, and you'll get him without a fuss. Canterlot here'll be sure to show you how it's done, and you'll probably be back in time for lunch."

Nyx nodded. "Well, alright. I won't let you down, then." She gave her new friend a salute and headed out of the office, Stonewall following immediately after her, only taking a moment to pick up the note in his mouth and nod to Delta before shutting the door behind them.

"I can't believe it, but you even look the same," he mused as he put the note in a saddlebag slug over his chair, then put it on while they walked toward the door.

Nyx slowed down to let him walk alongside her and asked, "The same as what?"

"That expression's exactly the same as Delta's, the first assignment she got as my partner." Nyx clearly looked surprised, so he told her, "Well, she might have raced up the ranks, but she still had to start somewhere. And she reacted pretty much exactly the same way, going after small-timers when we know there's plenty going on under our noses."

Nyx glanced back over her shoulder before looking to Stonewall. "And...?"

"And she did her job, made some high-profile busts, and made lieutenant in near record time."

Nyx walked alongside the earth pony as he made his way toward the address on the note. "So... that's it?"

"That's it for now," he replied. "Right now, it's about doing the job we've been given. Anything more than that can wait until you're more settled in."

Nyx pointed a hoof at her new partner and deduced, "But you're saying there is more."

Stonewall chuckled ruefully. "Trust me, Nyx, there's always more. The trouble is deciding which rocks are worth looking under."

As they moved away from the busy hustle and bustle of the strip and into a more worn-down residential area. They stopped in sight of a small, worn-down house with an overgrown lawn littered with chintzy ornaments, and Stonewall pointed to it. "That's the place. Now, before we do anything, we need to establish probable cause. He knows me, so the instant I set a hoof near that place, he'll flush away whatever he's got in there."

Nyx nodded and replied, "So, I guess we should..."
143111121211212111.title: "... a case on a known marijuana dealer."

choices: The bust goes off without a hitch.
Something goes wrong.
1431111212112121111.content:
Stonewall nodded. "That's the best plan. Mind you, normally we'd have you act like a customer, but..." he gestured to her, indicating her wings and horn, "... you're pretty distinct. And considering what everypony's heard about you, if he saw you, he'd flush his supply faster than if he saw me."

         Nyx blinked. "What has 'everypony' heard about me?"

         He gave a wry smile. "That you were adopted by the student of Princess Celestia, that you've been taught how to rain lightning down on unsuspecting ponies, that you eat foals... though I highly doubt that last one's true."

         Nyx looked ill at the very thought. "Of course it's not! Eating foals... I thought that was what the old legends of Nightmare Moon where about." She blinked. "Oh, right. Some ponies still think I am Nightmare Moon."

         Stonewall smirked. "If it's any consolation, you've dispelled any doubts about that in my mind." He paused. "Out of curiosity, what about the lightning?"

         She smirked back at him. "Well, if things get hairy, you might find out."

         Their chatter was silenced when they saw a purple earth pony stallion approaching the house. "Well, there's our bait," Stonewall said with a wry look. "Now, let's see if we can land the fish."

         "Hang on, I've got an idea!" Nyx said, as part of her mane and tail began to ripple. In moments, there was a copy of her standing right next to her. "Okay, go mist form, and make sure you don't do anything stupid." The clone nodded, and vanished into a spiraling purple mist. It flew over to the house, where the earth pony was now knocking at the door.

         "Yeah, yeah, I'm coming!" came a voice from within. A moment later, a green earth pony with a brown mane opened the door. "So, whaddya - OH!" His demeanor changed on seeing the stallion. "Ah, is Mr. Seven awaiting his latest shipment?"

         "Indeed," the purple stallion replied with a smooth, cultured voice. "Two-hundred and fifty bits, as we agreed then?"

         The green pony, apparently Grassy Knolls, shook his head. "Sorry, but my supply is starting to run dry. The Narcotics Division has been stepping up their game lately, and I can't get as much as I used to. Three-hundred."

         The purple stallion cocked his head. "Mr. Knolls, you know whom I work for, and yet you're making things difficult? Mr. Seven was under the impression that the price we agreed on was set."

         "Well, then, with due respect to Mr. Seven, he needs to understand that supply and demand exists," replied Grassy. "Marijuana, as I said, is getting harder to come by. Besides, what's fifty bits to somepony like him?"

         The purple stallion considered this, then nodded. "Very well, three-hundred it is." He hoofed over a large pouch of money, pausing to add more to it from another, larger pouch. Grassy took the offered pouch, and headed inside.

         From their hiding spot, Nyx and Stonewall were seeing everything thanks to a Seeing-Eye spell placed on the clone, and they could hear everything as well due to an Extendable Ear spell. Stonewall looked contemplative. "I wonder who this Mr. Seven is they're talking about?"

         "Dunno," Nyx replied. "So, once he's given the guy the pot, we bust him?"

         "We bust them," corrected the stallion. "Whether he's innocent or not - and given what he's been saying, he probably isn't - he's buying illegal substances."

         Nyx nodded. "Okay, I've got a Replacement Spell active and ready to cast once Grassy gives up the marijuana. It'll switch our position with my copy, so they don't have time to run."

         Stonewall nodded, bracing himself for magical transport. He never openly complained, but sometimes he was wary of being transported incorrectly. Looking back at the house, he saw Grassy come back out, pulling a large sack out to the purple stallion.
1431111212112121111.title: Busting the Weed-Dealer

choices: ... at the precinct, writing reports on their failed bust.
... at the crime lab, getting the clover analyzed.
14311112121121211112.content:
Nyx cast the spell, and for a moment she and Stonewall felt the faint vertigo of suddenly swapping places with her misty double. Teleportation was a tricky spell that only a few unicorns had ever truly mastered, and teleporting more than one pony with the same spell was exponentially more difficult to pull off. Replacement was a way to work around that problem. By having two spells cast simultaneously, there was no need for the magic to 'carry' a passenger and ensure that they appeared in exactly the same condition that they were in when they vanished. Instead, the dual magics didn't affect the passengers at all, but moved the space they inhabited instead. It would still be a very complex and difficult spell for any two unicorns to pull off due to the coordination required, but being able to split herself into two made it so much easier for Nyx.

Regardless of the mechanics of it, she and Stonewall appeared on either side of the two earth ponies just as the purple one took the bag into his mouth. Stonewall was inside the house, behind Grassy Knolls, and Nyx appeared behind the big purple buyer. "Freeze!" Stonewall shouted, immediately planting a hoof against Grassy's back and shoving him to the ground.

"S-stonewall?! How'd you get in my-?! I-I-I didn't do nothin'!"

Nyx followed her partner's lead, pushing down the heavily built stallion, and making him spit out the bag in the process. "Oh come on, we saw you give over the stuff with out own eyes. You have the right to remain silent; anything you say may be used against you in a court of law. You have the right to an attorney. If you don't have one, one will be appointed for you. Do you understand?"

The purple stallion rolled an eye back to look at Nyx and replied calmly, "I know my rights. And I know you don't have anything to arrest me on."

Nyx scoffed. "Seriously? You'll be lucky to see sunlight any time in the next decade, buying up that much pot." Using her magic to bind his legs in place while Stonewall kept Grassy pinned down, she walked over to the sack and opened it. Inside the bag, however, was not what she was expecting. "Wait... what's this?"

"Clover!" Grassy squirmed and shouted, "Organically grown clover! I sell it to the Seven-Leaf!"

Stonewall narrowed his eyes. "Pull the other one, Knolls."

Nyx replied weakly, "No, it... really is clover." Tipping it open, she let a little of its contents spill out into view. She then looked at the earth ponies and said, "But we heard you arguing about the price of marijuana!"

The purple stallion replied, "I represent Mr. Lucky Seven in this matter. He's a very influential pillar of the community. He is aware of the recidivism rate of former drug-dealers like Mr. Knolls here, so he offers them an opportunity to use their talents in legitimate ways, paying competitive rates so that they don't feel that they have to return to their previous bad habits. In return, Mr. Knolls provides quality ingredients for Mr. Seven's many hotels and restaurants."

Nyx and Stonewall looked at each other in disbelief. The detective put a little more pressure on Grassy Knoll and asked, "You're telling me the owner of the Seven-Leaf is willing to pay three hundred bits for fifteen bits worth of salad topping? And he does this out of the goodness of his heart?"

"Hardly," the purple stallion replied with a smirk. "It's a business arrangement. Ponies who smoke pot tend to do so in the privacy of their own homes. They don't go out, spending their bits in casinos or night clubs. By providing a substantial incentive for these dealers to find another line of work, Mr. Seven makes back his investment severalfold."

Nyx looked at Stonewall with a chagrined expression. If there had been resistance, she could have fought back. If they had tried to escape, she could have chased them. With this... she didn't know what to do but feel ashamed of herself. "What... do we do...?" she asked.

Stonewall grit his teeth and got off of Grassy Knolls. "Let them go. There's no evidence of wrong-doing."

Nyx undid her binding spell and helped the purple stallion back up to his hooves. "Sorry..." she muttered. "I thought... never mind..." She then picked up the bag and gave it back to the buyer, who put it in his saddlebag. "Oh, uh, I should probably still get your name for the record."

"Grape Juicer," the purple earth pony replied. "And don't worry about it. Things aren't always as clear-cut as they seem. It happens." With that, he walked away while Stonewall stared down Grassy Knolls.

"Just remember, I'm watching you," he growled as Grassy Knolls shrank back away from the detective. When the green earth pony whimpered and backed away into his house, slamming and locking the door tightly, he turned back to rejoin Nyx, who was rejoining with her duplicate. "He's hiding something."

Nyx pulled her copy back into herself and asked, "Grassy?"

"Well, obviously," Stonewall replied, "but I mean Juicer. No one's that calm when they're being arrested, especially if they're innocent or have powerful connections. He should've been cussing us out and threatening to bring the wrath of Celestia herself down on us, but he just took it. Didn't even threaten to sue the department."

Nyx thought about it. In hindsight, Stonewall had an excellent point. "So, what do you think he was hiding?"

"Not sure yet," Stonewall replied, picking up one of the clovers that Nyx had spilled out of the sack. "But hopefully this'll help us figure it out."

*****


Some time later, Grape Juicer stepped into Lucky Seven's office. The pegasus was busy filling out forms when he looked up and saw his associate. "Ah, how did it go, capo?"

"Two Narcs showed up when I was visiting Grassy Knolls. One of them was Nyx."

Lucky Seven raised an eyebrow, and gave the earth pony an amused grin. "Really now. I would have expected her to stick with Captain Whistle. That is interesting. And what were your impressions?"

"I wouldn't want to take her in a fair fight, that's for sure," Grape replied. "But as soon as she saw the clover, she had no idea what to do. I don't think she'll be a problem as long we don't make it a problem."

Lucky Seven smiled and leaned back in his chair. "Well, it's still a very interesting development. I think I'll enjoy seeing where this ball bounces."

Grape nodded and added, "Oh, one other thing. Grassy Knolls insisted on raising the price of his clover. He... demonstrated a lack of respect for the opportunities he's been given. I think it's probably time to cut him loose."

The pegasus frowned at this. "Did he now? That's a shame... he really was one of my best growers. Still, I suppose that's the way it goes with these repeat offenders. One day they're trying to walk the straight and narrow, the next they have a 'relapse' and run afoul of the law. Mr. Juicer, I'll leave the specifics in your capable hooves."

Meanwhile, Nyx and Stonewall were busy...
14311112121121211112.title: Busted bust

choices: There is something odd about the clover
It appears to be a completely normal, everyday, clover.
143111121211212111122.content:
Stonewall and Nyx were heading down the stairs of the precinct, heading to the crime lab. Since the precinct in general handled a great deal of narcotics and other serious crimes, it had the benefit of having enough funding for its own, on site lab. And Nyx was not making any effort to hide her enthusiasm about seeing the lab. She had once gone on a crime mystery binge in middle school, and had on occasion wondered what it would be like to be the mare, cracking the cases by finding the smallest details. Searching for the hoof prints, the strands of hair, the chemical stains, the—

"Don't move!"

Nyx was snapped out of her thoughts by a loud, blaring voice from a small intercom next to the lab door. Stonewall was less caught of guard. He went up to the intercom, pressed the button, and looked up at the camera above the door.

"She's the new officer. Now let us in, Penelope. I have something I want you to look at."

"Where have you been? Do you have mud on your hooves? Show me your hooves!"

Stonewall rolled his eyes but lifted each of his hooves in turn, showing them to the camera. The camera itself seemed to nod in approval, then focused on Nyx.

"Well, what about you? You got giant hooves. That means you can track a lot of mud."

"Just do it," Stonewall said quietly. "Penelope is protective of her lab, and the feather brain won't let us otherwise."

"I heard that! Don't think I didn't hear that!"

Nyx forced a laugh and then did as Stonewall did. Each hoof was raised to the camera, showing that they were all clean and free of mud.

"That's good, but you could stand a trip to a spa. Your hooves are ugly."

Stonewall had to suppress a snicker as Nyx glared at the camera. Still, the camera and the creature controlling it ignored her and focused back on Stonewall.

"What about Howler? Where is she? I don't want her slobbering on my spectrometer again," the voice from the intercom nagged.

"We passed her on the way in," Stonewall assured. "She's playing ball with some of the other officers on her lunch break. Now come on, Penelope, I need you to take a look at this."

A electronic clicked filled the air, signaling the release of the locks on the door. Stonewall smiled and placed a hoof on the push bar, but glanced back at Nyx before they went in. "Now, get ready. Like Howler, Penelope has a very particular way of greeting new ponies."

"Can't be worse than Pinkie Pie," Nyx muttered to herself as she followed Stonewall inside. "That mare has no sense of personal—"

The moment Nyx was inside she was set upon. A griffin, light in stature with a pair of large rimmed glasses had swooped up beside her with a tape measure. Measurements were being taken everywhere. Every part of her had a length was measure. Every part of her that had a width was measure. Basically, every part of her was measured by this griffin with yellow tips to her white feathers, the white being a common trait for most griffins. All the while, Penelope made the occasional comment, comments she made no effort of keeping to herself.

"Abnormal height, size... left hind leg is a 32nd of an inch longer than the right. Modest risk of tripping, will need to reorganize lab again to better accommodate larger stature... and get a new door installed.* Penelope poked at Nyx's side. "A little underweight and muscle tone is soft. Could use more solid oats in diet and more time spent with weight machines. Hooves... look worse than they did on the camera."

"Nyx," Stonewall said with a small laugh. "Meet Penelope, our local lab technician and brainiest griffin I've ever met. She does a lot of our local scientific work here in this lab. Anything she can't handle gets sent out to the cities central crime lab."

"Penelope," Stonewall said as he pulled her away from her measuring. "This is Nyx, new officer."

Penelope cocked her head to one side, as birds tend to do when they see or hear something confusing. "Nyx? The Nyx? Once known as Nightmare Moon. Ruled over Equestria for less than a month .The mare you used to worship in the cult known as the Children of Nightmare."

"Yes, that Nyx," Stonewall answered before taking out the small bag with the clover he collected earlier. "Now, if I can distract you from measuring her for a moment, can you take a look at this clover. I want to know if there is anything "funny" about it."

"Assuming that you are using "funny" in the sense of "illegal", as you usually do." Penelope commented as she took the clover and went over to some of her equipment. "Just give me a moment."

Stonewall nodded, and let Penelope go about her work before looking back at Nyx, who was still a little bit stunned. "You okay?"

Nyx shook her head once, still a bit in shock. "I thought Pinkie Pie's invaded personal space. That griffin just doesn't believe it exists."

"Oh, she has a great respect for personal space. You get into hers, she'll claw you like an angry cat." Stonewall said with a chuckle. "Yes, she's a little odd, but a fast and accurate worker. That's the type you see here in Las Pegasus. It's a town of glitz, glamor, and crazies... but sometimes, crazies do the best work."

"And she was measuring me because..."

"That's just her of getting to know you," Stonewall answered. "And it won't be the last time. She'll retake your measurements regularly to keep track of you. Inadvertently, our department's officers find it a lot easier to stay in shape and keep their donut guts under control. I lost ten pounds in the first two months."

Nyx dead panned for a moment. "And she thinks I'm under weight. Wonderful, that's just the kind of letter I want to send home to my mother. I've gained weight cause this crazy griffin at work told me I needed more oats in my diet."

"And milk too," Penelope squawked as she came back from her equipment, holding the clover in its evidence bag. "A higher calcium intake will help get those hooves of yours in better shape. That, and taller creatures need to worry more about issues with weak bones later in life.*

Penelope turned her attention back to Stonewall. "And, while I will run more thorough tests later, my initial findings on this clover are..."
143111121211212111122.title: ... at the crime lab, getting the clover analyzed.

choices: Confront Grassy Knolls again.
Speak to Delta about this.
1431111212112121111221.content:
"... Inconclusive. I did find traces of chemical residue on the leaves, but it doesn't match any known narcotics. To be honest, from what little I can make out so far, it doesn't seem to actually do anything."

Nyx groaned. "Great, my first case and the dealer isn't peddling anything stronger than bug repellant."

Penelope interjected, "No, I mean it doesn't do anything. This additive is tasteless and odorless. It wouldn't kill insects or even make them look the other way. It's just... there, soaked into the leaves. Maybe I could find out more with some more time and more samples to test, but it's all I've got for you so far."

Stonewall rubbed his chin. "Well now... isn't that something?" He turned to go, gesturing for Nyx to follow him. "Thanks for your time, Penelope. I'll make sure to bring something nice next time in the area. Maybe some grilled fish from the Golden Griffin. That place makes your favorite, doesn't it?"

"Don't bother flirting, Canterlot, I'm not in the market," Penelope replied dismissively, though she licked her beak at the thought and added, "But go ahead and bring the fish if you feel like it."

Nyx covered her mouth to stifle a giggle, the mannerisms reminding her a bit of Spike with a big gemstone dangling in front of him. "Thanks, Penelope, and please let us know if you find out anything else."

As the alicorn started to depart behind Stonewall, she heard Penelope call out, "Don't forget to eat your oats! You'll thank me when you need the carbs!" After closing the door behind her, Nyx could hear it lock securely. She then looked forward to find Stonewall looking her in the eye.

"So, recruit Nyx, anything about that stick out in your mind?" Nyx opened her mouth to reply, but he quickly interrupted, "About the case, not Penelope."

"Oh... right." Nyx thought back to the would-be bust, and the conversation with Grassy Knolls. "Well... a couple of things. Grassy said he was growing organic clover, so why would it have chemicals on it? Maybe it was just because 'organic' sounds more expensive, but like you said before, that Grape Juicer guy working for the Seven-Leaf was kind of suspicious. Maybe..."

She thought back to her understanding of chemistry. She was no expert in the field, but Twilight had made absolutely positively certain that she grew up learning a lot about many different subjects. "Maybe it gets treated with something else farther down the line. And if the clover is being sold to the Seven-Leaf, that's where it would be."

Stonewall nodded and led the way up the stairs. "Just two huge problems with that line of thinking. The most important from a legal standpoint is that it's just an idea with nothing to back it up right now. The most important from a local standpoint is that no cop goes into the casinos unless they're there to gamble."

"Or see a show..." she replied, a glimmer of an idea in her head. "My friend and I have tickets to a Suave Crooner show at the Seven-Leaf in a few days."

Stonewall stopped to look at her with a raised eyebrow. "You listen to Suave Crooner?"

"Y-yeah... what about it?"

"Oh. Nothing. Hey, who doesn't like the Chairman? And it might not be a bad idea if you weren't a recruit. Not to mention conspicuous. 14311112121121211112212.content:
Delta rubbed the side of her temple with a hoof, sighing as she looked at the two ponies in front of her desk. "Okay, run this by me one more time."

         Nyx sighed as well, but obliged. "We busted Grassy Knolls, along with a customer of his, in the process of selling what we thought was marijuana. However, the bags were full of clover, and so we let them go. We took a sample of the clover back to Penelope - "

         "Who invaded your personal space to get your measurements - " Delta broke in with a knowing grin.

         " - and she concluded that while there was something on the clover, it didn't do anything, by itself," Nyx finished.

         "The customer, Grape Juicer, mentioned that he represented Lucky Seven, of the Seven-Leaf Casino," Stonewall added. "We figure that something else gets added to the clover at the Seven-Leaf, but we're not sure what."

         "And we can't just go there without a good reason," Delta sighed.

         Nyx coughed. "I have a bit of a reason to go there, actually. My friend managed to get me tickets to a Suave Crooner show at the Seven-Leaf in a few days."

         Delta arched an eyebrow. "Really? Well, that helps a little bit. Still, you stick out like a sore hoof, Nyx, and I'll eat my down feathers if word of you joining the 63rd's Narcotics division hasn't reached all ends of the city yet."

         Nyx sighed. "So, are you saying I shouldn't go to the show at all?"

         "I didn't say that," Delta replied. "What would be ideal would be if you had a way to disguise yourself, to make you less recognizable."

         Nyx coughed. "Um, problem. Suave Crooner got a really good look at me when I came to town, after I literally ran into him. And since my friend went to the trouble of getting me the tickets, I have the feeling he'd be disappointed if I didn't show up as myself." She got a bit of a dreamy look in her eyes.

         Delta stared at her for a bit, then chuckled. "Wow. Sounds like somepony has their first schoolfilly crush."

         Nyx blushed hard through her black coat. "Boss!" she whined, then turned to glare at Stonewall when she heard a masculine chuckle.

         "You know, Lieutenant, you could always use your special gift on Nyx, or at least a duplicate of her," the stallion suggested.

         Delta blinked, then face-hoofed. "Why didn't I think of that in the first place? Nyx, summon one of your duplicates for a sec, will you?"

         Nyx cocked her head to the side, but obliged. "Okay, but what are you...?"

         She trailed off as Delta laid a hoof on her clone, and murmured something under her breath. There was a brief flash of light, and suddenly Nyx saw, not her doppelganger, but her mother! Delta smirked. "Oh, yeah. I've still got it."

         The clone was as shocked as Delta was. "How...?" it asked, speaking in Twilight's voice. "You're a pegasus, not a unicorn!"

         Delta smiled, turning her chair sideways a bit to show off her cutie mark. It was a red eighth note, inscribed in an equilateral triangle. "I'm not called 'Delta' for nothing. In ancient Equinnic, 'delta' was the fourth letter of the alphabet, and also used to represent change. I was born with a mutation in my magical circuit. A mutation that allows me to use magic actively, despite not being a unicorn. The catch is that I can only cast spells through the power of my voice, and even then, I have to have intent behind it."

         Nyx stared. "And... you became a cop?" she asked, disbelieving.

         Delta shrugged. "I don't get to put it to use all that often, but when I do, it's always for the purpose of busting some drug user or another." She smirked. "This, combined with your duplication trick, will give us some eyes and ears in the Seven-Leaf that nopony would suspect."

         Nyx smiled as well, then looked at the Twilight-doppelganger. "Quick question, why did it turn into a copy of my mom?"

         Delta shrugged. "That's one of the catches with the polymorph spell I use. It changes a pony into another pony that they're thinking about, or if they're not thinking of anypony in particular, one close to them." She sighed. "I've been trying to adjust it for years."

         "I still have nightmares about being turned into you for a day," Stonewall muttered.

         Delta shrugged. "Just tell your clone to think of a generic pony description that won't seem too out-of-place at a casino, and that will be taken care of, Nyx. In the meantime..."

Nyx took a second to scan the room, but saw only a desk, covered in piles and piles of paperwork. She felt her eyes go wide as she saw how much work there was, but then she smiled. "It's a good thing I was raised by Equestria's number one Librarian!" Nyx hopped into the seat and got to work.

Tax evasion; crime level: 4; top drawer, under 'e'.

Bomb scare; crime level 8; bottom left drawer, under 's'

In the first five minutes, Nyx had read through two of the reports, and turned to find the filing cabinets were horribly organized, so she reorganized everything in those first, before starting in on the pile of paperwork on the desk. It took her only half an hour in total to get through it all, and when she finished, she absentmindedly relaxed in her seat, and tried to take a sip of coffee before remembering it was only an illusion. Trotting out of the room, she watched as the room fizzled and faded, all the work she had just done reverting to the cluttered mess it was before she had gone in.

"Well, that was pretty relaxing," Nyx commented. "Let's see what we get to do next."

14311121.content:
"Officer! We have a bomb located in the basement of this mall complex. You need to take care of it!"

"What?!" Nyx had only just walked into the second room when a very scared looking policecolt came galloping up to her. The colt pointed towards the stairwell that lead to the basement, and she took off.

~~

Not three minutes later, Nyx was standing in front of an extremely complex bomb. She had already snipped one wire, but it had been a dummy wire. The bomb's timer had dropped by five minutes, and now there was only two left!

Nyx looked over the wires that were left. She'd already cut the red wire, and now there was a green, a blue, and a black wire.

Nyx thought over her choices...

"Oh, buck this!" She wrapped the bomb in her telekinesis and teleported outside of the mall. Using her magic to heat the air beneath her wings, she started flying as fast as she could, going straight upwards. It only took her forty seconds to get up into the Stratosphere, and from there she teleported up near the exosphere. Time was running low. She threw the bomb as high as she could, and as fast as she could, and it sailed away from the planet, gravity barely affecting it. Nyx dropped lower in the sky so she could breath again, and then dove back to the ground. She was so focused on not losing consciousness that she didn't see the explosion behind her.

Two options now!

Go to the Virtual Robbery (here: http://www.writing.com/main/interact/ite...)

Or get pulled aside before the next test by Sharp Whistle.

15.content:
Twilight chuckled quietly as she looked over at Nyx. "Well, you know how much of a homepony she is... She said she wants to do something nice for Ponyville before she considers going anywhere else. She won't say what, but considering how much I've seen her conspiring with Apple Bloom and sneaking off to the castle, I'm pretty sure they're working on renovating it."

The castle in question was the one that had built by the Children of Nightmare, from which they had intended Nightmare Moon to rule over Equestria. It had actually served that purpose for a few weeks, looming near Ponyville as a reminder of a dark time in their recent history. However, because it had also served as a shelter for the entire town's population when Ponyville was swarmed by a horde of monsters, the town was divided over whether it should be demolished or if it was too useful to lose.

Applejack was taken aback by Twilight's theory. "APPLE BLOOM!" Her voice snapped through the room, surprising everyone else, especially her sister. Heading over to look Apple Bloom directly in the eye, she said, "Be honest with me. Have y'all been sneakin' off to that creepy place?"

Apple Bloom meeped, seeming to shrink a little under her big sister's glare. "N-not exactly sneakin'... Ah, I mean, which creepy place?" she stammered, which didn't help much.

Setting down the contestant she was spinning, Nyx stepped up and said, "W-we weren't doing anything dangerous, Applejack. In fact, she's the one who made absolutely sure we didn't go into any unstable areas." An assertion to which Apple Bloom nodded enthusiastically.

Applejack sighed. "No offense, Nyx, but this is between me an' mah sister." She pointed to Apple Bloom and said, "When we get home, y'all're gonna tell me EXACTLY what y'all've been gettin' up to over there. Ah'm sure Big Macintosh is gonna have words about this, too," making her little sister go pale. "Either way, y'all're grounded at the farm fer a week at least for not tellin' us about this.

Both Apple Bloom and Nyx hung their heads apologetically. "Sorry, Apple Bloom," Nyx murmured. "I didn't mean to get you in trouble."

"Awww, come on, girls! It's a party, so let's turn those frowns upside-downs," Pinkie urged, not wanting to let the mood dip too far. She knelt down next to the younger ponies, looking up at Applejack with big, pleading eyes. An expression that was soon joined by Nyx and Apple Bloom, with Scootaloo, Twist, and all the little Crusaders joining in. Nyx even went for the kill with her patented finishing move, the big black pony's lip quivering as her eyes watered up...

Applejack facehoofed at the sight after a few seconds of this. "Okay, okay, MAYBE ah'll rethink groundin' ya, but y'all're still stayin' away from that castle 'til ah say so. GOT IT?" It wasn't perfect, but much better than grounding, so Apple Bloom hugged her big sister while the Crusaders cheered.

"That was so dirty," Twilight said to Nyx with a little bemused smirk on her face, right before an irritated Rainbow Dash suddenly burst into the room.

"What the hay, Pinkie Pie?! How long are we supposed to wait out there with those fireworks?!" At the mention of fireworks, the room suddenly went quiet for about three seconds before it exploded in squeals of joy, followed by the Crusaders and their families nearly trampling Rainbow Dash on the way outside!

------------

The next day, after they had all gathered to wish Sweetie Belle and Scootaloo well on their journeys from Ponyville, Nyx approached the castle alone. Twilight had offered to go with her since Apple Bloom and the other Crusaders had been forbidden from doing so, but she insisted on going by herself. She wanted to wait until the job was completed before showing her mother and the rest of Ponyville what they had been doing with the place.

Long gone were the stained glass windows and murals that the Children of Nightmare had decorated the castle with. Images depicting the tyrannical Nightmare Moon that they had been expecting to bring to power were painted over, one wall now proudly emblazoned with the imaged of a caped pony that was on the cape of every Cutie Mark Crusader. The castle had fallen into some disrepair over the years, but most of it was perfectly safe, and other areas had been reinforced thanks to help from the others and particularly Apple Bloom's talent for construction.

For everyone in Ponyville, not least of all Nyx herself, the castle had stood as a grim reminder of a much worse time. That was why she and her friends had grown determined to renovate it, however. After all, if Nyx could become something better than what she had been created for, then so could the castle. That was what enabled her to walk down its corridors, reminded of the painful memories haunting the place, but also hopeful for the better ones that she intended to replace them with.

As she walked along, however, something else echoed through the corridors besides memories. It was the sound of heavy breathing, telling Nyx that she wasn't alone.

She stopped for a moment and listened carefully to ensure that she wasn't just hearing the breeze or a creaking door hinge, but no. As she felt around with her magic, she could tell that there was definitely something or someone alive in one of the rooms. Approaching carefully, keeping herself ready to react to anything, the alicorn couldn't tell much other than whatever it was, it wasn't moving around. Once at the door, she kicked it open and used a bright light spell to illuminate the room while blinding anything that might turn out to be hostile!

Instead of an immediate threat, though, what she found was an unconscious form laying on the floor, looking as though they needed immediate attention.

151.content:
Nyx gasped as she recognized the pony. Though the two hardly ever interacted, the alicorn recognized her as the desk assistant at the post office, Chell. Being an earth pony, rather than a pegasus like Ditzy Doo, Chell handled the post office while Ditzy delivered the mail. One oddity about Chell was her lack of vocal cords, something that had apparently been done to her a while back. She didn't remember much of her past, from what Nyx gathered. She instead 'spoke' via a magical gem that gave literal voice to her thoughts. The gem, it seemed, had been a gift from Princess Luna.

         Chell looked to be in bad shape at the moment. Lacerations covered her body, and there were a few small holes here and there as well. She wore a set of odd white boots, with strange metal braces on the back. She was also breathing shallowly. Nyx quickly picked the mare up in her magic, and dashed off back to Ponyville, heading for the hospital where Nurse Redheart worked.

*****


         It was a testament to her composure that Nurse Redheart didn't flinch when the doors to the emergency room burst open, revealing a frantic Nyx. Redheart's knee-jerk reaction was to berate Nyx for being so careless, but the words died on her lips as she saw the mare Nyx was carrying in her magic. She hit the alert button for the orderlies, and came around the desk, grabbing a gurney on the way. "Quick, lay her down here," she instructed Nyx, who complied immediately. The orderlies came through moments later, taking the gurney back into the ER. Nurse Redheart saw that a doctor was coming, so she stayed with Nyx, who looked to be exhausted. "What happened?"

         Nyx took a breath. "I found her in the castle. She looked like she'd been beat up something awful. I've never seen such wounds before." She took another breath.

         Redheart looked uneasy. "I have," she said. "It was after the whole incident with GLaDOS."

         Nyx blinked. "Gladdys?"

         Redheart face-hooved. "Right, that was before you came here. GLaDOS was this... intelligent machine, for lack of a better word. It was evil, and it captured a good portion of Ponyville's population, as well as the Princesses. It put everypony through these so-called 'tests', tests that we later learned would have ended up killing us in the end. If it wasn't for Chell, many good ponies might have died. She freed Twilight and her friends, and gave them instructions to help disable GLaDOS. After a while, she was found outside where that whole disaster took place, shortly before the... facility collapsed in on itself. It took her some time to recover, and the Princesses thanked her for her efforts. Celestia paid for her hospital bill, and Luna gave her the gem she uses to speak."

         Nyx was wide-eyed. "Why didn't I ever learn about this?"

         Redheart sighed. "My guess is, Twilight didn't think it was important. It's in the past... or at least, everypony thought it was. But those wounds are just like the ones she had when we found her."

         Nyx gulped. "Do you think this 'GLaDOS' has returned?"

         Redheart grimaced. "I hope not, but I can't think of any other explanation for those wounds."

         At that point, the doctor came out of the ER. "Well, Ms. Nyx, you got Chell to us just in time. She'd lost a lot of blood, and her injuries are rather severe. Still, she'll recover, given time."

         Nyx sighed in relief. "Good to know. We can ask her what happened when she wakes up."

         The doctor winced. "That... may be easier said than done. Her gem is missing."

         Nyx gasped. "Missing? She didn't have it on her?"

         He shook his head. "No, and unless you managed to find it..."

         Nyx bolted out the door, leaving Redheart and the doctor's manes ruffled.

*****


         Searching the room she'd found Chell in turned up nothing. The mare's gem, her 'voice', was well and truly gone. Nyx groaned. "This is going to be a pain." She thought about what to do next. Letting Twilight and the Princesses know about this would be the prudent thing to do. Still, she didn't have all the details. Waiting for Chell to recover enough to answer questions might be wise. Then again, perhaps it would be best to investigate on her own. What to do...?
151.title: Still Alive?

1513.content:
Part of Nyx wanted to go back and tell Twilight about what had happened, or at least hurry to the post office to let Ditzy and Dinky Doo know about Chell's condition. However, if the situation was really as dire as Nurse Redheart had made it out to be, then somepony would already be on their way to do so. If she could find a clue about Chell's attacker by the time Twilight and her friends arrived, it could give them a chance to catch up with this GLaDOS before the trail went cold.

Taking a moment to think about how she had found Chell, Nyx recalled that for as battered as the orange pony was, there had been no signs of a struggle. Plus, she'd been bleeding from some of her cuts, but looking at the spot where she had been laying, the only trace of a blood trail was from Nyx carrying her away. It was as though she gotten wounded, then simply materialized where Nyx found her, but she was an earth pony, and even if she was a unicorn, teleportation was a rare magic.

There was too much that Nyx didn't know about the situation, and it was frustrating her to no end. She threw her head back and let out a confused sigh, which coincidentally allowed her to see it.

Nyx's jaw dropped open as she saw something she had seen before without ever realizing its significance. There, up on the ceiling directly above where Chell had been found, was a hole. Far from an ordinary hole, however, this one was lined with a sort of orange energy. Even stranger than that, though, was that instead of seeing the ceiling of the room above, she saw stalactites lining the ceiling of some sort of cave.

Nyx rubbed her eyes, but when she opened them again, the same bizarre sight greeted her. As no one had ever told the young alicorn about GLaDOS, neither was she familiar with Aperture's portal technology. Nevertheless, she had seen something like it during Dinky Doo's birthday party.

At that time, Nyx had never seen Chell's cutie mark before, as the mailmare was either behind the post office's service counter or kept it covered up with flaps of cloth over her flanks. To entertain the little ponies gathered there, she showed them a 'magic trick' by getting Ditzy to take a sharpened stick and stab it right through her cloth-covered flank. Everypony but Dinky immediately started screaming in horror as they saw the stick pierce right through Chell and out the other side. Nyx herself hadn't stopped sobbing until Chell reassured them all that she was alright, and proved it by showing them the round portals on her flanks.

Curious as she was, Nyx had pestered Chell, Ditzy and Dinky with questions about it once she got over her fright, but hadn't gotten any answers beyond them symbolizing 'problem solving' or something along those lines, and that they served as a reminder of a time Chell would rather prefer to put behind her. Being able to sympathize, Nyx had swallowed her curiosity until eventually she put it out of her mind.

Now, though, it was apparent that there was a deeper connection between Chell's strange cutie mark and what was happening now. With a leap assisted by a few flaps of her wings, Nyx launched herself up through the portal to scout out the other side. There, she found herself in a small cavern, the orange portal's blue counterpart on the floor of that cave. One end of the cavern narrowed into a tunnel that wound off into the dark underground while a crevice about half the size of an adult pony allowed a shaft of sunlight to illuminate the area where she stood.

Looking out through this crevice, Nyx gasped when she saw the castle she had just been standing in seconds ago, now off in the distance. If she squinted, she could even make out the window of the room where she had found Chell, and the orange glow of the portal there.

As Nyx processed what she had found, she looked over her shoulder at the tunnel. Drag-marks in the dust and flecks of dried blood indicated that this was where Chell had come from after being attacked. She had then dropped down through the portal on the floor and ended up in the castle. It was in that darkness that Chell's attacker would certainly be found.
1513.title: Through the orange rabbit hole

15133.content:
It was dumb luck that Nyx avoided the first salvo. She had bent her head down in a sigh, trying to figure out the best course of action. Without warning, she heard a strange sound, and sparks leapt off of the rocks past where her head had been. Yelping, she looked for the source, and spotted it.

         "Target acquired," came the voice from the floating white ovoid. It was held aloft by what appeared to be an intricate propeller design. A red 'eye' glared at her, a matching line emanating from it to her. Two small tubes on either side of it flashed, and Nyx instinctively ducked backwards, as sparks danced off the rocks again. The tubes kept flashing, causing Nyx to duck back more and more. "Target is evading. Accuracy calibration requested," the ovoid said as its tubes ceased flashing.

         Nyx wasn't one to look a gift horse in the mouth. This thing, whatever it was, likely knew where Chell's attacker was. Reaching out with her magic, she ripped the propeller off of the ovoid, but held it aloft and pointed away from her. As the thing's red 'eye' tried to track her, she growled at it. "Tell me where whoever attacked Chell is!"

         The thing's response, after a few seconds of 'looking' around, was simply "Sleep mode activated."

         Snarling at being so callously ignored, Nyx flung the object into a wall. This caused the tubes on the side to flash repeatedly for several seconds, sending sparks along the wall, before stopping. The ovoid's final words were "Critical error." Nyx flushed as she realized she'd damaged the thing too badly. It wasn't likely too answer any questions now. Still, she thought, it might be the evidence I need. I may not have seen anything like this before, but if this... GLaDOS has returned, I bet Twilight would recognize this, to say nothing of Chell.

         With those thoughts in mind, Nyx seized the ovoid in her magic's grip. After a quick check around the cave to make sure nothing else was coming, she flew down through the portal to the castle. She paused here a moment to set up a barrier around the portal to keep anything from crossing over. No sense in leaving a back-door to Ponyville for GLaDOS, she thought smugly. With that, she headed back to Ponyville. But the question was, who should she approach about this first? On the one hoof, since Chell was more familiar with GLaDOS, it would make sense to question her first. Her being mute shouldn't be too much of an issue; there were ways around such an obstacle. On the other hoof, Twilight wasn't currently in the hospital being treated for injuries. Plus, she had a line to Princess Celestia in the form of Spike, which would alert the princesses that a threat to Equestria was rising. Where to go?

1513321.content:
"Where have you been?!" Twilight snarled as she stood up from her position at the table. "I just got word from Ponyville General that you dropped by earlier, bringing in Chell, who looked like she lost a fight with a meat grinder! And that you took off without warning afterward!"

         Nyx lowered her head. "I'm sorry, Mom. I just... Miss Chell's lost her gem. The one that gives her a voice. I went back to where I found her, trying to find it." It wasn't the whole truth, but it wasn't a lie, either.

         Twilight's expression cooled. "Well, I suppose that's fair. Still, you should know better than to be out when there's something out there that can hurt ponies like that!"

         Nyx looked up, her eyes narrowed. Twilight's anger faltered at the cool gaze in her adoptive daughter's eyes. "Mom, have you forgotten what my cutie mark means? I'm a shield, something to protect other ponies from harm. And I can't do that without putting myself in danger from time to time."

         Twilight blinked repeatedly, then sighed. "You're right, Nyx. It's just... it seems like only yesterday you were a young filly, asking me to read her a bedtime story. Now, the years have flown by, and you're growing up... again. I... I'm afraid I'm going to lose you again, somehow." Tears welled up in her eyes.

         Nyx leaned forward, nuzzling her adoptive mother. "Don't worry, Mom. I'm not planning on going anywhere. Not again."

         The two embraced for several minutes, before Nyx coughed. "Tell me, Mom, have you ever seen anything like this before?" With that, she deposited the wrecked machine on the floor in between them.

         Twilight's eyes widened. "No... no no nononono! This was dealt with, this can't be happening again!"

         "Apparently not. I got the story about GLaDOS from Nurse Redheart," Nyx said. "And unless I'm mistaken, she's back, and she wants revenge. Chell's in the hospital because of her, I wager, and the gem's probably with her."

         Twilight's expression of fear faded into determination. "We have to inform the Princesses right away! SPIKE!" she yelled.

         "I'm coming, I'm coming," Spike replied as he came down the stairs, yawning slightly. "What's up, Twi?"

         "Spike, take a letter," chorused Nyx and Twilight. They blinked and looked at each other, then laughed. When Spike had retrieved parchment and quill, Twilight began.

Dear Princess Celestia,

         I'm writing to you about a matter of grave importance. Do you recall, a few years ago, the menace known as GLaDOS? We had thought her destroyed when the Aperture Science facility collapsed in on itself. However, it would appear we thought wrong.

         My lovely adoptive daughter, Nyx, has gathered evidence that suggests GLaDOS is still... 'alive', for lack of a better term. She found and wrecked one of those 'turrets' that we encountered in the facility. Moreover, Chell has been injured, presumably in a fight against GLaDOS. We thought to inform you post-haste, in case she attempts to abduct you and Princess Luna again.

         I hope you can suggest a plan of action to deal with this renewed threat to Equestria's well-being.

Your beloved student,
Twilight Sparkle


         With the letter finished, Spike rolled it up and sent it in a burst of dragonfire. When he was done with that, he looked worriedly at them. "This sounds bad, Twilight. Didn't that GLaDOS creep capture you and all of your friends?"

         "She did," confirmed Twilight. "But this time, we know she's here, and we'll be prepared to deal with her... I hope."

         Further conversation was cut off as Spike belched up a scroll in reply to the one they'd sent.
1513321.title: Tartarus Hath No Fury Like A Worried Mother

choices: ... the princesses and their royal guard!
... flying turrets, heading straight for Ponyville!
15133211.content:
Twilight unrolled the scroll and read it aloud while Nyx and Spike both leaned in.

         Dear Twilight Sparkle,

         I regret to tell you that shortly before your message arrived, the royal palace came under assault from a squadron of flying turrets. Unlike GLaDOS's previous attack on Equestria, these turrets were not equipped with portal devices for capture. Instead, these were outfitted with the deadly weapons of those that you faced in her 'testing' chambers.

         Thankfully, there were no fatalities as a result of this attack, but over a dozen of my finest Guards were severely wounded. I myself was injured by their weapons, but only superficially. I fear that the brutality of this assault means that GLaDOS's insanity is no longer tempered by her curiosity about our world, and that she now seeks nothing more or less than violent revenge against those who defeated her in the past.

         Luna and I have gathered the remainder of the Guard, and will be arriving in Ponyville shortly to plan a counter-offensive. If GLaDOS has rebuilt the facilities needed to manufacture these machines, then it is almost certainly near you. In the meantime, it is probably best if you gather the other bearers of the Elements of Harmony, along with any other pony possessing the necessary skills to fight this threat. The rest of Ponyville's citizenry should be warned so that they might prepare to defend themselves if the worst should come to pass, and GLaDOS launches another wave of machines against the town.

         Stay vigilant, and stay safe, my student. We will arrive soon.

         Your loving teacher,
         Princess Celestia

The ponies and dragon all gasped at the realization that the princesses had been attacked. They were grateful to hear that it hadn't gone nearly as badly as it could have, but the threat of what the insane machine might do next hung over all their heads. At the end of the letter, Spike asked, "So what do we do, Twilight?"

"Exactly what princess Celestia told us to," the unicorn replied. "Spike, you and I will gather the others. Nyx, I need you to warn everypony you can find about this!"

Nyx nodded in agreement. "I'm on it!" She closed her eyes, magic gathering in her horn as she focused on a spell, the alicorn soon splitting into two, then those two split into four. That was pretty much her limit, but while each copy would have almost no magic ability left over, she could still fly and cover four times as much ground this way. One by one, the Nyxes dashed out the door and took wing. The last one to leave, though, looked over her shoulder and smiled resolutely to Twilight and Spike before launching herself into the air.

Once they took flight, each Nyx turned toward a different corner of Ponyville, calling out warnings to the ponies below. Most were confused at first, not sure how seriously they should take the alicorn. When they heard GLaDOS's name, however, most remembered it well enough to immediately start galloping toward their homes and loved ones, locking themselves away and barricading the doors and windows of the buildings!

After just a few minutes of this, one of the Nyxes spotted something flying through the sky toward her. It was off in the distance and indistinct, but as she squinted, she was soon able to make out...
15133211.title: Prepare the troops!

choices: The princesses have arrived. It's time to begin planning!
GLaDOS has appeared in her alicorn body! This is bad...
151332112.content:
Nyx gasped as she saw more of the flying machines - turrets, the letter had said - that she had seen before. There were ten of them, heading straight for Ponyville. Glancing down, Nyx saw that the townsfolk were all barricaded inside their homes, save for the few that were heading to the library to take part in the upcoming fight. Among those she could see heading for the library were Mayor Mare. It made sense; the mayor was in charge of the town, after all. But Nyx's musings could wait. The incoming turrets could not.

         With a mental 'tug', the copy of Nyx called to her others, bringing them over to her location. The machines were closer now. Still a ways away, but closer. With a flash, the four Nyxes combined back into one. Nyx let out a small sigh as she felt her magic reserves be restored. "Alright, you buckets of bolts. Let's see if a group of you fares any better than one." She flew towards the interlopers. Their glowing red eyes spotted her, and the tubes emerged.

         "I see you!" one of them said, as all of their tubes began to flash. Nyx ducked and wove around the objects she could feel slicing through the air. With a snort, she lashed out with a small bolt of lightning, instantly frying one of them. Its propeller ceased moving, and it fell with a cry of "I don't hate you..." The others attempted to surround Nyx, to keep her from dodging with any degree of success. She teleported out of the circle just as they opened fire again. Three more fell to the ground before they stopped.

         Like an angel of death, Nyx descended on them from above. She had teleported quite a ways above the turrets, in preparation for a big attack. During her regrowth, she was tutored in flying by Rainbow Dash, and had taken to it like a duck to water. She had even, to the prismatic-maned pegasus's astonishment, managed to perfect her own version of the Sonic Rainboom. Since it was dark in color, she and Rainbow had dubbed it the 'Sonic Nightboom'. And if Nyx had done her ad-lib math correctly...

         She had. She broke the mach cone just as she passed through the center of the circle of remaining turrets. The wave of dark-colored energy blew the machines out of the sky, each of them falling with their own comment. Nyx used the momentum from the Nightboom to fly back to the library in record time.

         "Nyx!" Twilight greeted her at the library door. "We heard your Nightboom - what happened?"

         Nyx smiled wryly. "I just got finished dealing with GLaDOS's first attack on Ponyville. Ten flying turrets. They didn't even manage to hit me once."

         As Nyx was talking, Twilight looked apprehensive. When she finished, however, the unicorn sighed in relief. "That's good to hear. The others are already here, aside from the Princesses and the Royal Guard." Together, mother and daughter walked back into the library.

         Nyx glanced around at the assembled ponies. There were the Element Bearers, of course, as well as Mayor Mare. More surprising was Vinyl Scratch, who looked to be putting the finishing touches on an overly-large speaker. A label on the top read 'Bass Cannon'. Also present, much to Nyx's surprise, was Ditzy Doo. The wall-eyed mare looked unusually grim. Then again, Chell had befriended the mailmare, so it only made sense that Ditzy would want to be involved. Plus, she was unusually strong for a pegasus.

         Aside from those, there were a few large stallions, including Applejack's brother, Big Macintosh. They had obviously decided that muscle would be needed to fight GLaDOS. All in all, not the best turnout for a militia, the black alicorn thought. Still, at least some ponies other than the Element bearers decided to try and help.

         Twilight cleared her throat. "Well, everypony, it looks like we're just waiting on the Princesses and the Guard, and then we'll begin planning a counter-offensive against GLaDOS."

         "Just one more... there!" Vinyl said as she stepped away from the speaker, putting away her tools. "I guarantee, once this GLaDOS gets a taste of my Bass Cannon, she'll pack her bags and leave."

         "Don't count yer chickens yet, Scratch," Applejack said. "GLaDOS is one persistant turkey, and she can read yer mind, too."

         While Vinyl Scratch looked abashed, there came a knock at the door. Nyx trotted over to open it.
151332112.title: First Strike and Gathering

choices: Screams! Ponies are being abducted by tunneling robots!
A trap! The ground opens up underneath the gathered fighters!
1513321121.content:
On the other side of the door, a pair of Royal Guard soldiers stood to greet Nyx. Behind them were large transport chariots that had been brought down by pegasus Guards, and from which a few dozen large, armored ponies filed out. Nyx let out a small sigh of relief, and called out over her shoulder, "It's the forces from Canterlot!"

There was a cheer from the others as the mayor and Twilight stepped up to address the guards. "Thank you SO much for coming," Mayor Mare said to them. "Nyx here just fended off a small attack force, but everyone in Ponyville will breathe easier once GLaDOS is dealt with once and for all."

"We heard Princess Celestia was wounded in the attack on Canterlot," Twilight added, a worried quiver in her voice. "Is she alright?"

One of the Guards nodded stoically and replied, "Princess Celestia and Princess Luna request you and your militia to join them for the strategy meeting." The Guards then moved away, leading the ponies out of the library toward the landing zone.

A royal chariot had also set down nearby, bearing three horned ponies that Nyx was very familiar with. Princess Luna had already stepped out onto the ground to address the Guard commanders, but Celestia was more unsteady on her hooves. Even from a modest distance, Nyx could clearly see that one of her wings was wrapped in splints and bandages, as well as her left foreleg. The third pony Nyx recognized was a blue unicorn who was fussing over Celestia as he tried to help her out of the chariot.

"Really, Spell Nexus, you don't need to make such a production out of it. I'm still perfectly capable of walking," Celestia said with a faint smile somewhere between bemusement and embarrassment. It was obvious that she was still in some pain, though, as she limped noticeably whenever she placed pressure on her injured leg.

Seeing Celestia's condition, Twilight quickly trotted over toward her. "Princess! What happened?!"

Seeing her former student run up to her, Celestia smiled sadly and replied, "It's alright, Twilight Sparkle. My wounds are far less severe than those suffered by those brave Guards who threw themselves into harms way to protect Canterlot."

Luna approached, chastising her by adding, "And you wouldn't have those if you hadn't put yourself between me and those turrets, sister. Even though I had a magical barrier in place."

Celestia cleared her throat. "Yes, well... in any case, we should focus on the matter at present." Growing more serious, she looked over the Ponyville militia. "We may be relatively few in number, but GLaDOS's machines will doubtless have the numerical advantage no matter how many we gather. If we are to prevail, it will be by destroying GLaDOS's ability to manufacture and control her machines." The alicorn gestured with her good hoof toward the unicorn at her side. "For that purpose, I asked Spell Nexus to accompany us. His studies of the few remains we were able to gather from the last attack, combined with what insight Chell was able to give us about the nature of this technology suggests that the machines are controlled by a certain 'language.' Spell Nexus, can you please elaborate?"

The unicorn coughed and glanced around, but wasn't able to maintain eye contact with anypony for more than a fraction of a second. "Ah, yes. Well, my understanding of this language is extremely incomplete. It's incredibly complex, and it took years of studying the structure of the remains we could find before we were even able to draw it out into any form that we could even understand, but it's very similar in concept to the magic used to animate 'golems' in some cultures. Golems are relatively simple constructs and can only follow the words written into them to perform a very few basic commands. That's why they never really caught on here, since the effort it takes to animate one and get it to follow the orders you require generally outweighs the benefits."

Seeing that, while a few ponies like Twilight and Nyx seemed genuinely interested by the explanation, the others were generally waiting for him to get to the point (and he couldn't discern what expression Ditzy Doo was conveying, or if she was even looking at him). "Basically, GLaDOS controls her minions by transmitting this 'command language' to them. I believe that I've devised a spell which should, at least momentarily, cut off her ability to send commands and disrupt her machines. From what I understand, GLaDOS herself is far too complex for this spell to affect for more than maybe a fraction of a second, but if we can cripple her armies, even if only for a few minutes, it should buy us the opportunity we need to cut off the head of the serpent, as it were."

"Ewwwww!!" Pinkie Pie stuck her tongue out in disgust.

"He meant metaphorically," Rarity pointed out.

"That's even worse!"

Everyone, even the princesses, blinked at Pinkie. The collective grinding of gears in each of their heads as they tried to process this would have served as the industrial base for a small country, until eventually Celestia laughed. "Indeed. But before we can even use this spell, Spell Nexus must be in close proximity to the transmitter. Most likely, this will be somewhere on GLaDOS's body, and that will be in her hiding place. Nyx, your mother's letter said you fought a turret, but not where. Can you lead us there?"

Nyx stepped forward, causing Spell Nexus to cringe a little. Despite having assured him years ago that she harbored no ill will toward the former leader of the Children of Nightmare, due to his actions having been caused by the corrupting shreds of Nightmare Moon that had been sealed inside him, he nevertheless acted fearful on the few occasions they had met since then. It was as though he thought that the lack of reprisal for the things he had done back then was simply a foreboding sign that he was going to receive an even more severe punishment, even after all this time.

Doing her best to ignore Nexus's behavior, Nyx told the princesses and gathered ponies about the cave, and the portal connecting it to the abandoned castle. "Now that I think about it," she mused, "she could be using the system of caves and tunnels that the Children of Nightmare used. I never knew the full layout, but maybe Spell Nexus... er..."

Nyx trailed off as the unicorn suddenly screamed like a little filly, sobbing and throwing himself at Celstia's hooves. "I'm so sorry, your highness! I never even considered that those tunnels could still be used by your enemies! My crimes are truly inexcusable! Please, for the good of Equestria, lock me away so that I can never harm another pony again!"

"I can't believe we were ever scared of this guy..." Rainbow Dash said, not even bothering to hide it as she rolled her eyes.

"Erm... there there, Nexus," Celestia said to the wailing unicorn. "We do still need your expertise to cast that spell you created, after all, so we can't throw you into the dungeon just yet. We'll discuss whatever punishment we feel is necessary once the threat of GLaDOS has been dealt with, alright?"

Pinkie Pie piped up, saying, "Yeah, and you'll need to be there for the victory party once we beat her! Oooh, darn, I completely missed an opportunity for a pre-battle party! That would've been so good for morale, seeing as how everypony who's gonna be fighting GLaDOS is all in one place!"

For some reason, this comment struck Nyx as a bit ominous, and she wasn't the only one. Princess Luna said, "Now that she mentions it... we are all gathered together, and everypony else is locked up in their homes... you don't suppose...?"

Before she could finish her sentence, however, the ground started to tremor slightly under their hooves.
1513321121.title: All present and accounted for.

choices: It's safe. Nyx's pulse-bomb did the trick.
The portal closes behind them! It's a trap! ...Duh.
15133211212.content:
[[OOC: For the record, I'm assuming Shining Armor is here as part of the Royal Guard, since he is their captain.]]

         None of the ponies gathered could have anticipated the ground suddenly opening up underneath them. Still, the flyers present were all able to kick off before the ground collapsed completely. Among them were Nyx, Fluttershy, Rainbow Dash, Princess Luna, and a few of the Royal Guard. Still, that left several ponies falling into the newly-formed sinkhole in the center of town, among them Princess Celestia and the other bearers of Harmony. With Celestia's wing injured, she couldn't escape on her own.

         Fortunately, the falling ponies were caught by the combined efforts of Luna and Nyx, whose horns were glowing with the power to keep everypony else from falling into unknown circumstances. Slowly and carefully, they levitated everypony out, before glancing back down the hole.
