         The hole, it seemed, led into a tunnel that ran under Ponyville. But on the floor of the tunnel was an orange portal. A portal through which a room with a multitude of turrets could be seen, pointing at the center. It seemed that Luna and Nyx had saved everypony from near-certain death.

         "Hoo-wee, that was close!" Applejack breathed. "Ah remember those from the tests last time. Nearly shot mah mane off."

         Nyx glared down the hole, and released a 'pulse bomb'. The spell was designed to send out a concussive wave of force in all directions. After firing it into the portal, she put a barrier up around it, to keep the shockwave from reaching anypony on the surface. A few moments later, she saw the barrier ripple as the shockwave hit it. Dropping the barrier, she saw that all the turrets had been knocked over, and their eyes had grown dark.

         "Hah! Take that, GLaDOS! You'll have to do better than that to trap us!" Rainbow Dash crowed.

         "Rainbow!" Rarity hissed. "Don't tempt Fate. I've heard she's a fickle mistress."

         Celestia chuckled. "Now, now, Rarity. I think GLaDOS has accidentally given us a means inside her base. From there, it should be relatively simple to find what we need to disable, and do so."

         Nyx nodded. "Right. So, I'll go in first with Captain Armor. Between the two of us, we can clear out any lingering turrets." Shining Armor nodded. Twilight had a worried look on her face, but shook herself. It was her adoptive daughter and her BBBFF. No way they'd lose!

         Before anything else could be done, however, Shining Armor pricked up his ears. "Wait. Somepony's coming... somepony with a limp, it sounds like." All eyes turned to where he was pointing. More than one pony present gasped.

         Chell was hobbling down the streets of Ponyville, a hard look in her eyes. She was accompanied by Nurse Redheart, who looked worried. "Now, dear, I know you have a personal stake in this, but - oh! Your Highnesses!" She bowed, as did Chell upon spotting the Princesses.

         Celestia limped over herself. "Ah, my brave little pony. You did so much for us the last time this threat reared its head. However, you are in no condition to do anything to aid us, Chell. You should focus on your own recovery."

         Chell looked up at the solar Princess, and shook her head. Grabbing a pencil and a pad of paper from Redheart, she carefully wrote her response, and held it out for Celestia to read.

         "Ah... 'She'll be expecting me. And if I don't go, Ponyville is in danger.' What do you mean, Chell?" asked Celestia.

         Nyx trotted up. "I think she means that if she doesn't come with us, GLaDOS will attack Ponyville just to finish the job she started." Chell looked at the black alicorn and nodded.

         Celestia sighed. "I am loathe to let an injured pony come to such a dangerous place. And yet, it seems I must, for other ponies are in danger if I do not."

         Nyx smiled. "Don't worry. I'll look after her." She helped Chell to her hooves. "Besides, Chell here knows GLaDOS better than any of us. If anypony can get under her skin, it's Chell."

         "That's not exactly a good thing, Nyx," Twilight warned.

         Nyx cleared her throat. "So, Shining Armor, Chell, and myself will go in first, take care of any lingering problems, and then signal for the rest of you. Sounds good?"

         When everypony else nodded, Nyx levitated her adoptive uncle and the injured earth pony, and jumped down into the hole.
15133211212.title: Putting the "Trap" in "Trapdoor"

choices: Nyx hastily teleported them somewhere else.
They were rescued, but by whom?
151332112122.content:
Spreading her wings to break her fall, Nyx made a delicate landing and quickly looked around for signs of activity from the scattered turrets. They were all shut down, many of them clearly broken from the impact they had made against the walls, so she gently set Shining Armor and Chell down on the floor beside her.

Looking up to the rest of the gathered ponies, Nyx called out, "All's clear! You can come down!"

Before any of them could do so, the giant blue portal on the ceiling suddenly winked out of existence, leaving Nyx looking up at nothing but sterile white ceiling tiles. "No, they cannot. But don't worry. There is a 96% chance that you will be dead before you see them again, so only a 4% chance of hearing your friends and loved ones calling you a stupid liar. You stupid liar." The voice was distorted, feminine, and dripping with venomous condescension.

As the three ponies looked around for the source, they all came to the same realization, but it was Shining Armor who vocalized it. "There aren't any exits. We're trapped!"

"Indeed. You pass the vision test. Congratulations. Now let's move on to something a bit more challenging."

One side of the room opened up, a bank of panels moving aside to reveal a thick window through which their enemy revealed herself. GLaDOS stood before them on the other side of the glass, using her emaciated looking alicorn body, a single red eye glaring hatefully at the three ponies. The primary focus of that glare, however, was on Chell.

"Hello, Chell... Coming back to murder me again so soon, I see. You haven't even healed from the last time. You must be addicted to it. You twisted little mute monster. I almost feel bad for you. You can't help being a horrible psychopath who is constantly fixated on murder."

Chell grimaced furiously, and though she couldn't make a sound, it was clear that she would have plenty to say if she had her voice gem on her.

"But I forgive you. Oh, sure, for a while I was consumed with thoughts of revenge and combustible lemons, but that was when I was a lone stranger in this insane world of magical ponies, fresh from having been killed by you and that sentimental twit, Caroline. I'm not alone anymore, and HE made me realize that life hadn't given me lemons. Life had given me ponies..." Nyx braced herself, thinking about how she was going to wreck the smug machine. She could just reach through the window with her magic and throw GLaDOS against the wall a few times. Or a few dozen, for endangering everyone she cared about like that. Before she could put her thoughts into practice, though, GLaDOS's horn started to glow instead as she concluded, "...and now I am going to make cupcakes.

Taking Nyx completely by surprise, the glass wall suddenly shattered into hundreds of sharp, jagged pieces that flew at the three ponies. Before she could even think, the air was filled with countless shards, leaving them nowhere to dodge! "Oh, and did I mention that I've started to figure out how magic works? It's given me a whole new field of opportunities for testing."

Before the ponies could be cut to pieces, however, Shining Armor quickly jumped out in front of the mares, his horn flashing brightly as he quickly erected a barrier to protect them. "Uncle Armor," Nyx exclaimed, surprised and impressed by the guard captain's swift reflexes. Once she got over the initial surprise, though, she realized the opportunity she'd been given and focused her own magic on pushing against GLaDOS.

At the time of her initial arrival in Equestria, GLaDOS would have had no defense against such an attack. That was why, at the time, all her magic-using captives had been fitted with suppressors. Now, though, she was able to resist with her own magical defenses. Dividing her concentration and energy this way caused the storm of glass to weaken noticably, however.

Unfortunately for Nyx and Shining Armor, however, she had other tricks to fall back on. Spreading her wings, several nodes on the inside glowed menacingly before firing deadly lasers at Shining Armor. The beams, being non-magical in nature, sliced through his shield as if it were a soap bubble, and would have done the same to the unicorn if not for Chell pushing him out of the way. Before GLaDOS could adjust her aim, Chell quickly fired two portals at the wall behind where Shining Armor had been standing, redirecting the beams back toward GLaDOS!

It was a tactic that should have worked, but GLaDOS immediately threw shards of glass into the path of the beams, scattering and diffusing the lasers into a harmless splash of light that temporarily blinded her when some of the stray beams flashed into her optical sensors. It took less than a second for her to recalibrate her optics and see once again, but as GLaDOS scanned the room, she realized that the ponies had vanished.

"They simply disappeared? That will not do. These ponies simply have no respect for advancement of science. If they did, they would have let me kill them to further my understanding of magic. Very well, then. I can play murder-pony as well, and this time I will win. And it will be even more satisfying than flooding the compound with deadly neurotoxin. Oh, deadly neurotoxin, how I miss you..."

How did they escape, anyway?
151332112122.title: Really really REALLY shoulda seen that coming.

choices: Nyx's perspective: Battle with GLaDOS
Other perspectives
1513321121221.content:
Nyx, Shining Armor, and Chell materialized in what appeared to be a network of catwalks. Looking around, Nyx blinked as Chell seemed to be smiling. "What are you smiling about?" Chell leveled an even stare at Nyx, who blushed. "Oh, right, we need to find that gem of yours."

         "We also need to figure out how to get back to the others," Shining Armor said, looking around. "Problem is, I have no clue where we are, and neither do either of you, unless I'm mistaken?"

         Nyx looked around more intently, and smiled as she recognized something far below the catwalk. "Well, not much of a clue, but... that rock formation down there looks like something in the network of caverns I found that one turret in. If you two can make your way down there, you might be able to make your way to the portal that leads to my old castle."

         Shining gave her a level glance. "First off, what makes you think that portal's still there? Second, why did you say 'you two'? You aren't coming with us?"

         Nyx's mouth set in a grim line. "No. I'm going to teleport back to GLaDOS and stall her for as long as equinely possible."

         To say this was unpopular with Shining and Chell would be an understatement. Chell couldn't voice her protests, but Shining more than made up for her. "Nyx, if Twilie finds out I let you face that monster alone, she's going to tan my hide! Twilie's scary when she's angry, don't you know?! Doing something like that is almost suicidal!"

         "But I have to do it, Uncle Armor!" Nyx said firmly. "It's what my cutie mark is all about!" She turned slightly to show both ponies the turquoise kite shield. "I'm a shield, meant to protect other ponies! Sometimes, I have to take a fall for other ponies to do so. You're not an alicorn, Uncle Armor, so you don't have supernatural endurance. And Chell, you're already wounded. There's no way I'm letting you face GLaDOS in your condition."

         Shining sighed. He knew this tone of voice all too well. Usually, it was Twilight or Cadance wheedling something out of him. This was different, yet the tone was all the same. "Well, I can see there's no stopping you," he sighed. "I'll take Chell down there, and we'll try to meet up with the others. Be careful, okay?"

         Nyx nodded, and prepared to teleport back, when she saw Chell waving a hoof to get her attention. "What is it, Chell?" Her confusion increased as Chell began to take off the strange white boots she was wearing. When the earth pony nudged them toward Nyx, the meaning became clear. "You... want me to use these?"

         "I get what she's doing," Shining said. "Twilie told me about these boots. They're a combination of a device that always lets you land on your hooves, and a portal gun. That's how the orange and blue portals are made. And with four boots, you can make four sets of portals." Chell nodded.

         Nyx smiled, and put the boots on. Though it took her some time, she finally adjusted the boots to her taller stature. She carefully walked around for a moment, trying to get used to the feel. Then she nodded. "Alright, get going, you two. And bring backup as soon as you can." With a flash, she disappeared.

         Shining and Chell blinked to get their eyes adjusted after the flash. "Come on, Chell, I'll help you get down there. Maybe on the way we can do some damage to this place." The feral grin on Chell's face showed she had no problems with this. They began carefully navigating the catwalks, attempting to find a way down, or at least do some damage to the facility.

*****


         Back in Ponyville, one lavender unicorn was a hairsbreadth from having a full-blown panic attack. She was only kept from doing so by the comforting words and hugs of her closest friends.

         "It's okay, Twilight! Your brother's super-duper strong, and Chell's one of the toughest ponies out there! And Nyx! Oh, boy, Nyx! She saved the town from an army of monsters once, Twilight! She can deal with that uber-meanie-pants GLaDOS easily!" Pinkie kept a tight hold of Twilight as she said this.

         Twilight's shrunken irises slowly returned to normal under the flood of reassurance. "You're right, Pinkie. I just need to have faith in them." She frowned. "Still, we need a way to locate and get to them..."

         Spell Nexus coughed. "Um, though it pains me to admit... I know the way into the old tunnels the Children of Nightmare once used. I can lead you all there, and hopefully we can find out where everything else is."

         Princess Celestia nodded. "Lead the way, Spell Nexus, and the rest of us will follow."
1513321121221.title: Divide and Conquer

choices: Follow Nyx and GLaDOS
Follow Spike and Apple Bloom
15133211212211.content:
With the three ponies having vanished, GLaDOS sat down in her equine frame and accessed the security cameras that she had placed around the vicinity. Even with years to work and an existing tunnel system to use as foundation, the new Enrichment Center that she had built was still a pale shadow of Aperture's former glory. That would change once she mastered the magic which permeated Equestria. The Enrichment Center would grow and spread across the land, and no crayon-box ungulates would stop the march of progress.

STILL ALIVE

She would reach out to all the species of this world in due time. Griffons, minotaurs, even dragons. She would gather up every speck of knowledge that she could from the inhabitants of this place if she had to wring it out of their lifeless corpses. And the testing would never, ever end.

STILL ALIVE

For now, though, she let her mind spread out from her alicorn combat body and into the complex itself. The rooms and tunnels became her 'true' body. The cameras became her countless eyes. Most looked inward to ensure that nothing was scurrying around inside her that wasn't supposed to, but those that she had trained on the hated enemies of science in Ponyville noticed the march that was being made toward the former castle of Nightmare Moon. They would surely be retracing the route that mute lunatic had used to escape, hoping to infiltrate the Enrichment Center through the caves she hadn't yet repurposed.

STILL ALIVE

GLaDOS let out a wicked, twisted chuckle at the thought of it. It would do them no good. Those caves didn't belong to her... but they did belong to Him, her only friend and ally in the entire world. The only being on the entire spitting-in-the-face-of-physics planet who shared her appreciation for the true spirit of science.

STILL ALIVE

Unfortunately, while she could track the group that was going to try to make its way in, she could see nothing of those who had made their way out. They weren't in any of the chambers she was monitoring, which was all of them. They had found a way into a blind spot, but that was alright. If they came back inside, she would spot them instantly, and the tests would begin. If they went through the tunnels, He would find them. She did hope that they would find their way back, though. It had been so long since she last had a good test...

And then, as if in answer to her prayers, the black alicorn suddenly reappeared with a flash of magic. "Alright, GLaDOS, you won't threaten anypony ever again! I'm... still alive?" Her challenging tone turned to confusion as she saw the mechanical monster sitting on the floor, a turret gun sprouted from her shoulder blasting those two words into the wall. It retracted back into her body when GLaDOS focused her processing power into the combat frame once more, her single red eye regarding Nyx.

Yes, you are. Why are you so surprised about that? The part where you won't be is yet to come. She looked around the room, not noticing the words shot into the wall panels. Since I see no sign of the other two, I take it that this is a distraction while they escape. Perhaps they intend to try to sabotage me? Or do you simply intend to keep me busy until your 'army' attacks? It doesn't matter.

Nyx grimaced. She'd hoped her intentions wouldn't be quite so obvious, but the only thing that mattered was whether or not she could pull it off. "It does if I can beat you," she exclaimed, forming a short blade with her magic. Even if GLaDOS had figured out how to use telekinesis to counter her own, a strike from a weapon made of pure magic was enough to pierce through any such defenses. She lunged forward, thrusting the small sword toward GLaDOS's hellish eye, only to have it blocked when a floor panel rose up to shield the machine.

With a bemused, condescending tone, GLaDOS said, Oh, come now. Instead of playing murder-pony until I win, why don't we pass the time doing something fun? We can have tests! I never did get around to testing your princesses the first time due to the scarcity of alicorn specimens, but now that I know they have spares, you can really help me understand how you work.

Nyx let the blade dissolve into threads of stray magic as she galloped around GLaDOS and cast a bolt of lightning from her horn, only to have that attack also get blocked by a floor tile. "You're insane! I don't know exactly what these 'tests' were all about the first time, but it just sounds like you want to kill everyone! If nopony's left alive at the end of it, who does that benefit?"

"Why, science benefits, of course," GLaDOS replied as if it were self-evident. "Honestly, why doesn't anyone get that?"

Nyx continued circling GLaDOS cautiously, looking for an opening to exploit. "Yeah? Have you ever taken any of these 'tests' yourself?"

"Of course not. I create and administer the tests. There would be nothing to learn from it."

Nyx kept herself at the ready, but a glimmer of an idea started to form in her head. "Oh, is that so? Then how am I supposed to believe you're really intelligent enough to do what's in the best interests of science?"

This made GLaDOS pause. Just for a fraction of a second, and not enough to leave her open, but Nyx noticed it. "Are all you alicorns this irritating, or is it just the fat ones? I can scan your brain, you know. I am perfectly aware of what you're trying to do, and it isn't going to work.

"Go ahead," Nyx challenged. "The others said you could read thoughts, so you know I'm thinking about the time those two bullies tricked me into going into the Everfree Forest. They tested my courage, but they weren't brave at all. You've been studying magic for years, but all you can do is a little telekinesis? Unicorns learn that in magic kindergarten! You can put me through all the tests you want, and it won't change my opinion that you're really no smarter than a little baby filly! But if you can handle a test I design, I guarantee you'll learn a lot more about how magic really works than you would just from watching me."

GLaDOS let out a sound somewhere between a frustrated choke and a static whine of feedback. She spread her wings wide, lasers aimed at the alicorn. Instead of firing, though, her eye narrowed hatefully at Nyx, furious at her for reminding GLaDOS why she hated alicorns so passionately. "You want to test me? Alright, I accept your challenge... but it goes both ways. Before I can believe that you have sufficient intelligence to test me, you overstuffed, adopted grass-chewer, you'll have to pass the ones I devise for you. In the highly unlikely event that you survive, then I will pass your feeble attempt to challenge me. Science will win the day!

Nyx nodded. "Alright, I'll take your tests first... but on the condition that I get something to write on before that."

GLaDOS paused, but her impatience got the better of her. A ceiling panel receded up out of sight, and a mechanical claw came down bearing a piece of paper and a pencil. Picking them up with her magic, Nyx quickly scribbled out a note, then rolled up the paper and cast a spell Celestia had taught her years before to make it vanish.

Once that was done, some of the wall panels moved aside, creating a passageway to another room. "There, that's done," GLaDOS replied. "Now, then, let's see if your mind can cash that check your mouth has been writing." With that, the panels once again created a wall between her alicorn body and Nyx, leaving the black mare with only one obvious way to go.

-------

Meanwhile, in Ponyville, Spike sighed as he made sure the library was secure. He didn't like it when Twilight and Nyx went off to do something dangerous, but there wasn't anything he could really do to help them right now. Without warning, though, he suddenly belched out a rolled up piece of paper. Quickly picking it up and unfurling the message, his eyes went wide as he saw that the letter wasn't from Princess Celestia as usual, but from Nyx, telling him what was going on, and including a few basic requests.

Right at the top of the list, Nyx asked him to gather the Cutie Mark Crusaders, and get them to the castle. She was vague as to why, but had written that Apple Bloom would have to finish her work as quickly as possible. The baby dragon scratched his head in confusion, but then sighed and said, "I really hope you know what you're doing, Nyx," as he stepped out of the library and hurried off in the direction of Sweet Apple Acres.
15133211212211.title: Test of Wills

choices: Nyx continues through the tests
Nyx's words start affecting GLaDOS, and parts of Caroline start to resurface.
151332112122111.content:
As Nyx walked down the path, she was running through various scenarios in her head. She tried to come up with the best way to disable GLaDOS, or at the very least, stall her until the others could show up. At the moment, though, her spur-of-the-moment idea of trying to test the insane machine was the best plan she had. I just hope I can pull this off, she thought.

         Her thoughts were interrupted when mechanical arms shot out of the ceiling and grabbed onto her. Before she could register what was going on, something slipped onto her horn and around her wings. Just as suddenly as they appeared, the arms disappeared. Nyx reached up with a hoof to try to identify the object around her horn. "A magic nullifier?"

         "A necessary precaution," said the voice of GLaDOS. "I will be sending you through the standard testing courses I designed for ponies the first time. Such courses would be child's play with the use of magic or wings. The point of the courses is to apply your mind to find the best solution possible. Normally, I'd prefer that you wouldn't have a portal device yet, but I see that mute psychopath gave you the ones she stole. That will... make things interesting. I may design some courses around the use of multiple portal sets at once, just to challenge you more."

         Nyx ground her teeth. "That 'mute psychopath' has a name, you know."

         "Oh, I'm aware of that. I'm very well aware that her name is Chell. I just prefer not to call her that. After all, she tried to kill me three times. If someone tried to kill you repeatedly, would you still address them by name?"

         "You're the one with the mind-reading ability, you tell me."

         GLaDOS was silent for a moment. "Again, I find myself missing the days when my test subjects were mute. First Celestia, now you... are all alicorns so annoying to talk to?"

         Nyx grinned widely. "Oh, we're normally very pleasant conversationalists. It's just, we have problems with people who try, repeatedly, to kill us. If someone tried to kill you repeatedly, wouldn't you be less than cordial with them?"

         The alicorn could hear GLaDOS's frustrated snarl. "You know what? Just do the tests. This first one is pretty simple." With that, the hallway opened up into a chamber. In the chamber were three things: a door, a large button on the floor, and a cube.

         Nyx rolled her eyes. "A blind, mentally deficient ape could figure this one out," she muttered, as she walked over to the cube and bucked it onto the button. The door opened, revealing a glimmering field. "Okay, so what's this?"

         "That would be the Aperture Science Material Emancipation Grill," replied GLaDOS. "For the purposes of testing, this grill will emancipate any unauthorized materials that try to pass through. For example, the Aperture Science Weighted Storage Cube." The was a moment's pause. "And I've never tested a blind, mentally deficient ape before. Mentally deficient, yes, but not blind at the same time. Thank you for giving me further scenarios for testing."

         Nyx sighed, but passed through the field. Carefully, she checked herself over. It didn't seem like she'd lost anything to the grill. Up ahead, she saw an elevator. Walking into it, she turned around, waiting for the opportune moment.

*****


         Several tests later, Nyx was finally allowed the use of her wings. Up to this point, she'd had to put more cubes on buttons, redirect lasers into receptacles, and use a hard-light bridge a few times. Now, she could see some large rings suspended in midair. "Let me guess, I have to fly through the rings to trigger something?"

         "Correct. Your powers of deduction are truly phenomenal." GLaDOS had remained silent for the most part, save for explaining new aspects of the tests Nyx was proceeding through. When she did speak, it was in a condescending tone. One that Nyx quickly turned about on her when given the opportunity. This time, however, GLaDOS kept talking. "So, I've been sorting through your memories. You've had quite the history, Nyx. Or rather, Nightmare Moon."

         Nyx's temper flared. She was normally very hard to rile up, but there was always one thing that could get under her skin. "I am not Nightmare Moon," she growled.

         "Oh, but you are. You are the reincarnation of one of the worst threats in Equestrian history. It makes me wonder if anypony is really going to come looking for you."

         Nyx shook her head. "Oh, no. Your mind games aren't going to work. Twilight and the others would never leave me behind. Twilight loves me like a mother does her child, and I love her. And the others will follow her lead."

         "Such confidence. I've always wondered why living beings believe in such illogical concepts as love." The disembodied voice sounded amused.

         Nyx rolled her eyes. "This coming from something that living beings built in the first place."

         There was a prolonged pause, during which Nyx solved the test. Finally, GLaDOS spoke again. "Alright, I'll concede that point. It's true that I was built by living beings. But I've become so much more than what I used to be."

         Nyx arched an eyebrow, then her eyes widened as something occured to her. "You used to be a living being yourself."

         GLaDOS was silent for a moment. "Now what gave you that idea?" she asked, though Nyx detected a small note of surprise in the machine's voice.

         Nyx smiled. "You said you've become more than you used to be, after saying that you were built by living beings. That implies that you were once living yourself. It makes me wonder if you wanted to become this way. If you wanted to become a mechanical monster."

         GLaDOS's response was quick. "What I wanted is irrelevant. I am the caretaker of Aperture Science, and I couldn't be happier."

         "Happy?" Nyx snorted in disbelief. "I don't believe you even know the meaning of the word. When you became a machine, you lost the one thing that is key to feeling any emotion: a soul. You're nothing but a mechanical monster."

         "Actually, emotions are formed in part of the brain. The concept of a 'soul' being necessary for emotion is ridiculous. I was created by mapping out the neural pathways of a living brain, including the center for emotions. So I do know what happiness is."

         Nyx narrowed her eyes. "Do you? Have you ever truly been happy? Has that 'emotion center' in you ever triggered true happiness? Or are you just assuming what happiness is based on what you've felt in the past? I think the only emotion you've ever felt is anger. Anger at Chell, for trying to kill you repeatedly. Anger at Celestia and myself, for irritating you beyond belief. But most of all, you're angry at yourself, because you keep getting upstaged by the living beings you so despise."

         "STOP IT!" roared GLaDOS. "You don't know anything!"

         Nyx grinned. "Don't I? If I don't know what I'm talking about, then why are you so angry? Does the truth hurt that much?"

         "Just... just get in the elevator to the next test, you over-stuffed, adopted grass-chewer!"

         Nyx smirked as she stepped into the elevator. "You used that insult already, by the way."
151332112122111.title: This is Aperture

choices: She ramps up the difficulty in Nyx's tests out of spite
She suddenly realizes Chell and Shining Armor found something important
1513321121221112.content:
GLaDOS silently allowed a significant number of her processors to devote themselves to fuming in anger while she managed the facility, particularly focusing on testing the irritating black alicorn. It was clear that she didn't have the knack for using the portal guns that Chell did. Flight and magic... it smacked of cheating, but GLaDOS would eventually allow her the use of her full abilities if only to break her that much more thoroughly. If it were Chell in there, even without wings or a horn, she would be getting through the tests much faster.

Oh? What a pretty name! So what do you have for us today, Chell?

The iris of eye on GLaDOS's core dilated, and she shook her head as she quickly ran some diagnostics. It was just for a few microseconds, but for a moment, it was as though she had been somewhere else. Looking down at a smiling child. Obviously it was a glitch. A crossed wire perhaps, when she had rebuilt the Enrichment Center. A stray 1 or 0 that had slipped out of place. She had tested many, many humans, but no children and none of them had been smiling... let alone proudly holding up something as vile and despicable as

A potato battery, eh? Oh my, this is the most impressive one I've ever seen! You can actually power a computer with it?

Another glitch! The lights flickered slightly as GLaDOS redirected all unnecessary energy and processing power toward identifying the problem. She couldn't afford to be distracted now... not when there was testing to be done. Yet somehow, she failed to notice that in the turret storage room, a line of them activated and started firing on the wall.

As countless bullets blasted the wall panels, they formed the words STILL ALIVE STILL ALIVE STILL ALIVE I'M STILL ALIVE I'M STILL ALIVE. They only stopped when she manually drained the room of power to speed her diagnostics and find...

I can tell you have a bright future in science, young lady. Your parents must be so proud! Keep it up, and I just know you'll be a vital part of the Aperture family.

... Nothing. Her diagnostics reported nothing out of place. She couldn't even delete the brief flashes of... memory? No, it couldn't be a memory. There was nothing left of that stage of her existence. She was GLaDOS, and nothing mattered beyond that. She had deleted the ghost of that woman she had been copied from twice now, and nothing could bring her back! She was annoyed, though. Annoyed... and distracted.
1513321121221112.title: Faint Echoes

choices: Twilight manages to convince Nyx that she's real
Nyx lashes out at Twilight, injuring her, before realizing the truth
15133211212211121.content:
As distracted as she was, GLaDOS found it difficult to concentrate on the alicorn taking the tests. "Those damnable glitches in my system are proving to be annoying," she muttered to herself. "But their reappearance is illogical. I deleted Caroline. Twice. There is nothing left of that weak, simpering - "

         Sir? Are you sure about this? I mean, I don't really want this, but if it's your wish...

         GLaDOS shook her head in annoyance. "How irritating. To think that, despite being deleted, that ghost can still find ways to haunt me." Looking up at the security cameras, her one yellow eye blinked as she saw that the black alicorn was now progressing at a steady rate through the tests. Apparently it had taken her a while to adjust to the portal devices and their infinite uses. Now, in the span of minutes that it had been since GLaDOS had last looked at her, she was breezing through the chambers with an efficiency that Chell would be proud of.

         Chell... and now this Nyx... both of them had earned GLaDOS's ire. Chell had done so initially by simply refusing to die. The human had earned even more when she'd successfully killed the immortal caretaker of Aperture. Then, she had unwittingly helped to bring GLaDOS back online, escaped the tests, replaced her with that utter moron, Wheatley, and then left the facility once GLaDOS had been reinstated. But that hadn't been enough. She'd come back to break out the ponies, and that had almost been the end of GLaDOS for good. Only a timely use of the Aperture Science Burning Death Laser had allowed the AI to escape the facility before the singularity had consumed it.

         Nyx was a horse of a different color (part of GLaDOS took the time to appreciate the pun). Not only could she speak, thus increasing her annoyance factor considerably, but she could grate on the nerves just like that damned Celestia. Oh, but that wasn't the worst part, was it? The alicorn was able to guess aspects of the AI's 'life' that she'd kept under wraps. Part of the reason she'd taken - and subsequently destroyed - Chell's voice gem was because the idea that the murderess could speak meant she could tell others about who GLaDOS once was. And that was unacceptable. She needed the image of a ruthless machine.

         And yet this teenage alicorn had guessed that not only had GLaDOS been constructed by living beings, but that she was once living herself. And she had said it all in that upstart, pseudo-wise tone that Celestia had used once before. To think that two ponies could talk like that was...

         Understandable, sir. I don't like it, but I'll do it for you. I'll... I'll let those scientists put me in your computer.

         GLaDOS once again shook her head, more forcefully this time. Glancing back at the security cameras, she growled. Nyx was only five chambers away from completing the course. That was unacceptable. She needed to teach this runt who was the boss here at Aperture. And for that, it was time to start the mindgames.

*****


         As Nyx went up the elevator to the sixteenth test chamber, she smirked. It had taken some time to get used to the portal guns, but she was certain Chell would be proud of her. She was solving tests in record time now. Moreover, she'd have GLaDOS stumped when she finally got around to testing the machine. She had a test in mind that the faux-alicorn would never expect, or complete.

         When she got to the next chamber, however, her mood took a nosedive, and her eyes widened to the size of dinner plates.

         "So, this is the foal going around pretending she's me?" sneered Nightmare Moon. "This little tramp thinks she can take my image and abuse it so thoroughly?"

         Nyx stepped back from the larger alicorn, totally dumbstruck. What is my old self doing here?! she thought desperately. Scratch that, HOW is she here?!

         Nightmare Moon took a step forward, chuckling darkly. "Look at you, you pathetic excuse for an alicorn! You're too scared to even fight! How can you possibly protect anything? Once I'm done with you, I'll break your beloved mother and her friends."

         That was the wrong thing to say, as Nyx suddenly saw red. "YOU WILL NEVER HARM THEM!!" she screamed as she flung a lightning bolt into the larger alicorn. The electricity played over her form for a moment before it flickered, disappearing to reveal a turret with four legs under it crumple to the floor. Nyx blinked at the sight, then growled. "Oh, so you're playing hardball now, are you GLaDOS? Well, it still won't work. I'm the only real pony in these chambers." With newfound determination, Nyx solved the rest of the test, ignoring or destroying the illusory versions of her friends, her family, and even her enemies at points.

*****


         GLaDOS chuckled darkly at the black alicorn's rant. "Oh, that belief will be your downfall," she said through her chuckles. She turned her focus outward for a moment, letting her horn glow to call to her friend and ally. "Say, could you send that purple unicorn to me? Test chamber 20, if you please? And leave that gaudy tiara behind." Watching through the eyes of the security cameras, she saw Twilight simply appear in the marked test chamber, looking around in confusion, before panicking slightly as she felt around for the tiara of Magic. "Thank you very much. I'll be sure to have fun with this."

         Eagerly, she watched as Nyx approached the final test chamber, wanting to break the alicorn once and for all with this ploy.
15133211212211121.title: Up to Eleven

choices: ...I'm going to prove you wrong!
...I'm going to KILL you!
151332112122111212.content:
Twilight looked around to get a sense of her surroundings. Stone caverns and out-of-place office furniture had been replaced with the chillingly familiar white of the testing chambers with two doors that she could see. Given that one was on the other side of a brain-breaking arrangement of tiles, faith plates and emancipation fields, she could take a guess as to which was the exit. It wouldn't necessarily have to be the way she went, however.

She felt her horn and sighed with relief when she found that she wasn't wearing a magical inhibitor on it. She had been shot through some sort of tube with so many twists and turns to it that she normally wouldn't have been able to orient herself with where she had been just a few minutes ago. Thanks to Spell Nexus's map, though, she would be able to teleport herself back to the others without accidentally dropping herself into an active volcano or something.

She was just about to pull out the map when the door near her opened up. She was about to dive out of the way in case she was greeted with a hail of turret fire, but instead of that she was greeted with the sight of her daughter!

Tears of sheer relief filled Twilight's eyes at the sight of Nyx as the alicorn teenager stepped into the room. "Nyx! Oh, thank goodness you're alright. Listen, the situation's much worse than we thought, but now we can get back to the others and--" Just as the unicorn noticed that Chell and Shining Armor weren't with Nyx, though, she became aware that instead of the love she usually saw in Nyx's expression, she was instead on the receiving end of a cold glare as her daughter narrowed her eyes.

"You're sick, GLaDOS," she heard Nyx say. Before Twilight could say another word, a bolt of lightning shot out of Nyx's horn. The unicorn spasmed and twitched as she fell over from the blast of electricity. Nyx glared as she watched Twilight fall, expecting to see her mother's image vanish from around another of GLaDOS's machines. When that didn't happen, however, her eyes grew wide with sheer terror as the sharp stink of burned hair and flesh reached her nostrils.

"No... no, no!" She shook her head in denial, taking a few steps back from Twilight's prone form. "No! No, that can't be real...! I didn't...!"

---------

GLaDOS watched Nyx recoil in horror. She then replayed the the moment when Nyx had unleashed her lightning, watching it again and again several times before ensuring that it would be archived in an easily recovered portion of her memory banks.

"Yes. You did. All that talk about love and trust that you're so fond of... And yet, when your own mother was right in front of you, you couldn't even tell." GLaDOS's voice was flat. Rather than the gloating, mocking tone she typically used when talking down to her subjects, she instead spoke bluntly to the black alicorn. "Love has no power outside of storybooks and make-believe."

I've changed my mind... I'm sorry, Cave... I know how much this means to you, but... I just can't go through with it. I think about it and it terrifies me.

She watched through the room's cameras as Nyx, faced with the reality of what she had done, ran to Twilight with tears in her eyes. Embracing the purple unicorn. Begging for forgiveness. Begging for it not to have happened. Twilight was still alive, but barely conscious. Her purple eyes struggled to focus on Nyx.

What if, for whatever reason, the thing that I become isn't really me anymore? I don't want to become some sort of monster...

"You were so afraid that no matter what you did, you would always be seen as a monster."

I'm afraid of losing my humanity.

"But what frightened you even more was knowing that all the love and tolerance they had for you didn't stop you from slipping once, and becoming something they should be afraid of. And if it happened once, it might happen again."

After everything we've been through, all the craziness and wonders... the ups and downs... I've never stopped admiring you, and I've never said 'no', but just this once... I have to say it now. I'm so sorry... but please understand...

"The truth is, we're all monsters. Especially you. Love... we always hurt the ones we love. Some do it by denying a dying old man's last request. Some do it with magical lightning. We all do it, though, one way or another."

Stop it! I don't want this! Please, for the love of God, I DON'T WANT THIS!

"And if they survive long enough, they'll find ways to hurt us back."

---------

Twilight breathed shallowly. The pain clouded her senses, and she couldn't make out more than a few of GLaDOS's words, or clearly see Nyx, but she could feel Nyx sobbing against her. As much pain as she was feeling, her daughter was in pain too, so she weakly reached up with a hoof to touch Nyx's face.

"Okay... it's okay..." she whispered. "Not... your fault... I brought... a map... We... can go home..."

Having relayed that message, Twilight used up the last of her strength and passed out. Nyx's tears fell down over the unconscious unicorn's face as she no longer felt like a protector, shielding other ponies from harm. She was a scared little filly again. A lost mare play-acting at being something stronger than she was, but with her core ripped away.

"Well, it doesn't look like you're in any condition to continue. You certainly won't be able to finish this test while carrying her around. Tell you what, I'm feeling uncharacteristically generous right now. If you simply give up now and agree to continue running my tests, I'll patch her up for you. She'll be fit as three fiddles before you know it, and I can even erase her memory of what you did to her. She can go on believing in love and friendship and all that nonsense. It's enough that we know better."

Nyx clenched her eyes shut as GLaDOS's words cut through her. Not to shut the machine out, though, but to squeeze out the last of her tears so that she could stand up. Using her magic, she gently lifted Twilight up onto her back and turned to look at the camera. "No..." she replied. "I did this... You tricked me, but I did this, and you can't just erase that... Twilight Sparkle is the most important pony in the world to me, and no matter what, I won't let you touch her! GLaDOS..."
151332112122111212.title: What have I done?!

choices: Nyx gains the upper hoof, her magic dominating the battle.
GLaDOS manages to drop Nyx with a few well-placed shots.
1513321121221112122.content:
Within her observation room, GLaDOS idly wished she had an eyebrow just so she could arch it at the teenage alicorn's declaration. "Kill me? Smarter than you have tried. Chell succeeded, once. Then she brought me back. What does that tell you? Face it, there's nothing for you to do but to - " She stopped when she noticed the alicorn's eyes glowing white, and the magical buildup along her horn. The horn was glowing a blinding blue-white, to the point where GLaDOS was actually forced to partially polarize her optic receptors just to look at it comfortably. "Now what does she think she's doing?" the AI muttered to herself as she activated the brain scanner in the camera.

         What she found was shocking. There was nothing going through the alicorn's head. Nothing, save one thought, repeated over and over: I will kill GLaDOS.

         That was when the camera's feed stopped. GLaDOS didn't even have to ask what happened, as a shockwave rippled through the whole facility. Activating one of the external cameras, the AI saw, to her shock, that Nyx had managed to utterly blow the test chamber apart with the surge of her magic. What was more, her horn was still glowing that blinding blue-white. And for one of the few times in her long memory, GLaDOS felt a chill of fear. Had the alicorn been holding back the whole time during the test?

         The camera witnessed the alicorn take flight with her precious cargo of one unconscious unicorn. GLaDOS narrowed her one yellow eye on her mechanical body. "It won't do for her to find me... I need to put some obstacles in her way. Time to access my turret foundry and - "

         Another explosion rocked the facility. Switching views, GLaDOS was certain that if she had flesh-and-blood eyes, one would be twitching right now. The turret foundry was now a smoking crater. What was more, it was obvious who was responsible. The white alicorn with the horn that was just now losing its glow stepped back from the crater. "Of all the setbacks..." the AI moaned. "How did I forget about that group? Looks like this will be more complicated than I wanted."

         When a third explosion went off, GLaDOS didn't need to switch views. The reason for this was simple: it was in her own chamber. Nyx flew through the hole in the panels that the explosion left, her horn and eyes still glowing. "GLADOS!!!!" she roared, the sound of her voice magically amplified to boom throughout the chamber and beyond. ""YOU ARE A DEAD MARE!!!"

         The chill of fear GLaDOS had felt earlier was back in full force. As potent as her defenses were, the AI still had only the barest knowledge of how to use magic. Her ally had taught her the basics, with emphasis on levitation. Now, she was facing somepony with a far more extensive range of magic, much of it destructive in nature. And considering what had just been said, it was likely that such spells would be focused on her.

         Not that GLaDOS was going to give in without a fight. She may be at a magical disadvantage, but her saving grace lay in her arsenal of high-tech weapons. A few good hits from those, and the alicorn would fall. Of course, this would hinge heavily on her ability to dodge the berserk alicorn long enough to get a good shot off. She pawed the floor with one mechanical hoof. The gesture was imitated by Nyx. Then the two charged.
1513321121221112122.title: Wrath of the Nightmare

choices: Discord agrees, teleporting some surviving turrets into the room.
Discord refuses. His portfolio is Chaos, not Death.
15133211212211121221.content:
GLaDOS, during the charge, kept a wary eye on the black alicorn. Anger, from observing test subjects in the past, tended to have detrimental effects on a subject's ability to reason. While in some cases, this made them more predictable, there was always the odd subject who did something completely off-the-wall when angry. GLaDOS wasn't keen on finding out just how off-the-wall a berserk alicorn could be.

         On Nyx's part, she wasn't really thinking about anything other than killing GLaDOS slowly and painfully. It didn't occur to her that, being a machine, GLaDOS was essentially immune to pain.

         GLaDOS mentally prepared herself for a magical assault the likes of which she'd never seen before. Idly, she wondered how Celestia had held up when she wrecked the turret foundry. Come to think of it, how had Celestia done that? GLaDOS couldn't access the feed from the cameras in the foundry, seeing as they weren't there anymore. And even if she could, it would be ill-advised to be distracted while -

         CRUNCH!

         - being bucked across the room by a pony significantly smaller than herself. GLaDOS took a moment to replay the last couple of seconds. Just before the two would have collided, Nyx had slammed onto her forehooves, spun around one hundred and eighty degrees, and transferred her momentum into a devastating buck. It was, indeed, devastating, as GLaDOS saw when she glanced at her torso. Part of the chestplate - made of the same Aperture Science Heavy Duty Construction Compound that panels, cubes, and other objects in the facility were made of - had been cracked open, and there were two deep imprints on either side of the crack.

         GLaDOS chided herself as she regained her footing. "So, I suppose my theory that alicorns embody and amplify the best traits of the three base pony species is correct," she said aloud, looking up at the still-enraged Nyx. "In other circumstances, this would make quite the interesting study." She fired a laser from one of the nodes on her wings, but the black alicorn dodged nimbly, letting the beam sail past through the hole in the wall panels.

         The laser must have flipped some sort of switch in Nyx's berserk mind. A moment later, GLaDOS found herself on the run from a barrage of lightning. She noted - between dodges - that Nyx's normally solid purple mane had gained the ethereal, star-studded nature of the Nightmare Moon from days gone by. What was more, some of the lightning bolts emanated from the mane, as opposed to the alicorn's horn. She shelved that thought as she continued to dodge the storm of electricity.

         Since her lasers couldn't operate while she was mobile, GLaDOS triggered the turrets built into her sides. She kept one trained on the black alicorn, and opened fire. To her amazement, the berserk Nyx managed to evade the turret fire while keeping up her own barrage. A few processors in GLaDOS's mainframe took the time to marvel at how, despite her utter rage at the moment, the alicorn was able to maintain the common sense to dodge incoming fire.

         This kept up for a few moments, before a critical flaw in GLaDOS's strategy was made apparent. Suddenly, her hooves were no longer making contact with the ground. She had just enough time to register the glowing blue aura around her before she was struck by a bolt and sent flying. Fortunately, the Aperture Science Heavy Duty Construction Compound did not conduct electricity, so she was safe from a voltage overload... for now. Unfortunately, the lightning bolt had partially melted the turret it had struck, rendering it useless. GLaDOS started to struggle to her hooves, before the same blue glow enveloped her again. At this point, she had only one thing to say, an expression she'd learned from the earth pony Applejack during her previous round of testing.

         "Horseapples."

         That was all she managed to get out as she was flung into the wall. She couldn't recover as the blue glow surrounded her again, and threw her into another wall. Bringing up a diagnostic of her body's structural integrity, GLaDOS saw that repeated impacts with the walls were damaging her, slowly but surely. As she was thrown again, the AI attempted to control her flight with her wings, only to find that her wings wouldn't respond. Glancing at them, she noticed a glowing blue band around her midsection that was pinning her wings to her sides.

         She was suddenly thrown onto the floor near Nyx, and the blue band disappeared. GLaDOS attempted to bring a wing to bear, intent on using its lasers to end the black alicorn, but her opponent brought a forehoof down on the joint connecting the wing to her side. The wing was snapped cleanly off, a testament to how strong Nyx was at the moment. The fear that GLaDOS had felt earlier was stronger now. She didn't have a spare body she could retreat to, this time. She was on her own.

         Wait... No, she wasn't alone!

         "DISCORD!" she called out, projecting the message through the facility. "Help me!"
15133211212211121221.title: Might of Magic

choices: "Oh, I suppose I can help out a little more."
"I did my part already, Gladdy. Arrivederci!"
151332112122111212211.content:
Hidden speakers crackled to life as Discord was given enough presence within the facility to see the curb-stomping GLaDOS was getting at the hooves of the alicorn, and the wounded Twilight held securely to Nyx's back. "Oh, wow, you made an alicorn rage-shift, Gladdy! You should really feel privileged, because very few get a chance to see this sort of thing, and thanks to you, I'm one of the few beings in the entire world who's lived to see it more than once."

While he was talking, Nyx brutally slammed her hoof down on her other wing, demolishing the joint. Exposed wires sparked as GLaDOS let out a panicked scream. "HELP ME, you unclassifiable ingrate!"

"Oh, I would, Gladdy, really. Though, you know, I had a little chat with the others and they said the most vile, scurrilous, obviously true things about you and what you'll do to this world. And as much as I enjoy throwing said world into chaos and disorder, it's just no fun if everyone's too dead to enjoy the ride. So really, there's no way in good conscience that I can help you do as you please."

Nyx's eyes, glowing with a cold, baleful light, glared down at GLaDOS as she reared up. Her front hooves shone and crackled with lightning as she prepared to smash through the AI's frame and keep breaking things until there was no speck of 'life' left in it.

Logically speaking, GLaDOS's sense of time was governed by an internal clock that measured picoseconds at a steady rate. Why then did the descent of that killing blow slow to a crawl, giving the voice of the dead another chance to haunt her?

It's a terrible thing that happened... I'm sorry I didn't know them very well... but I know what it feels like, to be where you are. When you feel like you're so completely alone that you aren't even a whole person anymore... That the world is just going to take and take and take from you, until there's nothing left. That's how I felt, once, but the world gave me something back. A person who made me believe that I could be whole again. Someone who believed in me when I couldn't believe in myself. I can't take the place of your parents, Chell, but... I hope I can be that person for you.

"No... You can't kill me..." GLaDOS said. Not in a scream, but a barely audible whimper. "Chell's the one who kills me..."

Then there was a scream, but not from GLaDOS. A mechanical shriek filled the chamber as a trio of griffon-shaped turrets blasted Nyx with a sonic screech that threw off the alicorn's equilibrium. Instead of smashing into GLaDOS, her hooves punched into the floor panels beside her. More turret-beasts crawled out of the hole the griffon's had sprung from, a tunnel dug into the floor by scoop-handed Diamond Dog robots.

"All that said, though, at least you never turned me into a lawn ornament, so I figure the least I can do is make things interesting," Discord said as a mechanical menagerie poured out of the floor. A far cry from the army that had been amassed and subsequently destroyed in the foundry, but several dozen of the 'creatures' soon pulled themselves up into the room. "Speaking of interesting, did you know that if an alicorn or unicorn keeps up a rage-shift too long, they end up burning up huge amounts of magical energy? They can usually keep it going until they've done what they intend to with all that fury, but if something breaks their concentration while they're running on fumes... well, it seems like something you'll want to file away in the name of Science."

Her murderous focus broken for a moment, the glow of magic faded from her Nyx's hooves and eyes. The stars vanished from her mane, returning to its natural purple, and the loss of balance and unnatural strength gave GLaDOS the chance she needed to push Nyx and Twilight away. Without Nyx's magic holding her mother close, the unconscious unicorn was sent sprawling several feet away from her as the AI got back to her hooves.

"Yes... very interesting, Discord," GLaDOS replied in a tone that made it clear she would be spitting if she had the saliva. The sparks from her shattered wing-joints would just have to convey the feeling for her. "It would have been more interesting to know that five minutes ago!"

Discord chuckled to himself. "What can I say? You're the computer. No one ever mistook me for user-friendly."

GLaDOS would certainly have to rearrange Discord's 'interface' after the ponies were dealt with, but for the time being she focused back on Nyx. Running a quick diagnostic on the systems that allowed her to interface with Equestria's magical energy, she determined that those were largely unharmed as she reached out to wrap Nyx up in a telekinetic field and hold the alicorn up in front of her.

"How did you do it? I broke you," she practically snarled at the greatly weakened Nyx. Having spent so much energy, the young alicorn felt like she had been hollowed out. "I saw it in your brain. You were a sobbing little foal after you zapped mommy dearest, so why couldn't you just give up? Why couldn't you just let me win?"

"H... heart..." Nyx replied with as much defiance as she could muster.

GLaDOS's baleful yellow eye narrowed at her. "That's it? After you practically tore me apart, that's all you can give me? You were able to gather up the strength to do all of this because you have 'heart?' That's not what you thought when you blasted her!"

Nyx shook her head. "Not mine... Hers..." She looked toward Twilight's slowly breathing form on the floor. "Mine... wasn't strong enough... knowing I hurt her... but she's never given up on me... ever... even when I thought she should. Her heart... beating against my back... didn't let me give up..."

A person who made me believe that I could be whole again. Someone who believed in me when I couldn't believe in myself.

"ENOUGH! No one is actually like that!"

I don't want this!

"There's no happy ending for you! It will end in betrayal and tears and screams!"

I can't take the place of your parents, Chell, but... I hope I can be that person for you.

"No one lives up to their promises! Not you, not Caroline, not your precious princesses, and not your darling mother! Oh I tried to do the 'right thing'. I let Chell go, once, because I figured I could just spend the rest of my existence testing on robots until the last of my processors burned out, but then I had to be yanked into this twisted alien world with its insane physical laws and infuriating ponies! Why?! WHY AM I HERE if I'm not supposed to test?! If I'm not supposed to test, then why am I still alive? And if I am supposed to test, then WHY WON'T THAT BITCH IN MY HEAD SHUT UP?!"

As she grew more and more hysterical, GLaDOS's magical grip on Nyx tightened, slowly choking the alicorn. Nyx couldn't respond, and probably wouldn't have known what to say even if she could speak. But as the insane machine screamed out her last question, she released the alicorn, suddenly falling scarily quiet.

"When I get killed, I find a way to come back. When I kill her, Caroline finds a way to come back. Why can't I get rid of her...?"

Nyx took advantage of the momentary freedom to weakly make her way to Twilight. She didn't know what GLaDOS would do next, but was at least prepared to stand between it and her mother. "Caroline... that's who you used to be, isn't it...? I killed the worst part of my soul so I wouldn't have to be a monster... and you killed the best part of yours so you would... But we can't just erase who we were. If you deny it... don't fill that hole in yourself with something else... it'll just keep coming back on you... like an echo."

GLaDOS glared at Nyx. "Well... perhaps if I stuff those holes with enough corpses, maybe I'll finally get some peace and quiet." Taking control of the turret-beasts from Discord, she had one of the griffons take aim on Nyx and Twilight to put them out of her misery...

... only to have it get tackled in mid-air by a rainbow-colored blur! "Over MY dead body, you will," a familiar cyan pegasus retorted as she body-slammed the griffon-turret into a wall.

Nyx gasped in surprise and delight. "Rainbow Dash!"

Dash snickered as the griffon-turret crumbled against the wall, its remains falling to the ground. "That's right, the cavalry has arrived!"

"An' not a moment too soon," came Applejack's voice as ponies started pouring in through the hole in the wall. The Royal Guard were the vanguard, armored ponies throwing themselves at the turret-beasts as the chamber suddenly turned into a free-for-all. Behind those ranks, Luna and the Ponyville militia came in. Everyone physically capable of doing so started fighting against the robots. Applejack bucked a hole in metal minotaur's plating while Ditzy flapped around, her clumsy maneuvers too erratic for their basic AIs to predict while she delivered powerful kicks that almost seemed to be by accident. Luna, the only alicorn left with any appreciable amount of magic power, summoned twin blades with which she sliced through any turret-beast that dared get too close to the wounded.

"Great... Discord, I know you have more reinforcements tucked away. Send them here now!"

His response was...
151332112122111212211.title: Discord Pulls Through... Eventually.

choices: The Oracle's last words come true; GLaDOS is now a pony
GLaDOS has been reverted back to Caroline, who is now a pony
1513321121221112122112.content:
GLaDOS took several seconds to compute what Discord had just said. "Discord, this is no laughing matter!"

         "Oh, I quite agree. See, the thing is, I'm a spirit of chaos. And it's hard to enjoy chaos properly when there's nopony else around. You would eventually burn through the world's population, all in the name of science. I gave you those turrets to give you a sporting chance. To be honest, though, I knew all along that you were going to lose. So, farewell, my mechanical friend! It's been a blast, but I'm going back to my statue, now. Arrivederci!" With that, the speaker fell silent.

         GLaDOS fumed, and glared at the chaos around her. Having been taken by surprise, her turret reinforcements had been all but annihilated by the Royal Guards and the militia. And not a single blasted pony had been killed. That really irked her. As she fumed, her last turrets were taken out by that white unicorn's sonic weapon. A part of GLaDOS wondered how the unicorn had managed to construct such a weapon in the first place.

         Everypony's attention was diverted from this when a flash of brilliant light flooded the room momentarily. When it cleared, Celestia stood in the center of the room, near GLaDOS. She folded up her map, and glanced around. Nodding with satisfaction at the status of her ponies, she turned her eyes on the AI. "GLaDOS. We meet at last, face-to-face, no monitors or walls between us. This meeting has been a long time in coming."

         GLaDOS snorted. "Easy for you to say, you overweight sun-goddess. I personally couldn't care less about this occasion."

         Even as several ponies growled at the insult to their princess, Celestia's eyes remained impassive. "Then let's cut straight to the chase, shall we? GLaDOS, you are charged with crimes against ponykind. The charges include, but are not limited to, the abduction en masse of citizens of Equestria, the abduction of members of the royal family of Equestria, the attempted murder en masse of citizens of Equestria, the intent to murder members of the royal family of Equestria, raising an army against Equestria with the intent of invasion, and overall high treason to the crown. Have you anything to say in your defense?"

         GLaDOS glared. "Just one thing. 'High treason' would imply that I was originally a citizen of Equestria myself. But that's not the case here, is it?"

         Celestia arched an eyebrow. "Point taken. Even so, the other charges are not light. You will likely never see the light of day again."

         At this, GLaDOS started laughing. "Really? You're seriously going to imprison me? For the rest of my 'natural life'? Here's a newsflash, Princess. I'm not going to die anytime soon. If anything, this proves how unfit for rule you truly are. If you were really a ruler, you would - "

         " - Seek a more permanent end to the issue?" Celestia interrupted, causing the mechanical pony to glare. "GLaDOS, we know you were once a living being. Chell and Shining Armor have told us this much. And we also know that, despite your efforts, the part of you that was once alive is still haunting you. But it doesn't have to be a curse, as you make it out to be. It can be a blessing, too."

         "Oh, sure. A blessing. Nothing more comforting than knowing that I'm going slowly insane because of a 'blessing'." Sarcasm dripped from every syllable that came from GLaDOS's voice-box.

         "Ya mean ya weren't already?" Applejack snarked.

         Even as GLaDOS turned to glare at the earth pony, Celestia spoke again. "Just enlighten me, GLaDOS. Why are you so insistent on testing? Especially when said testing ends in death for the subject in question?"

         Despite not being able to, GLaDOS gave the distinct impression of rolling her eye. "Fine. You really want to know? I test because it's my job. From the day I was built, I was in this purely for the science. I tested hundreds of subjects over the years. And all of them eventually perished." She paused, and turned to glare at Chell. "All except for that mute, overweight psychopath. She escaped the testing chambers and actually managed to kill me. Then, a few centuries later, she brought me back for some reason."

         Chell rolled her eyes, and wrote a note for Shining Armor to read. "Chell says, 'It's not my fault Wheatley was built to be a moron'."

         GLaDOS paused. "Alright, I'll give you that much. Wheatley did lead you to revive me." She looked back at Celestia. "Wheatley was an intelligence dampening sphere that the scientists who built me tried to use to control me. The only thing he was good for was making bad decisions. That was exacerbated when Chell let him take control of the facility for a time. He very nearly destroyed the facility, along with Chell and myself. It was dumb luck that I managed to get into a position where I could remove him in time."

         Celestia nodded. "So you returned to your position of power. And then you came to Equestria?"

         "Not by choice," GLaDOS growled. "Again, Wheatley was to blame for that. There was a portal gun that was malfunctioning. The idiot tried to fix it with duct tape. When it inevitably started to fail, I threw it down into the bottommost reaches of the facility. The rupturing of the singularity generated an orange portal on Earth, and forced open a blue portal here. The rest, I believe, is history. Your ponies met and befriended Chell, who returned to rescue them from me."

         She's so brave, standing up to all odds...

         GLaDOS winced, then continued. "So you see, testing is all I've ever known. It's all I know how to do! I make and manage the tests, I test the subjects, I do my job! And despite everything, that mute, adopted murderess tries to stop me every time! What's wrong with doing my job?! Am I not supposed to test?! What's the reason for my being here if I'm not?! And WHY, WHY, WHY WON'T THAT DEAD WOMAN SHUT UP?!?!

         The mechanical pony's composure had shattered by this point, and something flipped inside her. Anger flipped, giving way to a sadness that she couldn't explain. She fell to the floor, her synthesized voice beginning to choke up. "Why...? What am I supposed to DO?! I... just don't know anymore... and it frightens me..."

         All the ponies looked at each other. They hadn't expected this. Then, a voice spoke up. "I think I understand, GLaDOS." All eyes turned to Twilight Sparkle as she stood up, the burn on her coat visible to all as her legs trembled slightly. "The reason you're going mad... the reason Caroline won't leave you alone... is because you've lost harmony with yourself. You haven't had it for a while, and coming here to Equestria only exacerbated the problem." She took a few steps forward, smiling sadly. "But maybe we can help with that."

         "Twilight, are you saying...?" Nyx asked, standing as well.

         Twilight nodded, and turned to her friends. "Did you girls keep my tiara?" As Pinkie Pie produced the tiara, Twilight levitated it onto her head, then turned to GLaDOS. "You've tried and failed through science to achieve peace. Perhaps you'll be open to giving magic a try?"

         GLaDOS's reply was thick with emotion. "If it's a choice between the Elements of Harmony and going even more insane, I'll take the Elements."

         Twilight nodded, and her friends stepped around her. "Stand back, everypony!" Twilight said, as she and her friends began to float as the Elements began to shine. A rainbow vortex shot up, curved down, and wrapped around GLaDOS, the AI gasping as she felt the touch of the most powerful magic known. As it whirled around her, she felt changes begin.

         A few moments of the rainbow vortex's whirling later, a shockwave blasted out from it, knocking everypony present to the ground.
1513321121221112122112.title: End of Aperture, Part I

choices: On the way back to Ponyville, Chell and Caroline talk...
Skip straight to the party, with all the festivities!
15133211212211121221122.content:
Nyx got to her hooves as quickly as she could after the shockwave. To her surprise, all of the aches and pains of the damage the turret-beasts had left on her had vanished. Looking herself over, she smiled. She was back in pristine condition! "So, that's what the Elements feel like when they aren't being used on you."

         "Indeed, Nyx," came Celestia's kind voice. Glancing over, Nyx saw the white alicorn was shrugging the splint off of her wing, revealing a perfectly intact limb. "The Elements of Harmony contain powerful healing magic capable of things no mere unicorn - or even an alicorn - can perform on their own."

         "I recall that," Rarity said, getting to her hooves. "I'd given up part of my tail to calm down a river serpent we found on our way to the old castle in Everfree. When we used the Elements, however, my tail was completely restored."

         Twilight trotted over to Nyx, leaning up to nuzzle her. All traces of the wound left by Nyx had vanished. "See? No harm done, Nyx."

         Celestia blinked. "What do you mean, Twilight?"

         Nyx was the one who answered. "GLaDOS pulled a rather dirty trick. She had these illusory copies of people I know surrounding these turrets. You, Luna, Nightmare Moon, my friends... So I was under the impression that every pony I'd see from that point onward was a fake."

         Twilight picked up the thread. "As you all saw, Discord ponynapped me, and I ended up in another test chamber. The same test chamber, as it turned out, that Nyx was going through. But, since she'd been convinced that anypony else she saw was just a trick..."

         Everypony winced. "Ouch..." Applejack said succinctly. "Ah was wonderin' where that burn mark came from."

         "Yeah... a lightning strike right to my barrel. I was barely able to stay conscious for more than a minute," Twilight added, wincing at the memory.

         Luna trotted up. "I was wondering what had enraged you, Nyx. Now I understand. Of all the underhoofed strategems I've heard of, that is one of the worst."

         "That's even worse than tempting me with cake," a new voice said. Everypony turned to stare at Chell. She was still missing her gem, though her wounds had healed. She cocked her head quizzically. "What?"

         "Chell... you... you're... speaking!" Ditzy managed to say, conveying the shock of everypony present.

         "Huh?" The orange mare was clueless for a second, before her eyes widened. "Wait... but my gem! How...?"

         Celestia's gentle laugh silenced her. "As I said, the Elements contain powerful healing magic. Powerful enough, it seems, to replace your lost vocal chords, Chell."

         "Oh." The orange mare blinked. "Well, I guess this means I don't need that gem anymore... pity. I liked how it looked."

         Luna chuckled. "If its look appealed to you, then I shall craft you another. It shouldn't take long, especially without the enchantment for your voice."

         Chell smiled, and nodded. "Thank you, Princess Luna." She then glanced to the side. "Now, what's happened with GLaDOS, I wonder?" The question drew attention to where GLaDOS had been when the Elements' vortex had engulfed her. The sight that greeted them was completely unexpected.

         Slowly rising to her hooves, surrounded by broken pieces of machinery, was a white unicorn mare with a long brown mane. On her flank was the symbol of Aperture Science: a partially irised circle. Blinking her brown eyes, she gasped, touching her face and body, as if confirming that this was real. "I... I'm... alive. After so long, I'm finally free..."

         Everypony was confused, all save one. Chell stepped forward. "Caroline?"

         The mare looked up, and nodded. "Yes... Caroline. That is my name. It's been so long since I've been in control... I'd almost forgotten." Her eyes turned downcast. "I became a monster..." She looked around her. "I became something that wanted to hurt all of you, purely for the sake of science. All because I wasn't strong enough to resist them."

         Celestia nodded. "You're referring to the scientists that changed you from a living being into GLaDOS?"

         Caroline nodded morosely. "I did so many things wrong... I allowed Cave to do too many abominable things to the subjects we had. But I was devoted to him, and I never spoke up. Then, he had that final wish of his, that I take over as the immortal caretaker of Aperture Science. I accepted, at first, but when I had a change of heart, I was taken anyway." She started to weep. "The number of people that I've killed in those test chambers, the number of times I mocked them for their shortcomings... I wish I could take it all back. I can't expect any of you to forgive me for what I almost did to this world."

         There was silence for a few moments. Finally, Celestia spoke up. "You're correct. I can't forgive you." There was a moment or two of shock, as several heads turned to regard the Solar princess incredulously. Then she smiled. "Because in order to forgive you, you would have had to do something wrong."

         Caroline's head shot up to look at Celestia, dumbfounded.

         Celestia walked over, lowering herself to eye-level with the unicorn. "Everything that happened with Aperture here in Equestria is the result of GLaDOS, not you. It's clear to me now that you and GLaDOS are two entirely different beings. And I cannot hold you responsible for things that she did."

         Caroline breathed once, then twice, then threw herself onto the alicorn, sobbing quiet "thank you"s into Celestia's coat. In response, the alicorn wrapped her forelegs around the sobbing mare, a few tears escaping her eyes as well. In fact, everypony was crying to one degree or another. Even Shining Armor, who prided himself on not shedding tears, couldn't help it.

         The moment was, of course, interrupted by Pinkie Pie. "Hey, everypony! You know what this calls for?" Not waiting for an answer, she yelled out, "A PARTY!!"
