151332112122111212211221.content:
Thanks to Spell Nexus's map, along with the... 'shortcuts' that Nyx had created during her berserk rage, the ponies were able to easily find their way out. Before they left the facility, Caroline took them to the chamber where she had been keeping Discord's petrified body. Everyone agreed that while he had been the lesser of two evils in this case, Equestria would be more secure if he was kept somewhere that would prevent him from causing any more mischief. When they opened it up, however, they found nothing but the machinery GLaDOS had connected Discord to in order to give him access to Aperture's systems, along with some tracks leading to a caved-in tunnel.

"There is no doubt that he will find a way to cause trouble in the near future," Celestia said upon finding this, "but we shall simply have to face that when the time comes. For now, let us return to Ponyville."

Soon afterward, they found themselves breathing fresh air again as they stepped out into the open and followed the path they had used to arrive. Along the way, Caroline glanced over at Chell several times before nervously moving over toward her. "Chell, I..."

"It's okay," the orange pony replied, taking a moment to rub her throat as she was still surprised to hear a real voice coming out of her. As she resumed walking, she said, "After everything we've been through, I know who you are. You're the part of her that saved me from getting shot into space. You're the part of her that sacrificed herself to save Equestria the first time." She smiled over at Ditzy and the other ponies. "And I've got too much good in my life to waste any more of it on grudges that have already been settled."

Caroline smiled back at Chell, happy to hear her words, but her voice had a nervous quiver to it as she replied, "I'm glad, but... actually, there were things I needed to tell you about our history... things even GLaDOS didn't know."

Chell raised an eyebrow at that and listened as Caroline explained, "When I was human, your parents worked for Aperture. Not very involved with the testing side of things, you'll probably be happy to know, but they were wonderful researchers. They died in a laboratory fire when you were about the same age that I was when I lost my own parents."

"You knew my parents?" Chell asked, surprised. It made a sort of sense, but she had never really thought about it. She knew so little about her own past that it had been easier to simply ignore that she had any. To hear Caroline talk about them, though, suddenly gave weight to the thought that before she had been turned into a lab rat, there had been people in her life who cared for her. That she actually had a past that began before she woke up in the Enrichment Center's test chambers, and that it was something that had been taken from her instead of simply not existing in the first place.

Caroline nodded. "Not well, but I saw them with you a long time ago, when they would bring you to company functions. They loved you very deeply, right to the end... I want you to know that."

Chell listened but despite having a voice, she was speechless as she tried to process it. Her only clear idea of parental love was from watching Ditzy and Dinky. The thought that such feelings were ever directed toward her was something she could barely imagine.

"After they died... you were all alone. This bright, beautiful child with not a soul in the world to lean on... So I took you in, myself. We were never really like mother and daughter... not like those two," Caroline said, gesturing toward Nyx and Twilight, who were practically leaning against each other as they walked. With a gentle grin with just an edge of sardonic self-admonishment, "But we were happy enough... and you never turned into a bitter, chubby bulimic, so you had that over my childhood."

Chell's jaw dropped. "You what...?! But GLaDOS never... you never..."

Caroline hung her head. "It was one of the very first 'upgrades' they made for me. I didn't find out that you had been 'volunteered' into the Perpetual Testing Initiative until after I was installed into GLaDOS. When I found you on the list of subjects, I refused to continue the program any more. Instead of doing the humane thing, they instead programmed a patch to ensure that GLaDOS would never remember our relationship, and that my sense of empathy would be dulled. I'm pretty sure that was when I started to go insane... when the programming they plugged into me contradicted with my human mind. That's why I want you to know, Chell, I was never a saint... I allowed horrible things to go on under my nose when I was human, and as a machine, I failed you in so many ways, but I need you to know the whole truth... about me... about yourself..."

Chell was silent for about a minute before replying, "That's... that's a lot to take in, Caroline. I don't even know what I'm supposed to think or feel about that. I mean, as far as my memories go, I've lived longer as a pony than I did as a human, and now all of a sudden there's this whole life I had, and you were a part of it?" She shook her head, and Caroline turned away, unable to make eye contact. But then Chell added, "Still... we've got a long time for you to tell me all about it. I guess we can take it slow and figure things out as we go."

Caroline smiled gratefully. "I'd like that..."

Suddenly, a youthful male voice piped up as the group passed near the castle. "Hey! You won!" Spike called out to them as he hurried out of the Children of Nightmare's castle to greet them. "Applebloom's got everything set up, so where's GLaDOS?"

Everyone looked at the baby dragon with confusion, except for Nyx who smacked a hoof against her forehead. "Tartarus! I completely forgot about that!" As everyone's attention focused on her, the alicorn blushed and said, "I, uh... kinda sent a message to Spike and Applebloom to get an obstacle course set up in the castle. It was mostly supposed to be a distraction to buy time, but then Twilight got hurt and-oops, don't worry, Spike, you can see she's completely fine!"

"Like she said, I'm perfectly fine," Twilight assured Spike when he gasped in shock at the admission she had been injured.

"So, yeah, since GLaDOS got dealt with, I, uh... I guess you kinda went to all that trouble for nothing..." Nyx concluded, chuckling nervously.

Applebloom's voice pierced through the crowd, shouting, "THE HAY AH DID!" She stomped out of the castle, her hair a mess and her face showing how exhausted she was. As she glared straight at Nyx, her bloodshot eyes grew wider and more frantic with every exclamation. "Ah spent the last five hours doin' five days' work! All because one o' mah best friends said it was a matter of life an' death ta throw together a near-impossible obstacle course! Well ah threw it together, an' as Celestia an' Luna are mah witness, SOMEPONY IS GONNA RUN IT!" Spotting the actual Celestia and Luna just past Nyx, she let out a squeak and bowed her head. "All due respect, yer majesties..."

The princesses looked at each other and each stifled a giggle. In as dignified a manner as she could, Luna replied, "Well, given that we are your witnesses, we should at least see the fruits of your efforts."

"Indeed," Celestia replied. "In fact, I recall something about there being enough room in this castle to fit everypony in Ponyville. Now that the crisis is over, why don't we invite the town over to celebrate?"

"PARTY IN THE CASTLE," Pinkie squealed, already bouncing toward the entrance.

Vinyl Scratch piped up, saying, "Awww, yeah! I remember this place having some totally plot-kicking acoustics! Didn't get a chance to make use of it last time, with all the monsters around and everything, but I bet if I crank the bass up, they'll hear it all the way in Manehattan!"

Plopping down from exhaustion, Applebloom blinked as ponies started filing in while several pegasi flew off back to Ponyville to let the inhabitants know everything was fine. "Ah... yeah, uh... jus'... remember we're still fixin' some parts up..." she muttered while Nyx gently lifted her up with her magic to help carry her inside where she could rest more comfortably.

Before following the others, Caroline and Chell looked at each other again, and Caroline laughed softly. "Well... to be honest, I am rather curious what it's like to be on the other end of these things."

Chell laughed as well, the two of them following the other ponies inside. "Actually... when there's nothing immediately trying to kill you, they're actually kind of fun. I think I might just see how 'impossible' it really is."

"Knowing you, the biggest challenge will be not embarassing everypony else too much."

While those two walked inside, Spell Nexus followed behind, only to suddenly find himself flanked on either side by Applejack and Rainbow Dash. "Well, somebody moves fast," the pegasus teased with a smirk.

Caught by surprise, Nexus blinked and stammered, "Wh-what? I don't know what you're talking about."

"Suuuure," Applejack drawled. "And y'all weren't checkin' out miss Caroline the whole walk here. Ya know she ain't been a pony more'n an hour, right?"

Spell Nexus flushed deeply. "N-no, I've just never seen the Elements of Harmony at work before! Her existence is fascinating... from a... magical studies perspective!"

The two mares both snickered at that, only causing the blue unicorn to turn even redder as they joined the others inside.

1513321121221112122112211.content:
Deep beneath the earth, in rough tunnels that were busily being reinforced by dog-bots, a single turret hovered along and stopped at a sharp curve. Slowly peering around the corner, it looked out into an open chamber where a stone statue was attached to a complex machine that walked around the room on spider-like legs. It stood in front of five personality cores, the 'eye' of each one a different color.

"The rainbow has given voice to the voiceless and flesh to the fleshless," the Oracle muttered quietly. "Now Chaos will give voice and flesh to a new rainbow."

Inside the chamber, Discord chuckled to himself as he checked each personality core, using a pair of pincer-like appendages attached to the construct that allowed him mobility. When he spoke, it was through a speaker attached to the top of his petrified head. "Ahh, Gladdy, you wouldn't have been much fun in the long run, but you gave me such wonderful ingredients for my stew. Selfishness, Treachery, Cruelty, Deception and Spite... You had it all, baby, but were just missing that last special spice that really brings a dish together."

One of the appendages changed itself, exposing a cutting laser which he used to start burning a pentagram into the stone floor. Once it was completed, he began placing a core at each point. "If you want to really make an impression, you need real magic, not the kindergarten schtick I taught you. And real magic? Well..." A panel opened in the base of his walker, and he reached in to pull out a vial of dark red liquid. "... that's in the blood."

As the sonic scream of the griffon-bots disoriented Nyx, pulling her out of her rage-shift, a floor panel moved aside slightly while GLaDOS was too terrified of her opponent to notice. A thin tube with a needle injected itself into the alicorn's leg, drawing out a few ounces of blood before the AI threw Nyx and Twilight off of her.

"Of course, I'll have to be sure to thank that Spell Nexus as well," Discord continued to monologue. "If he hadn't created Nyx, I would probably have never gotten the inspiration for this plan. Maybe I should even thank those fillies who put me in this state? After all, if they hadn't trapped me in stone, I wouldn't have been able to sit down long enough to work out the details!" His free 'arm' scratched his stone chin before he concluded, "Then again, if they hadn't done that, this wouldn't even be necessary in the first place. Oh well! Let's get this show on the road!"

While the turret watched, Discord began his ritual. He sprinkled just a few drops of Nyx's blood onto each of the personality cores while he summoned the magical energies of chaos, infusing the power into the cores. Before his eyes, the metal spheres began to change as they absorbed the blood and magic. First, their very structure changed from metal to organic. Balls of flesh which started to bulge and re-shape themselves, growing distinct features. As they sprouted hair and mains, legs and hooves, heads and faces, they cried out as they were each reborn in the form of five mares of various types.

The ritual was not over yet, however. "A beautiful five-course meal," Discord crowed as he saw the life that he had given form. "But still, my favorite part... is the dessert!" With that, his mechanical arm broke off one of his own stone claws. He then threw it along with the vial with the remaining sample of Nyx's blood into the center of the pentagram, where the magics giving form to his creations converged.

There was a bright flash as everything gathered together in that central point, a light of chaotically charged magic that converged, roiling and twisting in on itself before suddenly sending out a shockwave that rocked Discord back! When he got his balance back, however, he looked into the pentagram and rubbed his pincers together with glee at the sight in front of him.

Between the five mares, there was a teenaged alicorn stallion. His hair and mane were both a bright golden color that shone even in the depths of the cave where he was born. On his flank was a cutie mark of a black sword superimposed over a sun. While the mares around him were getting their bearings, he opened his eyes, and Discord chuckled at the sight of dragon-like pupils on deep red irises.

It was the stallion who said the first words to Discord, looking up at the statue. "Who... am I...?" he asked.

"You, my boy... all of you, are now my very favorite ponies in the entire world. The Elements of Discord," Discord replied gleefully. "Happy birthday to you all! And for your very first birthday present, I'll be giving you names."

Pointing at the lovely purple earth pony who had been the core of Selfishness, he said, "You'll be... Treasure."

To the wirey, dull grey pegasus who had been the core of Treachery, he said, "And you'll be Thunderbumper."

To the powerfully-built red unicorn who had been the core of Cruelty, he said, "You'll be Crimson Crash."

To the charming looking blue pegasus with a silver mane who had been the core of Deception, he said, "You'll be Silvertongue,"

To the sneering black earth pony who had been the core of Spite, he said, "And you'll be Snapper."

Turning his attention back to the stallion, he tapped his pincers together in thought. "As for you, last but certainly not least... hmmm... a-ha! Your name, son, is Sol Etude. Now, let's all have a big birthday celebration!"

The Oracle slowly, quietly pulled away and started hovering as quickly as it could in the opposite direction. As it did so, it muttered, "The dark rainbow will spring up from the earth to sunder harmony! And when the blade of the sun hangs overhead, the night will fall... forever..."

Chell grinned as she watched another contender go through the obstacle course, getting caught half-way through. She chuckled as the hapless stallion pulled himself out of the mud pit, grumbling slightly. "Wow, it's pretty fun to be watching one of these, rather than running through it!"

         Next to her, Caroline grumbled a bit, but her smile betrayed her true feelings. She was currently rubbing lotion on some rope burns she'd acquired when she'd gotten tangled in a rope bridge part of the 'test'. "It was certainly... interesting. I probably won't be doing it again anytime soon, though."

         "Nor shall I," Luna said from nearby, wincing as her wing was tended to by Nurse Redheart. She'd gone through the course on a whim, and had done better than anypony else thus far. However, near the end, she'd overbalanced on a narrow bridge and fallen. She'd managed to slow herself down enough so that when she crashed, she hadn't broken anything, although her left wing had been sprained. Nearby, Celestia was fussing over her sister, upset that Luna had managed to hurt herself at what was supposed to be a party.

         "Well, you're in luck, your Highness," Redheart said. "It's just a Grade I sprain of the elbow joint. Given the natural healing of an alicorn, I wager you'll be fine in a day or so. Still, to be safe, I recommend you avoid flying for at least three days."

         Luna opened her mouth to protest, but was silenced as Celestia replied for her. "Thank you, Nurse Redheart. It's fortunate you were on hoof to tend to her, as well as other injuries."

         Nearby, Pinkie Pie was scowling. "A party's no fun if ponies are getting hurt!" She leveled a glare at Applebloom. "Take that course apart, before anypony else ends up hurt!"

         Applebloom felt like whimpering. Part of it was because she'd heard stories of what Pinkie was like when she was angry. The other part was that, after all the effort it had taken to build the course, she wasn't about to start tearing it down in the same day. She was exhausted.

         Fortunately, Chell stood up. "At least let me have a go at it before it's dismantled," she said. When Pinkie opened her mouth to protest, Chell gave her a look. "No use arguing with me, Pinkie." The party pony sighed, and relented, as Chell went to the start of the course.

*****


         Ten minutes later, and Chell had made it through the whole course, almost without pause. She panted a little as she got down from the trampoline at the bottom of the last obstacle. "Whew! That was a bit harder than I'd thought it would be."

         Everypony present stared at her. Everypony except Caroline, who was laughing her flank off. "I thought I told you not to show everypony up!" she guffawed.

         Chell shrugged. "When you got it, you got it," she said, retaking her place by Caroline.

         Nyx shook her head, and stepped forward. "Anypony else want to give it a try?" As one, everypony took a step away from the course. "No? Well, I'll get this packed up, don't worry, Applebloom." With that, the midnight alicorn began dismantling the course with her magic.

         Chell and Caroline chuckled as Twilight stepped in to help her daughter. "Ah, that was a good course! A lot more intensive than the ones I'm used to." Caroline flinched briefly, but Chell noticed. "Oh, stop worrying about it! Celestia was right, it wasn't really you doing all those things."

         Caroline sighed. "That doesn't stop me from feeling responsible..." She shook her head and smiled. "On the plus side, I now know what that one psychologist meant when he said you were in the 99th percentile when it came to tenacity."

         Chell blinked, not sure whether the comment was a compliment or an insult.

*****


         Celestia had joined Twilight and Nyx in dismantling the obstacle course. They went about it with casual conversation for a while, until Twilight broached a subject that the two alicorns had been avoiding thinking about. "What do you think Discord's up to?"

         Celestia frowned. "Whatever it is, it won't be good for Equestria. We'll have to be ready for anything, be it cotton candy clouds or worse."

         Nyx nodded, then gasped as her horn sparked briefly, disrupting her magic flow for a second. She restarted it a moment later, rubbing her forehead around the base. "Yeesh, that was weird. I feel like something's straining my power."

         "Well, you did have a fairly lengthy rage-shift," Twilight said, coming over to scan her daughter. "And you used a ton of magic in the process. It only makes sense that you'd be experiencing some strain on your magic."

         Celestia frowned. "No, that's not it. The Elements' healing properties should have restored her mana levels to normal. Something else must be at work, here."

         All three pondered that for a moment, before Nyx yawned. "Eh, I'll worry about it later. Between the tests, the battle, and the party, I'm wiped."

         Twilight chuckled. "Yeah, we've had a busy day, haven't we?" She turned to Celestia. "Princess, I think Nyx, Spike, and I will retire to the library. You know where to find us if we're needed." With that, mother and daughter left the castle, stopping briefly to pick up Spike and bid farewell to a slightly disappointed, though understanding, Pinkie.

"Different? Whatever do you mean?"

"It doesn't matter at the moment, Rarity, but one thing that does matter is this: I am not your sister. No, no, don't say anything. I'm sorry for being so blunt, but for the last few Jumps, I seem to be arriving only just in time for events that are important, where things could have gone completely wrong." Summoning her notebook as if it were an afterthought, she held it for Rarity to see. "Here's my four acceptance letters into Celestia's School for Gifted Unicorns, my two acceptance letters into the Platinum University of Unicornia, and my acceptance letter into Nightmare Moon's Academy for the Magically Proficient. Judging by your age, and the state this room is in, I'd think that I've come at a moment in time somewhere in this me's marehood?"

Still shocked, it took Rarity a second to say "Y-yes..."

Sweetie Belle looked at her flank, drawing Rarity's gaze as well. "Still blank. I knew it. It doesn't matter what talent the me in a universe has gotten, I will not bear their Mark. I am not your sister, but I have to borrow her for a little bit. Now," Sweetie's eyes softened as she let her notebook disappear, and the dresser softly slid shut. "How are you, Rarity? What's life been like?"

Nyx looked up from the book she'd been reading at the knock on the door. She glanced at the clock. "It's almost three in the morning... who could be up this early?" She got up and magically opened the door, her mouth wide in an unladylike yawn.

"Woah, you really do look like Nightmare Moon."

Nyx growled at the name. "I do not like being called Nigh... Sweetie Belle? What're you doing back in Ponyville? And why are you here, this late at night? Gosh, is everything okay?"

"Yes, yes, everything's fine. Also, I'm not your Sweetie Belle."

Nyx tensed for a second, then relaxed. The display was not lost on Sweetie, however. "Not going to attack me, or accuse me of being a Yerk or Changeling? That's new."

"You would not have told me you were not my friend if you were a Changeling, and... Yerk?"

"Doesn't matter. Not in this timeline." Sweetie paused for a second. "Well, yet, anyways. They might show up, if Earth exists in this universe."

Nyx jumped on the information. "You're from a different universe? Wow, that's pretty neat! Chell and I had talked a little during the party tonight about her old universe. She used to be a human." Nyx giggled. "The name's pretty funny."

Sweetie Belle just nodded, unfazed. "So, Nyx, I need to know of anything out of place has happened recently, or if any events are coming up soon."

"Well, Chell, Mom, Uncle Armor, the Princesses, and I all worked together to defeat GLaDOS, a robot from Chell's past, and stop her from global genocide."

Sweetie Belle brought her notebook back into existence, a quill appearing by her side as she scribbled down some notes. "Anything else of note?"

Nyx nodded, thinking back on what her mom and the other Elements had had happen to them. "Yeah, GLaDOS had taken Discord's statue and given him access to the facility she ran, and in turn, he taught her magic. She'd only gotten basic levitation, but she was proficient. Nothing I or you couldn't do, probably."

Sweetie nodded again, this time while biting her lip. "Did you manage to recover Discord's statue, then?"

Nyx shook her head.

"I was afraid of that. Well, I need the help of my friends, any friends I can get. Since Scootaloo isn't here, that also means you, so... Hi! I'm Sweetie Belle, and I'm looking for pieces of my teacher, Twilight Sparkle!"

"Um... I'm Nyx, brought to life with blood magic meant to resurrect Nightmare Moon, and my adoptive mother is Twilight Sparkle."

"Great, now that introductions are done with, we need to get Apple Bloom and figure out what happened to Discord. Hopefully, we're not too late."

Silvertongue left the poor stallion hung from the carriage's harness, his eyes twin, sickly-looking hearts, twisting and turning. "Thank you for the ride, good sir," she said, her voice wafting and echoing like the rasping of leaves brushing against each other on an autumn breeze. "It's been a pleasuring trip."

"Snrk- yeah, everything's pleasurable with you around, Silver! You use that tongue for more than just talking- you can't deny it!"

"Oh, come now, Snapper, I know you don;t mean that. You enjoyed the ride as much as I did."

"Whatever, bi-"

"We are here." Thunderbumper silenced the two bickering mares with a quick smack to the face for each. "Now shut up. Crimson Crash, let the pony stay as is. you can strangle some of the guards if you need to." The crimson unicorn snorted angrily.

"Well now, who's fault is it that we're here, Thunderthighs? It's your fault Treasure's in this stupid dungeon! I wanted to have a nice day of bucking with people's lives, but nooooo, I gotta come out here to bust a stupid ground-beater from being punished!" Snapper put on a mock-scared look. "Oh no, the big bad guard's gonna hit me with the riding crop!" She snorted derisively. "You shoulda sent Silver in instead, she'd have gotten the guards to beat themselves."

Thunderbumper pulled up short before the small guard tower. "Stop."

She knocked on the door. "Treasure?"

The door slammed open and a mare clutching ten sheathed weapons to her chest pointed an eleventh one at Thunder threateningly. "They're MIIIIIINNNNE!!!"

Thunderbumper looked to Crash. "Go ahead and kill any guards. Treasure's already looted the place, it seems."

Snapper snickered again. "Wow, Treasure. You're almost as bad as Silver. You've been grabbing all those guards by the shaft, hmm?"

15133211212211121221122111212221.content:
Cerulean's hooves pounded the ground , Whitetail Woods flying past on all sides as he tried to get back home. He needed to warn Twilight! That freak with the... alluring... voice had mesmerized him. There wasn't much he knew, but he definitely needed to warn his wife. Maybe send their daughter off to Canterlot or something. It didn't matter! He also needed to make sure Big Mac was alright. He'd thought he'd seen his sister Crimson there...

~~~

Sweetie and Nyx were on their way to Sweet Apple Acres to get Apple Bloom, when Sweetie suddenly looked up. "Nyx, there's something wrong with this world, something bigger than just the two of us, or even Ponyville."

"What do you mean, Sweetie Belle?"

"Something's not right. Something sinister is in the air, the feeling of chaotic magic. Discord's done something. We just need to stop it before he can continue."

Nyx nodded, and looked forward again. The farmhouse was only a few minute's walk from here. "Want me to go up to her window and get her from there?"

Sweetie Belle studied Nyx, and then shrugged. "Sure, that'll keep the rest of the family asleep. Once you do that, we can teleport back to the Library."

"You can teleport, too?"

"Yes, I can teleport! Why is everypony always so skeptical about the spells I can do?"

"Sorry, but our Sweetie can only make music."

"Well, go get Apple Bloom. I'll wait here."

Nyx nodded and flew off.

~~~

Cerulean gasped as he sat down, trying to catch his breath. How long had he been running? Was he almost home? He briefly wished he could teleport, but instead just got back to his hooves. Casting a small snow spell, he collected flecks of the frozen water on his tongue until he had a sizable gulp. Sated for the moment, he started running, not wanting anypony who might be chasing him to catch him sitting still. "Where are you, Bluey~?" She was catching up. He needed to get out of here. No time! "Gotcha!"

With a startled yelp, Cerulean let loose some of his innate magic, the mare leaping at him freezing in midair, before dropping to the ground with a thump. He breathed a sigh of relief. "Whew, now let's see who you really are..." He looked at the red unicorn, smiling happily a bit when he realized it wasn't his sister.

He set off again. He might have bought himself some time, but it was still running out.

~~~

Sweetie looked at her new friends. "Time is not the most important factor here. The more important factor is space. We can't waste time, that's true, but the very fabric of reality in this world is unraveling. The unraveling of reality's already happened, but it won't happen until later. We can't stop it, because it's already happened, so time's not important. What we can do is save 'space'. We need to stop the advancement of the... You're not getting this at all, are you?"

Nyx shrugged, and Apple Bloom shook her head. Sweetie Belle groaned into her hoof. "Fine, let me explain a bit better. Think of the multiverse as an onion, okay?" An onion appeared next to Sweetie, floating innocently by her side. "Now, each layer of the onion is the same, but different. For example, let's take this knife, and cut into the onion," Doing just as she described, she stuck the knife halfway into the vegetable. "Now, when I peel away all the layers, only some of them share the cut, while others don't have the cut at all.

"That cut represents a choice, or a divide. Let's say... Nightmare Moon." Nyx glared, and Sweetie glared right back. "On the ones that are cut, Nightmare Moon was defeated, and Twilight and her friends, and the Cutie Mark Crusaders lived as they have in my own timeline, as well as your timeline. Happily.

The ones without the cut are where Nightmare Moon defeated the Elements, one way or another. Maybe Twilight didn't pass the entrance exam, and instead went on to work in the Royal Guard, alongside her brother. Maybe Pinkie Pie was inside her house when the Rainboom went off the first time, and she didn't learn how to smile. Maybe Rarity was bullied at school, and therefore was more angry than Generous. It doesn't matter. Whatever affected the outcome, Night reigns supreme in one form or another." Sweetie Belle rolls her eyes. "Like the time everything with the Elements went right, but it turned out Nightmare Moon wasn't evil, just a prankster." Sweetie muttered to herself, "I still can't believe she glued me to the ceiling!"

Nyx and Apple Bloom just stared at her incredulously. "... Glued," Nyx said, "to the ceiling?"

"Yes, right. Anyways, there's something wrong in your universe, that's affecting other universes nearby. Where the knife signifying a change should only have pierced your layer, it is spilling out into other worlds around it, and I think it has to do with Discord."

Apple Bloom was about to say something when the door burst open, and a stallion shouted. "TWILIGHT!"

~~~

Cerulean blinked. Sweetie and Apple Bloom looked... older? And, the mare sitting next to them was... "Nigh... Nigh... Nugh," He fell over in a daze, exhaustion and bewilderment drowning out everything else. His vision was blurry, and his hearing wasn't that much better.

"...ng on?"

"That stal... ju... urst in!"

He heard something that chilled his heart, his fading hearing catching one phrase in its entirety, as if to be cruel. Twilight asked, "Who is he?" Then he heard no more.

~~~

Twilight replaced a cool washcloth with a warm one, covering the strange stallion's forehead. "He's terribly cold, girls. I don't know what to do."

Sweetie Belle looked at him, her eyes flashing a little in the candlelight. "You need to warm him, then. He's not just cold in body. You can tell. Listen to his heart's song." Sweetie walked slowly up to the inert unicorn, placing her horn on his chest, before pulsing her magic. A sad, haunting melody poured forth, causing Twilight's hackles to rise.

"That..." Twilight gasped. "I can see... myself. And, and him. Why... How..?"

"Twilight," Sweetie Belle said as she canceled her magic, the haunting melody fading away. "You've interacted with alternate universes before. You're obviously special to him in the universe he's from, and if he thinks this is still his universe, than it's possible he's gone into shock after hearing that you didn't know who he was."

Twilight's ears flattened against her head. "So... I have to... to act like his world's Twilight to get him to wake up?" She jumped a bit when the cloth she was pulling off his forehead suddenly snapped. "The cloth, it's frozen stiff." She put a hoof on the stallion's body, gasping when she felt how low his temperature was. "Emotional Magic... I've never seen anypony use it before..." She picked up the stallion and started up the stairs. "I'm going to do something that I'll probably be embarrassed about later, girls. I..." She blushed a little, the wording sounding dirtier than what she wanted to say.

"You're going to lay with him in bed, to help give him body heat." Sweetie Belle smiled to Twilight, winking. "I always knew you were smart!"

Twilight nodded in thanks, and went back to her room.

~~~

"Cold... so cold... Why is this world so cruel to me? This can't possibly be my world... This is a nightmare."

A warm feeling started to grow within the swirling blizzard that covered Cerulean's heart, and the small purple flame within was growing brighter with each passing second.

It didn't grow into the inferno that signified his wife's love, but it was filled with worry and regret, both things that instead of making him feel worse, gave him the feeling he was about to be chastised. "This is not your world, but it is also not a nightmare," Twilight's voice spoke from beyond the swirling wall of snow.

"Then what mockery am I in? What's happened to my wife? You are her but not her. Are you a Changeling?"

"No, I am Twilight Sparkle, Librarian at the Books and Branches in Ponyville, Element of Magic, and Faithful Student of Princess Celestia." The voice, paused, as if hesitating. "Who are you?"

"I am... Cerulean. Husband to Twilight Sparkle. I'm also the Seventh Element."

"Seventh- There's only Six Elements!"

"Maybe, maybe not. My cutie mark is different than it had been when I first got it."

Twilight blinked. "I'll just have to believe you on that one. Now, you need to wake up. Stop moping. I'm sorry that I'm not your Twilight, but you can't just mope around here." Twilight's eyelids dropped, half lidded. "Besides, how would your Twilight react to your being in bed with another mare?"

Cerulean visibly seized up, and Twilight's laugh tingled as the snow melted away, the waking world coming into focus.

It had been almost three hours since Twilight had taken the stallion upstairs, to get him warm, and Sweetie Belle, Nyx, and Apple Bloom had spent that time discussing some of Sweetie's... 'lighter' adventures. "... And then Scootaloo got the idea to use cling wrap on the toilet." The three friends howled with laughter.

"Well, it seems that there are differences," the stallion's voice made the three look up.

"Ah, good, you're up."

"Yes, Sweetie Belle, I'm awake. Hello, all, my name is Cerulean."

Before anything else could be said, there was a knock at the door.

"Apple Bloom, are y'all in there?!" The knock sounded again, louder this time.

"Apple Bloom, if y'all're in there, open this here door!" Sweetie Belle was the first to react, pulling Cerulean into the kitchen and placing a one-way sound-dampening enchantment on it.

Apple Bloom gulped, before stuttering. "C-comin', Sis!"

She walked up to the door, shaking with obvious fright. Her sister looked down at her when the door opened, a frown of worry on her face that softened as she saw the fear of punishment on her younger sister's face. "Apple Bloom, why'd you run off like that? When Ah got up and saw you weren't in your room, Ah was right scared."

Applejack let a stern, but less angry look onto her face. "Now, Ah ain't gonna be all mean or nothin', but ya could've at least left a note!"

Apple Bloom mumbled out an apology, and AJ nodded tiredly. "A'ight. If you two are just hanging out after all the crazy with GLaDOS, I understand. Jus' lave a note fer us next time. I'll be goin', then. Bye!"

Apple Bloom sighed in relief as her elder sister trotted away. "Phew, Ah thought Ah was about ta get mah ears chewed off."

Sweetie Belle and Cerulean were just trotting back in when Rainbow Dash suddenly came flying through the window, slamming into Cerulean which, for some funny reason, created a puff of snow that blanketed the main foyer. "Twilight? Nyx!" The spectral-maned mare leapt* onto the young Alicorn, her eyes bugging out in a wild panic. "You gotta help me!"

"Wu-what's wrong, Dash?"

"There's a strange stallion in my bed! S-some sort of pervert!" Dash shuddered, getting off of Nyx and rubbing her forelegs with her hooves. "He... he called me Dashie and nibbled on my ear. The worst part, though, was that... He felt so... I dunno. right. Like... Like that's what was supposed to happen." Dash fell to the floor, cradling her head in her hooves. "I'm so confused!"

Cerulean created a small cloud of snow that shrouded Dash for a second, before he spoke. "Rainbow Dash, what did this Stallion look like? Dark grey coat, grey mane with a yellow streak?"

"I..." Dash hesitated. "Maybe?"

Cerulean smiled calmly. "Okay, then that's just Storm. Don't worry about him. He's your coltfriend." Cerulean took in Dash's flabbergasted appearance and amended his statement. "Well, in a different universe, or world, or something. Sweetie Belle could explain it better, I think." Cerulean and Dash turned to look at Sweetie Belle, who just frowned.

"I don;t think we have enough time to waste on explanations at the moment, Cerulean. Especially after having seen what you did after being rejected through ignorance by Twilight. It sounds like Dash here literally ran away from him. He's probably confused, if not downright horrified like you were."

"Yes, well... He'd probably either go back to Quakehoof's home- his dad- and ask either him or his mother for advice, or go looking for you- which would potentially lead him to the same place, seeing as you guys are always over there, pulling pranks on his younger sister."

"His sister?"

"Yes; Scootaloo."

Dash's eyes widened. "But Scootaloo..."

~~~

"... An orphanage..." Storm looked up at the building before him, where his parents' home used to be. The sign out front said in large, looping letters: 'Ponyville's home for the Young'. It was both great and terrible. Great, because that meant that a lot of ponies who didn't have parents could still find happiness, like Scoots' friend, Pipsqueak. But it was terrible, because the inscription at the bottom said it was in memory of Quakehoof and Flying Grace. His parents.

Storm shuddered, wiping at his eyes and hoping that the three story building would suddenly become the one story apartment that he remembered it to be. "D-dammit," he choked out. "What happened? What happened, dammit?!"

"Your parents are dead, Storm."

"Cerulean?" Storm looked up. Cerulean, Sweetie Belle, an Alicorn, Apple Bloom, and Rainbow Dash all were there, staring him. He ducked his head down in shame and remorse. "... How? How are they dead? They were alive just last night. I flew over their house- right here- after taking over Dashie's shift. When I got back to our house, I got back into our bed and snuggled up with her. Then, then this morning, she's kicking me out, and... and..."

"Rainbow Dash?" Storm looked up to see an unfamiliar mare walking forward. "You of all ponies would know that Scootaloo's not holed up in this old nag's care anymore, oh no... She moved on to... Oh, wherever it was, to be a stuntmare." The older mare tittered, smiling proudly. "What I would do to have had foals of my own, et alone as brave as her."

Storm looked up at her, working his mouth for a second. "... What happened?"

"Oh, I'm sorry dearie, I didn't see you there! What happened, you say?"

"Yes... To Scootaloo's parents?"

The old mare tisked sadly, shaking her head. "It was a shame, what happened. Burglary, it looked like. Caught Quakehoof asleep, apparently, because otherwise the town would have known something was amiss. No, Flying Grace put up quite the fight, though. There was a trail of blood that lead outside, and disappeared, so either a unicorn or pegasus. Roseluck and Lily were the first to see what had happened, and it took all of Rose's willpower to not faint immediately at the sight, and carry young Scootaloo all the way to the hospital. She was less than a month old, at that point."

Storm's eyes widened. "But... Mom came back before she even showed signs of pregnancy. Back to Cloudspire. Scoots had been born there, I helped raised her, ever since... I was there for her for years, until... Until that storm." Storm hung his head, his whole body quivering with painful shame and anger.

"Who killed them?"

"I... I'm sorry?"

"Who killed my parents? Quakehoof and Flying Grace? Who. Killed. Them?" His voice was haggard and demonic, like boiling lava pouring forth from the mouths of Tartarus itself.

"N-nopony knows! Proud Skies gave some speech up in Cloudspire about how disheartening it was to hear about his wife's infidelity, and-"

The rage was almost visibly rising from Storm's coat, his eyes flickering with an inner fire. "That... Bastard. Did he ever once mourned her loss? Or just her infidelity?"

"I... I can't recall..."

"How long until he had a new wife?"

"M-maybe a month? Two? I don't recall, it was a long time ago, and..."

"That. BUCKING. BASTARD killed my parents!"

Dash looked at him quizzically. "How d'you know that he did?"

"Because, he killed my grandfather as well. In... In our world. Mine and Cerulean's. Him killing my grandfather was what lead me to Ponyville, and meeting my real father. And... and you."

"Him killing my Grandfather gave me and my family such anguish, and yet more hope. Heh, Mom and Dad had another kid, right around the same time you and I were just starting to get intimate. Hope's almost a year old, and... Good Goddesses, you're probably due any month, now. If I'm not there to help you... I don't think I could ever go back. Especially since it would've been the second time I'd been... displaced... from my sis. I couldn't do that, to anypony in my family."

Storm looked back up at the group, many of whom didn't know what he was rambling about, and gave them a decisive, definite snort. "I'm gonna see if my Grandfather still lives in this world, and I'm gonna find myself. I'll need his help, as well as yours. Help me, and I'll help you fix... whatever it is that's wrong. I need to be home for my Rainbow Dash, but I think she'd be okay if I helped her out in a different world as well."

Rainbow's lip trembled as she failed to suppress a squee, and gave the other pegasus a hug. "Dammit, now I know why your Dashie loves you." Her eyes hardened, and she glowered at Storm. "If you bring your other self here, than you'd better make sure he's not all wimpy or something!"

Storm barked out a laugh. "Oh, I was kinda whiny and wimpy when I first showed up here, but you got me in shape real quick, with the promise of stunts only my Grandpa could ever do."

Then what're you waiting for, Storm?! Fly, boy!" Storm took off, flying almost as fast as Dash had ever flown.

1513321121221112122112211121222112.content:
While still exhausting, the trip hadn't taken the five days it had when he'd left. He could only thank Rainbow Dash for that. Trotting through the front door, he looked around until he saw the nurse that usually kept the air-freshener stocked up. It looked like he'd just received a delivery.

"Excuse me, Nurse Spice? Would you know where my Grandfather is at this moment?"

Nurse Spice looked up from the reports he'd been reading to look at Storm and smiled. "Ah, Storm! It's good to see you!"

Storm, who had been expecting a cold and blunt reply, blinked in surprise. "I-it is?"

"Well, of course it is! Thanks again for helping me set up that contest last week, these old featherweights have been a lot happier recently. Heh, I know what you're thinking; I've been saying that for years, ever since you first came here and brightened up the place. How's that mare of yours, uh... Cloudfire, was it?"

"Cloudburn, I believe..."

"Ah! Yes, that's it. I heard she was getting married; was it to you?"

A tight lump formed in my throat. Sweet Celestia I hope not, Night Gale's been pining for her forever! "Hey, uh, so did you know where my Grandfather is? I was hoping to speak with him..."

"Hmm? Oh! Oh, yes, yes of course! I think he's out on the racetrack out back."

I smiled, turning around and heading for the door, waving hello to some of the other old timers in the foyer. It was time to meet my... no, this version of me's grandfather.

|=|~|=|


"Alright, boy! Take 'er fer another loop! C'mon, Storm! You got this!"

Storm walked out onto the plateau to find his grandfather up in the air, next to a familiar hulking grey pegasus. "Don't worry, gramps!" The Storm already in the air said with a smug smile. "You're looking at the next best racer right here!"

Geez, I hope I was never that boastful, Storm thinks to himself with a grimace. After his double shoots off into the air, he takes a deep breath. "Hey, Lightning Wing!" At his call, his grandfather looked around for a moment, before spotting the hulking pegasus on the ground below.

Chuckling, the older pegasus lands, giving a low whistle. "You must've been faster than I thought; coulda sworn you went up and not down."

Storm chuckled, relaxing as he remembered his grandfather's love for ribbing and banter. "Eh, that's probably because you fell asleep again; I told you not to blink so much."

His grandfather roared with laughter, clapping Storm on the back as he tried to reign in his guffaws. "Where'd you suddenly grow that lip, eh sonny? I knew you could tell a sarcastic remark, but that was downright mean." Lightning's eyes narrowed mischievously. "I like it."

Storm basked in his grandfather's praise for a moment longer, before remembering why he was there. "Hey, Gramps, I need to talk to you for a moment, kinda seriously."

Lightning could tell that it was serious from the lad's tone. "Yes? What do you want, Storm?"

"Well, I've got a confession to make, for one. I'm not your grandson- he's actually up there." Storm pointed and waved at himself, who was too far away to make out anything more than a big gray blotch in the sea of blue and white. "I'm not even from this world, or universe, or something, and... well, I need my help."

Maybe his grandfather believed him. Maybe his grandfather was senile. Maybe they were both just plain old crazy. Whichever it was, his grandfather chuckled good-naturedly. "Well, that seems like an okay plan to me. I'll call him down, and we can go talk in my room. How's that?" Storm nodded, and headed for his grandfather's room; he still remembered the way.

~~

Storm looked up from the book he was reading when a pair of familiar voices came within earshot. "... what you mean by that, it's crazy, Gramps. You're pulling my wing. That's... It's utter nonsense!"

"Heh, it's only nonsense if he didn't find my room, yeah? Now... where's that key..."

Storm smiled; he had known exactly where his grandfather hid he key; of course, all the orderlies did, too, as well as many of the other Wonderbolts, but it was an unspoken agreement that nopony talked about the fact that his key hung from the rafters right in front of his door.

Storm got out of his chair and opened the door, his grandfather standing on the other side with a smile, and an exact copy of himself. "Hey, Storm," he said to his other.

The other Storm blinked, obviously surprised. "Hey..."

"So, what brings you out here, from... what did you call it? A different dimension, or something?"

"Yeah, I need to borrow Storm here. But first, a question:Are you getting married, Storm?"

The Storm outside Lightning Wing's room shook his head. "Nope, but I'm gonna be the best colt for Cloudburn and Gale's wedding."

Storm chuckled. "Well, it's about time, huh?"

Storm (Geez, we need a way to differentiate these two...) laughed as well. "Yeah, I finally realized that Cloud was pining for me- took me long enough- and I told her I wasn't interested. I also told her to maybe try Gale, he was already smarter, so he'd be the better prize."

Storm v1 nodded, a questioning look on his face. "Why'd you come here to live with Lightning Wing, Storm? Was it because of an accident?"

Storm v2 shook his head, his brow furrowed. "No, that wasn't it. After my Mom died, Proud Skies didn't feel like putting up with me. So, he shipped me over here. Gramps has been teaching me his tricks ever since."

Storm v1 breathed a sigh of relief. "Okay, so that means that Cloudburn and the rest didn't suffer here as well..."

"Suffer?"

"Never you mind, self. It's my burden to carry, and while we may be the same pony, we are still different. Which is perfectly fine. I need your help, but it's a two day fly from here with barely any breaks. Since you're in good condition- I wasn't when I first went there- we can get there pretty quickly. Pack up whatever you need, and let's hit the skies. There's a filly who might like to meet you, too."

"Really? Who?"

"Your sister."

Storm v2's eyes went wide. "M-my sister? Scootaloo... She's been alive, all this time..?"

"Yes, and she might not know it, but she's got a pretty cool brother, who needs to make up for not being there."

"Yeah, sounds good to me. Let's do this!" And with that, the two huge pegasai took off down the hall, packed up everything the two of them thought were essential, and left.

The announcer's voice echoed all around the stadium, but up on the blimp that was her starting position, Scootaloo could barely hear him over the crowd's hungry roar. That was a lot of ponies. Scootaloo gulped.

"You okay, kid?" Scootaloo flinched as one of the other team members spoke up from behind her. "Don't worry; it's just like we practiced. Only thing you gotta do here is look awesome for the crowd. Oh, and don't go splat. That'd be a terrible hit to our insurance." The stallion laughed as he put his own helmet on, and got into his starting post. She was only one of two pegasus members, both of them with underdeveloped wings. That was a long way to fall, but as a team it'd be easy to slow down. Individually... How did earth ponies get this crazy?

"And the first jumper, the colt who's mama was a pony, and his daddy was a donkey, the sonnuva mule we all love, hate, and tolerate, Ass Jackson!" With a mighty roar, the stadium below seemed to tremble and shake as the crowd cheered. Jackson waved to the pegasai on the cloud bleachers, flicking his sunglasses off before throwing them over the side of the dirigible.

Jackson trotted backwards away from the edge, before jumping into a full gallop, and leaping off the edge. Scootaloo gasped as she watched, knowing that it was only a matter of time before she had to do the jump. Ass splayed his legs out to the sides, the vest he was wearing puffing out like a balloon. His speed slackened, before he let the vest go flying off, giving him plenty of time to do a few flips and turns before landing gracefully in a pool of water in the middle of the stadium.

The crowd went wild as Ass Jackson got out of the pool, once again wearing his sunglasses. "Did you see that entry, folks?! Fillies and gentlecolts, Griffons and Goats, people of all races, hold onto your socks, 'cause this is only the beginning!"

*~*

"Hey, Scoots! That was pretty darn radical! Great recovery. I mean it! We should give you the title of 'Turkey' after that, 'cause your goose was just about cooked!"

Scootaloo smiled wearily at Geri, the team's griffon-chef. "Thanks, G. I'm just hoping this gets me past the 'Flying Chicken' comments after my last week's test run."

Geri chuckled. "Yes, your first week and you've already moved up in the name charts, good work, kid. You got this locked down, trust me."

Scootaloo was about to thank Geri for her praise when Dent, the team's go-to dragon, walked up. "Hey, Scootaloo! Express mail from Ponyville, seems your friends are already worried sick!" Dent chuckled as Scoots took the letter, opening it after seeing the red CMC emblem used to seal the envelope.

"Woah, a Level Eleven emergency, huh? Probably another 'end-of-the-world' threat." Scootaloo sighed as she began to read the letter aloud.

         Hey, Scoots. This is Apple Bloom, Sweetie, and Nyx, and we need your help.Reality is beginning to come apart at the seams, and ponies from different universes are popping up in ours. We need the CMC at full strength to deal with this, please come as soon as possible.

-Apple Bloom, Nyx, and Sweetie Belle.

PS: Sweetie's also from a different dimension.

"Huh, sounds important. Guess I should go, huh?"

Dent and Geri looked at each other, sharing a curious glance at the fily's nonchalance. "Uhh... Yeah. If the world's ending, I think I'd like to stay with my friends, too. You should go."

"Yeah, okay. Gonna go ask Ass if I can get the leave; tell him I'll be back later. See ya!"

Geri offered Dent a cup of Magma Coffee, and got himself a cup of Desert Falcon. "I don't always drink, but hey. If the world's ending, I might as well, yeah?"

Not ten minutes later, there was a weird chirring sound as a blue box appeared in front of the cook and dragon. The door opened and Scootaloo stepped out. "Thanks for the ride, Doctor! I gotta go! Hi Geri! Hey Dent! Long time no see!"

The two non-ponies looked at each other, shrugged, and went back to their drinks, Geri muttering to himself. "Mebbe I should stop drinking this stuff... Everytime I do something weird happens." Dent nodded as he drained the last of his drink, pouring himself another glass.

"Yeah. I think there's too much mint in this."

"You get the tables packed up Nyxie, and I'll take care of the streamers!"

"On it!" The party had been a grand old time for everypony, and had left a lot exhausted. Some so much so, that Nyx kept finding sleeping ponies lying in the strangest places. Like, for example... "Uh, Berry? Hello? Miss Punch, wake up."

"Grmlfrml Mrgn mmhmm..."

Nyx rolled her eyes. "There's cookies and punch by the doo-" Fwoosh Nyx giggled as Berry Punch picked up a nearby glass and began quaffing Neighan Punch like there was no tomorrow. "Have a good night, Miss Punch!"

Berry looked over at Nyx, smiling sheepishly as she put her cup down. "Y-yes, you too, y'hear?"

Nyx smiled and continued folding the tables and storing them away in a side chamber. Seeing that Pinkie was still busy with the streamers, she decided to do a once over of the castle, to make sure nopony was still there.

After an hour had passed her by, Nyx had checked most every room, starting from her tower all the way down to the dungeons. She was tired, hungry (hey, a growing mare's gotta eat- especially when they're growing by decades at a time!), and satisfied that nopony was still-

There's something there. Nyx froze in place, looking out of the corner of her eye at the room she was passing. It was one near the castle's main entrance, easily passable. On an impulse, Nyx decided to check it.

"Huh, thought I saw something moving in here..." Nyx trotted into the room, which was bare except for a single piece of ornate furniture; an armoire made of a dark, ebony wood and festooned with small gems and golden lines that swirled and danced across the armoire's surface.

Opening the doors to the bedazzled cabinet,Nyx looked into its depths. "It's bigger on the inside," she murmured to herself, eyes flicking across the rows upon rows of cloaks hung inside the small, unassuming wooden box. Pushing past the first row, she shuddered as she realized why the cloaks looked familiar; they were the same cloaks the Children of Nightmare had worn when they brought her back to power that night Celestia'd spirited her to Canterlot. She wanted to get out. No, she needed to get out, but something drew her in further. She spied a set of armor not much different than her- Nightmare Moon's own, except for its more elongated design, and the pauldrons were shaped for a different body type.

Nyx shivered as a draft of cold, wintry air passes by her, causing the cloaks to flutter on the breeze. Wait... Cold air? She pushed further into the armoire's depths, suddenly tripping on what appears to be a tree root, and falling face first into a snow drift. Pulling herself back to her hooves, she looks around to find herself in a small clearing, a large thicket behind her. "Where am I?"

You're in Narnia, you silly filly." Nyx jumped in surprise, and whipped her head to the side, finding herself face to face with a minotaur wrapped in a large fur coat. "Now, you look cold. Come, come, I've got a fire to warm your body, and a meal to warm your spirit." The minotaur shuffles a bit, shivering despite his large coat. "I've always hated winter. But that just feeds the Windigos further, eh? No one's got the energy to hate, but we don't really have much love, either. The winter's cold claws have a firm grip on most everybody's hearts, and the land of Narnia suffers on."

Nyx gave the minotaur a quizzical look as they stopped outside a hut made of several twisted and dead-looking trees. "Is there a point to all that?"

The minotaur shrugged, opening the door and motioning Nyx to go inside. "I don't know, but everything that comes through that thicket ends up asking questions, and my family's always ended up answering. It's practically a script, now. Most creatures return through the thicket after hearing our tale of woe. The question is, will you follow in their steps, whether hoof, foot, claw, or paw? Or will you stay here, and see if you could help us?"

Nyx sunk into thought. After a few minutes of sitting before the fire, she opens her eyes again. "I think that I'll..."

Shining Armor and Chell made their way down the catwalks, the former occasionally helping the latter skip flights of stairs with his magic. While he did so, he would occasionally try to make conversation, the brief periods when he was carrying her giving her a chance to write out responses. "So Chell," he asked, "you know GLaDOS better than anyone, right?"

The mute pony grimaced ruefully before nodding in reply.

Looking around, he asked, "So why does she do... all this? I mean, what's her end goal, if all she does is 'test' ponies until they're used up?"

Chell looked down at her notepad until Armor set her down next to him, then started scribbling her answer: "I don't think she has one. Everyone who gave her work any sense of purpose is dead, including her."

When Shining Armor gave her a confused raise of an eyebrow, Chell wrote, "GLaDOS was created from the mind of a human woman. A decent woman. I think. I don't remember much about being human. That part of her saved me once. We connected." Chell stared down at the paper, then with a heavy sigh, concluded, "GLaDOS killed that part of herself."

Shining Armor blinked as she tore out the page and gave it to him to read. "Oh... wow, I... I'm sorry. I never realized you were once friends."

Chell turned her head to glare up toward the area they had come from, then shook her head and wrote, "Caroline was my friend. First time GLaDOS attacked Ponyville, I found another copy of her original self. Caroline sacrificed herself to destroy the facility. Saved everyone. GLaDOS killed her own conscience. Twice. Has nothing but hate & spite now."

Shining Armor read the note. "I see..." He placed a hoof on the wounded mare's shoulder and told her with all sincerity, "Then I swear to you, Chell, in honor of your friend, we will put an end to this. Caroline bought us all several precious years. We owe her nothing less than to ensure her sacrifice will not have been in vain."

Chell looked the unicorn in the eye, then snorted as she couldn't keep a straight face. After quickly scribbling, "That's so corny. But thank you. You're right." she made her way along the catwalks deeper into the darkness.

"Well I thought it sounded good..." Shining Armor muttered as he walked alongside her, lighting up his horn to illuminate the gloom.

After walking for some time without any concrete sense of where they were actually going, Chell had to take a moment to rest. Though she had kept in relatively good shape in the years since arriving in Equestria, her injuries sapped her stamina. Shining Armor kept watch while she recuperated, and in the absence of their hoofsteps against the metal catwalks echoing in their ears, he noticed another sound. Something mechanical, so he quickly adopted a defensive stance, preparing to erect a protective barrier around himself and Chell at a moment's notice as he crept along the path, peering around the corner.

Whatever he had been expecting, it wasn't..

Hovering in the cavern was a single turret, its propeller keeping it aloft. Unlike other turrets, however, this one was speaking to itself, in a high-pitched, tinny voice. "She's not quite dead yet," it muttered, before blasting the wall repeatedly. When Chell and Shining Armor looked, they saw that the turret had shot a message into the cavern wall.

         StillAlive

         Chell looked at the turret, her eyes widened. She scribbled out a message. "I recognize this turret! I saved it from a fire once before, and left it on the catwalks in the old facility. How did it get here?"

         Shining glanced between Chell and the turret, which continued its nonsensical ramblings. "Let's see if we can find out," he murmured, as he stepped forward. "Hello?"

         The turret spun to face the two. Shining twitched, ready to bring his shield up at a moment's notice. However, the turret didn't open fire. It looked at Chell. "You... The savior..."

         The two ponies looked at each other, before Shining spoke up. "Why do you call her 'savior'?"

         "A previous existence, she saved from redemption," the turret said, hovering in front of the two. "Kindness was paid in the words of the Oracle."

         Shining blinked, then looked at Chell. "Does this make any sense to you?"

         Chell nodded slowly, writing a note. "Somewhat. When I saved the turret in the old facility, it... knew things that were to come. I didn't pay attention to it at the time, but now that I think about it, it was pretty foreboding. I guess this is that turret's successor... somehow."

         Shining looked up at the floating turret. "You are called the Oracle, then?"

         "The current Oracle," clarified the turret. "Born of a glitch in the programming, I have free will. I see and know things that others do not."

         Shining looked down, and chuckled. "Twilight's brain would explode if she knew we were talking to someone claiming to be able to see the future, let alone a turret." He looked at the wall, and blinked at the message. "Why were you blasting that message into the wall? 'Still Alive'?"

         The turret actually gave a small chuckle. "She doesn't know yet, but her past life is not so easily destroyed. The Guardian Mare will awaken the part of her she thought she deleted."

         Both ponies blinked at that. "By 'she', do you mean GLaDOS?" asked Shining Armor.

         The turret bobbed up and down, in a simulation of a nod.

         Shining narrowed his eyes. "If that's the case, who's the 'Guardian Mare'?"

         "She wears a coat of black and the mark of a shield. The stigma of her past hangs about her like a shroud, a shroud she is desperate to cast away."

         Shining's eyes widened. "That can only mean Nyx. So... Nyx will 'awaken' the part of GLaDOS she thought she deleted?"

         Chell gasped, one of the few noises she could truly make. She quickly scribbled a note. "It must mean Caroline! She's... still alive, somehow! Still living within that twisted metal shell!"

         Shining nodded slowly. "If that's the case, we've gotta hurry. There's no telling what could happen in the meantime. If your friend still exists, somehow, we've got to get her back to the surface. And I think the only way to do that is with the Elements of Harmony."

         Chell nodded, then looked at the Oracle. It was still floating before them, occasionally muttering something. Chell's blood ran cold when she heard one particular sentence. "A mechanical monster awakens a nightmare by placing her mother in jeopardy."

         Shining had been busy trying to locate a landmark of some sort to navigate by. Thus, Chell's sudden insistant tugging shocked him slightly. "Wha - Chell? What's wrong?"

         Chell looked panicked, as she simply wrote down what the Oracle had just said. "Think about what it means," she added.

         Shining thought about it... and did not like what his mind was telling him. "We've spent enough time down here. Let's go!"

         Together, the two ponies bolted from the room, as the Oracle floated away. As it slowly left, it said one last thing: "A rainbow will give voice to the voiceless and flesh to the fleshless."

A short while after they set out, the militia drew close to the castle, but did not enter it. Instead, they took a moment for Spell Nexus to pass out pieces of parchment that he had been working on along the way. Each group of ponies he passed them to unfurled them to see a highly detailed tunnel map.

"At present, these maps represent the tunnel system as they were when the Children of Nightmare disbanded. We won't know how accurate they are until we are inside, of course, so I've placed an enchantment on each one to automatically correct itself as we progress. I also took the liberty of linking them to one another in the event that we get separated. That way, each group will know what the others have found."

"Most impressive, Spell Nexus," Luna replied as she rolled the parchment up again and handed it to one of her Guards. "In Chell's current absence, this will surely give us a great advantage!"

Rainbow Dash bravely volunteered, "Yeah, just give me five minutes to fly through the place, and you'll have a full map!" Twilight, however, wasn't thrilled with the idea.

"That's not a bad idea, Dash, but I don't think we should be separated. We'll need to stick together in order to use the Elements of Harmony if we have to."

"I'm afraid Twilight has a point, Rainbow Dash," replied Celestia. "The Elements of Harmony are at their strongest when borne by you six. If anything should happen to one of you, it would leave the whole incomplete. You are far too valuable to risk losing by sending you off on your own."

Rainbow Dash clearly wasn't happy about it, but hung her head. "Guh... fine..." Another pegasus stepped up, however.

"I... I can do it, princess," Ditzy Doo said, her words slow and nervous as she looked up to the princesses. "I'm... not as fast as Rainbow Dash, but... I want to help!"

When Celestia and Luna looked unsure at the wall-eyed pegasus, though, it was Rainbow Dash who stepped up and said, "Actually, your highness, Derpy here'd make a good scout. Not as good as I would be, of course, but if there are any traps, she's tough enough to handle it. One time, she pretty much destroyed City Hall with her butt!"

Ditzy smiled unevenly, pretty sure that most of that had been meant as a compliment, but it was hard to tell with Dash sometimes, and probably hadn't helped her case. Nevertheless, Celestia smiled warmly and called over a group of three other pegasi. "Very well. Miss Derpy, you and my fastest Guards will scout ahead. Just remember that if you should encounter the enemy, your first duty is to escape, and fight only when absolutely necessary." As she passed a map down to Ditzy, the grey pegasus smiled widely and nodded before holding it in her mouth, so grateful that she forgot to correct the princess about her name.

The other ponies of Ponyville gathered and wished her and her entourage luck. "You watch yer flank in there," Applejack said. "Y'all got Dinky waitin' for ya t' come home." Ditzy smiled around the parchment in her mouth and nodded again before taking off into the tunnels with the rest of the scouts. Twilight then unfurled her own map, and saw that as the pegasi moved deeper into the cavern, the lines changed subtly to reflect how they found it.

"Alright," the unicorn said, rolling the map back up. "Let's find our ponies, then make GLaDOS wish she'd never been built!"

------------

As the Royal Guard and Ponyville militia made their way deeper and deeper underground, they checked their maps as the surroundings gradually changed. Based on what the scouts had found, the rough tunnels that had been carved out by nature and the Children of Nightmare eventually transitioned into more uniformly shaped, rectangular stretches. It was clearly where GLaDOS had started to develop the area, reshaping it into her own image, but as they approached those outer reaches, what they found was wholly unfamiliar.

Instead of the sterile white panels that GLaDOS was so fond of, or even the decrepit, industrial corridors that had been behind the scenes of the original Enrichment Center, the corridors that they found themselves in looked more like... office space. Cubicles and offices everywhere, complete with all the assorted supplies and knick-knacks one would expect.

"Well, this does have a refreshingly Manehattan-esque aesthetic," Rarity said in the hopes of breaking the confused silence that had fallen over the group, "but if this is supposed to be a workspace, then..."

"Where are the workers...?" Twilight mused. Though not as intentionally sterile as GLaDOS's testing chambers, the sense that this was a place meant to be populated made the absence of ponies all the more chilling and ominous.

Fluttershy quietly followed the rest of her friends, nervously staying as close to them as she could as it seemed like there could be something horrible lurking around any corner. She then squeaked and practically jumped out of her skin when a speaker near the ceiling suddenly crackled to life! Then a voice boomed through it, echoing loudly throughout the complex.

Who's voice is it?
