15133211212212221.content:
"Hello, everypony, and welcome to the lower reaches of the Aperture Science Testing Facility of Equestria, Mark II!" came a cheerful and all too familiar voice from the speakers.

         Everypony's eyes widened at the voice, though shock quickly melted into anger for most of those present. Celestia voiced nearly everypony's opinion in a single word. "Discord!" she spat, treating the word like a venomous snake.

         "Indeed! My, my, Celestia, we seem to be seeing a lot of each other in recent years, don't we?" Discord's voice chuckled out of the speaker.

         "A little too much," growled the solar princess. "How are you here? You're supposed to be sealed in stone!"

         "Now, now, Celly, no need to be so snippy," the draconequess's voice replied. "As for how I'm here, that's simple enough. The seal of the Elements wasn't exactly... perfect."

         Twilight frowned. "But how's that possible? With six ponies, each embodying one of the different Elements of Harmony, the seal should have been stronger than when you were sealed by the princesses!" She paused, and glanced at the alicorns. "Um, no offense."

         Discord merely chuckled. "You are correct, in theory, Twilight Sparkle. And indeed, the seal is stronger than ever, in certain parts. However, six ponies rather than two means six chances that there might be a weak link."

         Rainbow Dash growled. "You're saying one of us wasn't really into the spell?"

         "Well, well! It seems there is something behind that lovely mane of yours, Rainbow Dash!" Discord said with a laugh. "That's precisely what I'm saying. One of you six didn't have their whole heart into the weaving of the sealing. Now, for their sake, I won't name names, but I can assure you that the weak link isn't weak enough for me to do as I please. I need outside help in order to manifest in any form. Luckily for me, I found somepony willing to aid me."

         "GLaDOS," spat Luna with as much venom as Celestia had said Discord's name earlier. "You're truly working with that mechanical monster?"

         There was a pause. "If I didn't know better, Luna, I'd say you hated her almost as much as you hate me," Discord finally said, all traces of amusement gone.

         Before anything else could be said, the floor suddenly opened up under Twilight, causing her to fall. She barely had time to yelp before the floor closed up again, just in time to catch her tiara of Magic.

         "TWILIGHT!" everypony else yelped. Celestia glared up at the speaker. "Where is she, Discord?!"

         "GLaDOS requested her presence, for some reason. I don't rightly know why. I'm not concerned with what she does in the facility proper. I just maintain these levels for her, and teach her a bit of magic now and then, and in exchange, she lets me manifest partially." Discord sounded nonchalant about the whole deal.

         Celestia shook her head, anger replaced by... pity? "Discord, you don't understand how GLaDOS works, do you? She is not like you. She cares nothing for chaos. She is a machine dedicated solely to the progress of science, at any cost."

         Discord scoffed. "I know that, Celly, she told me when she introduced herself to me."

         "But do you truly understand?" Luna asked, having picked up on Celestia's thread of thought. "When we say 'at any cost', we mean 'at any cost'. GLaDOS tests ponies to the breaking point and beyond. She has killed in the past, Discord, do you know that? She cares nothing for the lives lost, all in the name of science."

         Discord was silent, so Applejack decided to interject. "Ah can't rightly say who ah hate more, you or her. Ah mean, ya done us wrong, Discord, but at least ya never killed anypony. Not directly, anyway. GLaDOS ain't like you at all in that respect."

         Rainbow spoke up. "She'll abandon you the moment your usefulness runs out. She has no concept of loyalty."

         "She takes what she wants from any living thing she gets her metallic hooves on, and never gives anything back," added Rarity.

         "GLaDOS is just a super-duper double-trouble meanie-pants!" declared Pinkie Pie.

         "She's... a monster," Fluttershy said in her barely-audible voice. From her, such a declaration was about as close to hatred as she'd normally get.

         After a moment, Discord finally spoke again. "Perhaps one of you might have been lying, but all of you? I need to do some thinking... By the by, Captain Armor and that earth pony are close by. You may want to meet up with them." With that, the speaker shut off.
15133211212212221.title: Chaos Theory

choices: Follow Celestia as she discovers the turret foundry
Follow Luna as she and the others try to catch up to Nyx.
151332112122122211.content:
After Discord's communication with them cut off, Pinkie Pie asked, "Chell and Shiny? What about Nyx?"

"I suppose we shall simply have to ask them when we find them," Rarity replied.

"I... I hope Twilight is okay..." Fluttershy whispered.

Spell Nexus overheard and unfurled his map, seeing the new details that had appeared on it. "Hmm, as long as she wasn't separated from her map, it looks like she's near the center of the complex."

Celestia spoke up, her calm, motherly voice drawing everyone's attention. "If that is the case, then GLaDOS's insanity will actually work in our favor. She may be a sadist, but she is not one to dispose of a valuable test subject too quickly." She smirked a little to the assembled ponies. "And if there is one thing my faithful student has always performed well at, it's tests. Our first priority should be reconvening with Captain Armor and Chell."

With that, Celestia resumed leading the ponies down the corridors, reaching out with her magic. If Discord was indeed telling the truth, she should easily be able to sense Guard Captain's own magic. Her focus was disturbed, however, by Vinyl Scratch's voice saying, "Woah, I thought she'd be freakin' out over Twilight. I guess that's why she's the leader, though. Cold steel nerves." After a brief pause, the DJ added, "Dude, that is SO the name of my next song!"

Turning to Luna, though, Celestia whispered quietly enough to keep it from the others, "Sister, I didn't want to worry the others, but I fear for Twilight Sparkle's safety. I know we shouldn't play our hand too soon, but if Twilight is for some reason unable to teleport back to us, will you go to her location? I don't want to put you in unnecessary danger either, but..."

Luna didn't even bat an eyelash before replying, "Consider it done, sister. I share your concern, but you shouldn't need to bear such fears on your own. Especially not with these ponies... or me. You still try too hard to carry all of Equestria's burdens on your own shoulders, sometimes. Especially when you're afraid and could use the help the most."

Celestia blushed slightly at the chastisement, but smiled with gratitude to Luna. Concentrating on locating their allies again, she quickly felt their presence. "Ah! This way, my little ponies," she exclaimed, turning off into a side-corridor that led back to the more roughly-hewn tunnels.

----------

Feeling the familiar sensation of Celestia's magic nearby, Shining Armor suddenly stopped in his tracks. Chell gave him a quizzical look, to which he explained, "Ah, I just felt the princesses searching for us. They're close, so we'll be able to tell them about Nyx!" Chell nodded resolutely and the two of them hurried down the tunnels as quickly as the earth pony's injuries would allow.

Within a few minutes, they spotted the lights of unicorn horns illuminating the path up ahead! Shining Armor called out to them, "Your highness! We're here!" Before he could reach them, though, as the red lines of laser sights suddenly came to life, all pointed at him and Chell.

Time seemed to slow down as realization dawned on the unicorn, his joy at finding the others turning to terror as he reflexively called upon his magic. In mid-step, he summoned up a protective bubble to wrap around himself and Chell, and at the same drawn-out instant, dozens of cheery mechanical voices exclaimed, "I see you!" Immediately afterward, thousands of rounds of ammunition spat out of the turrets from shadow alcoves dug into the walls and ceiling all around him. Most of them bounced off of the shield, but a number of them managed to get through before it was fully formed, and Shining Armor tumbled to the ground as several bullets struck him.

Chell wasn't able to stop herself in time before she bounced off the inside of the shield, but after shaking her head to clear it, she saw the state Shining Armor was in and quickly moved over to him. He was bleeding from where he had been hit. Thankfully, it didn't look as though he had been shot anywhere vital, or the shield would have collapsed and the both of them would have been reduced to a red paste by the hail of bullets. Still, while he remained conscious, his breathing was labored and his horn was chipped. As a result, the protective sphere around them flickered slightly, bulging inward where it softened while he struggled to maintain his focus.

When the other ponies arrived on the scene, following the sound of gunfire, they gasped at what they saw. Ditzy, seeing her friend and co-worker in distress, cried out, "Chell!"

Vinyl Scratch, taking the initiative, quickly pushed her Bass Cannon up front and pointed it down the tunnel. "Don't worry, everypony! I got this!" Before she could punch the button on the top of it, though, Applejack quickly butted her away from the device.

"What in tarnation are y'all thinkin'?! You wanna bring the whole cave down on 'em?!"

Celestia quickly turned to Spell Nexus and asked the wizard, "Nexus! Can you use that spell you devised to stop those turrets?"

"It should," the wizard replied, "but this far from the transmitter, and it will only work in this area. Plus, GLaDOS might find a way to counter it by the time we reach the-"

Luna snapped, "NOW, Nexus! It is a risk we shall have to take!"

"Of course, your highness!" Focusing his magic, the unicorn formed the complex spell in his mind, and lines of power burst forth from his horn. From a technologically advanced perspective, the runic lines and patterns that branched and spread out from Nexus would have clearly resembled the pathways of a circuit board as they filled the tunnel ahead, connecting to each of the turrets.

After being touched by the magic lines, every turret responded to the commands the wizard sent them by saying, "Nighty-night" and closing up as they entered sleep mode. Shining Armor's shield was able to hold out long enough to survive the last fading barrage of gunfire, but it was only a temporary reprieve.

"Hurry," the wizard urged, sweat forming on his brow from the effort of maintaining the spell. "GLaDOS is already starting to re-assert control, and I have the feeling she's barely even trying!" Indeed, automatic systems were already at work, fighting the external influence of the spell. As quickly as they could, the princesses and unicorns pulled Shining Armor and Chell over to them, out of harm's way.

Once they were safe, Ditzy hugged Chell while the others tended to Shining Armor's injuries. Celestia took the opportunity to tell Vinyl, "Now you can do it."

"Heck yeah!" The DJ unicorn eagerly slammed the button on the top of her speakers, causing the Bass Cannon to open up and unleash a tunnel clearing blast of sonic energy that vaporized the turrets in their holes.

Though they hadn't brought a doctor or medic with them, Luna helped by teleporting the bullets out of Shining Armor's wounds so that they wouldn't cause further damage. Fluttershy, used to tending to wounded animals, then helped by bandaging him up.

"Yeesh, pay more attention next time," Rainbow Dash told the Guard Captain. "You have any idea how bad Twilight's gonna freak out when she finds out about this? And why the heck isn't Nyx with you?"

Shining Armor winced before replying, "Nyx insisted on going back... stalling GLaDOS so we could get out and find you. Wait. Twilie! Where is she?!"

When they told him about Discord and how Twilight had been snatched from under their noses, the Guard Captain grunted and weakly pulled himself back up to his hooves. "Then it's already started. We have to hurry!" As quickly as he could, he told them about the warning from the self-proclaimed Oracle. Just as he finished, though, the tunnels suddenly trembled around them.

"Eeek! Vinyl's music is gonna kill us all! That dream was RIGHT," Pinkie Pie screamed, until the tremor suddenly stopped. "Oh, wait, never mind!" The princesses and unicorns in the group, however, had been struck by the emotions behind the source of that tremor.

"Oh no," Luna said. "This feeling... this power, it's just like..."

"...Nyx," Celestia finished. "But this feeling... I've never sensed such rage from her before..." Looking her sister in the eye, she commanded, "Luna, take everypony! Find Nyx and Twilight!"

Surprised by the request, she asked, "Me? What about you?"

In response, Celestia looked down the tunnel. "As much as I hate to say so, my injuries will probably keep me from fighting GLaDOS directly under these circumstances. Not without having to bring so much magical power to bear, I might be danger to our allies as much as to our enemy. But I have a feeling that those turrets were not set there simply to ambush us. Not with those alcoves carved into solid rock. No, I think they were set to protect something, and Shining Armor just happened to stumble across it. If my feeling is correct, then I can at least contribute by finding and dealing with whatever it is they were set to guard. If it turns out to be important, GLaDOS will at the very least be distracted."

Luna nodded. "Alright. But do not think that I want to see my sister put herself in unnecessary danger, either," she replied before addressing the other ponies and preparing to teleport them.
151332112122122211.title: Let's make some noise!

1513321121221222111.content:
Celestia made her way down the tunnel alone. She limped whenever she put pressure on her injured leg, but striding purposefully to the spot where Shining Armor had been attacked. From there, she shone light from her horn to find that on one patch of wall, Vinyl's Bass Cannon had stripped away a facade of rock hiding a door behind it.

Pushing that door open, the white alicorn followed a long tunnel from which she could hear the steady rhythm of industrial machinery. Louder and louder the sound grew until it opened up into a massive chamber. Criss-crossing conveyor belts carried parts and raw materials through the facility, robotic arms connecting and welding the parts together, manufacturing them into fully-formed turrets at a horrifying rate.

And not just the models that Celestia was familiar with, but new ones that were clearly modeled as some sort of parody of her world's various residents. Scoop-handed diggers resembling Diamond Dogs. Sleek, rigid-winged gryphon models, some of which soared around the ceiling of the factory after activation before alighting on the countless pallets containing what must have been thousands of slumbering death machines. Most horrifying to the princess, however, were the models that were shaped in the image of her beloved ponies. Earth ponies, pegasi, unicorns, all rendered in the form of a soulless technological caricature.

"This is an army..." she murmured under her breath. "With these numbers, she could easily conquer Equestria in one move, but she drew us here instead. Was it simply to gloat, or..." She heard the distant sound of gunfire, too far away to be aimed at her. Instead, a line of turrets were blasting STILL ALIVE into the wall over and over again. "... or was something inside her holding her back?"

After a moment of silently regarding the vast facility, she set her jaw and decided that it didn't matter. So long as the factory existed, it was a clear threat to everypony in the world.

She would not show restraint.

As she started to focus and gather her magic, however, a child-like voice chimed, "I see you!" A flying turret had spotted her, but before it could fire, she quickly grabbed it with her mind and smashed it against the wall. Too late to stop it from sending an alarm message, however, as a thick metal door suddenly slammed shut behind her, blocking her exit.

The princess braced herself, expecting the mechanical monstrosities surrounding her to spring to life in the thousands. What she did not expect, however, was the multiple tons of metal that slammed down onto the floor in front of her! She nearly lost her footing due to the impact, her mouth hanging open as she saw the new machine.

Built in the shape of a huge alicorn, this machine didn't share the sleek, almost anorexic design of GLaDOS's combat frame. Instead, it was twice the princesses own impressive height, and easily four times her girth, its wings looking cartoonishly tiny on its massive frame. If there was any doubt whatsoever what GLaDOS's intent had been in creating such a thing, that vanished the instant Celestia saw the crown welded to its head.

Rearing up, the princess-bot let out a deep, dim-witted sounding whinny and brayed, "I'm da princess! I'mma gonna eatcha!"

"... Subtle, GLaDOS," Celestia replied sardonically. She cast a quick burst of concentrated light and energy at the center of the mechanical mockery, only to barely budge it as the blast was absorbed by its thick armor.

"Haw haw! You can't hurt da princess," it brayed, flapping its tiny wings as a jet of flame erupted from its ample posterior, causing the princess-bot to rocket toward Celestia at astonishing speed for something of its size and mass! Celestia's first reflex was to jump over it assisted by her wings, but that instinct betrayed her as her wounded wing failed to give her enough lift. As it was, instead of being slammed by the full force of the enormous robot, it clipped her and sent her tumbling back down to the cold metal floor!

As the princess-bot zoomed and banked around the facility, it turned its head to keep locked onto Celestia, horn and crown glowing with energy before unleashing an energy beam at the alicorn! She just barely had time to push herself back with the strength of her good wing, then had to keep moving in order to stay just ahead of the deadly blast.

Fortunately for Celestia, the princess-bot wasn't able to make sharp turns, and attacked by attempting to dive-bomb the alicorn or fire broad, sweeping arcs with its energy beam. Unfortunately, it was too fast and sturdy to attack directly, and the constant harassment kept her from focusing on a spell that would finish it. As she watched it, however, Celestia noticed something about its cartoonish design besides the obviously intended insult to her own physique.

The wings which flapped rapidly while the princess-bot was aloft were clearly too small to actually assist in its flight. When she got a chance to look carefully, however, she noticed what looked like some sort of ventilation grill just behind them. As it banked in a wide arc to make another attack run, Celestia lined herself up. Assuming that if there was a structural weakness it would likely be there, she took careful aim and unleashed a volley of those light burst spells, homing in on the vents.

Not all of the blasts struck true, several simply bouncing off of the princess-bot's armor, but the ones that hit their target blew apart its air-intake and cooling system, causing the princess-bot's flaming plot to flicker and sputter out, its body arcing toward the ground as it quickly lost altitude. With a cry of "I'M HUNNNNGRYYYY," it smashed into the factory floor and exploded in an impressive ignition of jet fuel.

Taking a deep breath, Celestia looked around for signs of further interruptions. When none showed immediately, she mused, "I think that GLaDOS needs a reminder of who commands the sun in this world," and her horn glowed brightly. And brighter. And brighter. And brighter still. Without the safety of any other living being to be concerned with, the princess drew upon the power and fury of the sun itself. The nearest conveyor belts and clutches of turrets all began to melt as she wreathed herself in celestial fire, concentrating it around herself and feeding ever more energy into it.

The only reason why the princess was not herself consumed by it was because, as the bringer of the day, her own magic and essence were innately attuned to it. Something that nothing else in Equestria, or at least nothing else in the room with her, could claim as she decided that she had gathered enough power, straining even her ability to control it.

And then she let it go.

In the aftermath of the blast, Celestia looked down upon the smoking crater that was left behind. A few bits and scraps still remained, but not in any sort of usable condition. She had used up an incredible amount of magical power in order to do it, greatly weakening her, but she smiled and had no doubt that it had been worth the cost. Turning back to the now-melted door from which she had come, she limped her way back toward the tunnels.

1513321121221222112.content:
Luna and the other ponies materialized on a set of catwalks far above where they had been. Taking a moment to orient herself, Luna looked around, and spotted something: a smoking ruined part of the area marked with once-white panels. A quick scan revealed that the area had been wrecked by Nyx's magic. And what an amount of magic it was! Luna gulped; the young alicorn had regained a lot of power over the years, but had it been more than she'd let on? Either way, Luna was no longer confident that she could subdue Nyx in the event such an action became necessary. Nyx was being driven by unbridled rage.

         As she thought about this, a tremor ran through the area, sounding like it came from near where they had been. Shining Armor blinked. "Do you think Princess Celestia managed to find what those turrets were guarding?"

         "Possibly," Luna replied. "We need to find Nyx, and soon! If GLaDOS does something to Twilight - "

         She was cut off by an explosion that rocked the group from nearby. Yelping, the ponies all looked. They saw a black, winged shaped fly into a smoking hole in another section of white panels. Seconds later, a familiar voice boomed throughout the facility. "GLADOS!!!!!" Nyx's voice roared, rage underlying every letter. "YOU ARE A DEAD MARE!!!"

         Everypony cringed at the normally kind teenager's voice. "Call me crazy," Vinyl Scratch said, "but I think she already did."

         Luna looked at the hole Nyx had flown into. "Hm... this will be a tight fit, but I think I can fit everypony in there." She began to work her magic, but was forced to change the spell into a barrier as a set of turrets flew down and opened fire on the group. "Lauren's mane, they couldn't have picked worse timing!" she swore.

         Despite the situation, Applejack blinked at looked at Luna oddly. "Uh, who's Lauren?"

         "She is the mother to both Celestia and myself. Long story," Luna explained. "Do these things ever run out of ammo?" she added, as the turrets' barrage continued.

         "Not that I'm aware of," Rarity answered. "Perhaps Spell Nexus here could disable them again?"

         Spell Nexus grimaced. "Unfortunately, they're flying outside of my spell's optimum range. There's no guarantee I'd be able to make the spell stick. Perhaps Madame Scratch could use her sonic weapon again?"

         Vinyl chuckled nervously. "Ah-heh. My Bass Cannon has a thirty-minute cooldown. It's been about ten since I used it to clear out those turrets in the alcoves. And I doubt Princess Luna wants to spend twenty minutes holding up a barrier."

         "Indeed not," Luna deadpanned, already feeling the strain. Outside, she could tell that dawn was approaching, and thus her own powers were beginning to wane slightly. "I suggest somepony think of something, and quickly."

         As it turned out, they needn't have worried. A red laser lanced out from the hole Nyx had made, neatly severing the propellers the turrets were using to stay aloft. With cries of "No hard feelings," the turrets fell past the catwalks, to smash against the cavern floor below. Everypony blinked.

         Finally, Ditzy broke the silence. "Um... we can... go after Nyx now... right?"

         Luna shook herself slightly. "Yes! Yes we can!"

choices: Chell asks for help in dealing with GLaDOS
Chell asks about something to do with this universe
1513321121222.content:
The surroundings suddenly became much quieter and clearer. Also of note was a sensation of feeling much lighter. The room in which they were now standing featured a window looking out onto a brightly lit grey landscape with a black sky.

"Are we... on the moon?" asked the captain.

"Yes, although it's not your moon," called a familiar voice from behind them.

"Mum?" asked Nyx.

"Hang on! Let me get a bit closer," replied what was clearly Twilight's voice from the other side of a rather wide and somewhat deep pit.

With a cantering start, Twilight leaped right over the pit, landing with a clang a couple of metres from the three surprised ponies.

"Granted, I could have used a portal, but the jump is more fun. Now, where was I?"

The pony in front of them certainly looked like Twilight. The differences being a slightly shorter mane and tail and what she was wearing. On her hooves were a set of boots much like those worn by Chell, but without the portal emitters. On her back was what looked lot a white set of curved saddlebags with a pair of portal emitters. Her head included some sort of illuminated headset and the portal emitters on her sides changed direction to match the movements of her head.

"Let me start again. Welcome to Aperture Science Lunar Facility F. I'm Twilight Sparkle, co-director of Aperture Science appointed by Princess Luna following the 2011 Aperture Science Incompetence Trial and the resulting Equestria Vs GLaDOS trial for multiple ponycide. After being assigned my current position, I initiated a project to find out the extent of the capabilities of the portal technology. One such finding was the ability to connect to an already-open portal in a parallel universe. It was through this that I ended up finding and rescuing you from what looked like a very dangerous situation by using an overpowered excursion funnel to pull you through the portal to my universe." Twilight paused for a moment before adding "Although, I must admit that yours is the first parallel universe we've found with ponies as the main form of intelligent life."

Nyx and the captain just stood there with mouths agape. Chell, however, was scribbling furiously on her notepad. When she finished, she held it up and Twilight spent a moment reading over it before answering.
1513321121222.title: Aperture... Twilight?

choices: Wait for Princess Luna's reply
Go back now and try to stop GLaDOS with just what they can carry.
15133211212221.content:
"You want my help dealing with GLaDOS? How hard can it be to send a bunch of ponies in with body armour and gas masks to disconnect her from the mains?"

This resulted in puzzled expressions from two of the three visitors. Nyx broke the silence.

"From what I've been told, GLaDOS is from yet another parallel universe."

"Ah, well, that would explain the antiquated armour."

"Antiquated?" asked the captain. "I was fitted for this just last year."

"By the standards of this world, it's antiquated. Outside of historical reenactments, nopony has worn armour like that for about two hundred years. For its weight, it simply doesn't provide enough protection against a bullet. Oh, sure, it would slow one down, but it would still be travelling fast enough to at least severely injure you, if not outright kill you."

"And I suppose your armour would protect against one?"

"Certainly. Our armour is constructed from multiple layers of durable polymer fabrics impregnated with a shear-thickening fluid and incorporating a weave of electrically and magically conducive meshes to protect the wearer against electrical and moderately powerful magical attacks, all the while minimising weight to maximise manoeuvrability." Twilight blinked for a moment, then facehoofed. "Ugh. I was right. I did spend too much time reading over Aperture Science product release drafts this morning."

This was met by three amused looks from the visiting ponies. Parallel universe or not, this was definitely still Twilight.

"So can you help us?" queried Nyx.

"Not on my own, given Aperture is primarily a research company. However, as personal student to Princess Luna, and one of the six ponies to help take down Corona Blaze in 2010, I can probably convince her to arrange for help."

"Corona Blaze? Who's that?"

"You don't know the story? Well, the short version is that about a thousand years ago, the day princess went mad, turned evil, and tried to make the day last forever out of some twisted sense of being motherly to her kingdom. After failing to talk sense into her, the night princess used the Elements of Harmony to banish her to the sun for a thousand years, and taking on both duties herself. In 2010, Corona Blaze returned and a band of six ponies, of which I was a part, tracked down the Elements of Harmony and used them to clean the corruption from her, returning the normal cycle of day and night and restoring Princess Luna's sister, Celestia."

"Huh, that's the Nightmare Moon story with the princesses swapped," remarked Nyx.

"You can tell me about it while we wait for Princess Luna to reply," said Twilight. "Please be quiet while I'm dictating. The computer is easily confused by multiple speakers and I'd rather not have to do more editing than necessary."

Twilight made a series of whistles and clicks then started speaking again.

"Dear Princess Luna, comma, new paragraph. My latest investigations involving the parallel universe aspects of the portal technology- delete last two words. Portal technology. Have resulted in the rescue of three ponies. Full stop. They were under attack from a version of GLaDOS from yet another parallel universe. Full stop. Unfortunately, comma, their stage of technological development is far behind that of their foe- delete last word. Foe. Delete last word. Foe. And they need our help. Full stop."

Chell held up another note for Twilight. The purple unicorn paused in her dictation, gave her a worried expression and resumed dictating.

"New paragraph. I've just been informed by one of the rescued ponies that this GLaDOS is figuring out how to use magic, with significant progress so far. Full stop. I recommend that the ponies sent to assist be equipped with additional magical shielding and jamming devices suitable for interfering with magical telepresence setups. Delete last word. Setups. Full stop. New paragraph. Your loyal student. Comma, new paragraph. Twilight Sparkle. Capitalise last two words."

Twilight gave a series of whistles and clicks.

"There. Sent. We should hear back from Princess Luna in about three hours."

"It takes three hours to send a letter from the moon?" asked the captain.

"It takes one-and-a-quarter seconds to send a letter from the Moon to the Earth. It's mid afternoon in Canterlot right now, and Princess Luna gets up a little before sunset, so we can expect a reply from her in about three hours given the current time of day."

Nyx wondered if everypony back home would be alright for another three hours.
15133211212221.title: Chell asks for help in dealing with GLaDOS

choices: Training Facility with Nyx, Twilight, and Chell (POV of Nyx or Chell)
The Elements of Harmony! (The rest of the Mane 6 meet up)
151332112122211.content:
Shining Armor stomped a hoof angrily. "Three hours?! Twiley, are you crazy?!"

Twilight shifted on her hooves, shaking her head in confusion at what she perceived as a trick question. Her saddle-mounted portal devices swiveled and whirred as they followed along. "Of course I'm not crazy! I had my adrenaline and endorphin systems contracted to only activate when I need them to. They haven't needed activation in over three weeks, so I am at complete control of all of my mental functions." She stomped a hoof for added emphasis.

Shining Armor was starting to get extremely edgy. "We need to go back, now. No time for dilly-dallying!" Shining tried to jump towards the still open portal.

Twilight grabbed him, keeping the struggling stallion away from the opening. "Oh, stop that, there's nothing to worry about! It took us almost a day of deliberation and debate before we decided to step in and save you. And that's all after you opened the portals in your Universe." Twilight shook her head. "Boy, you Alts are completely backwards in arcano-tech, aren't you? I guess I can't say I'm surprised to hear that your GLaDOS is from a different reality than that of your own."

Shining stopped struggling as he tried to grasp what his sister's Alt was saying. "So... it took you a full day to save us... in the blink of an eye?"

"No, it only took me around Zero-Point-Five-Oh-Five seconds to pull you through the portal. It took us a full Twenty-three hours to decide whether or not we should. It would have been longer if Pinkie's subatomic horoscope initialization contracts hadn't started acting up. That's what finally swayed Rainbow Dash to agree to my saving you." Twilight looked away, biting her lip. "Dash doesn't like it when we get involved with Alts, because we can sometimes alter their timelines terribly, but if I hadn't intervened, none of you would have lived. None of my calculations gave you even a hope of living, unless you used an unprepared teleport."

Chell hastily scribbled on her notepad, before holding it out for Twilight to read.

Twilight smiled, a bit relieved at the change of subject. "No, we don't know how to control time. It's just that time does not flow symmetrically in all universes. There can be universes and new realities that spring into existence and reach the pinnacle of industry in mere hours, while any outsider looking in on that reality would say it took a millennium. To put it simply, time is relative, depending on distance and space."

Chell nodded, seeming content with that answer. Nyx had a question of her own. "So, now that we all have a basic understanding of time flux and flow, can I ask a different question?"

Twilight nodded. "Sure. Ask away."

"Where's Spike?"

"Spike?"

"Yeah, you know; Spike! He's a dragon! He lives with us back in our universe."

"Oh, huh. Dragons have actually been extinct for quite some time in this Universe; The Goddess of Strife, Eris, saw to that. But that's funny you should say that. The computer software used to send text via voice is called Dragon. I guess it'd be neat to have it activate or respond to a name, instead of a series of clicks."

Nyx smiles sadly, no dragons? "Well, my Twilight would always say 'Spike, take a letter' when she wanted to send a friendship report to the Princess."

Twilight hummed. "Yeah, I like the sound of that. Probably easier to say with a sore throat than-" she makes another sequence of clicking sounds, followed by a small chirrup. Nyx just nods.

Twilight looked over at Shining Armor, who looked away uncomfortably. "I'm sorry, soldier, did you have a question?"

Shining scuffed a hoof against the ground. "Well... you said you were one of the ones who voted for our survival. Why? You said yourself that you usually don't put yourselves in harms way when Alts are concerned."

Twilight's ears flicked back. "There... might have been a bit of a personal reason..."

"What was it?"

"Well... you look kinda, sorta, like my brother... Oh, I know it's foalish, don't laugh at me!" Twilight covered her head with her forehooves, her scarlet cheeks still visible.

"Well, at least we know that I have an Alt here, then. Thank you, Twiley."

"... Had an Alt. He... he died a few years back, the first time GlaDOS..." Twilight took a shuddering breath, letting it out slowly. "I'm okay. I... I was only a filly, but Cadance... she took care of me, and then I had my friends... He would've been proud, I think."

"Well, I may not be him, but as Captain of the Royal Guard, maybe not of this universe, but I am still proud to see my Alt's younger sister do what she can to save others."

"Thank you, that means a lot... brother."

"Hey, you're my LSBFF, no matter what universe you're from."

With everypony more at ease than before, they tried to think of a good way to pass the three hours.

'I want to see the testing facilities,' Chell wrote.

"I'd like to see the Guard barracks, and maybe train with them for a while," Shining stated.

"I kinda just want to learn more about the technology we'll be dealing with while fighting GLaDOS."

Twilight nodded. "Then you should go on the tour with Chell, but first..." Twilight makes a chirruping noise to her computer ("yeah, I'm gonna need to program the voice activation, that'll be much easier") "Process guest: Orange, female Earth Pony, diagnostics. Treat substantial wounds." Twilight turned to Chell. "This will more than likely hurt. Badly." Chell nodded as a few robotic arms dropped down around her, poking at her and injecting strange serums into her. She winced, but otherwise held still.

When the robots were done, Chell looked as good as new; even her limp was gone. Chell nodded in thanks, a grateful smile on her face.

"Alright! Now, you all have things you want to do, so what should we do first?"

15133211212222.content:
"Do I recognize any of you?" the alt-Twilight asked after reading the note. Regarding Chell and Shining Armor, she replied, "I'm afraid you two aren't very familiar..." She then turned toward Nyx. "... and you look almost exactly like the avatar Princess Luna used when she was the hacker terrorist, Cyber Moon, at least before my friends and I were able to reformat her. Oh, and don't worry about getting that stigma attached to you here. Those of us working with alternate universes know just how differently events can play out from one timeline to the next, even when counterparts are present, so as long as we all get along, there's no problem. Still, you do look just like that avatar... Are you connected in some way to Princess Luna?"

"You... could say we're related..." Nyx replied, still stunned by what she was seeing and hearing.

Chell, on the other hoof, was taking it in with almost startling ease. Scribbling furiously on her notepad, the next one asked, "And you work for Aperture? Who is in charge of it?"

Alt-Twilight nodded. "Well, that's a bit of a history lesson, but I'll try to keep it brief. Decades ago, Aperture was founded by a brilliant but frankly insane stallion who created some amazing things, but drove the company into the ground and eventually died of moon dust poisoning. The last thing he did before he died was have the mind of his secretary put into the cyber-construct GLaDOS, who, along with the new ownership, rebuilt Aperture Science. Unfortunately, the new owners either didn't realize or care that GLaDOS had the personality of a living being, so any time she was 'disagreeable', they created a patch or 'upgrade' to try to make her more compliant. Over time, this drove her bitter and insane."

Chell grimaced and wrote, "That sounds like my version. How did you deal with her?"

"It wasn't easy..." Alt-Twilight replied. "After she killed the executives and most of her 'test subjects', she began sending her machines to ponynap nearby settlements. Princess Celestia herself led the fight to recover them, but it was still a terrible battle. Eventually, GLaDOS's personality core was severed from the network, and anyone connected to Aperture who was still alive was put on trial for gross incompetence. GLaDOS herself, being a self-aware AI, faced the ponycide charges, but because of the extensive patching, it couldn't be determined how much of it was her own will, and how much was the fault of the programmers. Currently, she's held in a closed system while our own programmers try to figure out how to reformat her. Meanwhile, Aperture Science and its assets are now owned by the royal government."

Shining Armor spoke up softly, asking, "And... what about you, Twilight? Do you have any family? ... Siblings? Children?"

Alt-Twilight blinked in surprise, not having expected the questions to become directed at her personally. Hanging her head a little, she shook it slowly and replied, "Family? No, in this world...

"...my parents were captured in the first of GLaDOS' tests. My brother, a lieutenant? He was part of the final charge..."

Shining Armor let his eyes fall to the ground. Nyx stepped forward, gently, and put a hoof on Twilight's shoulder. "I'm... sorry for your loss."

"No, it's... I've had years to handle it. Princess Celestia helped, and Cadance adopted me after..." The unicorn looked up into her eyes. "Don't worry about me. I'm not going to go splitmad. I promise."

She cleared her throat awkwardly and turned to Shining Armor. "So! From your questions and your outfit, I'm guessing you're my alt's brother?"

Shining Armor glanced up. "Er, yes. I mean, are you okay with--"

"Oh thank the stars, I thought my alt must have married early or something! I mean," she backpedaled quickly, "no offense but--"

"...you know what I'm not going to ask." The unicorn turned to the final member of the group. "And you must be... somepony!"

My name is Chell. The earth pony tapped her throat meaningfully.

"Oh. I don't know a Chell. And you're mute, too..." Twilight coughed. "Well, it's time to get you three to processing, anyway. Don't worry, we'll send you back after--"

"Wait, wait wait." Nyx shook her head. "Back where we come from, GLaDOS just came back. We need to go deal with her!"

"Er... we never captured her." Shining gestured to Chell. "This pony actually pretty much blew her up singlehoofed, her and the entire facility. We thought she was dead."

"....what."

And the Cutie Mark Crusaders have their cutie marks.

"....okay, that one I can believe."

Also my cutie marks are functioning portals.

"....what."

Nyx shook her head, barely containing her laughter. "All right, that's enough of that. We seriously need your help with GLaDOS."

Twilight looked at the gathered trio. She shook her head once. Then she turned around, letting her gaze wander the lunar landscape...

152.content:
Approaching the unknown stallion, Nyx looked him over. She was pretty sure that he wasn't a new arrival in Ponyville, or Pinkie Pie would have thrown a welcoming party. But if not, then where had he come from? She reached out and gently nudged him with a hoof. This caused the stranger to stir where he lay, groaning and rubbing his head as he hesitantly stood up.

"Hey, are you alright?" Nyx asked as the stallion tried to get his bearings. "Who are you? Do you need any help?"

The grey stallion, becoming aware of the alicorn's presence, glanced up at her. "Y-yeah..." He then looked down at his hooves, then back at her a few times for some reason before letting out a breath. "Oh, thank God I made it... you're Nyx, aren't you? Come on, we have to hurry! I could only buy us a little time!" With that, he made his way toward the door, stumbling over his own hooves a little before he got his balance back.

Nyx, greatly confused, particularly by what he said about buying time. She followed him out to the hall, asking, "What are you talking about? Who ARE you?"

The stranger found a box of tools Apple Bloom had borrowed from various sources to help with the reconstruction of the castle. In it was a nail gun, a recently invented tool enchanted so that even ponies without magic could simply shoot nails into the wood at a quicker pace that it would take to hammer each one. "Perfect," he muttered, picking it up with his mouth and putting it into one of the pockets of his flannel shirt before replying, "Yeah, I didn't look like this the last time you saw me. I'm Alan Wake, the writer."

He was about to hurry out of the castle, but he glanced back and the utter lack of recognition expressed on Nyx's face made him turn back toward her. "You DO remember me, right? You should still be able to remember the Dark Place. How you, me and Zane brought Twilight Sparkle back to life?"

Nyx was even more confused. She had no idea who this pony was or how he claimed to know her. Unless the 'Dark Place' was supposed to be a metaphor or something, she'd never been there. And 'Alan Wake' and 'Zane' were such unusual names for ponies that she felt she would have remembered them if she had ever met them before, yet at the same time, this stallion acted as if they should know each other. When he brought up Twilight, however, her confusion turned into fuel for anger as she narrowed her eyes and suddenly reached out with her magic to lift him up off the floor.

"Back to life? What's that supposed to mean?! Did you do something to my mom?!" She snapped at him, shaking him up and down in the air, causing the contents of his pockets to slip out. Along with the nailgun, a flashlight fell out, followed by several sheets of typewritten paper that he tried to snatch out of the air before they fluttered to the ground, only to ineffectually bat them with his hooves.

"No! No, we were able to save her, remember? You gave up the last thousand years of your life to bring her back and pull everyone out of the Dark Place! Think back! I'm the one who gave you to her by putting you on that lakeshore! I wrote you a happy ending! Now you're the only ones who can help me against Mr. ****."

Nyx blinked and rubbed her ear. "Mr. what?"

"Mr. ****." She thought that he had said 'scratch' just then, and was pretty sure that's what her ears heard, but it was like something in her brain refused to process it. Like there was something so inherently wrong with the word that she instead heard it as the scratching of a vinyl record at one of DJ Pon-3's raves.

Nyx's turquoise eyes flashed with deepening suspicion and anger at the stallion's insane claims and bizarre linguistic trick. She shook him around harder with her magic until he stopped shouting, then pulled him closer so she could glare him right in the eye. "Listen here, 'Alan', I don't know who you think you are, or what kind of crazy nonsense you're talking about, but my mom and I are NOT characters in whatever story you're writing. Start telling me something that makes sense, or I'm throwing you in the dungeon until the Ponyville authorities come to figure out what to do with you."

Alan, dazed from being shaken around, replied, "Dungeon...? This is the princesses' vacation home, isn't it? That's nowhere near Ponyville..." He looked around, though, real dread beginning to creep into his expression. "No... no, this isn't, is it? Oh no... he tricked me. I'm in the wrong story!"
152.title: Opening narration

choices: Nyx gets the crazy pony back to Ponyville without incident

1522.content:
As tempting as it was to lock up the raving lunatic until she could bring the authorities to decide what to do about him, the truth was that Nyx had no real intention of doing so. He was crazy, sure, but at least he didn't seem dangerous. He'd quieted down, and as long as she kept an eye on him, Nyx was sure that she could keep him from getting himself into trouble. At least until they got back to Ponyville.

Alan, for his part, hung his head and quietly berated himself for being so stupid. He had panicked. Acted too hastily. And this was the price that he had to pay for his impatience.

-----------

It had been a long, grueling battle against the forces of his evil doppelganger, Mr. ****, but Alan had won. He had escaped the time loop Mr. **** had trapped him in, and Alan knew that he had nearly pulled himself out of the depths of the Dark Place. Standing in the light of a beautiful dawn, he was reunited with his wife once again.

As strange as it seemed to think back on, Wake owed a great deal of that moment to the inhabitants of another world. One bizarre and even ridiculous by the standards of his own, and he had been manipulated into giving the Dark Presence a foothold there. Yet no matter how silly the land of Equestria and its colorful pony inhabitants would have seemed to him before he wrote that tale, "Creeping Darkness", it was they who had given him the strength of heart to truly believe once again that a happy ending was possible.

Before that point, he had been drifting in the Dark Place, held back by his fears that all his efforts would prove futile. Without that guiding light of hope, he would have been worn down Mr. ****'s trap, and his psychotic double would have permanently taken his place in the real world. Instead, with the memories of Twilight Sparkle, Nyx, and the other ponies of Equestria to push him on, and the love for his wife Alice to pull him up out of the abyss, he had turned his enemy's trap against him. Bit by bit, he was able to put things right until finally, he watched Mr. **** dissolve in the light.

As his lips tenderly touched those of his wife, he knew that it still wasn't quite real, but it was closer than he had ever gotten before. Even if that moment of reunion was merely a dream, the connection was true. The barrier separating that wonderful dream from reality was no thicker than a soap bubble, and all it would take was one last push to break free of his dark prison.

And then the channel changed.

"Well isn't this all just SO touching?" An all too familiar voice whispered in the back of his mind. It was his own, but dripping with venomous sarcasm. Alan froze, prompting Alice to ask what was wrong, but he couldn't answer. He had won, or at least never been so close. But even though he kept embracing Alice, it felt as though he was drifting away from her again while the voice of his evil twin grew stronger, accompanied by a mocking clap.

"Bravo. I say bra-VO. You've gone and written yourself an ending. A weak Deus Ex Machina ending loaded with cheap sentimentality, but hey, by YOUR standards, it's practically a masterpiece. I'll try not to hold it against you that you stole my life to get it. After all... I've found a new one."

Alan clenched his eyes shut, clinging tightly to Alice as if to anchor himself against Mr. ****'s words, but he had to open them again when his double finished speaking. When he did, he saw a table where a television, powered by a small portable generator, sat next to an old typewriter. On the screen, in bright, colorful 2-D animation, was Equestria. He had never had a chance to see it in the daylight before, but there was no doubt of where the cartoon was set, as Mr. **** looked out at Alan through the screen... as a pony.

Objectively, it should have been ridiculous. Laughable, even. Seeing his nemesis as a cute little equine, identical to how he had appeared when he wrote himself into "Creeping Darkness"--albeit with slicked-back hair and a dapper--suit should have been the least threatening thing in the world. It would have been, but Alan knew what Mr. **** was. Alan knew what he would do to Equestria. Mr. **** was his dark mirror, manifesting every nasty rumor born from Alan's own history of belligerence and distilling it into a psychotic murderer who, human or pony, wore his face. When Alan used the light to burn Mr. **** out of his own world so that he could reclaim his life, he hadn't even thought that his connection to that magical world might have given Mr. **** a foothold there as well.

With a creepy smirk, Mr. **** leaned in close to the camera. "You know, I really have to thank you for not destroying this place when you had the chance. A world THIS retarded and saccharine deserves the attention of someone with a little more flair than you could ever produce. I mean really? REALLY? Your big champion in this world was a purple unicorn named Twilight Sparkle? The fact that you haven't slit your wrists in shame over that alone says so much more about you than even I thought, but don't you worry. Once I figure out how to hold a knife with these stupid hooves, I'm going to be sure to have some extra special fun with her and that little Mary Sue 'daughter' of hers. You and Alice enjoy your reunion... I'll enjoy mine."

With that, Mr. **** reached for the power button of his camera, and the television went dead. Alan grit his teeth in frustration, letting out a cry of "DAMMIT!" He reluctantly held Alice at arm's length, looking down at the ground. "I'm sorry, Alice... I'm so sorry, but I can't come back to you yet..." His wife, so close yet a million miles away, looked confused and distressed as she had not seen Mr. ****. That had been a message for Alan alone. "I don't have time to explain everything," he said, "but there's someone I have to stop. Pon-... people who don't have any idea what sort of danger they're in, and right now I'm the only one who can warn them. But I made it this far... got this close to coming back to you. I swear, Alice, I WILL come back!"

He couldn't know how much of that she heard, though. He saw her lips move to say something, but the sound was faint and muffled, as though heard through several feet of water. She was getting farther away from him... or rather, he was drifting away from her as he slowly sank back into the Dark Place, where his words would have the power to reach Equestria. She slowly vanished from his sight, leaving Alan alone with the typewriter.

Alan took a seat in front of the device. He knew that it was a double-edged sword. Simply the act of using it would require him to pay a price. At that very moment, he was sacrificing the progress he had made in exchange for a chance to save a world far more innocent than his own.

But what could he write? The Dark Place would require a horror story from him. Worse, it would be a sequel. The stakes would be even higher than they were with "Creeping Darkness". At that time, the Dark Presence had acted through a denizen of Equestria. Nightmare Moon had been a monster, made even moreso by becoming the Dark Presence's vessel, but she had been consistent with the tone of that world. Mr. **** was a vicious, sadistic killer. An out-of-context villain.

Against Nightmare Moon, they had been able to create an ending in which no pony was harmed. The Dark Place would not allow them to get off so lightly a second time. As Alan's fingertips hovered above the typewriter's keys, he knew that if he wrote this story, he would be unable to do so without ponies dying. Equestria and its inhabitants would be stained one way or another, which was certainly Mr. ****'s intention in the first place. Another trap... to force Alan to either watch helplessly while Mr. **** had his way, or have him take action and pay for it by sacrificing innocent victims with his words the way he had in Bright Falls with the story "Departure".

Alan thought frantically. There HAD to be something else that he could barter. Some other currency that the Dark Place would accept. Try as he might, though, he simply couldn't think of any means to wrest control of the story from Mr. **** without costing some pony their life... Control. Control was the issue. What if he were to relinquish the control that his writing gave him?

He had always written himself into the story, in order to fight the Dark Presence before, but only after preparations had been made. Without his input, the Dark Presence would fill in the blanks to give itself the advantage. To go in without a plan or outline was the ultimate gamble, but the inhabitants of Equestria had given him hope once before. It was just a feeling, but he felt that the only acceptable course was to trust in them once again.

Alan Wake began to type. Not the pages that he usually usually used to lay the groundwork for his trials, but simply a few paragraphs to arrange for his arrival. As a sequel, the best choice for a protagonist was Nyx, the purified form of Nightmare Moon. He would meet her once again, not as a filly but as a powerful young mare, trying to find her place in the world. The reformed villain versus a new, more terrible evil. It was the best that he could come up with on such short notice, and as he felt himself undergo the painful transition of traveling between worlds, he prayed it would be enough.
1522.title: See what the others think

choices: A Taken!
A confused and frightened pony.
15223.content:
As Alan walked along the path he sighed, having gathered his thoughts. He didn't know how or why he was in this world, different yet so nearly identical to the Equestria he had visited before. It might have had something to do with his lack of scene-setting before inserting himself into it, but his gut said no. It was almost certainly a trap laid by Mr. ****, but as little detail as he had gone into, he had still written himself into the story in pursuit of his psychotic doppelganger. Mr. **** was here somewhere, and it was only a matter of time before he made his move. That was why Alan had written himself to appear in the middle of the day, to give himself a few precious hours of preparation before nightfall.

Looking back over his shoulder at Nyx, he said, "Look, I'm... I'm sorry I freaked you out with all those things I said. I was confused, and I got you mixed up with someone I knew before, so I can't blame you for thinking I'm crazy. I need you to believe me about this, though. There's a man... er... pony named Mr. ****, and he may be the most dangerous thing you've ever seen."

"Oh yeah?" Nyx raised a skeptical eyebrow, having faced Scorpios, Hydras, and a Lupus Major. And for a time, she'd been the most dangerous thing she'd ever seen. Plus, she had doubts that this Mr. **** even existed, no matter what Alan did to cause that bizarre scratching sound in her brain whenever he said that name.

Dead serious, he stopped in the path and turned around to firmly state, "I mean it, Nyx. The whole reason I'm here is to stop him before he does irreparable harm to this place. He's a creature of pure--" Alan stopped in mid-sentence as the light of day grew dim. And though it could have just been a cloud passing by overhead, he looked over his shoulder at the sky only to have his worst fear realized. "--Darkness..." Where the sun had been high in the sky just minutes ago, it was now setting already.

"Dammit, NO!" he cried up at the sky. Likewise, Nyx's turquoise eyes went wide with surprise and worry. She knew that she wasn't causing the premature sunset, so why would Celestia and/or Luna do so? Alan slapped against his forehead and began berating himself again. "Stupid... STUPID! Why did I do that?! I should have known trying to give too much information too early would trigger this!"

Before he could say anything else, Nyx pushed him down onto the dirt road and pinned him down with her forelegs. "What do you mean?! Do you know what's causing this?" she asked with an accusing glare.

"It's... it's Mr. ****! It has to be, he's making his move earlier than I expected! I thought that I might be able to get here early enough to warn princess Celestia not to let the sun set, but that just made the darkness act sooner. Mr. **** must have caught the princesses off guard somehow, and now he's bringing the night." He pointed a hoof toward the rapidly dwindling golden rays of sunset. "Once it's dark, every pony that isn't in the light is going to be in danger! We have to get to Ponyville NOW!"

Nyx's heart and mind raced. She wanted to think that Alan was just crazy, considering how much he'd gotten wrong about her, but the simple fact was that the night shouldn't be falling so soon. And he sounded so certain and urgent that something horrible was going to happen, she couldn't help but start to grow fearful over what might happen to her friends and neighbors if, Celestia forbid, he was actually on to something.

"Fine," she said, getting off of him. She then flipped the flashlight on with her magic and levitated it to him before pulling him up onto her back. He was heavy, but she was strong enough to carry a passenger as she spread her wings and launched herself down the path.

he last bit of sunlight vanished over the horizon, and Nyx felt a chill as it felt like a wave of darkness rolled over the land like a dark wave. It wasn't just the absence of light, but rather something like a cold, oppressive fog that dimmed even the light of Luna's moon and stars. With Alan pointing the flashlight in front of her and her intimate knowledge of the path, though, she was able to twist and bank her way down the road.

When the edge of Ponyville started to come into view, Nyx noticed that there was virtually no activity along the road like there should have been for that time of day. Even with the premature night, there should have been a few ponies caught out in it, still making their way home. Vague worry started to settle like a cold stone in the pit of her stomach as she wondered what had happened.

Alan had a far more concrete, and vastly more terrifying idea of what may have occurred, though he tried to hold onto some hope that it hadn't progressed that far yet. He panned the flashlight around from side to side, scanning the path until the beam fell upon a pony-shaped figure moving through the darkness. Nyx saw it too and banked toward the shape before he could warn her of the potential danger. Within moments, they were close enough for him to identify it as...
15223.title: It's not me this time!

choices: Throw Alan the nailgun!
Protect Diamond Tiara first!
152232.content:
Nyx landed near the pony to check on them once she got close enough, but Alan was prepared for something completely different. Hopping off of Nyx's back once she slowed down, he braced himself and focused the beam of the flashlight on the equine, ready to burn the shadows from it if it proved to be Taken.

Instead of recoiling from the light, however, the lavender pony caught in the beam just brought a hoof up to shield her eyes while the light glinted off of the tiara atop her head. "Gah, who's there?! If you try to kidnap me, I'll scream so loud, the entire town'll hear it!"

Both Alan and Nyx were glad that at least it was another pony, but for Nyx it was tempered by recognition of WHICH young mare they had found as Alan moved the beam away so as not to blind her any more. With a groan, she asked, "Diamond Tiara? What are YOU doing out here?"

As Diamond Tiara's night vision gradually recovered, she recognized the alicorn's voice and accusingly snapped, "Nyx?! I KNEW it! As soon as I saw the sun setting, I just KNEW you were behind it! I'm going to make sure everypony knows it, too!"

She tried to dash off back to town, but Nyx just facehoofed and used her magic to turn the snobby earth pony back around toward them. "For Celestia's sake, Tiara, even if I wanted to, I'm nowhere near strong enough to move the sun and moon anymore. I'm just as confused as you are!"

"She's right," Alan said, taking the opportunity to put the flashlight in a pocket of his flannel shirt so that the beam would shine out in front of him and leave his mouth free. "I've been with her the whole time. This is the work of someone else, and as long as we're out here in the darkness, we're all in danger. We need to get into the light, and make sure every pony we can find does the same."

Diamond Tiara looked at Alan suspiciously. "I'm sorry, and you are... what... a lumberjack or something?" she asked, though there was a quiver in her voice betraying her fear. With a haughty sniff, she added, "You know what? I don't care if you're the king of the griffons, you two can do whatever you like! I'M going home and telling my daddy about this. Then you won't be able to make any excuses!"

She started to move away again, and this time Nyx didn't try to stop her. As she did, however, the darkness seemed to deepen like a thick mist, and Alan burst into motion to chase after her as the darkness started to obscure their view of her. "No! Wait, stick with us! There are Taken coming, and you don't have a light!"

Nyx followed Alan, and with narrowed eyes asked, "What's a Taken?" She soon got her answer, however, when she suddenly heard Diamond Tiara's scream pierce through the thick darkness! Her breath catching in her throat, the alicorn quickly summoned up a light spell around the tip of her horn to supplement the beam of Alan's flashlight, and this proved just enough to make the darkness spread apart and reveal a stallion wreathed in what looked almost like an aura of shadow.

On the ground, apparently knocked down by the shadowed pony, was Diamond Tiara, screaming in terror and pain as it pinned her down with a hoof. Nyx gasped in shock at the sight, but only for a moment as she instinctively launched herself at the creature... the Taken. Regardless of whether or not she and Diamond Tiara got along, she was still worth protecting.

When she body-slammed the Taken, however, it barely flinched. Instead, Nyx was the one who recoiled in pain from the impact, the shadows surrounding the Taken protected it somehow, and burned even the teenaged alicorn to the touch. Nyx had heard about substances that were so cold that it felt like being burned if you touched them, but had never understood it until this moment. Those shadows didn't just absorb the light, it was as if they stole the life out of anyone who got too close, and Diamond Tiara was still pinned by the monster.

Alan immediately stepped up, however, and focused his flashlight on the Taken, causing it to recoil away from Nyx and Diamond Tiara as it tried to shield itself from the light. As Alan tightened the beam, the shadows protecting it started to burn away while he shouted, "You need to burn away the darkness with light, Nyx! That's the only way to harm these things! Now quick, give me the nailgun!"

Nyx, stunned as she was, nevertheless started to comply as it became clear that Alan actually did know what he was talking about where these creatures were concerned. Before she could use her magic to give it to him, however, there was a rustling in the grass as two more Taken suddenly appeared, lurching toward Diamond Tiara. They were already setting upon the wounded earth pony, reaching for her and giving Nyx precious little time to react.
152232.title: Of all the ponies in Ponyville...

choices: ... relents and goes to Tiara's house first.
... convinces Tiara to go to the library with her.
1522322.content:
Seeing the danger Diamond Tiara was in, Nyx didn't have time to think. She acted on pure reflex, dropping the nailgun to instead focus her magic on shining a beam of light on the two Taken before they could touch her foalhood rival, tightening the beam enough to force the monsters back away from her as Nyx advanced on them. Just as it was Alan's flashlight, the protective shadows emanating from them burned away, leaving them open as she drew close enough to spin around and deliver a powerful bucking kick that didn't just send one of them flying, but caused the thin pony-shaped shell the Taken wore to split open, exposing the darkness inside to the light where it rapidly burned away into nothingness!

Diamond Tiara gasped at the sight. "You... you killed him," she exclaimed in horror. Nyx herself was stunned as well, because she never meant to kill it. The Taken, whatever they were, looked just like real ponies. The thought of it gave the teenaged alicorn a cold chill in the pit of her stomach.

"There's nothing to kill," Alan's voice refuted. He was still holding off his own Taken with the flashlight, but lacking the means to finish it off, he backed toward the discarded nailgun. "They're nothing but fragments of the Dark Presence that just look like ponies!" He had almost reached the tool when his flashlight suddenly flickered and dimmed enough that the Taken he had been blinding was no longer held at bay.

At the same time, Diamond Tiara suddenly screamed, "Nyx, look out!" The second of the Taken that had been coming for her reared up while Nyx was distracted, and was about to slam its hooves against her head!

Nyx reflexively ducked, her horn glowing as she summoned a short blade of concentrated magic, thrusting it up into the Taken before it could bring its weight down on her! Instead of the weight of a dead pony falling down on her, however, it simply dissolved into embers and wisps of shadow.

Her heart pounding in her chest, Nyx stood up and turned toward Alan, who was reaching for the nailgun while trying to fend off the Taken without the light. It was just out of his reach as the monster bore down on him!

Nyx's horn glowed as she cried out, "Alan!" A beam of light shot from her horn to push the Taken away, only for it to suddenly be stopped by a wall of darkness that seemed to erupt from the ground!

"Ah ah ahhhh," she heard Alan's voice say, but in a smug, sarcastic inflection she hadn't heard from the flannel-wearing pony. "You only get to save one whiny little bitch in this scene, and you already made your choice."

The wall of shadow receded a bit. Just enough for Nyx and Diamond Tiara to see Alan pinned down by the Taken on the other side, and another pony accompanying them. Smirking at Nyx through the darkness was an earth pony who looked identical to Alan, but with slicked-back hair and a sharp black suit.

Alan grunted, struggling to get free, but to no avail. "Nyx! No matter what happens, keep the light-" He was interrupted with a swift kick to the head from his doppelganger, causing him to pass out.

"Hmph. What an idiot. Not being able to shut up is what got him into this mess in the first place." Alan's dark twin laughed cruelly as the Taken started dragging Alan away. With a cocky smirk, he turned to Nyx and said, "Oh, by the way, I loved that bit with the sword. I'm a fan of blades, myself. Sometimes you want to go with blunt trauma for fun or expediency, but nothing puts a look of terror on someone's face quite like light gleaming off a sharp edge."

Nyx felt her throat go dry at the pony's words. "You're the one he was talking about, aren't you...? You're Mr. ****. What did you do to the princesses?!"

Mr. **** laughed and replied, "Same thing I'm going to do to Wake, pretty much. I'll leave it to your imagination for now... after all, you'll find out for yourself soon enough. So long, Mary Sue."

The wall of darkness rose up one again, blocking her view of Mr. **** before it vanished, leaving nothing behind but Alan's flashlight and nailgun. Feeling weak and sick, Nyx walked over to the discarded items.

"Who was that...? WHAT was that?!" Diamond Tiara was staring at the spot where Mr. **** had stood, her eyes wide and her voice cracking with near-hysteria.

"I don't know, exactly..." Nyx replied, hanging her head. "Something horrible. Alan's the only pony who knows for sure, but he got taken away because I thought he was crazy and didn't listen..." With her magic, she lifted up the flashlight and nailgun, floating them in front of Diamond Tiara. "Here, take these."

Diamond Tiara blinked, fear transitioning into indignation. "What?! Why should I? You're the one who goes on and on about 'I'm a shield, meant to protect other ponies!' Well, protect me!"

"I will!" Nyx snapped at the snobby mare, pushing the items against her insistently. "But... I... I might not be able to! I might make a mistake! All I had to do was throw Alan the nailgun before saving you. It would've only taken a moment, and you could've both been safe... You should at least have something to defend yourself with in case I make another mistake..."

Diamond Tiara blinked again, but didn't really have a retort for that. In any other situation, seeing Nyx admitting fault or weakness would have given her an opening to snark at each other, but with genuine threats possibly lurking behind every shadow, it only served to make her think about how she was caught smack in the middle of this horrifying situation. The thought of not making it home, or getting back there only to find dark monsters seized her heart, and after a moment's hesitation she grasped for the tools.

While the other pony worked out how she would hold both the light and the gun, Nyx thought frantically to herself. "Okay, the princesses can't help us now... the Elements of Harmony will probably work! We can get to the library, and from there find the other Element bearers, then..."

"NO!" Nyx was started from her thoughts by Diamond Tiara's sudden interjection. "No, you're going to take me to my house!"

"Tiara, we need to think about how to save everypony. Twilight..."

"... is your family! Well I have family too, and right now, all they know is I'm stuck out here in the dark where there are monsters roaming around! If we go to the library, you gather all her friends up and have your adventure to save the day, while my parents are at home scared out of their minds! Or worse, they get attacked without knowing how to protect themselves from those horrible Taken things!"

This time, Nyx was actually taken aback a bit. She was so used to Diamond Tiara being a spoiled, selfish brat that she had a hard time thinking that Tiara had a heart too, sometimes. But this argument hit especially close to home for the alicorn, because if there was only one thing that they could find any sort of common ground on, it was their love for their parents. She could imagine the Taken attacking the library, but at least Twilight had experience with monsters and adventures. She'd probably started taking precautions the instant the sun went down ahead of schedule. Tiara's parents, though, who could say how well they would deal with such a disaster? But at the same time, Twilight and the others were probably their best chance of defeating Mr. **** and resolving everything as soon as possible.

After a bit of thought, Nyx...

The Darkness was everywhere. It had barely been five minutes when they were jumped by more taken, these ones unicorns. Diamond Tiara had whimpered and shone her flashlight on them, while Nyx blasted concentrated beams of light that staggered them, allowing her to buck them. Diamond would not use the nail gun.

Her flashlight was dimming.

"We need batteries," Nyx said.

"W-we can get more at my house! It's not that far away!"

"That's what's worrying me. We should have gotten there by now, and no matter which street I look down, I can see your swing. Look."

Tiara looked the way Nyx was indicating and gasped. Her swing! She hadn't used it in ages...

And the light above it was dark. "What happened to the street light? Daddy's got it running on its own generator, I used to go swinging at night when he worked late. I always wanted to be the first bright thing he saw when he got home, so I got him to get it put in, I even gave up half my allowance for almost two years for that..."

Nyx looked at Diamond Tiara in a new found light, which was dampened when she realized the ominous sight meant. "Then that means we look until we find the one with a streetlight."

That settled, the dysfunctional duo kept walking.

When they turned the next corner, they saw it! Home! But, in front of it, just beyond the circle of light was...

Option one: Filthy Rich. He's been Taken! Yeah, Takin' STEROIDS! He's almost as big as Big Mac!

Option 2: Diamond's Parents. Filthy Rich is trying to go looking for their daughter, but his wife- whose body has flickering darkness crawling up her sides- is telling him to get back inside, lock the doors, and turn off the lights.
15223221.title: A Crooked Mile
