Something happens to prevent Nyx from curing her
152232212.content:
The cone of light that shone down on Diamond Tiara's swing seemed all the brighter and more welcoming in contrast to the unnatural, primordial darkness that surrounded the two mares. On the other side, the outlines of two equine figures could be seen.

"Darling, I'm scared," a mare's voice said, sounding terrified and slightly distorted as she clung to the other figure. "This night isn't natural, and these things running around...! Please, let's go back inside and turn off the lights before they're drawn here!"

A deeper, masculine voice replied, "Not without Diamond Tiara. We can't leave her alone like this."

"I'm sure she's with the Spoons, staying safely locked away with her friend."

"Maybe, but I need to know for sure before-"

Hearing their voices, Diamond Tiara's breath caught in her throat. Letting out a relieved sigh, she ran toward them and cried out, "Mommy! Daddy!"

"Diamond?" The shape with the voice of Filthy Rich looked up toward the sound of his daughter's voice, and he quickly moved to meet her. The father and daughter both stepped into the light between them at the same time, staring at each other for a moment before meeting in the middle for a loving embrace. "Diamond! I'm so relieved you're alright!"

Nyx was a little stunned at the sight. That expression on Diamond Tiara's face... it had to be the first time that the alicorn had seen her childhood bully genuinely smiling without any meanness or smugness behind it. She almost didn't want to interrupt as she joined them under the light, which seemed to brighten even more. Still, she let them have a moment before she would remind them of the danger surrounding them.

That was when she noticed that one pony wasn't joining them. "Mrs. Rich, come over here into the light. It's not safe out there!"

Instead of doing so, however, Diamond's mother shrieked, "Darling, get away! It's a trick! That's not our daughter!"

Diamond Tiara gasped in shock. "What?! Mommy, what are you talking about? Of course it's me!"

"Sweety, it's Diamond Tiara," Filthy Rich protested, looking at his daughter. "I know our daughter, and she came to find us." Noticing Nyx's presence, he nodded gratefully to the alicorn. "And you brought her here... thank you, Nyx."

Nevertheless, Diamond's mother exclaimed in a voice that chilled everypony present, "It's a lie, darling! That monster is using the light to cast a spell on you! It isn't our daughter, it's one of those things, wrapped in some sort of illusion! Come back out of the light, and you'll see it for what it really is!"

Diamond Tiara was the first to break the hug with her father, exclaiming, "Mommy, it's really me! Look!" She started to move toward her mother, but Nyx quickly put herself between them. "Nyx, get your flank out of the way!"

"Wait," Nyx replied firmly. "Something's not right here..." Turning her gaze out into the darkness, she lit up her horn and focused it into a beam of light, illuminating Diamond's mother.

The mare screamed in a voice that grew more and more distorted, and recoiled as though acid had been thrown on her. She quickly threw a foreleg up over her face as she staggered back, and the two earth ponies in the light gasped as they saw wisps of darkness leaking out of her mouth and eyes like smoke.

"Mom!" Diamond shrieked. Seeing her mother in such a state, she started slapping at Nyx. "Stop it! You're hurting her!" Her frightened blows weren't strong, but surprised her enough that the alicorn's beam flickered off.

A moment later, something flew through the air overhead. It smashed into the street lamp's bulb, causing the area to be plunged into darkness once again. Immediately, the ponies found themselves surrounded by the sounds of Taken all around them, hulking shapes moving in the blackness.

Nyx choked for a moment, but then shouted, "Everypony, get in the house! Now!"

Filthy Rich, surprised by the sudden appearance of so many Taken, nevertheless kept his wits about him enough to hurry for the house, pulling Diamond Tiara along with him. The young earth pony reached out toward her mother, screaming, "No! We can't leave mom!"

"I've got her," Nyx shouted back, reaching out with her magic to pick Diamond's mother up off the ground before she had a chance to slip away into the darkness and mass of Taken. Not again. Not if I can help it, she thought, images of Alan Wake being stolen away by Mr. **** still fresh in her mind. Once she had her aura around the darkness-touched mare, she galloped after the earth ponies at full speed.

It wasn't the most dignified way to enter a house, but this was no time for dignity. She threw herself into the mansion like a black blur, the struggling mare held up right behind her as Diamond Tiara and Filthy Rich both slammed the doors shut and latched them as securely as they could once everypony was inside. Nyx panted a bit before snapping, "Lights! Turn on every light you've got! Candles, lanterns, everything!" She couldn't do much herself, focusing her attention and magic on keeping Diamond's mother restrained as the other two earth ponies quickly ran around, gathering up every source of illumination they could find.

While they were busy doing that, brightening the house enough to at least temporarily ward off the Taken, Diamond's mother screamed and thrashed around in the magical field.

"What's happened to her...?" Filthy Rich asked, wincing whenever his wife let out a cry. "What are those things? Were they... ponies?"

"Taken..." Nyx replied. "The pony who told me about them said they were like puppets animated by some sort of living darkness. But this..." She looked Diamond's mother over very carefully. When she opened her eyes briefly, Nyx could see that behind the wisps of darkness were the eyes of a normal, terrified pony. A realization came to her that made a cold pit form in the stomachs of both her and Filthy Rich when she expressed it. "This is almost like... the Blessing."

"Then... you can cure her, right? The way you cured me?" Filthy Rich asked tentatively while Diamond Tiara replaced the batteries in her flashlight and shone it outside the windows to ward off any remaining Taken that might be lurking just outside.

Nyx admitted, "I don't know... it's similar, but not exactly the same. This didn't come from me, so I don't know what might happen, but I can try... if you'll let me."

Diamond snapped, "Don't you dare do anything that might hurt her, Nyx! Don't you dare!" The earth pony's eyes watered with worry and grief at the sight of her mother in such a state, glaring at Nyx in a way that promised revenge if even the slightest thing went wrong. But Filthy Rich placed his hoof on her shoulder, causing her to look at him and calm down slightly.

With a nod to Nyx, the stallion said quietly, "Do what you can... please."

Nyx nodded back, then took a deep breath to focus as she set Diamond's mother down on a sofa. "It'll help if you hold her down."
152232212.title: The Trap of Sweet Words

choices: Mrs. Rich reunited with her family, now cured.
A giant Taken minotaur smashing the mansion!
1522322121.content:
Filthy Rich looked at his wife with worry in his eyes, but helped to hold her down and told Diamond Tiara to do the same. With the two earth ponies' assistance, Nyx was able to let go of the struggling mare and focus her magic in a more precise, almost surgical way. Reaching out with her magic, she sent 'feelers' out into her patient's eyes and mouth where the wisps of darkness were emanating from.

The idea was to draw out the dark magic from her, pulling it out like a weed much as she had when freeing her 'followers' from the Blessing. As she had told Filthy Rich, however, this was a very different case. Each Blessing had been a tiny fragment of her own power, eager to be pulled out of its victim if it meant being rejoined with the original. That had made it easy to reveal and destroy the corruption. This darkness, however, belonged to Mr. ***** and didn't want to obey her will. Instead, it retreated from her, burrowing deeply inside Mrs. Rich.

Beads of sweat started to form on Nyx's brow as she cast her magic deeper and deeper to follow the darkness. She didn't want to show it in front of the others, but she was afraid that she might not be able to remove the darkness without harming Mrs. Rich. Sensing it moving toward the mare's heart, she quickly focused her concentration. By putting more of her consciousness into the magic itself, she was able to increase its speed and precision, avoiding causing harm as she quickly moved to cut the darkness off before it could reach the center of Mrs. Rich's being.

That was when the darkness that was already there sprang its ambush. Black tendrils lashed out from Mrs. Rich's heart, surrounding and ensnaring Nyx's own magic, pulling it and the alicorn's consciousness deeper and deeper away from the physical world, until Nyx found herself not in the Rich's mansion, but in a dark cabin. There was no light, but Nyx could nevertheless make out a few bookshelves, and a writing desk too tall for a normal pony, and a typewriter resting on it, though the characters on the keys didn't match Equestria's written language. A stack of blank paper was placed nearby.

"You like that, Nyx?" The smarmy voice of Mr. ***** chilled the alicorn as she spun around to face him. Nothing there. She turned back to the typewriter, only to suddenly find him standing up on his hind legs, leaning back with his forelegs on the desk. "You know what it is? It's the most powerful weapon in the world. And that sentimental idiot Wake just gave it up, because he thought that it was the only way to give you four-legged jellybeans a chance of getting through this without losses. I'm gonna let you in on a little secret though, Nyxie. There was never a chance of that happening."

Nyx felt cold as Mr. ***** spoke. "You're wrong," she replied with all the defiance she could muster. "I don't know where you came from, or who you think you are, but as long as I live, I won't let you hurt anypony!"

"Oh, but you will," Mr. ***** replied with a bored shrug. "Because those are the rules. That's the sort of story this is. Wake knew that, and that's why he left the typewriter. He gave up the ability to shape the course of this story, because he knew that if he used it, ponies would die. Sacrifices to appease the darkness just enough to let him write a win, delivered into the gaping maw of chaos by the very same 'hero' fighting to save the world!"

He flashed Nyx a toothy grin. "Oh, you didn't know that, did you? Flannel-boy never told you that. Oh yes, he's a murderer like me. If you want to win, you have to be willing to lose sometimes. Equivalent exchange. Dramatic tension. You wouldn't believe how many people he murdered to get this far. The big difference between him and me is that he did it with words."

Mr. ***** vanished, reappearing in a blink right in front of Nyx. He looked her straight in the eye, his own so much like Alan's. But while those eyes superficially resembled a pony's, Nyx could feel that they were just a thin veneer, and behind them was nothing but darkness and emptiness. "So that brings us to you, Nyxie. Wake isn't the hero of this story anymore... you are. The ex-villain Mary Sue who's now fighting with all her pure pureness to save her world from eternal darkness and chaos. If that's the role you want to play, what are you willing to give up for it?"

Nyx was startled and reared back. She tried to hit him with her hooves, but he vanished and reappeared elsewhere. "I won't give anypony up," she exclaimed. "You can't make me believe that's how this works!"

"But you've already seen it," Mr. **** replied, avoiding a shock of magic lightning that sent the stack of paper exploding into smoldering sheets. "Wake writes himself into the story to prepare you, and I take out your Deus Ex Machina princesses. (Speaking of which, princesses? Seriously? Queen it up, bitches!) Wake tries to tell you what's going on, and I kick things off early. You get faced with the choice to save one pony, and lose the other. And now you're trying to save another pony from my grip. What do you think'll happen if you succeed? Hmm... maybe a mom for a mom? You save the mother of someone you hate, and in exchange, your own gets dragged screaming into the darkness. What do you say? You willing to give up Twilight Sparkle to... God, just saying that name makes me want to vomit."

"Shut up!" Nyx shouted at Mr. ***** as she gathered her magic. "Even if I believed you, my mother would never want me to sacrifice somepony else for her!" Whatever this cabin was supposed to be, she still knew where it was. Whatever the source of it was, she was inside the darkness in Mrs. Rich's heart. Mr. *****, or at least the fragment of him controlling this darkness, was probably trying to distract her from the fact that it put her in the perfect position to do what she intended to. Her horn glowed brighter and brighter, filling the room with light and causing the writing room to start crumbling away as she attacked the darkness.

"You're making a mistaaaa-" Mr. ***** shouted at her as the light pushed him against the walls, leaving him nowhere to vanish to as he dissolved before her eyes into so many embers. As the room vanished into white, she drove the shadows out and destroyed them by filling Mrs. Rich with light from the inside out.

When Nyx opened her real eyes again, finding herself back in the Rich's mansion, she heard...

Mrs. Rich's eyes lit up with a brilliant white light and she gasped, a silent scream passing through her as the darkness was washed away. Mrs/ Rich flopped gracelessly to the floor, her eyes staring at Nyx with unease, but also... thanks. Nyx gave her a small smile, and prepared to leave while the three fell into a heartwarming family hug. She opened the front door, and was just stepping out when Diamond broke away from her parents. "Wait, Nyx..."

Nyx looked back. "Yes, Tiara?"

"I... What should we do, Nyx?" Nyx's smile widened a bit.

"Well, you can either hole up in here, and turn on- and keep on- every light in the house, or you can go out and help others who might need you. Silver Spoon could be suffering from the same thing as your mother, or she could be having her life stolen away like they were doing to you. It's not my choice to make, Tiara. It's yours and your family's. Thus town is prone to panic, and the panic and chaos that I haven't seen worries me just as much as the darkness. Just remember two things. Keep extra light bulbs at hoof, extra candles and matches nearby, and always have extra batteries for your flashlights."

Nyx dropped down to Diamond Tiara's side and gave her a friendly nuzzle. "The most important thing you need to do is protect yourself. Now, I need to go save my own mother, so she and I can work together." Nyx gave a nod to Diamond's parents before heading out, closing the door behind her.

"Well, Filthy..." Diamond looked towards her mother, whose voice had a hesitant tremble to it. "You heard the mare, go find every battery you can. Diamond, grab all the flashlights you can find. I'll get... I'll get my frying pan. You get something to use as well, Filthy." She looked down, scuffing the floor. "I've never been the best of pony, and the one pony I've possibly been the worst to just... j-just saved my life. I-It was s-so d-dark, a-and c-cold..." She choked on her words as she shuddered.

"Don't worry, Extra. We'll get everything ready." Filthy moved off, his heart burning with a passionate fury. He'd always loved his wife, even when she was overbearing, but nothing- nothing put his family in danger without paying a price. Nyx had paid her debt in full, now he had a debt of his own.

Her arrival was met with a blast of green flame that she had to duck under. Upon seeing her more clearly in the brief burst of light, however, the baby dragon yelped. "Oh, Nyx, I'm sorry! I thought maybe you were one of those crazy ponies! I didn't get you, did I? Oh, man, I don't know what's happening!"

Nyx closed the door behind her and latched it shut. "It's okay, Spike, I just need to tell- MOM!!" As her eyes adjusted to the dim candle light inside the library after the flame briefly blinded her, she saw Spike struggling to hold down Twilight Sparkle. The unicorn was snarling and thrashing against him as Spike held onto her with all his might. Wisps of darkness filtered out of her eyes and mouth like smoke. "Mom...! Spike, when did this happen?!"

"About five minutes ago! Some of those crazy ponies were trying to break the door down, so Twilight and I held it shut. I guess they gave up, but then this black cloud started flowing in!" The baby dragon shivered as he remembered how cold it had been. Cold enough to chill him through his thick scales, and how it felt like it was going to extinguish his inner dragon fire. But he had heard Twilight struggling, and he used that fire to burn away the darkness, only to find her possessed as she currently was, trying to snuff out the candle. As thought back on the horrifying events, he almost lost control of Twilight, who nearly bucked him off before Nyx could think to help him.

Five minutes ago, the alicorn thought to herself, the words playing themselves over and over again in her head. If I had come straight to the library... if I hadn't taken the time to cure Diamond's mother... I could have been here to protect her... In the back of her mind, she could hear Mr. ***** laughing at her. Mocking her foalish naivete. Worse was a dark little voice in her heart that agreed with him. Whispering to her that she shouldn't have bothered with the Riches. It was so much worse, because that voice was her own.

"I... I'm sorry... I got here as fast as I could..." she stammered, even as that little voice in her head called her a liar. "I can fix this! I can-"

Before she could finish, something smashed into the library through one of the windows. A sharp, cold breeze blew through the room, making the weak candle flame sputter out.

"Wop!" There was no reason why Nyx thought the sound fit, but that's what she thought she heard as she immediately shot light through her horn, trying to stop her mom from having even the slightest chance of escape.

It was a good thing her reaction was so well timed, as well, since Twilight had a hoof on the door, howling in primal anger and agony as the darkness tried to get away from the light. Twilight was cold. Too cold. She couldn't move. What was movement? Movement was bad. really bad. it hurt to move. Better to just stand. Nothing to hurt there. Just the cold. The cold was your friend. Cold and Darkness. Protection from the heat of anger and fear. Protection from the burning, torturous light. But she was Celestia's student. Princess Celestia was the Sun. Wasn't she? Wasn't the sun good? Celestia was good. No! She was bad. Evil Celestia. She used the sun to burn us, to make us uncomfortable. To make us work. Better to have darkness. Stay away from the light. What was that?

Before her, was the Ponyville train station. She hadn't walked here. How'd she get here? Here wasn't safe. Too much light! Stay away! Stay away! We cannot get close! But no. The light was warm. Darkness cold. We like the darkness. Don't I? Yes. Yes, we do. But I like the light. I like to read. I can't read in the dark. Not without light. Light was good. She walked towards the light. "Mom!"

~~~

Rainbow Dash couldn't see. But that was okay. It was dark. The sky got dark. She was in the sky. No walls. Nothing to trap her. Just had to keep flying. But she wasn't flying. It hurt to fly. She couldn't open her wings. Why couldn't she open her wings? Because we don't need them to fly. Yes, I don't need my wings. Flying without pain is better. But I'm not flying. Yes we are. We are flying fast. No. I am standing still, but not still. It's dark. I'm... Falling. Flying. Falling. Falling. Dark. Cold. Move my wings. We have no wings. My wings hurt. It hurts to move. Falling. Pain. Cold. Fear. We do not fear the cold. I fear the cold. We do not fear the dark. I fear the dark. We wish for the dark. We want it. I want light. And then there was.

Clear skies, the sun in the distance, rising over the horizon. Pain, pain from the light... but a good pain. Cleansing. Refreshing. My wings flared as we flew into the light, and the pain dimmed. "Rainbow Dash!"

~~~

It was hours. Minutes. Years. Nyx didn't know, but it was harrowing, trying to pull two ponies out of the darkness at once. "Mom! Rainbow Dash!" Nyx collapsed, panting, as the two mares started to stir.

Dash was the first to open her eyes. "Wha..?" Nyx didn't let her finish, instead pulling her into a hug. Nyx's body heat wash over Dash, her on body freezing, and she shivered as she felt the tingling heat from the fire behind her.

"Nyx..." Nyx looked over at Twilight, her eyes brimming with tears of joy.

"Mom!" Nyx helped her mother, horribly weak as she was, to a more natural lying position so she could rest easier. "Mom, don't worry. I stopped it. You're okay. Just rest, please." Twilight didn't have the strength to nod, but laid down her head, and was soon snoring softly.

Dash yawned, slumping aginst Nyx before the young Alicorn settled Dash next to Twilight, the pegasus almost instinctively wrapping the unicorn under a wing, the both of them shivering as they slept in the fire's light.

"Spike, it's done, you can... Spike!" Turning to look at Spike, Nyx's heart stopped cold. Spike was sitting there, a scroll made of darkness laying before him as he contorted before her.

"T-too... cold..." Was all Spike could whisper before passing out. Nyx scooped up the dragon and, thinking erratically, threw him into the fire. The young dragon sighed almost peacefully, the few wisps of darkness surrounding him burning away as his body warmed. Nyx sighed a breath of relief, before looking at the letter. There was only one person who would send pure Darkness to serve as a message.

Mr. ****.

152232212112121.content:
Alan shivered. He felt groggy, cold, and he ached all over, but as the last few moments of his memory played themselves out, he took some small shred of comfort in being able to feel anything. He could feel the grain of wooden boards against his cheek, telling him that he was inside somewhere. He didn't feel like opening his eyes, however, until he heard child-like voices whimpering nearby.

Hearing that sound caused him to push himself up and look around. What he found in front of him chilled the writer more than the preternatural cold that was all around him. He recognized his surroundings easily enough. The walls of the lake cabin where his nightmarish encounters with the Dark Place and its eldritch denizens began were all too familiar. The layout, however, was larger than he was used to, and walls were lined from floor to ceiling with black iron cages. Dozens of them, nearly half of which housed a pony.

Young, old, male, female, every color in the rainbow and then some muted in the primordial darkness of their prison, they all tried to struggle against the bars. Only Alan was uncaged; a fact which drew the attention of those who were nearby.

"Mister! Mister, please, let me out! I need to find my mommy," a young blonde unicorn mare with a purple coat pleaded.

"Don't say anything to this guy," a short, fat blue unicorn snapped, glaring at Alan with squinty eyes. "I saw his face before! He's the one who took us in the first place!"

An adult purple earth pony spoke up in a feminine voice that was both maternal and very clearly trying not to crack under the pressure of the situation. "Calm down, Snips, I saw that monster bring this pony in while you were unconscious." Turning her attention to Alan, she asked, "Please, I don't know who you are, but you seem sane! You aren't like those monsters, right?"

Alan shook his head as he looked around in shock. On the one hand, it was a relief to see so many of Ponyville's residents alive and not transformed into Taken, but the fact that they were here filled him with dread at whatever it was Mr. ***** had planned. "No, I'm... I'm Alan Wake. I'm a writer," he replied, almost robotically as he hooked his hooves between the bars of Cheerilee's cage to test them. Trying to jostle the bars proved fruitless, however, as a closer look revealed that the cages weren't merely secure, but they didn't even have any hinges with which to open or close!

"I'm afraid that won't do much good, Mr. Wake," Alan heard a stallion tell him in an English accent. Turning his head to look, the writer saw a brown earth pony wearing a green tie and fiddling with some sort of wand. "Big Macintosh nearly broke his legs trying to buck his way out before that 'Mr. *****' fellow came to take him away. If any pony could open these cages through brute physical force, it would have been him. My sonic isn't doing any better. I can't even determine what anything here is actually made of. Could it be...? Some sort of matter from a set of dimensions so alien that it can't be scanned even by my technology? Why, that would be fascinating if the one in charge weren't so obviously a raving psychopath by even the most charitable standards!"

That chill that Alan had felt upon seeing the captive ponies burrowed even deeper into the writer's gut. He interrupted the stallion's mutterings by throwing himself against the bars of his cage. "Taken away? You mean there were more ponies here who've been taken away?"

After jumping a little from Alan's sudden interruption, the stallion focused on Alan and replied, "Oh, unfortunately, yes. I don't know where or for what purpose, but our captor arrives every so often to select a pony or two, and removes them from their cages. The last time he did so, I saw him use a black key to open Big Macintosh's cage. Rather than doing so in the usual way, he seemed to be able to will the bars to dissolve into smoke long enough for his minions to carry off the poor fellow. I'm afraid he was not the first, either."

Alan nodded to the stallion. "Alright... if I get that key, I can get everybody out. I'll be back as soon as I can!" With that, he took off looking for a door. The room was even larger than he had thought before, however, a maze of cages housing not just the three types of ponies he was familiar with, but even more diverse creatures. Too many and too great a variety to have come from just Ponyville. Mr. ***** had clearly struck fast, and in many places throughout Equestria. Possibly even beyond.

And I gave him the opportunity, he thought to himself with bitter recrimination. I may have written very little, but it was still a part of a horror story. That's the only kind the darkness will allow. The better the odds seem in the hero's favor, the farther they have to fall in order to maintain dramatic tension. Why did I let myself forget that? How could I have? I can only hope that Nyx is struggling... because if she isn't fighting with everything she's got, and there isn't always a good chance that it could end badly at any moment... then she'll lose. The Dark Place will exact its price...

Muttering curses at himself for having the audacity to think that he could do things any differently from how he had always succeeded in fighting the darkness, Alan finally came across a door and pushed it open. Stepping through it, the author-turned-pony shielded his eyes as they were filled with a bright light for a moment. In truth, it wasn't all that bright and his eyes quickly adjusted to it, but as he saw what it was, even the dim glow of a low-powered desk lamp seemed like an island in the ocean of darkness that surrounded him.

What was more, that desk lamp was perched atop a writing table, its cone of light shining down on an antique typewriter.

There it was... a weapon he could use. Even more than any flashlight or flare gun, the typewriter was the true outlet for his light. Through his creativity and understanding of how the story should play out, he would be able to write out a scenario that would allow him to free the captured ponies. Build the tension and keep things uncertain enough that when the climactic battle with Mr. ***** came to pass, the hero of the story would come out victorious.

It was entirely too enticing. The light shining on the typewriter was genuine. Creatures of darkness like Mr. ***** couldn't create light. It could only come from something pure. This was a genuine chance to take control of the story once again, and Alan knew that if he took it, he would be able to wield that influence against his doppelganger. But at what price? As it was, he didn't know how many ponies, if any, had actually fallen to Mr. *****. If he started to write, it was certain that there would be victims. With just a few sacrifices, he could set the conditions for a satisfying conclusion, but trying to avoid that fate had been his reason for relinquishing control in the first place. What would it matter, though, if because he refused to accept responsibility for the story, the entirety of Equestria fell into Mr. *****'s hooves?

This wasn't Mr. *****'s doing, but it was no less deadly. It could be Equestria'ss best hope for salvation, but it was also a trap...

Nyx's eyes widened as she recognized the brown earth pony stallion laying on the castle floor. "Doctor!" she exclaimed, hurrying over to check on him. He didn't seem to be too badly hurt, but his breathing was shallow and he had a nasty bruise over one eye in the shape of what looked like a hoofprint. As she looked the brown stallion over for other injuries, he suddenly gasped and opened his good eye.

"Derpy! Hang on," he exclaimed, reaching out a hoof toward Nyx.

Taking the Doctor's hoof with her own, Nyx looked him straight in the eye and tried to bring him back around. "Doctor? Doctor, wake up! Der- I mean, Ditzy isn't here. She's doing her rounds."

The Doctor's one open eye slowly focused on Nyx, and he let out a deep breath. "Oh, Nyx, thank goodness it's you! That means I'm back here... Wait, how did you get inside the Tardis?" He looked around, soon realizing, "Wait, this is the castle. That can't be right, the last thing I remember is... Oh, dear!" The color drained from the stallion's face, and he shakily pushed himself upright, his legs wobbling. "You said that Derpy is delivering the mail? Have Scootaloo and Sweetie Belle already left Ponyville?"

Nyx tilted her head in confusion and concern. "Yeah... remember? You were there with Dinky Doo just this morning, waving them off. This isn't good... you should probably let Nurse Redheart take a look at that hit to the head you took."

The Doctor was only barely listening to her, though, if at all. He paced around the room, muttering to himself. "Alright, so I must have fallen out of the Tardis and landed here earlier than I intended to... it gives me until tomorrow to prepare, but I can't go home because I'll be there... No telling where or when my Tardis will return, but if I were to..."

Nyx watched him go back and forth a few times before sticking her hoof out to stop him in his tracks. "Doctor!" she exclaimed, trying to get him to focus again. "I need you to stop for a minute! This is serious. I think you might have a concussion or something, and I'm sure your eye needs some medical attention."

The Doctor blinked at her with his good eye. "My eye? Why are you going on about my eye again?" He reached up to touch his face, wincing when his hoof brushed up against the bruised flesh. "Ah, that's right! Twilight Sparkle certainly packed a kick..."

Nyx's eyes widened at the mention of her mother. "Whaaaa? Mom didn't... why would she...?"

"No time," the Doctor replied brusquely. "It feels strange to say it, but time is not a luxury I possess at the moment! Derpy is in grave danger, and probably all of Equestria as well!" Before Nyx could stop him, the stallion suddenly pushed himself harder than she expected him to in his condition, and started galloping out of the castle! "I'll come collect you after you get Apple Bloom!"

The stunned and confused alicorn asked, "Wait, what? What does Apple Bloom have to do with... hey!" She tried to follow him, but quickly lost sight of the stallion. "What the hay just happened?" she asked herself before leaving the castle in order to take wing. Her first destination would have to be Dinky Doo's house. Even though she had no idea where the Doctor was going to go, Nyx figured she should inform his... daughter? Step-daughter? (Her understanding when it came to the timing of the Doctor's arrival in Ponyville versus the date of Dinky's birth was contradictory at best, and like most ponies she had eventually stopped trying to make sense of it.) Whatever the case, she would need to know about his condition.

Soon reaching the house that the unicorn shared with her mother and the Doctor, Nyx knocked on the door until it started to open. "Dinky, there's a problem. I need to tell you... Doctor?!"

The alicorn's jaw dropped open as the one who opened the door wasn't the unicorn she was expecting, or even a unicorn at all. Instead, the Doctor looked out at her, his face completely unblemished, with his usual blithely cheerful expression beaming at her. "Oh, hello Nyx. Fancy seeing you again today! So, how can Dinky help you? If it's something crazy, I would be more than happy to lend a hoof." He snickered to himself and murmured to himself as an aside, "Lend a hoof... I never get tired of that."

Nyx gaped and pointed at the stallion's face. "Doctor... your eye..."

"Hmmm? My eye? What, is something wrong with it?" The doctor touched his face. "It hasn't turned purple again, has it? I was sure I flushed out the last of that Raxxodesian pollen..."

Nyx shook her head. "No, it's... fine. How...?" Suddenly, she looked off in the direction of Sweet Apple Acres. "Apple Bloom!"

With that, she took off at a gallop toward the apple orchard, running as fast as she could and leaving the Doctor standing in the open doorway. Behind him, Dinky Doo peeked out at the running alicorn. "What was that about, dad?"

The Doctor stroked his chin in thought, then shrugged and smiled as he pulled the door closed again. "Can't say I know, but most likely I'll find out soon enough. By the way, is something wrong with my eye?"

*****


A few minutes later, Nyx arrived at the Apple family's farmhouse. She was about to knock on the front door, but remembered that Applejack and Big Macintosh would probably be out working in the orchards, and even if they weren't, Apple Bloom was probably grounded. Instead, she sneaked around the house until she got to Apple Bloom's bedroom window and concentrated on turning herself into mist so that she could float up to it.

Seeing her friend moping in her room confirmed that the young mare was indeed grounded, so Nyx silently seeped in through the window and drew Apple Bloom's attention by letting some of the dark mist drift in front of her eyes before reconstituting herself. The earth pony was startled, but managed to keep from letting out a loud cry as she turned to look around at her friend. "Nyx? What're you doin' here?" she whispered, not having expected to see the alicorn after they bid goodbye to their friends earlier that day.

"I had to make sure you were alright," Nyx replied. "At the castle, I found the Doctor in bad shape and babbling nonsense, but when I went to his house just now to tell Dinky, the Doctor was there and he looked just fine! I don't know what's going on, but the one in the castle mentioned you, so I had to know you were safe and sound."

Apple Bloom blinked and said, "Well, I'm okay, and I ain't seen anythin' strange.... except that." She pointed out the window, and Nyx blinked in surprise. There, just outside Apple Bloom's bedroom window, was the strange blue box that the Doctor and Ditzy Doo were sometimes seen coming in and out of. It certainly hadn't been there when Nyx showed up just a minute ago!

The box's door opened, and the Doctor with the black eye poked his head out, beckoning for them to come over. They went to the window, and he told them, "Brilliant, you're right on time. Alright, I know it's sudden, but I need you two to hop in. As of this moment, the Cutie Mark Crusaders are my temporary assistants until we save Derpy!"

Nyx narrowed her eyes and replied, "Hold it, 'Doctor', I saw the other one of you at your house! How do I know you aren't a Changeling?"

The Doctor blinked and replied, "Oh, that was me from yesterday! Well, a week ago, really, but tomorrow is when Derpy and I depart, and... besides, if I were a Changeling, wouldn't it make more sense to approach you as your mother?"

To Nyx and Apple Bloom's even greater surprise, Sweetie Belle and Scootaloo poked their heads out. "It's true, Nyx," Sweetie Belle exclaimed excitedly. "He showed up at Canterlot Station and had Scootaloo with him! I was so surprised, I nearly fainted!"

"You've gotta come in here, girls! This thing's amazing," Scootaloo gushed.

Nyx stared in absolute shock, stammering, "But... you couldn't have picked them up at the station... Their trains should still be taking them there..."

Apple Bloom similarly boggled at the sight, but replied, "Oh yeah? If y'all're Sweetie Belle and Scootaloo, tell us somethin' only they would know!"

Scootaloo thought for a moment, then grinned and replied, "Nyx swiped a book from the library and keeps it under her mattress. It's about a unicorn who has a passionate love affair with a-"

"Eep! Stop" Nyx suddenly interjected, a blush practically glowing its way through her black coat. "I believe you! I believe you!" Or at the very least, she was willing to give the benefit of the doubt. As long as it stopped the orange pegasus from finishing that sentence. "But why us, Doctor? What are we supposed to be saving Ditzy from?"

While Scootaloo snickered and pulled herself back into the blue box, the Doctor replied...
153.title: Doctor, Doctor! Give me the news!

choices: Discord rules Equestria because Scootaloo is a giant chicken.
Fluttershy and Rainbow Dash never met, meaning no Sonic Rainboom.
Something else
1532.content:
Applebloom asked, "Alternate timeline? What's that supposed t' mean?"

Nyx replied, "It's like another world, similar to our own, but where events played out differently. But that's just science-fiction, isn't it?"

"So are aliens and time travelers," the Doctor replied, "but since both are standing right in front of you, it pays to have an open mind about these things. Please, you must hurry. If we leave now, then once we are done, I can bring us back to a point in time immediately after our departure, but the longer we stay here debating it, the more likely it is that we'll be spotted by somepony who isn't supposed to spot us, and then there's no telling what manner of paradoxical ramifications that could have!"

Nyx was still a little wary, but teleported herself outside while Apple Bloom climbed out the window. "Alright..." the alicorn replied, "I'll give you the benefit of the doubt for now." Of course, if she saw anything suspicious, she would buck the potential impostor in his other eye. The Doctor made way for her as she stepped inside... and before she could wonder how he expected her to fit in the small box alongside the stallion and her friends, she got the answer. "Sweet Celestia, it's bigger on the inside," she exclaimed, much to the amusement of the others as Apple Bloom followed her in.

"Wow, so all that stuff about time travel and other worlds was actually true?" the earth pony asked.

"That's right," the Doctor said. "Now, I imagine this must be a bit of a shock, but..."

Nyx interrupted, saying to her friends, "Think about what this means! We could visit completely alien cultures! See historical events or Equestria's future play out before our eyes! Have one last big adventure together and come back right after we left so we don't get into trouble!"

The thought of it made the mares giddy with delight as they shouted in unison, "CUTIE MARK CRUSADER TIME-TRAVELERS!" The Doctor winced from the volume, but couldn't help but enjoy their enthusiasm.

"Yes, but do remember that our mission is to rescue Derpy. Prepare yourselves, ladies, because are about to see an Equestria the likes of which you have never seen before!"

While the Doctor went to the Tardis's controls, Nyx asked him, "So, what sort of timeline are we going to, Doctor? How is it different from ours?"

While the Doctor pulled levers and very carefully started pushing buttons and flipping switches, he replied, "Well, it's quite fascinating. Where we're going..."

{Note: The following options are borrowed from The Many Secret Origins of Scootaloo http://www.fimfiction.net/story/47589/5/...}
1532.title: Which timeline?

choices: A gathering down the street. Iron Will is in town.
Nothing. Everypony is hiding from the rainbow witch doctor's visit.
15322.content:
[Note: This chapter has been edited due to recent revisions to "Past Sins"]

"What?! That's crazy talk," Scootaloo shouted. She zipped toward the Doctor, glaring icily at him. "Rainbow Dash is the most awesome pegasus ever! There's no way in this or any other universe she didn't pull off the Rainboom!"

The Doctor sweated nervously as he struggled to reach around her to get to the controls. "Ah... a little help...?" he asked Nyx, who rolled her eyes before lifting Scootaloo out of his way with magic. "Thank you... last thing we need right now is for me to crash the TARDIS (again) right before we land. And I'm only telling you what the circumstances are in this timeline. You can see for yourself, once we've consulted with Captain Sparkle."

Nyx blinked in surprise, accidentally dropping Scootaloo as she released her magic. "We're going to see Uncle Shiney?" That thought excited her. Twilight's big brother had intimidated her at first. Technically, the first time they had met was when, as Nightmare Moon, she split herself into numerous clones disguised as rookie Guards in order to infiltrate the royal palace. She hadn't known about his relationship with her mother, then, and had caught him unawares with a sleep spell so that she could confront the princesses he had been sworn to protect. Then, like the rest of the Guard, he had been brainwashed with the "blessing" by Spell Nexus.

After she was de-powered once again to a filly, and the time came to meet him again as uncle and niece, he had been the one pony in all of Equestria that she was most afraid of. She could still remember the sleepless nights of worry over what he would do to the pony who had threatened his protectorate, his family, and the very land he loved. And feeding those fears for days and days was the knowledge that he would be entirely justified to hate and despise her for what she had done.

When the day did come for them to meet, she was a jittery, exhausted wreck who was pretty sure that despite the princesses having made their decision regarding her 'punishment', Shining Armor would storm in filled with righteous anger and smite her hard. When he actually walked into the library, looking so much larger and more menacing due to her diminished stature, drastically reduced power and filly-like mindset, the first thing she did was throw herself at his hooves, wailing and apologizing until she lost her voice, then spend a good fifteen minutes after that sobbing her little eyes out.

She hadn't even noticed when he started hugging her, just that when she started to come out of her haze of guilt and fear, he had his forelegs wrapped around her, Twilight and Spike watching the scene. As it turned out, he and Twilight had been sending letters to each other for months before his visit. At the time of Nightmare Moon's rise to power he had been terrified by his inability to stop her coup against the crown, and frustrated by his failure in the aftermath. But greater than his fear was his trust in the judgement of his little sister and the royal sisters he was sworn to protect, and the understanding that she had released them of her own free will.

After she got her voice back, the two of them had talked about everything. They had been candid and honest, and it had been hard at times, but after it was over, they had been able to face each other without fear, and that had been the first step to acknowledging each other as family. Ever since, he had been a warm and loving uncle.

The Doctor interrupted her reminiscing by saying, "Umm... Actually, Nyx, it's rather different..."

The alicorn shook her head, pulling herself back to the present. "I know, I know. This timeline's Shining Armor won't be my Uncle Shiney, so I have to make sure not to act all weird around him. Still, I can be happy to see him, right?"

"That's not what I-" Before he could finish, the TARDIS chimed. "Oh! We're here! Alright, ladies, when you step outside, we'll be in Canterlot, so be on your best behavior."

Apple Bloom replied skeptically, "But we didn't even move."

Going to the door, Sweetie Belle opened it and peered outside. "Uh... actually, we did," she replied, a silent 'but' hanging in the air like punctuation. She left the TARDIS with the others to look around, finding that while they were no longer near Sweet Apple Acres, they were still in Ponyville, and the morning had turned to early night in the few minutes since they entered the box.

"Oh, blast it," the Doctor muttered. "We should be right outside the royal palace. Still, if we're here, then there's probably a reason for it. See? We're in the proper timeline, at least." He pointed up to the sky, and everyone followed his hoof. Their jaws dropped as one at the sight of the moon... along with the shadowy mark of the Mare in the Moon. A sight that most of the mares hadn't seen since they were fillies, and Nyx had never seen with her own eyes for obvious reasons.

"How's that there?!" Sweetie Belle asked, glancing over at Nyx to make sure that her friend was still with them. The alicorn was at least as surprised as her, and could only offer a weak shrug.

"As I understand it," the Doctor exposited, "in this timeline, Celestia's battle with Nightmare Moon lasted several years longer than it did in yours before she was able to imprison her sister with the Elements of Harmony. As a result, the thousandth year in the prophecy regarding her return has yet to arrive. It's quite a good story, actually, but we'll have an opportunity to hear it from a pony who knows it better than I soon enough. For the moment... do you hear that?"

The Cutie Mark Crusaders cocked their ears and listened carefully, hearing...
15322.title: Not as you know them.

choices: Nyx Rescues Fluttershy from Iron Will.
Before she can get up their, a familiar farmer saves the pegasus.
153221.content:
The group of ponies quickly headed down the street and found a good spot where they could see what was going on. A large minotaur wearing battle armor appeared to be harassing what looked like...

"Hey, that's Fluttershy!" Applebloom exclaimed.

"It looks like she's in trouble!" Scootaloo added.

"We have to help her!" Sweetie Belle chimed in.

The three started forward, But the Doctor somehow managed to bring them to a halt by stepping on all three of their tails at once. "Now hold on girls. We don't know what's going on yet and jumping to conclusions isn't going to help. Let's just watch and see what happens for now."

Reluctantly, the crusaders agreed. Nyx turned her attention back to what was happening with the minotaur.

"Iron Will does not tolerate pansy ponies that don't apologize after bumping into him. So you have thirty seconds to stop talking gibberish and say your sorry before Iron Will flattens you!"

Fluttershy trembled under the intensity of the Minotaur's words, looking completely terrified.

"Ich verstehe nicht, was du sagst. (I don't understand what you're saying.) Ich spreche nicht Equestrian. (I don't speak equestrian)" The Pegasus said, tears of terror running down her face as she felt certain the large blue minotaur before her was going to murder her.

"Did I forget to mention that the reason Dash and Fluttershy never met was because Fluttershy wasn't born in Equestria?" The Doctor stated casually.

"Doctor, she's going to get pummeled to death over a miscommunication if we don't do something." Nyx stated in a worried tone, while the minotaur shouted at Fluttershy again.

"Not yet." The Doctor replied.

The minotaur raised his arm to hit the unfortunate Pegasus. Nyx turned to the Doctor.

"I can't just stand here and do nothing! I've got to help her!" She said before she started to rush forwards to help the defenseless Fluttershy.

"Nyx! Wait!" The Doctor called out after her.
153221.title: A gathering down the street. Iron Will is in town.

choices: It's funny that Scootaloo would say that...
No, Dash is definately a pony...
1532212.content:
Nyx leapt forward, knowing that she was never going to make it through the crowd in time. The minotaur's fist came down, aimed directly at Fluttershy's face as the crowd looked on in horror. And Orange blur shot forward from the crowd.

WHAM!

Next thing Iron Will knew he was flying sideways through the air before he crashed into a tree. A roar of approval went up from the crowd. Nyx looker to see that Fluttershy's savior was none other than Applejack. Yes it was definitely her...accept that "she" was a "he"!

"Shame on yall, trying ta beat up a helpless mare." The farm colt admonished, before turning to face the cowering Pegasus. "Yall alright there darlin'? he didn't hurt you none did he?" The Yellow Pegasus hugged her rescuer, crying and babbling unintelligibly into his shoulder.

"Awe, don't you worry none. I'll make sure he don't try ta hurt ya no more." Applejack said before pulling away from the embrace and turning around to face Iron Will. "You should walk away right now, pardner, before I get really mad at yall."

The minotaur got up and pointed a menacing finger at the farm pony. "Don't you think this is over! Iron Will is going to tell his captain about this! You'll be sorry you ever messed with me!" He shouted before running off.

The Farmer helped Fluttershy to her hooves, and the Pegasus hugged him again. "Vielen Dank für meine Rettung. (Thank you for saving me.)"

Applejack blinked in confusion, before smiling and waving it off. "No thanks needed miss, just doing what any properly raised stallion would do."

The crowed cheered one final time and began to disperse, no pony seeming to notice the alicorn or her companions. The Doctor glanced at Nyx with a smirk. "I did tell you to wait."

"So, wait. In this universe Fluttershy is from another country, and Applejack is a boy? What next? Rainbow Dash isn't really a pony?" Scootaloo inquired.
1532212.title: Dude looks like a lady.

choices: It came from sugarcube corner and sounds like Pinkie Pie!
That was Rarity! It came from City hall! Let's go!
15322121.content:
"Actually it's funny that you would say that since..." The Doctor began to say before a rainbow colored blur shot past him, leaping up into the air, aiming straight for the orange farmer.

"Your life is forfeit, Applejack!" Shouted the unmistakable voice of Rainbow Dash. Before she could collide with Applejack, however, the farmer whirled around and kicked her in the face, causing the unfortunate recipient of that kick to go flying into a tree. Now sprawled out and in a state of non-motion, it was apparent just what was different about the Rainbow Dash of this universe: She was a Hippogriff. her crown feathers and wingtips were the many different colors of the rainbow, as was her pony like tail. In fact, her entire back half was the exact same as it was in Nyx's universe, except that her cutie-mark was missing. Her feathers on the front half of her body were all cyan, matching the body fur of her back half, and she had the same magenta eyes. Her front legs ended with golden yellow eagle talons.

"...She isn't." the Doctor finished weakly.

Rainbow got back to her feet, stomping a bit in frustration. "Dang it! I almost had you that time! One of these days, Applejack! One of these days I'll prove I'm better than you, and every one of you lame ponies will finally have to give me the respect I deserve!" She shouted, before spreading her wings and quickly taking off.

Scootaloo stared after her, shocked at what she had seen. "But...but...how is that possible?!"

"In this universe, Dash was never friends with Gilda, because Gilda was born a generation before her...Gilda is Dash's mother in this world." The Doctor informed them. "Being a hybrid, she's not exactly treated well by society, so she hates most ponies. Though I can't help but wonder why she'd try to kill Applejack in particular..."

Nyx turned around to face him. "Are there anymore surprises we should know about?"

"Oh, plenty, but well get to them as we move along. Right now we need to find-"

Whatever the Doctor was about to say, it was cut off by a scream from down the street.
15322121.title: It's funny that Scootaloo would say that...

choices: Stay and help Pinkie and Fluttershy clean up.
Help Applejack chase down the culprits.
153221211.content:
"Was war das? (What was that?)" Fluttershy exclaimed, hiding behind Applejack, who quickly took off towards Sugarcube corner. Suddenly finding herself without a hiding spot, Fluttershy swiftly followed the stallion. She in turn was Followed by Nyx and the gang.

"Yer not gonna try and stop us from helping this time if Pinkie is in danger, are ya?"

"No promises." The Doctor replied. "It will really depend on what the situation looks like when we get there."

"So, I know this isn't the best time, but I have to ask; how come I can understand what Fluttershy says, even though I don't understand the language she keeps speaking?" Sweetie Belle asked.

"TARDIS translation circuits. Translates almost anything except the most primitive of languages and anything older than the TARDIS itself, which is why if you see anything you can't read, you should come and get me right away."

The group finally reached sugarcube corner just in time to see Applejack running off what looked like a number of armored ponies. Not stopping to see if she needed help, Nyx burst into sugarcube corner to see the inside was a mess. There were two things in particular that caught her attention.

One: There was a Diamond Dog in a red vest.

Two: He was helping Pinkie get back into a wheelchair. The Pink mare looked like she normally did, except her mane and tail were straight, although something told the alicorn that was normal for her in this world.

Nyx blinked in confusion at the scene, her brain trying to process what was going on. Thankfully the Doctor decided to fill her in.

"In this world, Pinkie's Grandfather was close friends with the chief of a Diamond Dog pack. They managed to work out a mutually beneficial relationship with each other that kept the rock farm from going out of business and their descendants have been close ever since. The day Pinkie got her cutie-mark, bandits attacked the farm while she was holding the party. Her sister Inkie went to get the Dogs' help, but by the time they got there the bandits had knocked over the Silo and ransacked the house. The dogs got most of them, but it was too late for Pinkie; the Silo had landed right on top of her as she was trying to get away. She's been paralyzed from the waist down ever since. Fido there was her best friend at the time, so when they send her to live with her Aunt and Uncle Cake, he decided to go with her."

"I'm fine, really Fido. They just pushed me over, there's no serious harm...well not to me anyway, this place is a disaster." Pinkie told her companion.

It was true. the whole place looked to have been ransacked. Pasties were all over the place, tables overturned, chairs knocked over. Fluttershy was in one corner, having grabbed a broom and dustpan from somewhere and was sweeping up some broken dishes.

Nyx contemplated what she was going to do next.
153221211.title: Pony and pony's best friend.

choices: Just then Applejack came back.
Suddenly Rarity shows up.
1532212111.content:
"Excuse me?" Nyx said, catching the Pink pony's attention. "Me and my friends couldn't help but notice that you appear to have a lot of work on you shoulders here, and we were wondering if we could help out?"

"Oh, well, you don't have to if you don't want to, but Me and Fido definitely won't say no to some help. Just be sure to ask if you don't know where something goes." Pinkie replied with a smile, as she rolled her chair carefully around the room towards the kitchen door. "I can't really help pick stuff up off the floor so I'm going to get started on replacing the baked goods they ruined. If you need me, I'll be in the kitchen, otherwise just ask Fido."

With that she exited the room, and the crusaders (and Doctor) started helping clean up. After a few minutes of silence, Scootaloo spoke up.

"So...I thought you said that all the differences in this universe were caused because there was no Rainboom, but if that was true, then why is Dash a Hippogriff?"

"Yeah, and how come AJ is a boy here?"

"Wouldn't that stuff have happened before the Rainboom happened? How could the rainboom not happening change something in the past?" Sweetie Belle inquired.

"Well girls, you see, your all thinking about it the wrong way. You're viewing time as if it were a river, with all the water flowing swift and sure in one direction." the Doctor replied. "But it's really more like an Ocean, with waves tossing about this way and that, and if you drop a big rock into it, it'll make ripples that go in every direction, effecting not only the present and the future, but also the past. Normally it's effects on the past are small and unnoticeable things, like whether your bathroom is on the right side of the hall or the left. But the Rainboom in our world was a fixed point in time, and Island in the middle of the ocean, one that will always be there no matter what, and nothing can change that, because if it does, time will break and disintegrate, and all reality will cease to exist. But the Rainboom didn't translate over to this world, which is like suddenly taking an island out of the ocean, causing dramatically large ripples across the entire ocean, resulting in major changes to the past, present, and future." He stopped the work he was doing and looked at the fillies around him. "Does that answer your question?"

"So...basically what you saying is that Rainbow Dash is so awesome, her rainboom is holding all reality together back in our world, and this world is so messed up because it's trying to hold itself together without it." Scootaloo rationalized.

The Doctor sighed. "Well...it's not exactly the way I would have put it, but I suppose that's right."

"And we're here Because Ditzy Doo getting lost here is like throwing in a pebble, and your worried she'll hit an undersea volcano and cause it to blow everything up." Scootaloo summarized.

"Again, not exactly the way I'd put it, but I suppose that's right too."
1532212111.title: Time is like an Ocean...

choices: "...What Rebellion?"
Something Else.
15322121112.content:
A loud "Bang!" came from the Kitchen. Almost immediately everypony (and Diamond Dog) in the room moved for the Kitchen door, but they were cut off when Pinkie called out to them. "I'm Fine! Everything's okay in here, I just dropped something! There's absolutely no reason to come into the Kitchen!"

This caused everypony to slow there approach, as they could all easily tell she was lying...well, everypony but one. Alas, poor Fluttershy didn't speak Equestrian, so all she heard was a "Bang!" and some yelling, which she immediately misinterpreted as cries for help. The canary colored Pegasus opened the door and suddenly found the blade of a rapier at her throat. Her instinctual reaction was to panic and beg for mercy.

"Es tut mir leid! Bitte töte mich nicht! Bitte ersparen meines Lebens! (I'm sorry! Please don't kill me! Please spare my life!)"

"Ich werde mich nicht um dich zu töten, wenn Sie mir sagen, wer Sie sind und wer für die Sie arbeiten. (I'm not going to kill you if you tell me who you are and who you work for.)" Came the reply in a sophisticated, yet slightly roguish voice. Nyx, leaned slightly to the left and managed to see past Fluttershy. What she saw shocked her. The pony holding the sword to Fluttershy's throat was Rarity! She was dressed in a mostly black outfit and had on a bandana with two holes in it that she wore like a mask to hide her mane and face. The sword was held in the grip of her hoof, most likely through the use of special magic horse shoes.

"Mein Name ist Fluttershy. Ich bin arbeitslos und suchen Arbeit hier in Equestria. (My name is Fluttershy. I am unemployed and looking for work here in Equestria.)"

Rarity smiled. "Guten Tag Fluttershy. Ich bin der Dread Pirate Roberts. Bitte nehmen Sie Platz. (Good afternoon Fluttershy. I am the Dread Pirate Roberts. Please take a seat.)" She said, motioning to one of the chairs behind the Pegasus. The Pegasus complied, Walking to the chair and sitting on it, while Rarity followed her, eyeing everyone else in the room while keeping her blade on Fluttershy's throat. Pinkie wheeled out in her chair behind the sword mare, giving an exasperated sigh.

"I did tell you guys not to come in the kitchen." She said.

"Alright then...I want everypony in the room to Identify themselves one at a time, stating their name, occupation, and intentions." She motioned to Scootaloo. "We'll start with you my friend."

Scootaloo cast a brief glance at the Doctor and Nyx before doing as she was told. "I'm Scootaloo, I'm going to be a racer and daredevil in Las Pegasus, and I'm just following that brown Stallion over there because he promised me an adventure."

Applebloom went next. "My name is Applebloom, I'm a repair pony and an Apple farmer, and I'm here for the same reasons as her."

Nyx went after that. "I'm Nyx Sparkle, I'm technically not actually employed by anypony at the moment, but I help my mother run a library, and I'm here helping Him find his wife."

Then the Doctor. "I'm the Doctor...I'm the Doctor...and my intentions are to find my wife and to have a very fun adventure while doing that."

And Finally, Sweetie Belle. "I'm Sweetie Belle, I'm going to work at a conservatory, and I'm with them."

There was an odd look on Rarity's masked face for a moment as she looked Sweetie Belle over, before finally sheathing her sword. "As I told Your foreign friend, I am the Dread Pirate Roberts. I'm here because I've thrown my lot in with the rebellion in hopes of it succeeding, and if any of you even so much as think about causing me trouble You'll find that I'm more than a match for anyone with my blade. I've learned from all the best teachers: D'Artagnan, Cyrano de Bergerac, Zoro, Inigo Montoya, and even the Fox himself."

"Well," The Doctor said "That's quite the list of teachers. Though I have to ask..."
15322121112.title: As you wish

choices: Summer Sun Celebration?
Tell us more about The Rebellion and Blueblood
153221211121.content:
"Why the rebellion against the Nobility, of course." Rarity answered. "You must not be from Equestria either if you don't know about that. We're trying to take the power the Nobles stole from Celestia and put it back into her hooves so she can quit being just an overly glorified mascot and start acting like a proper ruler."

"But I thought Celestia was the ruler of the Equestria." Applebloom interjected, slightly confused.

Rarity Laughed at that. "Ha! Only a fool would believe that! She may be our ruler in title, but the Nobility are the ones who really run things. There are a few good ones, but most of them are greedy, corrupted, power hungry fools. And the worst of all of them, the one calling all the shots is...Blueblood."

Ratity spat out the name as if it were the most vile poison in the world. "Blueblood...a more disgustingly vile and treacherous stallion has never lived. He murdered my parents, kidnapped my sister, and left me helpless to a pack of wild wolves. If I can't make Celestia take control of Equestria once more, I can at least make sure that despicable piece of vermin never hurts anypony ever again! And I finally have my chance to do both, at the upcoming Summer Sun Celebration..."
153221211121.title: "...What Rebellion?"

choices: Rainbow believes them, but they're interrupted by a pink poet.
Rainbow doesn't believe them; she chases them to the aforementioned rock farm.
153222.content:
It was Nyx who pointed it out first. "It's too quiet. There's no activity at all. But I know Ponyville has some nocturnal ponies, and a nightlife."

         The Doctor nodded. "Yes, and the fact that there's no one around probably means something, don't you think?"

         Nyx nodded, looking around with her sharp eyes. It wasn't long before she spotted somepony moving among the otherwise silent village. Indicating the mystery pony with a hoof, she and the others slowly approached the figure. On closer inspection, the figure was wearing a cloak, and a pair of wings could be seen shifting under it from time to time. The hood was up, making facial features impossible to make out. However, what caught everypony's attention was the pony's tail. Even in the dim lights of the street lamps, that prismatic display was unmistakable.

         "The hay?" Scootaloo asked quietly. "Is that Rainbow Dash? But... what's she doing dressed like Zecora back when everypony thought she was a witch?"

         The Doctor sighed. "Remember how I said she never perfomed the Rainboom? Well, she flunked out of flight camp, and ran off to the Everfree Forest, where she eventually came across Zecora. She studied herbs and remedies under the zebra, and is now under as much suspicion as Zecora herself. The ponies here call her the 'Rainbow Witch-Doctor'."

         Applebloom frowned, then smiled. "Well, ah know just how ta fix that!" With that, she started walking towards the cloaked pegasus. The others followed her at a modest pace. When Applebloom was close enough, she called out, "Hey, there!"

         "Gah!" Rainbow Dash jumped and whirled to face her. "A pony approaches me at night? Forgive me, you gave me quite a fright." There was a brief pause, then the pegasus punched herself in the face. "Stop doing that," she muttered. Looking up, she smiled. "Sorry. I'm not used to ponies visiting me at night. Everypony is usually indoors, asleep whenever I come here."

         "Well, ah'm talkin' to ya now!" Applebloom said cheerfully. "Ah'm Applebloom!"

         "Apple...?" Rainbow blinked a few times, before narrowing her eyes. "You're not one of those superstitious farmponies that own the apple orchard at the edge of town? I swear all of them have 'Apple' or something similar in their names."

         Applebloom was about to reply when she was cut off by the arrival of the Doctor. "Distant cousin, actually, doesn't come around here much," he said as he trotted up, followed by the other mares.

         Rainbow looked him over. "Say, don't you live with the local baker's assistant? That wall-eyed pegasus who occasionally does work for the post office?"

         The Doctor blinked. "Well, yes, but..."

         The pegasus turned her attention to Sweetie Belle. "You look like one of those rock farmers I occasionally do business with."

         Sweetie's mouth hung open. "Rock farmer...?" she said incredulously.

         Rainbow passed over Scootaloo entirely, instead becoming fixated on the tallest pony present. "And you... look suspiciously like Nightmare Moon."

         Nyx's nostrils flared. "Do me a favor, and don't call me that."

         The pegasus flicked her eyes between Nyx and the moon above. "But... you can't be Nightmare Moon. My teacher told me that when the Mare in the Moon fades away, that's when Nightmare Moon will return to try and reclaim her throne." She looked closely at Nyx, nearly squinting her eyes shut. "But you look a whole lot like the descriptions of her, down to the draconic eyes."

         Nyx sighed. "Doctor, I don't think she's going to let us go without an explanation."

         The Doctor shook his head. "It certainly seems that way," he murmured.

         Nyx turned to Rainbow. "Alright, here's the story..."
153222.title: Stripes of a Different Color(s)

choices: Zecora's cottage. I may have something to ask her.
This rock farmer you mentioned earlier. (Rarity)
1532221.content:
Rainbow Dash sat and listened with little more than a raised eyebrow as they told her the truth. Well, the Doctor did most of the talking. The rest piped in when they had something to say, except for Scootaloo who just stared at her idol's alternate with an unreadable expression on her face. After a lull in the explanation, he mused, "I must say, you're taking this all quite well."

The cyan pegasus shrugged and replied, "Well, what you're saying sounds really extraordinary, but I live in the Everfree Forest with a walking rhyming dictionary. And it's obvious you all aren't from around here, since you say Zecora's name without any fear. So while it's all incredibly strange, it's not quite in the 'unbelievable' range." She glanced over at Scootaloo, who quickly glanced away and looked at the ground rather than meet Dash's rose-colored eyes. Pointing a hoof at her, she leaned in and whispered to the Doctor, "Say, why the hay is that filly staring? Is it something on my face, or the cloak I'm wear- Oh for Celestia's sake! I'm doing it again, aren't I?"

Everypony nodded, causing Dash to facehoof and start muttering to herself. While she did that, Nyx asked, "Umm... Doctor, as fascinating as it is to meet this world's Rainbow Dash, how does this help us?"

Sweetie Belle pointed out, "You do seem kind of weirdly calm about all this, considering you brought us here to save your wife from... hey, you didn't even tell us who has her!"

The Doctor had the good grace to look embarrassed as he rubbed the back of his head. "Ah, yes. Well, I made sure to arrive at a point in time that would give us the opportunity to prepare before Derpy is-"

"Wow. Lively, tonight," a voice mused. A familiar voice, but the tone of it was anything but. Everypony turned to look, and only Rainbow Dash and the Doctor took in the sight without their jaws dropping open. Walking down the street, apparently not caring about the rainbow pegasus's reputation or presence, was Pinkie Pie. Except she wore a full-body black turtleneck sweater. Her normally poofy hair hung straight and limp, draped over her left eye, a beret perched atop it. Slung across her back was a set of bongo drums.

"Oh, no, not her," Rainbow Dash groaned, standing up again. "Forget this, I'm heading back to the forest!"

Her wings confined by the cloak, she was about to simply gallop off, but Apple Bloom quickly snatched Dash's rainbow-colored tail in her mouth and dug in her hooves to keep her there. Dash's hooves slipped out from under her, causing her to trip and fall, allowing Apple Bloom to let go and ask, "What're you tryin' to run off, for? And what's wrong with Pinkie Pie?"

"Pinkamena," the pink earth pony corrected in a flat, joyless voice. She then took her bongos and set them down on the ground, then started tapping out a rhythm on them while Rainbow Dash clamped her hooves over her ears.

"A splash of color in the gloom of night, but no one comes out to see.
A madpony speaks prophecy, but no one lends an ear.
A brave smile shines upon the cold earth, but does not warm a heart.
A mare of wealth stands atop the world, but has given up her home.
A voice cries out, claiming knowledge, but true wisdom is ever elusive.
A knight stands firm against a tide of darkness that will drown her.
What a world, what a world in which we live.
There is no room in it for such wonders.
Magic dies. Magic dies. Magic dies.
And no one will remember it was ever there."

Pinkie... Pinkamena picked up her bongos again, slinging them over her shoulder. Only the Doctor applauded by tapping his hooves against the street, everypony else feeling as if their hearts had been squeezed in a vice. Except for Rainbow Dash, of course, who still had her ears covered. While Pinkamena started to walk away, he whispered to his temporary assistants, "Without seeing the Rainboom, Pinkie spent her fillyhood on her parents' dreary rock farm, never discovering joy or laughter. As you can see, she doesn't exactly liven up the party... though she is very popular in certain coffee houses."

"Is it over?" Rainbow Dash asked, eventually daring to uncover one ear.

Nyx replied, "I think I need to hug a puppy, or I don't know what I'll do..."

Dash groaned and picked herself back up. "Yeah, she'll do that. So, uh... was there something I could help you with? I mean, if somepony's in trouble it's probably not my problem, but you guys took the time to talk to me and didn't do it in verse or..." She shuddered for a moment. "... Whatever it is Pinkamena does. So I figure the least I can do is hear you out."

The Doctor, the only one among them not still moping said with disturbingly good cheer, "Ah, brilliant. Yes, it would help us greatly if you could show us to..."
1532221.title: The Beat Is Gonna Getcha

choices: ... a stern-looking orange mare in a business suit. "Your payment is due."
... a lavender unicorn in captain armor, who orders the Doctor's arrest!
15322212.content:
The mares and the Doctor followed Rainbow Dash past the outskirts of Ponyville, heading into Whitetail Wood. "You're fortunate I meant to come this way, since I deliver some stock every Wednesday," the prismatic-maned pegasus said, before face-hooving again. "Argh. This is what I get when I live with somepony who talks only in rhyme."

         The Doctor shrugged. "Personally, I don't mind somepony who talks in rhyme. I've seen far weirder in my time." He flashed a grin at Rainbow.

         "Not you, too!" she groaned. "Ugh..."

         Nyx and her friends kept to the rear of the group. So far, they had seen two formerly prominent members of Ponyville society changed. Rainbow Dash was still much the same, if an outcast, but the jarring change in Pinkie's character had left the four disoriented. Nyx still felt like hugging a puppy. Seeing Pinkie Pie, the happiest pony in their Equestria, reduced to a poet spouting melancholic verse, was confusing. Silently, Nyx prayed that that was the worst of the changes to their loved ones.

         As they approached a farmstead, they were treated to the sight of an alabaster unicorn trotting up to greet them. Her face and mane color were familiar. Her style. however, was not. Where their Rarity had elegant curls in her mane and tail with nary a speck of dirt on her whole body, this one's mane and tail were tied off in simple braids, and she was covered with dust. A brown Stetson was perched on her head, with a hole in it for her horn, and a pair of grass-stained coveralls concealed her body.

         Sweetie Belle started twitching immediately on seeing her, but not as much as when the white unicorn opened her mouth. "Well, hi there, Rainbow Dash! Yer a little late this evenin', aintcha?" The voice was familiar, but the cultured faux-Canterlot accent was nowhere to be found, replaced by a cowpony twang the young mares would normally have associated with Applejack. Sweetie Belle's twitches grew in intensity.

         As Rainbow Dash approached, the Doctor fell behind to explain this to the gobsmacked mares. "The rock her horn led her to wasn't cracked open by the Rainboom. Because of this, Rarity accepted that her fate lay in stonecraft and rock-farming. She's let everything of her old life go... almost. She always designs her own clothes, including those coveralls of hers."

         Hearing this calmed Sweetie Belle down somewhat. "So she still likes making clothes?"

         He grimaced. "Well... not entirely. She focuses entirely upon function, rather than form."

         "Ah'm worried about mah sister, now..." muttered Applebloom as the five approached Rainbow and Rarity.

         The rock farmer turned to greet them. "Nice ta meet y'all! Rainbow here tells me y'all are from another... timeline thingy, right? Sounds mighty complicated ta me, but that don't matter. Yer more'n welcome here at Cliffton Acres!"

         Applebloom whispered to her friends, "Ah've heard of them back in our Equestria. They're good folk, much cheerier than the Pies that Pinkie used ta live with."

         Nyx nodded, and stepped forward. "Um, hi there! You're... Rarity, right?"

         "Eeyup!" The wide smile Rarity gave her seemed eerily out-of-place. Then again, Nyx was still comparing her to her world's Equestria. "Say, if y'all are from another timeline, does that mean there's another me out there?"

         Nyx nodded slowly. "But, I think it's best if you don't ask questions. We don't want to throw the time-stream out-of-whack."

         Rarity nodded back. "Ah getcha. Anyway, wanna try some of our famous rock candy?" Seeing the blank looks she was getting, she chuckled. "Don't worry, it ain't made outta real rocks." She dashed into the farmhouse, and came out with a bowl of rock candy.

         Nyx took a piece, and carefully bit into it. A few moments later, she devoured the whole piece. "That's amazing! I've never had rock candy that good!"

         "Ain't it just?" Rarity beamed. Then she looked past the group, and her expression soured. "Ah, ponyfeathers. Way ta ruin an evenin'."

         Blinking, the group turned around to see...
15322212.title: One Rock, Two Rock, White Rock, Purple Rock

choices: Fluttershy, accompanied by her husband, Iron Will.
Twilight Sparkle, wearing a guard captain's uniform.
153222121.content:
Applejack was approaching the group, a pegasus-drawn chariot behind her as the orange mare focused her attention solely on Rarity. There was no mistaking who it was, but this version of her had traded in her hat for a sharply tailored executive dress suit. "Ms. Rarity, I do not like having to keep having these meetings, but your tardiness is completely unacceptable!" Gone was the country twang they were so used to, instead replaced with a crisp, upper-class Manehattanite accent.

Rarity stepped forward, meeting Applejack's eye. "What's the matter, afraid of getting the smell of good honest work on ya? Ah told you, the harvest had to be delayed! You'll get yer bits, you just have t' wait a while longer."

"Those weren't the terms of our agreement," Applejack snapped. "When I gave you that loan, you assured me that you would honor your end of the deal. You said you needed the money to make this rock farm thrive, but all I see are pebbles!"

Rarity glowered at the businesspony and picked up a stone with her magic. "It ain't the size that matters, it's how you bring out what's inside 'em! That takes care and patience, which you might know a thing or two about if'n you ever pulled your nose out of your spreadsheets and ledgers!"

Applejack grimaced and whipped around, quickly bucking at the rock Rarity held in place. It hung motionless in the air for a moment before a crack formed where it had been struck, then split apart to reveal nothing inside but stone and the faintest traces of metal. "I know a thing or two about deadbeat ponies trying to cheat me. I know you signed a contract, and the terms of an Applejack contract are set in stone. Though it's obvious now that stone is something you don't know anything about."

Rarity reeled back a step, but then rallied and gave the orange mare a glare that made everypony watching fear that Applejack's head would burst into flames.
