Then she started to laugh darkly at her adversary. "If you know so much, then do you know where your precious bits are? Gone! All gone, spent on upkeep for the farm! So y'all can either wait for the harvest like I've been sayin', or cry yourself to sleep over bein' slightly less rich an' snooty than you think ya oughta be, because ya can't squeeze juice out of a rock!"

To that, Applejack glared back and smirked. "No, but I can take the farm." Rarity visibly choked on that thought, so Applejack continued. "It's right there in the contract you signed. Failure to pay may result in seizure of assets equal to the value of the loss. Or did you skip past that part because there weren't any illustrations?"

"You can't do that! This farm's all the Clifftons have! It's all I have! They trusted me t' manage it...!"

Applejack stepped forward, poking Rarity in the chest with her hoof. "Then they shouldn't have placed their trust in an unqualified, illiterate, corrupt, lazy, lying hick!" After bearing down on the unicorn with a stream of verbal abuse, Applejack suddenly felt something slam into the side of her face. It hit her hard enough that she tumbled over onto her side, though she was able to shake it off. "Oh, you got some fight in you, Rarity," she said, rubbing where she'd been struck. "But when I'm done suing you, you won't have... wait... wha- What are YOU doing here?"

Applejack's expression of smug contempt was replaced by astonishment at the sight of Apple Bloom standing over her, the younger mare's body shaking as tears welled up in her eyes. "You leave my friend's sister alone, you... you... BULLY!" She shrieked at Applejack, her voice breaking.

The businessmare, having been too focused earlier to notice anyone but Rarity, stared gobsmacked at her little sister's sudden appearance. "But... why are you in Ponyville, sis? You should be..."

"You're NOT my sister," Apple Bloom screamed with all her might. "My sister's brave and honest and dependable! She'll always keep a promise, but won't use it as a weapon! Y'all're horrible! This whole world's horrible!" She sniffled, wiping the tears from her eyes.

When the very confused Applejack reached out to her sister, only for Apple Bloom to swat her hoof away and start galloping away blindly into the night.

"Apple Bloom! Wait!" Sweetie Belle was the first to chase after her friend, though Scootaloo and Nyx were quick to follow.

"Oh dear," the Doctor muttered. "I suppose I should have expected something like this to happen... girls, wait!" He tried to go after them, only to be blocked by Applejack.

"Hold it right there, mister," she said to the stallion with an icy tone. "Who are you, and what are you doing with my sister?! Did you kidnap her? Brainwash her? Whatever your sick plan is, you aren't going anywhere!"

The Doctor sweatdropped and backed away from the businessmare. "N-no, it's not like that, I assure you. Ms. Rarity, a little help...?" But the unicorn was looking off into the darkness with a surprised expression on her face. It had been dark and consciously or not, Sweetie Belle had been hiding behind Nyx for most of the conversation, so she hadn't noticed the presence of her little sister's double before seeing her run off less than a minute ago.

Rainbow Dash at least was able to throw off her cloak and let her wings stretch, a few bags of herbs and powders strapped to her barrel. "Through the darkness I can see, so don't worry doc, leave the girls to me!" With that, she pushed off and flew after them, greatly relieving the stallion.

His relief was short-lived, though, as this meant leaving him with Applejack and the two burly pegasi who brought her to the farm approaching. "Would you... care for a spot of tea while we discuss matters...?"

*****


Apple Bloom ran as fast as her legs would take her. Her eyes were clenched shut with grief, but it was too dark to see where she was going anyway. Aside from feeling the dirt of the road beneath her hooves, she didn't care where she was going, just as long as it was away from this world's twisted mockery of her sister. The others raced after her, but were weighed down by the impact of what they had seen as well. Scootaloo and Sweetie Belle had seen versions of their idol and sister respectively give up on their dreams, and after everything they had gone through that night, Nyx didn't even want to imagine what had happened to her mother in this timeline.

It was too hard for them to catch up to Apple Bloom while being assaulted with the constant revelations about what had happened to the adults they looked up to. As a result, she was still out of sight when their attention was brought back to the present by the sound of her crying out as she ran into something! "Bloom! Are you okay?" Nyx cried out, lighting up her horn so brightly so fast that it hurt everypony's eyes before she dimmed it. As the faint spots faded from her vision, she just barely saw what Apple Bloom ran into in time to skid to a stop before she barreled into it... or rather her as well.

Who did Apple Bloom run into?
153222121.title: This Apple isn't here to sell iPhones.

choices: The group plus Twilight run into Rainbow Dash, who is Twilight's friend
Back at the farm, the Doctor explains the situation to Rarity and Applejack
1532221212.content:
Nyx nearly stumbled seeing the guard pony picking herself up off the ground. She recognized that lavender coat, that indigo mane, and those bright violet eyes. However, she was not used to that coat being mostly covered up by a suit of purple-colored armor. Nonetheless, the pony before her was, without doubt, Twilight Sparkle.

         Shaking her head, Twilight offered a hoof to Applebloom, who was still rubbing her head. "Are you okay, miss?" the unicorn asked.

         "Yeah, ah'm fine," Applebloom replied, taking the offered hoof. "Ah'm just... peachy," she stuttered on seeing Twilight properly in the dim light from Nyx's horn.

         Twilight smiled. "Don't worry about it. I wasn't doing anything too important at the moment, so I can spare some time for a distraught mare. What's got you worked up, miss...?"

         Applebloom worked her jaw for a moment, before replying. "Applebloom. Ah'm Applebloom. This here is Nyx," she pointed at the alicorn, "Sweetie Belle, and Scootaloo. They're mah friends."

         Twilight did a double-take on seeing Nyx. "Wha - ? Another alicorn?! Ohmigosh, I have to let the Princess know about this immediately, or she'll send me back to the Academy!" She was about to gallop off, when a midnight-blue aura enveloped her and pulled her in close to the black alicorn. "Um... can I help you, milady?"

         Nyx was looking Twilight over, and she let out a laughing sigh of relief. "Thank goodness... at least one pony in this crazy timeline is still the same. Mostly."

         Twilight blinked. "Wait... 'timeline'? You all are from another timeline? I thought that was all theoretical stuff!" She smiled. "Oh, I can't wait to tell the Princess about this! Maybe she'll give me a science award!" She paused, then looked down. "Or rather, she would if I wasn't her guard captain..."

         "I was about to ask... how did this happen? What happened during your entrance exam to Celestia's School for Gifted Unicorns?" asked Nyx.

         Twilight sighed. "I failed the exam. I mean, nothing I'd read said anything about how to hatch a dragon's egg! After I left, I thought about applying as a librarian, but... then I got news that my brother had been killed by a manticore while on patrol in the Everfree."

         Nyx felt like she'd been bucked in the lungs. Her uncle, the pony who'd accepted her after all the evil she'd done as Nightmare Moon, was dead in this reality. "I'm... I'm sorry for your loss."

         Twilight smiled sadly. "It's been several years since then. I've gotten past the pain, mostly. But, he was a sergeant in the royal guard. I felt I owed it to him to try and follow in his hoofsteps. And, well, here I am, a guard captain. Who'd have guessed? Nerdy little Twilight Sparkle, a guard captain." She sighed again, then looked up. "So, what happened to me where you came from?"

         Nyx smiled at her. "In our timeline, you passed the exam. You adopted the dragon that hatched, and you went on to become Princess Celestia's personal apprentice and student. Also... your brother was never killed by a manticore."

         Twilight's smile was sad, but genuine. "At least there's a version of me out there who's living her dreams... and beyond."

         There was a cough. "Um, girls, don't we have other things to worry about?" asked Sweetie Belle. "We need to get back to that rock farm and get the Doctor!"

         Twilight blinked. "You mean Cliffton Acres? They have some quality material. Even if their temp is a little... flaky in terms of quality."

         "An' bein' bullied by that dirty city mare," grumbled Applebloom.

         Twilight cocked her head. "Uh... 'dirty city mare'? You wouldn't happen to be talking about Applejack, the premier loan mare of Manehattan, would you?" All of the other mares blinked at Twilight, who smiled. "She's done business with the Clifftons before. She's a real sweetheart, always willing to bend over backwards to make sure her clients aren't put under pressure."

         Applebloom gaped at her. "Are ya outta yer tree? The Applejack ah saw was ready an' willin' ta seize the rock farm just ta get her money!"

         Twilight's eyes widened. "Well, that's out of character for her!"

         Nyx sighed. "Come on, let's get back to the farm, and see if we can sort this mess out."
1532221212.title: A Sparkle of Hope

choices: Fighting Applejack's bodyguards alongside Rarity!
Talking things out peacefully.
15322212121.content:
As they turned around to head back, a raspy voice shouted, "INCOMING!" They barely had time to see the rainbow-colored blur streaking toward them in the moonlight, and the fillies hit the deck while Twilight's eyes widened. Her horn quickly lighting up with a purple aura, she managed to surround herself with an orb of magic right before Rainbow Dash could slam into her!

The cyan pegasus clenched her eyes shut as she was about to crash, but instead of slamming into a solid barrier, the sphere surrounding Twilight bowed inward and enveloped Rainbow Dash, absorbing her inertia and stopping her just before she could collide with the unicorn. Twilight then let the barrier pop like a soap bubble, dropping Dash to the ground none the worse for wear.

After belly-flopping onto the dirt road, Dash chuckled and rubbed the back of her head. "A-heh... nice catch," she said before blinking up at the unicorn. "Twilight Sparkle...?" Almost immediately, she was up on her hooves and glomping the armored unicorn. "Wow, it's great to see you again, Twi! But what the hay are you doing nearby? I thought you were too busy in Canterlot with your job to come and mingle with us Ponyville slobs."

The pegasus was so happy, she didn't even notice that she had fallen back into rhyming, causing Twilight to laugh and return the hug. "Hey, Dash, I'm actually here for a few days. Princess Celestia is going to be visiting Ponyville for this year's Summer Sun Celebration, so officially speaking, I'm here ahead of her to check out the preparations and security arrangements."

The younger mares picked themselves up after the expected collision failed to occur. Nyx asked, "Wait, so you two know each other?"

Twilight nodded. "Yeah, since about three years ago now. I'd just been promoted to captain when I got a report about a manticore spotted around the outskirts of Ponyville. After what happened to my brother... well, I did the stupidest possible thing and came out here alone to deal with it. I marched straight into the Everfree Forest without a plan or a guide or anything."

Nyx and her friends all gasped in unison, shocked beyond belief! The idea that Twilight Sparkle... any Twilight Sparkle might take action without triple-checking that she had made the proper preparations was so much more stunning to them than the idea of her taking on a manticore single-hoofedly. It could only have been a testament to how much grief she had felt at the time over Shining Armor's passing.

Twilight arched an eyebrow at the gasp, but kept telling her story. "Well, nopony told me about the weather working by itself in the Everfree, so while I was following its tracks, I got caught in a downpour. It was the worst storm I'd ever seen, let alone been in, so of course the manticore I was tracking decided to confront me while I was looking for shelter. It pounced on me from behind and stung me through my armor."

Applebloom asked as the four young mares listened with wide, astonished eyes, "What did ya do?! How'd ya survive?!"

Twilight replied, "I cast a spell to blast it with lightning, knocking it away."

"That's where I came in," Rainbow Dash interjected proudly. "I was flying back to the hut after hunting down some plants for Zecora when I see a flash of lightning coming from down below. Now, that's weird even for the Everfree Forest, so I fly down to check it out and what do you know? A lone purple unicorn suffering from a manticore's sting. Lucky for her, in my bags I had just the thing!"

Twilight smiled at the 'witch doctor' pegasus as she told the others, "The poison hit pretty fast so I was only barely conscious, but the monster was suddenly hit by a cloud of green powder that seemed to turn into a mass of snakes. By that point, I was sure I was hallucinating from the toxin when this rainbow streak slammed into the manticore."

"Bucked him straight into the river before it got her. Stupid monster got carried away in the rushing water," Rainbow Dash snickered.

Twilight joined her friend in laughing about it. "I must've passed out right then because the next thing I know, I'm waking up in a creepy hut with the infamous 'Rainbow Witch Doctor' kissing me."

The four younger mares all stumbled as they walked, but Nyx got it the worst and flopped over onto her face. "WHAT?!" she asked, eyes threatening to pop out of her head while Dash scoffed and swatted at the purple unicorn.

"Oh, you wish! I was just giving her the venom's antidote. It was the only way to safely get it down her throat."

Nyx blushed hard with embarassment, her face practically glowing through the dim of night and her own black coat. "Whew, that's a relief... er, I mean, not that there'd be anything wrong with that. It just took me by surprise." Considering her mother's personality, it was almost impossible for her to think of any version of Twilight Sparkle getting romantically involved with one of her closest friends. The checklists weighing the pros and cons alone would fill up the entire library several times over.

Scootaloo, by contrast, was beaming widely at Rainbow Dash. Seeing her friend's expression, Sweetie Belle nudged her and whispered, "Hey, Scootaloo, what's up? Weren't you all depressed just a little while ago?"

The orange pegasus whispered back, "Yeah, because I thought she was a failure because she gave up on flying... but she single-hoofedly took down a manticore! Rainbow Dash is the most awesome pony around in any universe!" Trotting up to her idol's alternate, Scootaloo asked Dash, "Hey... you got any more stories?"

Dash looked over at the younger pegasus and got a smug grin on her face, sticking her chest out as she walked. "Well, I'm not one to let my tongue wag on, but there's this one time I saved the princess's pet dragon..."

Twilight interrupted, "Hey, we're back at Cliffton Acres." Indeed, they were once more at the edge of the rock farm. Over by the farmhouse, they could see the Doctor...
15322212121.title: The More Things Change...

choices: "... my wife will be ponynapped by Diamond Dogs soon."
"... can you find a pegasus named Fluttershy for me?"
153222121212.content:
The Doctor glanced up, and smiled. "Ah, good! Our wayward mares return... and with additional company!" He waved at the guard captain. "A pleasure to see you, Captain Sparkle! I was hoping I'd run into you!"

         Twilight blinked. "Um, may I ask why?" She paused, and shook her head. "Actually, that can wait." She leveled an even look at Applejack, who now looked rather guilty. "Miss Applejack, a pleasure to see you again. I wanted to thank you again for the leeway you gave me in repaying my loan for my senior year at the Academy. I was worried when I couldn't get you the first payment on time, but you assured me that you knew how the Royal Guard's wages were, and you were willing to relax the contract a little."

         Nyx noticed the two pegasi guards shaking their heads in amusement, even as Applejack hung hers. "Well... I admit I have quite a bit of respect for the Guard. You keep us safe, after all." The businessmare smiled warily, despite Rarity's growing glare from the side. "And while I'd love to discuss possible future ventures, I do have... business I need to attend to." She glanced at Applebloom, who was giving her a hard look.

         The Doctor coughed. "Remember what I told you, Miss Applejack..."

         Applejack rolled her eyes. "Yes, yes, this whole 'alternate timeline' business. I found myself skeptical at first, but on closer inspection..." She looked at Applebloom again. "You're a little older than the Applebloom I know."

         Applebloom's gaze remained stony. "It's like ah said before; ya ain't mah sister."

         Applejack visibly cringed. However, it was Rarity who spoke next. "And... ya ain't mine, are ya?" she asked Sweetie Belle.

         The younger unicorn shook her head. "Sorry."

         The farmpony smiled. "Ah, it's alright. 'Sfar as ah'm concerned, yer family, even if ya ain't." She paused. "Does that make sense?"

         Sweetie Belle smiled and nodded. "You're different from my sister... but maybe you're more like a cousin?"

         The two unicorns embraced, sealing their familial bond. Applejack looked at Applebloom, whose eyes were still hard. "Listen, Applebloom... I don't know what I did that set you off, but - "

         "Ah'll tell ya what ya did," the younger earth pony interrupted. "Ya were actin' like a bully. Mah sister would never condone extortion. What's more, Twilight here says yer normally very generous in terms of yer payments. So what's the difference between her and Rarity, huh?"

         Applejack grimaced. "I... Truth be told, I came here after attending a 'charity' ball in Manehattan. I'm... a bit of a laughingstock among my peers, to be honest." Everypony blinked at her. "I'm a bleeding heart. I always give my clients enough time to pay for their loan. Because of this, I'm made fun of in the social circles of Manehattan." She paused, then allowed herself a small smirk. "Of course, I have more clients than most of my peers..." She sighed, her smirk fading. "I suppose their words were still fresh in my mind. I've never actually threatened to seize assets before, and it's left quite the bitter taste in my mouth." She looked up at Applebloom, her eyes watering slightly. "But is it so wrong to want to be accepted by your peers?"

         Applebloom's hard gaze finally softened. "Nah, it ain't wrong," she said. "But let me give ya some advice: Stay true to yerself, no matter what other ponies think of ya."

         Applejack blinked, and smiled. "Sage advice. Who was it that told you that?"

         The younger pony smiled back. "That was mah sister."

         The two embraced, similar to how Sweetie Belle and Rarity were. Nyx smiled at the scene, happy that Applejack hadn't completely changed. A cough from Twilight, however, cut the moment short. "Now then, sir," she addressed the Doctor, "you said you wanted to speak to me? About what?"

         The Doctor coughed. "Well, Captain Sparkle..."
153222121212.title: ... The More they Stay the Same

choices: She isn't as you know her.
She won't be acting alone.
1532221212122.content:
Captain Sparkle was surprised, but clearly recognized the name, based on her reaction. "Fluttershy? What does she have to do with anything?"

"So you know her?" Nyx asked, her friends' newfound acceptance of the alternates of the ponies they looked up to having taken the edge off her own worries. Now she was more curious than afraid to find out about the timid, kind-hearted Fluttershy.

"Yeah, she and her husband do a seminar for the Guard every year," Captain Sparkle replied, gazing off into the distance. "She helped me so much after my brother passed away. I always thought motivational speakers were just cheesy hucksters, but I've never met someone so energetic and full of life before. She got me to look past my grief and enjoy life again."

The Cutie Mark Crusaders were once again stunned by this revelation. "Seriously? Fluttershy?" Scootaloo asked incredulously.

"Motivational speaker..." Nyx muttered.

Applebloom asked, "Energetic...?"

Sweetie Belle exclaimed, "Husband?! Who in Equestria is she married to? Big Macintosh?"

Before she could get an answer, Applebloom interjected, "Why does everyone keep tryin' t' hook Fluttershy up with Big Mac? They've barely said two words t' one another in all th' time she's been in Ponyville."

Applejack quickly replied, "Oh, no, no, there is more certainly nothing going on between her and our... my brother. No, she's married to a minotaur by the name of Iron Will. They're quite a team; I've hired them to speak to my employees from time to time."

Silence fell over Cliffton Acres like a wet blanket.

Eventually, the awkwardness was broken by Twilight asking, "Is, uh... inter-species marriage a delicate topic where you're from?"

"Oh, no, nothing of the sort," the Doctor assured her. "But getting back to the matter at hand, I've heard that Fluttershy and Iron Will are to be taking advantage of the large crowds gathering for the Summer Sun Celebration, and will be putting on a show. Since you know her, it would mean a lot to me if we could speak with her before then."

Twilight blinked and asked, "Really? Why?"

"Because I'm a big fan, of course," the Doctor replied cheerfully. "My wife and I attended one of her seminars, recently, and I found her message to be most uplifting!"

Twilight replied, "Well, she is very good... and it's true, they will be in Ponyville tomorrow, so maybe I'll see if I can pull a few strings. I'm sure Fluttershy'll be thrilled to learn she's got fans all across time and space."

The Doctor smiled widely, taking Twilight's hoof and shaking it. "Ah, brilliant! Thank you ever so much, Captain Sparkle."

"Well, that's all wrapped up, so back home I'll creep," Rainbow Dash said as she pulled her robe back on and pulled the hood over her face. "It's been cool and all, but I need my sleep."

"Y'all're welcome to spend the night here," Rarity offered the five dimension-travelers. "It ain't much, but there are enough spare beds for each of ya."

"Thank you kindly, miss Rarity. You have all been extremely helpful and gracious," the Doctor replied. As Rarity showed them where they could rest, Rainbow Dash, Applejack and Captain Sparkle walked down the road a bit toward the businessmare's chariot while the pegasi bodyguards hitched themselves back up to it.

"So..." the unicorn asked, glancing back at the farmhouse to ensure they weren't followed. "What do you girls think about all this? About those five?"

Applejack shook her head. "As bizarre as it is, I have to believe their story. That double of my sister... I'm positive she's telling the truth. The one I'm not sure about is that stallion she's with. And an alicorn! How is she such close friends with an alicorn? That's like having Princess Cadance as a foalsitter."

Twilight coughed quietly.

"Not just any alicorn," Rainbow Dash replied. "She didn't want to be called it, but aside from her cutie mark she looks just like Nightmare Moon. Let me do some research and I'll get back to you soon."

Twilight nodded to the two mares. "I'm familiar with the Doctor, or at least our version of him. Whenever he takes an interest in something, it means something strange is about to play out. He might have good intentions, but he's not telling us everything. I'll have to keep an eye on Fluttershy and Iron Will when they show up."

*****


After Rarity went to the kitchen to fix them a snack, the Doctor and his temporary companions settled in. According to their internal clocks it was still early afternoon, so none of them were tired. As the brown stallion settled in, Nyx said, "Alright, Doctor, it's time you were honest with us. This isn't just about your wife, is it?"

The Doctor smiled tenatively and asked, "Why, what do you mean, Nyx?"

"It's perty obvious, Doc," Applebloom interjected. "Meetin' the bearers of the Elements o' Harmony?"

"The Mare in the Moon," Scootaloo added.

"The Summer Sun Celebration," Sweetie Belle said.

Nyx concluded, "It all adds up to the same thing. This is the thousandth year, isn't it? Whatever happened... or... is going to happen to Derpy, it's connected to this timeline's Nightmare Moon coming back. If it was anything less severe, you could use your TARDIS and deal with it yourself, I bet. But you needed us and the bearers of the Elements." The Doctor's expression turned sadder, confirming their suspicions. "Why didn't you just say so? Were you going to tell us, or were you just going to put us into position to do whatever it is you need from us?"

The Doctor shook his head and replied, "No, no! I was going to tell you everything, it's just that when we landed in Ponyville instead of where I expected, I saw an opportunity." He reached up to his face and brushed the tender spot around his black eye with his hoof. "Believe me, I'm going to pay for trying to manipulate things. And we didn't have much of a chance to sit down and discuss things until just now." He sighed and explained, "But as far as your guess, you girls are mostly correct. Nightmare Moon will soon be freed, but..."
1532221212122.title: Not-So-Shy?

choices: The preparations get underway, and the time-travelers talk
Meanwhile, Rainbow discusses recent events with Zecora
15322212121222.content:
The mares all blinked. "What do you mean?" asked Nyx.

         The Doctor sighed. "Recall how I mentioned that the battle between Nightmare Moon and Celestia lasted several years in this timeline? Well, Nightmare Moon was able to rally some support from various factions during that time. It was more like a war than a battle. Gryphons, minotaurs, even a dragon or two fought by her side. A few ponies even secretly joined cults dedicated to worshiping her. And after all these centuries, those cults still exist. The minotaurs and gryphons remember their old allegiance with her. In other words, this won't be anything like the timeline you remember."

         The CMC looked nervous at that. For Sweetie Belle, Scootaloo, and Applebloom, the memory of that Summer Sun celebration was filled mostly with terror for several hours, clinging together despite not being friends yet. For Nyx, it was another story: she had heard about what Twilight and her friends had been through. She had thought that the height of what could happen to somepony trying to confront Nightmare Moon. The thought of the Mare in the Moon having allies, people who would fight for her, was boggling. And it frightened Nyx.

         Still, there was something she felt aside from fear: determination. "It doesn't matter if she has allies or not. We'll make sure she's stopped, or my name isn't Nyx Sparkle!" the alicorn declared.

         Hearing this, Applebloom nodded. "Yeah! We'll send Nightmare Moon packin', for sure!"

         "No sweat!" Scootaloo added.

         "Because we'll be..." Sweetie Belle started.

         "CUTIE MARK CRUSADER WORLD SAVIORS! YAAAAAY!!!" the four exclaimed, doing a group high-hoof.

         The Doctor had covered his ears prior to the explosion of sound. "Ahem. Don't the four of you already have your Cutie Marks?"

         The mares all looked sheepish. "Well, that don't mean we have ta sit by and do nothin'!" Applebloom said definitively. "And besides, it's CMC tradition ta declare the latest adventure, whether ya got yer Cutie Mark or not."

         "So y'all were eager ta get yer Cutie Marks, huh?" asked Rarity as she stepped back into the room, levitating a tray with glasses and sandwiches. She smiled knowingly at Sweetie Belle. "Ya really are my sister's double, aren't ya? She was eager as all hay, too."

         As the unicorn distributed the snacks, Nyx spared a look at her flank. Rather than the trio of diamonds she'd grown used to seeing, Nyx instead saw a blue starburst shattering a rock. It makes sense, she thought. She's not our Rarity. She has a different talent... a different life. She shook her head, and joined the others in making small-talk with Rarity. The unicorn didn't seem to have heard their discussion, which Nyx silently thought was all for the good. No need to put the rock farmer in a panic.

*****


         The next day found Rarity and her time-traveling house-guests making their way to Ponyville. As they entered the village proper, they could hear a commotion going on in the town square. Trotting over, they saw a stage set up in the middle of town. On the stage were a minotaur, and a yellow pegasus pony with a bright pink mane and tail. Both were cropped somewhat short, allowing both of her cheery eyes to look at the world. This had to be Fluttershy. Currently, she was speaking in a loud, clearly audible voice: "And so, that's how I defeated a Timber Wolf all by myself. A little laughter goes a long way!" There was a roar of applause as the pegasus stepped off stage, allowing the minotaur to begin regaling the audience with his own stories of motivation.

         Fluttershy was intercepted by Captain Twilight, and led over to the group. "So, these are those 'time-traveling' fans of mine, eh, Twi?" the yellow pegasus asked. "Have to admit, never thought word-of-mouth could reach that far!"

         Nyx smiled. "Well, you'd be surprised at what we know. I'm Nyx, by the way. These are my friends Applebloom, Sweetie Belle, and Scootaloo, as well as the Doctor." She pointed at each pony in turn as she named them.

         The Doctor held out a hoof. "Nice to finally talk to you! I saw your show in Baltimare a few months ago. So inspiring!"

         Fluttershy grinned. "Wasn't it just? What part did you like the most? The part where I told my own story of dragging myself out of a rut, or the part where I gave the moral that time and effort can accomplish anything?"

         "Both! I liked the whole seminar!" replied the stallion.

         "That's great!" Fluttershy enthused. "Oh, it warms my heart that my speeches have such effects!" Rarity and Twilight nodded, smiling as well.

         "What a load of horseapples."

         Everypony turned to regard the speaker. Straight-maned and stern-faced, Pinkamena stood off to the side. "You seriously can't find a better job than lying to ponies?" she continued.

         Fluttershy narrowed her eyes. "Excuse me, I don't recall asking the opinion of a two-bit beat poet."

         Pinkamena's eyes were cool as she regarded the pegasus. "It's a free country, so I can say what I want. And at least my work pays me consistently. I don't have to rely on tips and handouts like an attention-horse showpony."

         Fluttershy growled, but before she could pounce on the pink mare, Nyx stepped between them. "That's enough! No reason to get into a fight over a difference of opinion!" She turned to look at Pinkamena. "Look, you said it yourself; it's a free country. Therefore, if Fluttershy wants to spread her message, she can. And really, there's nothing wrong with either of your lifestyles. Different ponies, different walks of life."

         The poet looked Nyx over, before giving a wry smirk. "You do have a point. Very well, I won't press the issue." She began trotting off. "And you'd know all about 'different walks of life', wouldn't you, Nightmare Moon?"

         In a flash of black and purple, Nyx was in front of Pinkamena, giving her a death glare. "Do not call me that again, or I will break those bongos of yours and feed them to you, piece by piece. Got it?"

         The pink mare gulped and nodded quickly, eyes wide. Applejack came up to the group at that point. "Easy, there. There's no need to start a fight, here. I imagine we're all a little high-strung about the Summer Sun Celebration, that's all. So, why don't we all do what we can to prepare, okay?"

         Applebloom blinked. "Wait, don't you live in Manehattan?"

         The businessmare smirked. "Yeah, but as a company executive, I have the authority to come and visit the place where Princess Celestia will personally host the SSC."

         Twilight trotted up with a list. "And, as it happens, I have a list of items that need to be prepared before the celebration begins tonight! So, let's get cracking!"
15322212121222.title: A Motivating Opinion

choices: Preparations are made without anything amiss.
While setting things up, one of Nyx's crew notices something sinister.
153222121212222.content:
Deep within the Everfree Forest, far along a path that no inhabitant of Ponyville dared to tread, two huts revealed the presence of those who didn't fear the forest's unnatural weather, or its dangerous flora and fauna. The larger hut was decorated with frightening looking Zebrican masks, while the smaller was instead surrounded by birdhouses and animal hutches. Her cloak removed, Rainbow Dash carefully removed the bandages from a blue jay's wing. "Alright, soldier, let's see what you've got!" Flapping her own wings, she pushed herself up off the ground and encouraged the bird to follow her.

Stretching its wings, the jay flapped its way up to a nearby branch. Then a higher one, and a higher one still, then started free-flying around the pegasus. "Alright, looks like you're back in business! Now go on and fly back home, I'm getting sick of looking at you every day." Despite her words, she was smiling as the jay returned the expression and waved with its recently healed wing before flying away.

"Funny, you haven't taken your own advice yet," a playfully mocking voice told the pegasus. Dash looked down to see her mentor, Zecora, smirking up at her. "Why don't you move out and go be a vet?"

Rainbow Dash set down on a thick branch and replied, "What? Me? Psh, yeah, right. Like that's ever gonna happen. Besides, if I give up the 'creepy witch doctor' schtick, it'll make pranking the town every Nightmare Night that much less hilarious."

Rather than respond directly to her student's far-too-obvious attempts to sound aloof, however, Zecora paused for a moment. "Perhaps we should discuss the matter of Nightmare Moon. The fated hour is coming soon."

Dash looked down at the zebra. "I already told you all about the Doctor and Nyx. Between them and the Guard Captain, there's probably nothing they can't fix. Plus, Celestia'll be there with soldiers by the score. If anyone, it's Nightmare Moon I feel sorry for." The pegasus crossed her forelegs behind her head and leaned back against the tree to get some rest.

Rather than allow her to do so, however, Zecora turned around and bucked the tree as hard as she could, causing it to vibrate and knock Dash from her perch. Taken by surprise, the pegasus didn't even have time to spread her wings and soften the landing before landing flat on the ground with Zecora looking sternly down at her.

"According to the prophecies, this is no time for catching Z's. Now you listen carefully to your teacher! What happens next decides the fate of every creature! 'The stars will aid in her escape', it says. What does that mean? Care to take a guess?"

Rainbow Dash groaned and rubbed her head. "Come on, I'm bad enough at riddles without a concussion too... Whoever wrote it probably just threw it in because they thought it sounded poetic."

"Or Nightmare Moon will be aided by powers dark," Zecora rebutted, offering a hoof to help Rainbow Dash stand again. Looking her student directly in the eye, she asked, "That Twilight Sparkle... what is her cutie mark?"

Rainbow Dash blinked at the question. "Stars, but..." Her eyes went wide, then narrowed as she stood up and knocked away her teacher's hoof. "Hold on, you did not go there! If we're talking about the same Twilight, I've never met a more loyal mare! If you think her betraying the princess is something that could come to pass, then you can take that idea and shove it right up your-"

"Assuming you know her as well as you think," Zecora interrupted, "then let us step inside and relax with a drink. But Nightmare Moon's agents are many, with hearts black as sin. There may well be dangers to your friend waiting to strike from within. There may be nothing we can do to stop what is in motion, but if you are willing to try, I can teach you some new potions."

Rainbow Dash sighed and knew her mentor was probably right. Not about the idea that Twilight could be a mole, of course, but maybe somepony under her command. Nightmare Moon had inspired several cults during her war of terror a thousand years ago, and some of them were still around, biding their time and waiting for the moment to bring their dark mistress back. During her time living with the zebra, Dash had heard Zecora's stories about how she had hunted down and exposed many such cults in her native Zebrica, before she had traveled to settle in Equestria and make what preparations she could before the thousandth year approached.

With the thought of her friend and the princess she served possibly being betrayed, Rainbow Dash joined Zecora in her hut. If there was going to be a war, better for the pegasus to have all the weapons she could gather up at her disposal. Not that she didn't trust Twilight to have everything well in hoof, of course. Knowing the unicorn, she had everything buttoned up tight.

*****


"Doctor! Doctor!" Twilight Sparkle ran up to the brown stallion as he and the Cutie Mark Crusader's assisted in the preparations. "I just found and arrested a couple of spies! They were disguised as you, actually. Would you like to come help me interrogate them to show that we know the jig is up?"

The Doctor coughed quietly and replied, "Ah, yes, I figured that would be about now... rest assured, Captain Sparkle, neither of them are any threat to Equestria."

The unicorn looked at the Doctor with a perplexed expression. "You figured... what?"

Looking embarassed, the Doctor explained, "Well, you see, Derpy (that is, my wife) and I were interested in seeing the Summer Sun Celebration while we were here. Being in the area, we thought that we might meet our doubles from this timeline while we were at it. So, while the Derpies were baking muffins together, my double and I compared notes when... well, you arrived."

Twilight looked flustered, stammering, "But... I... they were impostors... neither of them had a black eye..."

"Well, I dare say one of them will now." Seeing the unicorn's expression, looking as though the ground had just fallen out from underneath her, he patted her on the shoulder and assured her, "Oh, don't worry about it. A plate of English muffins with butter, and all will be forgiven. I can guarantee you that. It's all a bit timey-wimey, I know, and I would have warned you myself, but... well, I couldn't afford to risk a paradox."

"Right... paradox," Twilight replied in the voice of somepony who knew that she was going to be making one of the biggest apologies of her life in the near future. "I... have to go." With that, she ran off as fast as she could toward the nearest bakery.
153222121212222.title: Witch's Brew & Rhyming Too

choices: Applebloom escapes unnoticed, and warns the others of the cult.
Applebloom is captured by another cultist while fleeing!
1532221212122222.content:
Applebloom had been assigned the task of applying detail repairs to various structures. Frankly, she didn't really see the need for this. It wasn't like Princess Celestia would unleash holy vengeance upon the town for something as small as a chipped window pane. Still, it was Twilight who'd asked her to do this, and the unicorn was famous (in both timelines) for being absolutely obsessive about making the Princess's visits be as perfect as ponily possible. Ya'd figure Princess Celestia would tell Twi ta lighten up, thought the craftsmare as she applied a fresh coat of paint to the peeling sign outside Town Hall.

         As she put away her tools, she spotted something out of the corner of her eye. A blue unicorn with a white mane was trotting down the path nearby. Applebloom recognized him as Pokey Pierce, the pony who'd popped balloons at Diamond Tiara's cute-ceañera. She would have dismissed him, but she noticed a sack slung over his back. The sack was rather large, and was being held in place by Pokey's magic. Applebloom hesitated; she knew she should mind her own business, but at the same time, something about this seemed off. Giving in to her curiosity, she began discretely following the stallion. It was something she'd gotten better at over the years (with assistance from Pinkie Pie from time to time).

         Pokey trotted into an alleyway between two buildings. Looking around, he couldn't see anypony else. He then used a forehoof to slide a piece of the alley's floor aside. It was a secret passage! Pokey slunk inside, and the floor slid back into place moments later. Applebloom rushed over to it, pressing her ear to it. When she couldn't distinguish any hoofsteps on the other side, she carefully slid the secret entrance open herself. A set of stairs led down into a lamp-lit cavern. The craftsmare slid the secret door shut behind her, making sure not to make any noise. Going down the path, she saw that it split into three branches. Fortunately, Pokey was going rather slow, and she could still see him down the path he'd taken. Applebloom followed, using the secret arts of Pinkie-Jutsu to mask her hoofsteps.

         Pokey came to a door, and opened it, slipping inside and shutting it before Applebloom could sneak in after him. She sighed a little at that; one lesson Pinkie hadn't taught her yet was how to get into places without being seen or using conventional means. Still, she wouldn't leave this place empty-hooved. She slid a glass out of her mane (another trick she'd learned from the party pony) and held it against the door. She could make out a conversation in progress.

         "... ought to keep a better eye, Pokey. You're lucky you caught her, or else our whole plan could have been ruined!" growled a female voice. Applebloom recognized it as Colgate's, the local dentist.

         "It's not my fault," insisted Pokey's voice. "She snuck up on me. I never would have noticed if she hadn't bumped that vase. And I got what we were after, anyway."

         "I suppose we ought to throw her in the dungeon with the other unfortunates who've happened across our plans," sighed another mare's voice. This one was unfamiliar to Applebloom, but it held a hint of culture that reminded the earth pony of Canterlot. And it seemed... musical, in a way.

         "Quite right," said Colgate. "But first, hand over the gem, Pokey."

         There was some rustling, as well as a masculine grumble. "I hope our Lady finds this offering worth it. What would she want with a diamond, anyway? Wouldn't sapphires or amethysts be more appropriate for her return?"

         There was the distinct sound of somepony being cuffed across the head. From the sound of the grunt, it was Pokey who'd been struck. "For a unicorn, you're incredibly stupid, Pokey," Colgate scolded. "The diamond is a necessary reagent for the spell we need our Lady to cast. With it, we shall receive a part of Her dark power, and we shall forever be Her favored!"

         "For the glory of Nightmare Moon!" chorused the three ponies within the room.

         It was then that a fourth voice spoke up, groggy. "Uuhh... what...? Oh. This... is bad, isn't it?"

         Applebloom narrowly stifled a gasp. That was Derpy's voice! That, combined with what she'd just heard, was more than enough. It was time to call in the cavalry.
1532221212122222.title: Dark Rising: No Yeast Required

choices: Stick with Applebloom and Derpy
Move outside to keep the PG rating.
15322212121222222.content:
Applebloom quickly tucked the glass away as she turned tail. As much as she wanted to burst in and rescue Derpy from the cult's clutches right away, she had to acknowledge that one young earth pony didn't have very good odds against two unicorns and an unknown. No, the best thing to do right now would be to let the others know about this secret hideaway and return with Nyx, the Doctor, and a squad of Twilight's Guardsponies!

Hurrying down the passageway, she reached the end and opened up the secret entrance. Looking down the alley, she could see Rarity across the street chatting with Pinkie... or rather, Pinkamena. Since they were too far away to call out to, Applebloom started galloping down the alley. Once she was out on the sidewalk again, she would be able to get Rarity's attention, and then-

Stars. Stars and pain making the world explode as she suffered a sudden blow to the head, causing her to stumble and flop over. The last thing she saw as darkness filled her vision was the hooves of a lavender pegasus carefully setting down in front of her.

-----


"-ing out of our secret entrance, Pierce! That's twice somepony's been caught following you, now!

When she finally started to regain consciousness, Applebloom groggily opened her eyes slightly. The lantern light illuminating the room hurt like a knife through her eyes at first, but as she gradually came around, she found herself hanging by her forelegs, which were shackled to a dungeon wall. As she looked around, she could make out Derpy, who was held in similar restraints, and in front of her Pokey Pierce was arguing with a pegasus pony that Applebloom recognized as Cloud Kicker from Ponyville's weather team. At least, that was the case in her native timeline.

"What makes you think it was me? She could've been spying on any one of us," Pokey protested.

"Well it sure as hay wasn't me, because I'm the one who caught her," Cloud Kicker retorted. "Octavia's been down here planning our next move the whole time, and Colgate's smart enough to keep from drawing attention to herself. You, on the other hand, can't seem to keep from sticking your horn in everything and making a scene."

Pokey grimaced. "Yeah, and you would know all about where I've stuck my horn!"

"And you were just as clumsy with it then, too," Cloud Kicker snapped, making the stallion wither. She then noticed that Applebloom was awake and turned her attention away from Pokey to the chained earth pony. "Well, well... you woke up fast. But you Apples always did have a reputation for having thick skulls, even after your big sis decided you were too gentrified to stick around in Ponyville."

The pegasus sauntered over with what looked to Applebloom like a predatory gleam in her eye. Cloud Kicker even licked her lips as she sized up the young mare. "Mmmm, though it certainly doesn't look like city living's made you soft," she mused in a way that made Applebloom shudder.

Thankfully, the posh Canterlot-accented voice from earlier interrupted. "Enough, Kicker. You can indulge in wanton hedonism all you like once we've received our lady's blessing. Until then, I need you to remain focused on the task at hand." The voice belonged to a grey earth pony mare with a darker grey mane and purple eyes. Applebloom caught a glimpse of the pony's flank, spotting a purple treble clef for a cutie mark.

"Our plan hinges on being covert," the earth pony said, approaching Applebloom and Derpy. "So having this many spies on our trail when we're so close to our goal is unacceptable. Pokey, you're going to be assigned to something a little less conspicuous for the time being. You already procured the diamond, so you have done more than enough. Cloud Kicker, you stay here and assist me in the interrogation."

While a somewhat dejected Pokey slunk away, Cloud Kicker smirked and flitted off to the back of the dungeon. Glaring down at the grey mare, Applebloom asked, "Y'all ain't getting nothin' from me! Ah won't talk!"

Octavia smirked. "My dear, I have no intention of making you talk. After all, I am a musician by trade." Cloud Kicker returned, carrying a tray of medical instruments. "I intend to make you sing."
15322212121222222.title: Today's Forecast: Slightly Cloudy

153222121212222221.content:
While Octavia considered which tool to use, Cloud Kicker set the tray down on a nearby stool and asked, "can you not mess her up too bad?" The pegasus leered at Applebloom. "You know how much I love the athletic type."

Octavia rolled her eyes, which were seething with agitation. "I don't go about making crude innuendo while you're working, so kindly extend me the same courtesy. Unless you would care to join these two in chains?"

"Oooh, kinky. I like the way you think, Octy." When Octavia turned a scathing glare on her, though, she sighed, "I miss Blossomforth... She understands me..."

Octavia pressed her hoof against her forehead. She couldn't imagine it being this difficult to gather minions of proper quality in Manehattan or Fillydelphia. But with Celestia having chosen to visit the outdoor insane asylum otherwise known as Ponyville this year, her hoof had been forced. With a quiet groan, she muttered to herself, "Steady now, Octavia... soon you'll be able to plunge this glorified suburb into a symphony of darkness..."

After this little affirmation, she focused her irritation on the two captives. "Now then. Since we have wasted so much time as it is, why don't we skip past the overture and go straight to the first movement? Do you know how many nerve endings are in your hooves? Most ponies don't think about it much, but it's quite a few. Allow me to demonstrate."

Octavia then reached for the tools and medical instruments with her mouth, picking up a small hammer. Looking at Applebloom's defiant glare, she focused on the farm filly. "Kiggr, hlld hrr eghs," she said around the hammer. After taking a moment to mentally translate, Cloud Kicker dutifully came up and took hold of Applebloom's hind legs to hold them in place. And judging by the grin on her face, she was enjoying the opportunity more than was professionally necessary, even by evil cult standards. More importantly, though, was the way Octavia was focusing on her hooves with that hammer in her mouth.

Applebloom had cracked her hoof once, years ago when attempting to be a Cutie Mark Crusader Base Jumper, so in answer to Octavia's rhetorical question, she did have a good idea of how much it was going to hurt and absolutely no desire to repeat the experience. She struggled and squirmed to get her legs free from Cloud Kicker's grip, and did her very best not to think about how much the perverted pegasus was likely enjoying it.

Octavia took her time drawing it out, carefully aiming and rolling her neck around to limber it up. She pulled back to swing...

"I want you to eat my muffin, Cloud Kicker!"

Derpy's sudden outburst startled everypony, but especially Cloud Kicker. "Really?" she asked hopefully, looking toward the shackled pegasus and loosening her grip just enough for Applebloom to pull one leg free and kick Cloud Kicker in the face! Octavia was just starting to swing her hammer as Applebloom knocked the pegasus away, and instead of her hammer splitting open her prisoner's hoof, it hit only empty air while Applebloom wrapped both legs around Octavia's neck.

Once she had the evil earth pony caught, Applebloom said to her, "As a matter o' fact, ah know what a cracked hoof feels like. Question is, do y'all know how much leg strength it takes t' snap a whack-job's spine? Ah'll give ya a hint, it ain't as much as it takes t' work Applebuckin' Season!" With a grin, she looked over at the wall-eyed prisoner on the wall beside her. "Quick thinkin', Mrs. Hooves!"

Derpy gave a small, proud smile and shrugged as best she could while hanging by her forelegs. "Oh, I get a good idea now and then. So you're the Applebloom from my world? Does that mean the Doctor...?"

"Brought the whole Cutie Mark Crusader Cavalry! Now we just gotta get outta here." Octavia was fighting against her, but the farm filly had her in a position that she couldn't break out of easily, as well as a noticeable strength advantage over the sadistic cellist. Maybe it would have been a little more of a challenge if they were in a hoof-wrestling contest, but the ponies who could beat an Apple when it came to their bucking legs were few and far between.

Seeing Cloud Kicker start to shake off the effects of her earlier kick to the face, Applebloom increased the pressure on Octavia's throat slightly. "Alright, Kicker, here's how it goes! Y'all're gonna let her outta those chains," she said, tilting her head toward Derpy. "If you pull anything funny, ah'll squeeze 'til yer leader looks like one o' them funny stress dolls. Got it?"

Cloud Kicker groaned and rubbed her head where she was struck, but saw the position Octavia was in. The musician didn't say anything, purple eyes focused on her. "Yeah... yeah, I got it."

1532221212122222212.content:
Cloud Kicker wasn't an ordinary weather pony. She had once attended West Hoof Academy, a military academy that many Royal Guards attended. She learned a few things there, notably loyalty. But she had learned something else while in Ponyville; sometimes, it was best to cut your losses and run. And that's precisely what she did.

         Ignoring the angry calls of the earth pony filly, she turned and ran from the room, using the wind from her wake to close the door behind her. She then ran for the main entrance of the underground tunnel system, before pausing. She turned around, and headed for what had been dubbed her 'quarters', though calling them that was perhaps dignifying them too much. In reality, it was a glorified closet, with barely enough room for a mattress.

         There was a reason most of the cultists decided to continue actually living in Ponyville proper.

         At her quarters, Cloud Kicker retrieved her 'collection': a series of Playcolt magazines. She grinned at the top cover. Blossomforth, an old flame, was featured on that one, and seeing her made the weather mare want to find her and...

         She shook her head wildly. She's in Canterlot now, since Octy 'promoted' her. She's out of reach for the moment. Just got to get out of here with this, and lay low, and hopefully Octy will get the situation back under control.

         Cloud Kicker wasn't afraid of Apple Bloom following through on her threat. While the Apples were an honest bunch, they would never seek to deliberately harm somepony else, let alone kill them. Still can't believe a city filly like her has flanks that toned... she mused idly.

         She went back to the main entrance, sliding the alley floor out of the way, and closing it behind her, all while whistling a merry tune. Her whistling stopped when she came face-to-face with none other than the Captain of the Royal Guard, with a group of six other guards behind her. She thought of only one thing to say.

         "I'm going to kill Pokey."

*****


         Back in the 'interrogation' room, Apple Bloom cursed as the door closed behind Cloud Kicker. "Well, ain't that lovely? Nice minion ya got, there," she mocked Octavia, before throwing the musician a good twenty feet away.

         Octavia coughed as she rubbed her neck where the filly's hooves had been wrapped. "Good help is hard to find, I admit," she gasped. "Though I admit, I never thought a city filly like yourself would have such strength in her hind legs. Don't you live a sedentary lifestyle?"

         Apple Bloom was about to reply, when she paused. Ah don't want this whackjob ta know ah'm from another timeline. Outwardly, she shrugged. "Ah exercise a lot. Jus' 'cause ah live in the city don't mean ah gotta be lazy."

         "Quite," Octavia gave a knowing smile. "I suppose that part of an earth pony's ethic is something we have in common." She coughed again, and her look hardened. "Still, this has only given you a reprieve. I'll simply fetch Colgate, and have her assist me in this interrogation. I do think you'll find it far harder to distract her." She turned around, and headed for the door. "I'll be back in a minuette."

         When she had left, Apple Bloom sighed. "Well, can't say ah didn't try," she muttered.

         "You did your best," Derpy replied. "But why ask for me to be set free first?"

         "Ah was keepin' the grey psycho in place. If Cloud Kicker had set me loose first, it'd have been harder ta hang on ta her."

         "That makes sense," the wall-eyed mare admitted.

         Before the conversation could continue, the door opened again.

153222121212222222.content:
Nyx looked over her list one final time, then rolled it up, confident she'd done everything that was needed. She headed back towards the town square, where the group had agreed to meet once they were finished with the items on their lists. Nyx had drawn quite a few stares from the townsponies, but the reassurances of Twilight and Applejack were enough to get ponies to leave her be for the most part.

         As she approached, she saw Sweetie Belle, the Doctor, and Scootaloo already there. In addition, Applejack, Fluttershy, and Twilight were talking together, while Rarity and Pinkamena spoke off to the side. That last part confused Nyx; she never would have suspected the rock farmer and the beat poet would get along. Rarity often grew exasperated with Pinkie back in her own timeline. Still, she put that aside for the moment, approaching Twilight. "All done, Captain!" she reported.

         "Good. Now, did you triple-check that you'd done everything correctly?" asked the lavender unicorn.

         Nyx barely suppressed an eye-roll. "Yes, I did. And yes, I triple-checked that I'd triple-checked, and then checked once more just to be safe."

         Twilight's mouth closed with an audible *click!*. "Um, wow. You seem to know just what it is I expected."

         Nyx smirked. "Well, I know you rather well in my home timeline, and I figured if something would be consistent, it'd be your obsessive nature when it comes to organizing things."

         Twilight blushed at that as Fluttershy and Applejack laughed. "She's got you there, Twilight!" Applejack managed to get out through her guffaws.

         Nyx chuckled as well, then looked at her friends. "Hey, girls, have you seen Applebloom?"

         Sweetie looked over, and shook her head. "Nope. Then again, she's got all that detail work to do, so it might be a while."

         "True," Nyx conceded. She looked over at Rarity and Pinkamena. "I'm still having trouble with Pinkamena over there," she muttered.

         "Oh, she means well," Fluttershy said, surprisingly. "She's just a bit melancholy, and doesn't seem to know a good joke when she sees one."

         "That's the trouble," Nyx sighed. "In my timeline, she's the most energetic, happy-go-lucky pony around. She throws a party for every new pony that comes to Ponyville. Seeing her like this..."

         "Well, that sounds rather nice," Applejack said. "What happened to me in your timeline?"

         Nyx smiled wanly. "Well, during your visit in Manehattan, you saw a rainbow when you were lamenting leaving the farm. You followed it, and it led you right back to the farm, and you became one of its proprietors."

         Applejack sighed, lowering her head. "I do regret leaving the farm sometimes... but I can do so much good as I am right now. But... is my other self happy, at least?"

         "Very much so," Nyx nodded. "You even inherited your father's Stetson."

         The loan mare smiled sadly. "Big Macintosh got it in this timeline," she said. "I can't imagine what it would look like on me..."

         Fluttershy coughed. "So what about me and Iron Will?"

         Nyx blushed. "Um, about that... you two never met up until later in your lives. Instead, you take care of all the little woodland creatures in a cottage by the Everfree Forest. Also, you're a lot more... timid."

         The pegasus cocked her head quizzically. "Wow. I never outgrew my timid phase?" She paused, putting a hoof to her chin. "Actually, my hubby helped a lot with that. So, if we never met up, I guess I can see how I never came out of my shell."

         "The one time you two did meet, it was a near disaster. He tried to make you more assertive, but it worked a little too well. You became a bully," Nyx added, her blush intensifying.

         Fluttershy sighed. "So, he never outgrew his 'so boisterous it hurts' phase, either." She smiled. "If we hadn't met when we did here, we'd be completely different."

         "That's the truth," Twilight nodded. "Nyx told me last night that I actually got into Celestia's School for Gifted Unicorns, even though I flunked the entrance exam in this timeline. Also, something about being Princess Celestia's personal apprentice?"

         "Well, ain't that just dandy!" Rarity said, trotting over, followed by Pinkamena. "Makes me wonder what happened ta me over there."

         Nyx smiled. "Well, that rock your horn led you to got cracked open, revealing dozens of gems. You took them home and used them to spruce up the costumes for that play. You're now one of the most successful fashion designers in Equestria, having gotten the attention of Hoity Toity, Sapphire Shores, and the like."

         Rarity whistled. "So there is somethin' in that big ol' rock! It's actually on Cliffton Acres, but it's so big nopony's bothered with it. Ah'll have to give it a nice buck sometime."

         "That's all well and good," Pinkamena said tonelessly, "but why is everything so different? Why is your timeline so different from ours?"

         Nyx sighed. "It's because Fluttershy never met Rainbow Dash in flight camp," she revealed.

         "Wait, what?" Fluttershy asked with a blink. "What do me and the 'Rainbow Witch Doctor' have to do with it?"

         "Everything." Nyx gathered her thoughts. "You and Rainbow Dash met at flight camp in our timeline when you were being harassed by some bullies. She stepped in, and challenged the bullies to a race. During the race, you were knocked off of Cloudsdale, and were caught by a swarm of butterflies before you hit the ground."

         "You're telling us one race made all the difference?" Twilight asked, arching an eyebrow.

         "Not just the race," Nyx replied. "What happened during the race. One of the bullies tried knocking Rainbow off-course. She managed to catch up and win the race... by performing a Sonic Rainboom."

         Everypony's jaw fell open. "But that's just a Cloudsdale legend!" Fluttershy exclaimed. "No living pony's ever come close to performing one!"

         "And that Rainboom had effects all over Equestria," Nyx continued. She looked at Fluttershy. "When the explosion from the Rainboom startled all the animals, you coaxed them out of hiding, and comforted them, earning your Cutie Mark." Next, she turned to Applejack. "It was the rainbow from the Rainboom that led you back to your farm." Rarity. "The shockwave cracked open that rock, revealing the gems." Twilight. "The explosion startled you so much, your magic spun out of control, and you actually hatched the dragon egg." Pinkamena. "When you saw the Rainboom, you were filled with wonder and laughter, and you brought that gift to your family, and everypony else you met ever since."

         The five mares were silent, dumbstruck by the revelation. "Hon, that's gotta be the biggest stretch ah've ever heard," Rarity finally said. "Yer tellin' me that me and five other mares all got their Cutie Marks and different destinies because of the same event?"

         "She's telling the truth," Pinkamena stated, eyes wide with amazement. "It sounds crazy, but it's true!" She looked down. "So cruel... Why did you have to tell us that?"

         "You asked," Nyx replied.

         Twilight frowned. "Wait a minute. What is the significance of all that? Why are the six of us important?"

         Nyx gulped, but was spared having to answer by Pinkamena suddenly scratching at her neck. "Itchy neck..." she glanced around. "Something's wrong."

         "What do you mean?" asked Applejack.

         "Pinkie Sense," Nyx replied, standing alert. "Itchy neck means there's somepony spying on us."

         The pink mare looked at her oddly. "You really know me that well?"

         Nyx nodded. "You're a very good friend, Pinkamena." She glanced around, trying to locate the spy.
153222121212222222.title: Revelations of Rainbow

1532221212122222221.content:
Pokey Pierce grumbled to himself as he left the hidden base. He had been told to lay low, but it wasn't as though he was going to do anything that would draw any more attention. He was just going to get something to eat from one of those stalls that was setting up for the Summer Sun Celebration. After all, just because he was a member of an organization dedicated to overthrowing Celestia and destroying everything the celebration stood for, that didn't mean he couldn't enjoy a funnel cake.

But as he walked the street, seeing the preparations being made, that was when he saw... her. Pokey felt his heart stop in his chest as right there in the street, there stood a mare that he was certain had to be an hallucination.

To his eyes, she was the pinnacle of perfection. A tall black mare, fit and muscular, but so graceful and femininely proportioned at the same time. Through a long, flowing purple mane that seemed to dance around her face with every movement, a long black horn projected from her head. And her eyes! Those weren't pony eyes, with their vertically slitted pupils set in irises of sparkling turquoise, but the eyes of a goddess. So entranced was he by her face that it wasn't until she ruffled her wings that his gaze was drawn to the motion, and he realized that she had some.

Every facet... every detail... it all added up in his shocked mind and told him that he was looking at Nightmare Moon returned fully incarnate! But that was completely impossible. He and his group hadn't carried out the ritual to set their goddess free, and even if she had somehow slipped out of her lunar prison sooner than expected, there should be a greater outcry. A wailing cry of despair among the foalish sheep-ponies loyal to Celestia beheld Equestria's true dread ruler!

Instead, his goddess was just standing there. Watching the preparations while levitating a scroll in front of her face. And smiling as she checked things off on it.

Pokey's heart suddenly shifted gears from Neutral to Overdrive as he stared at Nightmare Moon. No, she couldn't be here. Not physically, anyway. It was a vision! That's right, he was being rewarded for his hard work in preparing for her return by getting blessed with a vision of his dark mistress! That was the only thing that made sense.

It was a sign that even in her prison on the moon, her spirit was watching them. Ensuring that everything was ready for her glorious return! And the fact that she had chosen to appear before him meant that he was favored by Nightmare Moon, no matter what that snob Octavia or that tramp Cloud Kicker said! And sweet Moon did his goddess have some amazing flanks, even though he had always been told that her cutie mark was a crescent moon, not a dark blue shield. But since the shield had a gleam to it that resembled a crescent moon, he figured that it was a minor detail that had been forgotten in the last thousand years. No, the only thing that was truly important was that she had chosen him to grant this vision to. This was for him and him alo--why was she walking over to that group of ponies?

Why was she talking to the Captain of Celestia's Royal Guard?

Why were they talking back to her?!

Pokey felt his breath catch in his lungs as his goddess had what looked like a breezy chat with a group of mares, some of which he recognized from around town, and that weird brown stallion with the hourglass cutie mark. And they could see her. And they were talking to her. And nopony was bowing or pleading for mercy! The unicorn stallion's mind reeled, trying in vain to make sense of what he was seeing, but this was the opposite of sense! It wasn't nonsense, it was anti-sense!

Perhaps it wasn't really his goddess, he thought, though that idea clamped down around his heart like a fish in a gryphon's claws. But then he realized that even if it wasn't Nightmare Moon incarnate he was watching, she could be. The gorgeous alicorn fit all the criteria, physically, so once his group called the spirit of Nightmare Moon back to Equestria, wouldn't this one make the perfect vessel? Oddly, he didn't entirely know how to feel about that, but as long as he had a goal to work toward, it gave him something to focus on.

Unfortunately, this rumination happened to come at around the same time that Pinkamena's neck started itching, and when he set his sights on the faux-Nightmare and her companions, he found them all setting their sights on him.

"Oh, horsefeathers," he muttered before turning tail and bolting away.

-----


"Get him!" Nyx and Twilight were the first to react, giving chase once the unicorn eying them tried to flee. In actuality, they hadn't really known who was spying on them. The appearance of their little group, especially Nyx, continued to draw quite a few curious stares. It was the fact that he started running that told them the blue stallion was the one watching them with ill intent.

"If you teleport in front of him, I'll get him from behind," Nyx suggested to Captain Sparkle as the two of them galloped after the spy.

"Teleport?! How the hay am I supposed to teleport?"

Nyx only refrained from facehoofing at her error to keep from tripping as she ran. "Oh... right. Sorry! I'll try to cut him off, then!" Spreading her wings, she used her forward momentum to lift off with a few powerful flaps, giving her enough altitude to soar after the fleeing unicorn. While the earth pony part of her heritage kept her from being as nimble in the air as a pegasus, she could lock her wings into place like an eagle and glide along the air currents. Not having to flap her wings to maintain lift also gave her another advantage in that it allowed her to concentrate on using unicorn magic.

Her horn glowed briefly, building up a magical charge before releasing it as a bolt of lightning that hit the ground in front of the spy, causing him to rear up and change directions. Nyx adjusted her course slightly, sending more bolts down around Pokey, herding him back around toward the others where they could circle around him, leaving him nowhere to go.

Seeing that he was trapped, Pokey tried to summon his own magic, only to get surrounded by a field of purple energy that lifted him up and started shaking, rattling his concentration to the point where there was no way for him to focus on casting a spell. When he was set down again, his eyes rolled around and around in his head as Captain Sparkle's armored form loomed over him. "Let's see if we can get some answers out of this guy."
1532221212122222221.title: Get the Pony Pokey & Shake Him All About!

choices: Twilight caves, and allows Nyx to join the operation

15322212121222222211.content:
Pokey struggled to focus his eyes on the image of Captain Sparkle. "So, care to tell us why you ran from us, sir?" the guardsmare asked. "You weren't doing anything wrong, were you?"

         "I don't have to answer to you, dog of Celestia!" Pokey retorted instinctively.

         There was a few moments of silence. "Well, I'd say we just found a cultist of Nightmare Moon," commented the faux-Nightmare.

         Pokey winced, realizing that he'd screwed up, yet again. I'll be lucky if Octavia doesn't chain me up in the base alongside those two spies! he thought desperately.

         "You do realize that worshipping the Mare in the Moon is considered illegal, don't you?" asked Captain Sparkle.

         "I'm not saying anything else," Pokey grumbled. "Torture me, beat me, do whatever you like, my lips are sealed."

         Captain Sparkle looked about ready to test his resolve, but she was waved back by the faux-Nightmare. "Let me handle him," she said, stepping forward.

         Pokey glared at her. "I don't know who you are, or why you look like a mockery of my Lady, but you will pay for your insolence when She returns." He didn't register that her horn was glowing softly.

         "You think me a mockery?" she asked, and suddenly her voice grew in power as her body grew, her mane and tail became star-studded nebulous trails, and she was suddenly clad in light-blue armor. "Show your respect, worm! I am no mere mockery!"

         Pokey didn't even register that he couldn't see any other ponies around, nor did he notice that the area was suddenly much darker; he only had eyes for the wrathful alicorn before him. He prostrated himself. "F-forgive me, my Lady! I - I wasn't certain it was you! After all, the prophecies state that you aren't yet supposed to be freed!"

         Nightmare Moon snorted. "It is true that I am still sealed on my moon, yet I've regained enough power to project an image to Equestria should I so desire."

         "Of course you can!" Pokey agreed. "You are, after all, the one true Goddess of Equestria."

         "Indeed." She regarded him quizzically. "Tell me, do you work alone, or are there others you work with?"

         Pokey gulped. "Don't... don't you know your worshippers, my Lady?"

         "Not all of them; this is the first image I've projected in some time," she explained.

         The unicorn nodded; it must take a fair amount of power to project an image like she did. "Well, in answer to your question, my Lady, there are three others in my sect; Cloud Kicker, a local weathermare, Colgate, the town's dentist, and Octavia, our coordinator with the main branch in Canterlot."

         "Oh?" His Lady seemed interested. "There are retainers of mine even in Celestia's stronghold? How many?"

         "I don't know, my Lady," Pokey answered, cringing in fear of disappointing his Queen. "Only Octavia might know, and she's busy interrogating a couple of spies."

         "Spies?" she asked, suddenly frowning. "What do you mean, 'spies'?"

         Pokey cringed even more. "Twice today, our plans were nearly uncovered by ponies outside our sect. One was a grey pegasus mare with a blonde mane; she very nearly caught me while I was retrieving an item we planned to present to you at your return. The other was a yellow earth pony mare with a red mane; she somehow followed me into the passage leading to our secret hideout."

         "And both times, you were at fault for not noticing them?" growled Nightmare Moon.

         The stallion planted his face into the ground. "Forgive me, my Lady! I managed to catch the pegasus, and turned her over to Octavia for questioning! And the earth pony has also been apprehended! Our plans are still safe!"

         "You are lucky," she replied with honey-sweet venom, "that I happen to be in a good mood. Now, where is this hideout you mentioned? I might visit while I still have some time left."

         "Of course!" Pokey nodded eagerly. "It's down the alleyway between Sugarcube Corner and Quills & Sofas. There's a hollow section of the street that you can move aside."

         "Good," the dark mare said. "In that case, rest, my retainer. Soon, all of your hard work, will be finished."

         Pokey wanted to reply, wanted to thank his Lady for being merciful, but his eyelids were drooping already. Soon, the blackness of sleep claimed him, comforted that his Lady's return was well in hoof.
