"Stop right there, filly. How did you get aboard my ship?" Applebloom looked into the face of a unicorn she would usually call a minor nuisance at worst, and her sister's eggheaded friend at best. This face, however, was stern, cold, and wary. A blade of black steel was unsheathed, but not wielded threateningly.

"U-um..."

The Doctor pushed past Applebloom and out onto the ship, seemingly not noticing all the guards surrounding them. "Blast, I didn't have the co-ordinates set for Colton at all, I must have used them to track- Twilight! Ah, there you are, old girl! How have you been, I mean, look at you!" The Doctor gave Twilight a wide grin, and she frowned, but hesitated.

"How do you know my name, stranger?"

"Oh, I'm sorry, thought it would be obvious. You're just one of the most well known Dark Knights that protect Colton, of course! I'm The Doctor, that's it, just 'Doctor', and these are my faithful companions, Applebloom, Sweetie Belle, Scootaloo, and Dawn." Nyx nodded and smiled, wondering why the Doctor hadn't just used her real name. She decided to put it out of her mind for now, though, and tried to keep up with the Doctor's wild ramblings.

"... And I'm a big fan, you see, and I wanted to show them the great city of Colton, as well as introduce them to you, and I guess you must have been closer than Colton was to our starting point, because we're here instead. I'd leave right away, but I cannot at the moment, because the TARDIS can only teleport once a day, and we cannot do so until tomorrow." An obvious lie if you knew the Doctor, but Twilight seemed to buy it.

"Very well. You will be checked for weapons, and then shown to a room. We sleep in shifts when at full staff, so you'll be sharing with Platoon Three. Look See!"

"Yes, Captain!"

"Show our guests to where they shall be staying. We shall let this... Doctor... keep the key to his contraption. They are to be treated as guests, with the best of Colton Hospitality. Is that understood?"

All guards and crew members in earshot hollered "Yes, Captain!" before going back to their patrols, maintenance or otherwise.

"Well, that went surprisingly well for ad-libbing your way into a Captain's trust," Nyx teased the Doctor. He just smiled honestly in return.

"Weeell, being around your mum for so long must be rubbing off on me. It doesn't matter where we are, or what she is, it seems that she's always got a few consistencies. You just have to touch on those to get her to accept you. It's actually getting to know ponies that takes real work." The Doctor laughed, but Nyx just looked at the ground, getting lost in thought.

"Here we are, Doctor and company. This is where you'll be sleeping for your shift." Nyx looked up at the spacious if spartan room, filled with bunks, hammocks, and lockers. There didn't seem to be enough for a whole platoon, but she guessed that was the point. Ponies would share the beds, lockers, everything. Nyx turned to look at their guide, a resplendent green pegasus with binoculars for a cutiemark.

"Thank you for having us, and I hope we don't interrupt the sleeping shifts any."

Look See smiled. "It's no trouble, this platoon is one of the smaller ones, so we'll have the space. Don't you worry about that."

Nyx nodded, smiling, before turning away. "I really like your mane, Dawn. The way you've styled it is something that wouldn't last long on an airship, not unless Lady Rarity was there to help." Look See giggled as Nyx blushed.

"Yes, um... I don't know how, but it usually fixes itself. It's like it has a mind of its own."

Look See laughed again and left the four of them to situate themselves. As soon as she was out of earshot, the Doctor whipped out his Sonic Screwdriver and began waving it around before squinting at the side of it. "Now that's weird..."

Scootaloo hopped off the hammock she'd been laying on and trotted over. "What's weird?"

"Nothing. And that's the weird thing. At this time of day, there'd be at least one encounter with some sort of flying beast."

"Flying beast?"

"Yes, this world is inhabited by many sorts of monsters and undead creatures, of all sorts and sizes and strengths. In this world, most 'non-combatants' are children, scholars, or bards. Every able-bodied pony has some knowledge of magic or fighting. And those monsters and beasts usually leave an energy signature that my sonic screwdriver can pick up. Like an early warning system, almost. Why, it can-" Suddenly, the screwdriver pinged, and the whole ship shuddered as something slammed into its side. "We need to get topside, and fast!"

What happened?!

The other ships in the armada seemed to be dealing with their own dragons, but the behemoth on the flagship was easily twenty times the size as any others. The dragon reached up with a hand to tear her off, but she danced around it, and the dragon howled in rage as it clawed itself.

The dragon pulled away from the airship, the ship rocketing higher into the sky as the engines, which had been trying to stall their downward movement, were suddenly free. The Doctor, Sweetie Belle, and Apple Bloom burst through the hatch, Scootaloo propelling above them and staring at the dragon with wide eyes. "Dawn! You go, filly! Woohoo! Show that dragon's who's boss!"

Nyx looked up at the name, seeing Scootaloo cheering her on. "No problem! Yeeah!" She brought the sword down again, smacking the but of it into the dragon's head. This time, instead of growling or roaring, the dragon just groaned, and started to sag.

Twilight saw this, and took aim. "Good work, Dawn, you've stunned it. Now move out of the way!" Twilight prepared her sword for another Dark Wave, and Nyx's eyes went wide.

"No, wait! Don't-"

"Yah!"

"Shield!" A large shield appeared around Nyx and the dragon, causing Twilight's attack to dissipate, and Rainbow to veer off course, lest she flatten herself.

"Rainbow Dash! How fare you in the fight?"

"I'm doing well, Twi, but what the hay's her problem? We coulda killed that dragon easily!"

"You don't have to kill it! Just reason with it!"

"You can't reason with monsters, you crazy fily! Now drop that shield spell!"

Nyx, with how angry she was, couldn't help but slip into something she hadn't used since her last big temper tantrum: The Royal Canterlot Voice. "NAY! I SHALL NOT LET THY SWORDS SPILL THE BLOOD OF SUCH A MAGNIFICENT CREATURE, WHEN IT IS WITHIN MINE POWER TO STOP THIS AT ONCE!"

Nyx then landed on the dragon's snout, and glared into its eyes, her own reverting to their draconic appearance. "Now, why doth thou attack a vessel of the Red Wings this fine day? What reason could drive a creature of such a proud race to prey on those who slay only in the name of survival?"

The dragon, much to Twilight and Rainbow Dash's shock and amazement, spoke back in a deep, rumbling voice that seemed older than the land. "We are in the middle of our centennial migration, Daughter of the Moon, and they were in our path. It is not a good idea to be in a dragon's path when it is in heat."

"Yes, I can understand your qualm, and I can hope that we could reach an agreement, if but only for this one chance: Spare us for our foolishness, for we did not know of this great ritual, and we shall give unto you the finest jewel held within the fleet. Does this sound agreeable?"

The dragon chuckled, the sound like distant thunder. "You make a brave claim, and we will let you go this one time, without the charge. When next we migrate, however, there will be consequences if our path is blocked."

Nyx smiled and bowed low on the dragon's snout, her eyes once again becoming 'normal'. "Thank you for your generosity, and your kind warning. I am sure that the Red Wings will take it to heart. If we ever meet again, I should like it to be in a moment of joy, not 'pon an open battlefield."

The dragon smiled, lowering his head so Nyx could hop onto the flagship's main deck as her shield spell fell away. With a roar like the Eastern wind, he flew past the ship, the other dragons all drifting along in his wake. Nyx just smiled as she looked after them, before turning to find that everypony on board was staring at her in shock.

"A... Amazing," Twilight muttered as she removed her helmet. "I have never seen anypony face down a dragon alone... and have both parties live."

Some of the guards around her started cheering, while others looked to their captain for orders, while nervously casting glances at Nyx. Twilight smiled broadly and shouted for all the ships to hear, "Stallions and Mares of the Red Wings, Ateeention!" There was a booming chorus of "Aye, Captain!"

Twilight looked around. "Report casualties!" A pegasus swooped down, reporting two with injuries, but no deaths. Twilight let him go back to his post with a nod. "Crew, salute!"

"Aye!"

"Three cheers for Dawn! The Dragon Speaker!"

"Urah! Urah! Urah!"

"Crew, take five!"

"Aye, aye!" With that, Twilight turned around and headed for her on-board office, motioning for Nyx to follow after.

"Dawn, come with me. We have much to discuss."

They quickly rushed after the white unicorn, and arrived just as she got the attention of...

Nyx's eyes went wide with shock, as did the rest of the crusaders eyes. Standing before them in a Black armor, mane hanging straight, was Pinkie Pie. There was a black sword strapped to her back, positioned for easy access. She looked at them with serious and danger filled eyes, with a bit of something else in the very back of them.

"Did you need something citizens?"

The Doctor opened his mouth to say something, when he was cut off by a scream. The ponies all turned to see two griffons running way from a mare, both of them carrying bags that obviously belonged to her. Stupidly enough, they were charging straight towards the group, and the armor wearing Pinkie Pie they had just approached.

"Stop! Thieves!"

Pinkie turned back to them, the expression on her face unchanged. "Please hold be patient, and wait for me to finish this before announcing your grievances." And with that she turned back around to face the griffons. One of them reached her before the other, getting up on his back legs as he approached, and swinging a fist at her. She side stepped it, and without ever changing her expression from one of mild boredom, grabbed his arm with her hooves and Twisted it until Nyx heard the Bones snap like twigs in at lest three separate places. Pinkie turned around and kicked him in the face before he even had a chance to scream. The second Griffon tried to take off right over her, but she jumped up, grabbed his wing, and spun him until he slammed face first into the corner of a stone building. She then landed and promptly stomped on his wing so hard the stone beneath it cracked.

She then turned back to the group as if nothing had happened, and sat down. "Thank you for waiting. What did you need?"

"I say, was all that really necessary?" The Doctor asked, pointing at the two thieves as the mare they had stolen from retrieved her bags.

"Almost any other knight would have simply killed them and been done with it." Pinkie replied, as she crossed her forelegs defensively. "Would you rather I do that?"

"No! But really! Breaking his arm, and his wing like that..." The Doctor continued to protest.

"Cripples do not fight in gladiator matches...yet another kindness I have shown them."

"Kindness?! You call that kindness?!"

"Considering who our king is...yes. I do." The Pink mare replied. "I'm being as kind and honorable as I can, while still upholding my honorbound duty to serve our king. Unless there is a successful rebellion, I can do no more that what you have already seen me do to protect the people."

"Now...what did you want?"

"Well...right now I'd like to know who you are." The Doctor said.

"Pinkamina Dianne, the Knight of Shadow, Daughter of Scorpan. Is there anything else you wish to know?"

"Yes. Can you direct me to Sugarcube corner?"

The knight paused, her expression remaining the same as it always had, but there was some thing like a twinkle in her eyes that had changed.

"If your going there in the hopes of joining into Rebellion centered activities, then you should know the guard is going to launch a strike against them soon." The pink mare turned and started to walk away, before pausing and looking back over her shoulder at the group.

"Tell anypony that I was the one who told you that, and you will not have a tongue tomorrow when you awaken."

And on that cheerful note, Pinkie left.

"Yeah, so?"

"So, who is Scorpan, and why does she think he's her father?" The Doctor asked.

There was a dramatic pause, before Scootaloo realized something. "Hey! She never actually gave us the directions to Sugarcube Corner!"

I brush a hoof over Shae's as she looks down, hiding her face from me. "Don't worry none 'bout me, Love. Y'know as well's I do that yer the best mare for it." Rain patters softly on the cobblestone around us, as we're huddled under an archway leading to Queen Platinum's palace. I bring a hoof to her chin and make her look up. "Don't worry, lassie. Ya've done harder things than babysittin' a full grown mare; ya've done that fer me plenty." I give a hearty chuckle and she manages a small smile.

Shae shakes her head a bit, before bringing her gaze to meet mine once more. "You're probably right, Rose. Thank you so much for understanding. This isn't going to be easy..." Again she turns away slightly, darting her eyes towards the castle behind her.

"Tch, I know, lass, I know. I also know Celina's a right dolly mare, an' if any'ne can bring 'er back 'round, it's you. Divines know this place needs it." I look up just as a flash of lightning streaks across the sky. The princess is distressed, indeed. "But I don't wanna get in th' way, see. I can't un'erstand wha's happening, an' I might just upset 'er further. I know where I'm not needed."

Shae giggles and presses her head into my shoulder, ruffling the end of my mane with her breath. "Again, thank you." She raises her head again to look me in the eye. "I'll do everything I can for her. At least it's good that somepony I care about hasn't changed." She smiles sweetly as she says this, and I can't help the bark of laughter that escapes.

"Oi, tha's me! Yer sunshine in th' rain." I ruffle her mane softly. "I'll come back an' visit when yer girl is happy again," I say as I lean in close. "Tha's a promise." I pull her into a hug, which she gratefully accepts, and then our lips are together and the world just disappears for a while.

As we pull apart, cheeks flushed, I lean in quickly to nuzzle her comfortingly. "Goodbye for now, love. And best of luck." Shae steps back, a smile gracing her face.

"Goodbye, Rose," she says with a small curtsy. "But you know I don't need luck!" After that, she turns around and starts trotting happily towards the castle. Funny how a kiss can make everything look better.

Despite myself, I feel all tingly too as I give a small whoop."Damn skippy she don't need luck! She's got me!" I jump in the air, clapping my hind hooves together before settling down once more. Out of the corner of my eye, I see a black unicorn stepping out of a strange blue box that I swear wasn't there a few moments before. "Oi!" I shout, startling the mare. "Where'd you come from, lass?" With a gasp she pulls herself back into the blue box, the door slamming shut. "Oi, I'm talkin' ta you! Least ya could do is answer!"



Nyx

"Oh, it seems we're in Everfree right now," the Doctor murmurs as he looks out the door at the opposite wall of a cobblestone pathway. "Hmm... This isn't where we needed to be, but I guess we could pick up some Royal Guards or Carrier Clansmares to help us..."

I step past Scootaloo, who is looking towards the Doctor quizzically. "Carrier clan?"

The Doctor chuckles as I take a step outside the box, only my head and withers outside, into the rain. "Nyx," the Doctor starts as he comes up behind me.

"Oi!" A voice I don't recognize suddenly shouts from somewhere outside.

"Nyx, get in here! Quickly!" The Doctor pulls on my tail, hissing under his breath, causing me to gasp and take a step back, into the TARDIS. The door swings shut of its own accord, and I turn towards the Doctor in a huff.

"What's the matter, Doctor?" He backs away a step as he lets go of my tail, sighing in relief.

""There aren't any Alicorns at this point in time, Nyx. Or at least, none that the public knows about. The only ones anypony talks about are the Divines, the nine Gods and Goddesses that watch the world from above. Ultimately, they're legendary ponies believed to have ascended to ethereal levels centuries ago. In fact, there's a great deal of disagreement over whether or not they were even real. Either way, these ponies pray to these Divines in times of need, since they don't have any physical deity to speak with. There's a god of the forge, a goddess of war, a god of literature, a god of labor, and so on. If you want my advice, if you must mention any deity, just use Epona. She's sort of the Celestia of this time."

I look back at my wings, and then up to my horn. "So you're saying I should change my appearance?"

The Doctor nods. "Basically, well, yeah. No offense."

I sigh as I tap into my magic. "Well, I'll have to become a unicorn; somepony's already seen me from the shoulders forward."

"That makes sense," the Doctor murmurs from behind as I will my wings out of sight. Taking another breath, I push open the door, quickly stepping out and almost running horn-first into the earth pony who'd seen me.

She narrows her eyes at me. "Oi, ya gonna tell me what that was all about? Ponies don't just turn away when hailed unless they be doin' somethin' wrong. Y'aren't doin' nothing wrong, aye?"

"W-well no, of course not! You just surprised me, is all," I stammer, feeling flustered. "Besides, my travelling companion had just called out as well, and, uh..." The Doctor steps out in front of me, a hoof held out in front.

"Why 'ello there! How're you doing today? It's a bit rainy, innit? Blimey, where are the weather pegasi when you need them, eh? I'm the Doctor, that's it. Just 'Doctor,' is all. What's your name, eh?"

The mare lifts up a hoof, and the Doctor grabs for it, giving it a strong shake. "W-well," the mare says, still trapped in the Doctor's grip. "My name's Rosemary, of the Spice Clan."

"Ahhhh, Rosemary Von Spice, eh? Interesting, interesting... You wouldn't happen to know the thyme, would you?"

Rosemary's eyebrow rises as the Doctor's smile broadens. "Aye... It's 'roundabout eight in the morn."

"Oh, do you have any sage advice for us?"

Rosemary's lip quirks. "Aye, that I do. Iffin' ya wanna be a dillweed, there's plenty o' room ta plant yerself and clary a conversation, though if you decide to clove about, ya might want some Filé around ta keep ya company."

The Doctor puts on an abashed look, for just a second, before chuckling. "Oh, so sorry to curry on like that, but I simply needed to check if you were a sassafrass lass before asking if you'd help us."

Rosemary grins and turns around. "Well sure, I'm headin' to the inn so's I can get outta the rain." She looks back at us, her smile bright despite the paltry weather. "Well, you guys cumin or not?"

The Doctor is practically prancing in place. "Oh, this is brilliant! She's not all depressing or murder means hello! And she's a ginger!"

Sweetie Belle steps out of the TARDIS, her face scrunched up in confusion. "But... I thought her name was Rosemary?" The Doctor and I just laugh.



Rosemary

I watch the Doctor and his four companions as they walk through the inn's door. The black-coated mare turns to the others and uses a spell to lift all the water off of them and throw it back outside. The Doctor looked about the inn with an eager smile on his face, taking in his surroundings. Spotting, he started wending his way through the crowd of boisterous drunks slumped around the hearth. Fought some Blackwings, joined a guild, yadda yadda, all in a day's work for an adventurer. And now I'm simply waitin’ until I can see the mare of my dreams again."

The Doctor nods along with my spiel, listening intently and mulling it over once I'm done. "Then you're perfect. A mare who's been running around all over Equestria must have come across some interesting sights."

"Shae Sparkle. One o' the best mages ta ever nose her way through a book, I'd reckon."

The unicorn’s mouth gapes open, but whatever she was about to say is cut off as the Doctor throws an arm over her withers. “Have you tried the wine they have here? It has the strangest hint of honeydew melon I have ever tasted!” The Doctor looks up and sees me standing there. “Oho, Rosey! Thank you for saying you’d help; you have no idea how glad that makes me!”

His smile, though wide and cheery as any I’d ever seen, didn’t reach his eyes. And what eyes he had. Eyes that spoke of many years of pain, suffering, and fear… but also a spark of love, hope. A righteous fury that burned every fiber of his being, yelling at him to run and keep running until he’d found everything that mattered… and yet the patience to sit here, pretending to enjoy the rest he was forcing upon himself so he could have the strength later. The stallion may well be the maddest haberdasher in the world, but his fear was genuine: he rightly needed to find his wife, else he might just keel over then and there.

I can’t help the warm smile that appears on my face. I know that I’d be just as worried if Shae were to be foalnapped… But that isn’t likely, or important right now. “Well, can ya tell me who took ‘er, Doctor?”

He nods, his smile slowly becoming a grim line. “Yes, I think I can. We were camping out in the woods out near Riverhoof, just enjoying some time to ourselves. Y’see, it was something of a second honeymoon…” I cringe, my heart feeling like an icy talon had taken hold.

“… An’ somepony up an’ took ‘er while you was lookin’ away, or somethin’?”

The Doctor nodded, a slight blush covering his cheeks. “Yeah… We’d been dancing, and I kinda, er, crashed into the tent we’d set up. While I was tangled up, I heard her cry out, then a muffled thump, and then I woke up, still ensnared, with a throbbing headache. I ran around for almost a full day, looking for any traces before returning to my box, going home, picking up some friends, and then setting down in a large town to see about getting some help from a local. And that’s when we met you.”

“An’ when did ya say she was taken?”

“About two days ago,” the Doctor replied.

“An’ ya spent one day lookin’ about, and then returned home, picked these four up, and then managed to come all the way to the Everfree, in less than a day.”

“Ayup,” the Doctor said with a drawl.

“An’ you’re expectin’ me ta believe that y’all went home to, what, Hoofershire, and then got all th’ way here… in less than a day.”

“Yup yup, that’d be right.”

“A trip that would take even members of the Carrier Clan a good two weeks with the mountain passes bein’ clear.”

“Yes, that’s correct,” the Doctor says, his voice steady.

I shrug. “Ai’ght, I’ll believe ya. The power o’ love an’ friendship has done way stranger things in th’ past couple o’ months.”

The tension in his body disappears, an honest, grateful smile appearing on his lips. “Oh, thank Epona! I don’t know how I could repay you—or rather, I do, I just can’t do it right now. Oh,” the Doctor looks at me seriously once more. “I did hear one of her captors say something before I lost consciousness. He’d said something about taking her black wings, which I couldn’t quite understand, as Derpy has grey wings.”

The icy talon gripping my heart squeezes a bit. “Blackwings are a group of mostly pegasi who have been rebelling against the crown. There are many who resent them, but I can only think of one group who would just foalnap a pegasus without first finding out if she’s one of them or not.”

The Doctor’s ears flatten at the seriousness of my tone, his voice quavering with the worry laid bare in his eyes. “Who..? Who, Rose? Who took my wife?”

I take a short breath, a chill going up my spine. “The Groundbinders. They’re a group of earth ponies and pegasi who’ve cut off their wings. They think the Blackwing ‘corruption’ is somethin’ that all pegasi are susceptible to ‘less they remove their wings.”

The Doctor and the black-coated unicorn freeze, their breaths catching in their throats. “H… how…” The Doctor forces himself to breathe, the fear and anguish in his eyes almost palpable. “How long..?”

I shake my head. “I don’t know. Some rumors say they brainwash their victims, an’ let them cut their own wings off ta show their loyalty. Others say they force pegasi ta fight in cages with the promise of bein’ let free, only ta kill ‘em all anyways. All I know is that most everyone agrees that they’re trouble. We can’t stay the night here, not if we’re dealing with this group.”

“Well, then!” The Doctor says as he cricks his neck and stretches out his legs. He begins pawing at the ground, eyes going hard with determination. “Let’s run, shall we?”

The Doctor coughed. "Well, as Apple Bloom said, I'm the Doctor. My wife, Derpy, and I travel through time and space using the Tardis." He indicated the blue police box. "We came to this world for a bit of a pit-stop, and, well, long story short, we ran into trouble."

"When I left, she was yelling at the zookeeper, telling him to 'let her go, or be sued for inhumane treatment of a sapient species'." He shook his head. "Didn't quite think she was serious, but considering the other ponies here..." He looked at all of them warily, especially Nyx.

         Scootaloo frowned. "On Equestria, putting a sapient creature on display in a zoo or something similar is considered a criminal act worth a few years in prison."

         Sweetie Belle looked at her in surprise. "So you were paying attention that day in class!"

         The pegasus shrugged. "Hey, if something ever tries to put me in a cage, you can bet your horn they'll be in for a fight."

         Apollo arched an eyebrow at the casual byplay. His attention focused on Apple Bloom. "So, uh... do you all have names?"

         "Nyx Sparkle."

         "Hello, Herr Forehead! It's been a while, eh?" the purple-clad blonde proclaimed, smiling at him.

         "P-Prosecutor Gavin!" Apollo stuttered. "What a surprise!"

         Nyx turned to look at Trucy, who was hiding with the ponies. "A prosecutor? What's he doing here?"

         "Oh, he's the nice Mr. Prosecutor. He's Polly's rival," the girl explained in a matter-of-fact tone.

         "Uh, well, it's more Trucy than me..." Apollo confessed. "So, have you seen the pony, then? I was actually going to the zoo myself, to try and ask the keeper to release her."

         Gavin's smile faded. "Ah, about that. I've got good news, and bad news, Herr Forehead."

         Apollo looked nervous. "Um, what's the good news?"

         "The good news is that Fraulein Pony is no longer in the custody of the zoo," Gavin explained. The ponies, hearing this, all breathed a sigh of relief... all save Nyx, who was waiting for the other shoe to drop.

         "And... the bad news?" Apollo asked, dreading the answer.

         Gavin's face turned serious. "She's being held at the Detention Center, charged with murdering the zookeeper."

         An explosive "WHAT?!" rang out from the ponies' corner, before Nyx leapt towards the door. She was beside Apollo in an instant. "Why was she arrested?!"

         Apollo tried - and failed - to wrestle Nyx back out of sight, grinning sheepishly at Gavin the whole time. "Um, I can explain - "

         "No need, Herr Forehead," the prosecutor replied. "To be honest, I'd be more surprised if there weren't more of these ponies lurking around. Though it means I'll have to think of a new nickname for the defendant..."

         "Her name is Ditzy Doo," Nyx fairly growled. "And you didn't answer my question. Why has she been arrested?"

         Gavin held out his hands in a placating gesture. "Easy, easy, fraulein. If you wish to know the details, perhaps you should ask Fraulein Detective at the scene of the crime."

         Apollo blinked. "So, Detective Skye's involved?"

         "Indeed," Gavin replied. He started to walk off. "See you in court tomorrow, Herr Forehead!"

         "Wait, WHAT?!" Apollo sputtered. "I haven't agreed to - "

         As Gavin walked away, Apollo pried the offending hoof away from his mouth. "Now wait just a minute! I never agreed to get involved in this!"

         "Why not?" came Phoenix's voice, as he ambled into view, a bottle of grape juice in hand. "I can't do it, since I've been disbarred. And I doubt any of our pony friends are registered defense attorneys. That leaves you, Polly."

         The young man sputtered indignantly. "B-but, it's insane! Defending a pony from charges of murder?! Even you can't claim this is something that happens on a routine basis!"

         Phoenix shrugged. "Well, I've done it once before, it's time for you to give it a shot." Noticing the recalcitrant look on the attorney's face, the older man sighed. "Why are you against this? Do you believe Miss Doo actually committed the crime?"

         Apollo paused. "Well, no... I mean, I haven't gotten any of the details yet, after all, so I can't make any judgements."

         Phoenix waved him off. "Then go out and get your details, and if you think she's guilty, you can pass the buck to someone else." He stroked his stubble thoughtfully. "I think Grossberg could use a client or two..."

As Apollo made his way down the familiar path to the detention center, he held a mental conversation with his unseen traveling partner. He'd learned quickly that he could 'project' certain thoughts for Nyx to pick up, but she couldn't read his mind. So, what's this pony like? I'm guessing you know her?

         There was a sensation of a nod. Yes, I know Ditzy well. Ditzy Doo is the Doctor's traveling partner, as well as the mailmare for our town. She's a very kind pony, so I really can't see her murdering anypo - er, anyone.

         Apollo sighed out loud. Well, I've worked a case or two where it looked like someone really unlikely actually committed the crime. Like, this one girl killed a doctor that botched an operation on her fiance, just to frame him in an effort to try and inherit his family's money.

         Although he couldn't see it, he had the distinct impression that Nyx was arching an eyebrow. Are all humans so petty? To kill over something as mundane as money?

         Are you telling me that ponies are so perfect? Apollo retorted.

         A few moments of silence passed, and Apollo allowed himself a smirk. Point taken, Mr. Justice, sighed the alicorn. Ponies can be rather petty, themselves. There was a unicorn magician who became a bit of a thorn in the side of my mother and her friends. She held the entire town hostage, just to prove she was superior to my mother.

         Apollo arched an eyebrow at that. The entire town? Are all unicorns so powerful?

         A sensation of a head shake gave him an answer. No, she had amplified her magic using an artifact known as the Alicorn Amulet. The catch is that that amulet also caused her to go mad with the power. My mom ended up tricking her into removing it. And, she actually became a better pony once all was said and done.

         Further conversation was postponed as they arrived at the detention center. Apollo identified himself, and asked to speak with the accused. The guards let him pass, and he was led to the visitor's section. A few minutes later, a grey pegasus with a blonde mane and tail was led in from the other side. Apollo couldn't help but stare at her eyes. I wonder if she can see through time with those... he thought, pondering the eyes that seemed content to swivel in any direction aside from directly in front of her.

         "Hi! You're the lawyer that wanted to talk to me, right?" the grey pony asked with a smile.

         "Um, yes," Apollo said with a nod. "My name's Apollo Justice. And you are Miss Ditzy Doo, correct?"

         "That's right!" She lifted off into a hover. "How'd you know? I didn't think the police had told anyone yet."

         "I... have my sources..." Apollo stammered, trying to think of an excuse.

         I've got an idea. Put your hand in your pocket, Nyx told him. Apollo did so, and felt something take shape in his palm. When he pulled it out, he realized it was a miniature replica of Nyx, with proportions intact. It was also moving like the real thing.

         Ditzy's eyes widened. "Nyx?" she gasped in disbelief.

         The mini-Nyx nodded. "Uh-huh," she said, in her normal voice. Apollo had, for some reason, expected her to have a higher-pitched voice in this mini form.

         "D-does that mean...?" Ditzy stammered.

         "The Doctor brought me and the senior CMC here to help you, Miss Doo. Don't worry, we'll get you out of here," Nyx assured the grey pegasus.

         Ditzy smiled. "Oh, thank goodness. I was worried I'd get some lawyer who didn't have any help at all." She dropped to the ground again, causing a few feathers to fall off her wings.

         This didn't escape Apollo's notice. "Um, is that normal?" he asked, pointing at the loose feathers.

         "Huh?" The grey mare swiveled an eye to look. "Oh, yeah, I'm in the middle of a moulting cycle. Nothing to worry about. The police aren't happy that they have to clean my cell every so often, though."

         Nyx nodded. "Well, anyway, what can you tell us about what happened, Miss Doo?"

         Ditzy's smile faded. "Well, not much. All I know is I went to sleep last night, and when I woke up, there was blood on my hooves, and the police had surrounded me. I was so scared... especially since there was a trail of bloody hoofprints leading up to where I was sleeping!" She looked about ready to cry.

         Apollo looked worried. "Um... do you have a habit of sleepwalking, Miss Doo?"

         Ditzy shook her head. "I've never had a problem like that before! The Doctor would have told me!"

         Nyx frowned. "So, if we rule out a sleepwalking murder... what does this mean?"

         Apollo's eyes narrowed. "Well, maybe someone moved her while she was asleep? Dipped her hooves in blood, and kinda walked her back, all without her waking up?"

         Ditzy shuddered. "I don't think so, Mr. Justice. I'm a really light sleeper. Comes with being a mother and a mailmare."

         Apollo blinked. "You have a kid? Er, a foal?"

         The grey mare smiled wistfully. "Yeah, my daughter, Dinky. My little muffin. She means the world to me."

         Nyx smiled. "Don't worry, Miss Doo. We'll have you reunited with her soon enough."

         Apollo cleared his throat. "So, you don't know any details about the murder itself."

         The pegasus shook her head. "Sorry, Mr. Justice."

         The attorney sighed. "Well... if you're certain, then I guess I'll take the case. If you want me, that is."

         Ditzy nodded. "You're with Nyx, so that makes you a good guy in my book."

         Nyx smiled. "Leave everything to us, Ditzy. You'll be a free mare once this case is solved, I guarantee it."

153232222122222222112121211.content:
Soon after leaving their interview with Ditzy, Apollo and Nyx arrived at the zoo. Apollo looked down at the map he had gotten from a man in a Blue Badger costume at the front gate, and he could practically feel Nyx studying it as well.

I can't believe I'm starting to get used to having a pony from another world living in my clothes, he thought-muttered to Nyx. And I thought some of my other cases were weird.

I can't believe you humans keep so many creatures locked up like this, Nyx retorted.

Don't you have zoos in your world? It sounded like you did, Apollo replied.

Sure, there's a great one in Manehattan with all sorts of exotic, non-sapient creatures. Not anything I would call a neighbor. Look, you have zebras here. And buffalo! And... She hesitated, and Apollo felt a sense of dread building as he sensed her 'eyes' lingering on the section labeled "Domesticated Animals (w/ Petting Zoo)". You lock up sheep here? Cows? P...PONIES?!

Apollo swallowed, nervous enough to forget to 'send' his thoughts to Nyx as he looked down at his vest and explained out loud, "Look, Nyx, I don't know how much you know about this world, but things are different here than back where you came from. If you settle down for a moment..."

I thought they locked Ditzy up because they didn't know what she was! You've been enslaving ponies this whole time?! In the moment, Nyx was furious. Seeing that ponies were incarcerated in the zoo was just the final straw, but she had been angered by the other 'domesticated animals' as well.

Sure, Sweet Apple Acres and the other farms surrounding Ponyville had a number of the same creatures living there, but more as tenants than as animals to be displayed. Instead of paying for lodging with bits, sheep gave their wool, cows gave their milk, and pigs gave their... fertilizer. They weren't as fully sapient as ponies, and thus weren't considered full citizens of Equestria, but were still given more consideration than mere show-pieces.

1532322221222222221121212112.content:
Nyx stopped herself before she did something she'd regret. But only barely. Mr. Justice, she thought-growled to the attorney. I'm giving you one chance to explain this. Only. One. Chance. If I'm not satisfied... She left the threat hanging.

         Apollo sighed, as he gathered his thoughts. What you have to understand, Nyx, is that Earth and your world are obviously very different. Here, ponies, sheep, cows, and the like, none of them are sapient. They lack the ability to reason. Also - and please, don't fly off the handle here - most of them are rather unintelligent, when compared to humans. Your kind of pony is very different from our kind of pony.

         Nyx pondered that for a bit, as Apollo walked towards the crime scene, the zookeeper's office. The more she thought about it, the more it made sense. The Doctor had explained to her and the other senior CMC that humans were the dominant life form, and had yet to encounter other sapient life. She's seen the word 'pony' and made an assumption which, in hindsight, was rather obviously false.

         I'm sorry, Mr. Justice, she thought to him. I was out of line. The humans here haven't encountered other species with sapience before, have they?

         Apollo smiled in relief. No, we haven't. He then sighed. Though the trial tomorrow will likely be blown out of proportion. Hell of a way to meet a new race.

         Before Nyx could comment, they picked up the sounds of crunching and munching. Apollo smiled as he walked towards the sound. Poking his head around the open door, he called out, "Hello, Detective Skye!"

         He ducked out of the way as... something sailed past him. Looking at it, Nyx saw a short, brown stick of sorts land on the ground. What in...?

         "Oh, it's you, Mr. Lawyer," came the voice from within the room. Apollo looked in again, allowing Nyx to see as well. The speaker was a young woman, with long brown hair, partially tied in a topknot. She wore a white lab coat over a green buttoned shirt and brown pants. A red bag hung from one shoulder, while a smaller bag filled with more of the brown sticks was held in one hand. "Deciding to expand your clientele? Going for freaky ponies with wings, now?" She looked rather perturbed.

         "You seem somewhat... out of sorts, Detective," Apollo noted.

         Skye grumbled, and pulled one of the sticks out before tossing it into her mouth. Nyx realized that the 'sticks' were actually a kind of snack food. "Out of sorts? A good way to say it, I guess. I got a look at that pony when she was arrested. Those wings have to have been glued on, or something. I mean, scientifically speaking, there's no way those wings could actually work."

         "They do. I saw her hovering using them at the Detention Center," Apollo countered.

         Skye raised an eyebrow. "So, you really are taking her case, huh? Well, you're fighting a losing battle, this time. We've got a lot of evidence to condemn her, not the least of which is the fact that she left a trail of bloody footprints back to her enclosure."

         "Mind if I look around? Just in case you all missed something?" Apollo asked.

         "Knock yourself out," Skye replied, munching on another stick. "Good luck finding anything wrong, though."

         Apollo glanced around, taking in the scene. A white tape outline was on the floor, with a large pool of blood around and inside it. "Yeesh, he must've bled like crazy," he muttered.

         "No kidding," remarked Skye. "From what I heard, his skull was caved in from a single blow."

         "A single blow?" Apollo looked at her, surprised. "Seriously?"

         "Yep. I'm sure you'll get the autopsy report at the trial."

         Apollo shook his head, and looked around again. As he did so, something seemed... off.

         Mr. Justice? Nyx thought to him. Remember what Miss Doo told us at the Detention Center? She's in the middle of her moulting cycle. If she'd really done this - in a single blow - shouldn't there be a lot of feathers around?

         Apollo frowned. Now that his 'passenger' mentioned it... "Detective, was anything taken from the scene by the detectives? Aside from the body?"

         "Huh? No, not that I know of," Skye replied, confused. "Why do you ask?"

         "Hmm..." Apollo pondered what to do next.

15323222212222222211212121122.content:
Skye coughed. "Mr. Lawyer, I'm curious: why accept this... pony, as your client? I just don't see what you'd get out of it."

         Apollo gave an embarrassed chuckle. "Um, I was kinda drafted into being her lawyer."

         Skye arched an eyebrow. "Drafted? By who? Don't tell me he has a soft spot for ponies..."

         He? echoed Nyx.

         She probably means Mr. Wright, Apollo replied mentally. She was really upset that he quit the practice.

         ... Being disbarred isn't the same as quitting. She knows that, right? Nyx asked sardonically.

         Apollo coughed slightly. "Well, it was more like Trucy wanted me to sue the zookeeper for keeping a sapient species here... and then this mess happened..."

         The detective scoffed. "Sapient, I'll grant you. But a species? No way. Whatever gave that pony wings is obviously a one-of-a-kind fluke in the gene pool. There's no way something like that can exist and persist along enough bloodlines to be a 'species'."

         "... Weren't you into forensic science, not biology?" Apollo asked dryly.

         "The two can coincide quite often, you know," retorted Skye, crunching into another one of her snacks. "And I stand by my statement." She smirked in a joking way. "Unless you can prove that there's more than one of them out there..."

         The lawyer could practically feel Nyx's evil grin. This opportunity is too perfect... Want to mess with her a bit?

         After hearing Nyx's plan, Apollo allowed himself a small grin. "Actually, I think I can prove it, Detective." When she looked at him in confusion, Apollo snapped his fingers.

*****


         Detective Ema Skye had seen quite a bit in her career, and even before she had become a detective. She had seen evidence that she had killed a prosecutor named Neil Marshall, only to find out later that the police chief at the time had set her up. She had seen a young girl use a device to almost perfectly recreate the scene of a murder... although she later heard that said murder had been staged.

         But all she had seen up to this point seemed insignificant as, with a snap of his fingers, that young lawyer that worked for Phoenix Wright summoned a cloud of mist.

         It was scientifically impossible. Ema knew that. And yet, she was seeing it. She pinched herself. She felt pain. No, she wasn't dreaming.

         The mist grew, and gathered together into a shape. The shape was of a... horse? No, horses didn't have a singular horn growing out of their forehead. Horses didn't have wings, either. Is this related to that pony from before? Ema thought wildly. Almost immediately, she dismissed the notion. This horse was far taller than the pony that had been arrested, and colored a midnight black. For a moment, she wondered if this was some sort of trick of the light the lawyer was pulling.

         Then the horse opened its eyes.

         Ema's bag of Snackoos fell from nerveless fingers, and she wasn't far behind as her legs gave out. She couldn't help it. Those piercing, cyan, catlike eyes seemed to look through her, and glowed with an unholy energy. The nightmarish creature stepped forward, and Ema hit the wall trying to scramble away. It leaned down, and opened its mouth.

         "Boo."

         The zoo would later have to replace multiple windows in the office that shattered from the scream... although Ema would deny it to her last breath.

*****


         "For shame, Mr. Lawyer!" groused Detective Skye. "I never took you for a prankster!"

         Apollo couldn't meet her eyes. This was because he was certain he had busted something from laughter when Ema had screamed. Who would have thought a prank like that could be so funny? he mused.

         The detective shook her head. "At any rate, you have proved that there's more than one of these... er... horses, running around."

         Nyx, who was lying on the ground recovering from her own laughing fit, looked up. "We generally prefer the term 'ponies', Detective."

         Skye cocked her head. "But, your proportions are more akin to a regular horse, than a pony."

         "Perhaps here on Earth, Detective Skye," Apollo mused. "On the world they come from, they're all ponies."

         Nyx elected not to correct the young attorney. There were, after all, actual horses in the land of Saddle Arabia. But that was neither here nor there. She took a deep breath, then stood up, shook out her mane and tail, and offered a hoof. "Nyx Sparkle. Pleased to meet you."

         Skye, while still somewhat in shock, nonetheless remembered her manners. "Ema Skye, Homicide. Likewise." She shook the offered hoof. "So, there's a whole world of you creatures?"

         Nyx narrowed her eyes. "Yes. And you can call us 'people', you know. We are just as sapient as humans."

         "Sorry, sorry," the detective apologized. "I'm dealing with my whole worldview crashing down around me."

         Nyx sighed. "So, Apollo had a point earlier. You seem out-of-sorts."

         Skye groaned. "Don't remind me. This case is so messed up, my toys are next to worthless!"

         "'Toys'?" repeated the alicorn, glancing at Apollo to see if he could clarify.

         He did so. "Although she's a detective, Skye really enjoys forensic science. I'm guessing, though, given who the accused is, most of her forensic techniques don't work."

         "Exactly." Skye retrieved her bag of snacks, and stuffed a few in her mouth. "Honestly, it's enough to drive a woman to drink."

         Nyx tapped a hoof to her chin... then brightened. "What if I showed you some Equestrian forensic techniques?"

         The detective paused, another snack stick halfway to her mouth. "Equestrian... forensics?"

         Nyx nodded. "For example..." She lit up her horn, and an image appeared in midair. "I can analyze these bloody hoofprints that were left behind, and compare them to the hoofprints of Miss Doo, the defendant."

         "Wow," Apollo mused, looking at the 'screen'. "This looks almost like a fingerprint comparison list. Wouldn't you say, Detective Skye?"

         "It does look similar..." Skye agreed, looking at the 'screen' herself. "But, where's the data coming from?"

         Nyx tapped her head. "I went through a forensics kick of my own a while back, and used a spell to compile everypony's footprint data into an area of my subconscious. When I wanted to compare hoofprints I found to ones there, I used another spell to call the data up in this form."

         Skye was grinning like a schoolgirl. "Well, let's test this out! Do you have the defendant's prints on file?"

         Nyx nodded. "Let's see here..."

15412.content:
Nyx blinked as she regarded the strange pegasus lying on the floor. His coat was a pale color, only a few shades off from Rarity's pure white. He wore a royal blue business vest and a red tie on his front. His mane was a spiky, slicked-back mess that reminded Nyx of a hedgehog in front of a blow dryer. But it was his Cutie Mark that drew her eye the most: an outline of a shout bubble from comics, with a bright red word inside: 'OBJECTION!'.

         Where have I heard that before...? wondered the alicorn. Deciding she'd need answers directly from the pony himself, she leaned down and gently nudged him. He groaned as he began to wake up.

*****


         "Ow..." Phoenix Wright moaned as he slowly regained consciousness. "That's the last time I let Gumshoe talk me into drinking after a case." He was content for the moment to lie where he was, trying to let the hangover work itself out.

         "Excuse me, are you okay?" asked a nearby voice. It was fairly young, and female.

         "I feel like a herd of elephants used my head as a tap-dance stage," Phoenix replied, not happy about his persisting headache.

         "Oh, you have a headache? Here, let me take care of that," the voice said. Before Phoenix could question her, he felt something hard and somewhat pointed touch his head. Moments later, a cool feeling of relief flowed through his head, banishing the throbbing headache.

         "Ma'am, I don't know what you did, but you are a veritable angel," the attorney said in bliss, finally deciding to open his eyes to look upon the heavenly savior that had defeated the foul menace known as a hangover.

         "You're quite welcome," the pitch-black pony with cat-like eyes replied.

         Phoenix blinked. Then blinked again. Then he sighed. "Oh, boy, back here again... So, who is it this time?"

         The pony blinked. "Uh, pardon?"

         Phoenix rolled his eyes. "Look, the only reason I'd be back in Equestria is if somepony wanted me to represent them in a case. So who is it?"

         "Back in...?" The pony seemed confused for a moment, then her eyes widened. "Wait a minute... I know you! You're Phoenix Wright!!"

         The attorney smiled. "The one and only! Best attorney in the universe!"

         "But... wait. I thought Phoenix Wright was a human," continued the pony, now looking confused.

         "Uh, yeah, I - " Phoenix attempted to stand up to face the pony, but fell over as his sense of balance seemed off. Puzzled, Phoenix looked himself over... and screamed. "WHAT HAPPENED TO ME?!"

         The black pony's ears flattened against her head as she was assaulted by the sound. "I'm guessing some sort of magic turned you into a pony, Mr. Wright. Maybe my mom could help you out though?"

         "Oh yeah?!" the former human snapped, rattled beyond belief. "And who's your mom that knows so much about magic?!"

         Her catlike eyes narrowed. "I believe you know her. Her name's Twilight Sparkle."

         That name cut through Phoenix's growing panic like a knife. "Twilight...?" he repeated. Almost immediately, a feeling of relief went through him. "Oh, if it's Twilight, then sure, let's go see her. Goodness knows, I'd like to see how she's been since the last time I was here."

         She smiled, her horn glowing as she lifted him up and set him on his hooves. "I'm sure she'd love to catch up with you, too, Mr. Wright."

         Phoenix smiled back. Then he blinked as something occured to him. "Waitaminute. Twilight was single, and childless the last time I saw her. How did you - ?"

         "Adopted," interrupted the pony.

         Phoenix blinked again at the one-word explanation. "Ah. That explains it." He then looked her over, cocking his head. "You're awfully tall, Ms... er..."

         She giggled. "My name is Nyx. Nyx Sparkle."

         Phoenix blinked, then chuckled. "Sorry," he said, when she looked at him quizzically. "It's just, the last time I was here, a pony nicknamed me 'Nix', short for 'Phoenix'. Said something about it being 'cooler'."

         Nyx chuckled as well. "Ah, that'd be Rainbow Dash. She's been doing quite well since you saved her from being banished to the moon or sun."

         "I should hope so!" the attorney said, raising a forehoof for emphasis. However, he was unused to being a pony, and fell over again. "Um, Ms. Nyx, could you perhaps help me to the Ponyville Library?"

         Nyx giggled again. "Certainly."

*****


         Nyx was nearly beside herself with giddiness as she led Phoenix Wright to Ponyville. I can't believe it! Mom told me about him a lot, and now I'm meeting him myself! Thoough the fact that he's a pony and not a human is a bit odd, but I'm not going to dwell on that! He's a hero of mine, and I'm TALKING TO HIM!

         In truth, there hadn't been much talking for the past few minutes. After Phoenix had gotten the hang of walking like a pony, there had been a companionable silence between the two. Nyx didn't mind; she was so gleeful at meeting one of her mom's old friends (and one of her own personal heroes) that she couldn't think of anything to say.

         The silence was broken by Phoenix. "Ahem. As I was saying before, Ms. Nyx, you're quite tall. Taller than most ponies I met last time. And... you have both wings and a horn. From what I read before, such traits are usually only exhibited by royalty."

         His words doused the flames of giddiness within Nyx, and her mood dropped sharply. "Well... there's a reason for that, Mr. Wright. It's complicated, though..."

         "Hey, hey, it's alright. You don't have to tell me if you don't want to," the neo-pony said, looking apologetic.

         Nyx smiled gratefully at him. "I'll tell you at some point during your stay here. You'll probably learn anyway, one way or another." She looked up. "Oh! We're here!"

         She opened the door to the Books and Branches Library, and spotted Twilight on the main floor. The unicorn briefly glanced up at Nyx, before returning to the book in front of her. "What's up, Nyx? I thought you'd be busy at the castle all day."

         "Well, I was going to be, but I found something I had to show you," the alicorn replied.

         Twilight rolled her eyes a bit. "Nyx, I told you, be careful with the stuff in there. I don't want you bringing home any cursed relics, dark magics, or murals of eternal night."

         "And what about old friends?" Phoenix asked, smothering a chuckle.

         Twilight's head snapped up, focusing on the pegasus standing next to her daughter. "Phoenix...?" she gaped in disbelief.

         "Long time, no see, Twilight," Phoenix said with a smile.

         Twilight fairly sprang across the room, and hugged the attorney, a hug which was eagerly returned. "Phoenix! Omigosh, it's really you! But what are you doing back in Equestria? And why are you a pony?!"

         Nyx smiled at the sight, but coughed a little. "Well, that's why we're here. Phoenix doesn't know the answer to either of those questions, and neither do I. We were hoping you could find out."

         Twilight smiled brightly. "Of course!" She began floating a few books off the shelves. "Though, I hope you don't mind if we play catch-up while we work on this, Phoenix?"

         "Not at all! I'd love to hear what's happened since I left!" Phoenix replied, equally brightly.
15412.title: Turnabout Spell: Chapter 1

choices: "... is one of our friends!" (Rarity, Applejack, Pinkie Pie, Fluttershy)
Somepony else
154122.content:
"So, what all's been going on since I left?" Phoenix asked, idly flipping through a book on transformative magic.

         "Oh, plenty of things," Twilight replied as she and Nyx peered through their own books on the same subject. "Discord's release and re-sealing, the Crystal Empire's return, my brother's wedding..."

         "Brother?" Phoenix blinked. "You never mentioned you had a brother to me!"

         "You never asked," the unicorn said teasingly.

         "And then there's me," Nyx added, a tone of self-deprecation making its way into her voice.

         Twilight nodded, her smile turning a bit wan. "Yeah, Nyx's story is... interesting, to say the least."

         Phoenix paused a moment. "There's an old curse from part of the world I come from: 'May you live in interesting times'."

         "Things have been interesting, I'll grant that," Twilight admitted, "but I think in the end, everything's worked out."

         "That's good to hear," Phoenix said with a smile. "So, how did - "

         He was cut off as something crashed through the library's window, slamming into the bookcases with enough force to knock every single book off the shelves. The ponies currently in the library all jumped out of the way of the cascade of falling books. When the dust settled, there was silence for a few seconds. Then the lavender unicorn's eye twitched.

         "Rainbow Dash!" she barked, her horn lighting up as she fished the prismatic pegasus out of the pile of books she was buried under. "How many times have I told you to use the door, not the window?!"

         Rainbow Dash shook her head to clear the stars from it. "Sorry, Twi, but this was important! I couldn't slow down to use the door, I had to tell you ASAP!"

         "And what is so important that you not only had to break my window, but make a complete mess of the library as well?" Twilight growled, as she began picking up books with her magic and reshelving them.

         "Somepony's been murdered!"

         This had several effects. The first was that Twilight dropped the books she was holding with her magic, whirling around to gape in disbelief at the pegasus. The second was that Nyx's eyes went wide with shock; she hadn't been around during the murder of Ace Swift, the first murder that had happened in centuries since Celestia's reign began. The final thing that happened was Phoenix staring in shock for a few seconds, before promptly bashing his face into the table. It was this final act that drew Rainbow's attention, as Phoenix hadn't been gentle on himself.

         "I'm beginning to suspect the cosmos hates me," the attorney-turned-pony muttered into the wooden table.

         "Huh? Who're you?" Rainbow asked, confused at this stranger's reaction to being told there'd been a murder.

         Phoenix pulled his head off the table to give Rainbow a wry smile. "I know I look a little different, but I'd think you'd remember the guy who saved you from a severe case of sunburn."

         Rainbow's eyes widened. "No way... Nix! It's you!"

         Nyx coughed. "You know his name is Phoenix, right? And that calling him 'Nix' is going to lead to some confusion between him and me?"

         Rainbow ignored her, zipping around Phoenix like a hummingbird. "This is awesome! You're a pony now! And a pegasus to boot! Oh, have you been flying, yet? You need to, it's amazing!"

         Phoenix endured the athelete's observing him for another minute, before he coughed. "You said something about there being a murder, Rainbow?"

         Rainbow's attention snapped back to the matter at hoof. "Oh, right!" She turned to Twilight, then paused. "Actually, Nix, maybe you could take the case? I mean, you did such a good job for me, so I thought maybe you could help out again? Because, believe me, the pony they arrested wouldn't do something like this!"

         "Well, who is the pony they've arrested?" Phoenix asked, while reaching into his vest pocket. He pulled out a pink, heart-shaped badge.

         Twilight blinked on seeing this. "Hey, you kept your Equestrian Attorney badge! I'd have thought you'd have gotten rid of it, since it's so tacky."

         Phoenix sheepishly grinned. "Well, I always thought there might be a possibility of my returning to Equestria to defend somepony else, so I figured I'd hold on to it. Besides, it's not so bad once you get used to it."

         "Guys, focus?" Rainbow interrupted, running a hoof down the front of her face. "The pony that's been arrested..."

154122111.content:
"Wait...they think sweet, innocent, random, slightly annoying, nonsensical, party happy Pinkie Pie...killed some pony?" Phoenix asked in disbelief.

"Yeah, I tried to tell the Canterlot guards it was a ridiculous idea, but they wouldn't-" Rainbow began, only to be cut off by Phoenix.

"Wait, the Canterlot guards?"

Rainbow nodded, before starting over. "Okay, so Rarity got one of her snootie Canterlot friends to give her some wonderbolt tickets, box seats, just so she could bribe me to model for her at this big fashion thing in a few days, and gave me a spare so I could bring one of our other friends along. Pinkie Pie was immediately interested as soon as she found out about it, so I picked her, since AJ was too busy, you were planning on reorganizing the library the day of the show, Nyx was going to be helping you and stuff, and Fluttershy doesn't handle crowds well. So we got on the train to head up to Canterlot right after Scoots and the other girls left, and the second we get there, Pinkie spots some friend of hers in the crowd and rushes off to say hi to them. I go with Rarity to the hotel to get our rooms, and the next time we saw Pinkie, it was hours later, and she wasbeing carted off by the royal guard for murder!"

"Who do they think she killed?" Phoenix inquired.

Rainbow Dash opened her mouth and replied...
154122111.title: Turnabout Party: A Pink pony under suspicion

choices: Of course he will! An innocent pony's life is at stake!
No...wait, "no"?! Why not Phoenix?!
1541221112.content:
"Some guy named Duke Greengrass." Rainbow announced.

Twilight took a step back in shock, her eyes widening in horror. "They think she killed Duke Greengrass of Manehatten?!"

Nyx looked at her mother, a worried expression on her face. "Is that anywhere near as bad as it sounds?"

"It's worse!" Twilight declared. "Duke Greengrass is one of the most wealthy and influential members of the nobility! His political tactics are known to be ruthless, and sometimes as legally questionable as his businesses!"

"So naturally, most of the nobility adored him." A male voice added.

"The only members of the nobility that can possibly be considered as being as bad as him are his wife and..." Twilight trailed off, her head slowly turning towards the door to her library. Nyx and Phoenix both followed her gaze, and spotted what she was looking at; a white unicorn stallion, with a blonde mane, and a compass cutie-mark.

"...Prince Blueblood." Twilight finished.

"I heard from a reliable source that I could find 'the greatest defense attorney in the universe' here. I have need of him to represent an associate of mine."

"Yeah, well you can wait in line buddy, because Phoenix already has a case right now defending my pal Pinkie Pie." Dash said, glaring daggers at the prince, who did not seem to be impressed.

"You misunderstand; Pinkamina Dianne Pie, also known as Marchioness Pinkamina Rose Quartz, is exactly who I am paying Mr. Wright to defend."

Several jaws dropped in shock, and it was Nyx who put the question in every ponies' head out into the open. "Marchioness Pinkamina?! You mean Pinkie Pie is a member of the nobility?!"

"Of course...didn't she tell you? Her step-father may have raised her on a rock farm under a different name, but Pinkamina Rose Quartz is the daughter of the Marchioness of trottingham."

"And why exactly are you trying to help her?!" Dash inquired in an interogational tone of voice.

"I just...don't want an innocent noble pony to get punished for a crime she didn't commit."

*BANG* *RATTLERATTLERATTLE* *BANG!BANG!BANG!*

Phoenix saw the area behind the prince turned black, as chains went flying around the prince. The red padlocks locked themselves in place, stopping the chains. Of course. Nobles and politicians; two groups that always have a hidden agenda.

"What will it be, Mr. Wright? Will you take the case?"
1541221112.title: Turnabout Party: Grass is Green and Blood is Blue.

choices: Go by land. (Train or carriage)
Go by air. (Flying or hot air balloon)
15412211121.content:
"Of course I will. I could never turn my back on an innocent client, let alone one who is a friend. I'll gladly defend her in court." Phoenix announced.

"Excellent! Who do I make the payment out to?" The Prince asked.

"That won't be needed. Your money isn't any good where I'm from, and I was going to take the case anyway." Phoenix said. Besides, I don't want to be obligated to keep you in the loop about things. Whatever your agenda is, I want no part of it.

"Are you sure?" Blueblood asked.

"I absolutely do not want your money."

"Very well then, but the least I can do is provide the tickets to get you to Canterlot. The next express leaves in thirty minutes, so don't be late." The ivory stallion told them as he turned around and headed out the door. Once he was gone, Rainbow scoffed.

"Yeah, like we're going anywhere with him. Phoenix and I are going to just fly there, right Phoenix?"

Before Phoenix could reply, Twilight spoke up. "Rainbow, Phoenix just woke up as a Pegasus today. He probably doesn't even know how to fly. It would probably be safer to take a carriage by land to get to Canterlot."

Phoenix started to reply to this statement, when Spike decided to add his two-cents. "But Twilight, the carriages may take hours to get there. Why don't we just go pick up our hot air ballon from Cherry Berry's house and fly it back to Canterlot?"

Phoenix didn't even have a chance to think about responding before Nyx spoke up. "I don't understand. The train is the safest and fastest way to get to Canterlot. So we have to put up with a bit of Blueblood on the way there; what's the big deal?"

"Oh come on, we could totally get there faster by flying, right Phoenix?"

"A carriage would be much safer, and it would give you plenty of time to study before the trial, Phoenix."

"I still say we should take the hot air balloon, since its faster and would get us all there together."

"We should take the train, right Mr. Wright?"

Phoenix thought it over carefully before deciding to...
15412211121.title: Turnabout Party: Phoenix Wright is on the case!

choices: Take the train.
Take a carriage.
154122111211.content:
Nyx definitely wanted to stay on the ground. While he wanted to make sure he was good and studied up before the trial this time around, he also wanted to get to Canterlot quickly, so he could ask Pinkie about her side of the story and have time to examine the crime scene. However, he didn't exactly want to be close to Blueblood or his hidden agendas, and the train would put them in close proximity to each other until they reached Canterlot. Then again, he could also learn a bit from Blueblood, if he was careful.

In the end he decided to...
154122111211.title: Go by land.

choices: The train gets to Canterlot, and the group heads for the Detention Center
Something happens on the way.
1541221112111.content:
Phoenix inhaled. "Alright, I've decided to take the train," he said. Seeing the looks on Twilight and Rainbow's faces, he quickly explained. "Look, it's the fastest means of getting to Canterlot while also being reliable. I can't fly on my own power yet, a balloon would take a while to get ready, and a carraige is just far too slow. The sooner we get there, the sooner we can get to investigating, and the sooner we can get evidence to prove Pinkie's innocence."

         Rainbow sighed. "I guess you're right." She glared at the prince. "But any funny business, and royal or not, I'll toss you into the baggage car and lock you in there!"

         Blueblood sniffed. "I assure you, your suspicions are entirely misplaced. I am completely serious when I say I wish to help."

         Phoenix shook his head. "Let's just get the others and get going."

*****


         Half an hour later, the remaining Bearers of the Elements, plus Nyx, Spike, Phoenix, and Blueblood, were in a VIP cabin on the Friendship Express. Phoenix was keenly aware of the death glares Rarity was shooting at the prince. He coughed lightly. "So, I take it you're acquainted with Blueblood, Rarity?"

         The fashionista snorted. "Regrettably, yes. He was responsible for my utterly miserable experience at the Grand Galloping Gala a few years ago."

         Blueblood sniffed. "Forgive me for being blunt, but I wasn't keen on merely being a trophy husband for some gold-digger."

         Rarity's nostrils flared, but Phoenix interrupted her. "Ahem. Could you explain your statement, your Highness?"

         Blueblood nodded. "You see, some years past, these five ponies, along with Marchioness Pinkamena, attended the annual Grand Galloping Gala. One of them - " he indicated Rarity with a hoof, " - spent the entire night cozying up to me. I recognized her type immediately. A beautiful young mare, all dressed up and seeking my attention? Tell me, Mr. Wright, what does that sound like to you?"

         Phoenix hesitated, then decided to answer honestly. "It sounds like somepony trying to jump up the ranks of the Canterlot elite."

         Rarity gasped, scandalized. "Mr. Wright! How could you?! I was seeking the stallion I thought would be the love of my life! Instead, I found one of the vilest scum to ever walk Equestria!"

         Phoenix looked at her, unimpressed. "Tell me, Rarity, did you know anything about Blueblood before that night? Did you ever write to him, become pen-pals?"

         Rarity paused. "Well... no. I knew him only by his looks. I was... infatuated with him for the longest time."

         Blueblood sighed. "And that, my dear, is why I acted like such a beast to you. I am not interested in somepony who knows nothing about me. Less so in a pony who seeks me out only to improve their own image. You are far from the first mare to have tried 'wooing' me, and you certainly won't be the last, I fear." He looked down, and muttered something under his breath.

         Nyx perked an ear up. "What was that about 'fixing that problem'?"

         "Ah, nothing!" Blueblood said brightly.

         Phoenix didn't even blink as the locks and chains of the Psyche-locks materialized around the prince again. Oddly, there was the same number as before: three locks. Could it be that this secret and the last are related? he wondered.

15412211121112.content:
As the train started approaching the station, Blueblood glanced out the window and barely suppressed a groan.

"We have a bit of a problem." He announced to the others. "It seems the press has caught wind of our arrival. We'll need to do something about that if Mr. Wright is going to reach the detention center in one piece."

"That's not a big problem. I mean, what's the worse they could do; snap a few bad Photos of us?" Rainbow asked.

"Actually, they could take every last single word that comes out of your mouth and twist it until it sounds like damning evidence against your friend or the potential for a conspiracy theory that you're all really top secret assassins for Auntie Luna or, heaven forbid they should think it, Ms. Nyx."

Everypony stared at Blueblood, who simply raised an eyebrow in responce. "What? I'm speaking with the voice of experience here. If you think I'm exaggerating, then you should have seen what the Canterlot Times wrote about Ms. Dash last time."

"Why? What did they say about me?" Dash questioned in an accusing tone.

Deciding not to open that can full of snakes, Twilight cut off whatever response Blueblood may or may not have had. "Blueblood is right. The last thing we need is a bunch of press ponies following us around and getting in the way while we're trying to investigate and find a way to clear Pinkie's name. So here's the plan; since they probably won't recognize Phoenix in his current form, we can have Nyx transform and sneak him into one of the other cars. The two of them can sneak out with the other passengers while we split up and distract the press. We'll all meet back at my parent's house at..." The lavender unicorn glanced at a clock on the wall. "...6 pm sharp. Everypony got that?"

---

The train finished pulling into the station, coming to a halt. The Press ponies were all crowded outside the VIP car. The door opened, and a Rainbow streak shot out, flying right past the paparazzi pegasi, most of whom quickly gave chase. On the ground, Applejack charged straight trough the crowd, like a bowling ball slamming its way trough its pins. This opened up a path for Rarity and Fluttershy to reach a taxi, which promptly sped off for the market district. Both Twilight and Blueblood hopped out and imediately charged up their horns, teleporting themselves to the opposite side of the crowd before splitting up, Twilight blinking her way towards a nearby park, while Blueblood's chauffeur pulled up to allow the prince to get in to the carriage.

With most of the photographers and journalists now chasing the scattered members of the elements of harmony (and Prince Blueblood), it was now safe for Phoenix and a disguised Nyx to step out of a different passenger car and begin making their way to the detention center.
15412211121112.title: Paparazzi Problems

choices: Phoenix heads for the crime scene, with Nyx in tow.
Phoenix is stopped by a member of the nobility.
154122111211121.content:
Miraculously, the entire paparazzi seemed distracted by chasing the Bearers, so the path to the detention center was clear, save for the odd pony or two. Nyx led Phoenix there, as he hadn't been to the detention center in Canterlot before. Phoenix made sure his Equestrian Attorney badge was visible, pinned against the lapel of his coat where his Earth badge would be. As he walked, he contemplated what would drive anypony to frame Pinkie Pie of murder.

         "Halt!" At the command, Phoenix blinked and looked up. While he'd been lost in thought, they'd arrived at the detention center. As with Ponyville, a pair of guards were posted outside. One of them spoke up. "What business do you have at the detention center?"

         Phoenix drew himself up. "I'm a defense attorney, here to speak to Pinkie Pie about representing her in her case."

         "Do you have proof of your profession?" the other guard asked. Phoenix simply nodded, pushing his badge into the light with a hoof. "Very well. You may enter, but your friend stays out here."

         Phoenix was about to protest, not wanting the press to get a chance to catch them, but the disguised Nyx shook her head. "I'll be fine, Mr. Wright. You go on and talk to Pinkie."

         Phoenix looked at her for a moment. "Alright, if you're sure." He trotted inside the detention center, being escorted to one side of a glass partition. A few minutes later, Pinkie was escorted in from the other side. Phoenix was taken aback at first; the normally perky pony looked rather depressed, her mane and tail both flat and hanging down. Even her coat seemed duller than usual.

         "I didn't think anypony would want to defend me," she murmured. "You're either brave, or stupid."

         Phoenix shook himself to get his emotions under control. "Actually, I have experience with murder cases, Pinkie. You don't need to worry."

         The earth pony blinked. "How do you know my name?"

         Phoenix smirked. "The last time we saw each other, I looked a bit different. Does this ring a bell?" He pushed the pink badge forward.

         Pinkie looked at the badge, and her eyes widened. "F-Feenie...?"

         Phoenix nodded. "It's me, Pinkie. I'm here to help you."

         A startling change came over the pink mare. Her mane and tail sprang into poofy curls, as her colors brightened to their usual shade. "OMIGOSH, FEENIE!" She tried to bounce over to him to give him a hug, but the glass got in the way. She smacked into it, and slid down. "Eh-heh, forgot that was there," she muttered. She shook her head, and looked at him. "But what're you doing here again, Feenie? And why are you a pony?" She gasped. "Did Twilight do this to you? Did she summon you to defend me, and screw up the spell, and that's why you're a pony now?"

         "Not quite," Phoenix admitted. "I woke up in that castle that's near Ponyville these days, and was found by Nyx." He felt safe enough mentioning the alicorn to Pinkie, since he was certain that Pinkie knew everypony in Ponyville.

         "Oh, okay. So it was Nyx who turned you into a pony?" Pinkie asked.

         "Wh - NO! I woke up as a pony!" Phoenix replied, then shook his head. "We're getting off-topic, Pinkie. We're here to discuss you and how I can defend you. First off, I want to know: did you actually do it?"

         Now, Pinkie may have been oblivious at times, but she could tell what Phoenix meant. "No! I've never ever thought about killing another pony! How could you ask me that, Feenie?!" She began to sniffle. "I thought we were friends!"

         Phoenix noticed a lack of psyche-locks, and quickly explained himself. "We are, Pinkie! It's just part of my job. And I believe you, don't worry." He coughed a little. "So, did you know the victim, Duke Greengrass?"

         Pinkie shook her head a little too quickly. "Why would I know a noble pony? I'm not a noble!"

         As a single psyche-lock materialized around her, Phoenix sighed. "Sorry, but Prince Blueblood already told us the truth. Please, don't lie to me again, Pinkie. Or, should I call you Marchioness Pinkamena Rose Quartz?"

         The lock shattered almost as soon as it formed. "Oh... so Blueblood told you all, huh?" Pinkie sighed, and her entire demeanor changed. "Well, then yes, I did know the Duke. I should, after all. He was my fiancee."

         Phoenix's eyebrows arched clear up to his mane. "You're engaged?"

         "Yeah." The pink pony sighed. "When I was four years old, before I left for the rock farm, my birth father and Greengrass's father met to arrange a marraige between us. Nothing ever came of it, since my step-father took me to the rock farm, and I never saw my birth father or Greengrass again... until recently." She looked down. "My mother fell ill recently, and my birth father came to her. He said he'd pay for her medical expenses, but only if I was married into the nobility. He still had that old contract he and Greengrass's father came up with."

         Phoenix was incredulous. "So, your father all but coerced you into this arrangement?"

         Pinkie nodded. "Guess it doesn't matter now. Greengrass is dead, which means the contract is dead, which means Father doesn't have to pay for Mom's medical bills."

         "How bad is your mother's sickness?" Phoenix asked in a sensitive tone.

         Pinkie winced. "She's not looking good. The rock farm doesn't pay much, and there's no way we can afford the expenses."

         Phoenix thought about that. "Have you thought about asking your friends for help paying for the bills?"

         "I couldn't!" Pinkie gasped. "If I did that, my friends would all have to know about my heritage, and everything would change!" She looked down again. "I didn't want things to change. That's why we'd been doing all of this in secret."

         "Well, everything's probably going to be revealed in the trial..." Phoenix muttered. A thought occured to him. "But, you have proven that you lack a motive to kill Greengrass. I'll be sure to bring this up in court. Out of curiosity, do you think I could get your mom's medical records?"
