         Pinkie nodded. "Just tell her Pinkie sent you, and she'll authorize it."

         "Alright, that'll be good evidence for the trial. I'll be back later." With that, Phoenix turned around. Before he left, he paused. "Out of curiosity, what's Blueblood's interest in the case?"

BANG! RATTLERATTLERATTLE BA-A-A-A-A-A-A-A-A-A-A-A-A-ANG! SKRIIIIIITCH! BOOOOOOOOM!!!


         Phoenix had to keep his jaw from dropping as no less than fourteen psyche-locks materialized, along with a huge amount of duct tape, and (of all things) what looked like a vault, with a note on it. The note read, "Sorry, Feenie, I Pinkie-Promised not to tell."

         Pinkie herself shrugged. "We've met. He's actually a nice guy, once you get to know him."

         Phoenix nodded. "Right... Well, I'll let you know if anything else happens."
154122111211121.title: Turnabout Party: Pinkie's Story

choices: Nyx and Phoenix make it to the crime scene without further incident.
They get stopped along the way.
1541221112111212.content:
Phoenix stepped outside and was immediately confronted with the sight of (much to his surprise) Edgeworth berating Nyx. He was a bout to call out to his friend, when the image of him was replaced by a nicely dressed Earth pony. He was light in color, similar to Phoenix's coat, wearing a brilliant magenta coat and white crevat. His black mane was cut short in the back, but pushed forward to frame his face.

"Watch where you're walking, girl! You almost knocked me over!" The stallion turned away from Nyx, heading in Phoenix's direction, muttering to himself. "Honestly, peasants these days..."

Phoenix noticed that the guards made no move to stop this pony, meaning they most likely already knew who he was, and were certain he was allowed in. The pony continued walking until he spotted Phoenix and then instantly stopped.

"Ah, a fellow well dressed aristocrat! Good day to you sir! Just finishing up some business in the detention center, I take it?"

Despite the fact that he already didn't like this stallion Phoenix forced a smile on his face, in the hopes that it would speed along the conversation. "Just got done talking with my client."

"Ah, a defense attorney. I should have guessed by how you were dressed. I myself am a prosecutor." The stallion said, extending a hoof to Phoenix. "Allow me to introduce myself; I'm Earl Morally Grey of Hoofington."

Phoenix shook the hoof, smirking slightly. "Phoenix Wright."

There was a pause, as Earl Grey waited patiently for Phoenix to add a noble tittle to his name. they stood their for about five minutes before a look of realization came over his face, and he quickly took his hoof back, attempting to discreetly wipe it on the ground while he spoke again. "I see. Well I wish you the best of luck with your day. I have to go give some villainous scum a chance to confess their guilt and reduce their punishment. Good day, Mr. Wright."

Earl Grey stepped around Phoenix and headed inside, while Phoenix walked over to Nyx. "Any idea who that was?"

"That? That was Earl Morally Grey. He became a prosecutor shortly after his wife died. They say that everypony who's ever gone into court against him has always lost, and their are more than a few rumors going around that he's even gone so far as to forge evidence and bribe witnesses just to make sure it stays that way, though nothing has ever been proven."

And with my luck, he'll probably be the prosecution at Pinkie's trial...great. Phoenix thought to himself. "Anyways, we better get going if we want to check out that crime scene and still have time to study before we have to meet up with the others."
1541221112111212.title: Turnabout Party: Encountering an Earl.

choices: Phoenix and Nyx finally reach the crime scene.
They get stopped along the way...again...
15412211121112122.content:
Nyx and Phoenix stopped by a cafe to get directions to the locations of the scene of the crime, when a pair of grey blurs slammed into Phoenix, knocking him off of his hooves. The attorney soon found himself underneath two mares. One was a Grey-blue color with a lighter grey mane white the other was light grey with a darker grey mane. Their manes were straight, and reminded him of Pinkie's mane when he'd first seen her at the detention center.

"Oops. Looks like we-" One started to say.

"-ran into somepony." The other finished.

"Sorry about that mister, we-"

"-were kind of in a rush to-"

"-get someplace really important-"

"-so we could see our sister."

Phoenix looked back and forth between the two as they got off of him and dusted themselves off. Both of them extended a hoof to him as a silent offer to help him back up. As he accepted their offers, he happened to spot their Cutie-marks.

One was a cartoon bomb, and the other was a stick of dynamite...

...and when he blinked, they switched ponies.

"Wait a minute, did your cutie-marks just...?" He started to ask, only to be cut off by the two mares.

"Say, you wouldn't happen to know where we could-"

"-find the canterlot detention center, would you?"

Phoenix blinked, and tried to ignore the fact that their cutie-marks had switched again. "Um...yeah, it's just five blocks that way." He replied, pointing in the direction of the detention center.

"Okay, thanks, bye!" The mares replied in unison, before rushing past him so fast, the poor attorney ended up spinning around like a top. Two pairs of grey hooves reached from behind him, and grabbed him, stopping his spinning motion.

"By the way, I'm Blinkie."

"And I'm Inkie."

"And were the Pie family twins!"

"If you ever need something blasted-"

"-into smithereens, then just give us a call."

"See you later mister handsome!"

And with that, the two siblings raced off towards the detention center again, once more leaving Phoenix spinning like a top. The gentle grip of Nyx's magic brought the dizzy defense attorney to a halt, as she walked back over to him.

"Geez, what happened to you? You look like you got hit by a hurricane!"

"I think I just got acquainted with a few of the members in Pinkie's family." Phoenix replied, as he silently prayed for the world to stop spinning.

"Yeah, well, speaking of Pinkie, I've got directions on how to get to the crime scene. It shouldn't take us too long to get there. Come on."
15412211121112122.title: Turnabout Party: Troublesome Twins

choices: They don't believe him, and think he and Nyx are reporters.
They believe him and let him and Nyx through.
154122111211121221.content:
At last, Nyx and Phoenix arrived at the scene of the crime: Duke Greengrass' Canterlot estate. It was a rather large mansion, and members of the royal guard were all over the ground, Several of which were glaring at the press ponies at the gates. There was a large hole in the wall of the building, that appeared to be burnt around the edges, and pointing at it on the lawn was...

"Either that Greengrass guy had a weird taste in lawn ornaments, or that's one of Pinkie's Party Cannons." Nyx said.

"Well, at least now we know how they came to the conclusion that Pinkie Pie committed the crime." Phoenix replied. "Let's go in and see what else we can find out."

The two headed up to the main gates, working their way past the crowd of reporters and photographers, until they came out in front, face to face with two guards.

"Halt!"

"State your business civilian!"

"I'm Phoenix Wright, the defense attorney representing the pony accused of murdering Duke Greengrass. I'm here to find out how the victim died and look for evidence." Phoenix replied.

The two guards glanced at each other, not sure what to make of this information, as both knew it would be incredibly stupid for a defense lawyer to get involved in a murder case...and yet, they'd heard of Phoenix Wright before. After a moment of silently communicating with each other, they came to a conclusion.
154122111211121221.title: Turnabout Party: The scene of the crime.

choices: Call them out on it infront of everyone.
Fetch the current captain of the guard to clear up the "Misunderstanding"
1541221112111212211.content:
"Nice try buddy, but Phoenix Wright was a hairless monkey." One of the guards said.

"Besides, you'd need an Equestrian Attorney badge." The other added.

"But I have an Equestrian Attorney badge, right here." Phoenix said, showing them his badge.

The guards didn't even bother looking before contradicting him this time. "It's a fake."

"A fake? What do you mean 'It's a fake'?" Phoenix began before something caught his eye...namely a large bag of bits the guard seemed to be trying to hide behind his back right leg. A glance at the other guard revealed that he too was trying to hide what was undoubtedly a bribe. The defense attorney glared at the two of them so intensely they started to sweat a bit.
1541221112111212211.title: Turnabout Party: Obstruction of Justice.

choices: "... is Trixie!" (Oh, the irony...)
Somepony else
1541222.content: If not one of the other Mane 6, then who is it?
1541222.title: Turnabout Spell: Arrestee Options

choices: Rainbow Dash.
Twilight.
15412221.content:
While the other ponies gasped, Phoenix just stared at Rainbow Dash.

Eventually, he said a single word. "... What." It wasn't as over-the-top as one would typically expect from the attorney. That was because he had crammed so much disdain into that one word for the myriad ways that the universe seemed to enjoy toying with him that there was simply no room for any other inflection.

That he just happened to get yanked back to Equestria when the second murder in any living pony's memory occured... that was pretty much par for the course for his life. That he was transformed into a pony this time was bizarre, but he could mentally file it away under "wierd Equestria stuff". That this wouldn't be the first time he was asked to defend someone (or somepony) who had been his opposition in court was an odd coincidence worthy of an annoyed groan. That he was being asked to represent the Smug and Obnoxious Trixie by the very same pegasus who was nearly banished to the sun thanks to her, however, THAT was the breaking point.

Twilight noticed that Phoenix was looking almost longingly at the table in front of him, and quickly cast a spell when she saw him start to pull his head back. Before he could slam his face into the table again, he was shocked out of it when he felt a blast of cold water hit him in the face.

The attorney pegasus coughed and blinked a few times before trying to wipe the water away while Rainbow Dash's dismay over the murder announcement turned into snickering at Phoenix's drenched look. "Thanks, Twilight... but did you have to soak me?" He then took a deep breath and turned his focus on the aerial speedster, who's snickering had evolved into a guffaw. Even Nyx giggled quietly, though at least she had the decency to try to cover it up. Under the circumstances, though, he knew he'd have to bring them down. "So, tell me about the murder. Who's the victim?"

Sure enough, Rainbow Dash's light mood immediately fell like a rock at the reminder of why she was there in the first place. "Right... the horse Trixie's accused of--"

"You mean 'pony'?" Phoenix interrupted reflexively, remembering how he'd been corrected upon making the same mistake when he had first arrived. He knew he had screwed up again somehow, though, when Dash glared at him, crossing her forelegs in irritation.

"No, I mean HORSE. It's this Hassim guy... some wizard from Saddle Arabia."

"WHAT?!" Twilight, Phoenix and Nyx all shouted so loudly that Dash found herself spinning back head over hoof before righting herself and rubbing her head.

Nyx asked, "Hassim? As in the Court Wizard of Saddle Arabia?"

Twilight followed by asking, "And they think TRIXIE was strong enough to kill him?"

"SADDLE ARABIA? Seriously? That's really a place here?"

"Phoenix!"

"I know, but come on!" With a sigh, Phoenix asked, "And you're sure she's innocent? This IS the same Trixie who tried to get you banished."

Twilight interjected. "I know what you're thinking, Phoenix, but Trixie's been through a lot since the trial. Sonata's blackmail..."

"... Getting humiliated when she tried to fill in for the Element of Magic..." Nyx added. Phoenix glanced over toward her, but the black alicorn looked away when he did so. Adopted or not, Nyx had definitely inherited her mother's lack of a poker face. It was clear there was something she didn't want to talk about there.

"... And then that whole 'Alicorn Amulet' fiasco," Twilight concluded. "I think that one was the wake-up call she needed. Ever since, she's focused on improving herself instead of just showing off and putting down anypony who challenges her, and she's gotten a lot more popular as a result. She's still... well, Trixie, but I couldn't have imagined her murdering anypony before, and I definitely can't now!"

Rainbow Dash nodded. "Yeah, and I've had to work with her since we're each supposed to put on a show for the Saddle Arabian prince when he shows up in a couple of days. I was gonna wow 'em with my sweet moves, and she was gonna fill time with her stage magic or whatever," she said, punctuating it with a derisive snort, which Phoenix easily picked up on.

"I take it you aren't feeling as forgiving as Twilight?"

"Buck no," Rainbow blurted out angrily, clenching her hooves with fury. Phoenix wasn't exactly sure how that was even biologically possible, but somehow the pegasus pulled that off. "She tried to get me shipped on a one-way trip to the SUN to satisfy her bloated ego! If I had it my way, I'd have dropped her right in the middle of the Everfree and let the monsters have her! But..." There was a moment of hesitation in her rant as her voice lost some of its venom, and her body drooped. "But the whole time we were stuck working together, she was going on about how it was her 'glorious comeback', and how much she was looking forward to performing for royalty. No way was she going to buck that up. I know she didn't do it, and I... well..."

"It's okay. I understand," Phoenix said to the other pegasus. And it was true. One thing he and the blue speedster shared in common was that they each knew what it was like to be accused of crimes they didn't commit. It wasn't something that he would ever wish on someone else, no matter how badly he thought of them. Seeing Rainbow Dash now, it was clear that she felt the same.

As if it was ever really a choice after hearing Dash of all ponies stick up for Trixie, Phoenix replied, "Alright. I'll talk to her myself, and if I'm sure she didn't do it, then I'll try to get her to let me represent her in court." He thought he heard a muffled 'squee' come from Nyx's direction, but when he looked over at the teenaged alicorn, she had apparently taken quite an interest in one of the light fixtures with conspicuous nonchalance. "So... I assume she's being held at the detention center? Let's go."

With that, he made his way to the door. After his initial difficulties, he was getting a bit better about walking on all fours. It helped if he didn't think about it and just let his new body move the way it wanted to move, though it would probably take him a while longer to get good at manipulating things with hooves. While he fumbled with the door handle, Rainbow Dash asked him, "Uh... do you even know which way to go?"

Phoenix rolled his eyes. "I know it's been a while, but yeah, I remember the place I visited every day that I was here last time."

"That's the Ponyville detention center," Twilight countered. "The Saddle Arabians are going to be visiting Canterlot, so wouldn't everypony involved in the entertainment be there?"

Phoenix's ear pricked up, which was a weird feeling. He'd never been able to wiggle his ears as a human, and they tended to have a mind of their own as a pony. Nevertheless, the important thing was what Twilight had said. "Canterlot? You mean Equestria's capital?"

Rainbow nodded. "Yeah, I flew straight here from there as soon as Trixie was arrested."

Phoenix's ears flattened atop his head. "And how far away is it? Even assuming Trixie lets me represent her, it won't do any good if we don't have time to investigate."

"Don't worry, Mr. Wright," Nyx said helpfully. "It's just a few hours in mom's balloon, or by train if we gather anypony else who wants to help. We can get there in plenty of time!"

Rainbow scoffed at that. "Pfft! TRAIN? Uh, in case you haven't noticed, Nix here's a pegasus. If we fly, the two of us can get there before the next train even leaves the station."

"I've been a pegasus for all of one hour," Phoenix replied, arching an eyebrow as he gave his left wing a weak flap. "When I first woke up here, I could barely WALK. I'm not sure if trying to fly around is a good idea."

Rainbow Dash gave him a Look then, fully deserving of capitalization. It was the same sort of expression he expected these ponies would give him if he got caught relieving himself into their Princess Celestia's soup bowl. A mix of disgust and uncomprehending shock. His fellow pegasus then narrowed her eyes and said with a challenging tone, "What are you, an earth pony? You said yourself that we need to get there fast! You. Are. FLYING."

Phoenix gulped, realizing that he had hit a nerve in the speedster. She DID have a point that having as much time as possible to prepare could only help their case, but he wasn't sure if he would survive the impromptu lessons in how to use his new wings. Plus, though it would leave him a little less time to investigate the scene, travelling with Twilight would give him a chance to learn anything he might need to know about the Saddle Arabians. To his chagrin, his lack of preparation during the early stages of his first trial in Equestria still haunted him.

Figuring that if he didn't make a stand either way, Dash would probably just grab him and drag him up into the sky anyhow, Phoenix settled on his answer. "Alright, I'll go with..."
15412221.title: And this is a bad thing WHY?

choices: They get to the Detention Center, and Phoenix and Nyx meet with Trixie
Something interrupts them on the way there.
154122212.content:
Seeing Rainbow Dash deflate at his decision, Phoenix quickly added his reasoning. "Look, the first time I stepped into an Equestrian courthouse, I was made a laughingstock because of how little I knew." He pointedly ignored a cough from the lavender unicorn. "If I'm going to represent Trixie, I'll need every advantage I can get. I don't know anything about Saddle Arabia, and I don't want to trip myself up over their customs."

         Dash sighed. "Yeah, I guess you're right. I just wanted a flying buddy. I think we could have made it there real quick, too, so you could study after doing everything else..."

         "Dash, not everypony flies like you do," Nyx interrupted. "And to expect a pony who was human until waking up in Castle Nightstone to be able to keep up with you is completely unreasonable. Besides which, if I know the trains, there'll be one here in about 30 minutes. It won't take that long to get there, and that'll be valuable study time for... Mr. Wright."

         Twilight glanced at her adoptive daughter and mentally giggled. Nyx was clearly suffering from hero-worship. At least, I think it's just hero worship... Shaking her head, Twilight smiled at Phoenix. "Alright, 30 minutes should be more than enough time to round up the girls and buy tickets to Canterlot. Rainbow, you get the girls, I'll take care of the tickets with Phoenix, Nyx, and Spike."

         "On it, Twi!" With that, Dash zipped out the broken window. A magenta aura surrounded the broken shards, and the window was soon flawlessly back in place.

         "With that done, let's get going!" Nyx said enthusiastically.

*****


         Roughly thirty-five minutes later, Nyx, Phoenix, Twilight, Spike, and the rest of Twilight's group of friends were nestled in a pair of compartments on the train, heading to Canterlot. Phoenix was fighting down a blush at being in close proximity to seven young mares, but no one seemed to notice. They were more interested in his current situation.

         "So ya got turned into a pony, Phoenix?" Applejack asked, snorting somewhat. "Can't say ah like that. It'd be like if ah woke up as a lizard. Ain't natural."

         "Oh, yes, a phoenix isn't supposed to become a pony. Twilight, you will try to help him, right?" Fluttershy asked, staring somewhat sternly at the scholar.

         Twilight gulped nervously at her normally timid friend's glare. "Um, yes! Of course!"

         "I think Feenie looks pretty cool as a pegasus!" Pinkie Pie said, bouncing around the slightly flustered attorney. "Ooh! Ooh! Have you tried to go flying yet, Feenie? I bet Rainbow Dash would love that!"

         "Nah, Nix said he's not used to the pony body yet, let alone being a pegasus," Dash clarified. "I gotta say, I was pretty bummed he wouldn't fly with me to Canterlot."

         "Well, thank Celestia he didn't Dash," Rarity interjected. "If he had, who knows what kind of damage could have been done to his sharp suit and dashing coiffure?"

         Phoenix smiled at Rarity. "Glad to know somepony was on my side... and my hair's."

         "Yeah, Rarity's right, it's cool," Spike said, eager to earn points with the alabaster mare.

         The group made small-talk for a few more minutes before Twilight brought everyone's attention to her. "Okay, everypony, since Phoenix still doesn't know much about this world, we need to educate him. He could be forgiven the last time he was here because he was new to Equestria and... *ahem* neglected to study some necessary materials."

         "Well, if somepony had warned me just how different Equestria is from Earth, I would have given more thought to studying," Phoenix replied, somewhat acidly. His first appearance in Equestria's courts still stung.

         "Well, we'd be happy to help you out, darling," Rarity said, batting her eyelashes. "But what subjects can we talk about in the time available? Canterlot isn't too far, especially by train."

         Phoenix rubbed his chin with his hoof (and he took a moment to marvel at how different ponies in this world were from his), then said, "Let's stick with Saddle Arabia. The victim came from there from what we've heard, so I don't want to sound ignorant of their customs."

         "Works for me, Phoenix!" Twilight said. "Now, here's what you need to know about Saddle Arabia..."

*****


         A couple of hours later, the train arrived in Canterlot, allowing Phoenix his first real look at the capital of Equestria. He couldn't help but gawk. This place is enormous! I've never seen such huge buildings! It took a prod from Nyx to bring him back to himself. "Ah, uh, sorry, it's just, kind of... daunting."

         Nyx smiled, although Phoenix detected a hint of sadness to it. "It grows on you. So, where to first?"

         "Well, that's easy enough," the attorney said. "We go to the Canterlot Detention Center. I'll need to convince Ms. Great and Powerful to accept me as her lawyer before I can do anything else."

         "It shouldn't be too hard," Twilight murmured, taking the lead of the group through Canterlot. "I mean, murder is extremely rare in Equestria, as you learned the last time you were here. Most lawyers probably wouldn't touch Trixie's case because of how severe the charge is."

         "Well, what are we waiting for? C'mon!" Dash said, about to speed off.

         "Hang on, Dash!" Phoenix interrupted her, causing her to false-start in midair. "Look, I know you all want to help. But if this is anything like last time, the guards won't let just anypony in to see Trixie. I have my badge, so I can get in, but I can't make cases for all of you. I think it's best if I take just one of you along as my co-counsel."

         "But the rest of us wanna help too, Feenie!" Pinkie protested. "I was really helpful the last time you were here, right?"

         "Yeah, you were, but being my co-counsel is different from helping me investigate, Pinkie," Phoenix explained. "You'd be actively helping me defend Trixie, which requires that certain protocols be observed. And, no offense, but three... actually, four of you just won't work as my co-counsel."

         "And who would those be?" Spike asked, arching an eyeridge.

         "You, Rainbow, Pinkie, and Fluttershy," the attorney replied bluntly. "Let me explain," he added, when he saw a few of the mares start to turn red. "Spike, you're way too young to consider at all in this case. Rainbow, you're very confrontational, which could land us in a ton of hot water if you push things too far. Pinkie... is Pinkie. And as for Fluttershy, well, I don't mean to offend, but you're a little too kind for this sort of work. You've got to be a little aggressive, which I think we can all agree you're not."

         "Oh... that's okay, Mr. Phoenix. I know I'm not that aggressive," Fluttershy agreed.

         "So that leaves me with Twilight, Rarity, Applejack, and Nyx as possible co-counsel. And of them, I think Twilight and Nyx are the only ones who could be truly qualified."

         "Meanin' what, exactly?" Applejack asked with a slight edge to her voice.

         Rarity sighed. "What he means, Applejack, is that you and I have little experience with legal matters. Twilight and Nyx, on the other hoof, live in a library, and thus are able to study our criminal-justice system."

         Applejack snorted, but relented. "Ah guess that makes sense. Sorry ah can't help ya more, Phoenix."

         Phoenix smiled. "It's no problem. Besides, the rest of you can still help with my investigation once I've secured myself as Trixie's lawyer."

         "So, who are you going to pick as co-counsel?" Rainbow asked.

         "Hm..." Phoenix thought about that, but his thoughts were interrupted.

         "Actually, Phoenix, I think Nyx will be able to help you out more than I can, this time," Twilight said, scuffing a hoof slightly.

         "Wait, what?" the attorney said with a blink. "But, you helped me out a lot, last time!"

         "Yes, well... I would like to study the magic that changed you in more detail, and I'm afraid that'll eat up a lot of my time. But don't worry! Nyx is just as good, if not better than me!" Twilight beamed at her adoptive daughter, who grinned back.

         "You mean it, Mom? I can help Phoenix Wright with his case?!" The black alicorn looked positively giddy. Without waiting for a response, she scooped Twilight up in her forelegs in a crushing embrace. "ThankyouthankyouTHANKYOU!!!" she squealed, before setting her slightly crushed mother back down. "Ahem. What I mean is, I humbly accept this grave responsibility."

         "NOW can we get going to the detention center? Trixie's not going to defend herself, you know!" Rainbow argued.

         "With her legal arguments, she probably could, actually," Phoenix retorted, as the group made their way through Canterlot.
154122212.title: Turnabout Spell: Study Time

choices: Go see Trixie now
Flashback to the study session
1541222122.content:
Nyx was practically prancing down the road as Twilight directed them toward the Detention Center, Spike holding the map open while riding on the librarian's back. Ever since her power had started to return through her natural growth and development, rather than the forced empowering she had been put through years ago, the young alicorn had been eager to live up to the destiny her cutie mark represented. The more she matured, the more determined she grew to honor the promise that she made to the Princesses years ago and protect ponies from whatever dangers might rear their heads.

Naturally, stories of heroes and champions had always been a favorite topic of her's, especially when they involved her mother and the other Elements of Harmony. On the surface, one might not expect the one about Rainbow Dash's trial and the human lawyer her mother had summoned to find the special place in Nyx's heart that it had. There were no monsters or great battles won by strength of arms or magic. Instead, it was about two groups shouting at each other.

But that was only on the surface. When Nyx heard the story, she could feel the importance of it. The courtroom had indeed been a battlefield where the truth was the most powerful weapon, and an innocent life had been spared because of those who fought to the very last to grab hold of that truth and bring it to light. For a pony who had been as prone to identity crisis as Nyx was in her early life, that thought that the truth was not something to be feared, but to be championed, helped her a great deal.

And now she was not only going to get a chance to follow in the hoofprints of that champion of truth, but he had personally hoof-picked her to help him scour the land high and low for clues pertaining to the guilty culprit! And on top of that, it would give her a perfect opportunity to make it up to Trixie for publicly humiliating the showmare those years ago, during her brief reign as Equestria's dark queen. Even if she had been doing so in order to restore her own image and sense of self-worth, the fact remained that she had been willing to take up the Element of Magic and stand up against Nightmare Moon.

Unfortunately, while it had seemed funny at the time to embarass the arrogant magician and run her out of Ponyville without even the clothes on her back, the humor had evaporated some months later when she showed up in Ponyville for the fourth time. Having been shown up in terms of raw magical power by both Twilight Sparkle and Nightmare Moon, Trixie had devoted her remaining resources toward seeking out the Alicorn Amulet to greatly amplify her own power. And it had worked, but the Amulet had corrupted her, darkly twisting her craving for fame and recognition into a desire to rule over other ponies.

Thanks to some advice from Zecora and the help of her friends, Twilight had been able to use sleight-of-hoof to con the power-mad Trixie into giving up the Amulet before her ambitions could spread beyond Ponyville. Still, even though nopony had really blamed Nyx for inciting Trixie's desire for the Alicorn Amulet in the first place, Nyx herself always felt that she shouldered at least a little of the responsibility for the damage that was done, and she hoped that this would be a chance to set things right once and for all.

"Hey, Nyx, what're you thinking about?" Pinkie's voice broke her reverie as the pink pony bounced alongside her with a wide grin. "You look like me when I'm waiting for that first fresh batch of cupcakes to come out of the oven, and the smell is just soooo good that I wish we didn't have to save them for the customers because I can practically taste that sweet, sweet goodness on my tongue already and oh my gosh girls, is anypony else hungry? Oh, and since when are clouds square?"

The sheer whiplash of Pinkie's questions caused everypony to look at her and see that she was pointing up at the sky. They all turned their heads up as one just as a perfectly rectangular shadow was cast over them, starting small but growing larger as something descended from the sky.

"That's not a cloud," Twilight replied, shading her eyes to get a better look. "It's... a carpet!"

"Shouldn't we get out from under it?" Spike asked as it gradually grew closer and closer. The others quickly realized that he had a point and spread out just as the carpet lowered itself onto the street. Once it had set itself down on the ground, a shimmering glow lifted itself away from the ornate rug and swirled around before being drawn into a ruby positioned on the forehead of one of its occupants.

Phoenix blinked at the sight. "A flying carpet... of COURSE it's a flying carpet," he mused, though in actuality it was the riders that drew his attention.

Actually seeing two Saddle Arabians in person, the horse/pony dichotomy suddenly made a lot more sense to the transmogrified human. He figured that if he were still in his normal shape, he would probably be about eye level with the two horses, but from a pony's perspective they seemed like giants. A stallion and a mare by the look of them, the female of the duo was light beige, and clad in silk and jewelry, one of which was the ruby that had absorbed the magic keeping their carpet aloft. She looked at him, but only fleetingly as golden eyes glanced every which way to take in everything around her at once.

The stallion, by contrast, appeared far more focused. He was much larger and more muscular than his companion, with a dark brown coat and bright white mane, Phoenix was hit with an odd sense of familiarity that solidified when the stallion's eyes focused on his own with a penetrating crimson stare.

For a moment, Phoenix felt as though he were yanked out of Equestria and back into the courtroom on Earth, looking across the room as a tall, dark man glared at him through a visor which glowed red.

"G-godot?!"

"Good day to you as well," the stallion replied, the image of one of Phoenix's courtroom adversaries vanishing to be replaced by the swarthy equine in front of him. "My apologies for disturbing you, but we are new to this city. Can you give us directions to the dungeon?" His female counterpart leaned in to whisper something into his ear before he corrected himself. "Ah, I mean the 'Detention Center.'"

Applejack asked, "You're headin' there too? Y'all here about the wizard that got killed?"

The bluntness of her question caused the Saddle Arabian to arch an eyebrow at her, but he replied, "'Too?' Indeed. I am Grand Inquisitor Achmed, and my wife Farah and I are here to represent our nation's interests in the coming trial. The Court Wizard was one of the King's closest cousins, and so we have been sent to ensure that justice is carried out upon his killer." To Phoenix, he asked, "And judging by your suit, are you here to defend the murderer?"

Phoenix felt his feathers bristle as Dash jumped up and hovered in front of the stallion. "Hey, Trixie didn't do it, and we're gonna prove it! So you can roll up your carpet and shove it up--YIPE!" Phoenix had reacted reflexively, trying to grab Dash's tail and yank her away. He'd momentarily forgotten that he didn't have hands, however, so instead of getting a grip, his hoof kept going until it touched her flank. This caused her to turn a withering glare on him. "Hey, hooves off the merchandise, Nix!"

Phoenix felt himself break into a cold sweat under that glare while Rarity whispered to herself with a hint of dismay, "Oh my... so THAT'S the sort of mare he likes," just loudly enough for him to overhear while Fluttershy supportively put a wing across her friend's back. The rest of the mares stared in shock while spike tried (and failed) to keep from snickering at his plight.

For his part, Phoenix was just hoping Rainbow Dash didn't suddenly decide to give him 'flying lessons', though a small part of his mind congratulated himself for at least diverting her attention before she could start an international incident. Clearing his throat, he tried to ignore the possibility of an imminent high-altitude demise as he addressed the horses.

"I'm sorry for Rainbow Dash's outburst there," he said while the other pegasus fumed at him. "We aren't officially her defense team yet, but she's right that we don't think that she's guilty, so if she lets us, we'll be seeing each other on opposite sides of the courtroom."

This was normally the point where the prosecution would start with the cocky insults, but Achmed smiled instead. "Well, your Royal Guards seem to think otherwise. As Inquisitor, it is my duty to believe in that truth and fight for it just as you fight for yours. If we do meet in the courtroom, then we will see who's truth has greater weight. Until then, I wish you and your many wives well."

As a deafening silence fell over three whole city blocks from that verbal bomb, Farah's ruby flashed and magic flowed out of it, swirling around them like a living thing before inhabiting the carpet once more and lifting the horses up into the air. The stunned silence was broken just before they flew out of earshot as they heard her say in heavily-accented English, "Farewell for now, Mr. Wright."

This left him surrounded by seven mares who were either blushing or glaring at him, and one guffawing dragon. Before he could protest that it was Achmed who said it, though, a thought came to his mind. Wait, how did she know my name?
1541222122.title: Turnabout Spell: The Prosecution

choices: "Alright, you're free to enter and speak with the suspect."
"The suspect is currently indisposed. You'll have to come back later!"
15412221222.content:
After having to spend several minutes defusing the rather tense situation caused by the Saddle Arabians' parting comments, Phoenix dragged himself down the street toward the Detention Center once more, both looking and feeling like he'd just barely escaped a pack of timberwolves. Hearing Spike call him a 'player' nearly every step of the way didn't help any, either. Taking a deep breath, Phoenix tried to tune the smartass dragon out and focus on his meeting with the prosecution, as well as what he had learned of their ways and culture on the train ride there.

-----


"When we get access to the crime scene, we're going to need to try to find the Court Wizard's djinn," Twilight explained as the Friendship Express departed from Ponyville.

Phoenix gave Twilight an odd look at that and asked, "This pony... er... horse is dead, and you want to raid his liquor cabinet?"

Twilight blinked a few times before realizing the error and groaned. "Not gin... His djinn. Saddle Arabian magic isn't quite like unicorn magic, but it isn't exactly the same as pegasi or earth pony magic, either."

"Wait, I thought only unicorns can use magic," Phoenix replied, confused.

"Only unicorns can cast spells, darling," Rarity corrected. "Why, practically everything has magic, it's just that for pegasi and earth ponies, it's innate rather than focused into spells."

"That's right," Applejack proudly interjected. "That's why we earth ponies get th' most bang fer our buckin' when it comes t' growin' crops or things t' do with the soil."

"And how else do you think pegasi move clouds around," Rainbow Dash asked with a smug, know-it-all grin. "Pfft, some eggheads think we couldn't even fly if it weren't for magic."

"You couldn't," Twilight replied with a tone that made it clear it was a point she had tried to make many times in the past. "The equine body type is completely unsuitable for flight! It's magic as much as wingpower that lets you stay up in the air, let alone break the sound barrier."

When Dash just rolled her eyes, exacerbating the unicorn's agitation, Phoenix tried to switch gears quickly to Nyx. "So you're a...?"

"An alicorn," the teenager replied, happy to be helpful. "I can use all three types of pony magic." Tilting her head curiously, she asked, "Don't humans have magic, Mr. Wright?"

Phoenix hesitated for a moment before replying, "Well... there are some types of magic in my world, I guess, but it's so rare that most people don't even think magic exists. I know a few who can channel the spirits of the dead, and then there's my magatama--"

"You that toy you were playing with last time you were here? You still have that?"

"IT'S NOT A TOY!" A number of other passengers glared at Phoenix after his sudden and loud outburst while Fluttershy reflexively dove under the seats. "I mean... it's not a toy, it's an artifact that lets me know when someone is keeping secrets from me. It helps me find out what people are hiding when I need to get info from them that can decide a case."

For some reason, Applejack raised an accusatory eyebrow at him when she heard this. "B-but I don't just use it whenever I feel like it," he explained quickly. "Only when someone's life is hanging in the balance, and I need to find the truth."

Thankfully, this seemed to satisfy the farmer enough that she didn't kick him upside the head as Twilight got them back on track. "Anyway, we were talking about Saddle Arabian magic. Their magic involves binding spirits called 'djinn' into their service by sealing them in gemstones or objects of personal value. Most common djinn aren't that powerful, sort of like how most unicorns don't learn much more than basic levitation and lighting spells, along with whatever magic suits their special talent. The ones bound to the royal family, though, are incredibly ancient and powerful, pre-dating Equestria's founding. According to legend, the one bound to the King is old enough that it was around during the creation of the world itself. That's probably an exaggeration, but even Princess Celestia says that it's probably more powerful than she is."

The ponies and dragon were awestruck, and even Phoenix was impressed by this claim, given the reverence his equine companions had for their rulers. "So how come they aren't ruling the world?"

"Well, as powerful as djinn are, they're also limited in what they can do," Twilight explained. "They can't harm or kill another living being, they can't control another being's thoughts or actions, and they're completely incapable of lying. As a result, they're used to improve the lives of the Saddle Arabians and defend them from outsiders, rather than as tools of conquest."

"I see," Phoenix said. "So what about their culture?"

"Ooh, can I take this one?" Nyx quickly leaned in before Twilight could continue her lecture, looking at her mother with big, eager eyes. Twilight blinked, but nodded to let her daughter go ahead, causing Nyx to let out a happy squeak before she went into it.

"Well, modern Saddle Arabia is descended from a large number of nomadic tribes who were unified over three thousand years ago by a king who was also the most powerful djinn-binder that ever lived. His name was King S--"

"Wait," Phoenix interrupted, holding up a hoof. "Don't tell me... was his name... King Solomane?"

Nyx gasped in astonishment. "H-how'd you know that?"

Phoenix gave a pained chuckle as the punny name made him want to hoof-punch himself in the face. "Let's just call it a lucky guess," he replied, wondering just how many places and historical figures in this world were one horse-pun away from being counterparts of his own.

"Right, well... King Solomane single-hoofedly bound all of the most ancient and powerful djinn known of today. Over five hundred of them, all told. Since Saddle Arabia doesn't have immortal rulers like the Princesses, he passed the djinn down to his children, laying the foundation for the extremely large royal family that exists now.

"They're very intelligent and civilized, and were among the first races to develop advanced mathematics and literature, though they do maintain some traditions that were inherited and modified from their ancient, more warlike tribal days. Dueling, for example, is a fairly common way to settle disputes, as they believe that destiny favors the righteous. Instead of fighting to the death or anything, though, they typically settle things with a contest between their djinni, ensuring that nopony gets hurt."

"Since the djinn can't cause harm to any living thing," Phoenix mused, putting two and two together. "Anything else?"

"Oh, there are other ancient customs too. Polygamy, for example, though it isn't nearly as widespread as common stereotypes would make you think. It used to be back when they lost a lot of stallions to inter-tribal warfare, but the only times it's practiced anymore are among extremely radical traditionalists or by the highest-ranking members of the royal family."

----


"That son of a bitch!"

"PHOENIX! Language," Twilight scolded him, quickly yanking the map from Spike's claws and covering his head with it. The baby dragon let out muffled protests as he tried to pull it off.

"S-sorry," Phoenix replied, "I just remembered what Nyx said earlier about Saddle Arabians and polygamy. According to that, either that Achmed guy thought I was a kook, royalty, or he was just messing with us. And considering his wife somehow knew my name when I'm pretty sure I never got around to saying it, I'm putting my money on option three."

"Well that wasn't very nice," Fluttershy said softly. "Playing on racial stereotypes like that..."

Rarity huffed, "I should say not! Rarity is the 'other mare' to no stallion, and I resent any accusation to the contrary, even in jest!"

"Ah, are you still worried about Farah knowing your name, Feenie?" Pinkie bounced over to him and said reassuringly, "Don't worry about it. She probably just read it in the dialog box!"

Phoenix shrugged. "Yeah, you're probably righ-- Wait, what?" But Pinkie was already bounding off ahead toward a stately building with marble columns, an emblem of the scales of justice, and a pair of unicorn Royal Guards stationed in front of the doors. "Oh, I guess we're here. Alright, they'll probably only let me in, so I'll go have a chat with Trixie and be right out."

"Good luck, Mr. Wright," Nyx said.

"Yeah, don't let that stuck-up blowhard turn you down!" This one came from Dash.

Approaching the door, the guards quickly braced themselves in his path and glared sternly at him. As one, they exclaimed, "Halt! State your business!"

Pulling out his Equestrian attorney badge, Phoenix held it out for the guards to see. "My name is Phoenix Wright. I'm a defense attorney, here to see Trixie Lulamoon about her case."

After looking at the heart-shaped badge to confirm that it was the real thing, the guard on the left told him...
15412221222.title: Turnabout Spell: Knowledge is Power

choices: Follow Phoenix and Nyx as they investigate the crime scene
Celestia tells the others she'll preside as the judge in this case
154122212221.content:
Phoenix marveled at the interior of the detention center. It was much larger than the one in Ponyville, and far more like the one in his world. Why, there was even a security camera on the prisoners' side of the partitions! Amazing how much of our electrical technology they can simulate using magic, he thought.

         He was brought back to his senses when he spotted a familiar azure mare being led into the room on the other side of the partitions. "So, are you the defense that is to be assigned to Trixie's case? Trixie is impressed, you responded quite promptly to her request. Why, it's barely been three hours since her unjust arrest!"

         Seems like old habits die hard, especially with this one, Phoenix thought. Out loud, he merely coughed. "Yes, I'm the attorney that's interested in representing you."

         "Well, Trixie will not allow just anypony to represent her," the showmare scoffed. "How does Trixie know you will represent her fairly?" She paused, and took a closer look. "Also, why does Trixie have the strange sensation of having met you before?"

         "Possibly because the last time we met, we were on opposing sides of the courtroom," Phoenix replied in perfect deadpan. "During the trial of Rainbow Dash?"

         Trixie's eyes nearly bugged out of their sockets. "W-w-w-WHA?! You... You're Phoenix Wright! But... but I thought you were human! At least, you were the last time you were here!"

         "My ponyfication is a mystery, Trixie, one that Twilight's looking into," Phoenix replied. "But that's not the issue at hoof, here. Twilight and Rainbow Dash both vouched for you, saying that you couldn't have killed Hassim. So, on their urging, I came here to look into your case."

         Trixie was slack-jawed. "Rainbow Dash vouched for me? I... admit I find that difficult to believe. Twilight Sparkle, I can understand, but that pegasus? I did my level best to get her convicted."

         "And yet she believes you wouldn't do something like this," Phoenix said, surreptitiously reaching into his pocket to touch the Magatama within. "Speaking loosely of which... you didn't kill Hassim, did you?"

         Trixie's stupefied look quickly morphed into one of anger. "I would never! Even during my darkest days, I never did anything that caused permanent harm to anypony! Certainly not murder!"

         Phoenix waited a moment, but nothing happened. "Hm... alright, then, Trixie. If you want me, I'll take your case. I believe you didn't kill Hassim."

         Trixie's anger evaporated into relief. "Trixie thanks you, Phoenix Wright. Trixie would be happy to ask you to represent her. Although, do you not find it awkward? Representing somepony who you once argued against?"

         Phoenix chuckled wryly. "It wouldn't be the first time."

         Trixie blinked, and smirked. "It sounds as if you have a story or two."

         "Doesn't everypony?" the attorney asked. "Anyway, what can you personally tell me of what happened?"

         Trixie sighed. "Very little of the actual murder itself. Trixie was in her cart when she was arrested. But as for Hassim himself... that is another story. You may not be aware, Phoenix Wright, but the Saddle Arabians were sending a delegation to meet with Princess Celestia. Trixie was to perform alongside Rainbow Dash for their prince."

         "Yes, Rainbow told me about that," Phoenix nodded. "But if the prince wasn't to arrive for a couple of days, what was the Court Wizard doing here ahead of him?"

         "Trixie was told, by Hassim no less, that he was here ahead of time to secure proper accomodations for the Prince," Trixie replied. "In addition to being the Court Wizard, Hassim also served as Saddle Arabia's ambassador to Canterlot."

         "Important guy," Phoenix mused. "So, you got to speak to him, eh?"

         Trixie's demeanor suddenly changed. She became slightly nervous. "Well... only in passing," she said hesitantly.

*BANG!* *RATTLERATTLERATTLE* *BANG!BANG!BANG!*


         As Phoenix watched, the area around Trixie became black, as chains materialized around Trixie, and three red padlocks appeared. Mentally, he sighed. Of course... everypony's got something to hide, after all. Knowing he didn't have nearly enough evidence to break the Psyche-Lock, he smiled. "Well, I'm off to go investigate. I promise, Trixie, you'll be a free mare by the time I'm done."

         Trixie smiled at him; a genuine smile, not the haughty arrogant smile he remembered from their first meeting. "Thank you, Phoenix Wright."

*****


         As Phoenix left the Detention Center, he noticed that only Nyx was waiting for him. "Hey, Nyx!" he called, causing her to canter over. "Where'd the others go?"

         "Summoned away for a meeting with Princess Celestia," Nyx explained. "They were asking for me as well, but since I'm your co-counsel, I asked to remain behind. Mom promised to tell me about the meeting later."

         "Hm, alright. Now, we just need to figure out where Hassim was murdered, and where he was staying," Phoenix mused.

         "I actually asked the guards about that," Nyx replied, pulling out a scroll with her magic. "They gave me a map of Canterlot, with the crime scene marked on it. Shall we?"

         "Let's," Phoenix agreed, eager to get as much investigating done as he could.
154122212221.title: Turnabout Spell: The Great and Powerful Accused

choices: ... Achmed and Farah again.
... The detective in charge.
1541222122211.content:
Phoenix sighed as they walked away from the palace. He and Nyx had bumped into Twilight and her friends after their meeting with the Princess, and the news hadn't been good. Due to the politically-charged nature of the case, their involvement would have suggested an unfair bias toward the defense. Nyx was allowed to help only because she was his co-counsel. Still, he couldn't help but feel like there were forces at work trying to keep his job from getting too easy by denying him the extra pairs of eyes that the six mares and dragon could have offered.

"Well, it's too bad your mom and her friends can't help, but it could still be worse," Phoenix said to Nyx with a jocular tone. "At least I haven't fallen off a bridge this time. Yet."

Nyx blinked, sensing there was a story behind that, but also giggled as she looked at him. "Well, you are a pegasus, so I can't imagine that would actually be so bad right now."

Phoenix looked back over his shoulder and flexed his wings a bit before tucking them back against his sides. "Heh, well, that's true. Not sure I really want to find out, though."

There was a moment of silence before Nyx asked, "Mr. Wright, are you scared of heights?"

Phoenix shook his head. "Not really. No more so than the next person, anyway, it's just weird to think about flying. Where I'm from, the only people who can fly under their own power are comic book heroes. Besides, Twilight said it's magic that lets pegasi fly, so what if I only have the shape of a pegasus, and none of the magic?"

Nyx rubbed her chin in thought. "Hmm... good point. Oh! Why don't we test it?"

"I'm not jumping off a bridge," Phoenix replied. "We don't really have the time, anyway."

Nyx laughed. "Oh, no, I didn't mean anything like that. There's a much easier way to tell whether you've got pegasus magic or not, and it'll only take a minute. I just hope they don't mind if I borrow a bit of cloud..." She looked up to the sky. As expected of the Canterlot weather team, the skies were bright and clear with a few fluffy white clouds perfectly shaped and placed to provide decoration and the occasional spot of shade. Spotting the nearest one, Nyx spread her large wings and pushed herself up into the sky.

On the ground, Phoenix arched an eyebrow as he watched her fly up. To his surprise, he found that he could see her clearly even as she got farther and farther away. He hadn't really thought about it before, being too distracted by his return to Equestria and the impending investigation, but realized that his eyesight was somewhat sharper at a distance.

Huh. Well, if nothing else, that should come in handy, he thought to himself as Nyx glanced shiftily from side to side before breaking off a pony-sized chunk of cloud and smoothing over the gap left behind before flying back down the ground with the bit of cloud held in her hooves.

Phoenix shook his head in disbelief at the sight, even though he knew from Rainbow Dash's trial that pegasi could manipulate clouds and weather. Which I will never, ever, ever forget. It was one thing to know it in theory, and another to actually see a flying pony break off a piece of cloud like cotton candy.

Soon, she was back on street level and placed the cloud in front of Phoenix. "Here you go. Just hop on," she said with a smile.

Phoenix inspected the cloud with an expression of uncertainty on his face. After all, magic or not, it was still a cloud. It looked like there should be no possible way that it could hold his weight. He looked up to Nyx, who was grinning widely, cat-like eyes sparkling with anticipation, so he reached out a hoof to poke it first. The fluffy white mass pushed in under his hoof, and as he gave it a few more experimental pokes, he realized that it felt like a stress ball, but one that could be broken up as he pulled off a small piece, molding it in his hooves before putting it back.

After confirming that he could indeed touch it, he climbed up onto the cloud and boggled as it not only held together under his weight, but didn't so much as drop an inch. It was like those cloud platforms in old 2-D platformer games he had played as a child.

"Congratulations, Mr. Wright, you're 100% pegasus," Nyx replied. "Well, at least for weather. There's a small chance that you might not be able to fly well, but that's incredibly rare."

Phoenix hopped up and down a few times on the cloud to test it before seeing Nyx's good mood fall somewhat. Sitting down on the cloud (which he quickly realized was one of the most comfortable things he had ever rested his butt on) he asked, "What's the matter?"

"Oh, I was just thinking of my friend, Scootaloo," Nyx replied, leaning against the side of the cloud as she reminisced. "She's a pegasus too, but she has a sort of magical birth defect. She can do almost everything any other pegasus can do, but her wings will never give her enough lift to stay airborne for more than a minute or two."

"Oh. Wow, that's... that's gotta be rough," Phoenix replied sympathetically. "I imagine it'd be like being born a human with only one leg."

Nyx nodded, looking up to the sky with a wan smile. "Yeah, you know how Rainbow Dash is so gung-ho about flying? Scootaloo absolutely idolized her. Still does, really. When she found out she'd never be able to follow in Dash's hoofsteps, she was completely devastated for a long while. But don't worry, she's okay now. What her wings lack in lift, they make up for in velocity, so right now she's in Las Pegasus to build up a name for herself on the stunt and racing circuit."

Nyx giggled and looked at Phoenix. "'Tires of Fire' Scootaloo, the fastest pegasus on land! That's what she's calling herself now, so I'm not too worried. In fact, I bet you twenty bits she'll be the first pony ever to pull off a Sonic Rainboom on ground-level."

Phoenix smiled back, but then asked, "So why did it make you sad?"

Nyx replied, "Well... it's just that right before you showed up, we had a Cutie Mark Crusader going-away party. Scootaloo's off in Las Pegasus, and Sweetie Belle's actually here in Canterlot at the big conservatory. I should visit her if we get any free time on this case."

Phoenix nodded understandingly while she sniffled slightly, opening up her heart to him. "I could've left, too... joined the Guard or the police academy to learn how to protect ponies, or even gone overseas, but... it was already too much, letting those two leave. My other friends, Twist and Apple Bloom, were still settled in Ponyville, so I found a reason to stay so I wouldn't have to lose anypony else from my life. My friends, mom, Spike... I'm... I'm probably going to live a long, long time... A lot longer than anypony except Spike. And I'm at peace with that, I think... I just want to hold onto them while I can."

Phoenix wasn't entirely sure how to respond to Nyx's confessions as tears started to form in her eyes. He had never been that great with kids and teenagers, and his knowledge of alicorns was limited to them having traits of all three pony races, and being extremely powerful and revered. On the subject of friendship, though, he could speak up. "I actually know how you feel, Nyx. You know, when I was young, my best friend left school really suddenly."

This got her attention, and he looked her in the eye as he nodded. "Yeah, his dad was killed, and he had to move away. I didn't see him again until years later, when we were both adults. By then, he'd changed completely. He'd become a cold and ruthless prosecutor who only wanted to get the accused convicted."

"Woah," Nyx whispered. "So did you meet him in court?" Phoenix nodded. "So what happened?"

Phoenix chuckled. "What else? He got accused of murder, and I defended him. It's a long story, but we patched things up, and it turned out he wasn't quite as different as he'd seemed at first. He just wanted to make sure that criminals would be punished. Now, the two of us are clear that we just want to get at the truth, so we're still able to be good friends. I'm sure it's the same for you and your friends."

Nyx smiled, her eyes still moist but her joy genuine. "Thanks, Mr. Wright."

"Not a problem. Oh... and about your... lifespan? Like I said before, I know people back home who can channel spirits. One of them's my assistant, so believe me when I say this." He placed a hoof on her shoulder. "You are never alone. The ones you love will always be there for you, so don't ever feel like you need to hold yourself back just to hold onto them. Real friendship never dies."

Seeing the conviction in Phoenix's eyes, Nyx tried to find the words to express her gratitude when their conversation was interrupted by a sudden shout. "Help! Help!" An elderly neon green stallion with a blue mane pointed at Nyx and Phoenix while shouting. "Nightmare Moon's stealing our clouds! And she's got an evil porcupine eating that stallion's head!"

Phoenix sputtered with indignation while Nyx eeped and quickly took off flying again. Phoenix was about to give the old coot a piece of his mind when he suddenly felt himself get yanked away by Nyx's magic, flapping and flailing wildly as she carried him off.

"What was that about?!" he exclaimed, eventually giving up on trying to escape the magic grip, instead crossing his forelegs.

"N-nothing," Nyx lied. "I just realized we should really be getting to the crime scene!"

"Uh-huh..." Phoenix didn't buy it for a second, but the fact remained that they did still have an investigation to perform, so he went along for the ride until they reached the scene where they met...
1541222122211.title: Turnabout Spell: Pegasi 101

choices: Phoenix discusses his findings with the Mane 6
Something else happens
15412221222112.content:
Shortly, Nyx touched down in an area of blackened grass in the backyard of a rather opulent house. "So, this is where Hassim was staying, huh?" Phoenix asked as Nyx set him down. He looked down at the charred grass, and sighed as he spotted a white tape outline. "Deja vu..."

         "Huh?" Nyx blinked at the seeming non-sequitor.

         "Just remembering my first time here in Equestria," the pegasus murmured. "Ace Swift was killed by a bolt of lightning, and his body was found in a charred area of grass. It took some doing to get Rainbow Dash off the hook."

         "So you're that defense attorney, pal!"

         The familiar voice nearly scared the feathers off Phoenix's wings. He yelped and spun to face the speaker. For a moment, he was under the impression that he was facing a slightly older man, wearing a filthy overcoat, with a scruffy appearance and a messy head of hair. He blinked, and the view changed... slightly. He was now facing a slightly older stallion, wearing a filthy overcoat, with a scruffy appearance and a messy mane. The similarity was even more jarring than when Phoenix had first met Sonata or Applejack.

         Nyx wasn't as disoriented. "Oh, are you the detective in charge here?"

         The stallion grinned. "That's right! Detective Dick Gumhoof, lead investigator on this case!"

         If Phoenix was disoriented before, now he was just plain dizzy. Seriously?! GumHOOF?! This is too crazy to be coincidence!

         Nyx noticed his condition, and kept him steady when it looked like he was about to fall over. "Phoenix? Are you alright?"

         Her voice brought the attorney back to his senses. "Huh...? Oh, yes, of course!" He looked at the detective, who was looking at him curiously. "Sorry about that, you just remind me a lot of somepony else I know."

         "Huh. Guess what they say is true, everypony has a twin out there," Gumhoof mused. He grinned again. "Well, anyway! You're the defense team for that magician, right? What was her name... Tricky?"

         "Trixie, actually," Phoenix replied, getting into his element. "And I hear the victim was the court wizard of Saddle Arabia, Hassim, correct?"

         "That's right, pal!" Gumhoof sighed. "Talk about your international incidents. This is going to be one ugly trial, and you've got one hay of an uphill battle ahead of you."

         "So, can you tell me any details on what happened here?" Phoenix asked.

         Gumhoof considered, then shrugged. "Why not?" He looked downcast for a moment. "Not like my salary can get any lower..."

         ... And the similarities continue, the attorney thought, as Gumhoof presented him with a manilla envelope. It took Phoenix a moment to open it, being unused to his body and all. The envelope, it turned out, contained the initial autopsy report. "Hm... cause of death... electrocution? This really is deja vu..."

         "Yeah, but there's one big difference from Ace Swift's murder," Gumhoof broke in.

         "What's that?" Nyx asked.

         "Y'see, we couldn't find any stormclouds or anything like that around. Also, our unicorn docs determined something. The electricution that did him in... was magical in nature." Gumhoof shivered. "Scary, being able to summon that much power."

         Phoenix frowned. "Something isn't right, then."

         "Huh?" chorused Nyx and Gumhoof.

         "It's just, when I defended Rainbow Dash, Twilight told me something," the attorney mused. "She said that no living unicorn has the magical prowess needed to summon lethal amounts of electricity, and that those types of spells are forbidden. So, why exactly was Trixie arrested?"

         "Well, she was seen leaving the scene of the crime," Gumhoof said. "A witness saw her after hearing a few lightning bolts."

         Remembering that Equestrian lightning worked differently from Earth lightning, Phoenix nodded with a sigh. "Great... an eyewitness. My day just can't get any worse."

         "Oh, you think that's bad?" Gumhoof asked with a wry grin. "Take a look at this." He led Phoenix over to what appeared to be a set of hoofprints in the ground, near the back door of the house. "They're still kinda fresh. Care to guess who they belong to?"

         "Trixie," the pegasus replied with a groan. "She told me she'd only spoken to Hassim in passing! What was she doing in his backyard?"

         "Good question, pal. Maybe you oughta ask her," the detective replied. He scratched the back of his head, lifting his coat enough that Phoenix caught a glimpse of his cutie mark: a broken magnifying glass.

         How fitting, if Gumhoof is anything like his double on Earth, the attorney thought wryly. Out loud, he coughed. "Well, anything else you can tell us?"

         Gumhoof frowned. "Well... just between the three of us... something here doesn't add up. And I don't just mean the 'lack of power' thing. From what I saw of the body... Hassim was hit from different angles at the same time."

         "That is strange," Nyx said with her own frown. "I'm not sure what to make of that."

         Phoenix sighed, giving the scene one more look. Nothing jumped out at him, unfortunately. "Well, we might as well get going. The trial's tomorrow, right?" he asked the detective.

         "Yep, sure is. You might wanna study hard, Mr. Lawyer," Gumhoof laughed heartily.

         "Study hard, and share this with my friends," muttered Phoenix.

         "But, didn't they say - " Nyx began, looking confused.

         "They said they couldn't help directly with the investigation. But I'm just going to ask them some questions about what we know about the crime. Getting details from ponies who know their stuff, you understand?" Phoenix clarified.

         "Oh..." Nyx nodded. "I understand." She grabbed Phoenix in her magic again, and flew off, the attorney pegasus not even protesting this time.

         Gumhoof watched them leave. "Huh. Wonder why he didn't just fly with her?" He shrugged. "Ah, well, not my problem. Instant noodles, here I come!" He trotted out through the opulent house, making sure not to touch anything. It wouldn't do to dirty the home of the prince of Saddle Arabia, after all.

*****


         At the station in Ponyville, three ponies awaited the train to Canterlot. Two young unicorn mares and a slightly older stallion drew hardly a glance from the rest of the town. They whispered amongst themselves, seperate from the townsponies.

         "I can't believe all of this!" the youngest mare squealed quietly, practically bouncing on her hooves. She was a purple color, a shade or two darker than Twilight, and wore a magatama and light-colored robes. Her black mane was done up in an ornate style that drew some curious looks from the locals. "This is amazing! And I thought Nick was lying when he told me about this place!"

         "It would seem Wright was telling the truth after all," the stallion replied. He was light in color, similar to Phoenix's coat, wearing a brilliant magenta coat and white crevat. His black mane was cut short in the back, but pushed forward to frame his face. "I'm just glad we were able to get used to these new forms on our own."

         "And knowing Phoenix Wright's luck, he's probably landed smack dab in the middle of a foolishly foolish fool's errand," the last mare said. She had a white coat, with a light blue mane that framed her face in a sort of bowl cut. She wore a black vest studded with jewels the color of her mane, and a small whip hung by her side. "That or a murder investigation."

         The younger mare frowned. "Well, normally I'd say 'that's impossible', considering what this world's like, but given what he told us about his last visit here..."

         "Indeed," the stallion said with a frown of his own. "Wright has the most unfortunate luck sometimes."

         "A fool's luck, one might say," the mare with the whip added. "Still, let's see what exactly he's up to in this city of 'Canterlot'."
15412221222112.title: Turnabout Spell:  Familiar Face

choices: Phoenix sleeps soundly through the night
Phoenix has strange dreams
154122212221121.content:
After leaving the crime scene, Phoenix and Nyx met up with the others to discuss their next move and prepare for the coming trial. At the moment, they were following Twilight and Nyx to the house of Twilight's parents, the librarian having gotten in touch with them during the investigation. As they made their way up the road, Phoenix found himself staring at the upscale houses they were passing.

"Uh, Twilight? Are you sure we're going the right way?" I feel like I'm trespassing, he thought. Some of these places look like they're worth more than the entire building my apartment's in.

"Don't worry, we're almost there," Twilight breezily replied, completely comfortable in their surroundings.

You live in a tree, for crying out loud! Try as he might, though, he just couldn't find a way to vocalize his astonishment that the small-town librarian he knew came from such a wealthy background. His train of thought was interrupted anyway when a pink, blue-eyed ball of energy started bouncing around right in front of his face.

Pinkie Pie grinned as she hopped backwards, blithely doing so without tripping over any of the cobblestones in their path. "Oh, you're gonna love Twilight's parents! They're super-duper nice and fun. They invited us here for Twilight's 25th birthday and we had so much fun at the party, everypony in the neighborhood came to join in!"

"They came to complain about the noise, darling," Rarity replied.

"Yeah, don'tcha remember all th' city guard that came t' tell us t' pipe down?"

"Hmmm..." Pinkie Pie rubbed her chin in thought as she continued to bounce along on her other three legs. "I remember they stayed for the cake. And the limbo contest! Officer Cuffem was so happy to win the trophy!"

Rainbow Dash groused quietly through lightly clenched teeth, "I so would've won if Officer Hotpants hadn't walked by. I'd like to see any of you try to limbo with a sudden wingy..."

Phoenix blinked, unfamiliar with the term, but Applejack nudged his shoulder and shook her head with an expression that clearly said 'you don't want to ask.' She then took it upon herself to change the subject. "Anyway, don't let the fancy digs worry ya none, sugarcube. Ah had th' same reaction, first time Twi invited us over t' her folks' place, but they're good, honest ponies. Not lahk the stuck-up snobs that live up in these parts."

"It's called 'class' and 'sophistication', darling," Rarity huffed. "I can't imagine why you would be surprised. After all, one should expect fine, upstanding parents to produce such outstanding children like our dear Twilight and her brother. Besides, I don't recall you turning Fancypants down when he wanted to sponsor Sweet Apple Acres in that agricultural competition."

Applejack retorted, "Now that was business. 'Sides, ah ain't got nothin' 'gainst yer friend Fancypants. Feller might not've ever put in a hard day's work in his life, but at least he appreciates the effort other ponies put into keepin' Equestria runnin'. Not like them sicky-fants always hoverin' around him with their noses in th' air an' not a single opinion of their own between 'em."

"The word is 'sycophants,' darling," Rarity corrected. "Though... I will admit, you have a point there. But that just demonstrates the difference between true class and those who merely play at it."

"We're here!" Twilight called out from the front, walking up to the door of their destination. It wasn't the biggest or the fanciest house on the block, but it still looked like a mansion to Phoenix, who hung back a bit to take it in. The door opened and an older mare and stallion came out to greet them as everypony filed in. Nyx wrapped her grandparents up in a big wing-hug before going inside, and the Elements of Harmony each paid their respects before following.

Phoenix was the last one in, and he reflexively reached out to shake hands with the stallion of the house before embarrassingly realizing that the gesture didn't work well with hooves. "Heh... sorry, old habit. It's nice to meet you, sir."

"Just call me Nightlight. And this lovely vision is my wife, Twilight Velvet. " Twilight's father replied, ushering the human-turned-pegasus inside. Velvet rolled her eyes a little, but couldn't keep a smile and a slight blush off her face at the obviously well-worn compliment. Then he said, "It's a pleasure to finally meet you, after everything our daughter's said. Though I have to admit, I expected you to be more... alien."

Phoenix chuckled and replied, "Heh, believe me, so did I. It's been a strange day for everypony."

"You'll have to tell me all about it," Velvet replied. "Actually, I wouldn't mind if you could share some stories of the cases you've tried back home! I don't know if Twilight told you, but I'm something of a novelist, and I'd just love to get a chance to talk to someone who's been involved in actual murder cases for inspiration."

Phoenix was taken aback by the suggestion, but in a good way. She thinks ponies would actually want to read stories about a defense attorney? Wow, maybe I'm finally cashing in some good karma points. Laughing modestly, he said, "Wow, I'm flattered! Yeah, I've tried a lot of strange and fascinating cases, and I'd love to tell you all about them."

"Yeah, he'd love to," Twilight interrupted, suddenly butting in. "But for now, he's got to make sure he studies and is prepared for the trial tomorrow." She gave Phoenix an arch look that made his pale coat paler as beads of cold sweat formed on his forehead.

"Y-yeah, that's right. Gotta study up! But after the trial, I'm all yours, Mrs. Velvet." Right. Gotta focus on making sure Trixie's found innocent, and not incite the wrath of my co-counsel's mother.

"And we're happy to put you and Twilight's friends up for as long as you need, though I'm afraid we don't have quite enough beds to go around."

At first, Phoenix was disappointed. Just another case of drawing the short straw, since he couldn't possibly ask any of Twilight's closest friends to sleep on the floor for his own benefit. But then he recalled a moment earlier that day and replied, "Actually, that's not a problem. I'm sure I can just get a piece of cloud to sleep on." It felt weird to say, but remembering the astonishing comfort of resting on condensed water vapor put him in a good mood.

"Yeah, I prefer cloud beds too," Rainbow Dash said from the living room before something clicked. "Wait, when were you up in the clouds? Nyx, did you take Nix flying without me?!"

Phoenix ended up having to quickly explain his continued aeronautic virginity and how Nyx had helped him test his pegasus-hood, much to the amusement of the others as Rainbow acted like she'd been cheated out of her chance to mentor Phoenix in the ways of the pegasi. After a lively dinner with Twilight's friends and family, the group gathered around to discuss the evidence Phoenix and Nyx had been given, sparse as it was. After hours of poring over every conceivable detail and angle, they decided that it was time to turn in so that they would be fresh and ready for the trial the next morning.

After Nyx brought down enough cloud matter for Phoenix to make himself some comfortable bedding (while Rainbow grumbled that a real pegasus should be able to do so himself), the attorney took off his suit and settled in for a good night's sleep. Unlike his first night in Equestria, not only was the bed properly sized for his current body, but it was the most snug, comfortable 'mattress' he had ever rested on. Even with all the thoughts and questions about the trial running through his head, it didn't take long for him to drift off to sleep.
154122212221121.title: Turnabout Spell: Settling in for the Night

choices: After breakfast, the group heads straight for the courthouse
On the way to the courthouse, they're interrupted by somepony(ies)
1541222122211212.content:
For the most part, the night passed smoothly in the household. Most of the girls had piled into Twilight's old room, as well as the guest room. Rarity and Fluttershy shared a bed, as did Applejack and Twilight. Nyx shared with Pinkie Pie, though neither really minded; Pinkie, after 'testing' various ponies, had determined that being Nyx's partner would be comfiest, and Nyx had agreed. Rainbow Dash and Phoenix slept soundly on seperate cloud beds, though Phoenix was out in the living room as opposed to in one of the normal bedrooms. He'd insisted, after all, seeing it as inappropriate to be the lone male in a room full of young mares.

         Still, his sleep started to become less sound, as he started twitching, his face contorting. "Mmm... no... Mia..." he murmured. His twitches became more pronounced, his breathing labored. Soon, he'd gone beyond twitching, and into outright thrashing. Sweat poured down his face, his murmurs turning into whispered pleas for mercy from Twilight, from Nyx, asking them not to leave.

         It was fortunate for him, then, that Rainbow Dash happened to pass by on her way to the kitchen for an early-morning cup of water.

         The athletic pegasus had refined the art of napping to the point where she'd actually reduced the overall amount of sleep she needed each night. She'd gotten a nap earlier, after Princess Celestia's little bombshell that she A) wouldn't be the judge in this case, and B) was asking the rest of them not to investigate with Phoenix. She was still a little mad about that, but she wasn't about to argue with the Princess. She'd woken up about a minute ago in the guest room, and silently crept out, intent on getting a cup of water, downing it, and perhaps getting in a little early-morning exercise.

         All that flew out of her mind when she saw Phoenix in the grips of a nightmare.

         "N-Nix?" she asked, hovering closer. When she saw how badly he was thrashing, her eyes widened. She'd actually seen this kind of behavior from Scootaloo once or twice, after the news that the orange pegasus would never truly fly like she could. She knew nightmares, and from the way the attorney was sweating and jerking around, this one was bad. "Nix! Wake up!" she hissed, trying to pin him to halt his thrashing. Phoenix was stronger than he looked, though, and she was knocked off of him onto the floor with a loud 'thump!'. Shaking her head to clear it, she saw that his condition seemed to be worsening. And for the second time that day, Rainbow felt useless, but this time it was worse. One of her friends was suffering, right there in front of her, and she couldn't do anything to help.
