"Nix!" she cried out, trying to reach her voice to him through the depths of darkness the nightmare had landed him in.

         Then Nyx charged into the room. She didn't require much sleep herself, being an alicorn, but she still enjoyed it. She'd woken up, however, due to a loud 'thump!' she'd heard from the living room. She'd carefully slid out of bed, making sure not to wake Pinkie Pie, and crept towards the living room to see what was going on. At Rainbow Dash's cry, she'd abandoned stealth, and burst in, intent on confronting whatever menace was assaulting her prismatic-maned friend.

         Seeing nothing threatening at first, her eyes then fell on Phoenix's thrashing body, and she understood. She was by his side at an instant, and used her magic to pin his limbs. "Here's hoping this works," she muttered, as she lowered her horn to Phoenix's head. There was a brief flash of light, and Phoenix awoke with a piercing scream!

*****


         About thirty minutes later, everypony in the house was gathered in the living room. Velvet, upon seeing Phoenix's condition, had hurried into the kitchen, and made a pot of tea. One cup of said tea was now with Phoenix, and it was definitely welcome, the frazzled attorney beginning to calm down.

         "So, what happened, anyway?" Twilight asked, looking between Rainbow, Nyx, and Phoenix. "All I know is I'm in the middle of a dream, when I hear a scream that jolts me awake, and everypony's charging into the living room to find you three all looking like you've seen a ghost. You most of all, Phoenix."

         Phoenix sighed. "Nightmare. Nearly a night terror, if what Rainbow was telling me is true."

         "It must have been, with the way you screamed," Rarity fretted over him... or more precisely, his mane. "Why, your mane is almost ruined with the sweat!"

         "Rarity, focus!" chided Applejack. "So what were ya dreamin' about?"

         Phoenix shuddered. "Bad memories and fears, all woven together in a tapestry of terror."

         "Sounds... terrifying," Fluttershy said ernestly.

         "Do you remember anything specific?" asked Nyx, nursing her own cup of tea. Phoenix's scream had scared her half to death, worrying that she'd botched the waking spell somehow.

         "Of memories... only the worst. Coming into the office to see Mia dead on the floor, with Maya crying over her was only the first act," Phoenix murmured.

         "Who are 'Mia' and 'Maya'?" Twilight wondered. "You mentioned 'Mia' the last time you were here, but you never told me anything specific about her."

         "Mia was my boss, the head of the law offices I work at. Maya is her younger sister." Phoenix screwed his eyes shut, not willing to shed more tears on this matter.

         "So... you found your boss dead, with her sister crying over her? That actually happened?" Rainbow asked, feeling sick. "And you said that was just the first act?"

         "Yeah... it only got worse. Being accused of murder, only to find out my supposed 'girlfriend' was behind it... falling to my near-death in a raging river due to a frail bridge..." Phoenix kept his eyes shut as he recounted his worst memories.

         The ponies, on the other hoof, were wide-eyed. "How have you managed to stay sane?" breathed Velvet. "If those three are the worst incidents... I can only imagine how much else you've been through!"

         "Sometimes I wonder how I stayed sane," the attorney mumbled. "Then I look around me. Maya, Pearl, Edgeworth... I've got a lot of friends, all of them ready to help me when I'm in a bind." He finally opened his eyes again, and smiled at the gathered ponies. "And I have friends here, too, to comfort me when I need it."

         The ponies all smiled back at him, even Nightlight and Velvet. The unicorn stallion coughed. "Well, after all of that, I doubt we'll be getting back to sleep tonight. I hope everyone's satisfied with how much rest they got?"

         "I'll be fine," Phoenix affirmed, draining the last of his tea. "At least I got more sleep than my first night in Equestria!"

         He and Twilight shared a chuckle at that, and the rest joined in, as Velvet bustled off to the kitchen to get an early breakfast started. Still, Phoenix pushed his nightmare out of his head. Today, he would defend another innocent in court. He was prepared for an uphill battle... one he intended to win.
1541222122211212.title: Turnabout Spell: Nightmare Fuel

One of Luna's Night Guards
15412221222112121.content:
Nyx took deep breaths as she and Phoenix waited outside the courtroom for the defendant to arrive. She adjusted her headband for the dozenth time, just for the sake of doing something. Somehow, Rarity had found the time and materials to put together a purple blouse and shoes, as well as a headband and glasses in the style of her childhood. Not to hide her identity, as that had been public knowledge for years now, but because the fashionista had insisted that a professional appearance would help her project confidence and conviction in court.

So far, it wasn't working. She looked over at Phoenix as he pored over the notes they had assembled during their study session, his mane re-styled and his suit freshly cleaned. Nyx had to admit that in his case at least, Rarity had a good point. Looking at him now, she would never guess that just a few hours ago he had woken the entire household up with his night terrors. Like he hadn't been forced to face half of the things he had told them about.

As the pegasus glanced up from his files, Nyx realized she'd been caught staring. Instead of calling her out on it, though, he asked sympathetically, "Feeling nervous, Nyx?" When she nodded, the corner of his mouth quirked up in a smile. "Heh, that's natural. I still remember having butterflies in my stomach before my first case. Heck, my butterflies had butterflies."

Nyx gave a weak, shaky laugh in response. "I wasn't this scared when I was fighting hydras and Scorpios," she replied, demurely looking down at her hooves and thus missing Phoenix's startled reaction to the admission.

After shaking his head in disbelief, Phoenix told her, "Well, it's okay to feel nervous, but try to keep it off of your face as much as you can when Trixie gets here." Nyx looked up at him, so he explained. "It's something Mia used to say. Right now, Trixie's future is in our hands... er, hooves. She's going to be looking to us for hope, so it's important that we smile and move forward with confidence. We know that Trixie isn't a murderer, so as long as we hold onto that truth, we'll be fine."

Nyx listened carefully to Phoenix's words, taking them to heart. "Giggle at the ghosties," she whispered quietly to herself, thinking of the song Pinkie Pie had taught her and her friends when they were little and more easily scared. It had a similar message to what the lawyer was telling her, so she started humming it and put a smile on her face. She would be calm. She would be focused. She would do everything in her power to help Trixie from being punished for a crime she didn't commit.

She kept her smile up as a pair of bailiffs approached, flanking Trixie as she was led to meet her attorney. In stark contrast to how she usually carried herself, the showmare's face was downcast, her steps hesitant. This is what Mr. Wright meant, she thought to herself. She needs us right now. Not just to defend her, but to believe in her, so she can believe in us. With as much confidence as she could muster, she stepped forward and said, "Hi, Trixie!"

The blue unicorn tilted her head up, gradually taking in the sight of the black alicorn who had an wide grin on her face. Trixie's pupils shrank, her ears flattening as she asked, "Phoenix Wright...? Have I gone mad with grief over my incarceration, causing me to hallucinate about past enemies, or do you see her too?"

Nyx felt a resurgent pang of conscience hit, but forced herself to smile even wider, adding a creepy, manic edge to her expression. Moving her lips as little as possible, she glanced over to the pegasus and asked, "Mr. Wright? Did you tell her I was your co-counsel?"

Phoenix gulped as even he was feeling a little creeped out by Nyx's expression and Trixie's reaction to it. Once again, he got the sense that there was a story there that he might have benefitted from knowing beforehand, but there wasn't any time to get into that. "It, uh... never came up. Is this going to be a problem?"

"A problem? A problem?!" Trixie reared up on her hind legs, waving a hoof between Phoenix and Nyx. "I should have known this was a trap! You both felt that you hadn't humiliated me enough, so now you want to get me shipped off to a Saddle Arabian dungeon! You can't do this to me! Do you have any idea what they'll do to a pony as beautiful as Trixie?!"

Phoenix groaned and rubbed a hoof against his forehead while Nyx visibly struggled to maintain a cheerful expression and Trixie started screaming 'mistrial' over and over again.

-----

Roughly fifteen minutes later, Phoenix and Nyx had finally gotten Trixie to accept that the black alicorn genuinely wanted to help. Or at the very least, they got her to stop complaining so loudly. It seemed to clear the air when Nyx blurted out that she had once bullied Trixie after having heard about her from Twilight. That had gotten a stunned look from the showmare and a good deal of surprise from Phoenix, who could scarcely imagine that sort of behavior from the young mare he'd gotten to know.

Still, even though this added to the questions he had about his increasingly enigmatic assistant, the stream of apologies that erupted from Nyx seemed to throw Trixie off. And just when she had seemed ready to launch into another tirade, Nyx had lashed out with the most pleading puppy-dog eyes Phoenix had ever seen on a horse. Trixie still groused a bit about how she should have tried to represent herself, but chose not to act on this. Instead, they spent what time they could discussing their strategy for the upcoming trial.

"So I think our best tactic right now is to prove to the court that you couldn't have performed the spell that killed Hassim," Phoenix explained, which went about as well as one could expect.

"Couldn't?! Is that a challenge? The Great and Powerful Trixie will have you know that there is no spell known to unicorn-kind that she cannot perform!" She reared up on her hind legs and thrust a hoof up in what was probably meant to be a show of grandiosity, but was rendered somewhat less so by the lack of her trademark hat and cape.

Phoenix cleared his throat and glanced from side to side, but thankfully the guards watching the doors simply did their duty with remarkable stoicism as Trixie dropped back down onto all fours with an indignant 'humph'. "Yes, well... that's sort of the point we're going for, Trixie. During Rainbow's trial, Twilight told me that no unicorn can summon up a strong enough lightning bolt to be lethal to a full-grown pony. Especially one the size of a Saddle Arabian, and a magic-user himself at that. As long as we stick to that line of reasoning, the prosecution can't establish that you had the means to commit the murder, and you'll be acquitted."

Granted, this means the real culprit is still at large, Phoenix nervously thought to himself. And the Saddle Arabians probably won't be satisfied going home with no one to punish for the crime, so to keep the peace between the two nations... No, I can't think about that. From what I've heard about the Royal Sisters, it doesn't sound like either of them would allow an innocent to be punished for political expediency. Besides, bad sense of humor aside, Achmed seems a lot more reasonable than most prosecutors I've had to face.

He lifted up a hoof to cover a yawn as his early and abrupt waking started to catch up with him. He didn't remember a lot about the nightmare he had been yanked out of, thankfully, though the flashes he could still recall were like a slideshow of all his worst memories. Times of terrible loss and horrific danger, bathed in the light of a full moon.

Phoenix tapped his hoof against his notes as he started to drift into a daydream, making small pencil marks on the papers. With a little help from the others, he had gotten a sort of strap that allowed him to hold a pencil with his hoof. His penmanship was nothing to write home about this way, but there was no way that he was going to have the time to learn how to write with his mouth the way Applejack and Fluttershy had demonstrated for him, so the improvised aid was a welcome addition to his arsenal.

Rather than writing, however, Phoenix's mind drifted back to the moon he'd seen in his dream. In contrast to most dreams where the details faded away the longer he was awake, he hadn't thought about the moon much immediately upon waking. The more he did so now, though, the more he realized that it had been a constant presence in every scene. Shining in through the window illuminating Mia's body. Hovering overhead as he plunged into the icy waters of raging mountain rapids. Even when his ex-'girlfriend' Dahlia Hawthorne had revealed herself as a sociopath and a murderer. That had taken place indoors, inside the courtroom back on Earth, yet upon reflection, he realized that somehow the moon had been affixed to the wall behind the Judge. Always shining its pale light upon the tragedies of his life, but not with the familiar pattern of craters one saw in Earth's sky. Instead, the moon had looked strange and alien, with a shadowy pattern cast over most of its face.

Suddenly, Trixie's voice snapped him out of his daydream. "WRIGHT! I know you're a pegasus, but get your head out of the clouds! What are you scribbling, anyway?" Phoenix suddenly felt the notepad get yanked out of his hooves by Trixie's magic as she looked at what he had been unconsciously doodling. "Wright, why in Celestia's name are you drawing the Mare in the Moon when you should be focusing on the case...?"

Before he could ask what that was, the trio were approached by...
15412221222112121.title: Turnabout Spell: Pre-Trial

choices: Ponies & Princesses (Phoenix & Nyx)
Theories and Thaumaturgy (Switch to the Mane 6)
154122212221121211.content:
The rich, dark scent of coffee wafted into everypony's nostrils, causing Phoenix to pale for reasons Nyx couldn't imagine. He looked around before sighting the two Saddle Arabian prosecutors, eyes locking on a coffee pot balanced on Achmed's back. "Oh you have got to be kidding me," he whispered to himself, though Nyx's keen hearing picked up on it just fine.

"Good day," Achmed said in greeting. Smirking slightly at Phoenix, he added, "Or is it 'Good doh?' I'm afraid my Equestrian may be a little rusty."

"No... no, you got it right," Phoenix replied nervously, eyeing the coffee pot as though Achmed had approached brandishing scimitars at the defense team. As before, Farah was by his side, the veiled and bejeweled mare's eyes darting every which way as she kept her own silent counsel.

Seeing the focus of Phoenix's attention, Achmed asked, "Ah, do you enjoy coffee? I would be glad to share a cup with you before the trial begins. You look as though you could use it."

"Uh... sure. As long as you don't throw it at me," he said with a nervous chuckle, drawing a confused look from every equine in the room save for one.

Trixie fumed, asking, "What are you doing, Wright?! You shouldn't be fraternizing with the enemy! They're just here to taunt us before the trial!"

Before either of them could think to stop themselves, Nyx and Phoenix both asked, "You mean like you did?"

If glares could set things on fire, then Celestia would have been able to take a vacation from her sun-raising duties.

"That is beside the point! Wright, these are the horses who want to get Trixie declared guilty and locked away in a Saddle Arabian dungeon for the rest of Trixie's life! As your client, Trixie commands you to have nothing to do with them!"

While this was going on, Achmed had taken the pot from off of his back in order to pour a cup and sip it while he watched with an amused expression. "Now, that is not entirely true," the stallion replied after she finished. "We wish for the guilty party to face justice for their crimes. If you are truly innocent, then your attorney shall prove it in court, and we will turn our investigation elsewhere."

Achmed took another sip of coffee, and for a moment, all traces of amusement vanished from his demeanor. "Evidence is everything, Ms. Lulamoon, and at this moment it points squarely at you. It is my duty to prosecute you, and I shall do so without hesitation or restraint. The trial will determine whether justice is on our side or yours, but justice is what Hassim's murderer will have to face. That is absolute."

Nyx gulped, feeling nervous for reasons she couldn't quite define. As a prosecutor, Achmed wasn't anything like the ones Phoenix had described from his own world, or from what she had heard of Trixie's behavior in the role. He wasn't making trash-talk or belittling the defense, but there was a sort of cold ruthlessness in his voice and eyes that sent a shiver down the alicorn's spine.

She looked at Phoenix to see if he felt the same way, but the attorney was meeting Achmed's eyes with his own. The same pegasus who had been getting browbeaten by his own client just a minute ago was now standing strong and steadfast. "So is Trixie's innocence," he replied. "I know it without a doubt."

Ever since Nyx had started to come back into her power, she had felt comfortable that she was stronger than almost any other pony around besides the princesses. Even though she still had a long way to go before both she and her magic fully matured, this was true in most cases. Something about the clash of wills between Phoenix and Achmed taking place, however, made her feel small again.

"Then prove it. Test the strength of your convictions against mine," Achmed challenged. Then he grinned, though the mood didn't lighten along with it. "If you felt like saving time, we could settle this the Saddle Arabian way, with a duel."

"The truth is the only weapon I'll need," Phoenix replied evenly.

Nyx's inner fangirl squeed at the sheer determination and conviction with which Phoenix said that. She tried to hold it in as she smiled with what was meant to be a projected aura of confidence and poise. Her state of mind turned it into a goofy grin that caused Trixie to feel sick and roll her eyes when she saw it, however.

"The prosecution and defense may enter the courtroom," a bailiff said, walking up to the lawyers. The stare-down between Phoenix and Achmed was broken up as they each turned to their respective assistants.

"Are you ready, Nyx?" Gesturing with his head toward Achmed, he whispered, "I don't know what it is, but he's definitely got something up his sleeve. He might not be the gloating type, but I can tell... he's confident that he's going to win."

Nyx smiled and nodded firmly. She had been nervous before, but now she was getting psyched up. The truth was on their side, and they were going to go as far as it took to fight for it. Turning to Trixie, the alicorn said, "It's okay. It doesn't matter what he throws at us, because we know you're innocent, and nothing will stop us from proving that!"

Trixie looked away and muttered, "Easy for you to say. Trixie has prosecuted against Wright before, and it was only thanks to that cowardly pegasus's intervention and that idiot judge giving him a second chance that allowed him to escape crushing defeat under Trixie's hooves." Glancing furtively at him out of the corner of her eye, though, Trixie's frown faltered from disdain into worry... and just a hint of desperate hope. "It took a miracle to beat me last time. Do you think you would go so far again to save me now?"

"Watch for yourself, Trixie," he said. "By the time this is over, you'll be walking out of this courthouse a free mare."

With that, the doors opened and they stepped into the courtroom. The battle was about to begin.

Phoenix noted that, despite the differences between the Canterlot and Ponyville detention centers, the inside of the courtroom looked very much the same. In fact, aside from Achmed at the prosecutor's bench, the only true difference that the pegasus could see sat at the judge's chair.

         Phoenix had never laid eyes on Princess Luna, aside from pictures. Now, however, he felt that those pictures did her an injustice. Her brilliant navy-blue coat, her sapphiric mane dotted with all the stars of the sky, blowing in an eternal, unfelt breeze... Phoenix had rarely had to think about such things since becoming a lawyer, but he had to catch his breath after laying eyes on this pinnacle of ponykind.

         "Never seen a princess in the flesh before?" Nyx muttered to him, giggling softly.

         This snapped Phoenix out of his reverie, and just in time. Princess Luna banged her hoof on the podium, in place of a gavel. The sound cut through the ambient noise of the courtroom like a knife. In a clear, strong voice, the Princess spoke. "Court is now in session for the trial of Trixie Lulamoon. Are the defense and the prosecution both prepared?"

         Inquisitor Achmed inclined his head at the prosecution bench. "The prosecution is prepared, Your Highness."

         Phoenix, noting one key difference in address, followed suit. "The defense is prepared, Your Highness." This trial's going to be equal parts pleasing her and proving Trixie innocent, I can feel it.

         The alicorn glanced between the two benches, finally setting her gaze on the pegasus. "Mr... Wright, is it? My sister speaks highly of your prowess in the courtroom. Given the... delicate nature of this case, however, are you certain you're up for it?"

         Phoenix nodded. "Definitely, Your Highness. I intend to prove my client's innocence beyond reasonable doubt."

         Achmed smiled, pouring himself a cup of coffee. "We shall see whose proof is more definitive in the trial proper, Mr. Wright."

         "Indeed we shall," Luna said with a nod. "Though I admire your conviction, Mr. Wright, know that it will not affect my ultimate decision."

         "I understand, Your Highness," Phoenix replied.

         "Then let us proceed! Inquisitor Achmed, your opening statement, if you would?" Luna turned to the Saddle Arabian.

         Taking a swig of coffee, Achmed set his cup down. "I have only this to say: The outcome of this case, and by extension this trial, will ultimately affect the relations between Equestria and Saddle Arabia for possibly years to come. I shall not rest until the culprit of this foul act is brought to justice."

         "Well said, Inquisitor," Luna remarked. "Now then, you may proceed by calling your first witness."

         "First we shall hear from the local detective in charge of the investigation," Achmed stated, glancing at a paper. "The prosecution calls Detective... Gumhoof."

         "Here's hoping that detective can trip himself up in our favor," muttered Nyx.

         "If he's anything like a detective I know on Earth, he will," Phoenix promised.

*****


         A few moments later, Detective Gumhoof was on the stand, having offered a short bow to the Princess. Achmed spoke again. "Detective Gumhoof, please run us through the details of this case."

         "Yes sir!" Gumhoof snapped a salute, and began his testimony.

"The victim was found dead in the backyard of the home he'd appropriated for the Prince of Saddle Arabia. Cause of death: electrocution caused by magical lightning. Since the defendant was seen leaving the scene of the crime around the time of death, we arrested her the moment we got word. Hoofprints taken at the scene match the defendant's perfectly. A pretty open-and-shut case, all in all."


         "Hm... in my experience, few things are as they seem," Luna mused at the end of the detective's testimony. She turned to Phoenix. "You may begin your cross-examination, Mr. Wright."

         "Yes, Your Highness," the attorney replied. He opened his mouth to start, but paused on hearing a muffled squeak next to him. He glanced at Nyx, who was pointedly looking away from him. Shaking his head, he started the most crucial part of the trial.

"The victim was found dead in the backyard of the home he'd appropriated for the Prince of Saddle Arabia. Cause of death, electrocution caused by magical lightning. Since the defendant was seen leaving the scene of the crime around the time of death, we arrested her the moment we got word."


         HOLD IT!

         "Might I ask who reported the crime?" Phoenix asked.

         Before Gumhoof could answer, he was pre-empted by Achmed. "That would be the eyewitness. You'll get a chance to talk to them when you're through with the good detective."

         The pegasus nodded at the reply. "Alright, then. But, Detective, how do you know that Trixie could have committed the crime? It could be coincidence that she was in the area."

         "Easy, pal!" Gumhoof replied.

"Hoofprints taken at the scene match the defendant's perfectly."


         HOLD IT!

         "And how do you know when those hoofprints were left at the scene?" Phoenix asked, desperate for a lead.

         "The prints were rather fresh. They couldn't be more than a few hours old," Gumhoof replied.

         "How much time passed between the report of the murder and Ms. Lulamoon's arrest?" the attorney continued.

         "Hm... about... 30 minutes, tops," the detective said after thinking.

         Phoenix blinked. "Only 30 minutes? That's rather fast."

         "The witness described the defendant rather clearly, ya know," Gumhoof said. "It couldn't have been anypony else!"

         "But still, how do you know those prints were left there at the moment of the crime?" pressed Phoenix.

         OBJECTION!!

         "Mr. Wright, kindly refrain from badgering the witness," Achmed admonished. "This hardly seems relevant to the detective's testimony. Shouldn't you wait until the eyewitness testifies?"

         OBJECTION!!

         "The detective has stated that the reason my client was arrested was because her hoofprints were at the scene of the crime. I believe it's important that we know more," Phoenix riposted.

         Luna nodded at that. "The defense is in the right. The prosecution's objection is overruled." She looked at the witness stand. "Detective, are you certain those footprints were left behind during or after the murder?"

         Gumhoof opened and closed his mouth a few times, but then sighed, shaking his head. "I'm not certain, no. And neither is anypony else."

         "Then the hoofprints are circumstantial evidence," Phoenix declared. "Without knowing when they were left, they can't be used to conclude my client's guilt."

         Achmed sighed. "Very well then. In that case, the prosecution calls for the eyewitness to take the stand! Detective, you are dismissed."

         "Y-yes, sir," murmured Gumhoof, slightly shame-faced.

         "That was amazing, Mr. Wright," Nyx gushed. "Wow, you totally blew a hole in that detective's argument!"

         "Yeah, well, that was round one," Phoenix sighed. "Now we have to deal with the eyewitness. Let's hope their testimony isn't foolproof."

15412221222112121111.content:
Meanwhile, up in the gallery, Rarity watched Detective Gumhoof get dismissed from the stand. Once he was out of sight, she whispered to the seemingly empty seat beside her, "It's alright, darling, he's gone now."

After a few more seconds, Fluttershy peeked out over the railing to make sure the coast was clear before sitting up straight again. With a timid blush, she stammered, "Th-thanks, Rarity..."

"Of course, dear, but how do you know that stallion? He didn't do anything to you, did he...?" At the thought of anypony harassing or harming her dear friend, Rarity's voice took on a dangerous tone.

Hearing that tone, Fluttershy squeaked and quickly shook her head. "Oh, no! No, I've never seen him before, but, he, umm... well... you'd think it's silly..." She trailed off, tilting her head so as to hide behind her mane as she thought back to the recurring nightmare she occasionally had of a huge, scruffy monster in a green coat popping out of nowhere and bellowing at her. She still remembered the first time she had it, since it was the same night that Rainbow Dash had been arrested, but probably would have let it fall out of her mind completely anyway.

Perhaps she would have, that is, if a member of the same species as the 'monster' in her nightmare hadn't shown up the next day. Even though the one in real life had seemed nice, with Twilight accompanying Phoenix and everything, she'd been too terrified to speak, and made up a lame excuse about being frightened by his hair. It was only by hearing his name, giving her the idea to bypass her fear by pretending that he was an actual phoenix, that she had been able to carry on a conversation with the human.

Of course, now everypony thought that she naive enough to think that she literally thought he was an immortal firebird, but she didn't want to make her friends feel foolish by pointing out the mistake. Detective Gumhoof, on the other hand, despite being a pony, looked so much like the creature from her nightmares that she had reflexively hidden at the sight of him.

"Found it!" Pinkie suddenly popped up on the other side of Fluttershy, holding something in front of the pegasus's muzzle with her hoof.

Rarity quickly identified it and recoiled in her seat. "Ewww, lint? Pinkie, why do you even have that?"

"Well, I saw Fluttershy dive to the floor, so I thought, 'Oh, she must've dropped something!' And since all I found was this pocket lint, I knew this had to be it!"

Fluttershy blinked and glanced over her shoulder at her bare body. "Um... Pinkie... I'm not even wearing anything with pockets..."

"Yeah, you should, though. I mean, if you just tucked your lint away in your pockets, then you wouldn't drop it on the floor!"

Fluttershy and Rarity blinked at Pinkie before the the pegasus smiled and replied, "You're right, Pinkie, I should have thought of that before we left. Rarity, do you think you could make something for me after court adjourns for the day?"

Rarity's eye twitched, and she rubbed her forehead as she felt the beginnings of a headache coming on. "Why, of course, dear," she replied before muttering to herself. "No, Rarity, don't scowl... scowling at upside-down logic isn't lady-like, and besides, you'll get wrinkles..."

For the first time that day, Rarity was starting to wonder just how good an idea it was for the three of them to be spectating over the trial. Twilight and Spike were busy researching whatever magic could have summoned and transformed the attorney while Applejack had stayed with them in order to help however she could. Meanwhile, Rainbow Dash had been summoned as a potential witness, and was being kept sequestered from the rest of the trial so as not to contaminate her testimony.

Rarity's current role was, naturally, to observe the proceedings and keep an eye out for anything that seemed odd. Her eye for detail would hopefully help her pick up on any contradictions or small details that might get missed by the defense team. Even if she couldn't help with the investigation or work with the defense during the actual trial, she could offer insight during the hours when court was not in session.

Fluttershy and Pinkie, though, were helpful in less obvious ways. The pegasus had really wanted to be there to offer moral support, but it was hoped that her natural empathy would help them pick up on the prosecutor's intentions, since Phoenix had grown convinced that there was more to the Saddle Arabian Inquisitor than met the eye.

Pinkie was there for... well, officially she was there to kick off the celebration if... no, when they secured Trixie's freedom. Unofficially, she was there so that she wouldn't get in the way of the others while they researched strange and complex magical theory. Even more unofficially, though, she was there because they knew she had a knack for 'stumbling' upon important clues or facts through some strange combination of luck and intuition. If there was anything that Phoenix, Nyx, Rarity and Fluttershy couldn't detect, Pinkie would do it somehow.

Though the rest of the time, she found lint instead

Fortunately, the next witness to arrive took her mind off of such things. Unfortunately, it brought back her scowl. "Oh, no... why him?"

"What's the matter, Rarity? You've got the same twitchy eye as when the Cutie Mark Crusaders offered to cater one of your fashion shows!" Pinkie licked her lips as she thought back to that night. The event had almost been cancelled when they found out that Sweetie Belle had tried to impress Rarity by swapping out the official caterer's mini-sandwiches with her own, which violated several chemical weapons treaties. The candies Twist had made, however, more than compensated for it!

Rarity groaned, now presented with two unpleasant things to think about. "Ugh... well, do you remember the conversation Applejack and I had about 'sycophants?'" When both of her friends nodded, she pointed down at the stand. "Well, there is your alpha specimen..."

At the witness stand was a grey-coated unicorn stallion with his nose stuck so far up in the air that he would drown if caught out in the rain without an umbrella.

After taking a sip of coffee, Inquisitor Achmed addressed the unicorn. "Witness, please state your name and occupation for the court."

The witness snorted derisively. In a voice that absolutely dripped with disdain and condescension, he replied, "Oh, please. Everypony who's anypony already knows me, so I shouldn't have to waste time giving my name out to the... ugh... commoners in the peanut gallery."

Pinkie Pie gasped. "Omigosh, we can have peanuts up here? And nopony told me?!" Unfortunately, she said this loudly enough that it was heard throughout the courtroom, and it only seemed to fuel the snob's sense of smug superiority.

Princess Luna, however, deflated him like a balloon at a cactus convention with just three words. "And you are...?"

The witness blinked and tried several times to reply to the Princess of the Night, but stalled out each time, so Luna asked, "I am sorry, apparently I am not 'anypony' enough to have made your acquaintance. Will the witness please state his name and occupation for the court records?"

"A-actually, Your Highness, we have met on several occasions," the unicorn stammered, trying to coax some memory of their meeting out of the dark alicorn. Instead, all he got was a bored 'get on with it' look, causing him to hang his head as he sheepishly replied, "Jet Set, Your Highness. I am an investor and patron of the arts."

"Thank you, witness," Achmed replied, barely hiding a smirk at the rich unicorn's expense behind his coffee mug. "Now, you claim to have seen the defendant at the scene of the crime on the night of the murder. Please testify before the court exactly what you saw."

Nyx bristled at the somewhat tribalist jab Jet Set made, though Phoenix simply rubbed his chin in thought. "Interesting..."

Jet Set blinked at Phoenix in confusion while Achmed chuckled to himself and poured a fresh cup of coffee. "And what do you mean by that?"

"Yes," Achmed said with an amused tone. "Please enlighten the court as to what you find so interesting, Mr. Wright."

Phoenix thought to himself, He knows exactly what's wrong with that statement, I can tell. So why is he so calm?

Before he could speak, Nyx asked, "It's because he said that they looked straight at the residence, isn't it?"

"Exactly. Tell me, Jet Set, if you assumed that some pegasus was setting off lightning near you, wouldn't your first instinct be to look up? As I recall, storm clouds are designed to strike straight down with the first bolt, and never strike the same place twice after that. Wouldn't you want to take refuge underneath the cloud?"

Once again, the courtroom was filled with muttering until Luna silenced it with a stomp of her hoof. "A very astute observation, Mr. Wright. I, too, would like to hear the witness explain this."

Jet Set sputtered on the stand before admitting, "W-well, yes... we did look up to the sky first, but it only took a few moments to see that there were no clouds in the vicinity."

Phoenix slammed his hooves on the table, then pointed one at Jet Set. "Then why did you say that you looked straight at the residence?"

Lacking the ability to put his hands on his hips, Phoenix flared his wings in what he assumed was a confident manner. Phoenix shook his head. "That's impossible. Unless you have a spell to make your eyes move around outside your skull!" He hesitated for a moment before asking Nyx out of the corner of his mouth, "Unicorns can't do that, right...?"

"Let me finish. Hoofprints were found leaving through the back entrance. You claimed that your carriage broke down in front of the residence, so tell me, Jet Set... how did you manage to see my client leaving at that time if there was an entire house in the way?"

         OBJECTION!

Jet Set shrank under the stern gaze of his ruler as he replied, "W-well... I may not have... actually seen her step out of it, as such... but we did see her nearby."

Phoenix froze as the room suddenly exploded in noise and gossip, realizing that he may have overplayed his hand. He had expected to trip Jet Set up with the contradictions in his testimony and discredit him, rendering everything he said circumstantial. This, however, was not something that he had been expecting. Even the Princess couldn't contain the chaos in the room before taking a deep breath.

"ORDER!!!"

Many ponies were blown back in their seats by the sudden bone-rattling vocal explosion. As the ringing in everypony's ears died down, Achmed calmly took a sip of coffee and said, "Your Highness, I think that the witness should amend his testimony to include this new information."

"Agreed," Luna replied. "The witness will testify as to what he saw the night before the murder."

I thought this curious, so I pointed her out to my wife.


         HOLD IT!

         "What was so curious about it?" Phoenix asked, sincere in his question.

         Jet Set opened his mouth to give a sharp retort, but felt Princess Luna's eyes on him. As such, he changed his reasoning. "The defendent is a pony of lesser means. I thought it curious as to why she would be entering a home that was obviously made for somepony far more well-off than she is."

         Phoenix nodded. It makes sense, from an elitist's point of view, he thought. Out loud, he simply nodded and said, "Anything else?"

Of course, we didn't realize the significance of her presence there until we heard the news the next day.


         HOLD IT!

         Phoenix slammed his forehooves on the bench. "Let me get this straight. You didn't actually see the crime or the witness leave the scene. All you saw was her enter the victim's home the night before. Am I right so far?"

         Jet Set nodded. "Your point being?"

         "My point is this: There was a twelve-hour gap between when you saw her enter the defendent's home, and when the murder occured!" Phoenix declared. "Are you suggesting that she spent twelve hours with the victim before murdering him?"

         "It would be something she'd do," the unicorn replied coolly. "She's a stuck-up, egotistical, narcissistic peacock who's always out for more power. She probably wanted to steal that Saddle Arabian's magic."

         Phoenix paused. "Are you referring to his djinn?"

         "Yes, that's right!" Jet Set said with a nod. "That is what Saddle Arabians use to power their magic, correct, Inquisitor?"

         Achmed nodded. "Very true. And the djinn of the Court Wizard would be tempting for anypony desiring power." He took a sip of coffee.

         Phoenix did his best not to look curious. "Inquisitor, tell me. Has Hassim's djinn been recovered?"

         "It has," Achmed said with a nod, arching an eyebrow.

         "And where, pray tell, was it found?" Phoenix pressed.

         Achmed paused, then his eyes widened slightly. "It... it was in his home."

         Phoenix slammed his forehooves again. "Then answer me this: If Trixie's target truly was his djinn, why did she not take it after supposedly murdering him?!"

         The gallery erupted in chatter, silenced only by three sharp bangs of Princess Luna's hoof. "The defense has a valid point. It would seem theft of the Court Wizard's djinn was not the motive behind this crime."

         Phoenix pressed his initiative. "Your Highness, I'd like to call a character witness on Trixie's behalf. Somepony who can testify that my client is not, as the witness claims, a 'stuck-up, egotistical, narcissistic peacock', and furthermore, that my client had no motive to commit this crime."

         There was more chatter in the gallery, though Princess Luna had to bang her hoof only once to bring silence. "Though it is unusual for the defense to call a witness, I'll allow it. Jet Set, you are dismissed. Thank you for your time."

         The grey unicorn bowed, and left the stand, tail hanging slightly in defeat. Phoenix watched him depart only for a moment, before gathering his thoughts. "The defense calls Rainbow Dash to the stand."
1541222122211212111111.title: Turnabout Spell: Motive for Murder, Part 1

choices: Everypony meets up in the lobby to congratulate Trixie
Skip to the post-trial celebration, hosted by Pinkie
15412221222112121111111.content:
A few minutes later, Rainbow was on the stand, looking as confident as always. Princess Luna gave a small smile. "Though I hardly think it needs to be said, for propriety's sake, please state your name and occupation for the court."

         "The name's Rainbow Dash," the blue pegasus replied. "Weather manager for the town of Ponyville, and cadet at the Wonderbolts Academy."

         "Very good," Luna said with a nod. "Now, you have been summoned by the defense as a character witness for Trixie. The defense claims you can provide testimony proving that the defendant had no motive to commit this crime. Is this true?"

         "Yep," Rainbow replied instantly. "Want me to go ahead and testify?"

         "If you'd be so kind," Luna nodded.

         Don't let me down, Rainbow, Phoenix thought.

See, Trixie and I have been working together, lately. We're busy with preparations for a co-performance together. It's for the upcoming visit from the Saddle Arabian prince, right? Trixie was over the moon about this opportunity! There's no way she'd screw up her biggest chance in years by committing murder, least of all the court wizard of the guy she was planning to impress!


         Luna nodded at this. "I see. It would hardly make sense for Trixie to kill Hassim, in that case." She turned to Phoenix. "Mr. Wright, I'd normally ask you to begin your cross-examination; however seeing as this is your witness, may I assume you have no problems with this testimony?"

         Phoenix thought about what Rainbow had said, then nodded. "I have no problems, your Highness."

         "Well, I do!" Achmed said, eyes narrow. "I have a question for the witness."

         "What's up?" Rainbow asked, quirking an eyebrow.

         "Is it not true that, several years ago, you were the defendant in a murder trial?" Achmed asked, taking a small sip of coffee.

         "Yeah, and I was acquitted. So what's your point?" Rainbow said, reclining in midair on the stand. Phoenix had a brief moment of envy before remembering that, as a pegasus, he might be able to do that as well.

         "Who was the prosecutor in that case?" Achmed pressed.

         OBJECTION!!

         "Inquisitor, how does a years-old trial have any bearing on the current case?" Phoenix interrupted.

         "The defense has a point, Inquisitor," Princess Luna agreed. "I fail to see the significance."

         "Nah, it's alright, I'll answer," Rainbow broke in, waving a hoof in dismissal. "The prosecutor was Trixie, the current defendant."

         "Truly? How curious," Achmed said with a tilt of his head. "And the sentence that would have been given, had you been convicted?"

         Rainbow shrugged. "Banishment to the moon, or the sun."

         "I see," the Saddle Arabian nodded. He took a swig of coffee. "Then, why speak up on her behalf? It seems like you have little reason to protect the defendant."

         Before Phoenix could object, Rainbow flipped back onto her hooves, and delivered a steely glare to Achmed. "If you think so little of me, then you know nothing about me. Or about Trixie, for that matter. Yes, it's true that there's little love lost between us, and after that trial, I'd have been more than happy to drop her in the Everfree Forest and let the wild animals there get her. BUT! I also know that she's innocent in this case. And I'm not the type to let an innocent pony get convicted for a crime she didn't commit."

         Achmed arched an eyebrow at that. "You're a very noble mare, then. Still, though, character witnesses aren't definitive proof of innocence, I'm afraid." He took a swig of coffee.

         Rainbow smirked. "Oh, you wanted definitive proof? How's this? From 8:00am to the time of her arrest on the day of the murder, I was with Trixie in her wagon working on plans for the performance."

         Achmed did a spit-take at that. "WHAT?!"

         The gallery erupted into excited clamors at this. Not even Princess Luna's hoof could restore order. She sighed, before taking a deep breath. Seeing this, Phoenix, Nyx, Rainbow, and a few other wise ponies covered their ears.

         "ORDER!"

         The Royal Canterlot Voice silenced the courtroom in an instant. Luna took a smaller breath. "Now then, Rainbow Dash. Are you certain of the timing?"

         After making sure her ears still worked, Rainbow nodded. "Trixie has this really fancy clock in her wagon. Says it's from one of the best clock-makers in Canterlot. It's magically wound to keep perfect time, apparently. I arrived at her wagon at 8 sharp, and neither of us left until she was arrested."

         "I see," the princess nodded. "And given that the murder happened around 10:15am, and the defendant was arrested around noon, if she was at her wagon the whole time, then there is no possible way that she could have committed this crime.

         OBJECTION!!

         Achmed looked less composed than he had all day. "But the previous witness, Jet Set, said that he saw the defendant nearby at the time of the murder!"

         OBJECTION!!

         "The previous witness has proved to be unreliable!" Phoenix retorted. "We can't take what he says as the truth. On the other hoof, Rainbow Dash has no reason to lie to protect my client!"

         Luna nodded again. "The defense has a point. We cannot take Jet Set's testimony as fact, whereas Rainbow Dash, who has good reason to lie to convict the defendant, is instead testifying on her behalf." She banged her hoof on the podium. "I believe prolonging this particular trial any further is unnecessary. The defense has proven that the defendant's hoofprints are merely circumstantial evidence, that the 'eyewitness' is unreliable, and that the defendant has no motive to commit this crime, and no opportunity, either. Given all of this, this court finds the defendant, Trixie Lulamoon..."

NOT GUILTY

         Confetti erupted in the courtroom around Trixie, who had tears of joy streaming down her face. Princess Luna smiled. "That is all. This court is adjourned!" She slammed her hoof down one last time.
15412221222112121111111.title: Turnabout Spell: Motive for Murder, Part 2

choices: The others show up, along with a Familiar face
Achmed shows up to congradulate Phoenix on his performance in court.
154122212221121211111111.content:
When Phoenix, Nyx, Trixie, and Rainbow Dash all stepped out into the lobby, Trixie finally dropped what little bit of her composure still remained. With a high pitched "Squee!" she launched herself at Phoenix hugging him. "Thank you! Thank you so much!"

"It was nothing, I was just doing my-OW!" The defense attorney cried as Trixie suddenly stepped back and punched him in the shoulder. "What was that for?!"

"That is a small taste of what will happen if you ever tell anypony what Trixie just did! Trixie is a show mare of the highest caliber, and has a reputation to maintain and lot's of adoring fans to please, so don't go bragging to them about how she hugged you."

Pheonix was about to respond, when someone bumped into him from behind, knocking him into Trixie, causing both of them to fall to the floor.

"Whoops. Sorry, I didn't see you there." Said an unfamiliar male voice. Trixie and Phoenix got back to their hooves, and the defense attorney turned to look at who had bumped into him. The sight he found awaiting him was an odd one.

He was a Griffon, smaller than Gilda had been, and wearing a black hoodie with holes for His wings, which were black like a ravens. His hood was up, but Phoenix could see his face quite clearly despite the shadow it cast over it. The feathers over his eyes were black and made shapes like an 'X' which contrasted greatly with the white feathers that covered the rest of his head. The most interesting thing about his appearance, however, was that Phoenix could clearly tell from his eyes that he was blind.

"Guess I should watch where I'm going next time, huh?"

"Yes you should! In your lack of attention you knocked over the Great and Powerful Trixie and her Competent and Tacky defense attorney, Phoenix!" Trixie growled, far to busy dusting off her cape to look at who had bumped into them.

"My bad, I...Wait. Did you say Trixie? As in the pony accused of murdering Hassim?"

"Not anymore." Rainbow Dash announced proudly. "Nix here just helped prove her innocent!"

"Well that's good." the Griffon replied. "I mean, it's bad that the killer is still on the loose, or that there was little to no evidence found that pointed to them, but it's good that an innocent mare wasn't punished for their crime."

Nyx noticed the cane the blind Griffon had dropped when he had bumped into Phoenix, and picked it up with her magic. There appeared to be a small emblem in the shape of a coat of arms on the handle, but she didn't recognize it as the logo to any company she knew of. Carefully she passed it back into his hand. "Here, you dropped this."

"Why thank you miss. My name is Jacob by the way. It's a pleasure to meet you all, but I'm afraid I have somewhere else to be at the moment, so I guess I'll see you later." And with that the Griffon worked his way around the group and left.

What a strange Griffon... Phoenix thought to himself, ...but he has a point. The real killer is still out there, and unless he's brought to justice, this international incident is only going to get worse.

"So...Trixie supposes this is the part where the Pink pony pops out and throws a party to celebrate the Innocent and Free Trixie's Innocence?"
154122212221121211111111.title: Trixie's free, but this is only the beginning...

choices: The group meets up with Twilight, AJ, and Maya
Skip to the post-trial celebration, hosted by Pinkie
1541222122211212111111111.content:
((Note: this is sort of an amalgam of the two choices))

         "Wow! You're so smart, Trixie!" Pinkie Pie exclaimed from directly behind the showmare, causing Trixie to yelp and leap a good foot into the air. "I wonder why everypony seems to think I'll throw a party for them whenever something good happens?" The party pony put a hoof to her chin in seeming bewilderment.

         Nyx and Phoenix chuckled. "Well, I'm looking forward to it, Pinkie," Phoenix said. "So, you were actually watching my trial this time?"

         "But of course, darling," Rarity's voice floated in, preceding the alabaster mare into the lobby. "Twilight wanted us to split up, between assisting her with researching a means of turning you back, and attending the trial. Applejack is the only one who chose to help her out." Fluttershy, having followed her friend in, nodded.

         Nyx smiled. "Well, I'm sure Mom will have a solution soon enough," she said with confidence. "On another note, that trial was amazing, and ended definitively in our favor."

         Trixie nodded, coming down from her Pinkie-induced heart attack. "Indeed. Trixie has to wonder, Phoenix Wright; were you simply toying with the Great and Powerful Trixie when we met in the courtroom?"

         "Hardly," Phoenix replied with a wince. "I was definitely not at my best when I first came to Equestria. I'd had less than a day to go over the case, I didn't know anything about how Equestria worked, you had literally almost all the cards..."

         "In short, a typical trial for you, Wright," came a cultured, Trottingham-accented voice. The voice's owner, an earth pony wearing a purple overcoat and a ruffly white crevat, trotted into the lobby, giving Phoenix a sardonic look.

         Phoenix was flabbergasted. "E-EDGEWORTH?!" he exclaimed. "Wha - how - why are YOU here?!"

         "Looking for you, Wright," Edgeworth replied. "You gave everyone a shock when you seemed vanished after the party. Maya called myself and Franziska when she realized you hadn't come in to the office the next morning."

         "Wait, is Von Karma here, too?" Phoenix asked, slightly nervous.

         Edgeworth nodded. "She should be here, soon. She said she wanted to talk to the prosecution..."

         The sound of a throat being cleared caught the two stallions' attention, and they looked at Rarity. "Mr. Wright, I assume you are... acquainted with this gentlecolt?"

         Phoenix nodded. "Yes, I am. This is - "

         "Miles Edgeworth, a high prosecutor for the city both Wright and myself live in," Edgeworth said, bowing to Rarity and the others. "I'm also a childhood friend of Wright's."

         "A high prosecutor?" Trixie asked, eyes gleaming slightly. "Trixie is intrigued. You must have many tales of squashing hapless fools trying to get the wicked back onto the streets."

         Edgeworth inclined his head towards her. "For a time, I was like that. I sought victory at any cost, stooping to dirty tricks to secure a 'Guilty' verdict. And my record was untarnished... until I encountered Wright. After losing to him twice, I ended up being defended by him against charges of murder." He smiled wryly. "I changed my viewpoint after that, deciding that bringing the truth to light is more important than getting a 'Guilty' verdict."

         Phoenix nodded. "I'll say this much, Trixie. If you took up prosecuting on Earth, I'd cry for most defense attorneys who had to face you. But understand that the truth is more important than 'winning'."

         Trixie looked contemplative at that. Before anything else could be said, however, Achmed entered the lobby, along with a unicorn mare. Phoenix's eyes zeroed in on the whip hanging by the mare's side, and he knew who she was immediately. Before he could comment, Achmed spoke up. "Well done, Mr. Wright. I confess that your convictions were stronger than mine this time. But the case is not yet solved. Are you staying in Canterlot long?"

         Phoenix nodded. "At least until the actual culprit is caught."

         Achmed returned the nod. "I hope that, when the actual killer is caught, you won't be defending them. Given your performance today, I'd hate to have to face you again."

         "I, for one, pity the foolish fool who so foolishly decided to kill an ambassador," the unicorn mare declared. "'Twas a foolishly foolish fool's decision to cause such an incident."

         Phoenix sighed slightly. "And hello to you, too, Von Karma."

         Franziska von Karma snorted a little. "Are you still so nervous around me, Phoenix Wright?"

         "Considering that during our first trial against each other, you whipped me into unconsciousness, I believe I deserve to be," Phoenix deadpanned.

         The native ponies all gasped. "She did what?" growled Nyx, contemplating all sorts of unpleasant things to do to the mare.

         Seeing this, Phoenix put a hoof on Nyx's shoulder (he had to rear up slightly to do this). "Calm down, Nyx. It was a while ago, and there wasn't any lasting harm."

         Nyx frowned, but calmed down. She had done the job, however, as Franziska looked intimidated by the larger mare.

         Achmed coughed. "If you'll excuse me, I must return to the investigation. We still need to track down the true killer." He bowed, and left.
1541222122211212111111111.title: Turnabout Spell: Unexpected Reunion

choices: "Your right Phoenix...I'm sorry, I wasn't thinking straight."
"No! I Won't let them take my daughter from me! Not again!"
15412221222112121111111112.content:
Phoenix was having a blast at Pinkie's "Yay-Trixie-is-Innocent-so-let's-have-a-party" Party, as were all his friends, both native ponies and transformed humans. Despite the fact that there was still a killer on the loose, he found himself thinking that there was absolutely nothing that could ruin this party.

He really shouldn't have tempted the fates like that.

There was a loud knocking on the front door, which Nyx answered. Somepony stopped the music to switch the record out for a new one just in time for everypony to be able to hear a Royal guard say...

"Nyx Sparkle, You are under arrest for the murder of Court Wizard Hassim of Saddle Arabia."

"WHAT?!" In an instant Twilight was at the door, standing between her daughter and the guards. "That can't be right! There has to be some kind of mistake!"

"No mistake ma'am." One guard said.

"The warrant was given to us by Celestia herself." The other added, showing said warrant to Twilight.

"No way! Princess Celestia wouldn't have! She knows Nyx would never do anything like that!"

"The Princess told the Prosecution as much when he asked for the warrant. His exact response was, and I quote 'If she truly is as incapable of committing this crime as you claim, then Mr. Wright will have no trouble proving it in a court of law.'" His expression then turned sympathetic. "If it's any consolation, Ma'am, I don't believe she did it either. I'm just following orders here. I'll give you a few minuets to say goodbye, but that's the most I can do for you."

By now, Phoenix was also at the front door. "If you don't mind officer, I'd like to use those five minuets to ask you a few questions about why your arresting Nyx."

"Nopony is arresting my daughter! She's done nothing wrong and you have no right to do this!" Twilight declared, her horn flaring to life, ready to defend her child at all costs. Rainbow and Applejack got ready to leap into action behind her, just in case their friend ended up needing their help to fight off the guards. The guards, seeing that there might be trouble, prepared to fight back.

Phoenix stepped in between the guards and Twilight, hoping to try and stop the disaster that was about to happen. "Twilight, listen to me! If you try to stop them from taking her it'll only make her look more guilty! Please, just say your goodbyes and let me defend her in court!"
15412221222112121111111112.title: Turnabout Spell: Alicorn Arrested

choices: Twilight panics, teleporting herself and Nyx away.
Nyx succeeds in calming Twilight down, and they say goodbye before she is taken.
154122212221121211111111122.content:
As Phoenix pleaded with Twilight to step back and let the Guard do their jobs, he tried to look her in the eye. She wasn't looking back at him, though. She wasn't even looking at the two Guards. Instead, her eyes seemed glazed over as she looked back through time itself to one of the worst moments of her life.

She was being taken away. Nyx was being taken away by Twilight's beloved mentor. She was being taken away because Celestia was afraid of what she could become, and Twilight had let her do it. She had allowed Celestia to convince her that it was for the best if the little alicorn filly that Twilight had grown to love as her own daughter got taken to Canterlot for testing. She had found herself unable to argue with her teacher and ruler when Celestia said that she had to separate them.

It hadn't been until after Celestia's chariot had taken flight that Twilight had found the resolve to hurry after them. To defy the logical arguments that had been made to her and beg Celestia to stop and let her stay with her daughter. By then, it was too late. Twilight had chased after the chariot, screaming and sobbing at the top of her lungs, but her cries had gone unheard as she was left alone with the knowledge that she had failed Nyx.

She had betrayed Nyx. Her daughter had been carried away against her will, and Twilight had known that there was a chance that they would never see each other again. Nyx had been taken away to be judged, not for anything she had done, but for what she might become. And if it had turned out to be the last moment that they ever spent together, Nyx's final memories would have been of the mare she loved and trusted more than anypony in the entire world simply standing by and allowing her to be dragged off to her doom.

"No... you can't do this," Twilight whispered, her voice dry and raspy as she began to hyperventilate. Her voice gradually grew louder and higher, building to a pained shriek. "Celestia can't have her! You won't take her away again! I WON'T LET YOU!"

Phoenix yelped and recoiled from the unicorn when she suddenly seemed to explode, her eyes burning red with fury and her mane and tail bursting into flames! The two Guards reflexively braced themselves in a defensive posture in the face of the most powerful unicorn alive tapping into a well of righteous anger and blind panic that only a mother protecting her child could draw from.

Phoenix and Twilight's friends shouted to her, afraid of what she might do in such a fragile emotional state. All of their cries fell on deaf ears, though, as all Twilight could see were the armored thugs sent to take her child away again, under orders of the crown. They wanted her to stand aside. They wanted her to blindly obey and betray Nyx again.

Never again.

Never again!

If they wanted to take Nyx, then Twilight would fight Celestia herself to her last dying breath! Without a care for her own safety, Twilight began charging a level of mana into her horn that was dangerous even for one of her strength and talent. The unicorn Guards, sensing the danger, quickly threw up barrier spells. Given the strength of the spell that Twilight was charging up, however, the result would be much like trying to use cocktail umbrellas to shield themselves from a flamethrower.

Just as Twilight began to channel the magic she had gathered into a wave of raw destructive force, however, a different sort of shield threw itself between herself and the Guards as Nyx jumped in to protect them.

Seeing her daughter leap into the path of her spell, Twilight immediately cut it off, while the tiny bit of magic she had already managed to cast lanced forward before getting absorbed by Nyx's own magic barrier. The young alicorn's shield cracked so badly that it nearly shattered from the strain, but barely held.

"G-get out of the way, Nyx," Twilight stammered, grinding her teeth together. She was burning through mana at such an accelerated rate, even without actually casting a spell, that she knew she would only have a short time to act if she wanted to protect her daughter. "I can't let you go! Not again!"

Nyx stood fast, though, and shook her head. "No, mom, you have to stop! I know you want to protect me, but you don't really want to hurt these ponies! If you did, then you'd never forgive yourself!"

Twilight wavered, her flaming mane and tail flickering before extinguishing themselves, leaving the unicorn looking slightly charred, and very frail. As burning red eyes faded back to their usual soft lavender, she weakly protested, "I'll... I'll never forgive myself if anything happens to you, either..."

Nyx leaned forward to nuzzle her mother. Her own voice tremored with worry, but she struggled to keep it under control as she replied, "It's okay... it's okay, mom, it's not like back then. I'm not a scared little filly anymore... I know this is all a big misunderstanding, so I believe in you and Phoenix and everypony to be able to prove it. You'll figure it out... I just know you will."
154122212221121211111111122.title: Not again!

choices: Twilight caves in, and explains Nyx's story.
A small voice interrupts. It's Nyx as a foal? What?
1541222122211212111111111222.content:
Try as she might, Twilight couldn't bring herself to panic. She was too burnt-out from her rage shift, and even were that not the case, Nyx's nuzzling soothed her fears. She reached up to embrace her daughter, an embrace which was eagerly returned. "Just... promise me you'll be safe," she choked out.

         "I will, mom," Nyx assured her. She squeezed a little harder, then let go of her mother. She turned back to the guards, sighing. "I'm ready to go, now."

         One of the guards put a magic restraint collar on the alicorn's neck, while the other bound her wings. They then led her away from the former celebration, although nopony felt like partying anymore.

         "Sorry to kill the mood, everypony," came a familiar voice. Detective Gumhoof stepped forward out of the shadows of the evening road. "But, well, a warrant is a warrant."

         Phoenix looked at the detective. "Mind telling us why, exactly, Nyx was arrested?"

         Gumhoof sighed. "Well, remember how I mentioned yesterday that it looked like Hassim had been struck from multiple angles at once? Nyx has shown in the past that she's able to duplicate herself, and that she's able to summon lightning strong enough to chase away gigantic monsters from the Everfree Forest. Not only that, but, well... when the Saddle Arabian prince heard that she was in town, he immediately told Achmed to have her arrested."

         "So the warrant didn't come from Celestia?" asked Twilight, now looking angry.

         Gumhoof shook his head. "Afraid it did. Achmed knows Nyx's history, so he wasn't about to step on anypony's toes, and risk igniting this international incident into something worse. So, he went to Princess Celestia, told her what the prince had ordered him to do, and she signed the warrant. Mind you, from what I saw of her face, she wasn't happy in the slightest. But, I think she's catering to the prince's demands, just to placate him for the time being."

         Twilight growled in frustration. "Argh... let me guess, the prince is convinced that Nyx is still Nightmare Moon, isn't he?"

         Gumhoof shrugged. "Dunno. I wasn't there when Achmed received the order, I was just there when Celestia signed the warrant." He sighed. "Well, afraid that's all I've got for you, everypony." He looked at Phoenix. "Good luck proving her not guilty. You're going to need it." With that, the detective left, leaving everypony more depressed than before. Even Pinkie Pie's mane had deflated slightly.

         Phoenix, however, was running through everything he knew of the crime so far. Something seemed off, to him. "Twilight, what time did Nyx bring me back to the library yesterday? After she found me at the castle?"

         Twilight blinked. "Um, it was about 10:30 AM, or so. Why?"

         Phoenix smirked. "Well, in that case, Nyx has a rock-solid alibi. The murder took place at 10:25 AM, which means that there's no way she could have committed this crime."

         That thought seemed to cheer everypony up. "That's right, everypony!" Pinkie said, her mane inflating again. "Feenie will just prove that in court tomorrow, and Nyx'll be free, just like that!"

         "Do you honestly think it'll be that easy?"

         Everypony turned to look at Trixie, who had a sour expression on her face. "Whatever do you mean, Trixie?" asked Rarity.

         "Yeah, what gives?" Rainbow added with a cocked eyebrow.

         Trixie sighed. "Must Trixie spell it out to everypony? Gumhoof just said that Nyx has demonstrated, in the past, the ability to duplicate herself. Therefore, if you bring up her 'alibi' in court, Achmed will just say that she sent a couple of duplicates to do the job."

         Edgeworth, having been silent up until now, nodded. "I'm afraid Miss Trixie is correct, Wright. You can't rely on a mere alibi for somepony who can make more of themselves." He smirked slightly. "Of course, your trusting nature is why you'd never make it as a prosecutor."

         Phoenix rolled his eyes at that. "True enough, I guess." He then turned to look at Twilight. "On another note, it's time for you and everypony else to stop tip-hoofing around the alicorn in the room."

         Twilight gulped a little, shifting her eyes from side to side. "I, uh, don't know what you're talking about, Phoenix..."

         Phoenix actually growled a little, startling the unicorn. "Twilight. From the moment I came back to Equestria, one question has been on my mind: 'Where did Nyx come from?' It's obvious she isn't your daughter by blood, she admitted to me that she was adopted. Moreover, both you and her have implied that her story isn't exactly a nice one, at least not entirely. And, twice now, ponies have referred to her as 'Nightmare Moon'. From what I recall of Equestrian history the last time I was here, Nightmare Moon sounds like a corrupted version of Princess Luna, so why would Nyx be addressed as her?" He stalked forward, until he was nose-to-nose with Twilight. "I need answers, Twilight, and I need them now, if I plan to defend your daughter."

Twilight glanced around nervously, as if looking for some way to escape, before lowering her head.

"Okay, Phoenix...your right. Your absolutely right. If your going to defend her, you need to know Nyx's story." She said. "It all started when I was kidnapped by the members of a cult..."

**

154122212221121211111111122212.content:
"That would be me!" said the younger purple unicorn in the room. Everypony looked at Maya Fey, as she grinned. "I help Nick out all the time back on Earth, and this shouldn't be any different!"

         Phoenix smiled. With this bit of familiarity, he knew everything would turn out fine. "Glad to have you back, Maya," he replied sincerely.

         "Okay, so we got that settled," Rainbow sighed, running a hoof down her face. "But, what do we do now?"

         Phoenix frowned. "Well... Twilight, how does Nyx's duplication technique work?"

         Before Twilight could answer, a small voice interrupted her. "Um... I can answer that."

         Everypony's jaw dropped as a small black alicorn filly stepped out of the shadows. She had very distinct cat-like eyes, a purple mane and tail, and a very familiar shield cutie mark. Twilight was the first to snap out of her stupor. "NYX!" In a flash the unicorn was across the room, embracing the filly.

         Edgeworth coughed slightly. "Well, I'd say this is a rather practical, if slightly illegal, demonstration of her duplication," he said awkwardly.

         "Quite," agreed Franziska, "but I can't find it in me to break up this admittedly touching scene."

         "I'm shocked," Phoenix commented. "You, the prosecutor with ice water for blood, can't break up a touching scene?"

         "Hush," the bright-maned unicorn snapped, reaching for her whip.

         After a moment, Twilight pulled away from the filly. "Nyx, how are you here? We saw them lead you away."

         "And why are you a filly again?" asked Rainbow, scratching her head.

         The filly coughed. "Well, like Mr. Edgeworth just said, I duplicated myself. I left most of my magic with my copy, so I'd be a filly in appearance again, which made it easier to hide in the shadows."

         "Wait..." Applejack blinked at this. "Yer sayin' that the one they took off ta jail was the fake?"

         "Uh-huh," Nyx replied. "I know it's kinda illegal, but I didn't want Mom to go nuts again."

         Twilight shook her head. "I'm sorry, Nyx. I just..."

         "You're acting like a mother should," Maya said knowingly. "I don't think anyone - or anypony - could hold that against you."

         Nyx nodded, then turned to face Phoenix. "Um, you wanted to know how my duplication trick works, right?"

         Phoenix nodded. "I can take a guess. You're using a spell that creates a copy of yourself, right?"

         Nyx shook her head. "Not quite. While magic is involved, to make a copy purely from magic is nigh impossible. What I do is more like mitosis."

         Phoenix blinked. "You mean you split yourself into two or more ponies?"

         "Essentially, and it does take some magic to do it, but once it's done, my duplicates are self-sustaining, until they merge back with me." Nyx sighed a little. "I had to put most of my magic into my copy this time, or else it would have been a lot smaller than it should be. This way, nopony should suspect anything."

         "So, do ponies mature physically based on how much magic they have?" Franziska asked with a raised eyebrow.

         Rarity shook her head. "Only alicorns do that, dear. If that were the case for all ponies, we'd all be less than half the size of Twilight over there."

         "Oh, hush, I'm not that - " Twilight began, before she was interrupted.

         "Twilight Sparkle, enough with the self-deprecation!" All eyes turned to Trixie, who stomped up to the lavender unicorn. "You are one of the most powerful unicorns1 alive. You levitated an Ursa Minor all the way back to its home in the Everfree Forest, while simultaneously using a water tower as a milk bottle for it. What's more, in addition to your raw magic power, you're also scarily intelligent. You deceived me - me - by using cheap tricks and sleight-of-hoof while I was under the influence of the Alicorn Amulet. I would remind you that, prior to getting that amulet, I was second to none in trickery and sleight-of-hoof. So, for the love of Celestia, quit acting like you're nothing special, because you are special!"

         Everypony was staring in shock at the azure unicorn, who was panting after her brief rant. Then, Twilight smiled. "Thanks, Trixie. I guess I just never thought about things that way."

         Edgeworth coughed. "Ahem. At any rate, Wright, perhaps you should do some investigating into the reasons why miss Nyx was accused?"

Footnotes
1  This universe hasn't had Magical Mystery Cure... yet
