15412221222112121111111112221211.content:
Phoenix was deep in thought. Finally, he spoke. "There have been two good points made so far. One, we need to find out why Nyx was arrested. Two, we need to find evidence that points away from her to the true killer. As good as I am, either one of those tasks would take all day for me alone, and we'd be at a disadvantage tomorrow."

         "Have you forgotten, Mr. Wright? 'Evidence is everything in court'," Trixie recited.

         "True as that is, Ms. Lulamoon, Wright needs a proper understanding of the reasons behind Ms. Nyx's arrest," Edgeworth countered. "Otherwise, he'll likely be in for a nasty surprise in tomorrow's trial."

         As Trixie digested that tidbit, Phoenix nodded. "Edgeworth has a point. I've always been better at talking to people than investigating, so that'll be my main focus."

         Edgeworth nodded. "I can't argue with you there - "

         "And I'd like the two of you to investigate the crime scene while I'm busy poking around," Phoenix added smoothly, causing both Trixie and Edgeworth's jaws to drop slightly.

         Edgeworth was the first to recover. "Ahem. Wright, why should I get involved in one of your messes? Unlike you, I have no real incentive to aid these ponies."

         "So helping to find the true killer of a high-level figure, and solving an international incident doesn't qualify as 'incentive'?" Phoenix asked with an arched eyebrow. "Besides which, there's no one else I'd trust more with this investigation. I remember reading about Ambassador Alba's arrest, and how you were the one that did that, in his own embassy."

         Edgeworth flushed slightly at the praise. "Well... yes, I was rather involved in that," he admitted.

         Trixie appraised the earth pony prosecutor. "Trixie admits intrigue as to how you managed such a feat," she said, then turned to Phoenix, "but Trixie is also curious why you would ask her to aid in your investigation."

         Phoenix had his answer. "Good as Edgeworth is, he's still new to being a pony. He's not as familiar with everything as a native would be. And considering how well you did in our trial against each other, I have to believe you have talent in investigation yourself."

         Trixie nodded, glowing slightly as she soaked up the minor compliment. "You have a point. Very well, Trixie will add her talents to the investigation of the crime scene." She turned to Edgeworth. "Between the two of us, that evidence is as good as found."

         Edgeworth couldn't help but chuckle darkly. "Ms. Lulamoon, have you ever heard the expression 'the best laid plans of mice and men go oft awry'?"

         Trixie winced. "Trixie sees your point. Shall we be off, then?"

         Before anypony could respond, there was a knock at the door, preceding the entrance of Princess Luna. All the native ponies bowed immediately, with the transformed humans following suit moments later. "Please, everypony, rise," the princess said. She looked at Phoenix. "I would first like to congratulate you on your brilliant defense today, Mr. Wright. I am admittedly new to the court system of this age, but I believe I'd call today a resounding victory in your favor."

         Phoenix coughed as he rose out of his bow. "Um, th-thanks, your Highness. But, given the current situation with Nyx, calling it a 'victory' seems a bit hollow."

         Luna nodded. "Yes... regarding that, it presents my sister and I with a new dilemma."

         "What do you mean, Princess?" Twilight asked, the filly form of Nyx still in her embrace.

         Luna eyed the black filly for a moment, before answering Twilight's question. "When I got word of Nyx's arrest and impending trial, I asked Celestia to be the judge in my stead, as I don't believe I can make an unbiased ruling where Nyx is concerned. But, my sister refused, saying that she can't act impartial so long as you are representing the defense, Mr. Wright."

         This caught Phoenix off-guard. "What do you mean, 'she can't act impartial'? Why am I so special?"

         Luna shook her head. "I do not know. She wouldn't elaborate. All I know is that, with neither her nor I willing to be the judge for this case, we are in need of a new judge."

         Twilight frowned. "But, when we talked to Celestia yesterday, she said it was important that one of you two represent Equestria's interests in helping Saddle Arabia catch Hassim's killer and bring them to justice."

         "True enough, but an impartial judge is more important than such political matters," Luna replied. "So, unless Mr. Wright is willing to give the case to another lawyer, we're rather deadlocked."

         Phoenix was the one to frown this time. "Last time I was here in Equestria, Twilight mentioned that no other lawyer would so much as touch Rainbow Dash's case. I can't expect anypony would be eager to defend Nyx against a similar charge, especially given the nature of the case, as well as... her own history."

         "True enough," Luna conceded.

         Trixie was the next pony to speak up. "What of Princess Cadenza? Could she be the judge in your place?"

         Luna shook her head. "Regrettably, the Crystal Empire is a seperate state from Equestria, and Princess Cadenza has already informed us that she has no wish to become embroiled in these matters."

         "So, none of the three Princesses can be the Judge," groaned Rainbow. "That's just great. Who can we call?"

         There was a moment of silence, before Franziska spoke up. "A rather foolishly foolish question, in my opinion. We simply must get an impartial judge, correct?"

         "And where do you plan to find one, missy?" asked Applejack, arching an eyebrow at the whip-holding unicorn.

         Franziska smirked. "Why, on Earth, of course! Wasn't it a human judge who presided over the trial of Rainbow Dash over there?"

         Twilight gasped. "Of course! The Judge would be more than willing to assist in this case... I hope. Just give me some time and I can summon him."

         Rarity, however, pushed the lavender unicorn down. "I think not, darling. You're still exhausted from your rage-shift earlier, you're in no condition to do any sort of summoning."

         Franziska nodded. "In that case, I'll head back to the portal in the castle near Ponyville." She looked at Phoenix. "It is the same judge, is it not, Phoenix Wright? The one who presided over the cases where we matched wits?"

         Phoenix nodded. "Yep, it's the same one." He rubbed his forehooves together. "Okay, so we've got our plan. Maya and I will try to learn the reasoning behind Nyx's arrest, Edgeworth and Trixie will investigate the crime scene, and von Karma will go back to Earth and fetch the Judge. Any questions?" Everypony shook their head. "Alright, then. Let's get started."

15412221222112121111111112221212.content:
Phoenix considered his options. At first, he mulled over the idea of asking Edgeworth and Trixie to search the Saddle Arabian residence for clues while he tried to find out the reasoning behind the accusation of Nyx. Between Trixie's knowledge of Equestria's workings and Edgeworth's keen investigative mind, on the surface it seemed like a no-brainer to place his trust in the two prosecutors.

The reason why he thought twice about it, though, was because his magatama allowed him to see beneath the surface. Thanks to his conversation with Trixie before the trial, he knew without a doubt that she wasn't involved with the murder, but the appearance of Psyche-Locks in that same conversation indicated that she had some sort of dealings with the victim that she didn't want to reveal.

"You're right, Trixie, we really do need to investigate the residence," Phoenix said before regarding Edgeworth and Trixie. "So if you can, I'd like you two to try to find out what you can about why the prince of Saddle Arabia was so quick to accuse Nyx instead while Maya and I look at the crime scene."

Edgeworth arched an eyebrow at his now-winged friend and asked, "Are you sure you'll know what to look for, Wright?"

Phoenix did his best to look offended. It wasn't that hard. "Hey, you aren't the only one who's done his share of investigating crime scenes. Besides, I know how things work in Equestria a bit better than you do, thanks to my last visit here. Plus that crash-course on Saddle Arabia that Twilight gave me on the train ride over. You and Trixie know how prosecutors think, so you'd get more insight from meeting with Achmed than I would."

Edgeworth took this in stride and nodded curtly while Trixie asked, "Perhaps I should accompany Mr. Wright instead. I have been to the residence on occasion in preparation for the show I was to perform. I'm sure that I would be more helpful in that regard than another non-native."

As Trixie shot a meaningful look at Maya, the young human-turned-unicorn puffed her cheeks out in irritation as she protested, "Hey! I'm plenty helpful! And not just with my spirit medium abilities!"

For some reason, Trixie rolled her eyes the instant the words 'spirit medium' came out of Maya's mouth. I guess they don't have those around here, Phoenix thought. Huh, I wonder if she can even channel spirits here? The magatama works the same, so she should be able to. I'll have to keep that in mind. More importantly, however, was Trixie's behavior.

Though she kept it low-key, the showmare's offer and exclusive use of first-person pronouns only helped reinforce Phoenix's decision. He had no evidence on hand (or hoof) that he could use to confront her about her meetings with Hassim, but Phoenix had a niggling feeling that as much as she wanted to bring the real killer to justice, allowing Trixie on the scene might result in an important piece of evidence going missing, if only to protect her own secrets.

"Don't worry, Trixie. I can't tell you how many times Maya's helped crack a case. Given your connections with the Saddle Arabians, Edgeworth could use your help a lot more than I do."

Trixie sighed under her breath before replying, "Very well, then." She turned to the adorable alicorn filly and reared up, cape billowing behind her as she proclaimed, "Nyx helped Phoenix Wright prove Trixie's innocence, so the Great and Diplomatic Trixie will do her part to return the favor!"

Phoenix grinned, glad that the showmare was willing to agree. "Thanks, Trixie." He then turned to the others and said, "Alright, everyone, we'd better get going. And don't worry, Nyx, we'll find everything we need to prove you innocent, and get you... er... the other you... out of jail."

"You bet we will," Maya exclaimed, scooping Nyx up in a hug so exuberant that Pinkie Pie held up a card reading 9.3 "You just stay out of trouble, and Nick and I will clear your name before you know it!"

Nyx let out a squeak as she was practically crushed, but she blushed a little, eyes welling up with happiness that there were so many ponies (and not-quite-ponies) willing to stick their necks out on her behalf. Because they trusted her. "Th-thank you," she said, stammering a little as she hugged Maya back.

The Blind griffon from earlier lay on the sidewalk before Phoenix. "Hello Mr. Ground. How are you today?" He asked the sidewalk. Before turning his head towards Maya. "I'm fine, Miss, no harm done. Although, if you'd be kind enough to help me up, I'd very much appreciate it."

Barely made it to the next house? But that means...this guy is a member of the upper class? "You were Hassim's Neighbor?"

That's why I was at the court house earlier; I was there to try and support them, but I guess I got there a little late."

For some reason, Phoenix got the feeling that the Griffon was hiding something, but no psyche-locks appeared, so he decided to...

15412221222112121111111112221212122.content:
"Can I ask you some questions?" Phoenix asked the griffon, who chuckled to himself.

"Let me guess; you want to know if I saw the killer, right? I'm afraid I didn't. But I did hear something that might help you."

Phoenix raised an eyebrow at the griffon. "And what would that be?"

"A read-my-lips spell. Dad has a room lined with one just so I can't eavesdrop on important meeting and top secret projects...and so I don't over hear what I'm getting for my birthday."

"And what exactly is a read-my-lips spell?" Phoenix asked.

"It's and advanced spell created by a disgruntled mare to see if her colt friend was paying attention to what she was saying or just staring at her flank and using a tape recorder to listen to the highlights of the conversation when she went to the bathroom. It creates an area in which no one can hear what anyone else is saying unless their looking at their mouth while they're talking. Nothing that's said in there can be heard outside the area of the spell either, even if you are looking at their lips. My hearing is sharp enough that it only muffles the sound and distorts the voices, but if I know them well enough I can identify them through the spell. There were a lot of ponies inside the spell area when Hassim was killed, but only a few seemed to be talking. Still, casting a spell like that over Hassim's entire house..." Jacob trailed off.

"I'm guessing it would take a lot of magic?"

"Most likely, but if a unicorn had a special talent related to sound, then they could probably pull it of with much less magic, and I happen to know a mare with a special talent just like that who had heated words with Hassim lately."

"And who would that be?" Phoenix inquired, hoping to get a name for his first potential suspect.

"Vinyl Scratch, daughter of Fancy Pants and Fluer De Lis. She came over and got into a pretty heated argument three days before he was killed. Hassim used his djinn to keep me from hearing what about though. I ran into her shortly after the police arrived when Hassim was killed."

"And you didn't tell the guards about this because...?" Maya asked.

Jacob gave her a confused look. "I did tell them. Why would you think that I hadn't?"

"Because Nyx just got arrested for the crime and this Vinyl pony is still walking around free as a bird."

"Nyx...the reincarnation of Nightmare Moon?" Jacob asked, his voice layered with a rather subtle amount of what Phoenix could only describe as 'burning anger'.

"Yeah, that's the one."

"Excuse me, Mr. Wright, but something very important just came up on my schedule." The griffon said before storming past the attorney and his assistant, his anger barely contained.

1541222122211212111111111222121221.content:
"The palace should be our first destination," Trixie said as they walked down the street. "So long as the Residence is under investigation, all Saddle Arabian dignitaries, including the prosecution team, are guests of the Crown."

"Agreed, that would seem to be the best course," Edgeworth mused back.

Trixie glanced over at the prosecutor and couldn't resist shaking her head in wonder at how well Edgeworth seemed to fit in on the streets of Canterlot. Despite being a human from another world who just happened to be wearing the shape of an earth pony, he had the dress sense and high-class attitude that would have made him blend in at any society function or garden party. Even without a horn, Trixie mentally added, considering the massively disproportionate ratio of unicorns to earth ponies or pegasi among the capital's upper-crust.

Not that being a unicorn was a free pass into the Canterlot elite, of course. Trixie grumbled to herself, recalling how, for all their pretensions of culture, 'the ponies everypony should know' were oh so quick to dismiss the wonders and astonishment she had to offer as nothing but a crass carnival act.

"Trixie is surprised by how quickly you have acclimatized to Equestria, Mr. Edgeworth. When Mr. Wright was here, he floundered about like a fish out of water, and that time he was still human."

This didn't even get a laugh out of Edgeworth as he replied, "Yes, that sounds like Wright. He's always been rather emotional, yet he somehow manages to work things out in the end, even when he seems to make horrible choices. His willingness to place his trust in those he probably shouldn't is something that used to utterly baffle me. Especially today."

"You don't believe that he should be defending Nyx?" This came as a modest surprise to Trixie, coming from a friend of her former adversary in court.

There was a moment of thoughtful silence from Edgeworth before he replied, "From what I have heard of this world's recent history, your system of justice is much more... lenient than the one I represent. In my country, someone who went mad with power, overthrew the government and ruled as a despot would have been imprisoned for the rest of their natural life."

Trixie began to nod in agreement before the vagueness of Edgeworth's description struck her as rather intentional. "You... are talking about Nyx, aren't you?"

Edgeworth looked askance at the showmare. "Miss Trixie, it astonishes me that you are a free mare."

Trixie flinched. "That was... my mind was corrupted by the Alicorn Amulet..."

"Which you purchased of your own free will, for the sake of getting some ill-conceived revenge on Twilight Sparkle. I've heard the story, and the fact remains that even if the situation ultimately spun out of your control, you not only set it into motion through your own actions, you did so with ill intent. The same is true of Nyx. Regardless of the circumstances surrounding her 'birth' and identity issues, she personally led a coup against your government."

Trixie shuddered as she looked at Edgeworth, hearing the icy edge in his voice growing as he levied her past crimes against her. But he wasn't done yet, his tone only growing colder as he leveled a withering stare at her.

"Even before that, your prosecution against Rainbow Dash was a farce and an insult to the law. I have no issue with the fact that you prosecuted her. Had I been in your situation with the same facts that you brought to court at my disposal, I would have taken the case myself. What I cannot forgive, however, is that you only did so to satisfy your need for some petty revenge. The justice system does not exist to bring anyone personal satisfaction, it exists to bring forth the truth, and ensure that the law is applied fairly to all who would break it!"

Edgeworth paused, looking up at the castle again for a moment. "Yet here you both are, walking freely until just yesterday, because those who were in a position to pass judgement on you believed that it was better to grant you opportunities for redemption than to punish you for your crimes. In that regard, Wright is far more suited to this world than I could ever be."

"I'm... Trixie is getting that impression, yes," the unicorn replied, suddenly realizing just how grateful she should be that the Princesses had respected Twilight's request for clemency after the Alicorn Amulet incident.

There was another long silence as they drew closer to the palace's public entrance. Surprisingly, it was Edgeworth who broke the silence.

"All that said," the earth pony mused, his voice reluctantly losing much of its hostile tone, "I am used to dealing with criminals who are far less willing to repent and take a second chance in good faith. Your society doesn't operate under the same rule of law as mine does, and it was your rulers' right to show mercy if they so chose. Given that both you and Nyx have apparently done well in living up to the trust given to you, and no permanent harm was done to your victims, I'm willing to go along with Wright for the time being."

Trixie gave Edgeworth a look. "And now the Great and Powerful Trixie has a better idea of how Phoenix Wright bested her in court if he routinely has to face the likes of you.." One thing was certain, and that was that her impression of the humans in Phoenix's world (based on her previous experiences with the lawyer and what was known of those who lived overseas) were in immediate need of revision.

Thankfully, before the unsettling conversation could continue once more, they had made their way onto the palace grounds. "In any case," she said, coughing into her hoof as she hastily tried to change the subject, "this portion of the palace is open to the public for tours or those seeking an audience with the Princesses when they hold open court. Now, one of these guards will be able to help us get to the quarters housing the Saddle Arabians. Simply allow the Charismatic and Influential Trixie to leverage her identity as one of the crown prince's entertainers, and they should take us right where we need to go."

Edgeworth arched an eyebrow at the ability of Trixie to rebound to her showy persona, but simply replied, "Well then by all means, go ahead."
1541222122211212111111111222121221.title: Turnabout Spell: Crime and Punishment

choices: Follow Franziska back to Ponyville.
Somepony else.
1541222122211212111111111222121222.content:
As the two teams left the party, Twilight sighed in relief. "Well, I feel better, now."

         "I wouldn't get complacent." Eyes turned to regard Franziska von Karma, as she wore a slightly haughty expression. "Phoenix Wright may have decided to represent your adoptive daughter, but this case is far from over. In my personal experience, Phoenix Wright has always won his trials through sheer luck. And even then, he hasn't won every case he's partaken in."

         "You mean Nix lost a case once?" Rainbow asked, stunned.

         Franziska nodded. "Indeed. I was there when the verdict came down. His client was guilty, and there was nothing Phoenix Wright could do about it!" She frowned. "And yet, despite his loss, he came away with a smile. That always infuriated me about him. His thrice-damned cocky - mmph!" She was cut off as a zipper materialized on her mouth.

         Rarity's horn stopped glowing, signifying her as the culprit. "Really, darling, I realize you must be upset at the memories, but that's no excuse to curse in front of children. Understand?"

         Franziska nodded sullenly, and the zipper was removed. "That was an interesting experience," she mused.

         "On another note, darling, who is your tailor? Your shirt and vest are simply gorgeous!" the alabaster unicorn exclaimed. "Why, with a slight modification, you'd be one of the most beautiful mares in Equestria, to say nothing of Canterlot!"

         The prosecutor flushed. Her father had always told her, from an early age, that a professional appearance was more important than an attractive one. She'd done her best to blend the two, but had never received so much as a comment on her appearance. She'd eventually stuck with what was comfortable for her; her shirt and vest, the latter studded with a few jewels. To be complimented so heavily on her appearance... it touched a side of her she hadn't felt in years; a true feminine side.

         Before anything else could be said, a knock at the door preceded Princess Luna into the room. She held out a hoof, forestalling the bows that were coming. "Please, this is no time to stand on ceremony." She looked around. "Where is Mr. Wright? I was hoping I could speak to him."

         "He left to investigate the crime scene," Twilight replied. "He's going to be representing Nyx, after all, so he needs evidence to point away from her guilt."

         Luna eyed the alicorn filly in the unicorn's embrace, then nodded. "I see. Of course he'd take the case." She sighed. "This presents us with a new dilemma, unfortunately."

         "What now?" moaned Rainbow. Given the number of unpleasant surprises of late, the prismatic pegasus was on her last nerve.

         Luna sighed. "I'm afraid that, circumstances being what they are, I must recuse myself as judge for as long as Nyx is the defendant."

         "What?!" Twilight and Nyx exclaimed at the same time.

         Franziska was more controlled. "Do elaborate."

         Blinking at the sight of the unfamiliar mare, Luna nonetheless did as asked. "Simply put, Nyx's history being what it is presents problems with her as the defendant. Even to this day, there are ponies who believe I was too lenient on her. If I find her 'not guilty' in such a politically-charged case, ponies may believe I had personal bias in her favor." She sighed again. "Which is, I admit, a not-entirely unfounded accusation."

         "So jus' because ya like Nyx, ya can't be the judge? Well, that's just great!" grumbled Applejack. "And yer sister can't be the judge so long as Phoenix is representin' Nyx!"

         The Princess of the Night nodded. "Indeed. You understand the problem clearly. Either Celestia or myself are needed to oversee this case as it unfolds, owing to its political nature. Yet circumstances are preventing both of us from doing so. We therefore were wondering if anypony had a solution to this conundrum?"

         There was silence for a moment, then Franziska chuckled. "Well, the answer is simple, your Highness." As eyes turned to her, she elaborated. "If neither you nor your sister can adequately watch over the trial tomorrow, we need to find a completely impartial judge."

         "And where might we find such a judge?" asked the blue alicorn archly. "And who might you be, anyway?"

         "Ah, forgive me for not introducing myself, your Highness," the prosecutor said with a sincere bow. "I am Franziska von Karma, a prosecutor of the highest caliber from Earth. And as for impartial judges, you can't get more impartial than being from another world entirely."

         Twilight gasped. "That's right! The Judge from Rainbow Dash's trial! I could summon him back here to Equestria, and he could preside in your place!"

         Pinkie shook her head rapidly. "Uh-uh! No way, Twilight! You're still a little loopy from when you lost your cool at the guards, so no summoning for you! Dr. Pinkie's orders!"

         As Twilight grumbled, Franziska chuckled a little. "Well, then, I believe I should make my way back to Ponyville, posthaste. From there, I can go to the portal that appeared in the nearby castle, retrieve the Judge, and be back well in time for the trial tomorrow."

         Luna nodded, clearly relieved at the solution to her problem. "I shall pay for priority tickets, for both you and the Judge, Ms. Karma."

         "It's 'von Karma', your Highness," Franziska said. She turned to the others. "I shall return before tomorrow, count on that!" With that, she trotted out towards the train station, Luna following close behind.
1541222122211212111111111222121222.title: Turnabout Spell: Recusive Princess

choices: They get to the train station without incident
Something happens
15412221222112121111111112221212221.content:
Franziska's confidence never wavered as she trotted to the train station. She knew it would be an easy task to get the Judge to come along. Probably just hearing about the ponies again would be enough to convince him. If that failed, she would use more... forceful methods. She flicked her eyes back to the whip she carried as she thought this.

         The motion didn't go unnoticed by Princess Luna. "I admit curiosity as to why a prosecutor would need to carry a whip, Ms. von Karma," the navy alicorn spoke up. "Is it for self-defense?"

         "Partly," replied the prosecutor. "But it's also an implement to... help things along in court."

         "Pardon?" Luna looked at Franziska in confusion.

         The smaller mare snorted. "The courthouse is but a three-ring circus, and the prosecutor is the ringmaster. As the ringmaster leads the circus, so too do I lead the trials in court. When the other 'rings' are being uncooperative, I simply give them some 'encouragement' to get back in their places."

         Luna's expression was unreadable. "I hadn't realized that the prosecutor's position was so much more valuable on your world than here."

         Franziska laughed. "The point of a trial, and the purpose of a prosecutor, is to condemn the one on trial. And the von Karma family prides itself in doing everything perfectly, in every way, so naturally my father and I were both prosecutors. Perfect prosecution, perfect verdicts. That is how we operate."

         Luna was silent for a moment. "I cannot help but ponder how twisted your father must have been to instill such a viewpoint into his daughter."

         Franziska froze. "What does that mean?" she asked, her tone frigid.

         Luna's voice was even colder. "You say that the point of a trial is to condemn the defendant. I've never heard such balderdash. The point of a trial is to find the truth, and convict the guilty party, be they the defendant or no. Obviously, your father was rather overzealous in his job, not to mention highly amoral."

         "Y-you dare?!" The prosecutor was grinding her teeth. "You dare say that a von Karma was anything less than upstanding in all respects?!"

         "Yes, I dare," the princess replied, still icy. "And not just your father, but you as well. Tell me, what levels have you stooped to to get a 'guilty' verdict? To what depths would you sink to see your 'perfect' record unblemished? When in a court of law, you deal with the lives of people, innocent or no. To treat the courtroom as a 'circus' speaks of a level of sociopathy darker than the far side of my own moon."

         Before Franziska could say anything else, Luna's horn flashed, and the world around them seemed to vanish. The alicorn's eyes glowed white, and the human-turned-pony was suddenly under the impression that the princess was looking through her, seeing her soul. Franziska had never felt anything like it, but it was almost like this pony was... judging her.

         Luna's next words, coming seemingly from nowhere, confirmed these thoughts. And for all your claims of 'perfection', Franziska von Karma, your record is anything but. You have lost two trials against Mr. Wright, despite saying that you 'encourage' the rest of the court to dance to your tune. And your father was convicted of murdering the one attorney who managed to put a penalty on his record. Your father was as amoral as any serial killer, and you yourself are treading a fine line.

         Franziska flinched, but tried to rally. "My losses against Phoenix Wright were mere flukes! He wins by luck, not any actual skill! And what happened to my father was... regrettable, but to tarnish a von Karma's reputation is - "

         Reputation?! bellowed the voice of the princess, the sheer force causing the unicorn's legs to buckle under her. The court is responsible for passing judgement on lives, for upholding the law. And you are worried about your reputation? Were you a prosecutor in an Equestrian court, I guarantee your antics would not be tolerated! Before you try to find fault in others, you should first examine yourself!

         The world came back into focus, and Franziska was suddenly aware that she was breathing hard, and sweating. She looked with wide eyes at the pony before her. She had seen Luna in court as a judge, but now she was looking at the alicorn in a new light. "What... are you...?" she breathed.

         "I am Princess Luna, co-regent of Equestria, Diarch of the Moon. Remember that, and mind your tongue in the future." With that, the alicorn trotted off, the unicorn following soon afterward.
15412221222112121111111112221212221.title: Turnabout Spell: Soul-Searing Speech

choices: Franziska wakes up in the backseat of Gumshoe's car.
She wakes up elsewhere.
154122212221121211111111122212122211.content:
Some time later, Franziska found herself walking up the path to Castle Nightstone. She'd hardly spoken a word since Luna's blistering retort against everything she'd known. Her body was on autopilot, while her mind was deep in thought. Such a state wasn't exactly common for the prosecutor, but the alicorn's words had shaken her foundations. She had taken a brief nap on the train to Ponyville, to try to sort out her thoughts and feelings. She wasn't having much luck.

         It's the same words. Those same damnable words! she thought. Both Phoenix Wright and Miles Edgeworth have said those words before! 'The point of a trial is to find the truth.' I thought it the idealistic prattle of those weaker than myself. But... this Princess Luna... she said the same thing. She wields power, great power from the looks of it. And yet she shares that idealistic view. I thought Phoenix Wright's performance today a fluke. But, is it really?

         "Could it be that... I've been wrong this whole time?"

         Even as a part of her mind violently rebelled against the idea, another part seriously considered it. Looking back on her previous trials against Phoenix Wright, and even her time with Miles Edgeworth during what would have been his debut trial, she realized that the truth had always come to light, owing to their determination. The latter case had been before Miles had become 'weak', falling into the same traps that she believed Phoenix Wright had. It was a sobering thought, but Franziska now knew that there was something to those words that all three had said.

         She shook her head violently. "Thoughts for later, Franziska. Focus on the here and now, and get the Judge to Canterlot." She looked up, and realized she was in the room where the portal had formed. Looking at the ceiling, she smiled, as she realized the ladder she, Edgeworth, and Maya Fey had used to safely climb down through the portal was still there. Using all four hooves as hands and feet, she carefully climbed back up the ladder. As her foreleg passed through the portal, she felt it change. It wasn't painful, just odd. Flexing her regained fingers, she climbed the rest of the way out. Stepping down onto the asphalt of the alley, she stretched her human form.

         "Ms. von Karma!" Franziska turned to regard the speaker, as he came running up to her. She mused briefly on the striking similarities to a pony she'd seen in court that very day.

         "Good afternoon, Scruffy," she replied. "Have you been doing as we asked?"

         "Yep!" Detective Gumshoe said with a nod and a smile. "Ain't nobody come through here, just like you said. I was just making another round when I saw you come through. So, what's it like on the other side?"

         "It's... interesting," Franziska admitted. "Scruffy, fetch your car. I need to find the Judge."

         "Oh? Something going on?" Gumshoe asked.

         She nodded. "Yes. There is a trial tomorrow on the other side, and the locals are in need of an impartial judge. You can't get more impartial than being from another world, correct?"

         "I getcha. It'll take me a few minutes to bring my car around. Just sit tight, Ms. von Karma!" Gumshoe dashed off, leaving Franziska to her thoughts.

         So dutiful... I hardly appreciate him and all the hard work he does, she mused. A small smile crossed her face; it was a genuine smile, not one of her haughty court smiles. "Perhaps... Miles isn't the only one who can change because of him."

         "Have you become weak as well, Franziska?"

         Franziska spun around to face the speaker, and her eyes widened. The whip she'd grabbed on reflex fell from nerveless fingers. "Impossible... you can't be..."

         Stepping out of the shadows of the alley was a figure she never thought she'd see again. He stood taller than her by a head, with greying hair and skin. Dressed in a fanciful suit studded with gems, he stalked toward her, using a cane in his right hand. His eyes were cold and harsh, and he had a cold, thin-lipped smile as he looked at her.

         The image of Manfred von Karma spoke again. "I can't be what, Franziska? I can't be here? A von Karma is perfect in every way. I had such hopes for you, after Miles let me down. To think that my own flesh and blood would become weak as well."

         Franziska tried to rally. "If Phoenix Wright and Miles Edgeworth truly are weak, then how is it that they both seem stronger than you? The two of them have done things together that no one person can do. They got the Chief of Police arrested. They got you convicted!"

         "I am aware of their accomplishments, idiot girl!" snarled Manfred. He stalked closer, even as Franziska retreated. "But for all their accolades, they are still weak! A trial is meant to convict the defendant, and a prosecutor is meant to expedite that process. That was the lesson I taught both you and Miles! And yet one lucky defense attorney is enough to rattle your convictions?"

         Franziska had rarely felt true fear before. The first time had been years ago, when the 'lawyer' Calisto Yew had pulled a gun on both her and Miles. The second had been a few years later, when she had been shot on the way to the courthouse. And now, for the third time, she felt it again, stronger than ever, as her father's image verbally assaulted her. She backed up against the wall of the alley. "W-what do you want from me...?"

         "That 'inquisitor' is not a true prosecutor. You will take his place, and you will convict the alicorn," Manfred said simply.

         Franziska blinked. "Why...? What do you stand to gain from this?"

         "If you do not do this... the court wizard will have been only the first to lose his life," said the phantom, as he stepped back into the shadows, out of sight.

         With the image of her father gone, the young prosecutor slid down the wall, breathing heavily. She was sweating again. It was too much. Combined with the shock of Princess Luna's scathing words earlier, Franziska von Karma did something she had never done before. She fainted.

         The last thing she saw was a car pulling around. The last thing she heard was her name, being shouted by a familiar voice.
154122212221121211111111122212122211.title: Turnabout Spell: Musings and Visions

choices: They get back to Canterlot with no problems.
Something happens on the way.
1541222122211212111111111222121222112.content:
She was adrift in a sea of nothingness. She couldn't hear or see anything in the endless black. She couldn't even feel anything. So, she just drifted along, content for the time being.

         Then there was a vibration in the void. She felt it.

         Felt...? No, she heard it.

         "... karma..."

         Karma? What was that?

         "... von Karma..."

         Von Karma...? That sounded... familiar...

         "MISS VON KARMA!"

*****


         Franziska snapped awake at the shout, bolting upright with a gasp. "What in the...?"

         "Oh, thank goodness, you're awake!" She looked over, seeing Gumshoe kneeling down near her. "You had me worried, sir!"

         "Scruffy? What happened?" Franziska shook her head, trying to clear the fog.

         "We were hoping you could tell us, Ms. von Karma," came another familiar voice.

         Glancing up, she saw the Judge walking in, with a tray holding a tea set. "I'm afraid it's been some time since I've prepared tea for visitors, but, here's hoping I haven't lost my touch," the elderly justice said. He set the tray down on a nearby coffee table, poured a cup, and gave it to Franziska.

         She took it cautiously, blowing on the steam slightly, before taking a sip. It wasn't the best tea she'd ever had, but it certainly wasn't the worst. "My thanks, your Honor," she said gratefully.

         "Now, now, Ms. von Karma, we're not in court here, so no need to stand on ceremony," the Judge laughed. "Just call me 'Judge'."

         Franziska nodded, slowly. "Very well, then, Judge. I was actually hoping to speak with you about something."

         "Sir, what about you?" Gumshoe asked, fretting. "I mean, I pulled my car around, and found you passed out next to the wall of the alley! What happened?"

         Franziska blinked. What did happen? I remember returning from Equestria, meeting with Scruffy, and then - !

         It was through dint of Herculean effort that she kept her face neutral as she remembered. That's right... I saw... Papa... He told me to take over prosecuting against Nyx. He said if I didn't, Hassim would have been only the first to lose his life!

         "Ms. von Karma?" the Judge asked, concerned at the lack of response.

         Franziska shook her head. "Apologies. It's nothing either of you need to worry about."

         "But sir - OWW!!" Gumshoe's protest was cut off as the whip came out.

         "I said, nothing for you to worry about, Scruffy," the prosecutor firmly stated. "Besides, getting the Judge to his new venue is more important."

         "I beg your pardon? 'New venue'?" the Judge blinked, confused.

         Franziska nodded. "You're aware that Miles Edgeworth, Maya Fey, and myself were concerned over Phoenix Wright's disappearance, correct?"

         "Ah, yes, I remember Ms. Fey was particularly worried. What of it? Has he been located?"

         "Yes, on the opposite side of a dimensional rift of sorts."

         "A dimensional rift? You mean, like in a science fiction novel?"

         Franziska nodded again. "Somewhat, although this one is real. I've been on the other side myself."

         "Fascinating," the Judge mused. "And are the locals in need of a good judge?"

         "They are," Franziska confirmed. "Moreover, you've been there once before, I believe. Presiding over the trial of... what was the name... Rainbow something?"

         "Rainbow...?" The Judge blinked for a moment, then his eyes lit up. "AH! You mean I'm needed in Equestria once more? Fantastic! I thoroughly enjoyed my first visit there!"

         Franziska nodded. "Well, then let's not waste time. Scruffy, take us back to the alley."

         "You got it, Ms. von Karma!" Gumshoe said with a smile.

*****


         A little while later, the three were standing outside the portal. "The last time I visited Equestria, I was summoned by a unicorn named Twilight Sparkle," mused the Judge. "Why do we need to go through this roundabout method?"

         Franziska sighed. "Twilight exhausted her magic earlier today, and is in no shape to do any summoning. I offered to bring you there personally, to ensure nothing untoward happened."

         "I see..." The Judge nodded, and stepped toward the ladder.

         "Ah, a word of warning, Judge," Franziska said, remembering a key detail. "For some reason, traveling through this portal changes people into ponies, so please keep your wits about you."

         "Fascinating," mused the Judge, as he began to step down the ladder.

         When he was completely through the portal, Franziska stepped on herself. "Scruffy, keep this alley clear of all pedestrians until all of us return."

         "You got it, Ms. von Karma!" Gumshoe said with a grin.

         With that, Franziska lowered herself back down through the portal. As her face cleared the threshold, she finished climbing down the ladder, to see a dark grey earth pony with a brilliant silver beard, dressed in black judge's robes waiting for her.

         "I have to admit, this is one of the more unique experiences of my life," the Judge said, looking over himself.

         "I'll help you get acquainted with your new body, then we'll head for Ponyville, and take the train to Canterlot," Franziska explained, stepping over to the Judge.
1541222122211212111111111222121222112.title: Turnabout Spell: Reunion and Return

choices: Twilight asks Maya about how she got here.
The foursome spot something suspicious going on!
154122212221121211112.content:
"Twilight!"

         The named unicorn snapped out of her daze, and blinked at her friend. "Huh? Oh, sorry Applejack. What did you say?"

         The farmer shook her head. "Ah swear, yer spacin' out worse 'n Rarity lookin' at a dust bunny in her boutique. What's got yer tail in a twist?"

         The two, along with Spike, were in the palace library, with a nice pile of magical theory texts sitting next to them. Twilight was supposed to be reading one on transformative magic, but she was having trouble focusing.

         Twilight sighed, lightly banging her head against the table they were sitting around. "Ugh, sorry, AJ. I know I'm supposed to be working on a way to turn Phoenix back into a human, but... I just can't help but wonder why Princess Celestia is hiding information about him from me."

         "This again, Twi?" Applejack asked. "Look, ah told ya before, the Princess don't got ta tell ya everythin' she knows, right? It's not like she's expecting ya ta become a princess too, right?1"

         Twilight smiled a little at her friend's quip. "Yeah, you're right. I really should work on a means of changing Phoenix back to normal."

         She went back to her book, while Applejack grinned, and returned to the farming magazine she'd found. Spike was busy reading the latest issue of a comic he'd been waiting for, though he kept a close eye on his surrogate sister in case she had a 'Twilight Spazzle' breakdown. It was unlikely... but then again, it had been unlikely that she would turn the whole of Ponyville into a battleground over an old stuffed doll.

         A mere few seconds had passed before another pony joined them. This unicorn had a coat of a slightly darker hue than Twilight, with a black mane done up in a small bun, with most of it flowing freely. She looked younger than Twilight, and was levitating a book on spirits. "'Scuse me, can I sit here?" she asked. "Um, there's no other place with sun left open."

         "Sure thing, sugarcube," Applejack said, scooting over to make room for the younger mare.

         Nodding her thanks, the newcomer sat down at the offered spot, and opened the book on spirits. After a moment, though, she looked up at Twilight. "Um, I kinda overheard what you were saying earlier. You... wouldn't happen to have been talking about Phoenix Wright, would you?"

         Though she spoke in a somewhat low voice, she firmly gained the attention of both ponies and the dragon. "How did you know his name?" Twilight asked, a slight edge to her voice.

         The unicorn smiled. "Simple; he's my partner."

         There was a moment of silence. "Wait, what?" Spike asked, confused.

         "Sorry, let me introduce myself. I'm Maya Fey," she said, bowing slightly. "I work with Nick at his law office on Earth."

         "Maya...?" Twilight blinked. "Oh, Phoenix mentioned you last night!"

         "He did?" Maya asked, perking up. "What did he say about me?"

         "Um, not much, I'm afraid," Twilight admitted. "It was in conjunction with a nightmare he had."

         Maya winced. "Ah." She brightened again quickly. "Well, no matter! I just wish I could've been in the gallery for the trial, but unfortunately, it's completely full."

         "Probably because this is sort of an international incident," Spike said carelessly.

         "Spike!" scolded Twilight.

         Too late, though, as Maya had heard the dragon. "Wait, 'international incident'? Was the victim someone important?"

         Twilight sighed. "The court wizard of Saddle Arabia. Sound important to you, Miss Fey?"

         Maya winced. "Ouch..." She brightened again. "Well, doesn't matter. Nick'll prove his client not guilty. Assuming he or she really is not guilty, that is."

         "She is, trust me," Twilight said. "Oh, my name's Twilight Sparkle."

1541222122212.content:
[[Note: This chapter is written prior to the conclusion of Turnabout Storm, so some elements of it may end up being non-canon to that series.]]

"You're ordering us not to investigate?" Twilight gasped in astonishment at what her mentor and Princess had just said.

"No," Celestia replied with a slow shake of her head. "No, I am asking you not to involve yourselves in this matter. This has become far more than merely a legal matter."

Applejack spoke up, asking, "Beggin' yer pardon, Yer Highness, but ah'm not followin'. Rainbow here's sure Trixie couldn't 've done it, so as long as we think she's innocent, why shouldn't we be doin' everythin' we can t' prove it? 'Tain't right t' sit on th' sidelines an' not do anythin' if an innocent pony's bein' accused o' somethin' she didn't do!"

"Yeah!" Rainbow Dash hovered, visibly fretting in contrast to her usual brash personality. "Y-you don't know what it's like, Princess!"

Celestia looked at each of the six ponies and Spike with a warm but sad expression. "I am sorry, my little ponies, but this is a matter of international importance. Court Wizard Hassim was a close friend and cousin to the King of Saddle Arabia, as well as an important political figure in his homeland. That is why it is necessary that I personally preside over this trial. To show that Equestria stands with our allies in bringing his murderer to justice.

"It also means that whatever judgement I arrive at is not just a legal ruling, but the will of the crown. If my faithful student and her friends, one of whom will most likely be called upon as a witness..." she said, looking toward Rainbow Dash. "If you involve yourselves in the defense, then it could be seen as bias which would damage the relationship between Equestria and Saddle Arabia. I assure you, the members of the royal investigation team are going to do everything within their power to determine the facts of this case. If your friend Trixie is truly innocent, then the evidence will prove that out, but I must show our allies that Equestrian justice is fair, true, and unbiased. Do you understand?"

Most of the assembled ponies reluctantly nodded, though Applejack tugged the brim of her hat down over her eyes. "Still don't seem right," she muttered quietly.

"I am sorry, Applejack, but this is the way it must be. Besides, as I understand it, you have already found counsel to represent Trixie in this coming trial. That should be enough."

"Oh yes," Fluttershy assured her despondent friends. "If anypony can prove Trixie's innocent, it's Mr. Phoenix!"

At the mention of that name, the already white-coated sun princess seemed to become even more pale. Not so much in appearance, but the radiant aura that always seemed to surround her faded slightly. "Phoenix...? Twilight, did you bring Phoenix Wright here?"

"Well... yes," the purple unicorn replied, slightly confused by the Princess's reaction. "As soon as we heard that Trixie was accused of murder, it just made sense to try to bring him here to represent her." Her ears flattened atop her head as she asked worriedly, "Did I... did I do something wrong, Princess?"

"Oh... no, no, Twilight," Celestia assured her, though her voice was touched with... dismay, perhaps? She approached her student and lowered her head to nuzzle Twilight softly as she said, "I should have expected nothing less. I know he will do a fine job. It just... makes things a little more complicated."

Twilight, grateful that she had not angered her teacher, was nevertheless still concerned about what she might have done to cause Celestia such dismay. "But why, Princess? You're the one who asked me to summon him to defend Rainbow Dash..." She trailed off as a long-unanswered question rose up to the forefront of her mind. "But you didn't want me to tell him that you were the one who chose him... Why? What's the connection between you and Phoenix Wright?"

Oh my, Rarity thought, watching the conversation between Twilight and Celestia. Her inner gossip took command as she mused, Could it be? That nervousness... Her reluctance to share the details of their mysterious connection... Is the Princess in love with Mr. Wright? Oh, how am I supposed to compete with THAT?

Celestia sighed and smiled wanly as she replied, "It's... not important, Twilight. I simply don't think that it would be best if I preside over a case in which he is representing the defense for the same reasons I didn't want you involved. I am afraid that I will have to ask..."
1541222122212.title: Turnabout Spell: Political Realities

15412221222122.content:
Twilight and the others blinked. It was Spike who ultimately regained his voice first. "Um, Princess, what's the big deal? Do you have some kind of issue with Phoenix?"

         "Not at all, Spike," Celestia replied, as she conjured a scroll and began writing on it. "However, if Phoenix Wright is defending Trixie, I... admit I'd be biased in his favor. Luna will have no such compunctions. I just hope she'll be willing to do this for me." She finished writing, and the scroll furled up and vanished with a soft 'pop'.

         "Ah'm sure she'll be willin', Princess," Applejack said. "After all, she's yer sister. Ah may not know why yer doin' everythin' ya do, but ah trust ya both ta do the right thing in the end."

         "Thank you, Applejack," Celestia replied, nodding to the farmer.

         Twilight was silent, but inwardly, her mind was racing to explain her mentor's behavior. Why is she acting like this? Come to think of it, when she asked me to summon Phoenix last time, she acted kinda oddly, too. How can I... wait. She reached inward, tugging on a strand of magic she hadn't used in years. Not since Rainbow Dash's trial. "Princess... you act oddly whenever Phoenix is brought up. He claims to know nothing about you, yet you know about him. Why is that?"

*BANG* *rattlerattlerattlerattlerattle* *BANGBANGBANGBANGBANG


         As Twilight watched, the area around Celestia turned black, and a multitude of chains appeared, surrounding the alicorn, as five red padlocks appeared, locking the chains in place. Celestia herself seemed not to notice. Nor did any of her friends. "As I said, Twilight, it's not important," the Princess said.

         "I see..." Twilight said, letting go of the magic strand... the leftover power of Phoenix's Magatama that lay within her. "Thank you for the information, Princess." She paused as a thought occured to her. "Um, I kinda asked Nyx to be Phoenix's co-counsel. Is that going to cause an issue?"

         Celestia put a hoof to her chin in thought. "Hm... so long as it's just Nyx, and just as his co-counsel, I see nothing wrong with that. But warn her to tread lightly. We can't afford any more of an international incident than we're already in."

         "Understood, Princess," Twilight said with a bow. Her friends followed suit, and they followed her out of the throne room.

         As they left, Celestia allowed the facade of the flawless princess drop, and she let out a sigh. "Phoenix Wright..."

*****


         "This sucks," Rainbow Dash complained. "I hate feeling useless, and that's just what I'm going to be for this whole thing!"

         "We're all in that same boat, dear," Rarity sighed. "I myself was hoping to contribute something to this trial, since I was so useless last time." She sighed again. "I suppose we shall simply have to support Trixie and Phoenix from the gallery."

         "I'm more concerned with why the Princess is hiding her connection to Phoenix," Twilight mused. "She won't even tell me! She didn't tell me the last time I summoned him! It's so frustrating..."

         "Is it really that big a deal, Twi?" Applejack asked. "Ah mean, she is the Princess, ya know. She can't tell ya everythin' she knows."

         The scholarly unicorn sighed. "I know, Applejack, but... still, it's frustrating that she can't trust me with this."

         The group walked through the palace, rounding a corner, and almost running smack into Phoenix and Nyx. It was only through dextrous use of magic that nopony ended up in a tangle of legs and hooves. Once everypony had calmed down, Nyx looked closer at her mom and her friends. "What's with the long faces, everypony? Phoenix and I were just about to go investigate the crime scene."

         Twilight sighed. "Phoenix, Nyx... I'm afraid the rest of us aren't going to be able to help you in your investigation after all."

         The two blinked at that. "Might I ask why not?" Phoenix asked, somewhat archly. "Wasn't the whole point of all of you coming along so that you could give me a hoof?"

         Before Twilight could reply, Rarity broke in. "I can sum it up for you in one word, Mr. Wright: politics."

         Phoenix groaned at that. "Oh, of course, it's not just a murder, no, it's a freaking international incident," he mumbled. "Sometimes I wonder if some cosmic being is having fun at my expense." He sighed. "So, it's just me and Nyx on this case?"

         "And the police from the precincts Criminal Affairs department," Twilight reminded him.

         "Well that makes me feel better," the pegasus attorney grumbled, thinking of the police back on Earth. "Well, I'll see what I can do. Let's go, Nyx."

         "See you later, Mom," the black alicorn called as she and Phoenix trotted off.

         Twilight looked after the two of them, thinking to herself. Should I have told Phoenix about the Psyche-Lock on Celestia? It was a big one... five locks total. I don't know if I should or not...

         Her inner musings were interrupted by Rainbow Dash. "C'mon, Twilight, let's find somewhere to relax or something."

         "Right, yeah," the unicorn agreed, as she followed her friends.

Nyx was surprised to find that the creature laying on the floor was no pony, or even a quadruped. Looking more like a cross between a skinny minotaur and a monkey, Nyx needed a few moments of carefully examining it before recognizing the creature as a human. She had heard of them from her mother and from rumors about the strange human/pony colonies overseas, but had never seen one outside of sketches in textbooks.

This one was a bit too small to be an adult, from what she had heard. If they were both standing, the human would probably be eye-to-eye with the teenaged alicorn. Wearing a dark blue dress, a light blue top hat and cape, and white boots, Nyx couldn't be sure, but if she saw anypony wearing a similar ensemble, she would assume they were a stage magician. And like all humans, it was mostly hairless except for a short brown mane.

While Nyx investigated the strange human, it suddenly shifted and groaned, startling her a little. It rubbed its eyes with the back of its hoof... no, 'hand'. Humans and minotaurs had hands. (Certain ponies in town would never let her live it down if she got caught making that sort of mistake.) It then slowly blinked open a pair of dark blue eyes, a hue similar to its dress. As it looked around, getting a sense of its surroundings, those eyes eventually locked onto Nyx.

With a comforting smile, Nyx asked, "Hey, are you alright?"

The human gasped, eyes widening before letting out a piercing shriek! She was...

154332222212.content:
Nyx winced, reflexively backing up as her wings flared defensively against the onslaught of the human's scream. Before she could try to calm the human down, however, she looked again and found the creature... smiling like Pinkie Pie during a solid week of birthdays. "Oh my gosh! Oh my gosh, you're real! And you talk! I knew it! I knew Equestria was real!"

Nyx suddenly found the human buzzing around her, occasionally touching her. "Oh, wow, you have such a beautiful mane... and wings! Real wings! *gasp* And a horn! Oh my gosh, does that mean you're a princess? I'm sorry, your majesty, I was just so excited!" She quickly stepped back and bowed with a stage flourish. It all happened so fast, Nyx had to remind herself to close her mouth as her jaw hung open from surprise.

"Ah... well... I am an alicorn, but I'm not a princess," Nyx replied, trying to get her head together. Then she blinked as something else the human said caught her attention. "Wait, why are you so surprised Equestria is real? Where are you from? How did you get here? And who are you?"

The human (Nyx guessed from her build and voice that it was a girl) smiled energetically. "Well, I wasn't surprised, exactly. My dad told me stories about when a unicorn summoned him to Equestria all the time when I was little. He always told me they were just bedtime stories, but I could tell he was lying about that! I was just amazed to actually be in a whole other world! There's so little real magic in my world, but I figured that if someone from yours could summon someone from mine, then there had to be a way to send myself here, and I found one!" Taking a moment to breathe, Trucy giggled and blushed a little. "Oops, and sorry for not introducing myself. My name's Trucy-"

"...Wright," Nyx interrupted, taking the time to piece things together while the girl rambled. Trucy wasn't the only one who had parents tell stories, and one was of the time Twilight summoned a human lawyer named Phoenix Wright from another world to save Rainbow Dash from charges of murder. If her father was brought to Equestria during that time, there were only two possibilities, and she could tell from Trucy's gasp that she was dead-on with her guess.

"Yes! How did you know?! Did you use your magic to cast an identification spell?" Trucy asked, causing Nyx to blink and bust out laughing.

"No, no... as far as I know, there's no such thing. I just knew because... my name's Nyx, and my mother's Twilight Sparkle. The one who summoned your dad."

This actually took Trucy aback. "No way... the Twilight Sparkle? I can't believe it!" Then she cocked her head. "But dad never mentioned her having kids... er... foals."

Nyx pointed out, "And from what mom told me, Phoenix didn't have any children when he was brought over here, either."

The two girls looked at each other. Then they grinned and simultaneously asked, "Adopted?" Then just as simultaneously, they answered, "Yep." This caused the two teens to start giggling, loosening up again.

"Wow, I never thought I would meet a human," Nyx said, "let alone Phoenix Wright's daughter! You know, he's one of my heroes, after all the stories mom told about how he never gave up, fighting right to the end to make sure justice was served and the innocent were protected."

Trucy nodded. "And I always wanted to meet Twilight Sparkle. A real unicorn, with real magic!" Clapping her hands together, she pulled them apart again to reveal that she was suddenly holding a wand. "All my tricks are just illusion."

Nyx oohed. She hadn't sensed any magic, but neither had she seen how Trucy put the wand in her hand. "Is that why you came here? To meet my mother?"

In response to that question, Trucy's expression shifted from bubbly and cheerful to a more determined face. "Actually... I need a pony who knows magic."

15433222221221.content:
As they reached the front doors, the sun's light shined on Trucy's face. She instinctively brought up a hand to shield her eyes, only to find that the sun shone through it! Blinking in surprise as her hand turned transparent, the teenaged magician staggered, feeling a sudden wave of vertigo overtake her.

"Trucy? What's going on?" Nyx quickly approached the slowly fading girl, allowing Trucy to lean against her while the alicorn held her with one of her wings.

"I... this is what it felt like coming here... I must be going back, but it's too early! Didn't... even get to see much of Equestria..." It was a struggle for her to get the words out as the magics in play were doing their best to overwhelm her consciousness and make her black out.

She wasn't the only one who felt it, however. Holding Trucy so closely and watching her fade, Nyx could see and feel the dimension-crossing magics in play. A spell more complex than any she had attempted herself, but by staying in such close proximity to Trucy, she could feel the spell surrounding her as well, overwhelming her senses and making the world around her go dark.

Unable to stay conscious any longer, both Nyx and Trucy found themselves blacking out. An indeterminate amount of time later, feeling a lot like time she and Scootaloo bet on which of them could drink more of Granny Smith's 'special' cider, Nyx slowly started to grow more aware of her surroundings.

154332222212212.content:
Before she could so much as summon up the strength to open her eyes, Nyx started becoming aware of sounds. Muffled and incoherent at first. Her sense of touch then started to kick in, including just enough equilibrium to figure out that she was laying on her side. Instead of the stone floors of Night Stone Castle, however, she could feel thin carpeting against her cheek. All the while, the sounds she was hearing slowly grew more clear.

"-ke up! Trucy! Trucy!" A stallion's voice. Adult, but probably not much older than her, if Nyx were to guess. And loud. Very loud. Either she actually had gotten into the special cider and was suffering a hangover, or this stallion could project his voice like an actor in a Trotway show.

Then she heard another voice. Softer. Female. Trucy's. Definitely Trucy's. Nyx heard the young magician groan as she was helped up to her feet. "'Pollo...? That you...?"

"Yes, now come on! We've gotta get out of here before that thing wakes up!"

However, 'that thing' had already woken up, and Nyx slowly, shakily started pushing herself up to her hooves. This prompted a yelp from the male voice, who shouted, "Stay behind me! I'll hold it off!" Nyx rubbed her forehead and slowly opened her eyes, allowing the light in as she looked toward the sounds.

Funnily enough, while her vision was still blurry and unfocused, she found herself looking at what seemed to be nothing less than a giant chicken brandishing a stick in her direction. When her eyes began to focus and let her see more clearly, however, she found herself on the receiving end of a frightened glare from a male human with the most unique manestyle she'd ever seen.

They were in some sort of office with a desk, a bookshelf in the back, and a decorative plant near the window. The human was standing between Nyx and a groggy Trucy, holding a golf club and waving it around in the alicorn's direction.

And then, before Nyx could say or do anything more, Trucy smacked him upside the head.

"Ow! Trucy, what are you doing?"

"What are you doing, Apollo?! I told you to give me at least three hours before casting the return spell!"

Apollo glanced back over his shoulder, finding himself caught between what he was certain was a demon horse from the depths of Hell and a fuming Trucy... and apparently didn't know which one he should be more intimidated by. "I panicked, okay? You disappeared on me!"

"I was supposed to disappear," Trucy retorted, hands on her hips. "That was the whole point! What kind of spell did you think I was casting, here?"

"Not a real one," Apollo protested. "And where did this monster horse come from?!"

Nyx blinked and sat down on her haunches with a sour look on her face. "Umm, excuse me, I'm not a monster or a horse. I'm a pony," Nyx replied with irritation evident in her voice.

This just freaked Apollo out again. "Ahhhhh! It talks?!"

Just as Nyx's anger flared up at being called an 'it', the door near Trucy and Apollo opened, and in stepped a tall, stubbly man with sleepy eyes. He looked older than Apollo, and wore a sort of grey, hooded sweatshirt, and a garish blue hat that would have made Rarity shriek with terror. There was a moment of silence as this man looked around the room before settling on the club in Apollo's hand. "Huh, I didn't know you played golf," he mused, causing the younger man to choke.

"Wha... buh... don't you see the big black horse?!" Apollo demanded, pointing at Nyx.

"Pony," the older man corrected, stepping forward so he was standing in front of Nyx. "And I was waiting for you to introduce me to our guest from Equestria." Holding out his hand, he smiled faintly and apparently decided to handle the introductions himself. "Hello, miss. My name's Phoenix Wright."

Nyx didn't even realize that her jaw was hanging open until she tried to respond. Lifting up a hoof and placing it in Phoenix's hand, she stammered, "N... Nyx. Nyx Sparkle..."

Phoenix's expression didn't visibly change in any way she could see, but as she looked up at Phoenix's eyes, she could see a brief shimmer there. Recognition, perhaps, at the mention of her mother's surname, but also a hint of... sadness? She couldn't really be sure. He simply took in that information and mused, "Well. How about that? Why don't I pour some grape juice and you can tell me how Twilight's been doing these days?" He then looked over at Apollo and asked, "Well? Aren't you going to offer the lady a seat?"

The younger man's eye twitched, causing Nyx and Trucy to giggle softly as he slumped forward in defeat.
154332222212212.title: Nyx Sparkle: Alicorn Attorney

1543322222122122.content:
After pouring a cup of grape juice for everypony (everyone, Nyx mentally corrected herself, being the only pony there) Phoenix asked, "So, how are things in Equestria? No more murder cases since I was there last, I hope."

Nyx laughed softly and shook her head. "No, things have been pretty peaceful lately. At least as much as you can expect in Ponyville. We get some monsters from the Everfree Forest every now and then, but we generally send them packing again before they can do any serious damage." She fidgeted nervously, slightly overwhelmed at being face to face with the only one of her heroes who didn't know about the events surrounding her 'birth', not to mention her rise and fall as conqueror of Equestria. And to be perfectly honest, sitting across from this champion of truth and justice, she quickly realized that she wanted to keep it that way.

Besides, between her mom's exploits and her own adventures with the Cutie Mark Crusaders, there were plenty of other stories. While she tried to think of one, she lifted up her cup with magic. For whatever reason, Apollo chose that moment to spray a mouthful of grape juice at her. Narrowing her eyes at him as the sugary drink dripped down her face, Nyx grabbed some napkins with her magic in order to wipe herself clean and clean up the carpet before it could stain.

"Apollo! What was that for?" Trucy asked, almost as irritated as Nyx was.

Looking back and forth between the alicorn and his human co-workers, Apollo stammered, "But she... the cup... napkins! Floating!"

"Well, she is part unicorn," Phoenix replied, calm amusement plastered all over his face. "That's sort of what they do. Don't be too hard on him, though, girls. I had trouble getting used to Equestria when I was there, and that was with Twilight's help. Speaking of your horn, though, Nyx... I couldn't help noticing your wings, and based on your size, I'm guessing you're part earth pony, too. As far as I knew, the only ponies like that were the Princesses, so does that mean you're royalty back home?"

Nyx froze for a moment, her black coat turning a few shades greyer as this question struck closer to home than she wanted to get into. After all, she could easily explain that no, she didn't have any claim to the throne, but then she would probably have to explain why she didn't.

Fortunately (if only for the sake of deferring the question) there was a rattling sound as someone outside the office tried to open it, only to find it locked. After that came a knock on the door. From the other side, a female voice asked, "Hey, is anybody in there? Why's this door locked? Open up, in the name of the law!"

Apollo suddenly went white as a sheet as he recognized the voice, while Phoenix smiled a bit. "Oh, it's Detective Skye. I wonder what she's here about," the older man mused. He got up to go to the door, but before he opened it, he grinned back at the other three and whispered, "Apollo, why don't you show Miss Nyx the back office while I see what Ema wants?"

Nyx suddenly found herself getting shoved toward another room on the opposite side of the office, and though she was indignant about being manhandled, didn't offer much resistance once she figured that if Phoenix didn't want her meeting this 'Ema Skye' person, there was probably a reason for it. Once in the back room, Apollo quickly closed the door and braced himself against it, looking like he was in the middle of hyperventilating.

"Oh, man... okay, we just stay here and don't make a sound until she's gone..."

Settling down nearby, Nyx raised an eyebrow in concern. Whispering quietly, she asked, "What are you so worried about? Who is this person?" Recalling that Phoenix had referred to her as 'Detective', as well as her 'open up int he name of the law' line, she quickly put two and two together. Her eyes widened and she asked, "Are you... on the wrong side of the law?"

"What?! No," Apollo hissed through his teeth, "I mean... I'm a defense attorney and she's a detective, so we're technically supposed to be on opposite sides in the courtroom, but that's not the issue. If you thought I freaked out, just wait until she sees you! She'll never stop screaming about how you're 'scientifically impossible', and probably arrest us all for breaking the laws of physics. Or at least for having an exotic pet without a permit..."

Nyx glared at him again, starting to wish she had cockatrice eyes instead of her draconic ones. Somehow, Apollo had proven himself to be able to push one of her buttons with every other sentence out of his mouth, and the ability to turn him into a spiky-haired lawn ornament was an increasingly attractive fantasy every time he did so. But in the ensuing awkward silence between them, she overheard Detective Skye speak.

"Uh-huh. So if you're just sitting around drinking grape juice, why lock the door? Better yet, why do I count four cups? That book is evidence in this case, so if you took it or are hiding whoever did, I'll have no choice but to search this place."

Apollo froze up again. "Uh-oh... she's gonna come back here. We've gotta hide you!" He frantically looked around, but there weren't any good places. The only thing that might be big enough to conceal her was Phoenix's desk, but there was no way that would work for more than a few seconds. And though he glanced out the window, thinking briefly of pushing her out and letting her wings keep her from splattering on the streets below, it was too narrow. Not to mention that he could just imagine the uproar that would spring up if she were seen in public. "Oh no... oh no, this really isn't good... Can't you use some of your... magic... for this sort of situation...?!"

Nyx sighed. If Phoenix hadn't suggested that it was for the best to hide her true nature by sending her back here, she wouldn't have any problem with simply introducing herself. Were humans seriously that xenophobic by nature? It probably wasn't a good idea to dwell on that, though, as Ema's footsteps were approaching the door, though it sounded like Phoenix and Trucy were trying to keep her distracted to buy a little more time.

"As a matter of fact, I do," Nyx replied to Apollo, focusing her horn on the first spell she thought of that might help here. One that would...
