15433222221221222.content:
Nyx's horn began to glow with magic as she laid the spell out in her mind. However, she needed a catalyst to get it going, To that end, she bit down on a few of Apollo's hairs and yanked them out. This drew a short yelp of surprise and pain from the lawyer, but he had the presence of mind to quickly clap a hand over his mouth and glare at Nyx while she smirked back at him.

Letting her spell mix with the hairs, Nyx felt the magic flow through her and start changing her body. It was a spell that she had studied when she had been thinking of exploring more of the world. The wizard who had developed it, Shifty Shaper, had called it 'The Ultimate Tourist'. A sort of shapeshifting spell that wouldn't require the constant focus of a maintained illusion, and if she tried to change into a shape from her imagination despite being unfamiliar with the species she was emulating, there was a good chance of falling into what was referred to as the 'uncanny valley'.

Instead, the Ultimate Tourist would use Apollo's hair as a sample to create a template, then apply her own features to that template to create a form for herself that, while human, would be uniquely her. Fortunately, as she felt her body starting to contort and twist in ways that made Apollo cover his eyes to keep from vomiting in disgust, there was no pain. Instead, she simply felt as though she were caught up in one of Miss Rarity's moments of inspiration, and getting pulled from one suit of clothes into another.

When the sensations faded, signalling that the magic had run its course, Nyx took a second to look herself over. Her line of sight was now lower, and being on all fours was no longer as comfortable a position as it should have been, so she reached out toward Phoenix's desk for support and hesitantly pulled herself up onto her hind legs. The fingers on the ends of her hooves... hands... felt strange and alien to her, but at the same time they gripped the edge of the desk as if they knew what to do on their own.

Her glossy black coat was gone, her skin having taken on a more mocha hue. Standing at full height, she realized that, just as she was tall for a pony by nature, she was also tall for a human, though not to as extreme a degree. Possibly an inch or so taller than Apollo. Her limbs were long and athletically toned, as far as she could tell. She was surprised by the lumps on her chest, though, not sure what they were supposed to be for. Thinking back, she recalled that Trucy had them too, just not as pronounced as the ones attached to her. Still, it was the physique that the spell had crafted for her, so she assumed that they were standard equipment for a human female.

Smiling proudly at her accomplishment, Nyx whispered to Apollo, "Okay, we can go out, now."

Apollo peeked out from between his fingers, his eyes bugging out before he quickly covered them again. "That's not better," he hissed, sweating nervously as Ema got closer and closer to the door out in the other room. Pointing at Nyx, he quickly whispered, "Horn! Wings! Eyes! Clothes! You need clothes!"

Nyx blinked in confusion for a moment, reaching up to her head and back to realize that her horn and wings were still present. "Oh yeah... Shifty did mention the horn would stay, since any unicorn casting the spell would still need it in order to use magic." Most likely, the unicorn wizard hadn't expected an alicorn to use the spell, which is why wings hadn't been mentioned. Likewise, since the eyes were one of her natural features that were applied to the template, those hadn't changed at all. As for clothes, Nyx wasn't sure why that was such a big deal, considering she had been just as naked only a minute ago.

Nevertheless, she chalked it up as 'one of those things that freaks Apollo out' and took it into consideration. She felt more... 'exposed' than usual, anyway, so she wrapped her wings around her body and focused on an illusion spell. Adding clothes to her existing body would be far less taxing than creating a whole illusory persona, so she imagined an ensemble around herself matching Trucy's magician outfit, complete with a top hat to cover her horn, and her wings being disguised as a cape. It would confuse anybody who tried to give her a hug, since tactile illusion was orders of magnitude more difficult, but she hoped that it would suffice until she could get some actual clothing.

Finally, to conceal her draconic eyes, she created an illusory pair of shades based on the ones DJ PON3 always wore. "Alright, now how do I look?"

Apollo hesitantly dared to peek again, but this time there wasn't anything to immediately throw him into panic mode. "Like you're going to pull a rabbit out of a hat and then use it to pierce the heavens," he replied, but she could see him relaxing a little. "It's better than nothing at least."

Right after he said that, though, he ended up getting knocked down as the Detective on the other side of the door suddenly shoved it open. A pretty brown-haired woman in a white lab coat (who looked to be a bit older than Nyx and Trucy as far as the alicorn-turned-human could tell) scowled as she looked into the room, quickly glancing at Apollo and Nyx.

Ema looked Nyx up and down, then crossed her arms and asked, "So, you would be..."

154332222212221.content:
Twilight sighed happily as she settled into her favored reading spot, a plate of nachos resting on the table in front of her while she magically reached out for her topic of choice. Today, it was an archaeological study on pre-Celestian civilization. Even with a couple of immortals governing Equestria, and the sun princess's edict early in her reign that historical records should be periodically copied onto fresh parchments so as to preserve them for future generations, there was still so little from before that time that had survived to the present day.

Holding the tome carefully in her magic, she plucked cheese-covered chips to snack on while she opened her mind to the wonders of ancient life. Nyx was busy refurbishing Night Stone castle, Spike was helping Rarity by acting as a model for those rare occasions when she might actually get to design something for a bipedal customer, and it was the middle of the day with nothing better to do than catch up on her research. A perfect moment.

Just as she was about to take a bite of her chip, though, the library door flew open, and Twilight's ears were immediately assaulted by a high-pitched scream! Her hold on both book and chip fumbled for an instant, causing the book to dip dangerously close to the cheesy snack. Her eyes flying open wide with panic at the thought of staining the book with grease so soon after getting it, Twilight reacted quickly!

Quickly, but not necessarily in the best way.

Instead of simply lifting the book back up, she quickly reached out with a third magical field for the plate of nachos, quickly moving it out of the way so that the book could land on the table safely. In the process, though, she forgot about the lone chip she was about to bite on for all of half a second, very nearly dropping it onto the open pages! Again fearing for the book's safety, she tried to push it out of the way while simultaneously lifting the plate up and moving it to catch the chip, but with her concentration as scattered as it was, this resulted in several seconds of magically juggling book and snacks in a total panic before a good half of the nachos simply slipped off the plate and landed on her head.

Gritting her teeth as the cheese and chips sank into her mane, Twilight groaned. It didn't help at all that she still heard that piercing shriek. Pushing her bangs out of her eyes, she looked up and snapped, "WHAT?!" That was when she saw Trucy, and her jaw nearly hit the table.

Not seeming to be aware of the disaster she nearly caused, Trucy paused for breath before rushing toward Twilight with an ecstatic gleam in her eye. "Oh, wow, it's really you! The Twilight Sparkle, and you look almost just like I imagined! And you were really juggling things with your magic, that's amazing!" She grabbed one of Twilight's hooves and started shaking it vigorously enough to shake the nachos out of her mane. "I'm Trucy Wright! Oh, man, between my dad and Nyx, it almost feels like I know you already, but I still can't believe you're right here in front of me. This is such an honor!"

Nyx couldn't help but snicker to herself as her mom became the target of Trucy's adoration. Gathering her senses, Twilight stammered in a shaky voice, "Who... human... you... Nyx... Wright?! You're... you're Phoenix Wright's daughter? My books didn't say human children grew up so fast!"

This made Nyx completely lose control and bust out laughing. Unable to contain a giggle-fit, she came up to help clean the bits of crumbs and grease out of Twilight's mane while explaining, "You're not the only one who came down with a sudden case of parenthood, mom. Mr. Phoenix adopted Trucy here some time after he helped you with Rainbow Dash's trial, and she found a way to come here just to see you. About a case." She added extra emphasis to that last word, rather excited about the implications.

Just as Trucy was obviously a fan of Twilight based on her father's stories of Equestria, Nyx had loved hearing about how Rainbow Dash was saved from banishment after being accused of murder. How both Phoenix and Twilight had worked together, pushing through doubt and lies to expose the truth and protect the innocent with little more than faith in their client and the determination to see it through to the end! The way it had been described to her made it sound as thrilling as any battle she had ever read about, or even experienced first-hand. And now they were being called upon to help!

Meanwhile, Twilight was still rattled, but not being shaken anymore. Looking at Trucy's beaming face and considering the implications of her arrival, the unicorn just couldn't stay mad. Smiling a little, she replied, "Oh, wow... I haven't seen Phoenix in so long, I'd love to hear whatever you can tell me, Trucy. How has he been? And the Judge, too, is he doing well?"

Trucy giggled and found a seat for herself. It was a bit small for even a teenaged girl like her, but she made herself comfortable. "Oh, sure, I'd be happy to tell you all about it!"

Nyx looked blankly at the gray unicorn lying on the floor. For a moment, she puzzled over the mysterious mare's appearance, but then she remembered something... something she'd been told long ago. Of a unicorn mare who'd done everything in her power to pin her own crime on Rainbow Dash.

         The crime of murder...

         "Sonata!" breathed Nyx, mind going into overdrive. How was the murderess loose? Nyx had been told that Sonata had been banished to the sun for her crimes, both the murder and framing a national heroine. So her appearance here was illogical! After all, Princess Celestia had seen to Sonata's banishment herself!

         That didn't stop Nightmare Moon, a treacherous part of Nyx's mind said snidely.

         "That was different! Nightmare Moon had a thousand years to prepare her escape! Sonata's been banished for far shorter than that!"

         Perhaps it's a sign that Princess Celestia isn't perfect? her inner devil replied.

         Nyx was about to retort, but stopped herself. "No, no, I'm not going to get into an argument with myself. Last thing I need is anypony thinking I'm crazy... again." She sighed, and glared at the unicorn. "Still, wouldn't hurt to bring her to Mom, see if she can do anything about this. At the very least, Princess Celestia ought to be informed."

         Her musings were interrupted when the object of her attention began to stir. "On the other hoof, I could deal with her myself..."

*****


         "...Ugh ..." Mia Fey groaned. "Maya, Pearl, where did you bring me this time?" She groaned again as the sound of her voice exacerbated the headache she already had. "What I'd give for some aspirin right now..."

         "I'm afraid you'll have to put up with the headache," a young, female voice said harshly. "After what you pulled a few years ago, I'm surprised you have the nerve to show your face around here, Sonata."

         Mia opened her eyes at that, intent on giving whoever was speaking a piece of her mind. The fact that she found herself looking at an angry black alicorn caused her train of thought to derail for a bit. "Um, what?" she said intelligently.

         The pony snorted. "Don't play dumb, Sonata. I don't know how you escaped your banishment, but trust me, I'll fix that soon enough," she said, as her horn began to glow a deep blue.

         Mia's mind finally caught on to the situation. She was in Equestria, somehow, and this pony thought she had committed some wrong. And she had seconds to convince the alicorn otherwise. "Wait! Hold on! I'm not this 'Sonata'!" she protested.

         "Oh yeah? Well you're a dead ringer for her, that's for sure," the midnight alicorn retorted. "Right down to the fact that you're a unicorn."

         That caused another derailment of Mia's train of thought. For the first time, she looked herself over. Gray coat, check. Tail, check. Four legs, check. Horn... she reached up with a foreleg to confirm. ... check. She sighed, then thought of something. "Miss, do you happen to know what 'Sonata's Cutie Mark was?"

         This seemed to give the alicorn pause. "An eye, I believe, representing her talent for perception."

         Mia craned her neck to look at her own flank, as did the alicorn. To her relief, there wasn't an eye, but rather the image of her attorney's badge, the mirror to the own she just now realized was on her lapel. "Well, I think that settles it. I'm not this 'Sonata'."

         The alicorn had the good grace to look sheepish. "My apologies, Miss... Fey, was it? It's just, you really do look a lot like her."

         "No offense taken, miss," Mia said. "Though, I confess to being rather confused about several things. How I got to Equestria, why I'm a pony..." She tried disengaging from the body, only to find herself firmly trapped inside. "And most importantly, why I appear to be alive again."

         "Wait, what?" The taller pony blinked, confused.

         Mia sighed. "Let me explain..."

*****


         Nyx listened to Mia's story with a neutral expression. When she was finished, the alicorn sighed. "So, let me get this straight. You're a human, from Earth."

         Mia nodded.

         "And you were killed a few years ago by a guy who didn't want you letting his secrets out."

         Another nod.

         "And, despite these claims, here you are, alive, as a pony. Is that about right?"

         Yet another nod.

         "Pardon my Prench, but..." Nyx sucked in a breath. "How the buck do you expect me to believe that load of horseapples?!"

         Mia idly pushed her bangs back into place from where they'd been blown back by Nyx's yell. "Do you have any proof I'm making it up?"

         Nyx blinked. "Well, no, but you don't have any proof it's true, either!"

         Mia shrugged. "Touché. We're at an impasse, it seems. So why don't we accept my word as being true until we come across proof leading one way or the other?"

         Nyx worked her jaw for a moment, then sighed. "Alright, I guess that's as good as anything. I think I should take you back into town, to my mom. She should be able to answer a few questions for us."

         "Works for me," Mia said, standing up on all fours... or trying to. She promptly fell over, as she was unused to the stance. "But, perhaps a lesson in balance is needed first?" she asked sheepishly.

         Nyx chuckled a little, and set about giving Mia some basic pony pointers.

A few minutes later, Mia had gotten the hang of moving like a pony. Nyx watched, curious. "Well, at least part of your story is more believable now. Having to teach a grown mare how to walk is not something I ever thought I'd have to do."

         Mia chuckled. "Well, at least nopony else is here to see my humiliation." She cantered around the room, getting comfortable with the movements. "Okay, I think I've got this. Now, should we head into Ponyville?"

         "Before we do... a question arises," Nyx said, fixing Mia with a Look that warranted capitalization. "How do you know about Equestria, if you're from another world?"

         Mia shrugged. "As a spirit, I get around. I've spoken to Princess Celestia on a few occasions. I told her about my apprentice, Phoenix Wright, and - "

         Nyx cut her off with a sudden gasp. "You trained Phoenix Wright?!" The alicorn was on her hooves, looking down at Mia. The height difference between the two, coupled with Nyx's catlike eyes and black hide, made it a very intimidating sight.

         Mia sweated, deciding honesty was the best policy as she looked up at the demon before her. "Um... yes?" She braced herself for whatever wrathful judgement Nyx had for her.

         She was unprepared for Nyx to let out a squee of delight, and wrap her in a bone-grinding hug. "OmigoshomigoshomiGOSH!! This is so awesome! I'm meeting the mare who trained Phoenix Wright! Eeeeee!!!"

         Mia gasped a little. "Um... Miss Nyx? Air?"

         "Oh! Sorry!" Nyx let go, blushing in embarrassment. "Sorry I got carried away, it's just... Phoenix Wright is one of my personal heroes. And to meet the mare who trained him... you must be legendary on your world!"

         "Eh-heh, not really. I mean, kinda hard to be legendary when you're dead," Mia said, scratching the back of her neck with a hoof.

         Before Nyx could comment, there was a gust of wind, resolving into a rainbow-maned pegasus. "Heya, Nyx! There you are! Twilight wanted me to check up on you, and - " The newcomer cut herself off as her eyes fell on the other pony in the room.

         Mia blinked, as the pegasus's irises shrunk, then dilated. When the blue mare started snorting and pawing the ground, that was when Mia realized she was about to come under attack.

*****


         Rainbow Dash couldn't believe it. Here was the mare who had very nearly ruined her whole life. Here! In Castle Nightstone! She was supposed to be banished to the sun! Well, it didn't matter. She'd get the chance to correct this little oversight of Princess Celestia's. And revenge would be sweet.

         Rainbow sprang at the mare, shrilling a war-cry. Her target yelped and scrambled to get away, but she was far too slow to escape. Rainbow was on her in a moment, a blue forehoof lashing out to strike the grey mare in the face. Before the blow could land, though, a blue aura caught it, and dragged the prismatic mare away from her target. Rainbow glared at the alicorn. "Nyx, what the hay?!"

         "She's not who you think she is, Rainbow," Nyx replied. "She's a different pony!"

         "How would you know who I was thinking she was?" the weathermare asked. "You weren't around when it happened."

         "Maybe not, but Mom told me all about what happened. I made the same mistake you did, assuming she was Sonata, but she's not! The Cutie Mark is different!"

         Rainbow blinked, and scrutinized the grey mare. She was on her side, giving Rainbow a good look at her cutie mark, which was some weird golden disc thing. And the mare she was thinking of had... "Oh. Omigosh, I am SO sorry!" Rainbow exclaimed, realizing her mistake. "I totally confused you with somepony else!"

         "Let me guess... a mare named Sonata?" the grey look-alike asked. "Nyx made the same mistake, as she said. What did this Sonata do that was so terrible, anyway?"

         "She committed murder, and tried to frame me for it," Rainbow said bluntly.

         The other mare blinked. "Well, that would certainly explain the hostility, if I resemble her that much," she mused. She held out a hoof to Rainbow. "Mia Fey. A pleasure to meet you."

         The prismatic mare blinked, then smiled. "Rainbow Dash. Again, sorry for the mistake."

         "No worries," Mia replied. Then she blinked, and looked at Rainbow closely. "Ah-ha, so you're the one Phoenix had to defend in court here, eh?"

         "Huh? How'd you know Nix defended me in court?"

         Mia blinked, then looked at the alicorn. "Wait, I'm confused. I thought the court case was before you came along?"

         Rainbow face-hooved, realizing her error. "No, no, not her! 'Nix' was a nickname I came up with for Phoenix when he was defending me. Haven't thought about it in a while, and didn't think about the confusion it could cause these days."

         "Ah, that makes sense," Mia nodded. "Anyway, I know Phoenix because I'm the one who taught him everything he knows about being a lawyer."

         "Whoa..." Rainbow's eyes bugged out slightly. "So, he learned everything from you?"

1543322222222222212.content:
Nyx cocked her head quizzically at the creature she saw lying on the ground. It wasn't that she didn't know what it was, far from it. She'd seen depictions of humans before, mostly in stories about them living across the sea with other ponies. Nyx thought their physical descriptions ridiculous, to be quite honest. A race of bipedal beings who could walk around without even a tail for balance? She'd seen feats that Pinkie Pie had done that made more sense.

         Still, even by what she'd read about humans, the one on the floor was strange. She (Nyx assumed it was female, judging from the softness of the face) had perhaps the most ridiculous mane - hairstyle, that is; reddish orange and long, but it was done up in a bizarre ponytail. Rather than hanging back behind the head, it was tied off to dangle to one side. In addition, the human wore yellow and white clothes (blast if Nyx could remember what each article of clothing was called, humans had so many), along with a black glove with a blue interior on her right hand. Around her neck hung a necklace with a blue... jewel? No, the blue area of the necklace didn't look like any jewel Nyx had ever seen before. It didn't sparkle in the light from Nyx's horn, for one thing, and it was too smooth on its surface.

         As the human groaned and began to stir, Nyx put such thoughts out of her mind, instead settling on more important matters. Who she is and how she got here, for starters, the black alicorn mused.

*****


         "Ow..." moaned Athena as she regained consciousness. "Note to self: never let Apollo choose the post-victory restaurant. What did I even eat, anyway?"

         "Apparently something bad enough you blocked it out," mused a female voice from nearby.

         "Apparently," agreed Athena. There was a moment's pause. Wait a tic... that wasn't Trucy's voice. Heck, that doesn't belong to any girl I know! So who...? She opened her eyes. She blinked.

         The black horse-like apparition with cat-like blue eyes blinked back.

         "Um..." began Athena. "Were you the one who spoke just now?"

         The horse-like creature nodded. "That's right. My name's Nyx. And you are?" It - she? It certainly sounded female - held out a hoof.

         "Uh... I'm Athena," replied the shell-shocked lawyer. She reached out to the hoof, half-expecting it to vanish. But no, it remained solid, even as she shook it.

         "Pleased to meet you, Athena!" Nyx chirped. She then cocked her head. "Are you alright? You look a little dazed."

         "Dazed... right... one way to put it," muttered Athena. She looked Nyx over. The lawyer had never been a fan of Greek mythology, but even she knew what unicorns were, and the long horn identified the black mare as one. Except, a glance at Nyx's sides revealed wings, and the winged horse Pegasus was the one known for those. What did you call a horse that had both a horn and wings?

         Almost as if sensing Athena's thoughts, Nyx smirked. "Never seen an alicorn in the flesh before?"

         "Alicorn?" Athena echoed, testing the word.

         The black mare nodded. "It's the term for a pony that has both a horn and a pair of wings, like I do." She extended her wings partially for emphasis, before folding them against her sides again.

         "Wait, pony? You're a pony?" The word triggered something in Athena's memories, a picture she'd found once. "Don't suppose you know of a human named Phoenix Wright?"

         Whatever Athena had expected, a huge grin and a squee from Nyx wasn't it. "You know Phoenix Wright?! He's one of my personal heroes! Omigosh, how's he been? Has he defended many more innocent people? Is he still practicing law? Is he - "

         "Whoa, whoa!" Athena held up her hands, smiling slightly at the alicorn's exuberance. "So, I take it you know him?"

         The mare blushed, visible even through her black coat. "Well, I know of him. He defended one of my friends from murder charges, before I met her."

         Athena nodded. "Yeah, that sounds like my boss, alright."

         Nyx's eyes went round. "Your 'boss'? You mean, you work under him?"

         Athena nodded, giving Nyx a 'peace' sign, along with a grin. "That's right! Athena Cykes, attorney at law!"

         Nyx smiled. "Well, let's get you to Ponyville, and see if my mom can figure out how you got here, and how to send you home."

         "Your mom?" Athena asked with a blink. "Why would she know all that?"

         Nyx's smile grew. "She's Twilight Sparkle, student of Princess Celestia, and one of the most powerful unicorns alive today. If anypony can figure this out, she can."
1543322222222222212.title: Turnabout for Two: Introductions

15433222222222222121.content:
"So, you're one of Phoenix's employees?" asked Twilight.

         Athena nodded. "Gotta say, it's kinda surreal, being in this place, talking to ponies. Especially one of the ones from that photo of his."

         The journey back to Ponyville had been smooth, free of any notable interruptions. A few ponies had said hello to Nyx, and given Athena curious stares, but otherwise there was little blocking their progress to the library. Twilight had given Athena one of those stares, until Nyx mentioned who she worked for, at which point the unicorn perked up noticeably.

         "So he still has that picture, eh?" Twilight mused with a smile. "I'm glad. It means a lot to me that he kept it."

         "Don't see why he wouldn't," Athena said. "I mean, from what Nyx told me, this place was the site of one of his biggest wins in any court."

         Twilight nodded. "That's right. He not only proved my friend Rainbow Dash innocent, but he proved that the 'murder' was actually an accidental death. All in an effort to keep an innocent mare from being sent to prison for a crime she didn't commit."

         The human smiled. "Yeah, my boss is really big on justice. The most important thing, to him, is to discover the truth behind any case, and he doesn't stop until he succeeds. His philosophy has kinda rubbed off on me and Apollo."

         "Who's Apollo?" asked Nyx, coming in from the kitchen with a tea set.

         "Apollo's the other lawyer that works under Mr. Wright," Athena explained, taking a cup and saucer for herself after Nyx had poured the tea. "His full name's Apollo Justice."

         "How fitting, a lawyer named Justice," Spike chuckled, as he organized the books in the library.

         Athena rolled her eyes. "It is kinda funny, now that I think about it. But, anyway... Don't suppose you can send me home?" she asked Twilight.

         "Certainly," the lavender unicorn nodded. "It'll take me a little bit to set up the spell, but it shouldn't be too long. No more than a day or so."

         "Let's hope nothing happens between now and then," joked Nyx.

         Spike groaned, facepalming. "Nyx, why did you say that? Now something is gonna happen!"

         The alicorn rolled her eyes. "Oh, come on, Spike, you're being paranoid."

         Athena grimaced. "Actually, I'm gonna have to side with Spike on this. Every time someone - or somepony - says something like 'what could possibly happen', something really bad happens."

         "Well, paranoia notwithstanding, if all goes well, you'll be back home by this time tomorrow," Twilight said.

         Both Athena and Spike groaned in dismay. "I'm going to get sucked into something here now, I just know it," moaned the lawyer.

         "Such pessimism," Nyx clucked in disapproval. "You know what you need, Athena? You need to relax. I'll take you to the spa."

         Athena perked up immediately. "A spa? Count me in! I haven't been to one in... gosh, have I ever been to one?"

         Twilight chuckled. "You two have fun. I'll let you know if anything major happens."

*****


         About an hour later, Athena and Nyx, along with Rarity (who had been at the spa for other reasons) were in the middle of the steam room, all of them feeling very relaxed. The fashionista had taken to Athena's hairstyle and dress sense almost immediately. Likewise, the lawyer found it nice to talk to Rarity, as Phoenix and Apollo weren't very good about answering appearance-related questions honestly.

         "Well, you can hardly blame them, dear," Rarity said, when Athena voiced this. "Stallions, no matter where they are from, will never answer such questions with honesty. Although, admittedly, Phoenix could dress rather sharp. And his hair! Goodness, I remember how it seemed to scream, 'Take That!'." She giggled. "Ah, if he were a pony, I would ask if he were in the market, as it were."

         Athena flinched. She hadn't pried much into her boss's past, but she'd read some old case files involving him. She didn't know how well over the whole 'Dahlia' thing Phoenix was, but she didn't want to risk it. "That might not be a good idea, Rarity. Phoenix had some... girl trouble in the past, and it might have jaded him to the idea of dating."

         Rarity pouted a little. "Oh, that's too bad. Might I ask what sort of girl trouble?"

         Athena thought it over, then just decided to be direct. "The girl he thought was his girlfriend tried to frame him for a murder she committed."

         Both of the mares' eyes widened. "Well. That certainly qualifies as 'girl trouble', though not in the usual sense," Rarity admitted. "How did that turn out?"

         "He was found innocent, she was found guilty, and she was... put to death a few years later," Athena said, wincing a little at the last part.

         Both ponies looked a little ill. "Put to death?" Nyx croaked. "I mean, I know she killed someone, but still..."

         Athena sighed. "That's Earth law for you. We're not very keen on the idea of murderers running loose, so we make sure they can't."

         The alicorn shuddered. "Here in Equestria, a murderer is just banished to the moon or the sun."

         The human blinked at that. "Well. If we could do that on Earth, it would certainly be an effective way to deal with them. But space travel on Earth is extremely limited."

         The three continued talking throughout their visit to the spa, blissfully unaware of what was to come.
15433222222222222121.title: Turnabout for Two: Introductions, Part 2

choices: Follow Nyx and Athena to Canterlot
Follow Twilight and/or Spike.
154332222222222221211.content:
I don't think I've ever been as relaxed as when I left the Ponyville Spa, with two ponies flanking me. I followed Nyx back to the library, while Rarity peeled off back to her home to prepare for a trip to Canterlot, Equestria's capital. I nearly burst out laughing when I heard that; the pun was just too obvious. Rarity's a fashion designer, and she was to meet with a prospective client up at the capital, as well as check in on her younger sister, Sweetie Belle. I admit, I'm a little jealous. I don't have any siblings, either to worry about or have worry over me.

Ironic, then, that soon I would worry over one unicorn's fate... and that I would play a key part in determining said fate.

*****


         Athena yawned as she cricked her neck. The guest bed hadn't exactly been comfortable, having been designed for ponies, but Athena had made do by curling up in the bed and sleeping on her side. The bad news was that she woke up somewhat sore in her joints, and so she was forced to massage them to get them working at full efficiency.

         "Morning, Athena," Nyx said as the human came downstairs. "Sleep well?"

         "Not too bad,"Athena replied. "Don't suppose there's a chance for breakfast before I go home?"

         Some chuckling preceded Twilight out of the kitchen, followed by a tea set. "Spike's working on it, don't worry. Also, since Phoenix was last here, I read up on human dietary habits, just in case I ever had to host one again, so you won't be offered hay."

         The lawyer grinned wryly as Twilight poured the tea. "Thanks for that."

         There was a sudden belch and flash of green light from the kitchen. Athena blinked at this, but Nyx and Twilight hardly batted an eye. "Who is it from, Spike?" asked the librarian.

         Spike came in, holding a rolled-up scroll with an official-looking seal holding it together. "Princess Celestia, who else?"

         As Twilight took the scroll in her magic and Spike went back to the kitchen, Athena leaned over to Nyx. "Did I miss something?"

         "Spike has a unique flame that he can use to send letters simply by exhaling it," the alicorn replied. "He used to only be able to send and receive such things from Princess Celestia, but he recently learned how to send letters to other ponies as well."

         "Huh," Athena mused. "That sounds convenient."

         The sound of Twilight's teacup crashing against the table caught their attention. The unicorn's eyes were wide as she re-read the letter. "No... no, this has to be a mistake!" she breathed. "This can't be happening, not again!"

         "Twilight? What's wrong?" asked Athena with a frown.

         The librarian looked up. "It... it's from Princess Celestia. She... she says that there's been a murder in Canterlot!"

         Athena groaned. Of course, I knew something like this would happen. Then a thought occured to her. "Why would the Princess be telling you?"

         Twilight opened and closed her mouth a few times. "Because... because the suspect they've arrested... is Rarity!"

         There was a loud *crash!* from the kitchen, and Spike ran back in. "Say what?!" he yelped, at the same time as Nyx and Athena.

         "Th-that's what it says!" Twilight insisted, as she held the letter out for them to read:

My faithful student,

         I hate to be the bearer of bad news, but a situation has emerged in Canterlot. One of the city's elite pianists, Ivory Strokes, was found murdered in his home late last night. The autopsy is still being performed, but a cursory inspection of the body has led me to believe he was struck with a blunt object with enough force to snap his neck.

         I normally wouldn't trouble you with this, but two circumstances force me to relay word to you: first, Ivory Strokes is the brother of Ponyville's mayor, Ivory Scroll. She should be informed of this by a friend. Secondly, your friend Rarity has been arrested as the prime suspect. Given the trouble you had finding a lawyer during Rainbow Dash's trial, I believe it would be best if you tried to contact Phoenix Wright once more.

         I personally do not believe that Rarity could have done this. However, I will not be presiding as judge; instead, I will be fetching the Judge from Rainbow Dash's trial, and informing him of the situation. He is the one that will need convincing of Rarity's innocence.

Your loving teacher,
Princess Celestia


         There was silence as the news was digested. "There's no way Rarity would do this," Athena finally remarked. "I've known her less than a day, and I already know she wouldn't do this!"

         "I agree," Twilight said, getting over her shock. "Spike, I want you to round up the rest of the girls, and get them ready for a trip to Canterlot. After I visit the mayor, I'll prepare a spell to contact Phoenix and - "

         Athena coughed. "You do know I'm right here, and could probably represent Rarity just as well, right?"

         Twilight blinked. "But, didn't you want to get home?"

         Athena smirked. "Now what kind of friend would I be if I left Rarity hanging? Going home can wait for a bit."

         Twilight considered this, then nodded. "Alright, that's one thing off my mind. Nyx, can you take Athena to Canterlot ahead of us, so she can get Rarity's approval?"

         Nyx nodded. "You can count on me, Mom!" She and Athena left the library, followed by Spike. Twilight was the last to leave, heading for Town Hall.

Nyx gasped as she saw the lavender coat and blue mane of the pony in front of her. "Twilight?!" she yelped, before pausing. Wait a minute, this doesn't make sense! I left Twilight back at the library! What would she be doing out here, and in this condition?

         Her cry had roused the unicorn somewhat, who began to stir, groaning. Nyx's eyes widened as the shifting revealed the familiar starburst cutie mark. Yet... something was different. As the unicorn started to rise, Nyx saw the squared-off snout and the more stocky build of a stallion, rather than the trim form of her adoptive mother. Flabbergasted, she stood there as the stallion double of Twilight rose to his hooves, grumbling.

         "Very smooth, Dusk. Dunno what you did, but whatever it was failed spectacularly," he muttered. He opened his eyes, blinking them for a second to reveal the same violet shade as Twilight's. This was before his irises shrank considerably and he jumped away from her with a yelp. "GAAAAAH!"

         The sudden motion and cry startled Nyx out of her stupor, and she held up her hooves in a placating gesture. "Whoa, whoa! I'm not going to hurt you!"

         The unicorn didn't appear to hear her. "I don't know how you're here, but you won't take me, Sable Noctis
For the record, Conner Cogwork's version of Nightmare Moon was originally called Anarchy Apollo. However, Apollo is a SUN deity, which makes little sense being applied to a creature of the MOON. Therefore, I've decided to rename him here.
!"

         Nyx blinked repeatedly, as the unicorn attempted to charge up his magic for a spell. However, everything he tried fizzled out before manifesting. She sighed. "Look, whatever you're trying to do, it's not working. So why don't you calm down and tell me who you are?"

         The stallion blinked a few times. "Wait a second... You're a mare!"

         Nyx arched an eyebrow. "Last I checked, yes I was."

         "But... then you can't be Sable Noctis," he elaborated. He looked contrite. "I'm sorry for any confusion, you just have quite the resemblence to him."

         This did little to clear up Nyx's confusion. "I've never even heard of Sable Noctis," she said. "I've been compared to Nightmare Moon, but not whoever you're talking about."

         The unicorn's jaw fell open. "Nightmare... Moon?" he repeated. "Never heard of her."

         Nyx's eyebrows flew clear up to her maneline. "How can you not have heard of her? The Mare in the Moon, patron of Nightmare Night, evil side of Princess Luna, wanted to bring eternal night, is this ringing any bells?"

         He shook his head. "You're the one not making sense! I've heard of the Colt in the Moon, not the Mare, and last I checked, Sable Noctis is the one who wanted to bring eternal night to Equestria! I stopped him with my friends, Applejack, Rainbow Blitz, Elusive, Butterscotch, and Berry Bubble."

         The unicorn puffed out his chest slightly. "I'm Dusk Shine, personal student to our benevolent ruler Prince Solaris, and librarian at the Ponyville Books and Branches library!"

Second, what you said about 'Sable Noctis' is identical to what we know of Nightmare Moon here. Third, you and your friends are all mares here with different, yet fairly similar names."

         Dusk blinked several times in succession. "So... I'm in a dimension where everypony's gender has been switched?"

         "That appears to be the case, yes."

         Dusk nearly collapsed in relief. "Thank Solaris! I thought for a moment I was dealing with a madmare." He blinked, and looked sheepish. "Um, no offense."

         Nyx chuckled. "None taken." She held out a hoof. "I'm Nyx, reincarnation of Nightmare Moon turned good."

         Dusk gaped. "Uh... you're kidding, right?"

         She chuckled. "Nope. Why, what am I called in your dimension?"

Nyx's eyes widened as she beheld the Alicorn slumped before her. "Huh-buh wha?!" She thrust her wings down, propelling herself to check on the... colt? 'I thought Alicorns could only be female,' She thought to herself.

"Ohhhh...." The Alicorn groaned as he tried to move, and Nyx leaned in close to check him over. His royal black coat made it difficult to see any wounds, but he had the faint traces of scars faded after years of growing and healing, and a slightly burnt stench permeated the air, likely the effect of a miscast spell.

"Are you alright, uh..." Nyx tilted her head, stopping herself from saying 'dude,' since she wasn't familiar with him.

"... I'm fine," the colt answered in a soft rumble, like the gentle beating of a drum. "I just... oww... didn't cast a spell right." He looked up at Nyx, not seeing her wings. "Why are you in my... er, Ponyville's Castle?"

"Your castle?" Nyx' wings flared, the hairs of her coat bristling slightly at the gall of this... this stranger saying that the castle she and her friends have been working on for so long was his! "This is mine and my friends' castle! We've been fixing it up for months!"

The colt wasn't listening any more, instead staring at her wings. "That's... that's impossible..." Nyx was about to throw a very strong rebuttal at the unwanted guest- namely, 'it is so possible!' - when he reached out and brushed one of her wings with a hoof. "Only stallions can be Alicorns..." He stopped poking at her wing and brought the hoof to ground, pushing himself to stand. "How in the name of Solaris' beard are you a filly Alicorn?"

Nyx blinked, briefly wondering who Solaris was before regaining her composure. "Well, of course I'm a filly! All Alicorns are female. Princess Cadance is female, so are Princesses Celestia and Luna." Nyx tapped a hoof against the ground with a self-assuring hmmpf.

The colt worked his jaw for a second, before replying slowly, "You mean... Prince Rythmus, Prince Solaris, and Prince Apollo?" The colt just shook his head, snorting dismissively. "Whatever. I'm done for today. I need to get home."

"Where do you live? What's your name?" Despite her confusion on how this impossible colt could exist, she still wanted to learn more about him. Her years as Twilight's daughter had done nothing to slow her desire to learn more.

The colt struck a heroic pose; his nose thrust into the air, his wings spread, and a sly smirk playing on his lips. "My name is Nox, and I'm the Hero of Ponyville!"

Nyx gaped for a second before shaking herself out of it and glaring at 'Nox'. She was going to show this... this boy who's boss, and she was going to do so in the most diplomatically amazing way possible! "Nuh-uh!"

"Yeah-huh!"

"Nuh-uh!"

"Yeah-huh!"

"Nuh-uh!"

"Yeah-huh!"

"Nuh-uh!"

"Yeah-huh, times a hundred!"

"Nuh-uh times infinity!"

Nox, fuming over his sudden verbal loss, turned to look away from the frustrating filly- only to see her cutie mark was a shield, just like his. "Hey, you have a cutie mark like mine!"

"Really?" Nyx looked at her own flank. On it was a midnight blue shield, with a waning crescent moon stamped in the middle. On the colt's flank was a similar shield, though the crescent moon was waxing, not waning. "Well, they are similar... but mine's cooler!"

"No way!"

Yes way! I got it for doing something super cool, and some other stuff."

"I got mine in a cooler way, though. I did something super-duper cool to get it!"

The two glared at each other, ready to shout out their greatest offenses and defenses possible (once again, being 'uh-huh' and 'nuh-uh,' respectively), when they heard the unmistakable sound of a draconic growl. "S-spike?" Nyx called out fearfully, Nox's question of "S-spines?" coming at the same moment.

A large, red, smirking dragon lumbered into the room, followed closely by a pair of bigger dragons. "Well, well, well," The red one said snidely. "Look at we found. Snacks," he and his cronies laughed darkly.

Nyx and Nox' initial fear washed away, replaced with anger at the intrusion in the castle. "Hey, dunderheads!" They shouted in stereo. "Get outta my castle or I'll stuff your faces with Mud cakes!"

As the two Alicorns blinked at each other in surprise, the red dragon laughed. "Oh-ho, this snack bites back! Let's see if it's less feisty in the belly."

The dragons all moved into the room, and Nyx an Nox gulped, backing into the corner by a large, ornate window. "N-nox..."

"Y-yes?"

"Should... should we run?" Nyx dropped into a slightly awkward battle stance as three... four... five dragons all lumbered into the large room, trapping them in a corner between a window and a wall.

"Well, I... I think that we should f-fight, right? We don't want them ruining the castle! What do you think?"

Nyx' stance shifted a bit as she tried to keep all the dragons and her fellow Alicorn in her vision. "Well, I think that..."
1552.title: Nox 3 times! (On the ceiling if you want me~!)

choices: Oh no, it's Twilight! (She seems angry...)
Oh, thank Celestia, Twilight's here! (A tad worried, but glad Nyx is okay.)
15522.content:
Nyx' stance shifted a bit as she tried to keep all the dragons and her fellow Alicorn in her vision. "Well, I think that... that this is MY castle, and these dragons are intruding on MY property!" Her attack stance shifted from clumsy and frightful to majestic and furious.

"Oh, your castle, huh? We were just gonna eat the gems in it, and if you ponies fly away like the scared brats you are, then we'll just-" The red dragon never got to finish as Nyx's buck sent him flying. "Hoo-wee! Working the farm every year with Applejack paid off!"

Nox smiled at his female ally. "Heh, that's what you call a buck? Lemme show you how a stallion does it."

"Is that a challenge, buddy?"

"Only if you think you can keep up!"

The two ponies glared at each other, smirks growing on their faces as the dragon Nyx had kicked stumbled back to his feet. "Well, what're you waiting for," the dragon growled. "Get 'em!"

Nyx and Nox each darted out of the way, flying around the dragons in opposite directions before swooping in and bucking the purple one out the window with a crash. Nyx smiled slyly. "We were planning on knocking out that window anyways."

"White one," Nox called, and Nyx swooped out of the way as he blasted the dragon with magical lightning.

Nox smiled, having knocked the dragon out with one blast, when a magical ball of ice flew past him to knock a fat brown dragon out of the air. "Don't worry, I got your back!"

The red dragon roared, fire billowing out of its mouth, both Alicorns barely getting shields up in time to keep themselves from being burnt.

~~~

In Ponyville's Books and Branches Library, Twilight was busily distracting herself with another read-through of a few older spell scrolls, all pertaining to the earliest attempted uses of Flyte and Cloudwalking on Earth ponies and Unicorns when she heard the dull, almost muted sound of a roar. "Spike?"

Spike looked up from the book he was reading. "... Yeah, Twilight? Did'ja need something?"

Twilight looks at him for a second before shaking her head. "No, not really. Just wondering if you were hungry. I thought I heard your stomach growling."

"Nah, I'm good. I think I had too many pop-rocks at the party last night." Spike snorted, a small pop and crackle emanating from his nose. "I think that filling sapphires with small amounts of gunpowder was both the smartest and craziest thing I've ever seen Pinkie do, when it came to cooking for dragons." Spike burped, a fireworks show in miniature dancing before him for a second. "The only problem is that she didn't tell me at first, and I ate the whole bowl..."

Twilight giggled, returning to her scrolls. "Alright, then. must've been my imagina-"

"TWILIGHT!"

"GYAH!"

"UUURRRP!"

"P-Pinkie Pie?! Don't do that, please!"

"Sorry, Twilight, but there's smoke and fire coming from Nyx's castle! I thought I should warn yo-" In a blur that even Pinkie could appreciate, Twilight was out the door. "Well, the cavalry's been sent. Have a good afternoon, Spike~!" She happily hopped into the Library's closet, where a whirring noise was heard for a second, before the door opend again, with nopony behind it.

Spike just raised the book to cover his face, thinking, 'this will all be over soon, it's okay... Nyx will be just fine.'

~~~

With a thwack, a slam, and a kra-kaTHOOM, All the dragons had been knocked unconscious. Then, using their combined strength, the two Alicorns sent them flying like a hammer-throw deep into the Everfree Forest. "Yeah, we did it!" Nyx and Nox shared a hoof-bump before their revelry was cut short by a bright flash, and a shout. "NYX!"
15522.title: I get Nox down, but I get up again!

choices: Nox Knocks Knockin' on Heaven's Door (Meet the Princesses!)
Donde. Esta. La Biblioteca. (Meet Twilight first.)
15523.content:
"Well, I think that, you know, we should ru-oof!" Nyx fell to the ground in a daze, having tried to break through the stained glass window, but it was too strong. "Dang it, these windows are enchanted! Ugh! We can't break them unless we got it out of the windowsill first, and we don't have time!"

Nox looked at the filly Alicorn and gave a shrewd but slightly fearful smile. "Then we shall fight like cornered rats, and show these dragons the powers of our joined fury!"

A purple dragon with blonde hair laughed. "Hey, Garble, Look at this. They think their puny pony power's gonna get us. Huh huh huh."

The red one, Garble, laughed too, and took a step closer. "Well, that won't do them any good. We're bigger than them, what do they think they're gonna do?"

Nyx and Nox shared a look. "Know any attack spells, like magic weapons?" Nox asked. Nyx nodded. "Alright. Ice?" Another nod. "Good. Let's do it."

Both Alicorns spread their wings and started weaving their magic, trying to come up with something they hoped would be good for attack. With a dual cry, four scimitars made of ice and magic appeared in the air.

Nyx inspected the weapons as the dragons paused for a second. "Well, not exactly Sword of Dragon-Slaying, but I think it gets the point across." She then smacked Garble on the head with the flat of one of her swords, swinging the other one low to sweep his feet from beneath him. Nox took to the air in the fairly tall room, letting loose his scimitars at the purple dragon, its blonde hair getting clipped as he ducked out of the way of one blade, the other coming around to give him a faceful of ice.

The purple dragon slumped into Garble, who was already struggling to get out of the daze Nyx had put him in. "Ooohhh.... you ponies are gonna regret that..."

Thunk! With that, Garble slumped to the ground and laid still. Two of their numbers down, the last three dragons decided to fan out, letting the two Alicorns out of the corner.

Big mistake. WHACK! FWOK! CRUNCH! The last dragon fell to the floor, unconscious, and Nyx and Nox sighed in relief. "Hey, Nyx. Let's not do that again, alright?"

Nyx giggled and let her weapons disappear. "Yes, I think that it would be most unwise. Though, we should really get some help with these dragons. I bet Spike could take 'em somewhere to talk some 'dragon sense' into them."

Nox nodded. "Sure, I guess. How're you gonna get him, though? Want me to stay here and guard them?"

Nyx smiled and brought out a piece of parchment and a pencil. "I always carry some writing utensils with me, just in case something bad happens. And duh; I live with a dragon. I gotta know how to send him a message!" A quick note and a flash of emerald fire later, the two were once again faced with a sense of unease.

"So... since Spike's coming over for these dweebs, what should we do?" Nyx 'hmms' as she tapped a hoof to her chin.

"Wanna meet the Princesses?"

Nox shifts a little on his hooves. "Well..."
15523.title: It's a Trap!

choices: Nebby
Midnight
More options! MORE!!!
1553.content:
1. A little blue unicorn colt with two-tone white and purple hair, napping peacefully on the castle floor, though the rest of the room is a wreck. (Nebula Sparkle, son of Twilight and Trixie from "The Greatest Gift" http://dekomaru.deviantart.com/)

2. A teenaged purple mare about Nyx's age with two-tone blue and purple hair. (Midnight, daughter of Twilight and Trixie (and technically Luna, too) from "Out In The Cold" http://esperderek.deviantart.com/)
1553.title: A alt-universe sibling? And the parents are...?!

choices: they head straight to the library.
Nebula gets hungry, so they make a stop.
15531.content:
Nyx blinked at the sight of the sleeping colt. She was surprised to see a child there, but even more surprised that he was completely unfamiliar to her. And he was napping so cutely and peacefully despite the rest of the room being wrecked. Where had he come from? And where were his parents? Whoever they were, they were probably going to be worried, if they weren't already. Leaning down, she gently nosed the little unicorn awake.

Slowly opening his eyes, the child yawned and mutters, "Aww, izzit morning already...?" He sleepily looked around before realizing, "This isn't my room..." Then he looked up at Nyx and said, "Uh-oh... I'm in twouble, aren't I?"

The alicorn looked down at him with a bemused grin and replied, "Well, I hope not. You shouldn't be wandering around in places like this by yourself, though. My name's Nyx. What's yours?"

"Nebbah-la!" he exclaimed cheerfully.

Nyx smiled warmly. "'Nebula', huh? That's a great name! So, Nebula, where are your parents?" Well, at least the unicorn wasn't scared. The question still remained as to how he got there in the first place. Still, getting him back home was the first priority.

"Prob'ly at home," he replied. "You're room's really dirty!"

Nyx laughed a little. "Well, it was clean enough yesterday, and it's not even my room. Anyway, where's your home?"

Nebula thought for a moment. Then another moment. As Nyx waited patiently, he eventually replied, "I'unno!"

Nyx groaned. Okay, so the kid was too young to have memorized his address. "Well, how about your parents? What are their names?"

Unfortunately, while his answer came much more easily this time, it wasn't any more informative. "Mommy," he told her with a bright smile.

Nyx sweatdropped a little. "I see... okay, well, do you know your daddy's name?"

"Mommy!"

"No, no, your daddy. What's your father's name?"

"Mommy!"

Nyx facehoofed. "Okay, this is the wrong line of questions, I guess." She thought for a second, then leaned down to ask Nebula, "Alright, Nebula, did your parents ever tell you what to do if you got lost?"

This proved more fruitful as he thought back and recited, "They told me t' go stwaight to the libary!"

Nyx sighed in relief. "Well, that's convenient! Tell you what, why don't I help you get back there, and then we can find your parents?" He nodded cheerfully as she lowered her body, offering her back. She couldn't help but giggle a little as he climbed up and clung to her.

Once she felt he was secure, Nyx smiled and started trotting out of the castle, getting back onto the path to Ponyville. She always had fun playing with kids, and got along well with the younger Cutie Mark Crusaders, but she'd never met a colt or filly that was so calm and cheerful about waking up in a strange place before. He was so at ease, it was utterly disarming.

As they approached the outskirts of Ponyville...
15531.title: Nebby

choices: ... City Hall. The mayor isn't going to like THIS.
... The Great and Powerful Trixie's show wagon!
155312.content:
As they got back into town, Nyx just made a few brief pauses along the way to ask ponies she met if they recognized the foal of her back, but none of them could say they'd ever seen the little blue unicorn. After thanking the fifth pony she asked, Nebula's stomach started growling against her back, causing her to say, "Oops, are you getting hungry?" When he nodded, she smiled at him. "Well, let's fix that. We can make a quick stop at Sugarcube Corner before we get to the library. I'm sure Pinkie Pie'll like to meet... of course, why didn't I think of that? Pinkie knows everypony, so she's bound to know your parents!"

Nebula smiled cheerfully and exclaimed, "Yay, cupcakes!" Nyx couldn't help but giggle as she changed direction slightly, trotting down the road toward the shop.

Soon, they entered and were surrounded by the smell of sugary treats. They had showed up before the usual lunch rush, so Pinkie Pie was able to break away from the couple of customers who were already there to come greet them. "Hi, Nyx! I didn't know you were a foalsitter. Is that what you've been doing up at the castle?"

Nebula waved with a cheerful, "Hi, Pinkie," while Nyx laughed and replied, "Oh, not exactly. The little guy was lost, so I'm trying to find his house. He got hungry along the way, so I thought I'd stop by here. You wouldn't happen to know where he lives, would you?"

Pinkie stroked her chin as she looked Nebula over, making several contorted 'concentration' faces that made Nebula giggle as he tried to imitate them. "Hmmm, nope! They must not live in Ponyville, because I'd recognize him if he were from around here." Suddenly, the pink pony let out a horrified gasp! "Oh my gosh! That means his parents are probably here in town, searching for their beloved foal... and I haven't thrown them a welcome party yet!"

Nebula gasped at that, clearly sensing the terrible ramifications of this. Nyx chuckled nervously and replied, "Uh... Pinkie, before you go off to do that, can we get a couple of cupcakes for the road? He said his parents told him to go to the library if he got lost, so I'm going to take him there and see if they show up."

"Yes! Yes, perfect!" Pinkie Pie said with enthusiastic focus. "We'll make it a 'Welcome to Ponyville and here's your son back' party! Here, try these, I made them just ten minutes ago!" With that, she offered Nyx and Nebula a couple of heavily-frosted cupcakes before pulling out a notepad to start furiously scribbling out plans.

"A-heh... thanks, Pinkie," Nyx said, leaving a few bits on the counter to pay for them as she left, floating her own cupcake in front of her to take dainty bits as she walked.

Nebula wasn't so well-mannered, instead gleefully scarfing the cupcake and getting crumbs and frosting all over his face. After a few bites, he licked the remnants from his lips and made a happy, contented sound... but then the sugar rush started to kick in, and he hopped off of Nyx's back to start bouncing around.

"Thank you, Nyx, thank you thank you thank you, Nyx!" he exclaimed, hopping about as his horn started to glow. Each hop grew higher as his magic enhanced the lift he got, amusing Nyx at first before she started to get disturbed by just how much air he was getting.

"I-I'm glad you enjoyed it, but don't go too high! I don't want you to hurt yourself," she cautioned, concerned that he might take a bad fall. When he refused to listen to her, though, she then tried to snatch him out of the air with a cushion of her own magic. Even then, though, the giggling unicorn's magic field tried to get him to bounce out of it, forcing her to quickly wrap hers around him completely like a bubble so that he wouldn't squirm out of it.

This normally would have worked, but as she held him in place, the 'bubble' surrounding Nebula started vibrating, building up what felt like a tremendous amount of energy before the baby unicorn suddenly burst free, letting out a gleeful squeal as he rocketed down the street!

Nyx's eyes bugged out in surprise, but she quickly spread her wings and took flight after him as he bounced around like a pinball! Nyx winced whenever he ricocheted off of something, but he seemed to be safely cushioned by his own personal field of magic, and as she gave chase, the greatest danger seemed to be to the town as she had to quickly react to keep the destruction down to a minimum, or to protect ponies in danger of being hit with debris. As such, she wasn't able to catch up with him until his trip came to a sudden, crashing end, making her clench her teeth with worry until she heard his delighted laughter.

Still, she knew there was going to be problems, seeing as how he'd managed to smash into...
155312.title: Sugar-bomb!

choices: Twilight gets herself together and casts a geneology spell.
Rainbow Dash crashes into the library, and sees Nebula.
1553122.content:
"What in the name of Celestia is going on?!" came a voice. It was familiar, though Nyx hadn't heard it in some time. Looking around, she winced as she spotted the Great and Powerful Trixie trotting up. The azure mare's eyes bugged out as she witnessed the remains of her wagon. "Wh-wh-what has happened here?! Who dares to destroy the Great and Powerful Trixie's property?!" Glancing around, the unicorn's eyes landed on Nyx. "You! You vile black fiend! How dare you destroy my property, Nightmare Moon?! I will - "

         Trixie was cut off by a bounding blue ball of energy that slammed into her with a cry of "Mommy!" Not only was the showmare knocked on her back from the force, but the sheer shock value of what the foal had just said derailed any thoughts of continuing her tirade against Nyx.

         For her part, the alicorn was equally stunned. Still, she wasn't currently on her back trying to recover her breath from a colt thinking he was a cannonball. Slowly, she trotted over to the stunned unicorn, who Nebula was currently nuzzling against. "Um, Nebula? Is this... your Mommy?"

         "Uh-huh!" Nebula chirped, continuing to nuzzle against the increasingly uncomfortable showmare.

         Nyx turned her attention to Trixie. "Well. I never would have figured you for the motherly type, Trixie..."

         "T-t-t-this is a mistake!" Trixie exclaimed. "Trixie has never had a foal before! Trixie has never had a coltfriend before!"

         Nyx blinked, and looked at the colt. "Still, he does kinda resemble you, Trixie..."

         Trixie looked at Nebula herself. "Trixie can see that, yet his claim that I am his mother is preposterous."

         Nyx tapped her chin in thought. "Well, this is quite the mystery, isn't it? He claims you're his mother, yet you remember otherwise. Good thing there's a pony in town who's good at solving mysteries!"

         Trixie glanced at the alicorn. "And who would that be?"

         Nyx grinned. "My adoptive mother, Twilight Sparkle."

         Trixie groaned, slapping a hoof over her face. "Ugh, it would be her, wouldn't it...?" Sighing, she began to stand up, pausing as the colt decided to scramble onto her back. "Very well, we'll go see Twilight Sparkle. I hope you appreciate the sacrifice I'm making to my dignity here, Nightmare Moon."

         Trixie found herself on the receiving end of a draconic-eyed glare. "For the record, my name is Nyx, not Nightmare Moon. I've put that life behind me."

         Trixie gulped, but rallied her courage. "Trixie recalls that you stole her hat and cloak after thoroughly humiliating her in front of the whole town."

         Nyx paused, then chuckled. "Ah, right, I forgot about that." Reaching deep into her astral mane, Nyx produced the two items in question. "Thanks for reminding me, I'd forgotten these were still in there." She set the hat on Trixie's head, and lifted Nebula up so she could tie the cape in place.

         Trixie was shocked. "Why... why would you return these?"

         Nyx smiled wanly. "As a show of good faith that I'm not who I used to be." With that, she trotted off towards the library, a still dumbfounded Trixie following.

*****


         The two mares plus one colt made it to the library without further incident, and Nyx opened the door. "Hey, Mom! Got a bit of a mystery for you to solve!"

         "A mystery?" Twilight's head poked out from a pile of books. "What sort of mystery?" She trotted over, but paused as she saw Trixie. "Uh, is Trixie part of the mystery?"

         "That would be correct, Twilight Sparkle," sniffed the showmare. "You see this colt here?" She turned to the side slightly, so Twilight could see the colt that was now lightly dozing on Trixie's back. "He apparently thinks Trixie is his mother, which is impossible because Trixie has never been with a stallion in such an intimate manner."

         "Really?" Twilight blinked. "Huh. I would have thought otherwise; the stallions in town all thought you were gorgeous."

         Trixie rolled her eyes. "If Trixie had gone with every starry-eyed stallion that was enchanted with Trixie's looks, Trixie would be a mother many times over by now."

         Any retort on Twilight's mind died as the colt yawned, stretched, and then opened is eyes to face her. Suddenly, he smiled widely, and pounced on the lavender unicorn. "Mommy!"

         If Trixie and Nyx had been confused before, it was nothing on what they felt now. The two glanced at each other, then at Nebula, then at the thoroughly gobsmacked expression on Twilight's face. Nyx began to rub the side of her head with a hoof. "Ugh, it's not even Tuesday..." she moaned.
1553122.title: The Great and Powerful... Mommy?

choices: Follow Nyx, searching the remains of Trixie's wagon
Follow Twilight as she tries to figure out what's going on
15531221.content:
After staring in shock for about a minute, Trixie apparently came to a realization and said, "Well, that settles that, then! Twilight Sparkle is the mother, so you will be hearing from Trixie's attorney about the damages to her livelihood!"

With a haughty sniff, the showmare turned her nose up and started to make her way to the door, only to be interrupted by Nebula asking, "Where's mommy going?"

Trixie stumbled and sputtered as she turned back around. "You just said Twilight was your mother! Make up your mind, you little-!" She cut herself off, though, when the little unicorn started looking at her with wide eyes, lip quivering as he reached out toward her.

Nyx blinked and looked back and forth between Trixie on one side, Nebula and Twilight on the other. She then spoke up and said, "Okay, this is getting so much weirder... Trixie, I've been living here for years, so I'd know if mom had gotten pregnant. It's as impossible for her as you say it is for you."

"As 'Trixie says' it is?" the showmare asked, narrowing her eyes at Nyx. "Perhaps you two haven't had your fill of humiliating Trixie, and set this all up to further damage the Great and Powerful Trixie's reputation by painting her as a deadbeat mother!"

"What? No! That doesn't even make sense," Twilight protested.

Trixie turned her attention back to Twilight, pointing an accusing hoof at her. "Don't try to deny it, Twilight Sparkle! You and your friends have always had it out for Trixie! Heckling my show..."

"Okay, they were pretty vocal about their opinions, I'll grant you, but..."

"Luring an Ursa Minor to make you look good..."

"Hey, that was those two doofus fans of yours trying to make you look..."

"Calling on the Great and Powerful Trixie to save Equestria from eternal night..." She gave Nyx a quick glare. "Setting it up so she would fail so that she could be mocked and humiliated all over again!"

Nyx interjected, "Look, I really am sorry about that. I was going through a lot of stuff at the time, and besides, they really thought it would work."

Trixie stomped her hoof down and asked, "Then why are you doing this to Trixie?! Twilight Sparkle, you are nothing but a-"

"Trixie, stop!" Twilight held onto Nebula, who was right on the edge of bursting into tears from watching the unicorns argue. "Look, there's no conspiracy against you, and a really simple way to settle this. I happened to read about a spell a while ago for this sort of thing. It's used in courts of law to settle inheritance disputes, so will that work for you?"

Trixie glared at Twilight, but then looked at Nebula and sighed. "Fine, but only if Trixie gets to see this spell first! The Great and Powerful Trixie will not allow for any funny business."

------------

"Trixie will cast the spell again!"

Twilight shook her head in confusion. "Trixie, we cast it six times now. The results are... kinda clear."

"Trixie said she will cast the spell again," the azure unicorn snapped, with a strain of desperation in her voice. "Or better, Trixie will find another spell, because this one is obviously faulty!"

Twilight groaned. "No, it's from the textbook used by Forensic Magic experts throughout Equestria, so it isn't the spell. And we've all been doing it perfectly." Between them, Twilight, Trixie and Nyx had all tried casting it, always with the exact same results. "Somehow, Trixie... you and I... have a son."

After a long, uncomfortable moment of silence, Trixie started to weakly stagger toward the door. "The Great and Powerful Trixie... needs to lie down..." Nyx and Twilight made no effort to stop her, but she stopped herself before reaching the door. With a bitter chuckle, she muttered, "But of course, Trixie's bed was smashed to pieces, along with the rest of her worldly possessions..."

Twilight walked over to her and put a hoof on her shoulder. "Look, I know we've clashed in the past, but you could stay here for the time being."

The showmare replied, "Trixie doesn't need your pity..."

"I'm not offering out of pity." She looked over at Nebula, who had fallen back to sleep. "For whatever reason, even without the spell, he identifies us both as his mothers. If you're gone, he'll probably be really scared. You saw how he got when we were arguing. Imagine waking up and suddenly finding one of your parents is gone."

Trixie joined Twilight in looking at Nebula before letting out a heavy sigh. "Fine... Trixie will accept your hospitality..." she relented.

Twilight nodded and guided her to the bedrooms. Passing Nyx, she asked, "Nyx, why don't you see about getting Applejack to let Applebloom help salvage what you can from her wagon?"

Nyx nodded. "Sure thing."

Heading out the door, she took wing just as Spike walked in the door with a big bag of groceries. Not seeing past it, the baby dragon snickered and said, "Hey, Twilight! When I was in town, I saw that showboating blowhard Trixie's wagon! It looked like it got hit by another Ursa. Can you believe, that obnoxious attention-horse even bothered showing up in Ponyville a... ahh..." As he talked, Spike had set the groceries down and started sorting through them. Looking to Twilight, he also happened to notice the other unicorn, who looked as though she were trying to burn a hole through his head with sheer force of will.

Twilight groaned and said, "Spike, Trixie is going to be our guest for a little while, so please treat her like one."

Spike gulped. "Oooookaaaaay. Hiiii, Trixie..." he replied. He forced a smile and gave her a little wave. Trixie didn't reply, but turned and let Twilight lead her back to the living spaces. Not before shooting him another dirty look, though.

Left alone in the room, Spike shivered. "Yeesh... what happened here?" Then he blinked and noticed something else. "And why is there a foal here?!"
15531221.title: And the real mother is...

choices: Meanwhile, Twilight's been doing research on this whole subject.
That night, at the party...
155312211.content:
Nyx flew towards Sweet Apple Acres, catching the thermals as Rainbow Dash taught her to in order to spare flapping on her part. She soon spotted the red barn of the Acres, and landed by the front door. She raised a hoof to knock, only to have it open before she could. "Howdy, Nyx!" Applebloom said cheerfully. "Whatcha doin' out here? Ah thought you'd be up at the castle all day."

         Nyx chuckled. "That was the plan, but... something came up. Is Applejack around? I need to know if I can borrow you for a little bit."

         "And what do ya need ta borrow her for?" asked the cowpony as she stepped into view from the kitchen. "If it's anythin' ta do with that castle, forget it, Nyx."

         Nyx sighed. "It's not that, Applejack. There was a bit of... a wreck in town, and somepony's wagon was practically demolished. Twilight wants me and Applebloom to salvage what we can and bring it to the library."

         Applejack blushed. "Oh, well, go on then! Don't take too long, ya hear?"

         "Ah hear ya!" Applebloom replied. She looked at Nyx. "Give me a minute, and ah'll grab some tools fer us."

*****


         A few minutes later found Applebloom and Nyx working on retrieving various things from the ruined wagon. "Hoo-wee! What happened ta this thing? Looks like somethin' smashed it but good!"

         Nyx's reply was perfectly deadpan. "A unicorn foal on a sugar high. That's what happened." She magically shoved some debris off of a pile of books that had survived.

         Applebloom looked askance at Nyx. "Uh, yer kiddin', right? Ain't no way a foal could do this!" She saw what remained of the bed, and smiled. "Well, ah think ah can rebuild that quickly enough."

         "Oh, you'd be surprised what unicorn foals can do," said Pinkie Pie, sifting through some broken glass in what appeared to be the remains of an alchemy lab. "Seriously, Pumpkin Cake could do all sorts of crazy things while she was less than a year old."

         "Ah guess," Applebloom said, pulling out the bed pieces. Then she paused. "Uh, Pinkie Pie? What're ya doin' here?"

         "Oh! I was just going to ask Nyx if she'd found out anything about Nebula's parents yet!" the party pony replied cheerfully.

         Nyx cringed, but neither earth pony noticed. "Who's Nebula?" asked Applebloom, curious.

         "He's this adorable little unicorn colt Nyx brought in to Sugarcube Corner!" Pinkie replied. "She found him up at the old castle, which means he's been seperated from his parents! Isn't that just awful?"

         "Yeah, it is!" Applebloom agreed. "Maybe ah should get Scoots and Sweetie... Belle..." she trailed off, remembering that her two best friends had set off that very morning for places beyond Ponyville.

         Nyx trotted over, and nuzzled her friend. "Don't worry, Applebloom. Twilight and I have solved that mystery... sort of."

         "Sort of?" both earth ponies chorused. Pinkie Pie continued. "How can you 'sort of' solve a mystery? That's like saying you're 'sort of' awake, even though if you're not awake, you're asleep, and - "

         "Pinkie Pie!" barked Nyx, cutting the party pony off before she could really get going. "What I mean is that the answer we've got only raised more questions."

         "Like what?" the repair-pony asked.

         Nyx hesitated, then glanced around. "I'll tell you two, but only if you Pinkie Promise you won't say a word to anypony else except me, Twilight, and Trixie."

         "What does Trixie have to do with this?" an annoyed Applebloom asked, having heard stories about the showmare from Applejack.

         "Pinkie Promise and I'll explain," Nyx repeated.

         Both earth ponies glanced at each other, then back at Nyx, and nodded. "Cross my heart, hope to fly, stick a cupcake in my eye!" they said as one, going through the motions.

         Nyx sighed. "Okay, here's the deal," she said in a low tone. "Nebula crashed into Trixie's wagon, right? Totally demolished it, as you can see. Trixie comes along, and she's not happy about this. She begins to rail into me about destroying her property, seeing as I was once Nightmare Moon and all."

         "Sounds like Trixie's just got a buncha sour apples from her past visits," Applebloom said.

         Nyx nodded. "Well, here's the thing. The moment Nebula pops out of the wreck, he sees Trixie, and just like that, he's slammed into her, and calling her 'Mommy'."

         "Wow. Trixie is Nebula's mommy?" Pinkie said with surprise. "Who'da thunk? I mean, Trixie's pretty good-looking, I guess, but not really my style."

         Nyx decided not to comment. "Oh, but it gets better. Trixie claims she's never had a foal, or even a coltfriend. Seeing as this is a bit of a mystery, I decide to take her and Nebula to the library. Lo and behold, when Nebula sees Twilight, he tackles her, calling her 'Mommy'."

         Applebloom blinked. "Waitaminute. A foal can't have two mommies. It ain't possible. I remember that lesson with Cheerilee." Her face reddened under her coat, and she looked away. "And ah still wish ah could get the image of mah brother and her outta mah head..."

         "You and me both," muttered Nyx. "So getting back to the point, Twilight shows us this spell that's supposed to determine a pony's parents. And, to our utter shock, it seems that both Twilight and Trixie are Nebula's parents. We cast the spell six times, twice from each of us, just to make sure."

         Both earth ponies looked dumbfounded. Then Pinkie cheered right up. "Well, if that's the case, then I need to make sure the party's ready for Trixie and Twilight!"

         Applebloom looked at Pinkie as if she'd grown a second head. "Ya can't be serious, Pinkie. Twilight's just found out she apparently had a kid, with another mare, with Trixie of all ponies! The last thing they need right now is a party!"

         "But... but parties make everypony feel better!" Pinkie said with surprise plain on her face.

         Nyx sighed. "Pinkie, remember, you Pinkie Promised not to tell anypony about this. A party would tell EVERYpony about this."

         Pinkie looked like she was twitching a little, but then she sighed. "You're right. We can't have a party for everypony." Then she perked up. "We just need a party for Trixie, Twilight, and the rest of our friends!" Seeing Nyx raise a hoof to object, Pinkie continued on. "They're going to find out anyway, somehow, so we might as well get it over with."

         Nyx blinked, then sighed. "Point taken," she said. "Let's get these things back to the library so Trixie won't complain... too much."

         "Ah'll get Big Macintosh ta bring the pieces of the wagon back ta the Acres when he's done with his chores fer today," Applebloom said. "Meantime, ah'll take the bed pieces an' get ta work on those." She piled the bed pieces into a wagon, and set off for the Acres, while Nyx levitated the books and alchemy lab remnants and flew back to the library.
155312211.title: Salvage Team AppleNyx
