In the bedroom where Trixie and Nebula are napping...
1553122111.content:
When Nyx returned to the library with Trixie's books, she found Twilight busily researching while Spike fetched whatever books she asked for. The unicorn was so deeply focused on her reading that she didn't even notice Nyx's arrival.

"No... no... definitely no..." she muttered as she flipped through the pages. "Arrgh, it just doesn't make any sense...!"

Nyx set the books down as she walked up and asked, "No luck so far?"

Twilight jumped a little, then sighed and shook her head. "No, there are a few spells that could conceivably help two mares have a child, but every single one I've found so far is ruled out." She blushed and shut the book she was reading. "Mostly because I would definitely remember being present for it. So, were you able to save anything?"

Nyx nodded and glanced over what she had brought from Trixie's trailer. "Applebloom took what she could, and it sounded like she'd be able to fix it up. These were all fine, but it looked like she had some alchemy equipment that got smashed up."

"Hmmm, probably how she makes fireworks for her show," Twilight mused. "Now if only I could make sense of this. I mean, maybe the genealogy spell got a false positive, like instead of me one of the parents was a close relative..." She trailed off, then shook her head firmly. "No! No, that's even more impossible. Ugh, I'm not thinking straight. So, what kind of books does she have?"

Nyx floated the books up one by one to look them over. "Looks like a couple of spellbooks... some plays... Huh, this one's bookmarked." She flipped it open and raised an eyebrow. "What's 'Vaenia?'" When Twilight shrugged, she set it down and picked up the last one. "Oh, and it looks like this one was something she was writing. 'How the Great & Powerful Trixie Defeated the Lupus Major.' Yikes, did that actually happen? Those things are killers!"

Spike came up and rolled his eyes. "Yeesh, she never learns. That's how the whole Ursa Minor thing got started. Anyway, why don't we take a lunch break? You'll probably be able to think more clearly when you aren't hungry."

Nyx blinked and exclaimed, "Cupcakes!"

"Uh... actually, I was thinking more celery soup, but sure," Spike replied.

"No, no, not cupcakes for us," Nyx explained. "When Nebula was hungry, I offered to take him to Sugarcube Corner. He said 'Yay! Cupcakes!'"

Twilight asked, "So? That's what they sell there."

"But I never said they did," Nyx told them. "I didn't say anything about cupcakes at all. And Pinkie Pie didn't recognize him, so obviously he'd never been there before. Oh, by the way... she's kind of determined to throw you a party, Twilight. Bloom and I couldn't talk her out of it, but we did get her to limit it to just your close friends."

Twilight sweatdropped. "Well, thanks for trying, Nyx." She then stopped herself as the pieces suddenly fell into place. "Wait... of course! That makes the most sense out of anything! Nebula remembers me and Trixie as his parents because we are! And we don't remember him because we're not!"

Nyx and Spike looked at each other, then looked back at Twilight. "Uh... you said that makes the most sense? Mind telling us how?" the baby dragon asked.

"A parallel timeline," Twilight explained. "Another Equestria that's similar to ours, but fundamentally different in some ways because of events that happened differently or ponies making different decisions."

"Well... you and Trixie getting together would sure be one heck of a different decision," Spike replied. When Twilight gave him an exasperated look, he said, "I'll get lunch started..."

After he went off to the kitchen, Nyx asked, "So, this timeline thing might explain how he got here, but if that's the case, how do we send him back home? How would we even find the world he came from, for that matter?"

Twilight winced. "Well, that's going to going to take a lot of work to figure out. I mean, parallel timelines are just a theory for the most part, but at least it gives us a starting point. And if his mother and I are anything alike, she's probably turning her own world upside-down to find him."

Nyx chuckled at that. "Well, that's certainly true. I suppose I'll go help Spike make lunch, then. We'll tackle this after we've eaten."
1553122111.title: Whatever remains, no matter how improbable

Stay with Trixie and Twilight, as they learn more about each other.
15531221112.content:
[[OOC: In the tumblr, Nebula does refer to Twilight as his 'papa'. Also, Nyx appears in the tumblr, so Nebula knows about her. For convenience's sake, the Nyx here is from yet another timeline.]]

         In the bedroom, Trixie sighed. Sleep wouldn't come for a multitude of reasons. The most prominent was the young colt currently snuggled up against her. Despite her protests, she couldn't help but smile when she looked at him. "You are an enigma, little one. How did Trixie become a mother without knowing?" She sighed again, and nuzzled him. "Well, no matter what, Trixie can't blame one so young."

         The napping colt was woken up by the nuzzling. He yawned, and smiled at her, though it faded when he saw her sad look. "Mommy? Why are you sad?"

         Trixie offered a small smile. "Tr-Mommy was just thinking about sad things, little one. It isn't nice, but sometimes it can't be helped."

         Nebula smiled back. "Don't wowwy. If you're sad, I'm sure Papa and Big Sis Nyx can cheer you up!"

         Trixie smiled, then paused. "Wait... 'Big Sis Nyx'?"

         Nebula nodded. "Uh-huh! She's weally cool! She always plays with me! She and Big Sis Midnight are really awesome! Auntie Wainbow says so!"

         Trixie slowly nodded. "Of course they are..."

         Nebula giggled, then looked around. "Where's Gwannie Hazel?"

         The question nearly stopped Trixie's heart. She hadn't heard that name in years, not since... "Um, she's... on a vacation. She'll be back soon, little one."

         "Oh, okay," Nebula said through a yawn. "I'mma go back to bed now..."

         When she was certain that the colt was asleep, Trixie carefully slipped out from the bed, making sure not to disturb him. She silently opened the door, tip-hoofing through before closing it just as silently. She trotted down the stairs to see Twilight flipping through a few books. "Any luck, Twilight Sparkle?"

         Looking up, Twilight sighed. "Well, a little. I've determined that Nebula is, in fact, from a parallel timeline, not this one. Hence, the reason neither of us can remember being his parents."

         Trixie blinked, then let out a relieved chuckle. "Oh, thank Celestia! Trixie thought she might be going insane!"

         "If you're talking about the whole 'two mares having a foal' thing..." Twilight began.

         "No, no, this is something different," Trixie explained. "You see, Trixie spoke to young Nebula just now. Some of what he said confused me. For example, he called your adoptive daughter 'Big Sis Nyx'."

         "Wait, he knows me?" Nyx asked, coming back in from the kitchen with a tray of sandwiches. "But he didn't seem to when I found him up at the castle!"

         "Search Trixie," the showmare said with a shrug. "He mentioned some other ponies, like a 'Big Sis Midnight' and 'Auntie Rainbow'."

         Twilight blinked. "Well Rainbow can only refer to Rainbow Dash. I believe you zapped her with a lightning bolt during that first show here in Ponyville?"

         Trixie had the good grace to look sheepish. "Yes, well... There was one last thing that bothered Trixie. He mentioned... my mother, Hazel Lulamoon." She spat out the last two words.

         Twilight and Nyx exchanged glances, though it was Spike who broke the silence. "Not on good terms with your mom, I take it?"

         "Let Trixie put it this way; if the way Hazel raised Trixie is an example of good parenting, Nightmare Moon would have won an award for 'best parent ever'," the showmare said venomously. Then she blinked and looked at Nyx. "Er, no offense meant..."

         Nyx sighed. "None taken. So why did him mentioning her bother you?"

         Trixie hesitated. "The way he mentioned her... he called her 'Grannie Hazel'. That implies that she's a part of his life, beyond stories on Trixie's part. Which means, logically, that she's a part of Trixie's life as well. Trixie feels... conflicted about knowing there may be a timeline where Trixie made up with her mother."

         Twilight looked at Trixie with a degree of concern. "Trixie... do you want to try to reconnect with your mother?"

         Trixie looked startled for a moment, then slumped. "Trixie... does not think that such an endeavor will succeed... but yes, part of her wants to see her mother again."

         Nyx spoke up. "Where does your mother live?"

         "Out in Whitetail Woods," replied Trixie. "It's an old wooden house with a thatched straw roof. It's the only building in that part of the woods for miles."

         Nyx nodded, and trotted to the door. "I'll be back in time for the party if I can't find her," she promised Twilight, before flying out the door.

         Trixie blinked, then looked at a nervous-looking Twilight. "What did she mean, 'party'?"

         "Well..." Twilight began, knowing that the showmare would likely react poorly.

Nyx set her hooves down on solid ground, huffing for a bit as she caught her breath after what felt like a good two hours of solid flying. "No wonder the princesses always take chariots..." she muttered to herself as she looked up the path. The cabin was surprisingly large and well-maintained for being so deep in the middle of nowhere, and there were dozens of little herb gardens surrounding it.

Keeping to the path so as to not accidentally step on anything she shouldn't, the alicorn stepped up onto the porch and lifted a hoof to knock on the door. She was rather nervous as she waited for the owner to respond, having no idea what to expect. Trixie had been extremely vague about why she had a rocky relationship with her mother, forcing Nyx to fill in the gaps with her own imagination, which had resulted in some rather bizarre ideas by the time she finally arrived. At the moment, the most prominent image in her mind was that she was some sort of mad scientist plotting world domination via mutant oregano.

Then the door opened, and Nyx quickly took a step back, startled out of her daydreaming. "Oh! Ah, hello. Mrs. Lulamoon, I presume?"

1553122111211.content:
The green mare glared at the alicorn sitting on her doorstep. "That's MS. Lulamoon. I was never married," she said curtly. "And there's no need to introduce yourself. I know full well about the 'benevolent' Nightmare Moon, who gave up her crown."

         Nyx's nervousness vanished in a sea of annoyance. "Nightmare Moon is in my past. I go by Nyx these days."

         "If you say so," Hazel replied. "Now, how did you find me? I don't really advertise my home's location."

         Nyx sighed, and steeled herself. "I found you because your daughter told me where this place was."

         Hazel's eyes widened. "You... you know my daughter?! Where is she?!"

         "In Ponyville," replied the alicorn.

         Hazel dragged a hoof across her face. "Of course. I should have known she'd return there eventually." She grumbled and stepped back into the house. She left the door open, which Nyx took as an invitation to come in.

         The inside of the home was... suprisingly bare. There was no mad science lab, no strange growths, nothing unusual at all. It unnerved Nyx slightly, but not as much as the green mare who was currently muttering under her breath about 'ungrateful whelps'. "Um, is now a bad time, Ms. Lulamoon?"

         Hazel snorted. "No, no, I'm perfectly happy to be told that my attention horse of a daughter is back in the same town where her fame went up in smoke. I told her she should never have become a showmare!"

         "Wait, you did?" Nyx asked with a blink.

         "Yes, I did!" snarled Hazel. Nyx was beginning to think the mare was perpetually angry. "I told her that no daughter of mine would be a show-boating showmare! But she ran away from home to do exactly that!"

         "I see..." Nyx said slowly. "Have you never tried to contact her?"

         "She traveled a lot," Hazel replied. "It was hard to try to get in touch with her. But even if that wasn't the case, she made it clear that she has no intention of listening to me. The only reason I keep tabs on her is to make sure I get a grandfoal one day."

         "Uh-huh," Nyx said skeptically. "If you were really concerned about getting to know your grandfoal, perhaps you would have tried reaching out to Trixie sooner."

         "Oh, I won't worry about that. When she does have a grandfoal, I'll make sure that it's raised properly, to make up for my failure with Trixie."

         That sentence chilled Nyx. "What are you saying...?"

         "Do I have to spell it out?" Hazel said acerbically. "When Trixie has a foal, I'm going to take it, and raise it as my own."

         Nyx stared at the mare. "Now I see why Trixie wasn't eager to talk about you. She never mentioned you were insane!"

         Hazel chuckled darkly. "Insanity and genius are often mistaken for each other."

         "There's nothing 'genius' about your plan! Hay, you told me everything! What makes you think I'm not going to report you to the princesses?!"

         "Simple. You're not going to leave."

         Nyx blinked, realizing belatedly that Hazel's horn was glowing a blood red. Before the alicorn could react, she felt a sting in her rump. Looking back, she saw a dart sticking out of her cutie mark. With a chill running down her spine, Nyx tried to run, but her legs were already unsteady. The tranquilizer in the dart was powerful. With a groan, she fell over, fighting to keep herself awake. It was a fight she lost, and the last thing she saw was the evil, grinning face of Hazel.

1553122111211.title: Brewing Anger

choices: During the party, somepony notices something is off about Nyx

15531221112112.content:
"Wh-what the hay is this?!" Nyx gasped, blushing at the Prench maid outfit she was wearing. It wasn't so much the outfit itself, but rather the stereotype that went with it that was causing her embarassment. Prench maids were said to be rather... naughty, at times. Nyx grumbled, and went to remove the outfit.

         "Stop." It was a single word, and should have been easily ignored. But Nyx found her attempt to remove the outfit stymied, as her body stopped responding to her brain. Unable to move anything save her eyes, she focused on the source of the voice.

         Hazel Lulamoon stood there, a wicked smirk on her face. "Wondering what's going on, by chance? It's a special brew of mine. It makes your body completely subserviant to my orders. When I ordered you to stop, your body interpreted that as a sign to cease all non-vital activities, such as moving." She circled the helpless alicorn. "Now, since you're completely under my control, let me ask you: What prompted this visit? Why did Trixie send you to me? Answer me truthfully, and leave nothing out."

         Against her will, Nyx found herself relating the story; how she had found Nebula in the old castle, how she had met Trixie and revealed Nebula's heritage, and the party which had partially prompted this visit. Nyx said everything in a dull monotone, a mark of how unwilling she was to relate anything to this mare.

         When she was finished, Hazel paced around her, a frown on her face. "So... this foal from another timeline bears Trixie's blood, as well as your adoptive mother's? How interesting... and disgusting."

         Nyx couldn't speak, but nonetheless arched an eyebrow at the potionmaker.

         Seeing the expression, Hazel elaborated on her statement. "The fact that this 'Nebula' was conceived from two mares indicates that magic was involved somehow. And using magic to conceive a foal is absolutely disgusting. The fact that it's from another timeline matters not; this abomination will not live, not so long as I'm around."

         Nyx felt a chill go through her, even as Hazel continued speaking. "So, here's what will happen, my pet. You will return to this 'party', and inform those in attendance that I was unable to make it. When the party is over, and everypony is asleep, you will take that foal, and bring it back to me. While you're doing all of that, I will prepare a potion to dissolute that creature spawned of magic back into its base components."

         The chill was now an icy claw of dread that held Nyx's heart in a vice-like grip. But Hazel still had more to say. "Oh, yes, and just to be sure, you will not speak of this to anypony. You will not even so much as emote that something is wrong. You will act as you normally would." Hazel trotted off, then stopped. "You will depart now, but leave the outfit here. No need to raise questions. And if you get caught, or somepony tries to stop you..." She leaned in deadly close. "Use deadly force to get that abomination here."

         The mad brewmistress left the room, even as Nyx removed the maid's outfit mechanically. Thanks to Hazel's orders, her face was perfectly calm. But inside, her mind was racing. How am I supposed to save Nebula?! What can I do?! Her body was moving on its own, leaving the house and flying back toward Ponyville. I can't give up! I can't just let that witch kill an innocent foal! But... what can I do...?

         Nyx's mind was in turmoil, even as her calm expression never faded.

*****


         Trixie eyed the decorations nervously. "Well, Pinkie Pie, Trixie admits she was worried this would be too loud. But this decor is actually rather tasteful."

         Pinkie shrugged, not losing her smile. "Nyx told me you'd like this to be somewhat low-key, so I decided to tone down on my usual stuff. The other girls should be here soon."

         Trixie gave Pinkie a gimlet gaze. "And why, pray tell, did you feel this whole party was necessary?"

         Pinkie shrugged again. "Mostly because Twilight, me, and the rest of the girls are the bestest of best friends, and something like this couldn't stay secret forever, so might as well get it out of the way now."

         Trixie had to admit, there was some logic in the party pony's statement. "Fair enough, Trixie supposes."

         Twilight trotted up to the two of them. "Trixie, are you nervous about meeting your mother again?"

         Trixie winced. "Trixie is... uncertain, whether her mother will even accept the invitation."

         "Why?" Pinkie asked, cocking her head. "Is she a big meanie grumpy-pants who doesn't want to see her daughter's alternate-timeline lesbian-self's foal?"

         There was dead silence for a few seconds. "Well... partly, yes," Trixie finally said. "But we parted on bad terms. Hazel didn't want Trixie to become a showmare, whereas it was what Trixie always dreamed of doing." She frowned. "Trixie received her hat and cloak anonymously, and with them was a note: 'Follow your Dreams'. So Trixie left Hazel's home, and has been on the road as a showmare ever since."

         "Aw..." Pinkie grabbed the azure unicorn in a tight hug. "Don't worry, Trixie! You'll be safe and sound here in Ponyville!"

         At that moment, the door to the library opened, and Nyx walked in. Something everypony noticed was that she was alone. "Did you find Hazel, Nyx?" Twilight asked, trotting over to the alicorn.

         Nyx nodded. "I did, but she declined the invitation. Sorry, Trixie."

         Trixie waved it off. "Don't worry about it, Trixie knew this was a likely possibility. And, honestly, Trixie is relieved. Trixie had no idea what she would say to Hazel."

155312211121121.content:
The party, such as it was, was in full swing. Those members of the Bearers of Harmony who hadn't been told about Nebula yet were informed, to varying reactions. Fluttershy thought it was sweet of Twilight and Trixie to try to care for him, despite not truly being his parents. Rarity was of like mind, and was mentally planning an outfit that would suit the young colt better. Rainbow found the situation hilarious, to the point where she'd literally fallen out of the air due to laughing so hard. Applejack was dumbfounded, but she eventually accepted what she'd been told.

         "So, what exactly have you been up to since the Alicorn Amulet fiasco?" Rarity asked Trixie.

         Trixie sighed. "Truth be told, Trixie has been working on rebuilding her image. She realizes now that the Alicorn Amulet fiasco was little more than a temper tantrum mixed with an ego trip. Trixie did some soul searching, and did not like what she saw. So, Trixie decided to start over from the ground up." She sighed again, glancing at Nebula, who was playing 'Pin the Tail on the Pony' with Pinkie. "And it was going well, until a blue cannonball disguised as a colt crashed into my wagon, destroying nearly everything."

         "Don't be too hard on the little guy," Rainbow said, giving Trixie a small glare. Of the six friends, Rainbow was the one who had the hardest time letting go of grudges. "I mean, he's just a kid, after all."

         "Trixie is well aware of that," the azure unicorn retorted, meeting Rainbow's gaze. "Trixie is just saying that this mishap is going to cause problems. She was scheduled to perform on a Manehattan stage tomorrow, but with her wagon and most of her supplies destroyed, Trixie may have to cancel."

         "Manehattan?" Applejack asked with a quirked eyebrow. "Fancy that. How'd you wrangle that kind of deal?"

"Why, yes I am," the unicorn who answered the door replied with a smile. She had a green coat and lustrous mane, her cutie mark bearing the image of a cauldron with a wisp of steam above it in the shape of a heart. "And please, call me Hazel. It's actually MS. Lulamoon, anyway, as I never did marry. Oh, but I'm sure you didn't come all this way to hear me prattle on about myself. And I know who you are, Ms. Nyx. There's only one reason a mare of your age would come this far out into the middle of nowhere... There's a certain special somepony who's eye you want to catch, and you heard that old Hazel Lulamoon could give you an advantage in that arena."

Not that Nyx would have called her 'old' anything. Nyx had been 'born' as a pre-adolescent, and been adopted by Twilight who was still rather young, herself. As a result, there wasn't much difference between their apparent ages. Hazel, despite being Trixie's biological mother, would have easily been able to pass for the showmare's older sister, and not by much. While Nyx was distracted by such comparisons, Hazel practically pulled her inside as she talked, then gave the alicorn a sly wink. "Well, I can tell you, dear, that you heard absolutely right. Why don't you come inside, I'll put on some tea, and you can tell me all about it?"

"Actually... you see, I... umm, okay," Nyx stammered, swept up in a sort of conversational tide that kept her from forming a complete sentence. Before she knew it, she was sitting down in what looked like the cabin's study, a nearby fireplace keeping the room warm and cozy. Before Nyx could say anything about why she was actually there, Hazel was already heading to the kitchen, assuring her she would only take a minute.

Left alone for the moment, Nyx looked around, particularly at the selection of books Hazel kept. Books on herbology and gardening, potion recipes, and several shelves worth of romance novels and self-help books like 'How You Know He's a Keeper' or '50 Tricks to Get The Stallion of Your Dreams'. Surprisingly harmless stuff, considering the impression Trixie had given.

"Here we go, I hope you like cinnamon tea," Hazel said, coming back into the room with a tea service floating above her head. Sitting down across from Nyx, she set the tea down on a small table between them and started pouring. "Now then, why don't you tell me about this pony who makes your heart flutter? And don't be afraid to share anything. Even a mare who happens to be a beautiful celebrity can be turned into a silly filly when that special somepony touches her heart, and that's why I'll do whatever it takes to ensure that you find happiness in the joy that is love."

When the teacup in front of her was filled, Nyx picked it up with her magic and levitated it in front of her. It was probably just the effort of flying all the way, but simply listening to Hazel was as exhausting as being around Pinkie Pie and Rarity when they were on a roll, combined. However, when she took a delicate sip of the slightly spicy tea, she felt warmth and energy start to return to her. She gave a contented sigh, feeling the hot tea slide down her throat, and while Hazel started to drink her own, she replied, "Actually, Ms. Lula-... Hazel, it's about your daughter, Trixie."

The mention of Trixie's name was immediately followed by Hazel's teacup falling to the floor, the cup shattering and spilling its contents. Nyx winced, and started fearing the worst when she saw Hazel's pleasant smile suddenly turn into a thousand-yard stare. "Trixie? My... Trixie...?"

As she reached out with her magic to scoop up the sharp pieces of china from the floor, Nyx gulped, afraid that she'd flipped some kind of switch in Hazel's brain. Something that shouldn't have been touched upon. "Umm... yes, it's a complicated story, but things happened and Trixie decided she'd like to resolve whatever issues there were between you in the past. She's in Ponyville right now, if you'd like to--"

"Yes!" Hazel exclaimed, coming back to the conversation from wherever she had gone a moment ago. "Of course the answer is yes! Oh, my darling Trixie said that she had given up on love completely after the unpleasantness, but I knew love would find its way back into her life!" The unicorn hopped down to the floor and reached up to take Nyx's hoof between her own. "And you don't need to wait until after the wedding. I would be proud if you called me 'mom'. In fact, I insist upon it," she said with wide, joy-filled eyes fixed on the utterly stunned teenaged alicorn.

Both Nyx and Trixie stared at Twilight as if she had turned into a Cerberus. "It was just a thought..." she replied sheepishly. "I mean, when you get down to it, it just sounds like she wants to know you're happy, Trixie. If you can show her that you're doing well, maybe she won't worry so much and you'll be able to really connect again."

"Are you crazy, mom? That'd never work," Nyx protested. "I don't know how to fake being in love, and even if I could keep it up for an entire evening, I barely even know Trixie! Not to mention all the ways the story could get blown, like... say... Applejack? The Element of Honesty?"

Trixie sighed softly and rubbed her chin in thought. "Absolutely right... we'll need to fool her too, somehow."

"Exactly," Nyx replied before doing a double-take. "Wait, what? You're actually considering this?"

"Oh, it's a horrible plan," Trixie confirmed with a nod, "but now that my mother has set her mind on it, she won't be satisfied unless she sees her daughter with someone. So it's either put on a show and soothe her enough that we might actually have a real conversation, or deal with her playing matchmaker all night."

Twilight added supportively, "And you're a great actress, Nyx! Everyone thought you were fantastic in the school play, remember?"

"That was years ago, and I was basically playing myself..." the alicorn argued, only to be interrupted by Trixie nudging her to the other side of the room.

"Tell you what, Twilight Sparkle, why don't you go help your snarky little dragon out with the preparations while I give Nyx a bit of coaching? After all, if there is one thing that the Great and Powerful Trixie knows how to do, it is putting on a performance," she said, shooing Twilight away. While doing so, she whispered to the alicorn, "Just play along for now..."

Nyx blinked, but sighed and resigned herself to it as she said, "Okay, okay, I'll give it a shot. Don't worry about us, I'll work it out with Trixie here."

Twilight smiled and nodded, heading out to the kitchen. Once she was out of earshot, Trixie said, "Look, Trixie will level with you. I never wanted to have to share this with another pony, but I'm left with no other choice."

"What? Is it something more embarrassing than what you already said?" Nyx asked, to which the unicorn groaned and nodded.

"Trixie told you what happened when I tried to introduce her to friends, or even just acquaintances. Because of Hazel's behavior, I had almost no friendships last longer than a few meetings with her. But when Trixie actually fell in love..." She facehoofed as she confessed, "Trixie allowed herself to become infatuated with another pony. Once. A teenaged crush. But it was one-sided on Trixie's part, and when Hazel discovered this, she took steps to fix it."

Nyx arched an eyebrow. "Fix it? What, you mean she got even more intense and drove your crush away?"

Trixie looked back at her with a deadly serious expression. "Much worse! The very day after Hazel discovered Trixie's infatuation, the one I was in love with immediately began fawning over Trixie like a lovesick puppy!" When Nyx just tilted her head in confusion, the unicorn filled in the blanks. "You saw Hazel's cutie mark, didn't you? Don't let her eccentricities fool you, my mother is a potion maker and alchemist almost without equal."

Nyx gasped as it suddenly clicked. "You don't mean... a love potion?"

The showmare nodded grimly. "It was the greatest betrayal Trixie ever felt... to be given something so precious, but knowing it was completely artificial... and Trixie has long suspected since then that it is why her father left Hazel before I was born. I had a terrible fight with her, left home to make a life as far away from that place as possible, and gave up on love completely. Thoughts of romance just felt so fake, and after what they did to my mother... Trixie hoped that she might have gotten over her obsessions in our time apart, but apparently not. And now Trixie is afraid of what she'll do if she thinks I haven't found love in all this time. So either we give her what she wants for just one night, or be prepared to watch her every single moment she is here."

Nyx winced. She still wasn't sure that she could do a good job of playing along, but at the same time she didn't know if there was a better option after hearing that story. "Okay, say I do go along with it, how would we convince her you and I are... a couple...? I mean, no offense, but there's a bit of an age difference, not to mention the friction between you and my mom and her friends... "

Trixie couldn't help but laugh a bit at that. "Have you ever read a romance novel? Anything that seems like a hindrance would just make it 'forbidden fruit' and therefore more romantic in her mind. Say... after Trixie's wagon was destroyed, you leaped in to rescue me, and it was love at first sight. Hazel will eat that up."

"What's it like, being a showmare?" Trixie and Twilight were sitting in the kitchen, drinking some tea while Spike was out helping Pinkie get the supplies she deemed were necessary.

Trixie smiled wistfully, stirring her tea as it cooled. "Oh, Trixie could tell you many stories of her adventures as a showmare, but you would most likely be disappointed; very few are true."

"Well, what can you tell me that is true?" Trixie stopped stirring her tea, instead just staring into it as if it were a deep well that held all the answers. "Think of it as a tapestry of the night sky, with far-reaching voids of loneliness and despair, with only bright moments of adoration and acceptance to let you know that you have yet to pass on into the vile landscape that is Tartarus." Trixie took a sip of her tea.

"One of Trixie's greatest foes was possibly hunger. Living as a traveling showmare did not pay much coin, and my hunger for food was only drowned out by the emptiness in my very soul, the gaping wound in my malnourished heart."

Twilight's ears flattened on her head, her nose scrunching up into what was, in Trixie's oinion, a very, very cute frown.

"Oh, I wanted to be loved and adored by all my fans, but it wasn't enough; it was never enough for Trixie. I needed new audiences after I had exhausted my meager tricks in Las Pegasus, Baltimare, and Whinniapolis, and I needed them to shower me with more adoration than ever before. So, I did what any good showmare would do. I found a small town that I had not yet visited, and I spun a tale about something great and spectacular that I had done, accompanied by visuals to help sell the story." Trixie snorted in derision. "It mattered not that it was impossible, because everypony knew it was, and knew it was just a tale. Well," Trixie said as she rolled her eyes toward Twilight. "Everypony except the town of Ponyville. Here, I'm taken as a boastful pony. It's show business, that's how you're supposed to act! So, when some of my crowd got uppity, I did the one thing I could: I performed."

Twilight reflects on the indignant airs Trixie had been using when her friends were trying to show her up and winced. "I guess that it's no fun being upstaged at your own show, huh?"

"No, no it is not.When I left here the first time, I had nothing but a small bag of twenty bits I'd been able to salvage. From there, I started saving up, starving myself at times to keep more cash than I was spending, so I could get a new stage-home. But that was difficult. Drunken ponies don't make the best of crowds, and they'd usually throw more bottles and lewd comments than bits."

Trixie cleared her throat, sniffing almost disdainfully. "But, that is the price I paid for trying to impress a crowd."

Twilight shifted uncomfortably in her seat, her muzzle down low near her teacup. "...ry," Twilight whispered.

Trixie looked up. "What? I didn't quite catch that, Twilight."

Twilight looked into Trixie's eyes, pain in her eyes. "I'm so sorry, Trixie, I... I tried to tell my friends that what they were doing was mean, but none of them would listen. And Spike kept telling me I should step up, because before you'd come into town, I had been practicing a set of 26 spells; something that I do every other week, with lots of practice before each set. H-he kept telling me to show you up, but I didn't want to, and then the Ursa came, and- and everypony was scared, and I was scared, and I did the only thing I could think of, and do you know how embarrassing that was for me? I've always hated the spotlight. Standing with Princess Celestia at the entrance to the Gala? That's easy, nopony's paying much attention to me. But the week after you left, everypony kept calling me the stagemaster, and I hated it. You'd looked so sad, and hurt when you left, I couldn't believe ponies were blaming everything on you!"

Twilight took a breath to calm herself, taking a sip of her cold tea before continuing, a heating spell activating itself almost unconsciously. "It wasn't even your fault, it was those two colts' fault. I don't even think anypony thought to tell them off, and I can't say I did anything about punishing them either." Twilight shrinks in her seat, squirming a little under Trixie's gaze. "I just felt so awful when you ran off like that, that, well..." She squirmed a little again. "I... I saved what I could from your cart before Mayor Mare decided to use everything else in the repairing of property."

Trixie was taken aback. Twilight... had saved something? "What... what did you save of Trixie's?"

Twilight got up and walked towards the door that lead to the basement, pausing to look back at Trixie. "It's... Everything I saved is down here."

Trixie got up as Twilight opened the door, and followed her down the stairs. When they got to the basement, Twilight trotted over to a small cabinet, and opened it to reveal a few spell books, and... "My... that picture, Trixie... I never thought I'd see it again..." Trixie picked up the old photograph, tears welling in her eyes.

"Who was he?"

"O-oh, he was... Like a brother to me," Trixie fibbed. No need for her to know that story, at least... not now.

Trixie sniffed again, rubbing her eyes to clear away the tears before trotting up to Twilight and wrapping her hooves around the other unicorn. "Th-thank you, Twilight. Trixie... I..." She couldn't say more, instead just held onto the lavender unicorn for all she was worth, letting out all the frustration and anger that had been pent up inside for too long in a long, shuddering breath. "Thank you, Twilight. Thank you for this."

~~~

Trixie kept her gaze on Twilight as the other mare turned a bit red, a small smile splaying across her face. "W-well, I'd... I would definitely like to get to know you better first, but... I do like you, and, um..." Twilight buries her head in her hooves. "Gosh, love is too confusing and convoluted! My heart's feeling all fluttery, and, um, oohh... I just... Let's do it, for tonight, okay? And, if... if we can say that we like each other, than let's spend more time together. I'd, um, I'd like that, if it's okay with you?" Twilight peeked over her hoof, quickly ducking back down as her blush deepened.

Trixie just smiled broadly, her own heart soaring, the hole that had been there for too long closing a little. Not much, but it was a start. "Twilight, Trixie- no, I would l-love that chance. I'll do it, I'll be a good pony, I-I can promise that!"

Twilight looks up again, hesitantly, before shooting her muzzle forward to give Trixie a small kiss that lasted forever and a second, each of their hearts beating all the quicker as they both gasped, flustered more than ever before.

Twilight looked at Trixie again, bashfully, and smiled. "We can do this. It shouldn't be too hard."

Trixie pulls Twilight into a hug, sniffling into her mane. "Yes... I know we can."

~~

Hazel gasped when she saw Trixie not standing with the Alicorn who'd come to visit her, but an absolutely beautiful unicorn mare with a purple coat, and a shimmering silvery-blue gown that had stylized magical swirls at the hem and along the bodice. Trixie was wearing a flowing, floor-length dress that was a lovely lavender, streaks of pink and violet accentuating her figure. All in all, the two of them looked beautiful, and Trixie's mother had no qualms about letting them know.

After Nebula was introduced as the two's 'adopted' son, Hazel's eyes had blazed with unnatural light, and throughout the night, Nyx and Pinkie played interference. While Trixie and Twilight were dancing together, Hazel slipped something into Twilight's drink, and Nyx had to dump it into a plant to make sure nopony drank it. The plant turned into a stylized green heart. When Trixie saw Twilight heading over to get another glass, she instead offered her own.

While Trixie and Twilight were participating in a breathtakingly beautiful duet, Pinkie 'accidentally' slipped, knocking Twilight off her hooves, the dart that Hazel had shot at Twilight embedding itself into the wall beyond while Trixie jumped forward to catch Twilight in her forelegs, both singing the last words of the song softly as they stared into each other's eyes, before remembering where they were and who was watching, and got back to their hooves and hurried over to do something else.

It was an equally as tired Trixie and Twilight who collapsed onto a third cushion together, Nebula bouncing around them excitedly, talking of how different Granny Hazel had been, but that she was still cool.

Nyx cocked her head, quizzically. "Her first crush?"

         "What, exactly, happened?" Nyx asked, sipping at her tea.

         The turquoise mare drew in a breath. "It happened when Trixie started secondary education, to further refine her magic. She got her Cutie Mark due to her skill at magic, you know. She wanted to develop her magic as an entertainer, a showmare. I was originally against it, but it made her happy. However, she always came home from secondary school looking a little down and depressed. Eventually, I asked her what was wrong. She was evasive with her answers, until I casually asked if she had a colt on the mind." She smiled fondly. "Her blush was answer enough for me."

         "Wait, if Trixie was so skilled with magic, why not send her to Celestia's School?" Nyx asked.

         "Too expensive," Hazel replied. "And even if that weren't the case, they focus more on practical applications of magic, rather than entertainment applications."

         Nyx nodded. She'd been by Celestia's School for Gifted Unicorns, and knew that they prided themselves on researching new magical ways to make life easier for the common pony.

         Hazel continued. "Continuing on, Trixie admitted that there was somepony at school she liked, but she wasn't sure how to approach them. I suggested that she ask him out to his face, but she protested, saying it would never work. I eventually gave her a small vial of potion that I told her would increase her courage, and let her ask. She took it, and said she'd consider it." The potionsmistress smiled warmly at the memory. "The next day, Trixie came home looking like she was on Cloud 9. She thanked me, and told me the potion worked, and she now had a date with the colt! I was happy for her, and I helped her get dressed for the date, although she was insistent that I not meet him yet. I understood that; meeting the parents often comes later in a relationship."

         Nyx smiled as well. "It sounds like things were working out. So, what went wrong?"

         Hazel's warm smile evaporated, and she looked down. "A couple of weeks after she started dating, I realized that I needed somepony in my life, too. I decided to go out to a club one night, while Trixie was attending a sleepover at one of her mare friends' place. At the club, I met a rather dashing stallion named Card Sharp. He was a specialist at card games, and he mentioned that he was a teacher of performance magic as well." She sighed. "That alone should have been a red flag."

         "Uh-oh..." Nyx had a feeling she knew what would be said next.

         "I took Card Sharp home with me, and... well, we were both a little inebriated..." Hazel was blushing furiously through her coat. "A-anyway, we ended up in bed together, not that either of us were complaining. But when we woke up, it was to Trixie's gasp of utter shock. Imagine my astonishment when Card looked more embarrassed than I was, telling her 'it's not what it looks like'. Trixie promptly threw him out of the house, then started yelling at me. As it turned out, her crush/coltfriend was Card, who taught at her school. The old schoolfilly/teacher crush/romance. So, seeing him in bed with her mother didn't do wonders for her attitude towards me."

         "I can imagine... So is that why she doesn't like you?" Nyx wondered.

         "Oh, no. The true hatred came just after. As it turned out, a paparazzi for the school newspaper happened to be lurking nearby, and caught most of her yelling at me. The next day, the newspaper's headline read 'Teacher/Student Relationship Doomed By Hot Mom'." Hazel spat out the headline. "Trixie became a laughingstock within the day, and Card was no better off. He tendered his resignation the very same day, and told Trixie he was leaving her and the town. Trixie came home in tears, yelling the whole story at me." Tears pooled around Hazel's eyes. "She packed her bags that same night and fled, and I haven't seen her since."

         Nyx was truly sympathetic to the turquoise mare. She'd read about such romantic failures in the few romance novels Twilight had in her library. And to think that Trixie had been such a victim of circumstance! She sighed. "Miss Lulamoon - "

         "Call me Hazel, dear."

         "Hazel, then." Nyx gathered her courage. "Look, I didn't know about any of this. And Trixie honestly does want to reconnect with you. There's been some... unique circumstances that have cropped up. It's not my place to explain, but there's a small party being held in Ponyville, and she's one of the guests. If you could attend, she can explain what's going on."

         "And I'll have the chance to apologize for my part in her utter embarrassment," Hazel mused. She smiled, and nodded. "Alright. If Trixie's willing to give me a chance, I'll go."

Nyx was startled by the pegasus lying on the ground. Not because she didn't recognize who it was, but because she did. "Rainbow Dash!" There was no mistaking the colorfully-maned pegasus, but what Nyx couldn't figure out (aside from why she was there in the first place) was why Dash was dressed in dark, imposing-looking plate armor with a spear on the floor right next to her.

With no way of knowing what had happened to her, or if Dash was just taking a nap, Nyx reached out a hoof to nudge the pegasus awake. When Dash opened her eyes, Nyx smiled and asked, "Hey, Dash, sorry to interrupt your nap, but I just found you laying there and-"

"NIGHTMARE MOON!" Nyx jumped as Rainbow Dash spat out that hateful name, instantly flipping herself upright and grabbing her spear in one fluid motion so that she could hold its tip pointed at Nyx's throat. "So, that whole 'I'm reformed now and flying away on the moon' thing was just a ruse, huh? Well, you're not getting away with it this time!"

Nyx's eyes went wide as saucers. "Wh-what?! Rainbow Dash, what are you talking about?! It's me! Ny-"

"Oh, I haven't forgotten who you are, NIGHTMARE MOON! Just because you're punier than last time doesn't mean I'm gonna give you a chance to get inside my head. Brainwash me twice, shame on you; brainwash me three times, shame on me!"

Nyx confusedly asked, "Brainwashed?" But then she yelped and reflexively pulled back as Dash actually thrust forward with her spear with clearly lethal intent! "Dash! What in Celestia's name are you doing?!" she asked, ducking from side to side to avoid the flurry of spear thrusts that came at her from the most loyal pony she'd ever known. Even though she had just woken up, the pegasus wielded the spear like a professional, and Nyx couldn't even spare the time to wonder where she had learned such skill without putting herself at risk.

With a flap of her wings, Dash suddenly flipped over Nyx and whipped her spear around to strike the alicorn's flank with the butt end of it. The impact struck like a club, making her hind leg explode with pain and momentarily stumble, leaving her open for a follow-up attack that would have impaled her if she hadn't reflexively summoned a magic blade to parry the spear and push back against the freakishly strong and skilled Dash.

Hobbling around to face the pegasus again, Nyx spoke with a voice filled with a mixture of fear and concern. "Dash, you're not yourself! Let's get Twilight, and she can-"

Again, Dash interrupted, though. Her eyes narrowed as she asked, "Twilight?! Did you do something to Twilight or Rarity? If you touched a hair on their manes, I'll-! This isn't over!" Pushing herself off, the armored pegasus flew straight into one of the windows, smashing through the glass while Nyx cried out for her to stop.

"This is so bad," she said to herself as she galloped toward the castle exit where she saw the rainbow-colored blur of the armored pegasus flying away. Stretching her own wings, she took flight and tried to catch up, even though she knew trying to outfly Rainbow Dash was a futile effort. Sure enough, it wasn't long before she lost sight of the pegasus completely.

"Okay, think, Nyx. She wasn't acting like herself at all... it was like she didn't even remember me. Maybe she got hit on the head. Maybe it was a spell. Either way, I've got to tell the others!" She banked toward Ponyville, hoping to find somepony who could explain what just happened and help her snap Dash out of it. Along the way, she encountered...

Nyx was, by this point, semi-accustomed to being an impromptu landing zone for certain pegasi. On some occasions, it was Ditzy Doo, losing her flight path as her misaligned eyes betrayed her. Admittedly, Ditzy had been getting better. She was receiving treatment for both her strabismus and logarrhea, treatment that served to make Ditzy more stable in flight, and more coherant as well. The other pegasus Nyx was used to landing on her was Rainbow Dash, whom she was currently chasing.

         So it came as a bit of a surprise to the alicorn when her flight path was derailed into a nearby cloud. "Oops, sorry Nyx, didn't see you there," came the familiar brash voice. Nyx looked up, and blinked. Yes, this was the Rainbow Dash she was used to, with no armor, no spear, and not calling her hateful names. Instead, she was smiling down at the alicorn, a smile that slowly faded. "Uh, you okay? You look like you've seen a ghost or something."

         Nyx slowly stood up on the cloud. "It's 'or something', Dash." Her eyes narrowed as a possibility occured to her. "I think there might be a Changeling masquerading as you."

         Dash's eyes flashed. "WHAT?! I thought we took care of them years ago!"

         "Well, yeah, but I found somepony in the castle who looked identical to you, down to the facial structure. Though... I thought Changelings could only morph their appearances." Nyx put a hoof to her chin.

         "Well, this... doppelganger of you was dressed in some sort of heavy armor and carried a spear. And she's pretty good with it, too."

         Rainbow blinked. "Why would I ever need a spear? I'm strong enough with my own two hooves!"

         Things are very, very messed up. This thought was foremost in the dragoon Rainbow Dash's mind as she looked at the landscape. There were absolutely no familiar landmarks. How had she gotten from Mt. Ordeals to... wherever she was now? She could never recall seeing a place like this throughout the whole world. There was a relatively small town nearby, and off in the distance she saw a fancy castle. But the shape and design matched none of the castles that Rainbow Dash had seen in her time. Hence why she had screamed at the top of her lungs.

         "Argh! This makes no sense!" she snarled, punching a nearby cloud in her agitation. "Nightmare Moon's back, and I don't know where the buck I am!" She paused as a thought occured to her, and her eyes widened. "Wait a minute... Of course! Nightmare Moon! She must have brought me here for... some reason! I'll just go back, kick her flank, and make her take me back home! Piece of cake!"

         "Funny. I said the same thing about catching you." The voice came from behind her, startling her. But it was more than its sudden appearance. It was the eerie familiarity. Turning around, Rainbow Dash came face to face... with Rainbow Dash. The major difference was that one wore armor, while the other was completely naked.

         The armored Dash's eyes went wide. "Wh-what the hay? Are you just one of Nightmare Moon's illusions?!" She whipped out her trusty spear, aiming it at the other.

         For her part, the unarmored Dash barely flinched at the weapon. Her eyes narrowed, however. "Hey, don't call Nyx that! Nightmare Moon is a thing of the past!"

         The two pegasi began to circle each other in midair. "Says you!" the armored one said. "I saw her myself! Sure, she's smaller than I remember, but I'm not looking a gift horse in the mouth! It'll be easier to smack her around if she's so weak!"

         The other glared. "You aren't going to smack her around, not if I can help it!" With that, she lunged at the dragoon.

         Dash was careful not to strike to kill. This may just be one of Nightmare Moon's illusions. On the other hoof, it might just be some poor pony she brainwashed and altered to look like me. I can't afford the risk of killing an innocent. She jabbed and swung with the blunt end of the spear. To her amazement, her doppelganger dodged and wove around her swings in a manner similar to her monk friend, Applejack. Could she be from Stabul? I didn't know they accepted non-Earth ponies as monks!

         She was less impressed when the look-alike tried kicking her, and just rebounded off her armor, clutching her hoof. "Yeesh, did Nightmare Moon's brainwashing make you dumber? This is full-plate armor! No dinky little kick is going to get through this!"

         Her double frowned, then soared up and away slightly. Dash watched her with a smirk, confident she'd run the mare off. That confidence vanished as her double did an about-face, and began to fly around her at high speed. Dash's eyes widened as she recognized the beginnings of a tornado. Quickly, she strapped her spear to her back and flew counter to her double, disappating the vortex that had partially formed.

         The two pegasi hovered in midair, panting at the exertion. Dash was feeling it more than her double, though. Her armor, while effective in combat, was considerably less so when dealing with weather. Still, she smirked. "It'll... take more... than that... to take me down," she panted.

         Her double merely smirked back. "Like an alicorn?"

         Dash barely had time to register the sentence before she was wrapped in a magical aura, and spun around to face Nightmare Moon again. "Now," the black alicorn said, keeping a firm grip with her magic, "are you going to try to attack me again, or are you going to listen?"

         Dash glared. "Why should I listen to anything you have to say? Twilight trusted that you were purified by the Elements, yet here you are, corrupted again! Are you going to try to destroy the world again?"

         Nightmare Moon glanced over Dash's shoulder, clearly looking at her double. "Would it help if I said I have no idea what you're talking about? Sure, I tried to bring eternal night, and actually succeeded for a couple of weeks, but the Elements of Harmony have never been used on me. Successfully, that is."

         Dash narrowed her eyes. "Are you trying to mock me?! I was there! I used one of the Elements on you! They purified you and destroyed the Giant of Babil! Don't tell me you've forgotten!"

         Before anything more could be said, a voice reached them from the ground. "What in tarnation is goin' on up thar?!"

         Looking down, all three fliers saw five more ponies below them. Five ponies they all recognized... or thought they did, in one case.

         Dash's double flew down to join the five first. "We caught some crazy pony who looks like me, that's what's going on!"

         "Who the hay are you calling crazy, you imposter?!" roared Dash, as she struggled to get out of the magical grip of Nightmare Moon.

         There was a pause. "She certainly sounds like you, darling," an alabaster unicorn said, looking between Dash and her double.

         Dash's heart skipped a beat. "Wha - ?" Then a thought occured to her, and she leveled a glare at the alicorn. "You... you brainwashed all of them, didn't you? You sick, twisted - "

         Nightmare Moon cut her off. "If I had brainwashed them, there'd be signs. They'd have my eyes, for one thing." She flew down to the others, and turned Dash around to face them. "Look. Do any of them have my eyes?"

         Dash remembered that from Twilight's description of her own brainwashing. Looking around, the dragoon's heart sank as she realized there was no trace of turquoise in any of the eyes she saw. Even her clone had her own, familiar rose-colored eyes. "So... if they're not brainwashed... then what the bucking hay is going on here?!"

         Twilight - or the pony that was a dead ringer for her, down to the cutie mark - smiled. "Well, in order to better answer that, why don't we head to the library? That way, we'll have a degree of privacy."
