The white unicorn delicately tapped her chin in thought as her mind went off on a tangent. "Goodness knows, it's next to impossible to get our Rainbow Dash to put on the more ladylike attire I've tried to make for her, but this gives me some fresh ideas! Oh, the things I could do with you... perhaps you could come by the boutique when you have a free moment, and I can get you out of that armor to try a few ensembles?"

Fortunately for the dragoon, the 'mysterious allure' provided by her helmet also made it more difficult for the others to see her cheeks turning red from the compliments. "I... uh... s-sure! Dragoon Dash it is," she replied before puffing out her chest with pride and gloating to her double. "See? She knows I'm awesome." Rainbow Dash just stuck her tongue out in response.

Applejack said, "That was one o' mah suggestions, so why'd ya latch onto it when Rarity... Ah, never mind, that ain't the question ah wanted to ask. Ah was wonderin'-" Before the farm pony could finish her thought, though, the group was suddenly interrupted by a terrified scream!

Everypony whirled around to see Fluttershy backing away from the thick brush on the side of the path. During the heated argument between the two Dashes, she had instinctively held back away from it, only to notice a rustling in the bushes. Thinking it to be some animal, she had leaned in to get a better look only to get a glimpse of something horrifying!

Pulling itself up out of the brush was a huge, slimy mass of something that was half drooling, fang-filled mouth, and the rest of it seemed to be nothing but tentacles and eyestalks! None of the Equestrian ponies had seen anything like it, but Dragoon Dash immediately knew the danger and pulled her spear from her back. "Fluttershy! Get away from it, quick!"

The timid yellow pegasus, not knowing what the creature was, nevertheless had a track record of being able to pacify hostile creatures. Focusing what confidence she had, she faced the monster and gave it The Stare, looking it straight in a few of its many eyes. "Now that wasn't very nice, startling me like that," she said sternly to the monster, which stopped in its tracks and gave her what was probably a confused look. "You should know better! Now, if you want to start over, you should apologize right now! Otherwise, you should go right back where you came from, if you're just going to cause a commotion and scare innocent ponies!"

The monster was apparently locked in place by The Stare, and started to pull back a little. But then it started to inhale, causing Dragoon Dash to shout, "Hold your breath, everypony!" She then pushed herself off the ground and started flying straight up into the sky as the monster belched out a cloud of noxious gas.

Being the closest to it, Fluttershy caught the brunt of the cloud. As soon as it touched her, the pegasus's eyes began to burn, her nose and lungs doing the same. Her body was wracked with painful coughs, soon joined by the others as they reflexively cried out for their friend, only to get caught in the cloud as well!

"That... *cough* *cough* fink..." Rainbow Dash snarled between hacking coughs, looking up with nearly blind eyes toward the sky. "Big... purple... *cough* CHICKEN *cough* abandoning us!"

The creature's horrible breath wasn't the worst of it, though, as the debilitating effects of the gas broke whatever hold The Stare might have had over it. As Fluttershy fell to the ground, the monster shambled over toward her and picked her up with some of its tendrils, its mouth opening wide. Between coughs, the others could hear the pegasus let out a ragged scream.

Nyx, the most combat-capable of the group, reflexively summoned her magic blade and struggled to fight the effects of the gas enough to hurry to Fluttershy's aid. Because she was nearly completely blinded, though, she was afraid to attack recklessly for fear of accidentally hitting Fluttershy. She staggered toward the pegasus's scream, but was going to be too late.

From out of the blue, however, a streak of dark purple and cyan came shooting down toward the ground at incredible speed! Dragoon Dash flapped her wings as rapidly as possible, gathering more and more velocity as she aimed her spear at the monster. She felt the sound barrier trying to resist her, pushing back against her, but she held her spear close and used the unique shape of her dragon knight armor to increase her aerodynamics, breaking that barrier just before she slammed into the monster, her spear punching straight through it!

The Sonic Rainboom that erupted from the point of impact sent out a shockwave that didn't just blow the monster apart from the inside out, but also blew the gas cloud away in all directions, where it could disperse harmlessly into the breeze. In the aftermath, the others wiped their bleary eyes clear and saw the dragoon standing in the scattered mass of tentacles and breathing heavily. With a cocky smirk, she said, "I told you to hold your breath. Those Malboros are bad for your health."
1553312112.title: The Malboro Mare

choices: Dragoon Dash continues her explanation of each pony
They are interrupted as Spike runs in with a message from Celestia!
15533121121.content:
Aside from the incident with the monster - which Dragoon Dash informed them was a Malboro - there was nothing else stopping the group from reaching the library. By some stroke of luck, nopony was around to question the existence of two Rainbow Dashes existing at the same time. Everypony breathed easier once they were safely inside.

         Spike's reaction to seeing a second Rainbow Dash, clad in armor and wielding a spear, was to sigh and head to the kitchen, mumbling, "It's not even Tuesday..."

         Dragoon Dash followed the baby dragon's progress with wary eyes, before she was poked by Applejack. "Ahem. Ah think ya owe us all an explanation?"

         The dragoon nodded. "Not that I know much of what's going on... All I know is that I was on Mt. Ordeals, training to increase my skill."

         "Increase?" Nyx said incredulously. "You're plenty skilled enough already! Hay, you managed to make me stumble from a blow from the blunt end of your spear, and that's no easy task."

         Dragoon Dash was about to make a snarky reply, but she became acutely aware of the death glare she was getting from Twilight. Nervously, she said, "Ah-heh... no hard feelings? I thought you were Nightmare Moon, that's all..."

         Nyx rolled her eyes. "Yes, I gathered that from the way you kept calling me that hated name. I'm not really Nightmare Moon, but rather, her reincarnation."

         The armor-clad mare blinked. "Reincarnation? You mean, like a phoenix?"

         "Close, but not quite," Twilight explained, getting into 'lecture' mode. "You see, when a phoenix dies and comes back to life, that is known as a ressurection. Ressurection, from what I've read, allows the being in question to retain all memories of the life prior to their death. Reincarnation, on the other hoof, entails a completely new life, with no access to the previous life's memory."

         Dragoon Dash nodded. "I get it. So, she was reborn, not just brought back from the dead, right?"

         Twilight beamed. "Exactly. You seem to grasp things better than our Rainbow, that's for sure."

         "Love you too, Twi," Rainbow Dash snarked from above.

         Chuckling, the dragoon nodded. "Anyway, so you're the reborn form of one of the greatest evils to ever plague the land? That's gotta be hard on you."

         Nyx sighed, her mood dropping. "You have no idea... I have enough trouble dealing with the stigma of Nightmare Moon's actions on this world, I don't need whatever she did on yours laid on my shoulders as well!"

         Dragoon Dash cocked her head. "So, we're going with the theory that I'm on a different world than I'm supposed to be?"

         "That is the most logical explanation," Twilight said. Noting the confused looks on everypony else's face, she elaborated. "There are theories that say multiple versions of the same world can exist, albeit slightly different from each other owing to choices or events that occured differently in each world. Rarity, do you have some ribbon and a marker I can borrow?" Rarity nodded, offering the requested items over to Twilight. "Thank you," the lavender unicorn said. "Now, suppose this ribbon," she held up a red ribbon, "represents the timeline of our world as we know it. Everything that's happened in our timeline makes up this red ribbon."

         "So what's the point yer tryin' ta make, sugarcube?" Applejack asked.

         "I'm getting there. Now, remember how the six of us got our cutie marks on or near the same day thanks to Rainbow Dash?" Everypony save for Dragoon Dash nodded, and Rainbow took the opportunity to smirk at the armored mare. "Now, this isn't an insult to your abilities, Rainbow, but there was always the chance you wouldn't have pulled off the Sonic Rainboom when you did, right?"

         Rainbow's smug look wilted like a weed under a garden-scouring spell. "I - ! But - ! You - !" she sputtered for a few moments, before sighing in defeat. "Yeah, I guess there was that chance."

         Twilight nodded. "According to the theory we're going by, somewhere out there is a world where Rainbow Dash didn't perform the Sonic Rainboom." She marked the red ribbon with the marker, and laid a blue ribbon branching off the red from the marked point. "This blue ribbon is that other world, or rather, alternate timeline."

         Everypony was somber at that revelation. Dragoon Dash finally broke the silence with a cough. "So, you're saying that I've somehow hopped from my 'ribbon' onto yours, right?"

         Nyx and Twilight nodded. Rainbow then spoke up. "Well, the sooner you get to work figuring out how to send her home, the better!"

         Before the dragoon could protest, Twilight shook her head. "It's not going to be that easy, Rainbow. Without knowing how she got here in the first place, sending her home is going to be a chore."

         "Then there's the fact that somehow, monsters from my world are popping up over here," Dragoon Dash added. When everypony looked at her curiously, she elaborated. "None of you have ever seen a Malboro before today, right? That kinda means something's wrong. And I frankly wouldn't be able to live with myself if I went home without fixing it. I can't leave my friends hanging, after all, even if you aren't exactly the friends I know."

         Rainbow's glare lost a fair bit of its intensity at that. "Yeah, I understand how you feel. I guess if I were in your horseshoes, I'd feel the same way."

         Twilight nodded, then turned to the dragoon with a smile. "On that note, what can you tell us about the versions of us from your world?" Her smile widened. "Oh, I bet I'm a mage somewhere, doing good for the sake of other ponies!"

         Dragoon Dash chuckled. "Hate to burst your bubble, but magic's not really your strong suit back home." Twilight looked gobsmacked, so she pressed on. "You are, in fact, one of the queen diarchs of the kingdom of Colton, where I served until recently as the Dragoon commander."

         Twilight's eyes bugged out. "I-I-I-I'm ROYALTY?!" she sputtered.

         "Well, you did help save the world, and you're well-known and loved in Colton," the armored mare explained. "And you're happily married to Rarity."

         Rarity almost matched Twilight's expression. "I-I beg your pardon?!" she gasped out, before looking at Twilight. "Not that there's anything wrong with you, dear, but I assure you that my interests lie firmly with the stallion persuasion."

         Twilight nodded, blushing furiously. "Same here. And even if that wasn't the case, you all are my friends! I couldn't picture any of you being closer than that!"

         Rarity nodded. "Exactly. I would hate to risk losing friendship for an endeavor that might never go anywhere anyway." She shook her head, then turned her attention back to the smirking dragoon. "So, aside from ruling this kingdom, what do Twilight and I do?"

         Dragoon Dash smiled. "Twilight is one of the best damn swordsmare's the kingdom's ever seen. She started out serving as a Dark Knight under the previous king, but she eventually gained the power of a Paladin as well, balancing light and darkness in herself to bring balance to the world." She paused for a moment. "At least, I think that's how she explained it."

         Twilight blinked. "Me, a swordsmare? Well, I guess in different circumstances, I can see it..."

         The dragoon continued. "Rarity, on the other hoof, is a White Mage, a wielder of magics designed to heal and support allies in the field, although she also mastered the mighty Holy spell, which is basically one giant 'screw you' to anyone thinking she's an easy target. Oh, and she's also a crack shot with a bow. Makes it look artistic at times."

         Rarity tapped her chin in thought. "Well, I guess I can see a certain elegance to archery. Goodness knows it requires more skill than swinging a sword around like a lunatic."

         Twilight looked askance at Rarity. "I don't fall into that catagory, do I?"

         Rarity blinked, then blushed. "Well, no. I mean, you don't, Twilight. And I doubt your counterpart is a lunatic either, I was just making a note."

         Pinkie Pie interrupted, having been unusually silent. "So when are you going to get to the part where you had a secret crush on Rarity?"

         Dragoon Dash stared, wide-eyed, at the pink pony. "How the hay did you - ?"

         "It's Pinkie Pie," chorused everypony else.
15533121121.title: Welcome to Corneria! ... Er, Ponyville!

choices: A moon not controlled by Luna has appeared in the sky!
A fleet of flying ships appeared out of nowhere!
155331211211.content:
Rainbow Dash groaned and facehoofed as the realization sank in. "Oh, sheesh, wait a minute. You're telling me my double from another world is a filly-fooler... and she didn't even get the filly? What's up with that?"

"Well, maybe if either of you would brush your mane now and then," Rarity teased, getting a dirty look from both Dashes, though Dragoon's expression was tempered by mild embarassment.

"So, do all our barn doors swing that way over on your side, or jus' you three?" Applejack asked with a raised eyebrow.

Dragoon Dash turned toward the farm pony and leered. "Are you suuuuuuure you wanna know?"

Applejack thought about it for a minute, then sweatdropped and shook her head. "On second thought, why spoil th' mystery? Ah'm more curious about mah job over there anyway."

"Royal concubine!" Dragoon Dash replied immediately, but she couldn't keep a straight face and started guffawing when everypony saw Applejack turn white as a sheet. "Nah, nah, I'm just messing with you. You're the toughest warrior monk alive, master of martial arts and guardian of Stabul kingdom. And last I heard, King Macintosh was looking for a good husband for you in case he never produced an heir to the throne."

Color returned to Applejack's face as she sighed and rolled her eyes. "Ah, dangit, mah Big Mac's startin' t' get the same way, talkin' 'bout me startin' mah own branch on the Apple family tree, even though ah'm so busy runnin' the..." She trailed off again, the others just as stunned as she was as the realization hit. "KING MACINTOSH?!"

"Oh, wow, you're a princess," Fluttershy said softly, beaming at her earthy friend. "That must be so exciting!"

"No way! NO way! Now ah know yer just messin' with me this time," she stammered in denial, blushing as she tried to hide under her hat. "Ain't no way ah'm royalty in any of them time-ribbons!"

"Whatever you say, your highness," Dragoon Dash replied with a snicker before noticing Fluttershy looking up at her with a gentle, bashful smile.

"So, um... am I a princess too?" she asked. In an instant, the dragoon stopped snickering.

"Uh... not... exactly," she replied. "In my world, you're a summoner." When she could see that the others didn't understand, she explained, "There are spirit beings called eidolons, and summoners are... were able to befriend them, summoning them to appear whenever they needed help. But you did spend several years on the eidolons' world being raised by their king and queen, so I guess that does kind of make you a princess." She gave Fluttershy a hollow smile, trying too hard to make it look good to fool the yellow pegasus.

Speaking softly, almost a whisper, she asked, "That sounds nice... but you said... 'were'... Did... did something happen to the other summoners...?"

Dragoon Dash couldn't keep eye contact, and had to look away from Fluttershy as she replied, "Yeah... um... 'something' did. I don't really wanna talk about it."

Fluttershy backed away. "Oh... okay... I'm sorry if it was a bad question to ask..."

Suddenly jumping in before the atmosphere could grow too heavy, Pinkie Pie bounced in front of Dragoon Dash and asked, "Ooh! Ooh! What about me?! Am I the princess of Partyland? Or am I like the Grand Vizier of Partyland, which is really a boring and evil place, but since I'm the Grand Vizier, I'm under contract to scheme and plot against the actual rulers so it can become a fun and happy place?"

While the dragoon stammered, suddenly caught in Hurricane Pinkie, who was rattling off detailed plans about how her double most likely plotted to usurp the throne of Partyland, Nyx saw Rainbow Dash creep quietly toward the kitchen with her head hung low. Whispering to her mother, "I'm going to go get some snacks for everyone," she got up and followed the usually brash pegasus.

In the kitchen, she saw Rainbow slump down onto the floor near Spike, who had a thousand-yard stare going on as he muttered to himself, "Twilight... and Rarity. Rarity... and Twilight. Twilight... and Rarity."

"Are... you okay?" Nyx asked, trying to nudge the little dragon out of his catatonic mumbling.

He turned his head to look at her, slowly growing aware of her as he said in a thin, strained voice, "Nyx... please... please tell me you have a spell to get that image out of my head!" He clung to her, whimpering at the thought of his long-time crush and the pony he thought of as a big sister.

Nyx gently hugged him and whispered soothingly, "There there, Spike. Come on, it's not like you've lost anything. That Rarity is a whole universe away."

"Yeah..." Rainbow Dash muttered. "A totally awesome universe..."

Nyx asked, "You okay, Dash?"

Rainbow muttered bitterly, "Of course! I'm totally great! I just don't see what's so great about that stupid other me that everyone's hanging on her every word. Just because she popped into this world from one where everyone's a ridiculously awesome gay princess, swinging around her stupid spear in her stupid chicken armor, with her stupid face..."

Nyx started to say, "Come on, Dash, it's not like--" only to be interrupted by Rainbow.

"...and when my friend was about to get eaten by a big ugly monster, she saves the day while I'm too busy hacking my lungs out to lift a hoof!"

Nyx blinked. "Is that why you're feeling bad? Come on, Dash, I know Fluttershy doesn't think that. None of us do. We were all helpless and couldn't do anything in that cloud. I know if we hadn't been taken by surprise, you would've grabbed her out of harms way in a blink."

Rainbow Dash looked up at Nyx, but then slumped back down. "Except I was and I didn't..." she said.

Nyx looked down at the brooding pegasus, but couldn't think of anything to do or say other than to let her deal with it on her own. "Well, Spike, can you help me make some sandwiches?" she asked. The dragon quickly nodded. Anything to divert his attention from the images playing out in his mind's eye, but before they could get the ingredients ready, he burped up a scroll.

Blinking in surprise, Nyx asked, "A message from Celestia? I wonder what it is?" Grabbing it and unrolling the scroll with her magic, she quickly scanned the brief missive, her eyes quickly growing wide with surprise. "MOM!" she cried, bursting out of the kitchen and into the library! To the startled ponies, she quickly exclaimed, "Something just happened!"
155331211211.title: Character bios continued.

choices: "... that lead airship looks like the Sunrise!" (Twilight and Rarity cross over)
"... I think they're being manned by phantoms!" (Battle chapter)
1553312112112.content:
[[Note: As the author of Pony Fantasy IV, I can tell you that the events of this interactive are non-canon. Just FYI.]]

My faithful student,

         Pegasi scouts from various towns have informed us of the appearance of a fleet of strange ships that fly through the air on propellers. Reports indicate that the fleet appeared somewhere over the ocean, and is now heading for Canterlot.

         I admit uncertainty as to the nature of the fleet, so I request the presence of yourself, Nyx, and your friends at Canterlot post-haste.

Your teacher,
Princess Celestia


         Everypony sat silently, absorbing the information. Then Dragoon Dash let out a sigh. "Great... sounds like I got followed. Somehow..."

         "You mean ponies from your world are responsible for those flying ships?" Twilight asked, a sparkle in her eyes.

         The armored mare nodded. "More specifically, Colton is the only kingdom that has airships. Which means it's probably the Red Wings, their premier air force."

         Rainbow Dash cocked her head. "The 'Red Wings'? Couldn't they have been named the Wonderbolts, like the premier flying team here?"

         Dragoon Dash shrugged. "Whatever. Twilight didn't name the Red Wings, King Colton did. Anyway, so how are we getting to Canterlot?"

         Rainbow narrowed her eyes. "What makes you think you're coming with us?"

         The dragoon rolled her eyes. "Their from my world. I'm from my world. Do I need to spell this out for you?

         "That's enough out of both of you," Twilight interjected. "We're going to Canterlot. If we hurry, we can catch the next train."

         Dragoon Dash raised a hoof, but Nyx interrupted. "Train's too slow, Mom. Don't worry, I'll get us there." Her mane and tail began to billow in an unseen wind, lengthening and filling with stars. "Hold on, everypony! It's been awhile since I've done this..."

         The two pulsing masses of stars began to swirl around the group, trapping them in a stellar tornado. Before anypony else could comment, they vanished in a swirling celestial mist that flew off towards Canterlot. The only one left behind was Spike, who looked around, and sighed once more. "Why couldn't this just happen on Tuesday, like always?" he muttered, and began to clean up the slight mess that had been left behind.

*****


         In Canterlot, Celestia and Luna looked at the approaching airborne fleet with wary eyes. "Sister, I admit uncertainty as to our course of action. I have never seen anything like these in our history books of the past 1000 years," Luna said.

         Celestia nodded. "Nor have I. Yet we will do what we must to make sure there is no threat to our kingdom." She turned as she sensed an approaching magic signature, and smiled as the approaching stardust cloud swirled to reveal the forms of the bearers of the Elements, as well as Nyx. "Welcome, my little ponies. I apologize for the short notice, but - "

         Celestia cut herself off as she noticed a discrepancy. Namely, that there was one extra pony who, nonetheless, looked very familiar. A pony who was curled up into as small a ball as her armor would allow, shivering. "Oh, by the Sun, that was weird!" moaned the armored mare, taking off her helmet to run a hoof through her prismatic mane.

         Celestia looked at her, then at Rainbow Dash, then at Twilight and Nyx. "Something tells me there's a story here."

         Before anything else could be said, the armored version of Rainbow Dash sprang to her hooves. "Story, yes, but not now," she said brusquely. "Now, that letter said something about an airship fleet?"

         Celestia arched an eyebrow, and idly folded down her ears just as Luna exploded. "THOU DAREST ADDRESS OUR SISTER IN SUCH AN INFORMAL MANNER, KNAVE?! THOU SHALT SHOW PROPER RESPECT TO THY SOVEREIGN RULERS, AND - "

         Luna was silenced by the swift application of a black hoof to her mouth. "Luna, what have you been told about the Royal Canterlot Voice?" Nyx asked.

         The lunar princess had the grace to look sheepish. "My apologies," she said with a blush. "I'm still unused to the current times, it would seem."

         "Eh, no problem," Dragoon Dash said, scooping up her helmet and putting it back on. Then she blinked, and looked back and forth between Luna and Nyx. "Wow, this really is different from my world."

         "World?" asked Celestia, glancing between the two different Rainbow Dashes.

         Twilight nodded. "From what we can tell, this Rainbow - whom we've taken to calling Dragoon Dash - is actually from a seperate timeline from ours. She's already noted several differences between our worlds."

         "I see..." the solar princess nodded. "Now things begin to make more sense. I assume, then, that the approaching fleet is from your world?" She directed this last part at Dragoon Dash.

         The dragoon nodded. "Gotta be. More specifically, they're probably from the kingdom of Colton, the only nation that has airships. Also, they're more than likely a contingent of the Red Wings, Colton's premier air force." She strode past the princesses, and squinted at the approaching fleet. "Hm..."

         "Can you see anything identifiable?" asked Celestia.

         Dragoon Dash narrowed her eyes. "It's hard to tell, but..."
1553312112112.title: Flight of the Red Wings

choices: "... prepare to land!"
"... fire all cannons!"
15533121121121.content:
"The Sunrise?" Celestia asked, smiling at the name and how pleased Dragoon Dash sounded when she said it.

The armored pegasus laughed in relief as she lifted herself up higher, shading her eyes with a hoof to get a better look. "The Red Wings' flagship. If it's here, that means my Twilight is, too! I'm gonna go up to greet her! Ha, just wait until she finds out we're in a whole other world. She's going to geek out so hard." Before anyone could say a word, the dragoon had already launched herself up toward the airships.

"WHAT DOST THOU... that is, what do you make of this, dear sister?" Luna asked.

Celestia replied, "I haven't seen enough to form my own opinion just yet..." Turning to Nyx and the Element bearers, she continued, "... but perhaps you have. What do you all make of this other Rainbow Dash? From that, I imagine we will have a fair impression of what to expect from these 'Red Wings'. Twilight?"

Twilight Sparkle blinked. "Me? Ah, well... she seemed trustworthy to me."

Nyx chuckled and winced a bit as she looked back at where she had been hit before, her naturally black coat the only thing hiding a nasty bruise. "Yeah, there was no subterfuge in her introduction. My flank is still smarting from when she mistook me for her version of Nightmare Moon."

"She's got some great stories," Pinkie Pie exclaimed.

"Perty rough around the edges, but ah'd say she's a straight shooter," Applejack agreed.

"She's... nice..." Fluttershy whispered softly. "She saved me from a horrible monster..."

Rarity said, "Really, aside from having better fashion sense, she's pretty much exactly like our Rainbow Dash."

"Oh, please," Dash jealously muttered. "Underneath that tin chicken suit and big fancy stick, she's just an arrogant show-off."

"Like I said, darling, exactly the same," Rarity teased, earning her a grumpy glare from the pegasus.

"I see," Celestia said with a bemused grin. "That is a relief. I believe we should be prepared to greet our guests from another world, then.

"Yay! Diplomacy party!" Pinkie squealed, bouncing up and down.

*****


Meanwhile, in the skies above Canterlot, Dragoon Dash flew up toward the Sunrise, and heard the sounds of the ship's lookouts calling out to the crews when they recognized her armor. As she drew herself up to the level of the ship's deck, she saw two very familiar and welcome figures, both clad in gleaming white.

"Twi! Rarity!" Dragoon Dash called out to her dear friends as she landed on the deck, coming in somewhat faster than recommended in her eagerness, so she skidded across the boards before coming to a stop right in front of the royal unicorns. She then wrapped them both up in a big hug. "Aww, it's so good to see you two! But how the hay did you make it here?"

The queen diarchs of Colton both blinked in surprise, but then laughed softly and returned the embrace. "We could ask the same of you, dear," Rarity replied. "We believed you were still training on Mt. Ordeals."

Dragoon Dash snickered and replied, "Geeze, even I don't know. One moment I'm up there, the next I'm in some castle I've never seen before, getting woken up by a mare who looks just like- Oh, Twilight, you are gonna flip! We're in a completely different world! Not only that, but we all have doubles here who've been living completely different lives! Can you believe that?"

Twilight chuckled and replied, "Well, actually, I can. That's sort of why we're here in the first place."

Dragoon Dash released her hug and facehoofed. "Ah, sheesh, and here I was hoping to surprise you. Well, you'll probably like meeting your double, at least. She's more of a magic-user than you are, but just as much of an egghead, and..." She trailed off a little before asking, "Wait, that's why you're here? Why would you come all the way to a whole other world?"

Twilight smiled and patted the dragoon on the shoulder. "Oh, don't worry, Dash, I'll tell you all about it. I'm actually really glad you're here, so you can help out. Just like old times." The purple unicorn stepped up toward the prow of the airship, looking down at Canterlot and all the ponies down below. She then looked back over her shoulder and called out, "Alright, everypony..."
15533121121121.title: Dragoon Dash didn't come alone

choices: "... we've accidentally let monsters from our world loose on yours."
"... we need your help. Our world is in grave danger."
155331211211211.content:
Dragoon Dash smiled, although it faded after a moment. "Say, Twi, Rare, I'm sorry for running out on you two after the whole thing with Discord. I... I just wanted to improve myself, so that I wouldn't be taken advantage of again."

         The two queens smiled back. "It's okay, Dash. I understand completely," Twilight said. "We all needed a breather after what happened."

         "Besides, I have some great news, Rainbow!" Rarity exclaimed. "I'm going to be a mother in a few months!"

         Dash's jaw dropped. "Seriously?! You two..." She forced her jaw closed and smiled widely. "Congrats, I really mean it! You two make a perfect couple!"

         Twilight smiled back. "So... you're over Rarity, then?"

         Dash's smile faded somewhat. "Well... I don't think I'll ever really be over you, Rarity..." She looked guiltily between the two. "But as long as you're happy, that's what matters."

         The two unicorns hugged the pegasus again. The moment, however, was interrupted by a call from the helm. "Landing has begun, my queens. This world's castle, in the sun it gleams!" Dash looked over, smiling as she saw the engineer Zecora expertly guiding the Sunrise to a gentle landing in front of the terrace where the world's native ponies had gathered. Zecora made sure the airship was properly secure, then turned around. "Welcome back, my prismatic friend. To your tale, an ear I'll lend."

         Dash smiled again. "Later, Zecora! Right now, it's time for a meeting."

*****


         The gathered ponies stared at the airships in wonder. The name 'Red Wings' was well-earned, as the hulls of most of the ships were painted a deep red. The exception was the lead airship, the Sunrise. That ship was painted gold, with white trim, and an emblem of a sun on the tip of the prow. Celestia smiled at the similarity to her own Cutie Mark.

         A gangplank descended from the Sunrise, hitting the ground in front of the gathering. An azure-colored mare stepped onto the top of the gangplank, and cleared her throat. Her appearance caught a few of the ponies off-guard. "Trixie!" hissed Rainbow Dash. "What the hay is she doing there?"

         "Hush, Rainbow," Celestia chided. "Remember, she is not the Trixie you know."

         Before anything else could be said, Trixie took a breath, and belted out in a voice that could be heard through the whole terrace and beyond, "Presenting their Royal Majesties, Queen Diarchs of Colton, Twilight Sparkle and Rarity! Also presenting, Dragoon Commander of Colton, Rainbow Dash!"

         As the named mares took Trixie's place at the top of the gangplank, Celestia and Luna arched eyebrows, turning to their own Twilight and Rarity. "Anything I should know about, Twilight?" asked Celestia in a teasing tone.

         Twilight sighed, her face beet red. "I think you know enough from that alone," she muttered.

         The three mares descended the gangplank, followed by Trixie, with whom Dragoon Dash appeared to be having a small conversation. Ignoring that, the two queens of Colton trotted forward, as Celestia and Luna stepped towards them, away from the crowd of smaller ponies. When they were a foreleg's distance apart from each other, they stopped. The two pairs of diarchs examined each other.

         Finally, the white-clad lavender unicorn spoke. "I am Twilight Sparkle, Queen Diarch of the kingdom of Colton on the world of Gaia. This is my wife, Queen Rarity." She bowed to Celestia, followed by the robe-wearing alabaster unicorn.

         When they had risen, Celestia took her turn. "I am Celestia, Princess Diarch and Regent of the Sun of the country of Equestria. This is my sister, Princess Luna of the Moon." Both she and Luna dipped their heads.

         Queen Twilight blinked. "You're both considered princesses? But then where is the reigning ruler?"

         Celestia smiled. "We are. When our mother, the Queen, passed away in a time before written history, both Luna and myself refused the title. We agreed to rule together under the title of 'Princess' in the hopes that our subjects would not think us to be unapproachable."

         Queen Rarity smiled back. "A very thoughtful and wise decision, your Highnesses. We have no such excuse in Colton, I'm afraid."

         Luna chuckled. "Apparently. And since you both possess the title of 'Queen', the two of you technically outrank my sister and myself. Therefore, you may drop the formalities around us."

         There was silence for a moment, before Dragoon Dash and Queen Rarity burst out laughing as Queen Twilight's face reddened slightly. "Are you two finished?" the lavender queen asked acidly once their laughter had calmed down.

         "Sorry, Twi," the dragoon replied, "it's just, I've heard about your track record for this sort of thing. Every pony in authority you meet wants you to drop formalities around them. And this time, they have a legit excuse!" She began laughing all over again.

         She wasn't alone, however, as the two alicorns chuckled as well. Laughter began to spread from that focus point, and soon everypony on the terrace was laughing to one degree or another. Once the commotion had died down somewhat, Celestia smiled at the two queens. "I look forward to the remainder of our meeting, Queen Twilight. Perhaps you would care to join my subjects and I for a meal? I'll have a banquet prepared within the hour."

         "I look forward to it, Celestia," the lavender queen replied. Glancing around, her violet eyes locked on another violet pair. "For now, though, I believe I'd like to meet your subjects."

*****


         Well, this meeting's gone quite well so far, Queen Twilight thought as she sat across from her counterpart near the head of the banquet table. My other self is a librarian, and a mage of no small power, to boot. And apparently, Starswirl has been dead for centuries here. When I mentioned I met him, she seemed to explode with questions. Reminds me of Pinkie Pie when she regained her laughter. And adopting the reincarnated Nightmare Moon as a daughter... I never would have considered that. Here, she glanced at Nyx, who was currently the subject of her wife's attention. On my world, Nightmare Moon was essentially a virus that infected Luna; a virus created by Discord. Yet here, she seems perfectly happy.

         As if sensing her thoughts, Nyx glanced at the lavender queen and smiled. "So, Queen Twilight. I don't mean to be rude, but what brings you to our world, anyhow? I mean, not that this isn't utterly fascinating and all, but I doubt you dropped by just to say 'hi'."

         Queen Twilight sighed, her good humor evaporating. "You're quite right, Nyx. Yes, my Red Wings and I came to this world for a reason." She turned to Celestia, her voice and face lined with seriousness. "Celestia, though it pains me to admit..."
155331211211211.title: A Diplomatic Meeting

choices: Nyx notices Rainbow and Pinkie are missing.
Rainbow and Pinkie spy undetected.
1553312112112111.content:
Most gasped in surprise when they heard this, though Twilight Sparkle wasn't among them. "That's why that... Malboro thing appeared and attacked us, isn't it? So how did they get from Gaia to Equestria?"

Queen Twilight sighed. "It was my fault... Before Rarity and I were given the throne of Colton, we and several other dear friends went on a quest to save our world. Along the way, we made use of an ancient machine. A ship like our airship, but so much more advanced that it could even take us into the depths of space, and allowed us to venture onto Gaia's moons. We gave up that ship, but I had Zecora, our Chief Mechanic, begin work on developing a new type of engine based on what we had observed of its workings. Just in case we ever had cause to venture beyond our planet again."

"But to travel beyond our own sphere," the zebra said, "is a challenge for even me, I fear. The workings I could recreate, of course. The trick was to find a stable power source. One that would let us reach the moon without ending in a huge ka-boom. With much trial and error (mostly the latter), I eventually discovered a new type of matter."

Queen Twilight cleared her throat and interrupted, "Long story short, we found a substance that contained extraordinary amounts of energy. In hindsight, we should have thought harder about where all that energy came from, but we were too eager to start working on how to use it to power our new engines. The early tests went fine, but there was a miscalculation that led to a massive power overload, which got out of control and started creating vortexes. Mostly in unpopulated areas, thank goodness, but our world is filled with hostile creatures. Malboros are bad, but far from the worst you can find tucked away in the dark corners of Gaia."

Queen Rarity admitted, "At first, we were just concerned with protecting our own world and closing up the vortexes. After a short while, though, we came to realize that there was another world on the other side. An inhabited one. Once we discovered that, we did all that we could to close every vortex except for the largest one, at the site of the original accident, we mobilized the Red Wings in order to lend whatever assistance we could offer."

Luna nodded thoughtfully. Obviously struggling not to use the Royal Canterlot Voice, she said slowly, "I see... well, your offer is certainly appreciated, but personally, I am unsure about allowing a foreign military to patrol our lands, no matter who is at its helm. I trust you understand?"

The queens nodded. "This is your kingdom, and we'll respect your decision," Queen Twilight replied, "though from what I've seen of it, you don't have much in the way of a standing defense force. If you choose not to let the Red Wings fight with you, then the least I can offer is sharing training and information on the creatures that passed through the rifts."

Celestia replied, "You might be surprised, Queen Twilight. Equestria is far from defenseless, though it is true that our society is not as martial as yours seems to be. Would you allow me and my sister to deliberate on the matter before coming to a formal decision?"

"Trust me, if you knew these two like I do, you'd jump on it," Dragoon Dash brashly interrupted. "Twi here's a paladin. A paladin. The ultimate goody four-horseshoes!"

Celestia laughed softly at the pegasus's outburst while Queen Twilight blushed over her friend's behavior. "Thank you, Dragoon Dash, that will certainly be one of the things we take into consideration."

*****


The rest of the meal went by without incident as the guests from Gaia and their Equestrian hosts conversed about each other and their respective worlds. When it was over, the queens and Dragoon Dash waited in a guest chamber prepared for them while Celestia and Luna deliberated in private. Meanwhile, Nyx and the bearers of the Elements were given a tour of one of the Red Wings' airships by Zecora, who gave them a detailed description of everything they saw, made all the more impressive by doing it all in rhyming verse.

One pony in particular wasn't paying attention to the tour, though, as Rainbow Dash hung back. When she was sure nopony was looking, she slinked back around a corner and started sneaking her way back up to the top deck. Once there, she looked at the tower where the Colton royals were waiting, and readied herself for take-off.

"Hey, Dashie! Where are you going? The tour's the other way!" Before the pegasus could launch herself into the air, Pinkie Pie's head suddenly popped up from a nearby barrel, startling her so much that she instead stumbled and fell on her face.

Quickly picking herself up, she clapped a hoof over Pinkie's mouth and glanced shiftily from side to side. "Shhh! You wanna get us caught? Look, I need to fly up there and see what those three doppelgangers are up to. It's way too convenient that we get monsters we've never seen here, and then they show up with their heavily armed flying ships and flank-load of soldiers."

"I dunno, I thought they explained it pretty well," Pinkie replied, talking out of the corner of her mouth.

"Yeah... a little too well," Rainbow muttered, narrowing her eyes at the tower. "Like the sort of story a spy would come up with."

Pinkie blinked. "But if you're gonna sneak up and listen in on them, doesn't that make you a spy?"

"It's okay if you're a spy for the good guys! Now, I'm gonna do this no matter what, so are you gonna help me or not?"

Pinkie Pie thought. "Hmmm.... okay! I'm in," she replied cheerfully. "Meet you there!" With that, she ducked back into the barrel.

Rainbow Dash pulled herself up in order to peer into the barrel, only to find it completely empty. Shaking her head, she muttered, "I will never understand how she does that," but then turned her attention back to the tower and took wing.
1553312112112111.title: Better start level-grinding!

choices: Captain Trixie spoke up. "There's a unicorn 'prince' demanding to see you."
A flight of monsters attacks Rainbow and Pinkie!
15533121121121112.content:
Rainbow and Pinkie pressed their ears against the wall, hoping to hear what the Colton natives were saying. Even Pinkie was silent for this, though she had a broad grin on her face. They listened carefully, hoping to catch some of the conversation.

         "... so I guess I was caught in one of those vortex thingies, huh?" Dragoon Dash's voice said.

         "It seems like it," replied Queen Twilight. "The spell that was cast to seal the vortices ▼
proper plural for 'vortex'
is one that could be cast remotely. I wasn't concerned with where the vortices were so much as sealing all but the one where the Red Wings could fit through."

         "Makes sense," the dragoon said. "But, what was it like traveling through the vortex?"

         "It was a little disorienting," Queen Rarity said. "It felt like down was in fifteen different directions at once. And don't get me started on what up felt like. It was only for a few moments, but still..."

         There was a pause, during which Rainbow and Pinkie imagined Dragoon Dash tapping her hoof against her chin. "Well, I don't remember anything like that. I just remember passing out on Mt. Ordeals, and when I woke up, I was greeted with Nyx's face."

         "Huh..." Queen Twilight mused. "Well, perhaps the vortex opened directly above you and sucked you in?"

         "Who knows?" the dragoon muttered. "All I know is that we're here now, and we've gotta stop the monsters that snuck in here from our world." There was a pause. "That is, if the two of you even want me along."

         Twin gasps emanated from the room. "Dash! How could you even think we wouldn't want you?" Twilight exclaimed.

         "I hurt you, Twi!" cried Dragoon Dash. "I literally, physically hurt you! Yes, I was under Nightmare Moon's control at the time, but that doesn't change what happened!"

         "It makes all the difference, darling!" Rarity countered. "You said it yourself, you were under her control, and you were doing things that were against your will!"

         "Not entirely," replied the dragoon, a hitch in her voice.

         There was a brief moment of silence. "Dash, what are you saying?"

         Dragoon Dash took a shuddering breath. "Nightmare Moon... she doesn't always forcefully brainwash ponies. She likes to play on your desires, your wants. That's what she did with me, the first time. She looked into me, and saw that there was a small part of me that wanted you for myself, Rarity. She took that part of me and exaggerated it, so that I was willing to do anything to get you. Even... even kill you, Twi. How can I live with that, knowing that my own weakness almost cost both of you everything?"

         Rainbow Dash was in tears by this point. She had never been in a situation quite like the one her counterpart was describing, but still... they were the same pony, in a fashion. "I don't think I could live with myself either, at that point," she murmured aloud.

         The dragoon was comforted by the presence of her friends. "Dash, no matter what she did to you, the fact is you stood by us when it really counted, when the fate of the world was at stake," Twilight said reassuringly. "And that's all that matters to us. I told you before, I forgive you for what happened."

         Pinkie Pie took the job of comforting Rainbow, hugging her prismatic-maned friend. "See? If that ever happens, Dashie, just stand by us when crunch time comes. That's all it really takes." The pink pony was unusually serious, and Rainbow hugged her back, letting her tears fall into Pinkie's cotton-candy-like mane.

         There were a few moments of silence. Then Dragoon Dash coughed. "So, why are you guys the only ones who came along? Why not round up the old gang?"

         Twilight sighed. "Fluttershy's been busy rebuilding the village of Mist, when she's not visiting the Feymarch. She probably would have come if we'd asked, but she's got more important things to do than fight monsters. Applejack's busy at Stabul, training new monks to replace the ones lost against Colton. We can't pull her away from that, not for something like this. As for Pinkie... well, she'll probably pop up here when we least expect it, anyway. She's crazy like that. But she needs to stay and rebuild Epona."

         "Makes sense," the dragoon said. "And yeah, she'll probably come flying in on the Surprise right when we really need it. She's uncanny like that."

         "Still, I do hope she stays in Epona for at least a while," Rarity mused. "I mean, she'd been seperated from Chrysalis for a while. The two deserve to make up for lost time."

         "Wonder what Chrysalis is like here?" asked Dragoon Dash.

         "Well, we haven't asked yet," replied Twilight. "But if Nyx is any indication, this world is far different from our own in terms of how ponies turn out."

         "Well, I already saw this world's version of Spike. He's still a baby dragon, and apparently your double's assistant at the library," explained the dragoon.

         "Makes sense. He was magically aged thanks to Nightmare Moon's influence on our world, but if she never got to him here..."

         "Makes me wonder what Gilda's like, here. She's my old friend, after all..."

         Rainbow winced as she heard that. She hadn't spoken to Gilda since the day of that party. She still remembered the griffon's spiteful words to her.

         "Well, don't go looking, Dash. We're here for the monsters, nothing else."

         "Yeah, yeah..."

         Before anything more could be said...
15533121121121112.title: Spying on Royalty

choices: Nyx and the others join in, clearing out the monsters
Something ominous happens!
155331211211211122.content:
Rainbow Dash held onto Pinkie and turned away from the wall through which they'd been eavesdropping on the Gaians. She sighed as she prepared to fly the two of them back down to the Red Wings' ship. Deep down, she had been hoping to hear something that would implicate them in a plot. Something to ameliorate the sense of inferiority shed felt since her failure to do anything when the Malboro appeared. After hearing what she had, though, she just couldn't hold onto her suspicions.

Before she could think too much, though, she noticed Pinkie Pie's tail twitching out of the corner of her eye. Her eyes went wide with shock, and she pushed away from the tower wall just as a monster's claws sliced through the air where the ponies had been! Those claws were attached to a flying creature that looked like a large beak-faced gargoyle, which hissed at Dash and Pinkie. And it wasn't alone.

At least a dozen monsters were flying around the tower, and many more filled the skies as cries of alarm spread throughout Canterlot castle. Pinkie Pie yelped and held on tight to Rainbow Dash as she juked and weaved through the air between the attacks of the monsters. Gargoyles, giant birds, creatures that looked like balls of living flame and even weirder things flew around them, lashing out at the ponies whenever they came into reach!

Dash's reflexes were put to the test as she had to evade the creatures while carrying Pinkie Pie. Lacking the weapons or armor of her Gaian counterpart, she nevertheless got in a few good kicks here and there, and would sometimes end up swinging her pink friend into one of the monsters in her attempts to dodge.

Unfortunately, one of those monsters happened to be a Bomb, which got a face-full of Pinkie hoof as the earth pony was dragged and swung around through the air. It didn't burn to the touch, but recoiled a bit, flipping around a few times before righting itself, then glared at the two ponies. With an angry expression on its face, it started steaming and changing color as it gave chase, growing larger and more puffed up as it filled itself with explosive energy!

Even without knowing what it was, Pinkie Pie's Pinkie Sense was going off like crazy as she saw it draw closer, Rainbow being too focused on escaping the swarm of monsters to notice it! "Rainbow! Behind us!" She then scrunched up her face as she felt the sudden urge to sneeze, but only in her left nostril, which caused her to blink in surprise... and delight. "Oh, you're actually gonna want to turn around to see this!"

Rainbow replied, "Kinda busy, here!" But nevertheless she glanced over her shoulder to see what was behind them. At the sight of the bomb, just moments away from detonating, she almost dropped Pinkie in surprise right there! But before it could explode, the sky behind it lit up even more brightly as the monsters between her and the tower were suddenly backlit by a pure white light that came from the horn of a unicorn that Rainbow was far more accustomed to seeing working with needle and thread than looking so... intimidating.

Seeing the light as well, some of the monsters quickly tried to turn and flee, but to no avail as Queen Rarity unleashed Holy on them, the light from her horn splitting off into dozens of shining orbs that flew off in all directions, seeking out the flying creatures. The Bomb that had been chasing Rainbow and Pinkie got caught up in one of those spheres, and was instantly vaporized before it could detonate. Many other monsters followed suit as the balls of weaponized white magic sought out their targets but left Rainbow and Pinkie unscathed, clearing out the sky immediately surrounding them.

Hovering in the air with her jaw hanging open, Rainbow just gaped in astonishment and held onto Pinkie Pie while the other two Coltonese ponies flew from the tower. Dragoon Dash flew, carrying Queen Twilight who had at some point changed from her white, shining paladin armor into a much darker suit of plate mail. Holding a dark, wicked-looking blade in front of her with her magic, Dragoon Dash flew her into a patch of sky where the monsters were still fairly thick. Queen Twilight then swung the blade around in an arc that unleashed a wave of darkness, striking numerous creatures down before they could harm anypony.
155331211211211122.title: Start the battle theme!

choices: Queen Twilight tries to take on Garland alone to defend Equestria
Reinforcements arrive, turning the odds against Garland
1553312112112111222.content:
With Dragoon Dash flying them around despite the heavy armor they both wore, Twilight continued using her Dark Wave to cut down scores of monsters, only pausing every so often to take a drink from her stock of healing potions.

Fighting the fatigue that was building in her wings, Dash said, "I don't get it, Twi! You never get this many monsters all swarming on a place at once! Especially a city like this! Not unless-"

"Unless they're being coordinated by some sort of mastermind," Queen Twilight agreed. She lashed out with another Dark Wave, the deadly technique drawing on her own health and life force to send an arc of destructive energy cutting through the army of flying creatures. When she had a moment to look around, she scanned the ground and saw something that clearly didn't belong in the chaotic panic that had overtaken Canterlot. Someone moving calmly and methodically toward the castle gates. "Down there! Land us in front of him!"

Most of the monsters had been cleared out of the immediate area, giving the Royal Guard and their doppelgangers a chance to start protecting the civilians, so Dragoon Dash nodded and went into a dive to intercept the unnervingly calm stranger. Dropping Twilight down first, Dash then landed beside her and drew her spear. "Alright, who are you and what're you doing here?!" the dragoon demanded.

The stranger paused in mid-step and stopped to look at them. Standing larger than the average pony, and closer to the Equestrian princesses in stature, but with a stronger, more masculine build. Encased completely in black armor similar to Twilight's own, the intruder wore a purple cloak and a horned helmet. Not like a unicorn, though, but rather with two horns sticking out to the side, one on either side of his head. In fact, his body structure and the design of the helmet suggested that he wasn't a pony at all, but rather a large goat.

"Who are you?" Twilight asked, holding her dark blade out in front of her, though she felt increasingly uneasy as she looked at the armored goat. It wasn't simply his intimidating appearance, but the fact that he seemed familiar, somehow. "Are you the one who set these monsters on Canterlot?!"

"I am," the goat replied, his deep voice sounding bemused as he focused his attention on Twilight. "That is interesting armor you wear. If you are worthy of it, then you should already know who I am."

"What's he talking about, Twi?" Dash muttered, keeping herself at an angle so that she would be ready to flank the goat at any moment?

Queen Twilight replied, "I'm not sure." To the stranger, she shouted, "My name is Twilight Sparkle, queen diarch of Colton! As a guest of Equestria, I demand that you call off your monsters, then surrender and identify yourself!"

At first she received no response, but then dark, tinny laughter came from the goat. "Ha ha ha! Well, Twilight Sparkle, since you have given your name, I shall do the same. I... am Garland."

Queen Twilight gasped, the parts of her not covered by armor turning pale. Dash glanced over at her, blinking in surprise at her reaction. "Twi?! What's the matter? Who is this chump?"

"Ah, good, you do know my name. Then you should also know that I will not surrender merely because you ask it of me," Garland replied. He then lifted up a cloven hoof and slammed it down into the ground, causing a tremor that caused the ponies to momentarily struggle to keep their balance as the street cracked open. From the fissure, an immense sword with a blade as wide and long as either of them rose up, the horns of his helmet glowing with magic as he took it up and held it in the same stance that Twilight held hers. "To a true dark knight, such words are meaningless! Let your sword speak for you, and fate will determine who's demands are met!"

Not knowing why Twilight was so shaken up, Dragoon Dash glared. "Yeah, well fate can kiss my flank, pal," she replied, launching herself and thrusting at him with her spear. "You mess with our friends, this is what you get!"

"Dash, wait!" Twilight exclaimed, broken from her trance by seeing her friend make the first move. "He's--"

There was a clash of metal against metal, sparks flying as the dragoon's spear was blocked by the blade of Garland's immense sword. "Ha, yes, that's more like it! Show me what I have been missing in the eternity since I was cast into the void between worlds!" The eyeholes of his helmet began to glow a baleful crimson color, his sword suddenly wreathed in dark magic. "But if this is all you are capable of, then I, Garland, will knock you all down!"

The giant sword swung around, swatting Dragoon Dash away and through a wall with such force that the bricks shattered and crumbled from the impact. In the same swing, a Dark Wave far larger and more powerful than any Twilight had ever summoned erupted from the blade. The shockwave smashed through anything and everything in its way, but unlike Twilight whenever she used the technique, Garland didn't look even the slightest bit winded.

In the aftermath of the attack, Dragoon Dash groaned and picked herself up on unsteady legs, looking like she had been on the losing end of five rounds with a Behemoth. "What... the hay...?"

"You're still alive. Impressive," Garland mused, noting the sheen of a protective magic aura surrounding the pegasus. "Even with assistance."

He turned to look at Twilight, who had exchanged the armor of a dark knight for that of a paladin, which is what had allowed her to access the white magic of a holy knight. Garland growled at her, "You, however, disappoint me. Diluting the teachings I left behind by taking on the mantle of a paladin? Did you think that it would give you greater power? Let me show you what a true champion of Chaos is capable of!" With that, he turned his blade on Twilight.
1553312112112111222.title: What a 'flowery' name for a villain

choices: "... that he was but an agent of an even greater evil power."
More options of dark design
15533121121121112222.content:
A beam of brilliant light lanced between Garland and Queen Twilight, forcing both of them back a couple of steps. Looking up, they beheld the glowing form of Princess Celestia, who landed between them. There was no gentleness in her face now. Every line was hard as steel. Her eyes glowed partially white, a testament to her cold fury. The air grew warmer, showing that the alicorn was letting her nature as Regent of the Sun shine through. And when she spoke, every syllable echoed with the power of the Royal Canterlot Voice. "Begone, dark one. You are not welcome in my city, or my nation."

         Queen Twilight trembled as she beheld the power that was being brought to bear. She sidled over to Dragoon Dash, who was likewise semi-paralyzed in fearful awe. "D-damn... Did our world's Celestia have this kind of power?" asked the dragoon, who was still somewhat unsteady.

         "No... she never displayed anything like this!" replied the paladin-queen.

         Garland, despite his helmet, was clearly uneasy about engaging such a foe. "Your power is your salvation, Sun Goddess. For the time being. I shall do as you ask and leave. But make no mistake, I shall return, eventually."

         Celestia narrowed her eyes as Luna and Nyx touched down on either side of her. Where Celestia glowed with the power of the sun, Luna shone like the many stars in the sky bespeckled her coat, instead of just her mane. Nyx's mane and tail writhed as though alive, though she lacked the visual impressions of the two elder alicorns. Still, she made her case known. "You think we'll let you come back without any repercussions?"

         "Thou art mad beyond reason if thou believes we would condone your return," Luna added, her voice slipping into antiquated speech as her feelings got the better of her.

         Garland chuckled as his sword sank back into the ground. "Peace, goddesses. The Sun, the Moon, and the Shield are arrayed against me, and I won't return for some time. But return I shall, more powerful than all three of you combined. That is a promise." With that, he turned, and a pillar of fire engulfed him. When the flames cleared, he was gone.

         Up above, the monsters began to flee and disperse. With the one controlling them gone, their natural instincts took over, and they left the city. The Royal Guard pursued them to the city limits, aided by the Red Wings. When the last monster had fled, a barrier formed around the whole city, emanating from somewhere in the castle.

         The three alicorns let their power withdraw back into them, losing the extra features that channeling such power brought. Celestia sighed. "I don't like doing that. I hate using my full power, or anything close to it."

         "There wasn't any helping it," Nyx sighed. "That... pony, and I use that term loosely, reeked of evil. It was worse than..." She trailed off, looking down.

         Luna seemed to sense where the young alicorn's thoughts were heading. "Be at ease, Nyx. Thou - ahem, you are Nightmare Moon no longer, and have not been for some time. Your friends and family see this, as do we."

         Nyx's next words chilled everypony. "But there's always a chance of a relapse. No matter how much time I spend among my friends and family, there's the possibility, no matter how remoted, that I might go nuts again. Whenever I think about that..." She left the sentence hanging.

         "So don't think about it." Three alicorns turned to regard Dragoon Dash, who limped toward them, Queen Twilight by her side. "Seriously, if you worry all the time about something coming true, eventually, it will come true. It's a... what's the phrase I'm looking for, Twi?"

         "A self-fulfilling prophecy," supplied the queen.

         "Yeah, that," the dragoon said. "Think about other things, like getting back at that tin can of a pony. Think about how much he deserves to rot in Tartarus."

         "An' don't let anything get ya down!" came Applejack's voice. From the castle, the bearers of the Elements of Harmony converged on Nyx, catching her in a giant group hug.

         "Silly filly! You just gotta stay positive, that's all!" Pinkie Pie said, hugging the alicorn tight.

         "Your days as Nightmare Moon are a thing of the past, dear!" added Rarity.

         "You haven't let us down since, and I'm not going to let you start moping about it now!" Rainbow Dash declared.

         "You're a nice pony, Nyx," was all Fluttershy said.

         "All you need to do is believe in yourself and your own strength," finished Twilight.

         With such a display of support, Nyx couldn't help but smile. She hugged the six ponies tightly, letting a few tears fall from her face. "Thank you, all of you."

         The tender moment was broken by Queen Twilight. "Princesses, I apologize for spoiling the mood, but... in light of this attack, I believe a strategy meeting is called for."

         Celestia sighed. "I believe you're correct. In the wake of this attack, my decision has been made for me. You and your troops are welcome to lend your hooves to deal with the monsters of your world, as well as this... Garland character. First, however, I will need you to tell us everything you know of him. I'll have a strategy meeting called immediately."

*****


         Less than fifteen minutes later, all the requested ponies for the meeting were gathered around a large table. The two reigning Princesses were there, of course, as were the bearers of the Elements, and Nyx. Also present for Equestria was Captain Shining Armor of the Royal Guard, his wife Princess Cadence, as well as the captain of Luna's personal guard. For the visitors from Gaia, the two queen diarchs of Colton were there, along with Dragoon Dash, Captain Trixie, and Zecora. The dragoon had been healed by the expert touch of Queen Rarity's magic, as though she'd never been hurt.

         Looking around, Celestia saw that everypony who should be here was. She coughed into a hoof. "Everypony, may I have your attention?" The mutters around the room fell silent. "Thank you. In the wake of the recent attack, I've decided that the Red Wings of Colton are to be welcomed in Equestria. They have offered their help in dealing with the problem of the monsters, as well as their mastermind. Queen Twilight, please, take the floor. What do you know of this... Garland character?"

         Queen Twilight stood. "What little I know about Garland comes from legends and myths. The legends state..."

155331211211211122221.content:
Queen Twilight took a breath and closed her eyes, thinking back to the records and legends she had read. "Once upon a time, centuries ago, Garland was the strongest and bravest knight in all the nation of Capricorneria, a kingdom of goats that no longer exists in our world. It was a feudal era, with many nations constantly warring against one another. No one nation could gain much of an advantage over the others without the others focusing their forces on them, so the state of turmoil continued. Under Garland's leadership, however, Capricorneria's armies started aggressively seizing neighboring territories.

"Unlike previous times that other nations had attempted this, though, Garland succeeded in gathering large amounts of territory for Capricorneria very quickly. He focused his attention on strategic supply points and political centers. Instead of setting his forces up in large army-to-army battles, he would lead strikes against his enemy's most vital points, personally defeating their best champions and overthrowing their leaders. Without their commanders, many of the enemy armies were quickly absorbed into Capricorneria's, and before the other nations could mount an effective defense, Capricorneria had grown into a powerful empire.

"Some of the remaining nations fought to the bitter end. Others surrendered and were absorbed into the empire once their warlords realized that they couldn't hide behind their soldiers. Eventually, within Garland's lifetime, he had transformed his kingdom from a small feudal state into a superpower with no enemies that could threaten them anymore.

"This was the last thing he wanted. To his people and his king, he was a hero. His king lavished him with honor, glory, wealth, and even offered him the princess's hoof in marriage. He didn't understand that the only thing Garland really cared about was battle. All the victories he had won hadn't been for Capricorneria sake, but for his own love of conflict. And with no serious challenges left outside of the kingdom, he turned against Capricorneria itself. He abducted the princess and stole her away to a nearby fortress, challenging Capricorneria to send its mightiest champions against him if they wanted to take her back."

Both Dashes glowered at this part of the story, and Rainbow snapped, "That rotten snake! I hope he got what was coming to him," before getting shushed by her librarian friend.

"Sorry about that. Please continue," Twilight Sparkle apologized to her double.

Queen Twilight chuckled a little, then took a moment to gather her thoughts before she continued. "Well, here's where things get a little muddled. According to the story, Garland defeated every warrior that Capricorneria sent against him, until finally four pony warriors of light from a distant land appeared. Led by a swordspony of matchless skill, they defeated him and rescued the princess. But even though the stories say he was killed in that battle, they also say that he came back soon afterward, wielding the power of darkness and commanding monsters to terrorize the lands.

"Supposedly, just before death could take him, his anger and thirst for battle drew the attention of a powerful, malevolent entity. It brought him back from the brink of death and gave him the powers of a dark knight. The very first dark knight. In exchange, he would spend the rest of his life spreading chaos and destruction.

Queen Twilight hung her head a little. "Honestly, the records were so old, it was impossible to tell what was fact and what was fiction. Personally, I always assumed he was killed by the four warriors, and that the rest was a story made up after the fact to embellish how evil he was. It's true that when I was being trained in the ways of a dark knight, he was credited as the inventor of the techniques, but he still could have just developed the skills before his death. After meeting him today, though... I think he could actually be the real thing."

"But why would he appear before us now, and in Equestria rather than Gaia?" Princess Luna asked.

Queen Twilight replied, "When we fought, he mentioned having been imprisoned in 'the void between worlds.' Unfortunately... I think we are to blame. Perhaps he was banished from Gaia somehow, and when we opened a hole between our worlds, he was able to slip out."

Celestia interjected, "Personally, I am more concerned with his stated goals. He seemed quite confident that he would be able to gather the power he would need to face all of us. You are the only one of us who knows the ways of the dark knights, your majesty. How would he go about doing so?"

Queen Twilight thought deeply, shaking her head. "I don't know... The skills I was taught weren't nearly on Garland's level, but when I use the Dark Wave, I sacrifice a bit of my own life force and convert it through my sword into chaotic energy that breaks apart whatever it hits. Garland himself calls himself a champion of chaos, so if there is some source of that type of energy he could tap into..."

As one, the Equestrian ponies immediately groaned, "DISCORD..."

1553312112112111222211.content:
The group of ponies, led by Princess Luna, made their way quickly to the statue garden where Discord was kept. Princess Celestia had gone elsewhere, to fetch the Elements of Harmony. Hopefully, they'd be able to seal Discord back up again should Garland break the draconequess loose.

         On reaching the statue, the ponies were relieved that they'd arrived before the armored goat did. Luna sighed. "Good. It would seem we've outmaneuvered him."

         "Maybe he doesn't know where Discord is?" Twilight suggested.

         Her double was more interested in the statue. "So this is what's become of your world's Discord... A statue in a garden. Doesn't that strike you as rather... dangerous?"

         Luna shrugged as Celestia teleported to the group. "Tis how the Elements of Harmony decided to deal with him. What became of him on your world?"

         Dragoon Dash smirked. "Sealed in the core of a moon, drifting off in endless space."

         The Equestrian ponies all blinked repeatedly. Queen Twilight smiled. "Remember what I said when we were discussing the monsters earlier? We had a ship at one time that could take us to the moons orbiting Gaia. One of those moons was where we sealed Discord. Incidentally, that's also where we met your double, Princess Celestia."

         "Is that so?" asked Celestia as she distributed the Elements of Harmony to her ponies. "Strange. Is your Celestia not connected to the sun as I am?"

         The question caused the Gaian ponies' eyes to bug out. "Wait... connected to the sun?! What does that mean?" the dragoon sputtered.

         "Exactly what it implies," Twilight Sparkle said, slipping into 'lecture' mode. "Princess Celestia is the Regent of the Sun, and she raises the sun daily to grace Equestria with light and life. Her power is tied to the sun, and she can draw on its immense power for extra strength if the need ever arises. Similarly, Princess Luna is tied to the moon, and raises the moon when night falls, as well as keeping the stars in order. Like Celestia, she can draw on the cold void of the moon and stars to fuel her power."

         There was silence for a few moments. "So that's what that energy was earlier, when you faced down Garland," Queen Twilight breathed. "You were tapping into your respective celestial bodies to give you power! Except..." She turned to Nyx. "What is it that gives you power?"

         Nyx smiled. "I gain power from the knowledge that my friends and family will be safe when I stand up for them. I am a shield for the ponies of Equestria." The gathered ponies, both of Colton and of Equestria, smiled back at the teen alicorn.

         The moment, however, wasn't to last. "Well, well, well, how sentimental," came a drawling masculine voice.

         Everypony, even the Gaians, gasped as they spun to face Discord's statue... which was as solid as it had ever been. "How are you able to talk?" growled Celestia as she narrowed her eyes at the stone face. "The Elements should have sealed you in all respects!"

         "Six ponies, six chances for a weak link, my dear Celly," came the reply. "Now, for the sake of your friendship, I won't name names. After all, you'll need to retain your trust in each other if you're to bring down Garland."

         This caused everypony to blink. "Waitaminute," Dragoon Dash said, stepping forward. "You mean you don't want him using your power?"

         "Of course not!" snarled Discord's voice, and he actually sounded angry. "That goat is using my power in completely the wrong way! I enjoy chaos, not destruction!"

         Queen Twilight cocked her head. "Strange... you sound the same, but you're completely different from our world's Discord. He manipulated everypony to try and destroy the world."

         "Well then, with all due respect to myself, he is an idiot," was the reply. "I never ask for anything, you know, but this once... stop Garland. He cares for nothing but death and destruction."

         There were several moments of silence as the gathered ponies processed the draconequess's words. Then a deep masculine voice spoke. "How disappointing." A pillar of flame on the edge of the group caused everypony to yelp as Garland was revealed. "To think that a spirit of chaos would ask harbingers of order to stop an ally." A lightning bolt flashed between the horns of his helmet, lashing out to strike the statue.

         Several yells and exclamations followed the crack of the bolt, as the stone fell away to reveal Discord himself. He narrowed his eyes at the armored goat. "While I appreciate the gesture, you are not my ally. You're not even my friend."

         "Yet I could be," Garland replied, even as the various ponies glanced back and forth between the two. "Why do you hesitate to aid someone who would aid you in making use of your full potential?"

         "Maybe you weren't listening when I talked to the others," the draconequess said with a sneer, hopping down from his pedastel. "I am a spirit of chaos. Chaos, not destruction. Allow me to emphasize my point. Celly, during my reign, do you recall if anypony ever died directly by my hand? Not because of me corrupting them, not because they got caught in an environmental shift, did I ever directly kill anypony?"

         Celestia thought back on those dark days. Many ponies had died, some driven to suicide by the chaos, others dead because of changes to the landscape. But... "No, you never killed anypony directly, Discord. Thank Faust for small favors."

         Discord gave a sardonic look to Garland. "And there you have it. I'm quite proud that my hands are, more or less, unsullied by the blood of ponies. And I see no reason to change that. That means no allying with you."

         Garland sighed. "And here I'd hoped you'd be reasonable." With that, he threw a red orb at Discord, which expanded to swallow him whole.

         The draconequess yelped, and beat his fists against the sides of the orb, before lightning began to play over his body, causing him to scream in agony. To the shock and horror of the ponies present, his body began to mutate. His serpentine body contorted and became more equine in nature, his horns moved to the center of his forehead and merged into one, and his wings lengthened and grew into large feathered wings. His arms and legs grew longer and gained hooves as the rest of his body continued to change. When the lightning was finished, and the orb vanished, Discord had been completely changed into an alicorn stallion.

         He staggered to his hooves, leveling a glare at Garland. "How... How did you know about this?!" he snarled.

         "I've known of you since you were but an infant," the goat replied. "How does it feel to be in your true form once more, Discord? Or should I call you Prince Harmony?"

         "Prince?!" exclaimed Rainbow Dash.

         "Harmony?!" gasped Twilight Sparkle. "As in, 'Elements of Harmony'?!"

         "Ironic, isn't it?" Garland gloated. "To think that your own creations could be used against you."

         Discord snorted. "That's part of a life that's no longer mine, you fool. Change me back!"

         "Apologies, but I'm afraid I can't do that," the armored goat said. With that, he rushed forward past the stunned ponies, and slammed a hoof into the alicorn stallion's face, knocking him over. With a quick application of chain and a magic inhibitor ring, Garland had effectively disabled Discord's magic and flight. With that done, the goat latched on to Discord. "You are but one half of a greater whole, Discord. It's time to return to Gaia, where you will be complete!"

         As a pillar of flame manifested around the two, Discord's eyes locked on to Celestia's... and the solar princess was startled by what she saw. Discord was terrified, and his last words conveyed that all too well. "Celly! Save me!" That was all he could say as the goat teleported them out.

         Everypony stared at the spot where the two had been. Then Fluttershy looked up at Celestia, and gasped on seeing tears trailing down the white alicorn's face. "P-Princess? Why are you crying?"

         Celestia took a ragged breath, and when she spoke, her voice was choked by repressed sobs. "He... Harmony... the pony Discord used to be... he was my..."
