15533121121121112222112.content:
Several minutes later, everypony had gathered back in the conference room. Celestia had spent a good portion of that time trying to dry her tears, with little success. Still, when she addressed the room, her voice's strength had returned. "I suppose I owe many of you an explanation."

         "Ta say the least, Princess," replied Applejack. "Ah heard what ya said, an' ah still can't believe it."

         Celestia took a breath. "I believe starting at the beginning would be best in this instance. You see, it's a common misconception that alicorns are immortal. We aren't, at least for the most part. Luna and I are special, in that we are tied to our respective celestial bodies. That bond is what gives Luna and I our eternal life. Other alicorns, such as Cadance, do not have such a bond, and thus are far more limited in their lifespan." She nodded towards Cadance. "She will still outlive the average pony of the main three breeds, but eventually old age will claim her."

         Cadance nodded back. "It's a bit of a pill to swallow, knowing that I'll probably outlive my husband, his darling sister, and all of my other friends," she said sadly. "But at least my aunts will be here to help me out."

         Luna took up the narrative. "Cadance, unfortunately, is one of two remaining non-eternal alicorns. She has the title 'princess' merely because she is of higher noble standing than other nobles, including my many-times great-grandson, Blueblood. Unless she bears an alicorn foal, Celestia, Nyx, and myself will be the only alicorns left. And I'm not certain whether or not Nyx shares my eternal lifespan."

         "And I'm not certain I want to," Nyx replied. "I'm not sure I can handle outliving Mom and all of my friends."

         Celestia coughed. "At any rate, Prince Harmony was a non-eternal alicorn from long ago. He and I met several times, and we grew to love one another. Prince Harmony's greatest accomplishment was the forging of the Elements of Harmony. He spent years working on them, determining what traits would be essential to maintaining harmony throughout Equestria. The first successful test was when a surviving group of Windigos tried to invade. The Elements banished them to the frozen northlands. It was after that event that Harmony proposed to me." She smiled. "I'd never been so happy as on that day."

         Twilight frowned. "So what happened? Why did Prince Harmony become Discord?"

         Celestia sighed. "As I said, he was a non-eternal alicorn. I think knowing that was a bit too much for him to swallow. After learning that I would outlive him, he started looking for a way to gain his own eternal life. He spent years working on it. More than once, I asked him to give up his quest, but he refused. He didn't want to leave me. And, after about a century, he came to me one day, and said he'd done it. He'd found a way to stay with me. I was curious, but he said it didn't matter, that we were now together forever."

         Queen Twilight arched an eyebrow. "And, let me guess. Shortly afterwards, things started going wrong."

         Celestia sighed. "It started out harmless enough. Small pranks on various ponies, an occasional change in his appearance, a random quip here or there. I paid it no mind. But the pranks started getting more creative, and less... harmless. His appearance would shift from one moment to the next. And his attitude towards order had been almost completely inverted. Still, I didn't see it. Or rather, I forced myself not to see it."

         Cadance sighed knowingly. "Ponies can do stupid things when they're in love, auntie."

         Shining Armor coughed. "Your Highness, when did you realize that Prince Harmony had truly changed for the worse?"

         Celestia winced. "I didn't truly see it until one of 'Harmony's' pranks nearly got Luna killed. Even we eternal alicorns aren't truly invincible. The cloud Luna was napping on spontaneously became part of a rapidly-forming tornado of chocolate milk. Harmony had always liked chocolate milk. Luna barely escaped unscathed. But that was when I knew that Harmony was changed. When Luna and I confronted him, he told us he'd grown tired of the orderly world we'd made together. He just wanted to have fun. He was wearing the form of a draconequess by that time, and I knew that there was no bringing him back. I called him 'Discord', and he liked the new name. Shortly thereafter, Luna and I brought his own creations, the Elements of Harmony, to bear against him. The rest, as you know, is history."

         There was silence for several seconds. Then Queen Twilight coughed. "Well, I apologize, but my forces and I must depart for Gaia immediately. Garland said that he was heading there, and we need to secure our borders."

         "Waitaminute!" Rainbow Dash interrupted, incredulous. "What about all the monsters that were let loose into our world? You're just leaving those for us to deal with?"

         Queen Twilight looked contrite. "I'm sorry, but I need to consider my own subjects' livelihoods over those of ponies from another world."

         "I'm going with you."

         Every head spun around to look at Nyx, who had spoken. Twilight finally broke the silence. "Nyx, what are you saying?"

         Nyx had a hard look in her eyes. "I'm saying that I'm willing to offer my help to Gaia in bringing Garland to justice. And, like it or not, Discord is technically a citizen of Equestria, and I intend to bring him back."

         There was silence for a few more moments, before Twilight smiled. "Well, then I'm going with you! Goodness knows, an opportunity to study another world doesn't happen every day!"

         "Count me in, too!" Rainbow Dash said, flying over. "No way I'll leave you two hanging!"

         "Woohoo! We can have a party in another world!" Pinkie exclaimed, bouncing over to the group.

         "Studying the fashion trends of another world would certainly increase my own repertoire of designs," Rarity mused.

         "Ah'd be lyin' if ah said ah weren't interested, mahself," Applejack agreed.

         "Um... I'll come too... if you don't mind, that is," Fluttershy murmured.

         Queen Twilight looked over the seven volunteers. "Um, not that I'm not grateful, but are you sure you all want to go gallivanting off to another world? Besides, it's technically your princesses' call if you can come along or not."

         "It's quite alright, I'm going with them," said...

15533221.content:
The tiny form of a gray pegasus lay absolutely still, a paper hat placed cutely upon her head. She must have fallen from a great hieght, seeing as she was in the very center of a microcrater presumably made by her impact.

"Oh by Celestia..." Nyx rushed over to the foal, carefully placing a hoof on her chest. "Breathing. Heart pumping. Good."

As her hoof came away, she noticed it was covered in glittering gray dust.

"...that's weird. Worry about it later." The alicorn wrapped a gentle telekenetic field around the filly, lifting her carefully in order to avoid hurting her any further. "Alright, my little pony, we're just going to take a quick teleport to the hospital. I promise you'll be okay in no time." Focusing her magic, Nyx disappeared from the scene.

***

Sheets.

Soft?

Beeping.

Not booping, mind you, beeping. Totally different.

She opened her eyes slowly. A... bed? That was the word. Bed. Well, except it was a rectangle instead of a circle, which meant she couldn't curl up like she liked to. Anyway, where was this bed anyway?

There was a screen next to her making weird lines. That explained the beeping. She considered taking it, but until she knew what it did there really wasn't any reason to. There were curtains around her bed... oh, and look! A little table next to her, with her hat on it!

Where on the moon was she?

Curiosity piqued, the foal rolled out of the bed. The Cartographer's Cap was placed primly upon her head--no sense exploring without it, after all!--and she began to examine her surroundings more thoroughly. Nothing for it, she was going to have to open the curtain!

Had she been more focused, she might have noticed a number of subtle things. The dust coming off her, for instance. The sheer color of the place. Birdsong. But it wasent until she came face to face with the window and saw the bright blue sky that she finally understood.

This was not the moon.

She tried not to panic.

"WAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA!"

She failed utterly.

Bursting through the only door in the room, the filly ran screaming down the hall with her forelimbs waving in terror. Nurses jumped from her path, pressing against the walls as the siren rushed past them. She went head-over-heals down a staircase, rolling to a stop at its base; calmly, she adjusted her Cartographer's Cap, shoook her head, and began running in panicked fear again. Eventually she managed to leave the building.

And she stopped, and stared. Grass. Dirt, the real clumpy sorta wet kind. Buildings....

"Wow. Where am I?"

"You are right outside Ponyville hospital."

The filly turned to look at the speaker.... and started screaming again.

Nyx sighed. "And today is going to be a loooooooong day, isn't it."

Nyx tried to interrupt the little filly's screaming, but her words were drowned out by the shrieks coming from the little pegasus, who was pointing up at her with a hoof, eyes bugged out in panic. When that failed, the alicorn sat down on her haunches and decided to just wait it out. As the scream continued, Nyx found herself watching and waiting with a raised eyebrow as she started to wonder just how in Equestria such a little pony could hold so much air in her lungs.

Eventually, after getting tired of waiting, Nyx reached out to put a hoof over the filly's mouth. The grey pegasus apparently took this as a sign of aggression, however, and quickly snatched the Cartographer's Cap from her cute little head, re-folding it in a blink into a Cartographer's Cutlass with which she valiantly swatted against Nyx's leg.

Though this was about as effective as one would expect from a sword made of paper, it did produce several very interesting results. The first was that Nyx noticed the cute little horn on the filly's head, revealing her not as a pegasus, but an alicorn! The second was that she noticed the cute little tiara she wore. The third was that as Nyx looked her over, she noticed the cute little Cutie Mark on her flank, and the crest of the moon that so resembled Princess Luna's.

This took Nyx so much by surprise once it came together in her head that as the filly attacked with theCartographer's Cutlass, the teenager faltered. As a result, instead of planting her hoof against the filly's mouth, she instead gently booped her nose. At the same time, the Cartographer's Cutlass poked hers.

There was a moment of stillness as the two alicorns stared at each other. In that moment, drawn out through the sudden silence, there was a sense of connection between them. A spiritual bond, almost, allowing a sense of understanding to pass between them.

"Do you... like jam?" the little filly asked, breaking the silence.

"Um... sure, who doesn't?"

"Evil jam?"

"Nooo... I prefer grape," Nyx replied.

As the two ponies looked one another in the eye, the adorable pony princess saw the truth and sincerity in the teenager's visage. Truly, this was a mare who preferred grape jam over evil! A champion of delicious fruity spreads, pure and sacred. Not her evil doppelganger, grown large and powerful from the fruits of wickedness, as she had at first assumed. Woona felt so moved by the teenager's good and honest connection to non-evil preserves that tears welled up in her eyes, and she embraced the large black alicorn. A hug that spoke her apology for the misunderstanding so much more powerfully than mere words ever could, even those spoken in the ROYAL CANTERLOT VOICE.

Though a few words would have been appreciated, as Nyx blinked in confusion. "Um... sooo... this is an awkward question, but... are you Princess Luna?" She didn't know how the princess of the night would have ended up in such a state, though it was possible. After all, she had been reduced to fillyhood and Luna restored to full adulthood by transferring Nyx's excess magical power into the princess. Could something have happened to drain Luna's power, reverting her to this... utterly adorable state?

Instead of answering with a straight 'yes' or 'no,' however, the filly bowed in a dignified manner and formally introduced herself. "I am Princess Woona of Equestria, the Chosen Woon, Queen of the Moon Rocks, friend of the Lunar Mares, Bat-Ponies, and Minotaurs, and deposer of the Changeling Regent!" As she finished, she gave a pose holding aloft the Cartographer's Cutlass.

Nyx coughed. "Sooooo.... you're sure your name is 'Woona'. Not 'Luna'."

"Yes my name is Woona!" The filly crossed her forelegs in a huff. "What, do you think I have some sort of lisp or something?"

"Nonono! No, I believe you, It's just..." The black alicorn paused, unsure how to put this delicately. "I've only ever heard of a princess Luna on the moon before. And since I live in Equestria, well--"

"Gaaaaaaaaaaaasp!" Woona's eyes widened, shimmering in wonder. "You live in Equestria?"

"Er... yes, Ponyville is in--"

"CANYOUTAKEMETHERE?!"

"Well. Um. We're already in Equestria."

The gray alicorn blinked. Slowly her gaze roved across the landscape, taking in the plants and the grass with newfound awe. "I... I'm back? But... where's Celestia? Where's my sister?" Her eyes began to water up. "I, I need to tell her about... about the moon and--"

"Whoa, whoa whoa, hold up." Nyx leaned down to the filly gently. "Listen. I... think that things are a little... I don't know, something's not right here. Okay? But I promise I'll try to help you... if I can figure out what's going on. Okay?" She set aside her increasing number of questions for the moment, choosing instead to wrap a foreleg around the dusty Woona in a gentle hug. "Right now, I need to go into the hospital and make sure you weren't hurt. Then we can take you to my mom, she... knows princess Celestia and--"

"She does?!"

"Yes but--"

Woona drew herself up, quickly reforming the Cartographer's Cutlass into the Cartographer’s Super Duper Fancy Crown of Specialness. "As Queen of the Moon Rocks I hereby formally request an audience with your mother so I may ask her to contact my sister."

"....As a senior member of the Cutie Mark Crusaders, I must postpone your request until I have assurance from the medical staff that you are uninjured. However," Nyx added quickly as Woona began to protest, "I will also ask my mother to contact Celestia and prepare a formal meeting between the two of you."

"Wait, how are you going to do that? You can't be in two places at once!"

Nyx rolled her eyes, shimmered, and split into two.

"...Oh. Nifty!"

"Thanks," both black alicorns replied. One of them took off, flying toward the library; the other gently led Woona back into the hospital.

155332211211.content:
Princess Celestia was in the middle of enjoying a brief period of rest and quiet in between her royal duties. Sitting in the middle of the royal garden, she poured herself a cup of tea and watched her many pets play in the sunshine. As she magically raised the teacup to her lips, a scroll suddenly popped into existence beside her.

"Oh, my. I wasn't expecting a letter today. I wonder if Twilight or one of her Ponyville friends have a report?" Holding the scroll in front of her, she took a long sip of tea as she unrolled it and read its contents.

Fortunately for her royal image, nopony was around to see either her eyes bugging out or the spray of tea that drenched the scroll.

*****


"LUUUNAAAAA! LUUUUNNNNAAAA!!!"

The night princess groaned, buried under her covers. To shut out sounds of shouting and banging against her bedroom door, she tried covering her ears with her hooves. When that didn't work, she picked up her pillow and jammed it down over her head, only for her sleep-drunk mind to realize after the fact that her horn made this a bad idea.

Grumbling to herself, she dragged herself out of bed and made her way to the door. After taking a deep breath, she gripped the handles with her magic and yanked the doors open. Her eyes bloodshot and star-lit mane messy from being interrupted in the middle of her sleep, she looked out at her sister and hoarsely croaked, "WHAT?! What is important enough to drag me from mine slumber in the very middle of the day, dear sister?"

Celestia was outside, a hoof raised to knock on the door some more as she was flanked by the Lunar Guard who were stationed outside the princess's bedroom whenever she slept. Seeing her sister's condition, the elder princess looked her up and down and observed, "Sister... why do you have a pillow impaled on your horn?"

Luna looked up at the pillow resting on her head like a letter on a spike. Downy feathers fluttered down around her face from the hole as she returned her attention to the princess of the day. A blush of embarrassment touched her face as she replied flatly, "We asked thou first..."

"Of course, Luna. My apologies for disturbing your sleep, but I just received a letter from Twilight and Nyx that you must see." Celestia held up the tea-stained letter for Luna to read.

Dear Princess Celestia,

A new arrival has appeared in Ponyville. A young alicorn filly named 'Woona', which Nyx found in the Ponyville castle earlier this morning. According to Nyx, she looks exactly like she imagines Princess Luna did as a filly, and claims that you are her sister. If you and Luna are able, please hurry to Ponyville at your earliest convenience so we can make sense of this.

Your faithful student,
Twilight Sparkle

As she read it, Luna's eyes widened much as Celestia's had minutes ago, her mane straightening itself into a more orderly flow as she grew more and more awake by the word. "Woona? Thou means..."

Celestia nodded. "Indeed," she replied, producing a second object.

-----------
Option 1: An ancient map, drawn on thousand-year-old moon paper.

Option 2: A storybook Celestia wrote long, long ago for her sister about a filly named Woona and her adventures on the moon.

The second scroll Celestia held up had the scribbles of a madpony if looked at by anypony who hadn't seen it before. "My star map," Luna gasped. "The map for... You kept it?"

Celestia smiled softly. "Yes, my dear sister. You gave this to me, saying that it was where you hid all your favorite keepsakes and treasures. You said it was where you kept all that you had that was good." Celestia's smile fell a bit. "And then..."

"... Nightmare Moon. I'd barely been a filly back then, maybe Nyx's age when she first appeared, but I had had such big dreams." Luna chuckled sadly. "It truly was a foalish wish, wanting everypony to enjoy my night, when at times it is too dark to see." "Wait." Nyx shook her head. "What?"

"She's completely unhurt," the doctor repeated. "I can't explain it, but she doesn't have broken bones, magical maladies, nothing."

"I found her in a crater. After I brought her here, I calculated how much force it would take to make that crater, how far she would have had to fallen from, how it would effect her mass... I gave you guys the calculations! And you're just saying she's a-ok?"

"Yes."

The black alicorn blinked. After a moment, she put a hoof to her forehead witha graon. "Okay. Okay, I'll just... I feel a headache coming on. You're absolutely, positively sure she's all right? No small problems or anything?"

"Well... there is the dust." The doctor glanced carefully at the little alicorn foal, who was playing with some other underage patients in the hospital nursery. "She's constantly coated in a layer of gray... something or other. When we tried to clean it off, it regenerated. Surprised her as much as any of us." He smiled for a bit. "Then she asked for science Woona to explain, whoever that is."

"Did she?"

"What?"

"Did science Woona explain?"

"...no." The doctor peered at Nyx carefully. "Are you feeling all right?"

After a moment the teenager snorted. "What? Yeah, yeah, this is just... Alicorns are powerful, I should know, and I was thinking maybe she somehow used her magic to... do something. I'm going to go in and talk with her," she added, "she should know about Mom's letter to Celestia."

Nyx walked into the nursery, receiving a few cheers from foals she had saved recently, and gave Woona a nudge. "Hey, so the letter's been... What are you wearing."

"I say, good madam, it is a pleasure see you again. Perchance would you like to join us for a spot of tea?" The alicorn filly twirled her fake mustache, gesturing to a unicorn in a wheelchair and a stuffed hydra. "Miss Owlsong here and her beau Multiplex are certainly excellent hosts."

"Oh you're too kind," the unicorn tittered, sipping a cup that was not filled with anything but air. "Although Multiplex thinks your top hat is a bit behind the times."

"What! Scandalous." Woona adjusted her monocle and gave the hydra a stern look. "I'll have you know this attire is the most dapper thing on the surface of the moon, young sir, and I do not appreciate such accusations to the contrary!"

Nyx sighed. "Owlsong... look. I kinda... I..."

Owlsong gave the teenager big, watery eyes.

Though a former grand-master of the pouty stare herself, this gave Nyx precious little resistance when it was used on her. Besides, she didn't have to interrupt the foals' playtime to deliver the news. Seeing a box of tissues, she levitated a few over toward herself and concentrated on a temporary transformation spell. One tissue was transformed into an elegant sun hat based on one she'd seen in Carousel Boutique. The other was transformed into a scarf that wrapped loosely around her neck and shoulders.

Sitting down on her haunches, the alicorn did her best imitation of Rarity's accent to play along as she replied, "....I prefer degobah tea, darling. Did you hear about Blueblood's party?"

Hearing the name, Woona suddenly gasped, her dapper monocle falling out of her eye and into the empty teacup in front of her before her eyes narrowed. "Blueblood!" she muttered icily, surprising Nyx and Owlsong.

Clearing her throat, Nyx quickly raised a cup to her lips and daintily sipped the nonexistent tea. "Ah, I can tell from your tone that you are well acquainted with him. That stallion may be a prince, but he is surely no gentlecolt. Everypony who actually knows him thinks so."

This got a smile from Woona, who fished the monocle from her cup and put it back into place. "Ah, yes, quite! And he's also quite the cheat at all manner of games."

Nyx replied, "Well, only a pony in the know would wear such a smashing hat, darling. You simply must give me the name of your haberdasher!"

The three ponies giggled and chatted for a few minutes more, giving Nyx a chance to get to know Woona a little better. For an alicorn who had survived the impact she had calculated earlier without a scratch, she came across as nothing more than a silly filly.

"Why, sir Multiplex, you're of the Fillydelphia Plexes? How marvelous, you and Owlsong simply must join me at my chalet this winter," Nyx said to the stuffed hydra before a cloud of mist flowed toward her, wrapping around the alicorn and getting absorbed into her.

Re-united with her other self, Nyx gained her copy's memories and said, "Ah, good news, Woona. My dear mother sent a letter to the princesses--" Nyx suddenly stopped herself. The little filly seemed to think that only Celestia ruled over Equestria. As Woona looked at her curiously, Nyx coughed and added "--elestia. The princess-a Celestia. I'm sure that you will be able to see her soon."

If there was any chance of Woona catching her slip, it was gone the moment Nyx mentioned Celestia's name. A wide smile spread across Woona's face, her eyes glittering with joy before she leapt up into the air, her hat and mustache flying off of her as she let out a squeal with the force of the Royal Canterlot Voice behind it!

"I'm gonna see my sister! I'm gonna see my sister! I'm gonna see my sister!" the little filly exclaimed over and over as she bounced around, hugging Nyx and Owlsong and Multiplex repeatedly and getting a thin coat of dust over all of them. Nyx giggled at the sight and let her hat and scarf turn back into tissues, removing them from her body as she said, "Since the doctors say you can leave, why don't we go to the library? The princess will probably be meeting us there."

Woona nodded happily and waved to the other filly before leaving. "Bye, Owlsong! Thanks for the tea, it was great!"

Nyx giggled and also waved, turning to go. Before she left completely, though, she levitated the tissues over to the recuperating filly and transformed them into a hat and scarf to fit her small stature as a parting gift.

Meanwhile...

15533221121212.content:
"...maybe I should not be here."

Celestia sighed. "We agreed to both come, Luna. It would be easier to explain with you present."

"But you remember what happened when Nyx came into being! You remember how she reacted to learning--"

"That's why we're doing this now. So we can be there to comfort her when she... understands." The sun princess let her wings droop. "I... do not like to think on what happened with Nyx, but I cannot deny that I should have handled the situation better. This is--"

"This is your chance at redemption." Luna nodded slowly; she could appreciate exactly what her sister was going through. "Alright... We're here."

The two of them dropped out of the sky, landing on Twilight's balcony. Celestia made to knock, but paused. "Is there anything you can tell me about her?"

"If she is who I think she is... she will be a very silly filly, absolutely believe you're her loving older sister, stand firm in her beliefs even when they are challenged, and..." Luna blushed. "Well, she might hate Blueblood's name. And probably will try to boop you on the nose."

The sun princess gave her sister a mildly amused look.

"It wasn't like I expected her to suddenly appear!" Luna defended. "I thought Nyx was unique!"

"Well, no chance to back out now." The sun princess tapped lightly on the balcony doors.

Soon enough, Twilight was opening them with a smile. "Pri--sorry, auntie Celestia. It's still weird to think of us being related, and hello aunt Luna!" She stepped back as the two walked in. "I think Nyx is bringing, well, 'Woona' with her from the hospital. They should be here soon enough. Um... is Woona really Luna?"

"Only insomuch as Nyx is," Luna replied primly. "That is to say... she is of me."

Twilight raised an eyebrow. "Sorry, but... [i]of[/i] you?"

"On the night you were kidnapped," Celestia explained, "Spell Nexus did manage to summon a portion of Luna's soul, the portion that was Nightmare Moon. Your blood was used to generate a body for her, but without her memories--"

"I saw," the unicorn interrupted darkly. Then she sighed, her demeanor becoming cooler. "I'm sorry, you just sounded like... those fanatics that keep showing up trying to--"

"Perhaps I should explain, sister." Luna rubbed her forehead. "The soul... when a child is born, naturally, the mother tears off a part of her own soul to give to it. The thing you must understand is that souls can regenerate, can... grow, but only if they are given a form to embody. What they took from me was purely anger and hate, but even Nightmare Moon is more than that, and somehow that anger and hate became a scared little filly in the forest." She gave a dark smile. "I find it somehow gladdening that my seed was so small as to be almost buried by what Nyx became."

"Wait, are you saying you're Nyx's father?! And, and what does this have to do with Woona?"

Celestia and Luna exchanged glances, the sun princess looking away first. "Well.... technically speaking, Luna would be the mother and you would be--"

"Skipping that! Images I don't need! Just... just focusing on Woona."

The white alicorn giggled. "For all that growing up you've done, there are still some things that never change my faithful student."

Twilight gave Celestia a deadpan look. "I was fourteen when I found out about the.... ugh, 'primal era.' Really, going into a catatonic state after seeing images of your princess with--"

"The point we wish to make," Luna interrupted smoothly, "is that Woona is a portion of my soul. But there are... differences between her and Nyx. For one thing, she is from a more---childlike side of my personality, developed while I was...."

There was an awkward silence.

"....you know. And for another.... she remembers her "adventures" on the moon, which to be honest may or may not have happened." Luna shifted uncomfortably. "I had years to... imagine, and there was this complicated story I made up while I was bored, but it's entirely possible that the story has somehow managed to... manifest."

"The unusual thing about Woona, when compared to Nyx, is that she comes from a fully developed alternate world." Celestia shrugged. "That means her soul should, in theory, be attached to all the other souls that Luna imagined is somepony were to attempt to pull her out with the spell that Nexus used to make Nyx."

"So all the wizards want a piece of Luna to make their artificial children?" Twilight asked, somehow managing to keep her face utterly deadpan.

"Twilight!"

"Indeed, she has always been quite the prize."

"TIA!!!"

"The problem here is that we don't know if any of Woona's imaginary friends would also become real." The princess of the sun ignored her sputtering sister for the moment. "To be honest we don't know how Woona came to be. When Nyx appeared, there was a massive... surge in magic, but this is unprecedented. I have no idea how Woona is existing in the physical realm, or if it would allow her friends to come with her. The worst part is she is unaware of any of this."

Twilight sighed. "I thought as much..."

Luna, managing to get herself under control, gave Twilight a sympathetic look. "Don't worry. We intend to explain the situation calmly and rationally but with the most tender loving care we can manifest and assure her that she is just as real as any other pony. We've all learned from the Nyx debacle." She coughed gently. "Speaking of which, shouldn't she be here soon?"

"She probably didn't want to teleport. I can imagine Woona's asking her all sorts of questions about Ponyville on the walk over, they'll be here in no--"

The door burst open, a panting Nyx staring wildeyed. "YOU ALL HAVE GOT TO SEE THIS."

A herd of ponies was gathered around an impromptu stage that hadn't been there when the princesses arrived. Granted, for a town in which Pinkie Pie lived, this wasn't actually that strange. What was strange was that the stage and curtains were all made up of some sort of grey matter. The curtains weren't hanging from anything, but instead went up a few dozen feet before fading out. Not only that, but even though it was the middle of the day and there was no sign of speakers or musical instruments, two spotlights with no apparent source shone down on the center of the stage while its lone performer danced and twirled a cane to a snappy ragtime number.

Said performer was Woona of course. The little alicorn filly was giving it her all to do an entertaining tap dance for the crowd of ponies.

As the princesses and Twilight stepped out to see, the librarian's jaw dropped open. "What the... how is she doing that? Why is she doing that? Can you do that?" she asked Celestia, who was nearly as stunned (just better at masking it).

The sun princess looked over to her sister for answers, but the most Luna could manage was a nervous giggle and a shrug.

Nyx shook her head, and while she couldn't enlighten them as to the 'how', she could at least give them the 'why'. "By the time we left the hospital, word had gotten out that a little filly Luna had shown up, so when we got here, there was this mob demanding to know what was going on. Neither of us really had a good answer, so Woona said something about 'making a good impression', and then this stage just... appeared!"

> Science Woona, explain!

Tapping her pointer against the chalkboard that showed her equations, the cute little science filly adjusted her glasses and explained, "Through a process known as 'Adoragenesis', Woona's sheer cuteness can be used to stimulate the production of moon dust that is perpetually coating her body. The moon dust will then shape itself into any form she wishes (because moon dust is known for being gentlecoltly) and can even vibrate to produce music. This all goes to show that when you're a pretty magical pony princess, anything is possible."

-------


Nyx blinked. "What was that?"

"What was what?" Twilight asked, having been watching Woona's dance.

Nyx shook her head, a hazy feeling in her mind like waking up from a nap. "You know how Pinkie Pie just shows up out of nowhere sometimes? I feel like my brain just did that for a few seconds."

Luna replied, "Odd, I felt the same thing."

"Really? I didn't," Celestia replied, concerned about whatever might have entranced her sister and 'niece' for a moment. Before she could get any more, however, Woona took notice of the princesses.

In an instant, the music stopped and the stage and cane all crumbled into dust which spread out into a cloud, but vanished before it could cause any of the ponies nearby to choke on it. With a cry of "Celestia!" the little filly broke into a gallop toward the alicorns, launching herself toward--

1553322221222.content:
Nyx blinked as her horn illuminated not one, but four ponies, all in various states of unconsciousness. There were two unicorns, a pegasus, and an earth pony. The pegasus (a mare) and one of the unicorns (both of whom were stallions) shared yellow coats and brown manes, giving Nyx the distinct impression that the two were related. Even their cutie marks were similar; each had one half of a firey blue wheel. The earth pony, the other mare of the group, was a dark brown, with a similar-colored mane. Her cutie mark was a wrench, similar to Applebloom's. Nyx doubted, however, that this was a cousin of the Apple family.

         But it was the remaining unicorn that drew most of Nyx's attention. His coat was ash-grey, while his mane and tail were a mix of red and orange. The spikey style gave the impression that the unicorn had flames instead of a mane. His horn, Nyx noted, was sharper than the norm, looking like it could easily pierce flesh were the unicorn so inclined. The last odd detail about the unicorn was his cutie mark. It looked like a capital letter 'B', mirrored and placed edgewise on the left side of a capital letter 'M'. Nyx couldn't begin to guess what such a cutie mark meant.

         Seeing that they were starting to come around, Nyx doused her horn, and hid in the shadows of the room. She would judge whether or not they were threats before revealing herself.

*****


         "Ugh..." Ashen Blaze moaned as he rubbed his head with a hoof. "Gale, why didn't you tell me that that machine could explode if I channeled magic through it?"

         There was an indignant snort. "I wasn't counting on you testing it so soon. It was still experimental. And thanks to you, it will probably remain experimental for a while longer!"

         Were Ash's eyes open, he would have rolled them at the mechanic's annoyed tone. As it was, he huffed. "Well, if you'd just have the courtesy to label the things that aren't ready for testing yet..."

         "Knock it off, you two," Gold Heart said. "Gale, since Soul and I arrived late, mind telling us what the machine was supposed to do?"

         "It was meant to work in tandem with Ash's artificial Element of Magic," Gale explained. "The two working together would have amplified the effects of Ash's spells. At least, in theory."

         "Considering how big that explosion was, I'd say it worked a little too well," Ash muttered, as he finally opened his eyes. Then he blinked. "Come to think of it, just how big was that explosion? Because I don't recognize this place."

         The other three opened their eyes, too. "Oh, great. If we were blown so far away there's no identifiable landmarks, I shudder to think what my apartment looks like," moaned Gale, the earth pony covering her eyes with a hoof.

         "Not to mention Canterlot," Soul Mage added. "Of course, this could probably work as a side-show to one of Trixie's performances, assuming you can tone down the explosion enough..."

         Heart cuffed her brother with a wing. "Be serious! We don't have any clue where we are!"

         "Or how we got here," Ash added, frowning. "I can't see any holes in this room that would mark entry from four impromptu missiles."

         "You know, that's one of the nicer things we've been called over the years..." mused Soul. As Heart raised a wing to cuff him again, he backed away from her. "Easy, sis! I'm just kidding!"

         "Let him be, Heart," Ash said, and the pegasus stood down. "First thing's first, let's get some light in here," he continued, lighting up his horn with an orange glow. Looking around, he sighed. "Still don't see any - "

         "Ash! Behind you!" Gale exclaimed, falling into a basic fighting stance. Soul reached out with a tendril of blue energy, and connected with his sister, wreathing the two in ethereal blue flames.

         Ash, knowing his allies weren't prone to over-reacting, whirled around to confront what had spooked them. What he saw caused his eyes to widen. "Ah, skvetch."

*****


         Nyx knew her cover had been blown. Mentally, she berated herself for forgetting that a simple light spell was something any unicorn worth their horn knew. She was more interested in what she'd learned from overhearing them speak, as well as the blue flames surrounding the brother and sister pair. Still, she knew she had to defuse the situation. "Whoa, there, calm down!" she pleaded, holding her hooves out to the side to show she was unarmed. "I'm not going to hurt you."

Ash narrowed his eyes at the Alicorn, eyeing her critically, before waving at his teammates to stand down. "Yes, if you were going to attack, you would have done so while we were unconscious, or at least hidden yourself better."

Nyx blushed and pawed at the ground. "Yeah, probably. It's not every day you find a group of ponies suddenly appearing, especially not a place like this." Nyx sized the other ponies again, biting her lip lightly. "I'd almost say you weren't from Equestria, because if you were, then you'd know about Castle Nightmare here."

Gale looked up at that. "Castle Nightmare? No, never heard of it." She frowned in annoyance. "Great, that machine threw us into a completely different universe. Oh, I hope it didn't do anything bad to ours..."

"I don't think it did," Ash said as he activated PC. "Every other time we've flown through the temporal fields between worlds it creates a sonic boom. Since that obviously did not happen this time, we can safely hazard the guess that our world is perfectly fine, we'll just need to get back to it..." Ash trailed off as PC's screen filled with text. "Well, I'm getting an energy reading that matches one of the Gems, but... Why are they here..?"

"Energy reading? Gems? Do you mind cluing me in, please?" Ash looked at Nyx, smiling thinly before offering a small, lazy salute.

"Ashen Blaze, de facto of the Order-Naries,at your service, Ma'am. My friends here are Gold Heart, Soul Mage, and Gale."

"It is a pleasure to meet you, Ashen Blaze and company. My name is Nyx. And," Nyx cocked an eyebrow inquisitively. "The Ordinaries? Why would you name a team about being ordinary?"

Ash sighed as Soul chuckled. "No, we're mercenaries, who work to keep balance and order. We defend against anything that would cause chaos, like Tau'rin."

Nyx blinked, not really understanding but willing to go with it. "That seems very interesting. Also, what is that thing on your head?"

"This? It's PC, a Portable Computer. It's basically a super-enhanced energy detection spell, attached to a locator matrix, equipped with a sarcastic and sometimes quite annoying persona." Ash seemed to glare at Nyx, before she realized he was looking at the device. "Yes, you were supposed to hear that. Well, I can't help it if it's true." Ash shook his head. "Whatever. Look, Nyx, it has been good meeting you, but if you can point us in the direction of your version of Ponyville, I would be much obliged."

"Sure, it's right over that way," Nyx said as she pointed through the window. PC beeped, Ash turning around until he was facing the opposite direction.

"Hmm, there is a Gem here... I can't tell where, though, and I don't know why there would be one without Tau' here as well. It just wouldn't make sense."

Gale started towards the door. "Well, fearless leader, do you want to go after the Supposed Gem, or the Actual Town?"

15533222222221.content:
"Oooohhh," a familiar voice moaned as the light spell faded. "Jeez, Twi, you weren't kidding when you said Gate Jumping without a Gate Key would be rough. Ugh..."

"R-Rainbow Dash? Pinkie Pie? Mom?!" Dash looked up to find a pony looming over Twilight, a glint in her eyes. No, that's no pony, that's an Alicorn! "Nightmare Moon! Step away from my friend before I have to get physical!"

Nyx's eye twitched. "Seriously, Rainbow Dash? did you hit your head or something? I'm just checking to see if my mother is okay." Nyx looked back at her mother, barely sparing Rainbow Dash a glance, though she seemed somewhat... different. Did she style her mane?

Rainbow gasped, backpedaling as she stared at Nyx and Twilight with growing horror. "N-no... No! That's- that's not true! Twilight can't be your m-mother! She's my best friend, a-and you... you're... you're-"

"Well, hello, stranger! Woooowwww, I wonder where in Sugardia we are this time- oh, better yet, when we are! I wonder where Fluttershy went, she always knows what time it is! Hey, Twilight, wake up! We're down a teammate! We need your sciencey smartiness, Twilight!" Nyx was soon completely ignored as Pinkie started shaking Twilight, who whimpered in response.

"H-hey now, you can't just go shaking ponies awake like that, she might have a concussion, Pinkie!"

Pinkie looked up at Nyx, whose eyes were quavering with worry, and she smiled bashfully. "Oh, sorry. I get a little carried away sometimes." Pinkie stepped back as Nyx leaned over Twilight, horn aglow with a healing spell.

Twilight started stirring, and Nyx's horn stopped glowing as she sighed with relief. "Mmm..."

"Mom, wake up. You've been injured, it looks like you're close to magical burnout."

Twilight squeezed her eyes shut, squirming a bit on the hard ground before curling up. "Juss fiev mur menuss," she mumbled.

Nyx giggled. "Oh, mom, you're still you... I guess I'll have to eat all these chocolate chip pancakes on my own..."

Twilight's eyes snap open, and her stomach gives off a particularly loud grumble. The room is silent for a moment before Pinkie and Rainbow started giggling. "Shut up, I used up too much energy..."

Twilight looked around at her surroundings, not noticing the other pony present until she looked up into her teal, draconic eyes. "Hi, mom!"

-----


Spike was busy cooking up some grub for dinner that night, sucking on a small emerald as he worked. "... KYYYYAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAHHHHHHHHHHH!!!!!!!!!!" Pots and pans clattered and fell from their hooks as a yell- a very familiar yell- cut through the peaceful quietude of that simple afternoon.

"Twilight! Twilight, are you alright?!" Food abandoned on the stove (after turning flicking the stove top down to 'simmer', of course), Spike ran out into the library's main room, and then up the stairs, where he found Twilight sitting on her rump before her desk, face splattered with ink. "Twilight, did you get ink in your eyes? Oh my goodness, that was scary! Why'd you scream so loudly?"

"That..." Twilight cleared her throat, a magically procured towel wiping ink off her face. "Th-that wasn't me."

-----


"Mom," Nyx cried out as she ducked beneath a gout of flame. "Mom, it's me! Nyx! Your daughter!"

"I-I-I'm not gonna fall for th-that! I know w-who you are, N-Nightmare Moon, and we shall defeat you, and stop Lavos from ever destroying the world!"

"Woah, woah, woah, destroy the world?! Why would I want to do that?! I live here! My friends live here!"

Twilight, still in hysterics, cackles. "Friends?! What friends?!"

Nyx stands up proudly, a smile spreading wide across her face. "Why, the rest of the Cutie Mark Crusaders, of course! Me, Apple Bloom, Sweetie Belle, and Scootaloo have been friends for years now!" Her smile faltered when she saw the crazed look in her mother's eyes go from 'Freaking out!' to 'What's sanity? I got fire!'

"Buuuuurrrrn the witch!" Twilight shrieked as she let loose a terrifyingly large fire spell. Nyx brought up her Shield spell just barely before the fire spell's impact, sending her careening towards the wall, before bouncing off of it, her spell dropping with a pop! as she charged up a stun spell.

"Mom, stop this!" Nyx released her spell, hitting Twilight square in the chest and staggering her, but the armor she wore seemed to diminish the spell's effect. "I- I don't want to hurt you!" Nyx was getting scared, and Rainbow Dash and Pinkie Pie were not being very helpful, to her or her mother, as they sat huddled against the wall, staring wide-eyed at the two combatants.

Nyx gasped for breath, tears of confusion blurring her vision. "M-mom," she said, her voice straining with emotion. "I... I just..."

-----


"I just don't know what's going on!" Twilight ran through Ponyville's streets, Spike bouncing along on her back as Pinkie and Rainbow Dash bounced and flew along beside her, respectively. "That scream sounded like me, but I know it wasn't me! The only other pony I can think of whose vocals might sound similar would be Nyx! I'm glad you two could drop everything and help, I don't know what I'd do if I had to fight something that made Nyx cry out in fear!"

"Don't worry, Twilight! We're your friends!" Dash gave Twilight a smirk as she started pulling ahead. "We're always here to help!"

-----


"Then why aren't you helping me kill her?!" Twilight roared in anger and pain as she sent yet another Firewall at Nyx, the young Alicorn teleporting closer to her so the spell harmlessly sailed past.

"Because, I don't kill ponies! I could've killed Nightmare Moon's general when we had her and her two friends, but I didn't because that would be wrong!" Dash flew up to Twilight's side and wrapped her forelegs around the purple unicorn. "You don't have to do this, Twi. I freaked out a bit when I first saw her, but she hasn't done anything to hurt us since we woke up. Fuck, she even healed you, and unless she's the stupidest villain in the universe, she's not the Nightmare Moon we need to defeat."

Twilight sagged into her friend's reassuring grip, tears welling in her eyes. "I'm sorry," she whispered. "I'm sorry... I'm sorry..." Nyx folds her wings and slowly trots forward, giving her- no, this wasn't her mom, it seemed- a reassuring nuzzle.

"It's okay. I'm sorry for startling you. I guess-" Pinkie let out a gasp,and promptly fell on her face.

"Pinkie Pie, are you okay?" Twilight slowed to a stop and looked at her pink-coated friend. They were in the castle's courtyard, and Pinkie had tripped right as she entered through the gate.

"Y-yeah, I'm fine," Pinkie said, her voice wavering as her teeth chattered. "T-teeth chatter... eye twitch... Hoof flutter... nose itch, I-I'm getting a doozy!"

"A what?"

"A d-doozy," Pinkie repeated as she began to vibrate, slowly advancing across the floor. "I guess I never told you about my Pinkie Sense, huh?"

"No, I guess not." Twilight's tears were forgotten as she saw her friend's body twist and convulse into patterns not even she could perform when drunk.

"W-well, it's a little bit of an e-e-early warning system, like wh-wh-when my tail twitches, it means something's g-g-gonna fall!"

"Oh, like when we fell from the Gate while trying to get the Moonstone?"

"Exactly!" Pinkie's body was now vibrating so quickly, it was like there was a large earthquake happening, and only affecting her. Suddenly, she shot straight at the door, stopping just short of it, and landing on her hooves. "Huh, that was new. What? Hello? Weeeeiiiirrrrd. Eeeechoooo!"

"Pinkie, what are you doing?" Pinkie turned to look at her friends running down the corridor towards her.

"This door is saying the same things that I am, exactly as I say them! Isn't that neat, Twilight?"

"So... is this the doozy you were talking about?"

"Hmm, nope! the doozy's on the other side of that door, though!"

"Well, then let me pull it open."

Thumf, thumf, thumf.

"It's stuck."

"That's because you gotta push it, not pull it!"
"That's because you gotta pull it, not push it!"

Pinkie blinked and looked at the door, before grasping the handle with her hooves. "And... no-woah-oof!"

Pinkie lay sprawled in front of the open door. "Oww..."

Pinkie rubbed her head, hissing in pain at the bump. "You said it. Can you get offa me, please?"

Pinkie grunted, a hoof to her head. "Yeah, hold on..."

The two Pinkies suddenly stopped moving, before turning their heads towards each other, their noses barely a centimeter apart. "Hi, I'm Pinkie Pie! It's good to meetcha!"

Twilight groaned. "There's two of them..."

Twilight whimpered. "I'd just gotten my sanity back..."

What will happen next?

2: Curiosity wins out over suspicion as Nyx moderates between the two groups.

1553322222222222121.content:
[[Note: I plan for this thread to be an AU of Crisis on Two Equestrias, found here: http://www.fimfiction.net/story/92300/cr...]]

         Nyx gasped as she recognized the form lying on the ground. "Mom!" she cried out, rushing to the lavender unicorn's side. Her mind raced, trying to figure out what was wrong, when a logic circuit tripped. Wait, she thought. I left Mom at home. She said she was going to be there all day, reading some of the new stock that came in. How did she get here ahead of me, and... she leaned closer, taking a whiff before recoiling, and why does she smell like she's been on the road for a while?

         Looking the unicorn over, Nyx could tell there was something amiss. Twilight didn't keep herself up to the fastidious standards of Rarity, but Nyx knew her mom had gone through a shower that morning, and was generally clean more often than not. The mare on the ground, though, had not gone through a thorough cleaning in some time. This, combined with the fact that Twilight wasn't prone to changing plans on a whim, left Nyx confused.

         Only one way to find out what's going on, she thought. She carefully poked the unicorn with a hoof.

*****


         Twilight Sparkle groaned as she felt a hoof poke her. The spell she had used to escape from Shining Armor had taken a lot more out of her than she'd thought. Then again, she reasoned, he is the most powerful shield-caster alive, so breaking through his shields take proportionately more energy. She groaned again as she took stock of her magic reserves. I'm going to need an ether potion soon. I didn't quite overchannel, but close enough to be dangerous.

         A hoof prodded into her side again. Careful not to strain herself, Twilight opened her eyes. She promptly shut them when the sunlight set off an explosion in her brain. "Ow... is this what a hangover feels like? Because if so, I'm never going to drink anything alcoholic."

         "Probably for the best," a young female voice said. Twilight placed the age range somewhere in the teens.

         "Who are you?" she asked, carefully cracking an eye open. There was no explosion this time, so she opened it wider. She was in a dark room, made of stone. Glancing around, she couldn't see the speaker, at least not from her position.

         There was a slight pause. "My name isn't important. What's yours?"

         Twilight carefully started twitching various limbs, testing which ones were in working order. "Twilight Sparkle, daughter of Viceroy Night Light of the Lunar Court."

         "I see..." There was another pause. "I don't mean to sound rude, but you sound like you may have overchanneled a bit."

         Twilight opened her other eye at that, just to roll it. "Not quite, but close enough for government work."

         "In that case, I'll ask a couple more questions, just to make sure your head is all right. If that's okay with you?"

         The unicorn was about to protest, but thought better of it. Better safe than sorry, as the saying goes, she thought. "Alright, shoot."

         "What's the currency in Equestria?"

         Twilight stretched a foreleg. "The bit, with ten jangles per bit."

         "Who's the current head of state?"

         The other foreleg stretched. "Princess Luna."

         A brief pause. "Right. Do you have any siblings or children?"

         Hind legs, both at the same time. "One sibling. He's Captain of the Royal Guard. As for children, no. I've never been interested in that."

         "One last question. Do you know of Celestia?"

         Twilight shuddered at that. "Yes, I know of her, though she's commonly called the Tyrant Sun, Corona. She went mad with power one thousand years ago, and Princess Luna was forced to seal her away into the sun, although she recently escaped. She's currently at large somewhere in the Everfree Forest, last I heard."

         "I see..." the voice said.

         Twilight, now feeling able to stand, did so, glancing around. However, she still couldn't make out who was speaking. Perhaps they were hiding in the shadows, though their coat had to be pretty dark for that to be true. "So, am I mentally sound?" she asked sardonically. She knew she was.

         "Well, a few things you said don't add up with things I know," came the response.

         Twilight blinked. "Such as?"

         "First of all, while there is a Night Light living in Canterlot, he is not a Viceroy, nor does he possess any noble title. He's just exceptionally well-off. Second, while Princess Luna is Co-regent, she is not the head of state. Third, your description of Celestia is somewhat of a mirror of what is commonly known to have happened to Luna."

         "And finally," the speaker said, emerging from the shadows, "the Twilight Sparkle I know calls me her daughter."

         Twilight took one look at the pitch-black alicorn, and screamed.

*****


         Nyx's ears folded back at the shrill shriek that came from the mare before her. At least it's not as bad as when Rainbow Dash snuck a joke snake into Mom's chem lab. I think more beakers popped from her scream than from her magic spazzing out.

         The unicorn's next words surprised her. "Please don't hurt me, Princess Luna! I swear I didn't mean to run, I just didn't want my dad to be disappointed in me, and - "

         A swift application of a hoof later, the stream of words had been silenced. "I believe we have a communication problem here," Nyx said, rubbing her head with her other forehoof. "I never claimed to be Princess Luna. My name is Nyx."

         'Twilight' blinked, and pulled away from the hoof. "Nyx? Never heard of you, but you look like Princess Luna in a bad mood."

         The alicorn coughed. "Yes, well, there's a reason for that, but it's not important. What's important is determining who you really are."

         Her mother's doppelganger glared. "I told you, my name is Twilight Sparkle!"

         Nyx arched an eyebrow. "Well, let's just head back to the library in Ponyville, and we'll - "

         "PONYVILLE?!" yelped the lavender mare. "I teleported all the way back to Ponyville?! Omigosh, Trixie's gonna kill me, or turn me over to the Guard, or - "

         The hoof was applied again. "Calm down," said Nyx firmly. "Now, what kind of problem do you have with Ponyville?"

Nyx eyed the creature before her warily. She was familiar with changelings (as familiar as she could be, given that the changeling invasion of Canterlot had occured prior to her creation). There were a few things she knew about them. One, they were pony-sized and proportioned, for the most part. Two, they had black chitin and dark blue shells around their barrels. Three, their eyes were typically a featureless blue. Four, they had teal-ish short manes and tails, if they had any at all. It was theorized that changelings who deviated from this design were royal changelings, and therefore greater threats.

         Nyx's concern was understandable, given that the creature before her, while sized like a typical changeling, had several key differences in appearance. The first was that its shell was a deep orange, as were its mane and tail. The second was that said mane and tail were much longer than the norm, and styled in ponytails. The third was the presence of a crown, studded with topazes, atop the changeling's head. If that wasn't a clue that this changeling was royal in nature, nothing was.

         "Okay, get a grip, Nyx," the alicorn told herself. "You've just found a royal changeling in the castle, so there's plenty of time to deal with it before it becomes a problem."

         Still, something seemed amiss. Why would a royal changeling be here, in the middle of Castle Nightstone, in its true form? Nyx frowned. It seemed like the only pony who could answer the question was the changeling itself. Nyx walked towards it, charging a spell, ready to let fly at the moment of treachery. She then prodded the changeling with a hoof.

*****


         She groaned. What did ah drink last night? she wondered to herself. Oh, right. Last night was Pinkie's 'Welcome to Ponyville Again' party. Ah think ah got a little wasted. She smacked her lips a couple of times, then grunted as she felt her fangs. "Consarnit, must've changed back sometime while ah was drunk," she mumbled. Oddly, though, she didn't feel the trademark headache that came with having a hangover. "Mebbe ah didn't drink as much as ah thought?"

         "Good, that'll keep your head clear while you answer some questions," came a cold, yet youngish voice from above.

         The unfamiliarity with the voice caused her to snap her eyes open, and look up. Whatever retort she had on her mind was instantly swapped for yelping in mortal terror. "Nightmare Moon?!" She scrabbled away from the midnight alicorn, but didn't get too far before she slammed headfirst into a wall. Rubbing her head with a hoof, she spun around to face the menace. "T'day just keeps gettin' better 'n better."

         Nightmare Moon's horn was glowing, though her eyebrows had arched. "Been a while since I've heard somepony call me that name. I go by Nyx, these days. Or does information not get to the hive like it used to?"

         She felt her temper flare. "Ah dunno what yer talkin' about," she said shortly. Gotta get to Twi somehow, she'll know what ta do about Nightmare Moon, she thought to herself. Out loud, she said, "So, why kidnap only me? What makes me special, aside from the obvious?"

         Nightmare Moon blinked repeatedly. "Kidnap? I'm afraid you're mistaken. I found you here in Castle Nightstone, unconscious. I was wondering if you could tell me how you got here."

         She narrowed her eyes. The midnight alicorn didn't seem to be lying. Then again, she's probably had centuries of experience, she reasoned to herself. She decided to ask about something else. "Castle Nightstone? Never heard of it. Where's that?"

         The eyebrows came up again. "You must be really behind the times in the hive. Castle Nightstone is where I ruled Equestria for two weeks before giving up my authority to the Princesses again."

         She stared, then uttered a single word. "Horseapples. Ah was there, ya got beat by me, Twilight, and the others usin' the Elements of Harmony. Yer reign didn't last a day, much less two weeks!"

         The alicorn's nostrils flared. "I find it hard to believe that a changeling could claim to bear one of the Elements of Harmony. Who do you think you are, you bug?"

         That got her dander up. "Who do ah think ah am?" She willed herself to change, emerald fire changing her into her familiar earth pony guise. "Ah'm Applejack, Bearer of the Element of Honesty."

Nyx saw a pony laying in the middle of the floor, but couldn't make out many details, not even their tribe, because they were covered by a black, hooded coat.

This made the alicorn's blood run cold at first glance, because in her experience, that sort of clothing was the style of dark cultists and other nefarious conspirators, so she stayed on edge as she made her way toward the pony, wary that it could be some sort of trap. The gold leaf around the sleeves and neck, while undeniably stylish, did little to change Nyx's first impression. For all she knew, this pony could be a leader of such a cult.

She made it to the prone pony without incident, however, her senses detecting no threat, and the mysterious pony showed no sign of consciousness. Paranoia and past traumas giving way to concern, Nyx pulled the hood away from their face and gasped in surprise.

Laying there, dead to the world, the pony appeared to be a stallion, albeit a rather slim, almost androgynous one. A stallion with a black coat to make the coat he wore, much like Nyx's own, but also a bright pink mane. What had startled Nyx, however, was none of these factors, but rather that he possessed the tufted ears and fanged mouth of a thestral. A brief lift of his coat's tail confirmed it as Nyx saw the large bat-like wings tucked against his sides.

Thestrals (or "bat ponies" as they were more informally known) were a rare sight, as most of them kept to themselves in their colonies in mountain caves. Most of the exceptions that other ponies saw were either merchants trading for the fruits they ate, or those who left their colony to join the Night Guard, which had understandably grown in the years since Princess Luna's return. To see one in the light of day was still extremely uncommon.

Another thing that Nyx found curious was that the mysterious thestral was clutching several books between his forelegs, but was wearing no saddlebags with which to carry them. Nyx carefully cracked one open with her magic, but found it written entirely in a foreign language that she couldn't even recognize.

There were many questions surrounding this stranger, but Nyx decided that she should try to wake him. If she couldn't, then she would have to take him to the hospital. And let her mother know about him and his books, in case she could figure anything out.

1553322222222222222222212.content:
(Note: Once again, MASSIVE spoilers for the ending of Fire Emblem: Awakening. If that's an issue, then proceed no further.)











































... WHAT... WHAT ARE YOU DOING?

"For once, I'm glad you and I are the same. Now I can give my life to protect those I care for..."

Robin raised his hand, gathering his magic into it as he stood over his mirror image. For all of the fell dragon Grima's claims of godhood, he had been laid low by mere mortals. Even as they stood upon the mountainous dragon's back, the true monster knelt before Robin in the form of the man who had allowed himself to become corrupted by the fell dragon's power. The man who had embraced the power to destroy the future of all who lived upon their world.

Robin looked upon a face identical to his own, and smiled as dark lightning crackled around his hand.

... YOU WOULD... NOT DARE!

"I would and I will. The evils you would visit on this world are unthinkable..."

Even now, he knew that he could stop. Chrom was racing across the battlefield to reach them, Falchion in hand. All Robin would have to do would be to wait long enough for the young Exalt to land the finishing blow and Robin's counterpart from another world would fall, but the power of Chrom's strike would only send Grima into a state of hibernation.

It could be centuries, or even millennia before the fell dragon rose again, but it would still rise to threaten the world once more. Only Grima's own power could truly kill him, but there was a price to be paid.

It was a price that Robin was willing to pay, as one who had been bred to be Grima's host. Throughout the wars which he had taken part in as Chrom's tactician, he had always strived to protect everyone he could. This was no different. His essence was identical to the version of himself who had become Grima, and by extinguishing the fell dragon's existence, it was virtually certain that he would be destroyed, himself. Yet even if he ceased to exist, and could never again be with those he loved, he knew that this sacrifice would secure the future of countless generations to come.

"In some ways, I--we share the blame. It's only right we meet our end together!"

...NOOOOOOO!

Grima howled in fear and despair as Robin gathered the dark magic into a ball and cast it at his dark doppelganger. The dragon's body on which they stood let out an ear-splitting roar as the sorcery ate away at its human body until nothing was left.

Silence reigned over the battlefield as the undead Risen Grima had summoned to protect itself began to fall and crumble into dust. Chrom and his army lowered their weapons and looked toward Robin, unable to celebrate their victory just yet as they all knew what this meant. Sure enough, a black mist began to emanate from Robin's body as the very same sorcery he had used against his double now began to claim him as well.

"Robin! No!" Chrom finally reached his friend, clenching his teeth in grief as he knew that it was too late.

As the dark magic slowly began to eat away at Robin, the pink-haired tactician turned and gave his lord and good friend a peaceful smile. As much as it pained him to leave his friends and family behind, there was no turning back now, so Robin thought back to the times that they had all shared, all the way back to that field in which Chrom and his sister had found him and taken him in like a stray pet.

Even as his body began to dissolve away, Robin's memories of his time as Chrom's tactician shone in his mind like precious gems. The conversations they had shared, the odd assortment of characters that had joined them... his rather unorthodox marriage proposal to the dark mage Tharja... meeting Noire and Morgan, their children from an alternate future that Grima had destroyed...

As sad as he knew that he should be to think that he would never be with them again, Robin couldn't help but laugh happily as the memories filled him with such love and joy. Unlike Grima, he had lived a full life in the few years since he had woken up in that field, surrounded by the most wonderful people he could imagine.

"Thank you, Chrom. For... everything... Tell the others... my last thoughts were of them... May we meet again, in a better life..."

"Robin! No! Ah gods, NO!"

Robin's smile widened, and he waved one last goodbye to his friend before his vision faded away entirely.

"--ever seen this language before. This one looks like a spellbook, but these diagrams... if they're spell matrices, it's unlike anything I ever learned."

"You think we should tell the Princesses about this, mom?"

"Definitely. Spike..."

"Already on it, Twilight."

"Oh my... Twilight, I think he's waking up!"

Robin fidgeted slightly as consciousness slowly returned to him. He made out voices, though his sluggish mind took a while longer to process what they were saying. The fact that he was hearing anything at all was something of a surprise, but his body felt too weak and tired to respond in any way.

Slowly, he cracked one eye open and immediately winced as the bright light stabbed into his brain like a hot knife.

"Oh dear, he's in pain," one of the voices exclaimed, followed by a stern male voice demanding to know, "Hey! Who opened the blinds!?"

"Oh, that was me, doctor. It was far too dim and gloomy in here," a posh woman's voice replied.

"Because thestrals are nocturnal! They're sensitive to bright light," the doctor snapped.

"I-I-I'll get it," stammered one of the other voices... the soft, gentle one who had noticed him waking up. In moments, the intense brightness faded to a more tolerable level, and Robin slowly tried to open his eyes again. They still needed time to adjust, but as he peered through a fog of blurriness, he made out a faint shape hovering over him... one with pink hair like his own. "I drew the blinds. Is that better?"

Slowly, Robin's mind put together the soft voice and pink hair, creating an image in his mind of his elder daughter. "... Noire...?"

Another voice asked, "Noire? Isn't that Prench for 'black?'"

Robin ignored it, though, instead summoning all of the strength he could gather into his tired body. He suddenly pushed himself up, wrapping his arms around the shape in front of him. "Noire...! I'm... I'm so glad to see you again... Your mother... and Morgan... are they here too...?"

Instead of answering, 'Noire' simply let out a startled squeak as Robin embraced her, his arms wrapped around her to the wings sprouting from her back.

... Wings...?

"Let go of Fluttershy, buster, or I'll buck you in the head!" This was a new voice, sounding raspy and gruff, but feminine like most of the others. He suddenly felt his embrace getting broken as he was shoved roughly down.

"Rainbow Dash, stop! He's obviously disoriented!"

"But Twi, he attacked Fluttershy!"

"Eep..."

"It seemed more like he mistook her for someone else."

"It doesn't matter if he did or not, this is a hospital, for Celestia's sake, and only I get to assault my patients! So move it on out of here so I can do my sun-blasted job!"

In the confusion and shouting, Robin rubbed his head and tried to clear it as he felt himself waking up more completely. In doing so, he felt his hoof touch one of his ears, which was long and tufted. Then, he started to realize that he had a hoof instead of hands. Then his vision cleared, and while the sunlight still seemed quite harsh despite being filtered through the thin blinds, he was still able to get a clearer view of the beings that were surrounding him, including the one he had mistaken for his future daughter.

With one word, the tactician once again drew everypony's attention back to himself.

"... What...?"

15533222222222222222222121.content:
As Robin's eyes gradually adjusted to the unusually harsh light (though never to the point of being comfortable, he noted) he carefully looked over each of the equines that were in the room with him. He had seen many horses, pegasi, and even the occasional unicorn in the Ylissean army, of course, though never ones so... colorful, let alone capable of speech.

Seven females, one male, and a small purple reptile, he thought quickly as his mind quickly analyzed the ponies. The stallion is the only one clothed, aside from the orange mare's hat. He referred to me as his patient, so he is the physician. The reptile is holding a quill and parchment in his claws. A scribe or servant, perhaps. One of the mares is unusually large and possesses both wings and a unicorn's horn. Unique eyes as well. She and the others are glancing toward the purple unicorn, however, including the doctor. SHE is the leader, here.

It was an unique ability of his, to size up the capabilities of others at a glance, especially while in a combat situation. His uncanny abilities in this regard were somewhat less honed outside of war and battle, but he could still be a decent judge of character, most of the time.

"My apologies," he said, addressing the pink-maned pegasus in particular, whom he had mistaken for his daughter. "I'm... rather disoriented. My name is Robin. Did you all bring me here?" Most likely I've somehow ended up in an Outworld. One in which equines are intelligent, rather than mere steeds. Given that I have hooves, I would seem to have been transformed into one of their sub-species. The Outworld gate never caused physical transformations before, but I have never visited one like this, either.

The unique black-coated mare raised one of her wings. "I did. I found you unconscious in Nightstone Castle."

A castle, this time? A step up from a field, I suppose, Robin sardonically thought to himself as he recalled his first clear memory. At least he still had those, this time, from being found by Chrom to saying goodbye after striking the final blow against Grima.

He found his mind drifting through his memories, grateful that the names and faces of his companions still came to him so readily. He was alive... and so were all of them. That meant that there was still a chance to see them again, if he could find this world's Outworld gate.

He didn't realize that his eyes were tearing up until the completely pink one offered him a handkerchief. "Awww, it's okay! I mean, sure it's not a great place to fall asleep in, but you're okay!"

Robin shook his head and chuckled as he took the handkerchief to wipe his eyes. "No, no, it's alright. I'm just happy to be alive. My friends and family are going to be waiting for me to get back to them. How long do you expect I will have to stay here?"

This question was directed toward the doctor, who grumpily replied, "Well, we didn't find any obvious signs of trauma while you were out, but we'll need to give you a check-up just to be on the safe side. After that, we should be able to sign you out, and then you aren't my problem anymore."

Robin nodded, only to be startled by the sight of the purple unicorn's horn began to glow with a violet aura. In a similar-colored field of magic, a book which he quickly recognized as his Nosferatu tome levitated in the air.

"We'll get out of your way then, doctor. It's nice meeting you, Robin, and we'll talk after you've gotten your check-..."

"Put that down!" Robin's voice snapped through the room as he practically lunged out of his bed, only to stumble as he was unfamiliar with his body's new center of gravity. Bat-like wings flapped and flailed with the rest of his limbs as he struggled to reach the book, only to get blocked by the orange mare and an incredibly multi-colored pegasus. The tall black mare also stepped in front of the started unicorn protectively.

Under other circumstances, Robin would not have reacted so violently. The Nosferatu spell was dark magic, designed to draw the life force from a foe into the caster, healing their own injuries while harming their enemy.

As dangerous as it could be in the hands of a skilled practitioner, the book itself was merely an ornate paperweight to anyone untrained in the dark arts. Robin had never seen someone use magic itself to carry magical tomes before, though, and the potential dangers of the interaction between such magic and the spells within the tome were what drove the tactician into such a blind panic.
