         Calliope nodded. "Yeah, I'm from one of the dimensions where Aunt Luna went nuts 1000 some-odd years ago, and tried to blanket the world in eternal night, yadda yadda." She glanced at Nyx. "Y'know, come to think of it, you kinda look like her when she went Nightmare on us."

         Nyx sighed. "Okay, so I don't have to give you Nightmare Moon's history... good. Well, about two years after Luna's return and purification by the Elements of Harmony, a cult dedicated to Nightmare Moon foalnapped Twilight Sparkle. Do you know her?"

         Calliope nodded again. "Yeah, she's Mom's apprentice." She looked left, then right, then leaned across the table. In a conspiratorial whisper, she added, "I think Mom's secretly grooming her to be a Princess herself someday, but you didn't hear that from me."

         The black alicorn arched an eyebrow. "Right... Well, anyway, this cult foalnapped Twilight, and used her blood in a ritual designed to resurrect Nightmare Moon seperate from Princess Luna. But, the spell got interrupted mid-cast by Princess Celestia."

         "Yeah, I think Mom wouldn't have taken kindly to her apprentice getting foalnapped," Calliope remarked.

         Nyx nodded. "But, since the spell was interrupted mid-cast, it managed to form something. A small blank-flank alicorn filly, caught in a thorn bush in the middle of the Everfree Forest." She shivered. "That used to be one of the worst experiences of my life."

         "Whoa, stop the music!" Calliope was slightly wide-eyed. "You mean you're the product of an interrupted spell designed to bring back one of the worst evils to walk Equestria?" She whistled. "Heavy stuff."

         "You're telling me," muttered the black alicorn. "I didn't have any of Nightmare Moon's memories, and I was just a filly, in the middle of nowhere, for a whole night and day. I was scared to death. Luckily, Twilight came back to the clearing to get the saddlebags she'd had when she was foalnapped, and found me. She brought me back to the library and cared for me. She knew what I likely was, but she decided not to tell the princesses about me, simply because I didn't act like Nightmare Moon."

         "Heh. Bet Mom was really understanding when she finally found out," the white alicorn said with a smirk.

         Nyx grimaced. "I wish. After I'd been living with Twilight for a while, I started calling her 'Mom', simply because that was how I saw her. A few days later, Princess Celestia showed up at the library, and took me away. Turns out she was scared of what I could be, and she didn't want to wait and see what would happen."

         Calliope blinked. "Huh. That doesn't sound like Mom at all. She usually has a lot more patience and understanding."

         Nyx winced. "Well... I asked Princess Luna about it once. She said she asked Celestia about that at one point. Celestia's response to Luna was, and I quote, 'The last time I waited to do something, I lost you for a thousand years.' So, yeah, she was not willing to wait and see what happened to me."

         "So... she tried to kill you? A filly?" Calliope looked aghast at the thought.

         "No, she took me to a unicorn who had a scanning ritual ready to determine whether or not I was actually Nightmare Moon," Nyx replied. "At least, that's what Celestia thought. As it turns out, he was the leader of the cult that had foalnapped Twilight."

         Calliope winced. "Ouch. So... lemme guess. The 'scanning ritual' actually gave Nightmare Moon's powers to you?"

         "More than that, I received her memories as well. And, less than a week later, I subdued and sealed both Celestia and Luna into the sun and moon, respectively. I took over Equestria without a single drop of blood being spilled." Nyx sounded anything but proud at the 'accomplishment'.

         Calliope, on the other hoof, was stunned. "You took out both Mom and Aunt Luna? Wow. Remind me not to tick you off."

         Nyx sighed. "Yeah, well... As it turned out, I was anything but happy at what I'd done. I eventually abdicated my status as ruler, and cut the cultists loose. A few days later, I ended up saving Ponyville from a bunch of monsters that had come out of Everfree, but I was heavily injured in the process. At Twilight's urging, I freed Celestia and Luna from the sun and moon, and I let Luna pass judgement on me." She smiled for the first time during the story. "Luna took most of the power I had as Nightmare Moon, and sentenced me to be the ward of Twilight Sparkle."

         Calliope burst out laughing at that. "That's Aunt Luna for you! Some 'punishment', huh?"

         Nyx nodded, then inclined her head at the white alicorn. "So, how about you? Judging from what you've been saying, you're the daughter of your version of Celestia, right?"
15533222222222222222222222111.title: Stories of Past Sins

choices: The Mane 6 suddenly arrive.
Food's here, and Calliope is very hungry.
155332222222222222222222221111.content:
"Yeah...it's not easy being the daughter of Princess Celestia. I always was a bit more of a Daddy's girl, but unfortunately my mortal father was captured and killed by unknown hostile forces when I was young." Calliope said. "Things got rough after that."

"I can Imagine they would. It's a horrible thing, losing a member of your family." Nyx replied.

"Yeah, well, it was only made worse by the muttering nobility always pretending like they cared so darn much about a no name soldier they'd never heard of before. He wasn't a war hero or an outstanding captain. He was just a normal guard and a commoner...and I could hear every awful thing they said about him behind our backs. Mom tried to handle the pain by throwing herself into Twilight's training, upping the difficulty of their lessons dramatically, while I tried to focus on learning to fly. They'd hired the wonderbolts to teach me, myself being disguised as a pegasus named Morning Song."

"Wait, disguised? Why were you disguised?" Nyx asked, curiously.

"Because nopony outside the palace was supposed to know I existed. My mother wanted to spare me from a life of politics for as long as possible, and once I realized the full implications of what me being royalty meant, I was grateful for it. I don't think I could have handled the loss of my father if I'd been having all those responsibilities forced on me at the same time." the Ivory alicorn let out a heavy sigh, and hung her head. "To be completely honest, I'm still looking for a way out. The thought of me being a Princess terrifies me to no end...I mean, technically I've already been one since the day I was born, but actually getting up their and leading the country, everyone in equestria watching me and judging my actions? Did you know I once almost accidentally killed Fancy Pants and Countess Chocolate because I couldn't make up my mind on which desert I wanted for my birthday? There's a lot of pressure in this being royalty thing."

"I can relate. Being the 'Queen of Equestria' was absolutely horrible."

"I can imagine. I have issues with just being a princess, I shudder to think what would happen if I had to run the country by myself. Anyways, after a while I got careless, and as a result 'Morning Song' had to turn up in the obituaries. A few years later, 'Vinyl Scratch' arrived out of nowhere and started DJ-ing around canterlot, and she kept to herself, interacting with the world at a bare minimum. And that was my life until slightly over a year ago, when I moved in with Twilight, learned to make true friends, and even managed to fall in love."

Nyx smiled. "Sounds like your life took a turn for the better."

Calliope didn't return the smile, instead scowling a bit at her own memories. "Yeah, well then i found out my boyfriend was actually a changeling queen who was tricking me into telling her everything she needed to know to impersonate me. She went on to replace me and begin her second hostile invasion of Equestria, during which I learned that she was the one who killed my father and that on some sick level of her mind she was actually attracted to me. As you can imagine, I didn't take that too well. the resulting battle showed me that there was a difference between being nigh immortal and actually being immortal. I spent several months in the hospital after that."

"Ouch."

"You think that was bad? You should have seen the bug by the end of out fight. She's probably still wearing bandages and casts after what I did to her."
155332222222222222222222221111.title: Story of the Sun's Daughter.

choices: Calliope makes it through every piece of food.
There's too much for even a princess to handle!
1553322222222222222222222211111.content:
"So, how did Ponyville take the revelation that 'Vinyl Scratch' was actually a princess?" asked Pinkie Pie, idly slurping on a milkshake.

         Calliope shrugged. "Eh, they were actually pretty cool, for the most part, Pinks. Once I told them I didn't want any special treatment, they calmed down... mostly. I still get ponies bowing to me here and there."

         Nyx arched an eyebrow. "You seem remarkably calm, considering she was nowhere in sight just a minute ago," she said, pointing at Pinkie.

         "It's Pinkie Pie, don't question it," deadpanned the white alicorn.

         "There's sage advice if I've ever heard it," commented Rarity, as she and the other Bearers of Harmony came up to the table. "A pleasure to make your acquaintance. I am - "

         "Rarity, owner of the Carousel Boutique, and bearer of the Element of Generosity," Calliope cut in. At the alabaster unicorn's blink, she sighed. "I know who you all are from my dimension, so let me just introduce myself. I'm Calliope, daughter of Celestia, princess of Equestria, et cetera, et cetera. I don't like formalities, so no bowing around me, okay?"

         "Works for me, Cally!" Rainbow Dash said, taking a seat next to the white princess. "Say, you look kinda familiar... You wouldn't happen to be a fan of DJ-P0N3, would you?"

         Calliope snorted. "Actually, in my dimension, I am DJ-P0N3. Lemme tell you, castle life? It royally sucks when you're not allowed to go anywhere in your natural form. So, I came up with the alias 'Vinyl Scratch' to get out of there, and enjoy myself once in a while." She frowned. "Still, royal politics have a way of following the family, even in disguise. That's actually why I'm here, to get away from politics."

         "And... you're not worried that your Celestia might be worried sick about you?" Twilight asked, concern lining her face.

         Calliope waved her hoof dismissively. "After I practically pulped Chrysalis, Mom's let me have a lot more leeway when it comes to doing my own thing. I think she's finally realized I'm not a filly to be sheltered anymore. I'm my own mare, and I deserve to spread my wings."

         Further conversation was interrupted by the waiter's return, bearing a huge tray on his back. On the tray was Calliope's meal: four Humongo veggie burgers, two with fries and two with onion rings, an order of hay bacon, mozzerella sticks, and a large orange soda. The waiter carefully slid the tray in front of Calliope, then deposited Nyx's salad in front of the midnight alicorn almost as an afterthought. "Your meals, madams," he said, before stepping away.

         Calliope licked her lips, before grabbing the first Humongo burger. To the surprise of everypony present, her first bite took nearly an eighth of the massive sandwich. She chewed, swallowed, then bit down again. Within two minutes, the first burger was gone, and Calliope was washing it down with a bit of orange soda.

         "WOW! Not even I've finished one of those things before!" Pinkie exclaimed. "You must've been hungry!"

         "Yeah, interdimensional travel can do that to ya, I guess," Calliope snickered, before letting out an almighty belch that shook the tables of the restaurant.

         "Good heavens, dear, must you be so uncouth?" Rarity asked, waving a hoof in front of her face. "I realize you dislike formalities, but even so, there is such a thing as proper behavior!"

         "I consider it to be a compliment to the chef," the wayward princess retorted, picking up the second burger. She paused when she realized there was a faint purplish glow around her. "Um, Twi, honey, what're you doing?"

         "Just a simple scan," the purple unicorn replied. "Looks like I was right. Your magic reserves have been drastically drained, probably from passing through the dimensional barriers. And your body is in such dire need of a refill, it's breaking down the burger the moment it hits your stomach, and converting it into raw magic."

         Calliope arched an eyebrow. "So... you're saying I can eat as much as I need, without worrying about calories or anything like that?"

         "In essence, yes."

         "Sweet!" With that, the second burger was devoured.
1553322222222222222222222211111.title: Conversations and Meals

choices: Wait for her to open up. You don't want to force a demi-god into anything...
Make her spill the beans! Whatever she's hiding could be dangerous!
15533222222222222222222222111111.content:
Everyone watched in a mixture of horror and fascination as Calliope wolfed down the food before her at an alarming rate, quickly finishing off the fries, mozzarella sticks, and burgers. Just as she was about to finish off the last onion ring on her plate, Rainbow decided to ask a question.

"So what's up with the scorch marks on your fur? You just get done fighting a dragon or something?"

Calliope's eyes went wide and she began hacking and coughing, trying to dislodge a rogue onion ring that had tried to make a mad dash down her windpipe. Applejack, slapped her on the back and the ring went flying out of her, mouth landing on Rarity's horn with such precision that it could have won her the international horseshoes championship game.

Rarity's eyes looked up and the saliva-covered half-chewed onion ring that was currently resting on her forehead. Her left eye started twitching in disgust as her mouth hanged open in silent horror.

"I'm fine!" Calliope announced, completely ignoring the incredibly disgusting yet spectacular feat she had just accomplished. "The scorch marks are from when I jumped the barrier! Like a bad teleport! I definitely didn't have these burns before I came here, no sir! Let's change the topic and talk about this again never. Hey, Applejack, that's a really nice hat. Where'd you get it?"

It was obvious to everyone (Except maybe Rarity, who was still focused on the whole Onion Ring thing) that the Ivory alicorn was lying. The question was, should they pressure their new acquaintance into telling them the truth about it, or wait for her to open up to them on her own?
15533222222222222222222222111111.title: She has an Apatite and a Secret.

choices: ... a huge grin. "So, wanna practice for that show?"
... a  look of terror. "Um... please don't hurt me, ma'am?"
155332222222222222222222221111111.content:
A silent consensus was reached among the Bearers and Nyx. It wouldn't be a good idea to try to force Calliope into revealing what had happened. She would tell them on her own time. Instead, Applejack decided to ask a question of her own. "If'n ya know me, don'tcha know how ah got my pappy's hat?"

         The white alicorn shrugged. "I know you guys mostly by reputation, not direct contact. The exceptions are Twilight, 'cause I lived with her for a while, and Pinks, who is hard not to know about."

         "Yup-yup!" Pinkie said, slurping up the last of her milkshake. "Not too much in my past that's not known to everypony!"

         Applejack nodded. "Alright, then... Anyway, ah inherited my pappy's hat when he and mah momma passed away. It's one o' the few things left in this world o' his. It marks me as the boss o' Sweet Apple Acres."

         Calliope arched an eyebrow. "Isn't Granny Smith technically the owner?"

         Applejack nodded. "Yeah, but she ain't got the strength ta do much in the way o' farmwork these days. Ah'm pretty much the boss o' the Acres in all but name." She looked down. "Though ah'll get the name, too, when Granny passes on..."

         The wayward princess had the decency to look contrite. "Hey, I'm sorry. Didn't mean to bring up an unpleasant subject."

         "S'okay, sugarcube," the farmer sighed. "Ah've long made peace with the fact that ah'll be the true boss o' the Acres some day."

         Nyx coughed. "So, if you're the DJ-P0N3 of your dimension, are you planning on doing a show while you're here?"

         Calliope had been taking a drink of her orange soda when Nyx asked the question. The white alicorn nearly did a spit-take, but stopped herself on seeing the onion ring hanging off of Rarity's horn still. She waited until she was absolutely sure she could swallow, and did so. "Ahem. I wasn't planning on it. I mean, this world's already got a Vinyl Scratch, right?" She levitated the onion ring away from Rarity, and wiped the alabaster unicorn's horn off with a hooferchief.

         This served to snap Rarity out of her stupor, and she shook herself back to reality. "Ah, yes, we do have a Vinyl Scratch here. She lives here in Ponyville, and does the music for various events. She even did the music for the wedding of Shining Armor and Princess Cadence."

         Calliope whistled. "Wow. Wish I coulda done that. Mom wouldn't let me go to the wedding because she was afraid I'd end up blowing my cover somehow1."

         Pinkie spoke up. "You and our Vinyl Scratch totally ought to do a show together! I mean, Vinyl's great on her own, but with another Vinyl, it'd be superriffic!" She gasped in amazement. "Why, the wubs would be loud enough to reach Canterlot!"

         While the others pondered if Ponyville could survive such wubs, Calliope looked nervous. "Eh-heh. Thanks, but no thanks, Pinks. I just think it'd be too awkward if your Vinyl met 'herself'."

         "So? Go as Calliope, not Vinyl Scratch," Pinkie said, in a perfectly reasonable tone.

         Twilight coughed. "Um, Pinkie? You do realize that Calliope is an alicorn, right?"

         Pinkie cocked her head at the scholarly unicorn. "Duh! She's Celestia's daughter!"

         "I believe what Twilight is saying, dear," Rarity broke in, "is that our Vinyl Scratch might be too intimidated at the prospect of doing a show with an alicorn. And nervous performers always perform sub-par, at best."

         "Nah, I'm sure she'll be totally cool with it!" Pinkie exclaimed.

         "And how would you know, Pinkie?" asked Rainbow.

         "Because she's been eavesdropping two tables over, and hasn't said a word," Pinkie replied, pointing.

         Sure enough, a white unicorn with an electric blue mane was sitting at a table less than five yards away. She was facing away from them, meaning nopony could see her expression.

         Calliope winced, as the local version of Vinyl Scratch turned around. The expression on her face was...

Skip to later on in the day.
1553322222222222222222222211111111.content:
"So, wanna practice for that show?"

Calliope tensed up, as if she'd just been caught stealing cookie's from a cookie jar. "I...uh...well...I'll think about it. I mean, it's not like I need to choose right now, right? This is my vacation after all."

"Cool. No problem. Just let me know when you've decided." Vinyl said before turning back around, just as the waiter showed up.

"So how much for the food?"

"Actually, the policy says anypony that can successfully finish a humongo-burger in one sitting get's to eat for free, so your meal is covered." He informed them.

"Cool. I want to go see just how similar to my ponyville this one is. You guys feel like showing me around?"

There was a chorus of affirmative responses from the element bearers, as the group got up and headed for the out the door.

"Have a good day, love." The waiter said right as the door shut behind them. Calliope froze up for a second.

"Did he just call me...?" She began to mutter to herself, before shaking her head. "Nah, now I'm just being paranoid." And with that, she and the others headed out to see the town.
1553322222222222222222222211111111.title: ... a huge grin. "So, wanna practice for th...

choices: "... about those injuries you have."
"... about the current political climate in your world."
15533222222222222222222222111111112.content:
A few hours had passed since the group had left the restaurant. Calliope had been given a tour of Ponyville, although it had been largely unneeded. She knew where everything in the town was, thanks to her stay in her dimension's Ponyville. For the most part, the tour had been a distraction on the part of Twilight and Nyx, because they knew there would be much to talk about later.

         As the day went on, the ponies split away from each other, until only Twilight, Nyx, and Calliope were left heading to the library. The white alicorn glanced at the two natives. "Okay, as much as I love playing dumb, what was the point of dragging me all the way around a town I already know like the back of my hoof? I'm guessing you two have something planned for me."

         Twilight chuckled nervously. "Well... okay, we were planning something. And I want you to know, we only have the best of intentions."

         "Well, that just makes me nervous," Calliope said with a chuckle of her own. "What did you have planned?"

         She asked this as Twilight was opening the door, but it was a different voice that answered. "It's more along the lines of what I have planned, my dear." Sitting by the table of the first floor of the library was a much larger white alicorn. Her mane and tail both blew in an unfelt wind, their pastel colors seeming to blend together as they did so. Her pink eyes regarded the smaller alicorn, whose own eyes had widened in shock.

         "M-mo - !" Calliope cut herself off. She realized, half a second after she'd started to speak, that this was not her mother, but rather the native version of her.

         Celestia chuckled. "It's quite alright. My student and her adoptive daughter have explained the situation to me in a letter. You are fleeing from political troubles at home, correct?"

         The smaller alicorn nodded, not trusting herself to speak.

         "Well, not to worry. I went ahead and informed your mother of the situation. She's worried, naturally, but she agrees that perhaps some time away from the political turmoil your dimension is in could do everypony some good." Celestia took a sip of tea that Spike offered her.

         "Wait... you can talk to my mom? Isn't that kinda... weird?" Calliope cocked her head quizzically.

         Celestia laughed. "It's not that weird, my dear. After all, if you can break the dimensional barrier, what does that say about me?"

         Everypony joined in the laughter this time. As it died down, Celestia spoke again. "At any rate, dear, while you're here, I'd like to ask..."
15533222222222222222222222111111112.title: Royal Meeting

choices: She makes a great effort, but loses them in a crowd.
She almost catches them, but they round a corner and disappear into thin air.
155332222222222222222222221111111121.content:
"Let me guess...mom asked you to ask about them?" Calliope inquired. Celestia responded with a nod. "I see. Okay, I'll admit, Breaking out of a hospital wasn't my brightest idea, but it's not like i actually still needed the doctors fighting over what the best treatment is anymore. These thing's will heal up in no time by themselves."

"Wait, you broke out of a hospital? And you jumped the dimensional barrier while injured? Do you have any idea how dangerous that is?" Twilight asked. She then paused before adding. "In theory of course; there have never been any reported cases of this happening before to my knowledge."

"Uh, dangerous for you mortals, maybe, but I'm a Demi-god. A few little burns aren't going to do anything to me."

"Yeah, but if your still healing, then it sounds like Chrysalis did an even bigger number on you than what you led us to believe." Nyx said. Calliope's response was the strangest yet: She laughed. She laughed loudly and obnoxiously, falling over and rolling on the floor in laughter. She laughed and it worried Nyx slightly.

"What's so funny?"

"You think Chrysalis was responsible for these?" The young alicorn asked as she gestured to her injuries. "Ha! Even if she did have the power to pull it off, she was way too busy being creepy and trying to stay alive to do any real harm." She stopped laughing and let out a tired sounding sigh. "I got these from a solar flare."

"But that means...your mother did that to you?!"

Calliope looked at Twilight. "In her defense, I was kind of going Nightmare Moon. Between me and chrysalis we nearly demolished the entire east half of the castle...then I nearly destroyed to west half when aunt Luna stepped in to keep me from killing her. After I took her out, Mom really didn't have any options left to save me from myself, what with some of the element bearers being unconscious. So, she blasted me with the fury of the sun...and it was one of the best things she's ever done for me. If she'd let me kill the bug, I'd probably still be stuck like that, rampaging around, hurting countless innocent ponies." She turned her head to look at Celestia. "Let me guess; Mom want's me to have your Doctors take a look at my injuries, doesn't she? Don't bother. It's just a matter of time now, and I intend to spend that time relaxing and staying out of the spotlight...with the exception of maybe just one concert."

"I think it would help all of us to worry less if you'd allow my best doctors to look at those injury's, just to make sure your trip to our world didn't cause any problems for them."

The smaller alicorn let out an exasperated sigh. Her eyes darted to the window, and suddenly she smiled. "Okay, but only under one condition."

"And that would be?"

"Catch whoever the heck has been spying on us since we left the burger place." The young princess Pointed towards the window, and everypony looked just in time to see a shadowy silhouette disappear from it. Nyx quickly rushed outside and took off after the figure.
155332222222222222222222221111111121.title: Burns and Spies.

choices: Stay in Ponyville, looking for changelings
Follow Calliope in Canterlot
1553322222222222222222222211111111211.content:
Nyx immediately noticed that the running pony had a full-body cloak on, making it nearly impossible to distinguish any features about them. Still, she wouldn't give up. She flew after them, noting that the runaway was heading for the outskirts of town. Since it was afternoon, there weren't many ponies on that stretch, so catching this rogue would be child's play. She flew low, intending to tackle the pony, when they suddenly cut a sharp left, heading back into town. Nyx, unprepared for the change in course, overshot the turn, but quickly compensated, flying up and over the buildings, intent on intercepting the pony.

         However, when Nyx cleared the rooftops, she couldn't see her target. All she saw was the typical afternoon market crowd. There was no trace of a cloak anywhere, seeing as it was a warm summer day. Nyx hovered there, baffled for a moment, before a thought came to mind. Her eyes narrowed. "Looks like we're about to have changeling problems of our own," she muttered. With nothing to chase down, Nyx flew back to the library.

*****


         When Nyx opened the door to the library, she noticed it was much like she had left it. The only difference was that Calliope and Twilight now had some tea as well, and Spike was bringing out a tray of biscuits. Calliope looked up at her. "No luck?"

         Nyx shook her head. "I didn't catch them, but I have a pretty good feeling that they were a changeling."

         Twilight nearly dropped her teacup. "A changeling? Here?!"

         Calliope groaned, and banged her head into the table. "Great. I thought I'd seen the last of those bugs when I sent my Chrysalis home in a body cast. Ugh..."

         Celestia frowned. "The changelings here have been quiet ever since the failed invasion of Canterlot." She looked thoughtful. "In fact, I've been sending envoys to them, in the hopes that we could have peace talks."

         "How's that been working out for you?" the smaller white alicorn asked, looking up.

         "It's been going rather well, actually," Celestia noted. "It seems the invasion was spurred by equal parts desperation and lack of communication. You see, for months before the invasion, Chrysalis had tried to send envoys to us, to try to open diplomatic relations. But, the guard captain at the border always turned them away... sometimes forcefully. When I sent my own envoys, the changelings were hostile at first, but eventually, Chrysalis saw that I was sincere."

         "Wait, but if Chrysalis is open to peace talks, why would a changeling be running around in Ponyville?" wondered Twilight.

         Celestia frowned again. "From what I've been able to tell, Chrysalis is not the only changeling queen out there. She's merely in charge of her own hive. Other hives exist, with their own queens. And, from what she's told me, some of those queens think far less of ponies than she does."

         "Why didn't we know you were having peace talks with Chrysalis?" asked Nyx, a bit miffed that something so important had not been relayed to them.

         "I was keeping it a secret, and for good reason," replied Celestia, looking stern. "If I let everypony know that I was opening peace talks with the changelings, it would cause a panic. Even had I just let my faithful student in on it, the odds were high that unauthorized ponies might catch wind of it, and blow things out of proportion. Far better that I keep it close to the vest, so to speak."

Everypony was still in a state of shock regarding what had just happened. A changeling queen had just made out with Nyx, in the middle of the town square. It was perhaps the most surreal moment in living memory. And given everything that Ponyville had been through just in the past few years, that was definitely saying something.

         Eventually, somepony broke the tableau of stillness. Twilight shook herself, and turned to Spike, who already had a quill and parchment ready. Twilight began quickly dictating, "Dear Princess Celestia. I hate to be the bearer of bad news, but we have a... situation of sorts. The Queen Chrysalis of Calliope's dimension has apparently followed her here, and is seeking her out. She has learned that Calliope is in Canterlot, and is on her way there. Be advised, she seems emotionally volatile."

         While Twilight was dictating this letter, Rainbow Dash approached Nyx. "Well, that was odd, don'tcha think?"

         Nyx didn't reply, merely opening and closing her mouth.

         "Uh, Nyx? You okay? I know that was a bit of a shock, but..." Rainbow trailed off when she noticed that Nyx's mane and tail were beginning to writhe.

         Twilight, having just finished dictating, noticed this as well. "Nyx? What's wrong?!"

         Now, it must be understood that Nyx, while having had bad experiences with being a Queen, was still very much a 'girly' mare. She had dreams. Dreams of meeting a kind-hearted stallion with whom she'd share her first kiss, first date, first... everything. And now, part of that dream had been dashed. By a wounded changeling queen, no less. Mt. St. Nyx was about to erupt.

         Pinkie Pie, having been in the crowd, popped up next to Rainbow, and quickly pulled her away from the alicorn. "Everypony, you might wanna step back! This one's gonna be big!" She dived behind a cart, while the other ponies in earshot who heard her took cover of their own.

         Finally, Nyx blew her top.

         "I AM GOING TO KILL HER!!!"

         This thundering statement was followed by Nyx vanishing in a blinding flash of light.

         Twilight gulped. "Spike, add a P.S. to that letter."

         "Yeah, no problem," Spike muttered, his eyes wide.

         "P.S.: Nyx was... molested by this version of Chrysalis, and is taking it quite poorly. She is on her way to exact vengeance. Be prepared." With that postscript, the letter was rolled up and sent on its way.

         Rainbow Dash simply gaped. "Wow. Never would've guess Nyx had it in her."

         "What happened?!" Looking around, Rainbow saw Rarity running up. "I heard Nyx shouting something about wanting to kill somepony. What could drive her to such an extreme measure?"

         "Well..." Rainbow trailed off, unsure how to answer that.

         "She just got kissed by Calliope's version of Queen Chrysalis, and now both of them are on their way to Canterlot," Spike said succinctly.

         "Oh." Rarity blinked a few times. "Oh, dear. I do believe that was Nyx's first kiss." Her eyes narrowed. "Oh, that is unforgiveable! To steal a lady's first kiss in such a manner! This cannot stand! Twilight, you fetch Applejack, I'll retrieve Fluttershy! We're going to Canterlot after them, to avenge Nyx's loss of innocence!"

         Rainbow blinked. "Uh, Rarity? Chrysalis didn't... you know, end up in bed with her. How is that a 'loss of innocence'?"

         The fashionista rolled her eyes. "There are different types of innocence, darling. But, no time to explain. We must get to Canterlot as soon as possible!" The unicorn ran off towards Fluttershy's cottage.

155332222222222222222222222222222221112.content:
Nyx looked over the young pegasus as best she could. Said pegasus was lying on her side in the middle of the room, and appeared to be asleep. Her coat was a deep red, almost black, while her short, messy mane and tail were only a couple of shades lighter. A bright red cloak was wrapped around the young mare's shoulders, extending back past her flanks, on which Nyx could make out the red symbol of a rose.

         Nyx's attention was drawn, however, to an odd metal device that she could see under the cloak. Strapped to the pegasus's back, Nyx couldn't see precisely what it was, or what it was meant to do. Still, as the pegasus began to stir, Nyx supposed her curiosity about the device could wait.

         "Ow... my head..." moaned the pegasus. She didn't bother moving much, aside from opening her eyes briefly before squeezing them shut again. "What did I do last night to make me feel like this?"

         Nyx, recognizing the signs of a severe headache, thought for a moment. "Well, there could be a few reasons. Excessive consumption of alcohol can cause headaches, as can high blood pressure, tension, or being struck on the head."

         "I don't drink, so that's out," replied the downed pegasus. "And I've never been diagnosed with blood pressure problems, and I'm not the most tense girl out there. Being struck, though, is a likely possibility." She slowly opened her eyes, revealing them to be silver in color. She glanced around. "So, who are yooooOUUU!!!" The last word ended in a yelp as her eyes fell on Nyx, and she reflexively scrabbled backwards. However, she didn't get far before landing flat on her back. "Ow."

         Nyx sighed. "Look, despite my appearance, and no matter what you've heard about me, I'm not going to eat you, okay?"

         The pegasus blinked. "Uh... okay?" She shook her head. "I'm more concerned with why my body doesn't... feel... right..." She trailed off as she brought her forehooves up, presumably to rub her head, only to stop and stare at them.

         Noticing that the young mare's irises were starting to shrink, Nyx tried to break in. "Uh, miss - "

         The pegasus started letting out a yelp, before slapping herself with a forehoof. "No, no, calm down. There's got to be an explanation for this. There's got to be a reason why your hands have been replaced by hooves. Keep calm, and nothing will - "

         "Hands?" Nyx broke in. "You mean you weren't always a pony?"

         "Uh, no, no I wasn't," replied the pegasus. She rolled over onto her belly, before attempting to stand. "Easy does it, Ruby..." she muttered to herself.

         "'Ruby'? Is that your name?" Nyx asked, moving in to give the newcomer some help.

         "Yeah, Ruby Rose. That's my full name," the pegasus said. With Nyx's help, she was soon standing on all fours. "This feels so weird..."

         "What were you originally, before becoming a pony?" Nyx asked.

         Ruby blinked. "You... you just believe me? Just like that? No questions about if I'm crazy or anything?"

         Nyx rolled her eyes. "In my town, we get all kinds of weird things happening. Someone claiming to be something other than a pony is new, but not that special. 3 out of 10 on the weirdness scale."

         Ruby blinked several times. "Your town must be crazy."

         Nyx laughed. "My dear, you have no idea."

1553322222222222222222222222222222222221.content:
Nyx looked the stranger over, uncertain what to make of the mare. She was a mare, Nyx could tell from the rounded snout and slight build. Her coat was a deep shade of blue, nearly black, which stood in contrast to her long light grey mane. A leathery wing was folded up on her side, and Nyx assumed that it had a partner on the other. Despite the leathery nature of the wing, the mare lacked the tufted ears common to thestrals.

There were two features about the mare that stood out the most, however: the first was the gilded sword that was strapped across her back. The second was the armored plates that adorned her body, from the neck down. This mare was girded for battle... and had recently come from one, to judge by the burns that marred the armor plates and her exposed coat.

Nyx bit her lip. On the one hoof, she was nervous about the fact that this mare seemed to be geared for conflict. On the other, she was clearly injured, and needed attention. Making up her mind, the alicorn picked the mare up in her magic, and dashed away, heading for Ponyville General.

* * * * *


Corrin had never felt this much pain in her life. She wasn't certain it was normally possible to be in so much pain. What in heaven's name happened to me? she wondered, doing her best to keep still, as even the slightest movement brought agony. As more of her senses returned, the pain was joined by a sense of wrongness. Her body felt completely off.

"And how long ago did you find her?" asked a male voice. It wasn't familiar to her, which filled her with dread; had she been captured by Hoshido on the way back from the Sevenfold Sanctuary?

"No more than half an hour," an equally unfamiliar female voice replied; it sounded young, not as young as Elise, but definitely younger than Camilla. "As soon as I found her, I brought her here for treatment."

"Well, you did the right thing," the male voice said. "And it was a good thing you removed her armor, too; having any sort of cover over those burns would have exacerbated the condition."

It was around that point that Corrin realized that she could feel the sheets of the bed she was in, but the feeling was odd. She wasn't feeling the sheets on her bare skin; rather, it seemed like there was something fuzzy in between her skin and the sheets. My body feels completely off, she thought, and I need to know why! Mustering her resolve, she started to crack her eyes open.

The room was dimly lit, she noted, which was a blessing on her eyes. Opening them wider, she glanced around. She was in a sterile white room, which immediately ruled out any room at Castle Krakenburg; the rooms there were made of hewn stone. She was lying on a simple bed, on top of the sheets it seemed.

In front of her were two horses, though they were markedly different from any horse Corrin had seen before. One was a light brown, with a darker brown mane and tail. It appeared to be wearing a white coat of some kind, as well as a metallic disc on its head, just below its horn. Corrin remembered tales of such horses, and knew that the term for them was 'unicorn', an archaic word meaning 'one horn'.

The other horse was far stranger looking. Standing a good deal taller than the unicorn, it was a pure black, with a purple mane and tail. Unlike the unicorn, it was without adornment of any sort. Like the unicorn, it had a horn, but Corrin could also see a feathered wing that was folding up at its side. What do you call a horse that has wings and a horn? she wondered briefly.

Her puzzlement increased to incredulity as the strange dark horse opened its mouth and spoke. "How long will it take for her to recover?" it asked, in the female voice from earlier.

"I've ordered burn salves to be brought in on the double," the unicorn replied in the male voice. "In the meantime, I should probably cast a painkiller spell on her. Those burns have to hurt."

Almost as though merely being told of their existence caused them to react, a flare of agony raced along the burns on Corrin's skin. She hissed, drawing in a breath, which caught the attention of the two horses. "Yeah, that might be a good idea," remarked the dark-colored horse.

The unicorn's horn glowed with a teal light (what sorcery was this?!) and almost immediately, Corrin felt the pain recede into a dull, tolerable ache. She sighed in relief. "T-thank you," she managed to get out.

"No thanks necessary, my dear, I'm doing my job, after all," the unicorn replied. "I'm Dr. Stable, and I'll be taking care of you while you're here."

Corrin nodded in response, then started twitching her limbs. "I am Corrin. A pleasure to meet you, sir. And you as well, miss...?"

"Nyx," the dark-colored mare replied. "I'm the one who brought you to the hospital, Miss Corrin."

Corrin blinked at the familiar name, but immediately dismissed the notion that this Nyx was in any way related to the snarky mage she'd met up with outside of Fort Dragonfall. "Then you have my thanks, Miss Nyx. I'm uncertain myself as to how I became injured, so your aid is greatly appreciated."

Nyx smiled. "It's no big deal, I'd do the same for anypony in your position."

Any... pony? Corrin thought, and for the first time, she glanced at herself, to find that she was, indeed, a horse of some sort.

info.brief_description: Nyx, the good-natured reincarnation of Nightmare Moon, decides to follow her true calling.
info.description:
This interactive follows the life and trials of the character of Nyx from the My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic fanfiction "Past Sins}" by Pen Stroke and Batty Gloom, which can be found here: http://www.equestriadaily.com/2011/07/story-past-sins.html

The interactive takes place several years after the events of "Past Sins" and follows Nyx as she and her friends have reached the proper age to pursue their unique paths in life. As Nyx leaves the nest to learn how to be a strong protector, she will also try to make new friends and companions, and face those who only know her as Nightmare Moon reborn.

This is a 13+ interactive in keeping with the spirit and tone of the original fanfic. As such, knowledge of the events and characterizations presented in "Past Sins" is highly recommended (also because it's a very good read). Please follow these general guidelines:

* No sexual content. Exploring youthful romance is fine, but please keep it tasteful.
* Character death should be kept to an absolute minimum, if used at all. No killing Nyx, period.
* Violence and injury are allowed, but please keep it at around the level of "Past Sins", or the cartoon when used for comedic effect. Absolutely NO GORN.
* Please keep all posts at least one paragraph long.
